review_content: Across the board, this is the BEST boutique hotel EVER. This enchanting inn perched up against Thunder Mountain has the power to WOW you while simultaneously making you feel very much at home! True luxury isn't grandiose it's simple and refined... Every small detail from linens to amenities, like fresh baked cookies, hot teas and coffee, and beautiful decor is tended to and nothing is overlooked! Andreas, the inn keeper, made it all about us. He was so warm & hospitable and hugely helpful & knowledgeable. He made us feel welcome and went above and beyond to ensure our comfort at the inn. The inn exudes a perfectly Sedona vibe with the Adobe Arizona feel, rich earth tones and south western textiles. Our honeymoon suite was upstairs, beautifully remodeled and stocked with a jet tub for two, a stone standing shower with 3 heads, a clean fridge, a toasty fireplace, the comfiest bed and a gorgeous terrace with seating for star gazing! We will be coming back every year and staying at the Casa Inn because I have absolutely no complaints and we left beyond satisfied!Very Nice Inn that is off the busy path. Great views of the Red Rocks and the highest rated restaurant in town downstairs. Wine Chiller, Fresh Cookies, Whirlpool in my room, 3 Shower Heads.... Staff was friendly and welcoming......Lots of Western Flavor and DecorAmazing! So welcoming and helpful. They will book outings for you, many times with a cheaper price than if you booked it yourself. We stayed in the Trail's End room and it was beautiful - jet two-person tub, fridge, and chocolate covered strawberries to greet us. Amazing breakfast each morning! We didn't even have to get lunch because they fed us so well!Came up from Scottsdale for just a night with my girlfriend and Golden Retriever dog to enjoy the beautiful scenic views of Sedona. It was a little tough finding a place that would accommodate us, but found this gem after numerous searching. They only use two of their rooms for friendly visitors bringing along a pet which is respectable. The room we had was very spacious and gave that Adobe Arizona feel that you want when staying up here. The surroundings are right up near Thunder Mountain trail and in prime location to some good Restaurants. It is a very quiet area where the specific bed & breakfast is located that gives you that getaway atmosphere. I want to share with you the service. The service is by far one of the most important as it can make or break your stay. We called them and were very welcoming on the phone/ excited to meet out dog :). When we arrived, we were greeted right away and shown around as if we were going to buy the place, It made us feel special. Kim the owner and her staff did an excellent job of giving us a warm and pleasant welcoming during our stay that really put our mood in the right place from the start.  Lastly, the chef. We had read the reviews on the way up to our stay and they gave him justice. Excellent food preparation for our breakfast in the morning before our hike that got us even more jazzed up to enjoy the day. One of our best experiences away from home. If your looking for a Sedona getaway in the future you have to check this place out!!!This place is amazing.  If you want a quaint place to come home to after a long day of hiking, this is it.  The owner and the staff are great.  And the property is nice and updated.I would characterize this place as a high end B&B.  There's a community kitchen with dishes, wine glasses, hot tea, and fresh baked cookies.  The jacuzzi in the back was used every night.  Not sure the condition of all the rooms but the renovated rooms are very nice.  Each room is different, so do your research.We stayed in the Navajo room which had a nice private deck, a large tub, a huge shower (with three shower heads!) and an oh so comfy bed.  If you are a light sleeper, you may want to choose a different room because this one is right above the kitchen, so you may be woken by some noise early in the morning.  It didn't bother us at all and we will choose this room again.We cancelled our fancy dinner plans one night and opted to have wine and cheese on our deck instead.  We spent every night star gazing from our deck.Then there's the restaurant.  The food is amazing!  The breakfast (included) each morning was not your traditional breakfast.  And dinner is also available but you need reservations.  Again, amazing!I like nice hotels, but I typically think of hotels as just a place to sleep.  This place really added to our overall experience.  We will definitely be back!My fiance and I had come up to Sedona on New Years to get married, but switched last minute from one of the large nationally known chain hotels to Casa Sedona. Upon our arrival we were greeted by Kim, the owner. The entry way was very inviting with a fire place, cozy chairs and leather sofa. As we were checking in we had noticed more and more snow coming down and started to get little concerned about road and site conditions for our wedding the very next day (Bell Rock).Without any hesitation, Kim had offered her facility to us free of charge and upgraded us to a room reserved for wedding couples.  This room is newly decorated with all of the comforts of home including a king bed, mini refrigerator, Jacuzzi tub and a shower built for 2.  The bedding and towels are the best quality you can get and the furniture and fixtures look to be hand selected. The mini refrigerator had chocolate covered strawberries for our arrival and she even brought a slice of cake up to our room after the wedding!The restaurant at Casa Sedona is very inviting and well decorated. You may choice a window seat or a table in front of the fireplace. All of the cups and dishes are customized. The first night we planned on going to a local restaurant, but became convinced after looking at the menu that we should stay in and eat dinner at Casa Sedona. The food was amazing and well beyond our expectation. I had the bison tenderloin and my wife had the chicken. Both meals were perfectly prepared and the service was excellent. The breakfast at Casa Sedona is included with the price of the room and went well beyond our expectation for a bed and breakfast. Both mornings we were served a full sit down breakfast with a very creative spin on eggs coupled with bacon, potatoes, French toast and warm croissants. In my opinion, Casa Sedona rivals any of the top restaurants in the area!There are many other details like the views from the rooms and the fresh baked cookies daily, but I want to personally thank Kim for letting us use her facility for our wedding service due to the snow storm. Our stay was absolutely amazing and we look forward to returning soon!I've lived in Sedona almost 9 years and only recently heard about this place. It's a Bed and Breakfast but open to the public on weekends. Outstanding restaurant! Great atmosphere and staff. The food was beautifully presented and delicious! I would definitely go back!This was my first stay at Casa Sedona - a unique boutique hotel- and it won't be my last!! The owner is very friendly and helpful and makes you feel like family. All of the staff I interacted with were just like her!! My room was clean and looked just like the pictures online. The bed and linens were simply amazing. Also I noted that of the six pillows on the bed, they were all different firmnesses- so you could find the perfect one for you. As a single woman traveler, I never worried about my safety here and the neighborhood that it's in is great for walking each morning. Lastly, the breakfast here is worth the entire room cost. It's served in 3 courses and both days it was delicious. I ate out on their beautiful patio my first morning and enjoyed the view and the quiet bubbling of their fountain.Amazing, simply amazing!  If you are a breakfast person like myself and my beloved, you must have breakfast here.  They serve a fixe price three course breakfast that is fresh, delicious and innovative in beautiful, beautiful surroundings!This boutique Hotel is the best. Our room was on the first floor that overlooked their beautiful serene garden. Kim was a perfect hostess and the gourmet breakfasts were exquisite and healthy. It was a perfect retreat to return to after a day of hiking and tourism. Our room had a private patio and was close to the hot tub. I was going to change our room at the last minute because the upstairs rooms are remodeled and I'm so happy I didn't. I loved our room and plan on booking the same room in the Spring next year or the Fall this year. Everything about this hotel my boyfriend and I loved. Our service at breakfast was extremely efficient as well as friendly and enjoyable. Please believe all the positive reviews because the negative one has not one ounce of honesty that I read or experienced. Kim runs a top notch resort and we have traveled all over the World. We visit Sedona twice a year and have stayed in other resorts. All of them were nice but now since staying at Casa Sedona there is no other place for us.Two stars based on the price. Nice refurbished room and very helpful staff. We had a room with a patio, but the furniture and atmosphere on the patio could have been much nicer. We found the previous guests old pizza in the refrigerator! Breakfast was very rushed and with zero choices: one berry smoothie and one "main course".We had such a wonderful stay.  The room was very comfortable, and Kim was so nice.  The free breakfast was the biggest surprise.  It was just fantastic.  The restaurants that Kim suggested were all terrific as well.  I would love to come back for another visit.That's was our first time at the Casa Sedona and we had a wonderful stay. The rooms were comfortable and updated. The property had a zen like atmosphere, and the breakfast and coffee was equally great. If I could give the host Kim 10 stars who runs the property I would! This will be a repeat visit for my wife and I on a regular basis. Thank you.Great location, quiet street off Hwy 89A. Easy access to activities in Sedona. Robin was an excellent host, providing a tour on arrival and was truly at our service. Beds and linens A++++! We loved the Sunset room on the first floor with a fireplace, king bed, and 2 person spa tub. 2-course Breakfast was excellent, a much better quality than we could have imagined. On our next trip, we won't be looking anywhere else. Thanks Casa Sedona Inn!!! -Preston & AshleyThis review is for dining only as we did not stay there.  My BF and I went for dinner while vacationing in Sedona, based on reviews made on Trip Advisor.  We were NOT disappointed!  We were seated promptly in the dining room, which had nice, dim lighting and soft music playing.  There was a table of six loud people next to us, which made it hard to hear ourselves speaking, but thankfully they were finishing up as we sat down, and the rest of the evening was quiet and romantic.  It is BYOB, which we knew ahead of time, and I don't mind at all.  I had the seafood risotto and my BF had the salmon and our entrees were delicious.  Amazing.  So good that we contemplated calling and asking if they had room for us the next night too:)  The grounds are super cute and we would totally stay here as guests the next time we're in Sedona after seeing it.  I think the one one star review lady is most likely insane.  Go there!  You'll love it.We spent two nights at Casa Sedona, great location, super nice & friendly staff, very helpful with planning hikes and other things on the must do list. The grounds are beautiful, the common area w/ coffee, tea & cookies is a very nice amenity. We stayed in the Garden Pueblo room, it had a very nice private entry & deck outside. The bed was comfy and the room was clean, could use a bit of updating, mainly the carpet.  If in the area we would stay again.The Sedona hillside location is nature up close with private & customized decor in each room. A beautifully designed building, with plants and art objects adding around everywhere to add an upscale tranquility for just being on the property. Breakfast out side on the patio each morning is uniquely different and delicious. Worth every $285/night dollar.Good, but not great.  Hotels in Sedona are generally quite expensive, and at around $200/nightly this one feel in the mid-range of what was available.  However after having been to this town and seen the gorgeous views available from EVERYWHERE (i.e., the grocery store parking lot, the side of every road, and - I'm imagining - many rooms of the local Super 8 Motel) location is less of a concern for next time.  The included free wifi and decent (again, not great) breakfast were plusses.  Downsides include surprisingly uncomfortable pillows, lots of noise from the breakfast area downstairs starting at 6:30 AM(!!), and a subtly clashing color scheme in the room of dark red, silver, orange red, and pink carpet.So, in short, unless you are dead-set on a B&B OR can splurge and go for the REALLY luxurious top-end places, I personally would recommend you save your money and go for one of the cheap places in town.  It's not like you're going to be spending a lot of time in your room while you're here - Sedona is one of the most astonishingly beautifully placed cities I have ever been to (and I've been to a lot of amazing places around the world).We booked the Moondance room.   The bed was comfortable and the terrace access on cool April mornings was very nice.   The two course breakfasts were well-prepared, and dining in the shadow of Thunder Mountain on the peaceful patio was an awesome way to start a day of hiking and sightseeing. Robin was our main contact, and she was extremely friendly and helpful throughout our stay.   She recommended Barking Frog and Heartline restaurants, and we thoroughly enjoyed both.  We'll be back.

Currently staying here. Ideal for the price. Bed is okay, room is quaint and charming! Location is ideal and the view of bell rock is unreal. I love this place. Friendly staff too!THINK TWICE. Or at least don't expect these guys to take the high road. There was a Hotwire.com booking error, that confirmed an unintended reservation to an old email. I asked the manager, John, if he could reverse it since I never stayed there. He said someone else even used "my" room, named Nina, and collected rent from her too. He still took my money. The spiritual nature of Sedona doesn't extend everywhere.I'll start off with the things I wasn't too impressed with. The room did come with a microwave and fridge, however the microwave was hidden behind a bedside table on the floor. There was also bits of cacti in the mattress cover, which fortunately didn't hurt anyone in the room but was still not exactly what I was looking for in a room. Overall the room was just bland and wearisome of its exact cleanliness. but BONUS free wifi. (only thing being that most rooms aren't in range of the modem)But the staff was very friendly and everything worked as it was supposed to and the rooms came at a super good deal. So if you're looking for something easy, cheap and slightly out of the middle of Sedona, the Sedona Village Inn willmost likely fit your needs!Spent two nights here. Basic but more than adequate.The room was clean and had the fundamentals I needed: bed was neat, clean and comfortable. The bathroom was also clean and had fresh towels. The room also had a microwave and small refrigerator. The office was no-frills and unassuming. It wasn't even that easy to find as it is located on the second floor in the middle of the building. Check-in was easy, but I was amused that my reservation was noted on a Post-It sticky note on the desk rather than in a computer system or something. And check-out was simply leaving the key in the room when you leave.The only issues I had with the room was that the floor was not carpeted and was cold tile - which was clean and well-kept, but it made the room have a much colder feel to it. Also, the wi-fi didn't really work. I think I managed to connect to it once, but it was so slow that it wasn't worth it.Aside from those issues, though, this is a decent, very affordable place to stay when all you need is a bed, shower and toilet. And for me, that was all I needed.Awesome place! Everyone I've come in contact with had excellent customer service, they always greeted you with a smile & try their best to make your stay pleasant. It's very generously priced & you get some great views of Bell Rock. Their furniture is very groovy too ;). It's close to pretty much anywhere you need to go. I would definitely recommend this hotel!Very dog friendly. It was decent for the price and location. The pizza place in the same parking lot is amazing! If you are looking for a fancy hotel keep looking; this is strictly for functionality.I stayed here while my street was being paved. The owner was very nice and friendly, and gave me a local discount. My room had free wi-fi and a small fridge which was all I needed. The room is in a quiet area and I was able to rest well. I now recommend this place to friends and family alike.We stay here every time we are going to Sedona. Very basic, very inexpensive, nice staff, pet friendly. 5 stars based on budget no star hotel. Walking distance to great morning coffee at the Bike and Bean and great Chinese food next door at Red Chopsticks.This is a low budget hotel. Lowwww budget. I don't think a room can be found in the seediest 'hood for what they charge. The 5 stars is in relation to the budget hotel category. I've pd. Much more for a lot worse. There are no frills, no ice makers, (but there is a plastic ice tray in the freezer /fridge provided) no food, no pool, or 24 hour desk.It is sparsely furnished and dated for sure. We got the 49$ king room which was clean. I've no complaints about the cleanliness of the room. Right outside of our window was the garbage area to the Chinese restaurant next door. Ew. We didn't eat there. The door lock was damaged, but, worked, kinda. We went just before July 4th weekend, everyone else had raised their prices, and the other budget motels didn't look much better. The air conditioner in the room was ice cold, yay! It was pretty hot, so that negated the mediocrity of the place for us. Besides, there's way too much to see and do in Sedona to be hanging around in a hotel room anyway.It serves its purpose of short stay/place to sleep. The money saved with this hotel can go towards a meal at one of the great restaurants in town.Oh yea...the free wi-if doesn't friggin work either...lol(Credit to jmg for pointing out the typos)Great place for the money. Several restaurants within walking distance. Our room was clean and the staff was very helpful. Glad we stayed here, Sedona is a beautiful town.Pleasantly surprised when we walked into our room. My wife and I and our dog were on an Arizona roadtrip. We'd just came from Flagstaff, where we paid double the rates of Sedona Village Lodge for a questionable motel room. First off, our dog stayed here free. No pet fees! Free! The room we stayed in at Sedona Village Lodge was huge! Featured a living room area, kitchenette, separate bedroom with King bed... and a fireplace! Wow! We'll definitely come back!2 words. BED BUGS. and as soon as I left, the next morning my bank called me and told me there was $300 fraud on my card...Spacious Cheap Motel in a very expensive area. My Dog and I (Buddy) were very lucky to find this place and we tell others about it.We stayed here for 2 weeks while doing business in the area.We were offered towel and maid service every day and sheets too! The Central air worked great and we were very comfortable.Low key little motel. Sedona Village Lodge only merits 2 stars on its own, but because it offers an incredible view of the rock formations and the trails are only a few minutes walk away and because a double is only 50 bucks, I give this motel 3 stars. The motel is in a mall that includes a couple of rather uninteresting dining options, but its right off Highway 179 and its a great starting point for some serious hiking.Great choice for the budget minded traveler who just wants a place convenient to some good hiking trails.This motel gets two stars... One for the gorgeous view from room #16 and the other for the beautiful layout of that room... a suite... which was spacious and comfortable. I stayed in both the suite and a downstairs room and there is a huge difference in quality, view and comfort.Here the thing with this motel... It is the least expensive price you are going to get in Sedona/Village of Oak Creek, and if you mention anything wrong, they be sure to let you know that it is the least expensive room in the area and they say that you should feel lucky that you are getting such a rate.So here's my story...I stayed here while waiting for my apartment to be ready to move into... 3 weeks... The first week in the suite, the second in the downstairs dungeon, and the third back in the suite.I was able to ignore that 4 out of 4 bulbs in the overhead light were out, and that my garbage hadn't been picked up for a few days, but half way through my 2nd week, my dog got heat stroke. I was in a serious panic. My cell had stopped working and I couldn't call a clinic. I called the front desk and asked him to connect me with the clinic which he did. The clinic told me to take the dog's temp and if it's over 102.5 to call back. Well, I didn't have a thermometer, but I knew that the young man at the desk had a young child and that he could probably help me out.Well.... if he hadn't closed up the office. So my dog is shaking and looks terrible and this gentleman at the desk closes up without checking in with me, even though he knows there is a somewhat serious situation going on.And the difference of a few degrees could mean life or death, but I had no way of knowing, and didn't want to leave my dog alone and didn't want to take him with me in the 90+ degree heat.So I sat out the night with my dog and he was ok. But it was quite a trying experience.The next morning I told the owner (the young man's father) that I thought it was a poor choice that the evening desk man left without checking in on me.At that point the father/owner starts YELLING at me saying my dog barked for 2 hours while I was out and that his son was totally ok for leaving because I didn't ask him to stay in this EMERGENCY situation.First of all, I had no idea that my dog had been barking. I have left him alone hundreds of times, including in a house with 3 other roommates, and he has never made a peep. Something/someone probably set him off. And they didn't have my cell to call me, because I could have been back in 5 minutes to take care of the dog. Still, I take responsibility for my dog and let the whole thing with the son slide. Again, i was reminded I am paying the cheapest prices in Sedona. The young man/son of the owner was nice to me the next few times I saw him.Well, a few days later (once I moved back upstairs to the suite) I walked by the office and ducked my head in to ask a question. It was that same young man, and he was busy with his kid and so I said I would come back a little later. I got to my room and realized I forgot my key and went back to the office where the drapes had been hastily closed and the office door locked. It was 8:30 at night and they close the office at 9pm (as I learned the week before) and so I knew I was justified in knocking (and I needed to get into my room). I litterally knocked for 5 minutes and eventually the door opened about 3 inches and a key was THROWN at me, and then the door slammed shut.Well, at least I could get back in my roomWhen I told the woman at the front desk the next day, she seemed completely unfazed by it, again, there was no apology and I was (again) reminded that I am paying the cheapest rates in Sedona.If the incident with the doorkey had not happened, I could have forgiven the incident with my dog. But this was getting absurd, so i asked if I could leave that day. I was on a weekly rate and had 3 days left and the woman said I didn't give them enough notice and that I would have to stay.Well... OK. But I'm going to yelp about it! So here I am.Thank you for reading my rant. It's a shame that the desk is so hostile because that suite and the view from the suite was gorgeous. And internet worked really well in the suite. (So so in the downstairs dungeon.)I would say that it would be worth paying a little more to be treated better and have more responsible and kind interactions with the front desk. But I also can't stay that I wouldn't stay there again... I just know not to rely on anyone and that I'm putting my money there because of the view and the suite. The Wildflower Inn is next door and they have the same great view. The Quality Inn is next to the strip mall that Village Lodge is in and they have a pool and breakfast for just a little more.Finally, if you have pets, i would say that the Village Lodge allows pets but it not "pet friendly". Like, they are pretty hostile toward animals even though they allow pets to stay .Had a great time here last time my girlfriend and I were in Sedona. We didn't want to pay the high prices that the other Sedona hotels offer and we found this place. Nice and tucked away from the hustle and bustle of uptown and its close to trails including our favorite Bell Rock. We will definitely be staying here again. Thanks!My problems began with the reservations. I had made them earlier in the week by phone, but when I arrived at the motel the front desk person was already in the midst of confusion, repeatedly going though a number of post-it notes to verify the reservation information for the four patient people ahead of me. He was polite but obviously flustered about names, dates, number of rooms, length of stay, and even whether rooms were ready or not (he sent one group to a room that turned out to be dirty).When he got to me, he only had reservations for Saturday night; none of his post-it notes or calendar scribbles noted my Friday night reservation, though he claimed to recall our phone conversation. What to do? It's Sedona so hotel spaces are hard to find. I was headachy and tired after driving in from Nevada and was glad that he did the professional thing by giving me the only room available for the same price I had originally reserved: a "suite" (kitchenette, kiva-style (gas) fireplace, and mini livingroom. I didn't care - I just needed a room. Unfortunately, I would need to change rooms the next day, which was very inconvenient as I had plans to be out all day sightseeing with a friend who'd made tour reservations.There is no food on the premises, nor any ice or vending machines, so I got carry-out from the Chinese restaurant within the same plaza, ate that and tried to rest before going to bed. The spiderwebs added to my discomfort. It only takes a broom to clean them away, right? I re-thought my plans to stay there a second night. When I called their service number I got voicemail telling me to leave a message and they'd call back. For an emergency I could call their home number, but I didn't consider this an emergency so I left a voice mail around 6:30 pm letting them know what I was unhappy about (no one called back).Later when I retired to the bed area I regretted not calling the home number. There was dirt- crumbs, etc. on the floor between the beds. Spiderwebs on the ceiling, and - worst of all- HAIR all over the sheet! The peelable stain added even more to my revulsion. By now it was after going on 9:30 pm but I left a second voicemail, this time voicing my disgust. Despite wanting to flee I checked the other bed and the sheet was hairless so after a long internal debate I tried to lie down and forget the conditions. Then I reached over to the radio and got my fingers covered with some kind of sticky half-dried substance. Well, that was it! I called the home number and spoke to a woman to whom I described the nasty conditions of the bed and floor, and my displeasure with their reservation system which would require me to have to change rooms. The woman had no sympathy for me. Hair on the sheets? Sleep in the other bed. Messy room? Housekeeping is closed for the day. Discount? Well, "we get complaints from people but we never give discounts" (yes, that's a quote). Since I was now angry but powerless, I kept up the complaining just to see if I could at least get an apology for the crappy experience. She finally offered one, but only after telling me, "you should be happy. You already got a $30 discount because we put you in a suite." Yeah, a suite I have to move from the next day because of your crappy reservation system. A room containing dirt and hair from any number of previous guests, old spider webs and who-knows-what-else. Thanks for the upgrade.The only reason I stayed the second night was because I refused to ruin my friend's day by spending it looking for another hotel. In addition, I was driving across country starting early the next morning and needed all the rest I could get. When I went to the office Saturday morning I received a key for the new room from the man (owner?) on duty and was permitted to leave my belongings in the "suite," so they could move everything themselves. That was a professional thing for them to do, so I am acknowledging it. However, he made sure to add insult to injury by announcing that the new room had a terrible view and "barely enough room to walk around the bed." When I saw the second room late that night I was dismayed again. Housekeeping is clearly not important to these people. I can forgive the bugs all over the halls since they leave the doors open during the day, but the rooms themselves should be free of old spiderwebs. The bathroom wall and ceiling had months worth of black fuzzy stuff from a filthy ceiling exhaust fan. How much work does it take to sweep a broom across a fan, wall and ceiling? Why would you make your customers sleep in conditions you wouldn't make your own family live in- and take money for it besides?I can understand people having a bad day (like, perhaps, the front desk clerk) but overall, the problems appear to be systemic. Needless to say I will not be staying there again, $59 or not! I have posted pictures of some of the things I've complained about.I was pretty impressed with this place for the price. Clean, spacious room, comfy bed, easy to find, very nice staff (granted we didn't interact with them much). Definitely a good value for a low key traveler.

I am not even quite sure how to begin this. Do I talk about the room? the food? the hosts? because all three were simply amazing.My wife and I were celebrating our 5 year anniversary by taking a trip to Las Vegas and Sedona.While in Sedona, we chose the Bear Lodge based off reviews and room photos. Neither did this place true justice.We stayed in the upstairs private room called the Indian Garden.   When we arrived in Sedona , it was in the middle of a cold snap and was 19 degrees outside. I was concerned that we might be cold in the room, but I was wrong. It was very very warm and toasty and there were no drafts. We would have never been able to tell it was that cold out side.The room had a private bathroom and balcony as well.  The balcony served us greatly as I am an avid Star watcher and we arrived in the middle of the Leonid meteor showers. It was a wonder to see the shooting stars from the privacy of our balcony.We were very impressed by the comfort of the bed and the cleanliness of the room and bathroom.The public area had a massage chair that my wife got a lot of use out of and Myles and Masumi were gracious enough to get the hot tub that is out side cranked up so we could use it.  We used it everynight.  Nothing better than being in a hot tub when its that cold.  Looking up from the hot tub offered us great views of the open sky and stars.  We even saw the International Space Station transit overhead. What a delight.Next the food.Words can not describe the food. I can't even find the right ones to describe how good the food was. The four breakfasts we had wereBreakfast KebabsBreakfast Burrito (If you plan on going on hike the day you get a breakfast burrito, make sure to ask for some foil. Take half the burrito on the hike. You will thank me later)Loco MocoBlueberry PancakesMyles and Masumi made everything there and boy do their efforts work out in your best interest.   I have been to a lot of breakfast and brunch places and never. NEVER. have I had such wonderful food.The Loco Moco is a traditional breakfast from Hawaii. I have never experianced it before , I am glad I did.  It was the best thing I have ever eaten.All the breakfasts come with a little fresh fruit sorbet / glacee dish. I can not impress that this is the place to say if you love food.  We ate dinner out every night in Sedona and would definately say that If Myles and Masumi opened up a full service resturant. It would instantly be the best thing in town. Finally the Hosts.Myles and Masumi are so wonderful and gracious. They made sure that our needs were met and that we had all the information needed about the local sites and sights so that we didn't miss anything that we should not.     We have been to some bed and breakfasts where I was kind of put off by the hosts, but These two I could have sat and listened to their stories for hours. Their wealth of knowledge of the area and graciousness made a wonderful stay for us.Stay at the Sedona Bear Lodge when in town. You won't be disappointed.beautiful place! we stayed in the Hacienda Room. the bed was amazing and huge! very warm, tons of extra blankets, beautiful decor. warm and quiet too. Myles and Masumi were so hospitable. the breakfast was delicious! super simple and filling. the best breakfast we've had at a hotel or b&b. this was home cooked in their kitchen by Myles himself. we loved the small treats too!the whole property radiates positive energy. we were able to spend some time on the outside porch. loved the wind chimes. the lodge is tucked away in a cute quiet neighborhood and is surrounded by juniper trees. overall, a wonderful stay.. we will definitely be staying there again the next time we're in Sedona!I can't believe I forgot to rate this place!!!!!This place was amazing, awesome, perfect... The Sedona Bear Lodge is tucked a way a little bit from downtown (or uptown I forget) Sedona. You simply can not find a place that gives you as much bang for the buck as this place. Seriously... Try and find a less expensive place that comes even close to here!The couple (Myles and Masumi) and their dog (Meeko) are extremely welcoming and make your visit to Sedona perfect! They will make you the most incredible breakfasts and tell you anything and everything you need to know about Sedona. We stayed two nights in the Indian Garden room and it was great. We spoke so highly of this place to friends that another couple stayed here when they came to visit. Review Basics... - Super great service - Super inexpensive considering Sedona prices - Excellent breakfasts included - Would absolutely stay there next time we go to SedonaWhat all the other reviews say are fact - this place is truly special. Why? Here's why:1) Gourmet home-cooked breakfasts perfectly portioned2) Cozy rooms, large bathrooms3) Reasonable rates (very reasonable for Sedona)4) Conveniently located to the major hiking spots and town areas5) Cute friendly dog!Above all, the hosts Masumi and Myles are truly wonderful. My fiance and I felt like they were family. Needless to say, we'll be returning soon, if anything to try out one of their other rooms.Awesome experience.  The rooms  are reasonably priced the breakfast was way beyond our expectations.  Nice cozy location.  Highly recommended.  The owners are cool they treat and talk to you like family.  If u have a chance to stay here don't miss that chance because it will be a cool experienceWe had the most wonderful stay at the Sedona Bear Lodge. Unlike other B&B experiences, we got to know Myles and Masumi, proprietors, who treated us like we were so welcome in their home. Typically, a B&B experience is just about the breakfast. But, at the Sedona Bear Lodge, Myles and Masumi were warm, friendly, and gave us discount cards to local restaurants. Myles even invited us to a free concert by famed flutist Jesse Kalu. What a special treat! Our rooms were ideal as we got a master to ourselves and were provided with a separate room for our two children. Downstairs we spent many hours in the shared living room, getting a massage on the public chair, and playing with the family's dog, Meeko. Sedona Bear Lodge is one place we hope to get back to soon!I found this great B&B from Tripadvisor which currently shows it with a 5 star rating from 98 reviewers.  If you are like me and you'd want to obsess over every review prior to parting with your precious money, you might want to check out that website for more details.Why I love Sedona Bear Lodge:1. Hospitality/Customer service: Example: Masumi and Myles packed a delicious on the go breakfast for us when we had to wake up very early for our drive to the Grand Canyon.  I know they even did this for a guest that was leaving at 2am! 2. Cleanliness: Our room was spotless. Linens and towels were cleaned everyday.3. Breakfast: It's been mentioned by many other reviewers before but it really is going to be one of the best you'll have.  I thought it was better than some restaurants I've had breakfast at and coming from a great food city, I tend to be a bit food snobby.4. Large and clean private bathrooms, good water pressure and good water temperature.  Not many people mention this but after a long day of hiking or walking around exploring, you want to go back and have a good shower, or at Sedona Bear Lodge - a great one.5. Location: The Sedona Bear Lodge is very close to downtown but it is actually in a residential neighborhood which makes it very quiet and peaceful.Love love love this B&B!!! We had an awesome time! The couple who run it (Masumi and Myles) are simply incredible! Food was AMAZING!!!!!! We will be back next time we visit Sedona!!!!This is the best accommodation I've ever paid for, and it's worth every precious cent.I may still be in my late twenties, but I used to travel a lot for work (i.e. Marriott Platinum status) and so I have developed precise evaluation criteria whenever I had to stay at places on my own dime.Here are the top 5 reasons that you should stay here:1. FOOD. Resounding another review below (or above, I don't know how the ordering works), You're losing money by not staying here! Sedona is a touristy and expensive place for food. Breakfast easily exceeds $10 per person and at Bear Lodge you'll get the best breakfast there is. Our breakfast was a really fancy and beautiful breakfast burrito, homemade cucumber and papaya muffin (amazing), homemade pear sorbet (a-freaking-mazing), fruit dishes, homemade cookies, etc. I just drooled on my keyboard.2. MEMORIES. The owners (Masumi and Myles) are an absolutely wonderful people who place your experience at the top. Not only do they provide the materials for you to create the souvenir, they also keep the memories of every guest they've had. A whole lot of fun toys you can use here too-- multiple telescope for viewing the moon and the stars, books, massage chair, hammock in the back, swings, etc.3. BEST BATHROOM. It's super clean, spacious, and they provide everything for you. It feels like staying at a Category 4 or 5 hotel in Marriott terms (out of 7, and 7 is a Ritz-Carlton). It's the best thing you can ask for after a fruitful day of hiking one of the many beautiful Sedona trails.4. BEST GUIDES. The owners really have the love for Sedona and its energy; they really position you right with the peacefulness that you should be experiencing here. Aside from giving you the best tips on sunset, hiking, photos, and food, they also have a delegated fridge to hold all the water bottles you can take for your hikes.5. PEACE. If you're staying at one of the hotels or complexes, you should expect exposure to some absurdity of the youngsters running around at night, dogs barking, or plain drunk people. Light pollution is kind of a problem if you're around downtown too. At Bear Lodge, it's completely silent at night and dark (as in... you literally can't go walking around at night without your own lights). Absolutely beautiful.You'll absolutely love it.Look, this is a different way to view Sedona...The right way!  Miles and Matsumi (the owners of the lodge) make you feel like one of the family. The prices are fair and they have all the info you need about the area, where to eat, what to see, and great hiking trails.    Breakfast was Awsome! The room was clean . This is a great way to stay in Sedona if you are looking to get away from the hotel feel, and want to feel more like you are staying with family.The reviews Don't lie!!! The hosts of Sedona Bear Lodge are the best. I felt so welcome and at home during my stay. Myles, Masumi and Meeko were the nicest and showed great hospitality. I enjoyed talking to them during delicious morning breakfasts and also coming home from a weary day. They gave great recommendations to see Sedona and wonderful insight to what Sedona is all about.  They made us feel like we were their own family. I now consider them as friends, even after a short stay! :)We stayed in the Indian Garden room. It was nice, clean, and cozy. It also had a balcony with a telescope. But we didn't have to use the telescope to see the bright beautiful stars. I'd recommend this place to anyone and will stay there again in the near future.If you have been exhausted by your daily life, you must visit Sedona and stay at Sedona Bear Lodge.  Masumi & Myles (Owner) will treat you like their family. We have stayed Sedona Bear Lodge twice already.  When we visited Sedona this February, we hiked Boyton Canyon which Masumi recommended the most.  It took us 1.5 hours to arrive to the top but it does worth it!!!   We enjoyed amazing view of Mother Nature.  It was absolutely one of our best hikes ever. On that night we soaked in the Jacuzzi & looking at stars.  I am surprised stars in Sedona's sky are big and bright!  We enjoyed our quiet time and it was so relaxing. (Don't forget to try a massage chair in their living room) Next morning, it's time for famous breakfast made by Masumi & Myles. Masumi bakes homemade bread every morning and Myles prepares the breakfast. I love their breakfast burrito; it's so delicious    Breakfast menu changes everyday so you never get bored. If you love bear, you should check Masumi's bear collection.  She has a great selection of Smokey Bear and other bears.  You can purchase Masumi's original Sedona bear or other staffs for souvenir. Too many things to tell you about this B&B. Well, seeing is believing.  Pack your staff and visit Sedona Bear Lodge next weekend!Myles and Masumi are the BEST!!!!!  Cannot laud their property, accommodations, food, and service enough.  They bend over backwards for all of their guests and are the heighth of friendliness.  We forgot our hiking sticks at home . . . guess what--they had two to loan us!  As well as binoculars, canes, meditation mats, pretty much anything you might need they have available.  Need guidance/advice on something to do?  They have a mountain of information/fliers/maps and personal experience ready and available for you.  The location is in a very, very quiet and relaxing area--slept like babies!  Rooms were extremely well-decorated and very comfortable.  We cannot give them a higher rating, and will definitely be availing ourselves of their services the next time we're in Sedona!Where do I have to start about this place? First, let's start with the tenants, Matsumi and Myles. They both made my fiancee (Laura) and my stay the best it could possibly be. The way they relate to you and allow you to become family changes the entire way you will look at lodging. Talking to them throughout our stay they were beyond helpful in offering advice on where to go and what to do. They have many books and pamphlets about what to do in the area, and despite the fact that they are still new to the area; they went out of their way to make sure we were treated supremely well.  As for this cozy house, it simply engulfs you in its aura, and it feels like you do not want to leave. Walking in immediately, you will see the dining area, where your amazing breakfasts will start (I'll discuss later). You will also see to your left pristine living room with a comfy massage chair among large snug couches ready for you to be enveloped in.  The outside has a large Jacuzzi; however it was a bit too chilly to use it just yet. The outdoor porch is amazing and welcoming, especially with the views it provided us when we sat outside. We were allowed to tour the entire house and see each room. Each room is well worth the price levels they put on their website. Among options for rooms you have the Indian Garden, good for a lone visitor, or for a family trip you may want to opt for the Ponderosa/Bunk House, large enough for the whole family. We opted for the middle option, the Hacienda Room, which had everything a couple could need for a weekend trip.Finally, the food.....My goodness. Each night before you retire they will ask when you want your food made, and it was spot on timing from their end. First morning, we had breakfast burritos with salsa. Sounds simple right? No, no, you're mistaken. These burritos were handcrafted by Myles and Masumi, and came with a build your own fruit, granola and yogurt area. Along with this comes a carafe of fresh OJ and fresh coffee all made as you wake up. Finally, there is a frozen twist! Myles makes this frozen fruit smoothie, each morning a different type. The next morning, we were provided an outstanding chopped ham and cheese dish which was partnered with a sunny side up egg atop 6 separate sauteed veggies. Once again, same yogurt bar and a different frozen fruit smoothie. They will hang around with you, opting to make wonderful morning conversation and gather what you did the night before and what is to await you that next day. This may very well occur the night before as well, if you aren't exhausted from your travels that day. They have a quick-boil pot which will allow for a quick cup of relaxing tea for yourself. Heck, they are always around and ready to put on a spot of tea for you, or help you. That's what makes them so great. At the end, we truly didn't want to leave, but we were told that this was now our own "home away from home", and that we "must stop by so we can see you next time you're in town".  We truly won't forget this spot. They've earned customers for life, and we will always make sure that when we stay in Sedona, we stay at the Sedona Bear Lodge. If you see this, let them know Jeff and Laura sent you....It will put a smile on their faces.-JeffReally nice! Friendly staff ! Great area also! A cool town to to in! Prices are good tooI loved staying here! The owners of the B&B were so inviting and welcoming. My fiance and I talked with them for several hours and it immediately felt like we had known them for years. The room that we stayed in was adorable and quaint. We were able to sneak a peek at the other rooms and they are just as nice if not nicer than the one we stayed in. Miles and Matsumi never hesitated to offer use something to drink and always had snacks out for us to munch on and take with us on our journey. They even made us breakfast. I thought it would be a continental style where we just help ourselves to bagels and muffins. Nope! A warm, cooked meal. Reviewing it is making me want to go back now!We only stayed one night but we are looking forward to going back for a longer stay. Super nice folks; Masumi amd Myles. They accommodated our early check-in request. They checked with us on any diet restrictions and followed through on those the next morning at breakfast. Room was great. Grounds are great. Price is great. Beautiful area. They took pictures and sent to us when we checked out; a nice touch. Breakfast and all the snacks and beverages were great.Lovely B&B,nice owners, amazing balcony copious shelf space.  Moon was awesome, there is a telescope on the balconyWe had a great time staying with Myles and Masumi at Sedona Bear Lodge. We stayed in the Hacienda Room. It was perfect. Super comfortable king sized bed, luxurious sheets, down pillows. It was very private and quiet.  Myles and Masumi make delicious, gourmet breakfasts. They are the perfect mix of attentive while also giving you your space. They had tons of suggestions and guides of things to do while in Sedona. Basically, stay here. It is the best bang for your buck. We will definitely be back.

I recently stayed here for while in town for a wedding--I was looking for an affordable place  that was not only convenient, but nice enough to really feel like I was on vacation. Overall, I was fairly disappointed. Not to say the hotel didn't have it's perks. Location-wise, King's Ransom was great. It was right in the middle of town and the view was decent.  Breakfast wasn't bad either. It was a bit cold to spend time outside when I visited in December, but the hotel grounds did have a few nice areas to spend time in warmer weather.For about $100 a night,though, even in an expensive town like Sedona, I expect a lot more from a hotel.  I should really say "motel" since you access the rooms from outside.  The room was also pretty dingy, complete with worn bedspreads made popular by places like Motel 6. And even though the room was (too) dim, there were a lot of obvious carpet stains.There was also a problem with the TV in the room. We had a technician come to look at it, but he was stumped. We told him to forget about it since we weren't spending much time in the room. But that didn't stop a different maintenance guy from showing up at 7am the next day. So much for sleeping in. We told him not to worry about it either, but he showed up again while we were getting ready. Just to avoid another unexpected visit, we let him in. Turns out the cable was broken. And when I say broken, I mean the cord itself was severed. I'm not sure how this stumped the first guy. Next time I go to Sedona, I'll just plan on footing the bill for something nicer or pay half the price for an actual motel/ Why pay $100 for a run down "inn" when there are so many other options?Only stayed one night. The room was just fine. The front desk service was sort of strange...like they have never checked anyone in before. No elevator to help lift your stuff to the second floor. We had a cooler of ice and drinks since it was over 100 degrees. The pool was fine. We missed the free breakfast. It is right at the bottom of a lovely hike. Don't miss the hike...it's the best part about this location.What a disappointment. The only thing positive I can mention is that the staff listened to my concern and acted accordingly. After checking in, and finding a parking place, we made the long walk down a musty hallway to a dark, dank and depressing room. Stained carpet and the smell of mildew instantly turned my stomach. The entire place needs a serious make-over! The furniture is old and ugly, the sheets have lost their crispness, and the AC is loud! And what hotel feels justified charging $135 a night with an only 24" tube TV? Smelly, ugly and overpriced! Sorry guys, you were great at the front desk, but your Inn is OU!great place to use as a "base camp" for hiking Sedona.  Central to Cathedral, Bell Rock, etc.  Elote Cafe is on the premises.  Staff was accommodating.  The free breakfast has lots of offerings for hikers: hard boiled eggs, oatmeal, yogurt, cereals, sweet rolls and make-your-own waffles.  Room was clean and housekeeping cleaned quickly after we left the room.  Having a view from the room was a great treat.This place worked great for us during our trip to Sedona!  We ended up getting a great room for pretty cheap in Sedona standards (around $115 before tax).  The ladies at the front desk were friendly and accomodating.  They let us look at the rooms before deciding to stay there.  We looked at three rooms.  The one we got was clean and roomy, but there was one that smelled like smoke, and one that was pretty cramped.  Not all of the rooms are the same.  Some have flat screened tvs, some don't, but they have all the necessities.  They even have an awesome pool and hot tub that was connected right to our sliding door.All in all, this fit my standards.  They were even economical using soap and shampoo dispensors to avoid going through a lot of those tiny bottles and bars of soap. They are also located right next to what is supposed to be the greatest mexican restaurant in town.Ok so this is not Kings Ransom Hotel that is just across the parking lot. But this place was affordable & had the pool that guests over at Kings Ransom Hotel come over to use. They share facilities apperently like the gym over at the hotel, Inn guests can use it. So it had all that I needed. A bed and a shower. Breakfast is provided but not much of a selection. Awesome do it yourself waffle maker though. I had the breakfast the first morning but opted to something else the next. Nice staff but they tend to walk out for a smoke very often. Downside was that the pool are closes at 10pm. I came back after a day of hiking wanting to soak longer in the spa for my aching muscles. The watchdog at night that came out for a smoke kicked us out. The room had outdated carpet, shower was not strong enough, odd that the sink is outside of the bathroom and AC was SUPER loud. Kept me up the first night trying to get used to. Oh and the walls are thin so in the morning I could hear everyone.Based on the pictures and online ratings I thought I was booking a decent room at a nice establishment.   Not so much,  the room was nothing like the advertised picture, no refrigerator and an old Zenith TV not anything like the flat screen in the picture online.  It smelled bad, very musty and not very clean.  The sheets were stained and furniture very old and beat up.  It smelled so bad we couldn't even sleep the whole night through!!  King Ransom Inn,  if your going to charge the same rates as your competition in Sedona, AZ you could at least do some renovation and give your guests the experience they paid for!!!  Very disappointed!!This hotel is not worth the money. The room are NOT worth the amount they charge. I am currently disputing a credit card charge from them that was made ONE MONTH AFTER I stayed there.Not as crappy as the quasi-attached Kings Ransom Sedona Hotel, but still pretty crappy.Filthy carpet, years worth of dust on the draperies and in every corner, and the toiletries are super-lousy supposedly-green versions that you pump out of wall-mounted bulk dispensers. Vacuums are apparently not an amenity afforded the housekeeping staff. (And actually, come to think of it, I never heard one running when I was present for housekeeping time.)The night receptionist was rude, the day receptionist was disinterested.I apparently lucked out in my room, as I had enough pillows for my bed, unstained linens, and an air conditioner with a thermostat. The WiFi was  non-functional, but Comfort Inn's is helpfully unsecured. My travel companions and my hotel neighbors were not so lucky.The "free expanded continental breakfast" isn't worth the price paid, pays no heed to hygiene or food safety, and has the audacity to proffer a tip jar but no breakfast attendant or restocking. The "expanded" is waffle batter, of which only an allotted number of pre-measured cups are provided. By the time you get to them, they'll already have skinned over or congealed. Whoop-de-effing-doo. And, BTW, waffles apparently do not imply the availability of syrup. On the (extremely small sliver of a) bright side, the location is super convenient, Elote Cafe is supposed to be awesome, and Margs Draw Trail is right out the door.If you win the room lottery, never have to interact with the staff, and plan on eating breakfast elsewhere, it's not the worst hotel I've ever stayed in. It would take a lot to bring me back here, though.We stayed at this place on the first week of September 2012. Sedona is expensive and places in the village area are mostly sold as resorts which we did not need.For a modest place to sleep, Kings Ransom is fine, and price is fair.I have to say that I'm pretty easy going when it comes to hotels & getting what you pay for. However!!! This place was definetly over priced! The room was outdated & basic, the walls were so thin we could hear our neighbor coughing all night!! & then of course all the morning hussle & bustle too! The pillows were excessively big! We had a nightmare of a night!! So bad so that we rarly argue but we had such a bad night it we had a rough morning! Stay away from here, not worth it! Motel 6 is a better value!!Came here on a last minute trip and thought this place looked like a cheap enough place to stay for a night.  To my surprise it cost more than I expected but nonetheless we stayed there anyways.  We got there before check-in and were fortunate enough that there was a room open.  Room wasn't great--smelled muggy when we walked in, everything in there was outdated, and we also didn't have regular pillows(?). Not sure if this was just in my room or in every room, but our pillows were TINY (half the size of normal pillows). Not sure what was up with that! On the bright side: complimentary breakfast!My traveling companion from the Netherlands and I checked in on 01/21/2012 and stayed just long enough to discover a bedbug when I pulled down the sheet on my bed.  We were offered another room.  No thanks!  We got a refund and stayed at the clean and accomodating Super 8 Motel across town.We found this at the last minute when we got into Sedona. Location was great because it was in old town not on the strip. The price was $99 for a large room with two beds. This was a road trip with my bf and we just wanted a clean room with two beds in a good location and it had all that. Both the night front desk and day person were very friendly and helpful. It was comfort Inns wi-fi because I think they own them. Nothing fancy but I would stay here again unless of course I was looking for a resort or spa.To put it simply:  this place is a dump.  I was very disappointed, and I'm not "hard to please."  I see no difference between this hotel and a Motel 6.  The only other plus is that it sits right at the trailhead for Marg's Draw.  If you're in Sedona purely for the hiking, then this place will do.  Also, be warned, many of the photos depicting the Inn are photoshopped!  It does NOT sit amongst the red rocks!If you aren't going to spend much time in your room and looking for a cheap place to crash while visiting Sedona - this will do. We stayed here on a last minute trip. The room was ehhh. We killed a cricket within the first 5 minutes of being there... ok, not a huge deal. The bed was comfy, nothing special. The biggest complaint I have was the amount of NOISE we could hear from the rooms above us. Maybe it was the location of ours... but man, starting around 6:30am, I heard every step someone took above me. The metal steps that run alongside the hotel - also loud throughout night/early morning. I would recommend requesting an UPSTAIRS room if you do stay here. I'll give credit though, they do have a great continental breakfast complete with a waffle maker and fresh muffins, and a pretty ncie pool area with nice lounge chairs. If you're going to Sedona to be outside, and not looking for a resort-style place to hang - Kings Ransom will do the trick.

A heart-felt thank you to the Briar Patch Inn in Sedona, Arizona. From the moment we pulled into this sanctuary we were enveloped in it's magical, grounding peace. Every word, every pebble, feels like a gift given with intention. I entered this sacred space raw and yearning and left with healing peace. From a mourning mama with a husband and three adventurous little boys, you honored me and I will forever hold gratitude in my heart. One constructive note: The shower in Oriole cabin desperately needs to be upgraded. A garden hose behind the building might have been better.My wife and I had an absolute wonderful time staying in the Owl cabin. This place is a hidden gem. Quiet, peaceful, almost like stepping back in time. Real fireplaces in the cabins. No WIFI, no TV. A weekend here will send you home a changed person. Eat breakfast right next to Oak Creek. Stare at the millions of stars at night. We made our next reservation before we left.This was a much needed getaway. Stayed in the Owl room. The place is amazing! It is secluded and romantic. A great breakfast every morning,featured quiche, homemade breads or muffins. The staff is amazing very helpful and friendly. The fireplace is stacked nicely each day. A Great getaway for anyone needing to relax and rejuvenate.It starts with a warm and welcoming check in and it only gets better! Relaxation is something we all need a bit more of, well, go to Briar Patch Inn and you will go home a more peaceful person. The quiet nights, the stars that are brighter than bright and the cabins that are so toasty and warm. It was our second stay (every mid-December) and will not be our last. Polly is amazing and pleasant beyond words; she is so well suited for her job as hostess! Everyone is just wonderful.The perfect place to get away and focus on what really matters. What a sanctuary. There is not one negative thing I can say about Briar Patch Inn. I HIGHLY recommend.Just stayed here for two nights, it was so peaceful and beautiful! We stayed in Robin and you could hear oak creek from the cabin. The staff were very friendly and I lived the personal touches; the fire was made every day, lots of firewood, wine in the room, fresh flowers. Really great experience overall. The bathroom was very dated, but I can look past this because of the charm and tasty breakfast.We love this place everytime WE visit Sedona. The Establishment, the Staff(Rob & Polly) & Location is the Best. Hope to be back soon!No other Place in Sedona!!! The FirestonesI wish a world existed where I had no commitments or obligations other than simply living year round at The Briar Patch Inn. Friendly staff, homemade and thoughtful breakfasts and beautiful grounds running alongside the subtly rippling Oak Creek. I was secretly glad the Sedona Marathon was cancelled when I visited because I thought, 'this means I can stay at Briar Patch and just read beside the fire and walk around!' The Briar Patch Inn is almost synonymous with The Shire in that it's secluded, lush in foliage and seemingly comprised of jovial, congenial hobbits. When we walked into the office to check in I half expected someone to be perched on one of the wooden tables, shouting, "Today is my one hundred and eleventh birthday!" I really hope to return to The Briar Patch Inn. I know I'd like to see it . . . one last time . . .My husband and I just stayed here and it was amazing. Cute little cabins that were extremely clean!! Cozy beds and a wonderful fireplace. I use to work in Sedona and I have wanted to stay the night here at Briar Patch for years!!! Glad we did and we will most certainly do it again! Good breakfast as well. Thank you Brianna, for accommodating us on our anniversary stay!I have somewhat mixed feelings after staying at the Briar Patch Inn. First and foremost, the staff is INCREDIBLE. They are so wonderfully friendly and helpful, some of the nicest people you want to meet. Another great point of this inn is that they serve breakfast every morning--and it's a fantastic breakfast of hard and soft-boiled eggs, oatmeal, quiche (which changes daily), fresh fruit, yogurt, breads, and muffins. It was a fantastic way to start your day on the right foot. They also serve cheeses, cookies, and hot cider in the afternoons (which was fabulous). The grounds are really quite pretty and there are a few resident sheep and also a small patio overlooking the nearby creek that goes by the property (which is really pretty). The cabins are all relatively private and quiet, so we didn't hear any noise during our stay. That said, I was surprised how rustic they were. This wasn't a bad thing, but I had thought given the cost of the facility, perhaps the bathrooms and kitchens would be upgraded with more lighting or nicer materials. Knowing this, I might have opted to find another place to stay that was slightly more modern. So that caught me somewhat off-guard. We stayed in the Robin cabin, and my husband is 6' so he could barely fit in the shower---I'm 5'6" and it was definitely a squeeze for me, too! Additionally, our toilet was placed in a smaller location which made me wonder how people who are larger would fare in that cabin. Not sure if some of the other cabins were like that, but I had hoped we would have a tub or another option for relaxation other than the fire. There are no TVs at Briar Patch (which we were pretty okay with) and you have all the wood you can burn! We were able to still have a nice, cozy Northern Minnesota-style Christmas down in sunny AZ, which was what we were after.A friend of mine chose Sedona as a way to celebrate a big birthday milestone. I reviewed a number of options to stay including private homes through Air BNB and VRBO.com and ultimately landed on Briar Patch Inn. Upon arrival we were met by a mystical lush set against a babbling brook surrounded by the beautiful red rock that Sedona is known for. Already our expectations were blown.The Inn keeper met us with a smile, a personal note, and worry dolls to set under our pillow at night as we settled into our escape from the technological world. We roamed the grounds and happened upon peacefully placed hammocks, friendly sheep and literally had a butterfly bless our cabin the very first night there.Waking up the next morning took us further down the rabbit hole of this hidden gem when we were met with a beautiful breakfast spread and a LIVE string duet. We thought we might've found a little piece of heaven. No other part of the world existed except for where our imagination would carry us, and carry us it did. It carried us to sparkling watering holes, majestic panoramic views and unexplained energy points. Not only will we be coming back to Sedona to re-experience the enchantment that radiates from all parts of this quiet town, but we will be doing it at the Briar Patch Inn. There is something about that place that makes your soul smile and spirit soar and it's perfect for all ages.There's a testimonial online that states "Paradise on Earth" for the Briar Patch Inn; this encapsulates the mystical place that we had the pleasure of resting our heads for 2 nights. We (my Mum & her best friend - both Australian, my boyfriend - Indian, my friend from Austria and my friend from California) arrived in the dead of night after an afternoon at the Grand Canyon. Even though it was close to midnight when we arrived we were able to easily find the Inn and were provided the keys to the Ponderosa cabin. It was a muggy June evening, so to be welcomed by air-conditioning once crossing the threshold was a godsend. As I walked around the cabin, settling in, I was struck by the influence of Native American/Sedonaesqe decor. There were gorgeous materials on the wall, comfortable leather couches and unique items dotted throughout. I glanced at the gorgeous table that could seat 8-10 people and right in the middle was a welcome note with a worry doll box on it. What a thoughtful gift! (I think this was particularly needed for some in our party after driving from Grand Canyon to Sedona late at night.... but, that's another story)Waking up the next morning was a delight; from the view in my room overlooking the gorgeous Sedona hinterland, to the expansive (breathtaking!) view of the Arizona landscape on the balcony, everywhere I turned I was impressed. Inside the house the view during the day shed new light on the accommodation. The kitchen was large and filled with sunlight, the house was clean and welcoming (with board games to boot!), the bedrooms were sized well and there was plenty of space for a large group + all our luggage. Breakfast was provided every morning, and what a breakfast it was! Fruit salad, pastries, quiche, coffee, tea, jams, juices and the list goes on. Not only was the breakfast itself impressive, but the dining area was one for the history books. I'd read before coming to Briar Patch Inn that it there was creekside seating, however, I thought that was for the swimming hole or for those who wanted to do a little adventuring. The dining area itself was next to the creekside, and what a joy it was to eat breakfast next to a creek every morning, the sounds of the running water washing away all negative thoughts preparing you for a day filled with adventure, relaxation or mysticism (Sedona has all 3 options). Breakfast isn't the only option next to the creek, there is a gorgeous massage room that is available for those needing even more of a wind down (me!). I had the pleasure of utilizing this service and what a pleasure it was! The woman they contracted out (I can't remember her name...) was experienced and was able to provide a thoroughly relaxing time. There's also swimming hole next to the creek and the path that leads up to the swimming hole has a little sheep enclosure and a gorgeous area with hammocks and totem poles. We stayed up late in the hammocks one night and just watched the stars in the night sky.Overall I would give this place 9.5/10. The only thing that I could see that could need improvement is little updates in the bathroom amenities (in the cabins) and whole house cooling/heating rather than the small air-conditioning units in each of the rooms. Thanks to Rob and the team for providing a wonderful experience. See Hear Speak No Evil - danyellekelly.comWhat a fabulous place to stay. The folks were so friendly and helpful. The breakfasts were delicious and plentiful in such a cozy setting. The cabin (I had the Quail) was rustic, impeccably clean and very comfortable. Glad there was no TV. The small wood burning stove was a real treat. Next time I go back- it's the Briar Patch for sure.I just returned to the Briar Patch Inn after my first visit several years ago this past weekend. It was as wonderful as I remembered it. If you are looking for a gorgeous place for rest and relaxation away from computers, phones, wi-fi, tv and noise, this is your place. These are rustic cabins right on Oak Creek. We stayed in Creekside where we could hear the rushing of Oak Creek as we sat on our patio and as we played Scrabble in our living room. The breakfast is excellent and is included in the price of the room. The beds are comfortable, and we found the kitchen well stocked enough with pots, pans and utensils to make ourselves a really nice meal the first night we were there. The grounds are beautiful and well tended. So why, you may ask, only four stars?The rooms could use some upgrading. They haven't changed one bit in the years between when I was there the first time and now, and for what you are getting the price is pretty steep. Also, there was a marked difference in the desk staff and the way they interacted with the guests. The woman who was there the day we checked in and the next day was super helpful and accommodating. She helped us find a Scabble board and a deck of cards, gave me a breakfast recipe and asked if we wanted our room serviced while we ate breakfast. The woman at the desk the last morning we were there asked everyone which room they were in (almost as if her intention was to make sure no one was stealing breakfast) and when I asked for a recipe she told me to buy the book they had for sale (which I didn't really want). When I explained that the person the prior morning had given me a copy of a recipe she said, "well we really don't do that anymore but I can look." It was just a totally different way of being treated and when you are spending close to $400 per night--I expect the former not the latter treatment. All in all this is the place to go if you want a special setting near Sedona and you are looking for something that is unusual, beautiful and dedicated to relaxation.The Briar Patch was everything I wanted and needed and more. I spent hours wandering the beautiful river looking at rocks and odd pieces of wood that had washed down stream in high water times. Total relaxation is what I wanted and found away from the traffic and people in Sedona. The Inn was total luxury for me in a comfortable and cozy sort of way with delicious food and a happy staff. I wasn't disappointed and plan to go back with my grandchildren the next time!We recently visited Sedona for a week, and we decided to try two different places to stay. We stayed at Briar Patch Inn the first 4 nights in the cabin Wren. This was a magical little place that I thoroughly enjoyed. It's beautifully located in the woods, and this particular cabin is quite isolated on the corner, which is pleasant. The breakfast is delicious, and the scenery next to the creek while eating breakfast is even better. The decor in the cabin is delightfully bright in Southwest designs. There's not much to complain about, but the cabin could be updated a bit. The patio seating had no cushions, which I found strange as much as you want to sit outside with a glass of wine. The toiletries were most definitely lacking with the glycerin soap and built-in shampoo dispenser. I believe this could be improved. Other than that, this establishment is quaint, a perfect location, provides a lovely breakfast, and is a wonderful place to relax with beautiful scenery. I also enjoyed seeing the sheep on the property each day, Wooly and Lilly. When I return to Sedona, I would most definitely like to stay here again.What a great place...I'm hesitant to even review it because I don't want people to know how amazing of a place this is. We had a creek running outside of our door and it was so well kept. Wow. I am writing because people do need to go and support this business. Love this place and if/when I am in Sedona again I will stay here no need to look any further.Amazing! Everything about Briar Patch exceeded our expectations. We stayed in Quail cabin and were very pleased...clean, cozy and quiet (the real woodstove was a treat!). Breakfast was lovely, but must say that I wish it was served earlier than 8am (which is the only reason this is not five stars). An earlier option, even if less food, would be great. Nevertheless, the food was delicious with plenty of options, but get there early or you'll be standing and waiting for people to 'decide' what they will eat when you are about to gnaw your arm off. We can't wait to return and will plan staying for a much longer time to soak in the river, the trees, the relaxing atmosphere of the Briar Patch Inn, plus there is so much more to explore in the hills of Sedona and outlying areas.Unfortunately it rained our whole visit and was very cold and we were told we couldn't use fireplace, that was a bummer. And sadly bc of weather there wasn't much to do, not there fault. But it was cold and couldn't get heat in the bathroom. It was nice to sleep in the rain, beds were pretty comfortable even though place is pretty rustic. I wish breakfast went a little later, I like to sleep in and not rush on vacation. It was beautiful but maybe too rustic for me...I just want to agree with all the positive comments. We had a really memorable three- day reunion stay in two separate cabins: my sister and her husband in Ivy and my brother and and husband and I in the two-bedroom Heron, both of which are delightful. Ivy is tucked in cleverly behind the main building and feels very cozy, and Heron is at the far end of the property farthest from everything (which means a lovely short walk along the road beside the creek and past the sheep.) The fires are laid and the fireplaces lovely, the breakfasts are wonderful and the entire outdoor ambiance is restful and just sublime. We'll go back.
review_content_20: I am so thankful I made the decision to visit Briar Patch, because it was such a fantastic and relaxing experience!First off, this is the most relaxing place that I have ever been. There is no wifi (except in the lodge during business hours), there is no TV in your room, and the only phone is a payphone. My cell phone got no service in this area whatsoever (ATT&T but Sprint did work). Briar Patch has a wide variety of books and magazines to read, and there is a CD player with local musicians CD's in the room.The fireplace was absolutely fantastic, especially on those chilly nights. They restock you with wood every day.There are so many lovely little spots to visit and sit and relax all about the property, including hammocks and seating areas by the creek. Grab a bottle of wine from the little store a half mile up the road, grab some cheese and crackers from the lodge, and find an area near the creek to relax and share a romantic moment with your loved one.The cabins themselves are huge and fully stocked (we stayed in "The Oak"). We had a full kitchen with lots of cooking utensils that allowed us to cook and not have to go into town. My favorite part of the experience was the personalization and dedication to customer service. They left a little note with our names wishing us a fantastic time, and it was such a nice thing to walk into. They also let us check in about two hours early. The breakfast was nice each morning. There was oatmeal, hard and soft boiled eggs, a different quiche each day, home baked bread, jams, fruit, yogurt, and muffins; all included with your room. We also had on-site massages from two wonderful ladies. We had our massages in the outdoor "Kiva" room because they were renovating the creek site massage hut... but we snuck a peak and boy does that massage hut look fantastic! Outdoor massages are great because you feel more connected with nature, and you get to hear the sounds of nature and birds chirping instead of ocean waves like you get at a spa. I can't wait to come back the next time I need some R&R!I stayed here for three nights recently and it was worth it!! We were in the Kingfisher cabin which had its own beautiful path out toward the private patio overlooking the Oak Creek which was flowing with water. We swam in the creek which is private for guests staying at the Inn. This is where you go to relax. Although Sedona is beautiful it was hard to leave this place. It is cooler down there as you are right on the water and it is absolutely lush and green. The staff is very friendly and accommodating. The breakfast was lovely and included: Soft & hard boiled eggs, granola, fresh fruit, oatmeal, home baked bread, muffins, quiche, jams & jelly's, orange juice, coffee, & teas. Plus as you eat your delectable breakfast creekside you have this most wonderful music performed by "Lyra." The breeze is blowing through the trees, the birds are singing the creek water is flowing. Life is good!! You can lay in one of their hammocks and dream and nap and dream...I say go there now! Next time I am there I will stay at Briar Patch Inn :) LOVE LOVE LOVE!!!We stayed here last valentines day! It has such charm and character. I forgot what cabin we were in but it was huge facing the creek. Had a nice fireplace, beautiful patio, and very sweet breakfast in the morning. Although it doesn't get phone service it's really quite nice because you have to disconnect to reconnect sometimes!
