Plus room wasn't that cheap.My husband and I had a fantastic stay at this hotel! The room was very nice...well kept and comfortable. Our room had complimentary bottles of water, bag of popcorn, and bag of pretzels, which was a nice touch. I loved the strands of lights behind the headboard, it made for romantic mood lighting. All of the staff I encountered were very friendly. Especially the man who was staffing the breakfast area - he was so upbeat and did a great job keeping everything stocked. The breakfast buffet was great! The property itself was clean and had nice landscaping. Overall, it seems like they care about all the little details that make a great stay. I would definitely recommend!If I could rate this hotel a 0 on customer service I would. Everyone at the front desk especially then men are extremely rude to the point it is almost harassing. I will never return and will make sure to advise every single person I know to not go here. Worst service in the world. I would much rather sleep outside in the freezing cold then stay here again.This was one of the only lesser expensive places around.No Views here.King size comfortable bed with large Jacuzzi tub.Good AC.Back area on lower level.ProsGood friendly serviceDecent Gymgood location of Hwy 89APlenty of parkingConsDated roomsSmall Bathrooms.Glorified motelNo easy access with a lot of baggage.Our experience at this hotel was amazing! Checked in late in the afternoon to a very welcoming staff & was a super easy process. My sister and I were offered cookies & fruit infused water (yum). The office was clean, big & so was the rest of the property! We got to our room & it was so cute! I was surprised with how spacious our 2 queen bedroom was. The decor was warming & matched the whole Sedona feel. Our room faced the pool, yes the pool is small but its surrounded by tables and chairs. We easily went down there to eat and relax. The next morning we had their FREE continental breakfast. It was way MORE than a continental breakfast because they served waffles, pancakes, bagels, cereal, oatmeal, eggs, potatoes, sausage & much more. It was also pretty tasty. We were elated and so happy with our stay. Definitely will be coming back.The place was clean. I like that they provide complimentary cookies in the lobby. We had the pool and hot tub to ourselves at night. The room we got didn't have a special view or anything (we could see into the back yard of a house).Not bad for a Motel!My husband and I decided to drive into Sedona a night early from our reservations. Amara was fully committed for Saturday night so we had no other choice but to call around for a place to stay for a night.. This place was a good deal for the price. Nice size fridge, great air conditioning, flat screen, microwave, complimentary WiFi.. and I'm very picky about running HOT water, and I was not disappointed. Breakfast is over at 10AM.Poorly designed rooms, small jacuzzi, rooms THUNDER when adjacent doors close. Bathroom incomplete, tub and vanity outside bathroom, making it awkward, at best. No blackout curtains, morning sun waking you prematurely. Electric AC unit rattling all night. +1 For hot breakfast, it was good. Poor room, for the rate. Would not recommend.My wife and I stayed at the Arroyo Pinion Hotel during our visit to Sedona. While we didn't have a great experience, I appreciate the staff following up with me after our trip and ensuring that we receive a full refund. Overall, I'm a satisfied customer.Totally serviceable, but not a bargain, or a premium experience.    What do you look for when you stay at a hotel?  Break it down:  Some folks want a place they can get for a great price.  Great is relative, though, since hotels cost more on expensive cities then they do in cheap cities.  Some folks want a premium accommodations: marble baths, plush carpet, 1000 thread count Egyptian cotton sheets. If you've ever stayed at (or been upgraded to) a suite at one of the nicer hotels in Vegas, you know what I'm talking about.      Arroyo is a "lil of column A, lil of column B" type of hotel.    A room here costs between $150-$200 a night, which is not crazy expensive...but not cheap either.  Sedona on the whole is a bit overpriced, so I'm going to call this hotel "moderate."You get a large room, reasonably comfortable bed, a gas fireplace, and a very awkward jacuzzi in the sleeping area.  You get a large fridge, and a microwave. There is a small flat screen in your room, with a decent number of free channels. Unfortunately, the towels are scratchy, water pressure is low, and the bathroom is small enough that the sink/vanity is outside of the shower/water closet area.  Wifi is free, and they give you access to breakfast that is a mixed bag.  Fruit, yogurt, bagels/cream cheese - all good.  Eggs/sausage?  Inedible.  There is a pool that is great if you are smurf sized.  Kinda small otherwise. Front desk staff is helpful, but not very knowledgeable about local hiking or attractions.  When asked about the difficult of specific hiking trails, for example, I got a lot of blank stares.  Which is weird, considering hiking is one of the major attractions of the area.  If you are not seeking a premium "Vegas-style" hotel, and can stay here for $100-$125 a night, go for it!  Otherwise, see what else is out there.Hotel is located right in the tourist trap zone aka Main Street. It's relatively cheap to stay here but the price does reflect the room conditions. They do serve breakfast if you absolutely need to eat; otherwise this is something easily skippable as the food isn't that great.I like the apples they have in the lobby. These make great snacks for hiking.Not the cleanest hotel I've been in, but the beds were comfortable and the complementary breakfast was GREAT! Fresh orange juice, good choices of fresh bread, mini muffins and bagels! I recommend a deep cleaning of the rooms!We stayed in this location while visiting the Sedona area - which was several weeks ago and I just realized I uploaded lots of pictures and never reviewed the place (oops)!  We booked the room online prior to going up for the weekend and it was a painless process.  Upon arrival, all we had to do was check in and grab room keys.  The doors were a touch difficult to get into with the new key system they have here, but once we figured it out we were good to go.  The room was obviously a renovated room as alluded to on the hotel's booking site online.  It was very modern and even had USB charging ports in the wall along with the AC plugs, which was very convenient.  Probably the most lacking thing was the porch area outside, although it rained for a large portion of the weekend, so we wouldn't have used it much anyhow.  It's not too bad of a drive to get to the main attraction areas in downtown Sedona, but parking in downtown Sedona when you don't book a hotel on the main strip can be a touch of an annoyance, but on the flip side it is why this hotel charged less for a night.  The service was just as easy upon check out. Overall: A-It felt a touch tight in the bathroom, which is design of the place, and not so much the hotel's fault since there isn't much they can do about it now, right?  We will probably stay on the main strip next time, but this is definitely NOT a bad night stay if you are in the area!My partner and I came up to visit the vineyards in cottonwood, made our way into Sedona and decided to stay the night. We were greeted by a really sweet girl named Katie who was so nice and gave us a great deal on a king room with a jacuzzi tub and fireplace. The property was super cute and clean. A perfect romantic getaway and only a  5 min drive into town. We will definitely stay again. The whole staff was super friendly!! Well done.We come to Sedona quite a bit and have stayed at so many different places...private homes, hotels and a few of the resorts.  We had a change in plans and made last minute reservations (less than 24 hrs) and decided on Arroyo Pinon for the price, location and amenities based on the website. We did check out another website for recommendations and reviews and they were not as bad as what the Yelpers posted.  The other website had more recent reviews.  Upon arrival we were able to check in early and my son loved they had cookies waiting also apples which we took for our hike.  We got into our room and it was clean no ugly hairs anywhere, the bathroom was stocked with nice towels and the bedding was clean (but I didn't have a blue light or anything).  I noticed we had golden yellow bedspreads oppose to dark brown, but all the sheets were white, clean and soft. A few nice amenities included free Wi-Fi, coffeemaker with Starbucks coffee, a safe, microwave and small refrigerator.  The Arroyo Pinon included breakfast which wasn't that bad.  They offered  eggs, bacon, sausage and waffles.  Also a variety of bagels, pastries, yogurts, instant oatmeal and cereal.  It probably saved us 40 bucks for a family of three.  So, all in all we were all very comfortable and very please with the amenities.
review_content_20: On a good note: beds were comfortable, hotel is in good proximity to town & hikes -and bottles of water are offered daily for free, with a free breakfast and a clean (small) pool and Jacuzzi. However, beware - this is nothing more than a glorified motel.The cleaning staff does not understand one single word of English, so I find it hard to believe they are legal citizens.  Not one word.  You would think that at the very least: English words to comprehend of "coffee, bugs, towels & toilet paper." should be on the job application for a housekeeping position. Nope. No matter what you try to ask them, "packets of make up remover" are handed to you?  If that doesn't satisfy you, then toilet paper is thrust into your arms (?). t don't even use makeup remover & how does that relate to "can you please keep your voices down we are trying to rest,"  or, "the coffee machine is broken can you please send maintenance?"    One day, we received no clean towels at all.About 50 or so, spider wrapped bugs, or something fuzzy, gross and grey, was in our wall AC unit, which continually blew dust and allergens into our room from the site under construction next door. Also not mentioned when booking.  One night they were using a crane at 10PM and all day on Sunday, while we were resting for our long trip back home, they were cutting with an electric saw. We all went home sick and I am still on antibiotics for whatever I caught there.The cleaning staff,  doesn't appear until 4pm daily and one of the gals spent all her time one day with an extremely LOUD, Walkie talkie, on the highest volume (and I mean loud, really, really loud) talking a mile a minute to her boyfriend it seemed, while she was IN our room.  Even though we continually asked her to leave, making "pushing motions" towards the door and clamping a pillow over my head, because I could not take it anymore, she would to leave. The front desk was finally called. They did send a guy up to talk (interpret) for us, they claimed but she quieted when she saw him coming down the hall. He said a few words, then soon he too, joined in on the talking & laughing right outside our door? WTH?This was supposed to be a wonderful weekend with my 86 year old mother and sister with Breast Cancer, for a once in a lifetime family reunion.  Literally.  Most went home sick with flus, headcolds & sinus infections.  No doubt,  since when we showed up dirty wet towels and trash were in my sisters adjoining room from the previous guests.  Not a single penny of compensation was offered to us for the poor service, when it was mentioned to the front desk staff, both as it happened and at checkout.This is not a luxury hotel  Don't be fooled by their title. They don't even have an elevator, so a warning to Aging Guests, beware: There are stairs everywhere, no elevators, so be prepared to lug heavy bags all around yourself.We stayed a week at Arroyo Pinion, using it as a home base while touring Sedona and the surrounding area.The rooms are up to date, very nice, clean and roomy with a fridge and microwave. The Wi-Fi works well and it is centrally located.What sets this hotel apart is the always friendly, very helpful staff. Everyone genuinely wants to help out and make your stay nicer.They have a clean laundry area that was helpful on our cross country trip.They also offer free hot/cold breakfast that has the usual offerings, all of which were good.Could not have asked for a more pleasant stay.Couldn't have asked for a better stay. Where to begin??? We found this hotel after calling many to get a group rate for a wedding we were having in Sedona. We were looking for a hotel that would be comfortable and affordable for our guests who were flying in and, oh boy, we couldn't have been happier with our selection. The front desk staff that we interacted with, Katie and Edna, were both so helpful and friendly. They were always eager to help and made the check in/out process so easy and nice. Some of our guests had some troubles with the reservation process at the beginning, but the manager, Rani, was super quick to respond and sort it out. They not only reserved some rooms for our guests till a certain date, but also discounted it a great deal for them as well. The rooms were updated, clean, spacious, and appealing. Our room, which was updated by the manager as a gift, had a jacuzzi, fireplace, and patio. They also placed roses, a beautiful card, bubblies, and chocolate as a gift in our room as well. We were tarted like royalty by the staff. The morning breakfast was better than most and free. Plus this place is super easy to get to. If you ever have a chance to see beautiful Sedona... STAY HERE!My first time to Sedona,AZ.  Such a breath taking hidden delight.  My hubby and I are Choice Hotel members, and found the beautiful hotel through Choice, and we are very please to have found the Arroyo Pinion Hotel.  We are from San Diego area, and plan on taking the trip back to Sedona, AZ this spring to see its beauty again, and we will definitely seek reservations here.Spent our honeymoon weekend here!  The staff was terrific, room was great with patio, fireplace, and jacuzzi.  Nice location on west side of town to head out to Verde Valley wineries and Red Rock Crossing.Stayed here 2 nights....I would stay here again.Nice, friendly,helpful and a  good location.Newish remodeled hotel. Not sure if this location was some other hotel in the past.Haven't stayed at any other Sedona hotels, but I rate this below average to hotels in other cities that I have stayed (low $100 range). There is morning breakfast: bread, muffin, pastry, waffle, etc... your basic variety.The room itself was ok, remodeled, but you can feel the layout is dated. The remodeled room had some sloppy workmanship, the tile grouts were sloppy and uneven (one notices these thing doing #2).The room has white curtains, the thicker curtains are fixed to the window ends (can't close). The white curtains could be transparent when the interior lights are on.The price of an overnight is high, doesn't match the return.BTW, their signage on the building facing the street has crooked letters, one of the "O" isn't installed correctly... Intentional or sloppy workmanship?My husband and I enjoyed our stay at the Arroyo Pinon Hotel. I read mixed reviews on another site, where I will also leave a review, and may have hesitated for a second to book. After comparing other rates, amenties and location, we knew that this was the hotel for us. We chose an updated room that had a small terrace and a very comfortable bed. I haven't slept that good on a hotel bed in a long time. We didn't use the jacuzzi tub, but the shower was decent as was breakfast. Love the waffle maker. We did use the hot tub and pool. So perfect after hiking. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful with hiking areas and do's and don'ts of Sedona. We will stay there again.I was very happy with this hotel. The rooms were extremely clean and updated. I do wish the jacuzzi was a bit more secluded. I was looking forward to a soak but changed my mind as the location was right near the highway. Additionally, the breakfast was meh. Other than that we were very happy with our two night stay.Very accommodating hotel. They give you a little gift basket included in the room and has very nice beds. Highly recommended.Clean hotel. It's a ways from town, so you have to driveif you want to wander around the shops and restaurants, but if you dont mind, then... The breakfast was average at best. I would stay again if I had kids with my, but if it was a hubby and me only trip I would opt for a hotel in town.I am sure there are worse hotels, but not in the area.  Yes, the prices are good, but the value is poor.  There are so many things wrong.   This hotel is not clean.  I would never stay here again and would steer anyone away from it.Here's the good, bad and ugly.  Bad and ugly (far more of that):1) Housekeeping is VERY poor.  When looked around our room after check-in, we saw a pubic hair right next to the sink drain.  The bathroom was gross.  We asked to be moved to another room.  In the new room, the bottom sheet was not tucked in.  The bathroom floor had a piece of black dirt right in front of the tub, but we could live better with that.  The dirt stayed in the same spot for 2 days, so it's obvious they did not clean the bathroom floor.  On the date before check-out the spot was clean.  The housekeeper also left a note/envelope soliciting a tip.  I guess that is why it was cleaned that day, when it was not the previous 2 days.  2) Security.  This hotel is not secure.  A)They do not have the normal latch you see on the inside of the door.  I am talking about the one that you can set from the inside and cannot access from the outside.  There is only the one lock. B) They put a sticker on your room key with the room number.  That might seem like a good idea, but, if the key is lost, this becomes an invitation for someone to break into your room.  The hotel should know this. 3) The lobby closes at 10 pm.  The lower price attracts a lower-end clientele.  We brought our laps down to the lobby to process some photos and there was a trailer-trash group of people hanging out there.  Very annoying.4) NO amenities other than pool and hot tub.  They were not open during our visit.  It was a bit cold for the pool, but the hot tub should have been fine.  There is no restaurant or shop in the lobby.5) The complimentary breakfast is horrible.  If you do decide to chance it on this place, make other plans for breakfast.  Words can't even describe how bad the "breakfast burrito" was.  It was like a microwave burrito with some really sloppy, indistinguishable mixture inside. The texture was unrecognizable.  The eggs seemed to be from a mix. They do have yogurt and instant oatmeal.  This breakfast was very disappointing.6) The decor is very dated.The good:1) Free wifi in the room2) The price for the area (price, not value).  It is probably $10-$15 less than other hotels in the immediate vicinity3) The linens and bedding seemed clean.We did look at changing hotels but, practically everything under $200/night was booked. Sedona was packed during our stay, due to travelers displaced by the Grand Canyon closing (budget shutdown).I would not wish this place on anyone.Paid about $134. Hotel looks good from the outside- up to date, attractive. Smooth adobe stuccoed exterior painted in a Sedona-esque color palate. I like the trees that surround the property, and there is a tiny little botanical garden in the adjoining lot- so extra star for that. It's nice and quiet as well. I can tell that they are trying to remodel the property and improve the rooms, but I was disappointed.Room set up is weird- immediately to your right in the entry is the sink and vanity. Then there is a bathroom to your left with a tile shower. As you enter into the main sleeping area- there is a large Jacuzzi bathtub next to the bed.  I walk over to the desk and pull out the chair- food crumbs on it. I look at the brown carpet and notice some dingy stains. I look at the dated chair in the corner and the ottoman is missing a wheel and sitting there lopsided. Definitely not at the Ritz here. Lol!I have a bug paranoia and always check my mattress. The first thing I notice is the dark brown bed spread.. who knows what's hiding on that spread. I feel it should be standard that hotels provide all white bedding so that you know what you are sleeping on... but I digress.  The next thing I notice is that instead of king size pillows on the king size bed, there are about 5 small pillows arranged diagonally.  I also notice that the hotel webpage says that the rooms have down pillows, but the pillows are not down. I pull the brown bed spread back to find wrinkled and slightly worn in looking sheets. There isn't a fitted sheet on the bed, but instead, a regular flat sheet that's not tucked in, just thrown haphazardly over the mattress. I lift the edge to check for bugs and see that there isn't any type of mattress cover, just an old fuzzy blanket type thing that covers the center of the mattress only and a chewed on sunflower seed kernel.Good news is, I did not see bugs, but I'm not feeling too good about anything else at this point. Then I discover that the red black out curtains are for looks and do not in fact pull shut over the sheer white curtain. I decide I need to say something. I can't be in a 1st floor room without privacy while I sleep and change and take a bath, etc.So, I go to the front desk and I ask if they have a room with black out curtains. That's when I was informed that I was "doing it wrong". Turns out there is another black out curtain behind the sheer curtain- apparently I'm not the only one that didn't discover this on my own. Anyhow, I take this opportunity to mention the crumbs and the sunflower kernels in the room. The man apologizes, and I express that I am just concerned that my sheets are not clean. He offers another room, but I tell him it 's okay.So, I go back to my room and decide to take a bath. That's when I notice that the bath tub is dirty. I decide at that point that I need another room. I go back to the front desk and tell the guy I need a new room. He says to go back to my room and he will call me in 10 minutes. I go back, but he never calls. In the meantime I start examining the room. I discover that the shower doors have not been cleaned. There is a bug dead in the shower door tracks. The entertainment center has not been wiped down and there are coffee rings and sugar and cream dust all over the top. There are icky dirt spatters on the floor boards, even the electrical sockets have spots of crud and worse yet, I find a curly black pube and an eyelash where I would normally rest my head and a stain on one of the pillows.So, I head back to the office...Long story short. He says he will give me a new room. I go to new room. Key doesn't work. I'm told I'm "doing it wrong"- which I wasn't doing it wrong. This continues 3 trips with me alone, 2 trips with the desk guy and 1 trip with the owner. The internet goes out and the cable TV.  Almost an hour and half passes before I am put in a room. Then it turns out they are unable to key the keys at all, so I now can not leave my room or I will be locked out. The owner gets involved and is very kind, apologizing over and over and then tells me to call the 800 number and find out why the internet doesn't work... I look at him like he's crazy and he insists I keep $20 cash and apologizes. He shows off the room upgrades and turns on a light that illuminates the head board. I can't figure out how to turn light off the entire night and no one is at the front desk to help me. I have to sleep with the lights on all night until 5AM when a front desk person comes to my room and finds the switch to turn the light off. I didn't even try the continental breakfast.. too scared of what it might be. All in all, everyone was really nice, but I did not get what I paid for. I have stayed at Motel 6s that were cleaner with better amenities- and I'm not saying that to be cruel. I suggest spending less money on jacuzzi tubs and back-lit head boards and have a cleaning service take care of the bedding. Priorities!We were sent here to stay as their sister property was booked out for part of our stay... we were so pleasantly surprised with this property also, being a very nicely maintained hotel right across the "Thunder mountain" We enjoyed the view from the poolside and hung out all day in their wonderful pool. Loved the breakfast, which we ate at the patio, hearing the early morning bird chirps. Great friendly and helpful staff! The rooms had indirect lights over the head board... so romantic!! Very neat and modern look to furniture and decor. They had charging stations for modern gadgets anywhere you sat in the room making it easy for us to work on bed or the desk at night!One more hotel on my favorite place to stay in this cute town!!Nice upgrades!  Peaceful environment. Front desk staff were helpful, price was good for the night we stayed. In_room Jacuzzi was delightful, also included fridge and microwave with room. highly recommend.Great hotel. Nice rooms and free continental breakfast. The room is kind of old - the bathroom is tiny and the sink is by the door. The front door is hard to latch and there aren't a lot of blankets, but the room is really nice otherwise and the staff is super nice. I think overall it is a good value for the price.For the rate we paid in Sedona this place was a gem. We lucked into a $120 rate on a Saturday night on a holiday weekend.Comfortable beds, simple lay out, great service. Brand new carpet and bathrooms. The rooms are very nice and modern. Great work on the remodel! And the tubs have the nice tile work. The breakfast (no longer provided by most hotels) was a Continental+ which was a surprise. Nowadays, Continental means all-cold pastries or toast and coffee. This Continental had egg and cheese biscuits and waffles. Not that this is the most amazing breakfast feature EVER, but when you're expecting 'Continental' it was a pleasant surprise.My wife and I stayed at this hotel for 2 nights. The Vice President was on campus, the staff was very helpful, friendly, and responsive to  our needs. The VP congratulated us personally on our new marriage, and wished us the best- even called our room personally to clarify that everything was fine. If you don't stay here, you're not experiencing the ultimate in customer service, convenience in location, and a great overall experience. The rooms are beautiful, the pool and spa are wonderful,  and the property itself is just beautiful!The room was recently renovated, very comfortable. For the price, would stay again. The staff was great and gave great recommendations for dinner, hikes and horseback riding. The continental breakfast was nothing great but did the trick.First thing first, they call themselves a "Hotel", this is a "Motel" at best.  I expected so much more for the price I was paying. The pool is small and does not look like it gets daily attention. There are few anemities.  They are in the process of renovating which is commendable, but call it what it is, a "Motel".  It is obvious this structure has been here many years, worn and damaged stairways. Cracks between the walkways and building. The door to the room appears to have been damaged and repaired several times, the hardware was loose. Second day, ran out toilet paper and there was no spare (?). The continental breakfast was okay, very clean. Would like to see more fresh fruit, there was only one, very ripe banana. One more positive, the beds were comfortable.  I was very disappointed with this place. I fault no one but myself. This place was the only one available for the dates I needed on all the Hotel searches.  Apparently there was a reason for that. I should have lowered my search to Motels, I'm sure I would have found something better for the price.

review_content: I can see why the Desert Quail is so highly ranked on Trip Advisor!  Everything about this little place was awesome.  The man who worked the front desk the entire time during our stay was extremely friendly and very helpful.The rooms are a little older but we had no problems with that.  The room was very clean and we had zero problems with anything in our room.  Our room had wonderful shower pressure and consistent hot water.  I have zero negative things to say about my stay here.  I would recommend this motel to anyone visiting Sedona for any length of time.This location might not be for everyone since it's a little down the road from the main drag in Sedona.  Since most people have a rental car while visiting Sedona I don't see that as a negative.  If you're looking for a hotel to be able to walk to and from while visiting the main drag this motel wouldn't work for you.We found this hotel on TripAdvisor; we were a little surprised when we drove in to see it looked like a budget motel. But the rooms are nice inside, having been remodeled fairly recently. Definitely stay on the second floor if you are a light sleeper because you can hear everything on the first floor(which is pretty typical).The king bed was a little firm for my taste but it was spacious. The pillows were a little small. There was a fridge and a microwave, an ironing board and an iron. The toilet was really loud--don't flush in the middle of the night! The water pressure in the shower was good, which was not the case in a lot of the restrooms around town.The staff was very accommodating, efficient, and friendly. This is a very well run hotel!If you've never been to Sedona, be aware that this hotel is actually in Oak Creek, a tiny community 5 miles outside Sedona, so it takes a few minutes to get into town. FYI I would definitely recommend this hotel!Very clean and very stylish for the price. Gabby was most helpful with anything needed...great customer service. Highly recommended...I'll be staying here again!Nice rooms and cheap. The bathroom door hit the toilet when you try to open or close it which was odd and the toilet was very loud. The woman at the front desk when we checked in wasn't very friendly. Wasn't patient with us and was more interested in getting us out the door than helping us, even though we were the only ones there.Overall not a bad place to stay. Coffee pot with coffee, tea and hot chocolate was in the room and the bed was nice and big. Pillows were a bit small for the size of the bed. Definitely recommend brining your own pillow.My wife and I stayed here over the July 4th 2015 holiday weekend and were very pleased. The prices were reasonable even during the holiday. Our "king room" (205) was large, clean, and have everything we needed. Upon check-in they even gave us a coupon to use for a discount on our Pink Jeep Tours! Also, it is located in a convenient location with plenty of shops, places to eat, and nice scenic views. The only downfall, in my opinion, is there is no free wifi or decent television channels to watch. I mean there was essentially only infomercials to watch all day and night.UPDATE !!STILL 1 STAR THOUGH My hubby n i stayed with a friend instead of this  awful hotel room,so we went back in morning to get previous managers info along with the REAL owners contact info just for us to actually meet the owner! Pretty interesting since we were told he was India in less than 12 hours prior from that awful lying manager. Come to find out The "manager " LIED to her owner to cover her ass by leaving a note about us trying to get a FREE upgrade after being in our room for over 30 minutes !! We were absolutely appalled by this experience! I had asked him to even look on any cameras to prove i had my credit card to pay her and he then claimed there's no cameras in lobby or property !! So its also an unsafe property! Anything could happen to their guests and nothing would be seen !! This owner "nick bhakta" wouldn't give out his name nor his employees name for us to report him n her . He gave his name as other guests were coming into the lobby. Its very unfortunate there are owners like this that actually were allowed to open up a business. The negativity will spread worst than wildfires. The owner showed us he had pink eye and thats why he was gone at the dr. Yesterday.... well now we know desert quail inn is nothing but false hopes. BE AWARE ! EVERY OTHER HOTEL AND INN IN SEDONA IS BETTER THAN THIS PLACE !!First, I really appreciate the owners/managers working with us.  Less than 48 hours ahead of our reservation, our plans changed, and we wanted to have our 1 night stay a night earlier.  They were willing to make the change, but they did not have any more rooms with 2 Queen beds.  We had to take two rooms with King beds.  With two older kids, that turned out to be a better arrangement.As far as the rooms, the layout was roomy, and a each room had a gas fireplace.  The linens were fresh, soft and comfortable.  The towels were soft and absorbent.  However, on the negative side, the beds were very firm, which none of us are use to, so we did not sleep well.  Also, the cable/dish TV was horrible.  After Sedona rolls up its sidewalks at 5pm, there wasn't much else to do except attempt to watch television.  Regardless of the channel, the image constantly froze, or temporarily changed channels.It was a nice enough hotel. It's a little far from downtown Sedona- about 10-15 min drive, but close to Bell Rock and some other  nice hiking points. The room was clean and modern. Reasonably priced, friendly guy working the counter. The only things I could say that weren't good were: the halogen lighting, the super loud flushing toilet haha, and the lumpy pillows. That shouldn't stop you from staying, it was nice.Room was spacious and clean, bed comfortable. There is a fridge and microwave. Behind the motel is a grocery store which was convenient. We were in room 205 and it was very quiet. The cons... The toilet made a loud noise when flushed (I would not want to have had the room below us). If you are scent sensitive you might have a hard time when you first open the room. When the heater first came on I  thought a train was going by but I got used to it.It was snowing when we were here so I didn't try the pool. Wifi good. No breakfast. Outside of Sedona and close to hiking trails. There was a loveseat in the room so if you're watching tv you don't have just the bed to sit on. Everybody seemed friendly. Great place to stay if you're looking for a less expensive place.Very clean, comfortable bed, great service you can tell the manager takes pride in keeping the property clean. Also rooms were recently updated.Arrived in Sedona for our first time and during check in were hoping the receptionist would've been a little more knowledgeable of the area and give us a few pointers, but she wasn't interested.  We had a room upstairs and they do not have elevators.  The room was clean and had a nice couch and table to sit at.  Positives: fridge, sink separate from the bathroom, quiet hotel, clean rooms.  The hotel has 1 ice machine and it is located by the pool.  The free wifi worked well too.I was really looking for a nice place to stay in Sedona, and wasn't looking for golf or the spa.  This place was perfect for a quick 1 night stay and there were only two minor things I didn't like.  1- It is a little ride to downtown Sedona, about 6 miles North on the Scenic Byway (Hwy 179)2-The rooms were all renovated except for the shower (old 80s prefab fiberglass).  Why they would do such a good job with everything else but leave the bathtub/shower untouched was beyond me.  Other than those two small complaints the room was excellent; comfortable and clean.Pros: There was a ceiling fan with a remote in our room! This was great, when was the last time you have seen a ceiling fan in a motel/hotel room? I could not think of any!There was DIRECTV with the individual tuner with HD.  Sweet.  Not that we used it much but still.  And lastly, there was a very nice gas log fireplace with a remote, this would cone in handy in the fall/winter.  Too warm to use on our May trip, but a nice addition.I would consider staying here again if I was back in Sedona, it was a great value! Oh and I had a great bagel for breakfast in Sedona at the NY Bagels & Deli, nice place to grab a quick bite since the Motel does not have breakfast.Excellent place to stay. Very clean room and manager was very pleasant!I would definitely recommend this place!!!Nice clean place to stay.  Worth the $89 we paid for sure. Quick and easy check in. Lots of free movies on HBO. Small pool but unfortunately no hot tub. Nice comfortable beds. Fridge, microwave and coffee maker is useful. I enjoyed the hot chocolate with the usual coffee and tea.We opted for the king suite. Huge room and hot tub plus a fire place even though we didn't use it. There is some painting that needs to be done but it's 20 dollars more than the regular room?? So if you want a big comfy bed, reclining chairs and a hot tub, stay here it's so affordable and close enough to everything. Plus there's a cafe and grocery store 1 minute away, on foot.It was definitely worth the value. Located near shopping, hiking trails and eateries. The room was clean and spacious. The staff was helpful and made suggestions on places to dine. Definitely recommend.My husband and I stayed here for one night. It has everything you expect and then some. The inn is roughly 15 min from downtown sedona but the hotel tax and city tax is cheaper then staying in Sedona proper. We would stay here again if we came back through town.My boyfriend and I wanted to take a trip to Sedona and stay for a night (we live a few hours away in Phoenix). He said he stayed here before and knows how picky I can be with hotels (ha) so he recommended this hotel for me! The room is beautiful! Huge bed, giant tv, and oh did I mention the extravagant hot tub in the room?!?! Absolutely loved this little gem and will stay here anytime we come up! Also, there is a great breakfast place next door and an awesome restaurant across the street.  We will be back soon!What a pleasant surprise the DQI was. We were expecting a budget motel when we drove up - in fact, I was wondering what other reviewers were smoking when they wrote such glowing reviews. But, WOW!! The property is your typical motor inn, but all of the rooms have been refinished quite nicely. Nice carpets, excellent decor and crown mouldings throughout. The king size bed was SOOOO comfortable! A real oasis, after a day in the summer heat. The management are excellent, calling us not long after check in to ensure that there wasn't anything else that they could help us with or if we had any questions. I was also grateful that they heeded our request for a room overlooking the Red Rocks. Beautiful!The main tip I would give travellers is that the DQI is in Oak Creek, which was about 10-12km from the main Sedona strip. We drove into Sedona, which was no big deal - indeed, we preferred to make the drive, as it is along the gorgeous Red Rocks Scenic Byway (SR 179) - what scenery! I rather preferred it this way!The only request I would have for a future stay is if they could invest in some large pillows more appropriate for a king size bed. There were like six little Chicklets - though definitely not a showstopper for me or most travellers.Stayed for 2 nights and it was fine, but after reading such rave reviews I really did expect more.  I would call it an OK value for the price, but we could have stayed at the Days Inn down the road for almost half the cost & I'm sure it would have been just fine as well.  No breakfast, which of course we knew beforehand, and the computer connection (not even talking wifi) was horrendous.  I couldn't even check my email.  The room was in OK condition, but frankly, could have used a little work.  Wasn't thrilled to pull up at 11pm to find our room keys taped to the office door with a note.  I was told that if we were going to arrive before 10, I should call (which I did) and someone would be there (which they were not).  It was "fine," but I doubt I'd stay again.
review_content_20: This was the best budget motel experience I've ever had, and my rating is based on the type of place it is. For under $100/night I got a king bed, sofa, large room, gas fireplace, fridge, microwave, flat screen and wifi. I had been staying at a place up the street that had a more of a view, but was $40 a night more. Who stays in their room in Sedona to see the sights anyhow?  The room had been recently renovated and was very clean. The location was great, in Oak Creek out of the thick of the tourist area, next to a cafe, supermarket, and plenty of other things within walking distance including an outlet mall. The owners were friendly and you could see people around the properly working. There is a pool, although it wasn't open for the season yet. I would definitely stay here again if I returned to Sedona.Very clean, quiet, perfect location. Would definitely go back. Great location to hike Bell Rock, Devil's Bridge, & more.I searched for an affordable yet nice place to stay in Sedona and came across Desert Quail Inn on Yelp. My boyfriend and I stayed here on 11/8 for my birthday and were very happy with our choice! The room was GREAT! Very clean, modern, and quiet! The jacuzzi tub and the fireplace in the room were so relaxing. The staff was very friendly.The Red Rock Cafe is right behind the Inn, takes just a second to walk there, and is the highest rated cafe in Oak Creek! Delicious breakfast! I would definitely stay here again and recommend it to my friends!Everything you could want in a budget motel; and then some.  I don't know about you but when I am on vacation it is all about the sights; NOT the room I am staying in.  As long as the room is clean, has my basic needs covered and I feel safe I am happy. C'mon; when you are in beautiful Sedona who wants to waste time hanging out in your room anyway?We booked our room online based soley on the reviews and were not disappointed.  Our room was extremely clean and had a king sized bed with a very comfy, yet firm mattress. We also had a sofa, gas fireplace, ceiling fan, wi-fi, flat screen tv, microwave, fridge, hair dryer, iron and a HUGE wooden wardrobe closet that I thought was a nice touch.  All that and a friendly, informative front desk staff for a mere $100 a night. Count me satisfied.The place is just outside downtown Sedona so you don't have the traffic issues to deal with.  There are several restaurants, a local pub, an outlet mall, and a grocery store all within walking distance.  You are a mere 5 minute drive away from Bell & Courthouse Rock as well as multiple other trails. I would absolutely go back next time I am in town.Went there for my husbands B-day weekend. Prices were reasonable and they rooms were very nice. We upgraded to the fireplace room for only $10more and it was remodeled and clean. Would definitely stay there again. Close to uptown Sedona but you need to drive. Beautiful Red Rock views with the second floor rooms. Also Desert Quail is in walking distance to IGA store and coffee shop.So glad it had a little re-do on that awful decor rom before.It is a decent place, good location, nice view, overall ok.If you need anything extra and have to call to ask, you have my warning, they don't seem to like it.Comfortable.  Clean.  Friendly and helpful host.   Reasonable cost.  Outdoor pool.  And you can walk to Red Rock Cafe which has awesome breakfasts.We stayed here one night. The place was nice for the money and very clean. I would stay here again. The room came with a microwave and a mini fridge.Nice friendly staff. Decent looking hotel. Relatively clean, dirty floors, but that's to be expected with these types of resorts.The reason for the 3 star review is that the beds we slept on were hard as cement. In fact, I honestly think the floor would have been more comfortable. We managed to finally get to sleep but being in our 30's we woke up quite sore. The views do make up for the beds, pretty much...Great experience! Particularly for the price; nice surprise how cute the room was, even with crown moulding. Loved that it wasn't in the middle of Sedona! Much better being down the road some. Plus the drive from Oak Creek to Sedona is the best in the entire area so totally worth it. Finally, an awesome Cafe for breakfast is behind the Inn as well as a great grocery store. All worked out great. Very pleased.I needed a flop house for a layover in Sedona, and the Desert Quail Inn more than hit the mark. The motel's recently been renovated, and the rooms are quite attractively furnished, comfortable, and clean. The staff are also extremely friendly (which is always a plus, but became an even bigger one after staying later on the trip in another Sedona-area hotel).My super-cheap $79 king room offered a refrigerator, a microwave, a totally awesome shower head, and a comfortable (if slightly hard for my pillowtop-owning self) memory-foam-topped mattress. Bonus points for a quiet A/C with an even quieter sleep mode and actual temperature settings measured in degrees.I'd gladly stay in the Desert Quail Inn again without a second thought. It's easy to find in Oak Creek, and I don't have a bad thing to say about it.Great decor, memory foam on the king size bed, DirecTV, great shower, easy to find, nice views of the red rocks and a very nice staff. Plus it's  $70 a night? What more can you ask from a budget hotel? The front desk guy was super cool too. If you are looking for a cheaper alternative to super expensive hotel rooms in the heart of Sedona, then this is it. One caveat, it is in a suburb of Sedona which means that you do have to drive ~15 min to get to downtown Sedona. (I know who knew that Sedona had a suburb right? Love you Sedona!)My husband and I stayed here for the night and spent the extra money to get the jaccuzi room. Not only did our room have a jaccuzi but also had a big LCD tv with direct tv, a beautiful gas fireplace, refrigerator, microwave, coffee pot, cozy four post bed, couch, 2 recliners .. just amazing! Very clean room. I think this might be a family owned hotel. The staff is very friendly and told us about a few places to eat that they recommend. They made sure to let us know if we had any questions they were there to help. Free WiFi just ask for the password at check in. There is a grocery store and cafe just a few steps away. They have a pool that's a bit small but serves the purpose for cooling off. When you get a hotel room in Sedona it's never really cheap but this place was very reasonable especially being right in the heart of Sedona and all it tourist attractions. Definitely recommend and will visit again!This place was just fine for our 2-night stay in Sedona.  The room was clean and large.  It had a small fridge which came in handy to cool our water before going on our hikes.  (It was 80+ degrees.)  No complaints except that the bed was hard and you had to slam the door to lock it.  Pool on-site so bring bathing attire.  Outlet stores located across the street.  Cafe next door at Red Rock Coffee.  Plenty of restaurants within walking distance.Great little place to stay! Clean, roomy, big beds, refrigerator & microwave...Nick, at the front desk was kind and very helpful. We weren't here long, but would stay again if we're ever in the area.This is the hotel that I stayed in when first to Sedona.  I thought I had booked into a Quality inn, but discovered this was a Quail inn.  Oh well!The rooms were clean, the pool was small, but enjoyable, the views were terrific, the price was cheap, and I had a little fridge.Other than that, it was all about hiking on the red rock.  If I were on a tight budget, I'd stay here again.  Otherwise, I might spend a tad more and sleep at the Kings Ransom.Nice, clean, simple hotel....  and for the price it is AMAZING. Good size rooms that look recently renovated. Staff was friendly. Location of the hotel is just outside of Sedona. View of Red Rocks is awesome. My wife and I walked around the area and found it very nice and safe. Would definitely go back to this hotel.Why 5 stars. Very, very nice room, very, very low price.  Clean, big room, everything you could want without high price. Best deal I've ever gotten on a room.Nice views, decent prices, very pleasant staff - don't expect the same atmosphere as the Hilton but I would stay here again.This place was great for the price, we payed about 60 bucks for a night without reservation, the rooms where decent sized, beds where comfortable, customer service was superb, "Red" I believe was the guy working there he was really nice, all in all it was great.  The pool was closed but we didn't mind because it was really cold, we only needed to stay there for the night because our campsite was freezing.

review_content: We had a wonderful stay in the Matterhorn Inn. Great location for visiting the area and the Grand Canyon and it's right in the heart of Uptown Sedona, so shops and restaurants are a short walk away. We stayed in Room 39, on the second floor (first floor for Europeans) and paid an average of $180/night plus tax. The room was large, bright and clean. Great shower and lots of room for toiletries in the bathroom area. And the view - wow! We kept the curtains open all night so we could wake up to views of the red rocks from bed. We would return in a heartbeat to Sedona and the Matterhorn Inn.Clean and simple. I really like the layout and how the bed faces the balcony overlooking downtown Sedona. Blow dryer, coffee maker, closet with full length mirror, decent size tv. Little pricey but I think it was a busy season. Front desk gave us a coupon to a few restaurants in the area to compensate for not having a continental breakfast.This place was not what i expected. On the website they make it sound very nice and pet friendly. It was not very pet friendly at all!!! They have all these charges for pets and got kind of snippy when we told them we had animals. Also the lady at the front desk was not very nice at all or helpful when asking directions or recommendations.Also they said they had a dog park in walking distance,it was not in walking distance at all! We had to drive to it. The beds were very small,on the site it said king, they were not they were double it seemed like!!Overall this place was very disappointing,especially on our last day of vacation!! They were rude and messed up on charging on our credit cards. They were the same price as a residence inn or fairfield. I wouldve rather gone back to flagstaff and gone there!Basically if youre looking for an overpriced room that is not that nice then here is your type of place. However it did have a good view of the mountains and it was in the middle of all the shops. Go here if youre going to be out of your room and there is no other place that has rooms.What a great property. I travel throughout the United States and stay always at branded hotel chains this is a little gem in the hills. I've been to Sedona many times and was lucky enough to find this place. I would recommend this place to anyone. The rooms have gorgeous views of the rocks.We had a very pleasant experience at the Matterhorn Inn January 30 - February 1, 2015! We were in town for the Sedona Marathon event. From the time I made my reservations last spring to check-out on Sunday, the service was wonderful! I called the staff occasionally before arrival to check on the temperature and suggestions for the marathon. Once we checked in, we went to the room. We stayed in Room 41, which we will request in the future. The heater was on and the room was toasty warm, which was a very nice treat since we had been driving for several hours in the rain. The view from the balcony in both directions was absolutely stunning. Sedona has got to be the most beautiful place God created on the planet. The staff was very nice and helpful. While in town, we enjoyed the coffee, protein shakes and pastries at Theia's Coffee House which was recommended by the Matterhorn Staff and is right across the parking lot from the hotel. Kari is amazing! We also enjoyed Mexican food and margaritas at Javelina Cantina. We are planning a hiking trip in the future and will stay at the Matterhorn Inn, have coffee at Theia's, and dinner at Javelina Cantina. We will also try the Hike House to plan some hikes for us. Thank you Matterhorn Inn!! You have customers for life!! Blessings!!This place is nothing special, just an ordinary motel. However, it was clean and comfortable and conveniently located near restaurants and shops. With the AAA rate, it is very reasonably priced. Ask for a room on the second floor to enjoy the views from the patio!This place did the job. Great view right out on to the Red Rocks and tourists shopping along 89A. Host at counter was kind. Room was clean, sufficient, and had a nice TV.Very handy to tourist area. Got a nice rest here.We came in from the Grand Canyon on our way home to Tempe and only planned to stay the afternoon. Once we got close the views kicked in and we then wanted to stay the evening. I checked hotels.com, hotwire, hotel tonight and none had a room within 10 miles of city center. Sucks. We also had a pup with us so that made things rough also.We get into town, park, and start our trek through uptown and stumbled upon this little Inn with awesome views and prime location. Went in to ask if they have any rooms, had one, pet friendly $170. Boom. Done. Room 22, first floor for the pup and a great balcony with stunning views. At check in we were told all the places of interest and was also given a great map to get us around town.Our overall experience was excellent and it was a great time in Sedona. Our next trip we WILL be staying at this Inn again. Thank you.LOCATION is the key and this is what Matterhorn Inn has the edge over the other places. In the heart of uptown Sedona where all the overpriced gift shops and restaurants are. You get to have a nice vista of the mountain from your room balcony. The decor in the room is simple and a bit outdated. The plastic potted plants are a complete waste of space and has to go!Bed is comfy with a mattress topper. Flat screen tv with cable, complimentary wi-fi for all the guests. Ample parking space available and free of charge.Housekeeping did a good job of keeping the room clean and at the same time changing our towels throughout our stay.The place is convenient and has easy access to food and shops.Our room was really stinky, we had to drive a few miles to purchase a scented disinfectant. For $150/night, it sure was a very unpleasant stay.Great location, fantastic views of mountains. One of the lower priced motels in Sedona.Large room with balcony.Very small bathroom; toilet & bathtub very tight and close together; outdated fixturesVery thin interior walls - 2 neighboring TVs (next room and directly beneath) could be heard at once. Keeping the air conditioner on 'fan' throughout the night produced a loud but constant white noise effect that effectively drowned out outside sound.Exterior walls good - no traffic noise from busy street could be heard, but muffler-less motorcycle in the parking lot was enough to wake the deadWi-fi is provided but spotty; kept going in and out. Could be because of location of room - top floor on end; might be better in other rooms.Our room was spacious and clean, with an amazing view. The bathroom was tiny, but manageable. No complaints about the room comfort or decor. It could be a little bit noisy, but we were there in January, and since everything in town closes down by 9 PM, it's quite quiet after that. Our biggest complaint was the hot tub. For outdoor temperatures in January, the hot tub isn't nearly warm enough. When we got in, it felt lukewarm, and we were freezing when we got out. Not a pleasant experience at all. When we mentioned it to the young guy at the desk the next day, he told us something about rules that require them to keep it no hotter than a certain temperature. He offered to check it for us, but who knows if he ever did. (The hot tub seemed to be the same lukewarm temperature the next night.) The girl at the desk was very friendly and helpful. When we told her about it the day we checked out, she at least seemed genuinely concerned, wrote down our comments, and said she would speak to the management about it. We told her we thought it wasn't even worth having a hot tub if it couldn't be warmer. And if they are following some rule, they seem to be the only ones in the area following it!We appreciated daily maid service. But one day we stepped out for a half an hour to grab a coffee, and when we returned to the room at 10 AM, there was a note on our door telling us that made service was done for the day. Really? 10 AM? That seems awfully early. It wasn't a huge deal to us, but at the end of our stay we decided not to leave the maid our usual tip.In general, it's a pleasant place, with a great location, especially for the price, if you don't care about having a hot tub.There was a small gaggle/family/herd of about 100 gnats in one of my washcloths. They happened to migrate into my sink. There was a small fly in one of my bath towels. I'm sorry, I expect clean towels... At least ones that don't have insects in them. The staff was pretty receptive after I showed them my pictures. Offered me $10 off. I declined. The view was nice........ It's in a good location. Parking and wi-fi are free... and hey.. you can always use another towel, yes?I would say for what this is, it is great!The room:The rooms are always clean, and well done. Meaning they are always clean, and made when we get there as well as vacuumed. I will say there are few rooms, and they are all accessible from the street, making them not as secure. The things that are missing, are a room safe, and a microwave.The ambiance:It is more like a motel type thing, but the view is excellent! You see one of he mountains out of your balcony sliding glass door.The Front Desk staff:Are always friendly, and helpful!Security:I would say poor, but crime has been low in this part of town, and the Matterhorn consistently gets good reviews. The Amenities:I would say non existent, with the exception that they do in fact have free wi-fi in the rooms, and it is amazingly fast.The Price: I would say right on. Even cheap for this end of Sedona. Everything is within walking distance.This update has absolutely everything to do with management, and nothing at all with the quality of rooms. I'm so upset we just had the experience that we did, because I was certain this would be the place we went back to time and time again.Last time we visited, we stayed for 5 days and had a terrific experience (per above). This last Friday we decided to make a last minute trip up just for Saturday night, and called to make reservations. They offered us the same room we had previously since we enjoyed it so much. Great!Halfway up from our drive from Phoenix, we get a call from the front office saying they've had another guest requesting the same room, but they want to stay three nights. Their three nights trumps our one night even though we booked first. Fine. Disappointing and not very professional, but fine. Not the end of the world. We accept a different room. If our problems had stopped there, our experience would have been perfectly fine. We arrived very early, around 9:30am. We didn't expect to be able to check in that early, so instead we just filled out the paperwork and tried to pay. Per the Matterhorn's preference, they had not finished billing for the previous night and did not want our payment to be on the wrong day's report. They asked us to pay later. Again, no problem, we had a credit card on file with them which they could always charge at any time.We left and went about our day. After they called to say the room was ready, we went back to get settled before our dinner reservations that night. A loud noise was coming from the room next door, but since neither of us were sleeping we decided to ignore it. Just after 6pm, they called the room and asked us to come down and pay now. Rushing to make our reservations in Oak Creek at 6:30, we forgot to stop at the office in our haste. At 11pm, we had been trying to sleep for an hour when the loud noise next door still hasn't stopped. I called the overnight service desk to report it, and was told "yeah, okay we'll look into it" by a man who sounded like he couldn't care less. The phone rang soon after we hung up but this time it was the female manager. As I tried to explain the situation to her, she rudely cut me off to say "By the way, you're room isn't paid for. You never paid for it."Excuse me? In every hotel I've ever stayed in, including hers, I have never been officially billed until checkout. We tried to pay early and they told us no. We take responsibility for forgetting earlier in the evening, but with a credit card on file and a record of on-time payment from past visits, is 11 o'clock at night when I am calling to report a disturbance really the best time to harp at me? I offered to come down to pay right then, but was told the office was closed. To make things even better, when we tried to pay (again) at checkout, we were told by the same woman that our card was charged last night. Whoa whoa whoa. It was charged last night? So either she took my head off for nothing when it was already paid for, or she opened the office in the middle of the night to charge it after we called. Either way, ridiculous. Apparently charging ahead of time is their policy for one-night-only stays. Thanks a lot for telling us. I'll miss the view and the location, but they have made it clear we are not worth their time unless we shell out for a week's worth of accommodations.Clean reasonably priced room in a great location. Would stay there again. You can walk to most everything in Sedona from here.Convenience, comfort, and classic. Beautiful views, fresh air, and a tiny taste of small luxury.The Matterhorn Inn has never ceased to please my fiance and I when we visit Sedona. Most of the time when we stay, it is on a whim, and we select this place because of it's lower prices, awesome patio view, and its matter of convenience to the downtown area.If you are looking for class, than perhaps this is not the place for you. Although the rooms are nice, they are basic, yet CLEAN. Oddly enough, the bedding is very comfortable (I have difficult times sleeping in hotel beds) and provides a nice night's sleep to those in need. Your room will have a small mini-fridge, coffee maker, blow dryer, etc. (all you basic stuff). The bathroom is slightly smaller than I would expect, but does have a window for outside in it at the top, which is useful for a steamy shower or steamy...well, you know what.I have stayed in both the regular room and pet room. Surprisingly, the pet room does not have a funky oder to it as I imagined it would. All pet rooms are located on the bottom floor.The view from your patio is the best thing about this place. The patio is huge and gives amazing views to the red rocks and downtown area. I can sit out there for hours and WISH that this is what I could do everyday. They also have a pool and spa available. Keep in mind, the spa does not get super hot, which was a slight downfall, but at least it was relaxing late at night after walking all day.Management is always very nice here. They want to make your stay as good as it gets.Location, location, location... This location is great! The room was clean, the view was beautiful, the lady that checked us in was very friendly and helpful. The only 4 drawbacks, was no microwave, no breakfast, the coffee pot was down low on shelf very inconvenient had to move it up on counter to use and the pot was plugged in under counter and it had a short cord, and lastly, the room had a odor of some kind and it never went away... We sprayed a nice room spray and it still overpowered the room spray, so don't know what the odor was. I would stay here again. Ask for upstairs rooms, better views, but if you have trouble with stairs there is no elevator. We enjoyed the hot tub it could use a little work. The last day as we were getting ready to leave, it was on Monday MLK day and the crew was using a jack hammer on the parking lot behind the Inn pretty early... Very noisy!Location location location! This place is in the heart of Uptown Sedona and there are tons of shopping and restaurants within walking distances. The drive to Cathedral rock was only ten minutes and the views from the room balcony were amazing..especially at sunset. The room is clean and well maintained. The people at the front desk, especially Melanie, were so incredibly nice. The office is only open from 8 am - 10 pm, but this was not a big deal to us at all. Highly recommended for the price which is about $135 per night not including taxes and you can't beat the location.Fantastic location with incredible view from private balcony (in every room). Great friendly and helpful staff. In the middle of downtown Sedona. Couldn't ask for a better location. Room was very clean, nicely sized with convenient mini-fridge (for storage of locally brewed beer).
review_content_20: The hotel was located right downtown, views were great and the room was clean but the "Inn" is really much like an old motel.  What made me give them a "one star" when I probably would have given a three is the service.  Both my friend and I left our iphone chargers in the room and called right away, we had plugged them in behind the TV so it could have been overlooked by the maid.  They were going to check for us, they didn't , we had to call back and then someone was in the room.  The clerk assured me the guests were checking out in the am and she would call me.  No call in the am, so I call and she says "I TOLD YOU WE DID NOT FIND IT YESTERDAY" in a rather bothered, irritated manner.  When I explained that someone had to look behind the TV she said (still irritated like she was talking to a child) well the guests did not check out so I'll call you tomorrow.  Losing an iphone charger is not the worst thing that can happen but it's about $45 to replace.  I live not far from the "Inn" and could have gone back for them.  For $190/night - off season, I would have at least expected someone could have walked the 20ft to our room (right outside the office) and made an effort to find our property or been nicer about it.  Can't they left a note for the guests to look behind the TV, or ask the maid when she cleaned to room to look?  How hard is that to do for a paying customer?   I would not go back....Good Location.  Great Views.  Small, Older rooms.  No extras.  Dbl beds.  2 levels: if @ lower level, you hear stomping around from above.  Old a/c units which are quite deafing, esp. when running all nite.  For $140 I was pissed! That gets you in Scottsdale = 5 star resort.  This was = Motel 6 or Holiday Inn.  Guess that's what you get if you want to stay in Tourist Town.We booked 2 nights at the Matterhorn Inn basically because it was the only decently reviewed place we could afford in Sedona. I must admit that I didn't have high expectations. Online it looked like a basic motel. And the name didn't help. Matterhorn? In Sedona?  (Never did learn why they named it that.) The reality is that the motel is very clean and maintained with a nice pool area and is in a fantastic uptown location. Our room was spacious and comfortable with a great view. The staff was very friendly and helpful. I would stay here again. Give it the chance I almost didn't.My husband and I stayed at The Matterhorn Inn last weekend during our brief visit to Sedona.  The hotel is in a good part of town if you're into touristy shops and overpriced, underwhelming food, but the location is just about all it has going for it.  Our room wasn't exactly clean.  I found a pile of whiskers near the sink, hair stuck in the blow dryer, and hair stuck on our "clean towels".  Um -- gross.  I didn't look closely at the bedding for fear of what I might discover.  I've definitely stayed in nicer hotels, especially for the money.  Plus, the hotel lobby closes at 10pm, so, should you need anything after quittin' time, you're out of luck.

review_content: When you are on a long-awaited, "hopefully not-just-once in a lifetime" vacation/belated honeymoon, and/or visiting a BEAUTIFUL, one-of-a-kind, natural setting, and you can't quite get away with "living off the land" for a week, the next best thing to do is to find a good, clean, basic place to stay, and save your $$$ for the fun stuff.  That's EXACTLY what we did when we moved from our first semi-lap of luxury (not really) first hotel to this Days Inn.  And really, for what's it's worth, all things considered, this was as good, if not BETTER a place for us (and nearly $50.00/night cheaper than the first place!!)  SCORE!!!With a (rental) car, which you REALLY need if you plan to spend any amount of time in the area, there's really no "bad" location here in Sedona.  We wanted a pool and breakfast, and that's exactly what we got.  Quiet, comfortable, convenient, not far from any of what we wanted to see and do.  We had a upstairs room, private balcony overlooking the pool, with a comfy king-size bed, microwave, fridge, and not a care in the world.  Nope, this is not "lap of luxury," and the breakfast area is small, and there aren't a ton of choices, but staying a week here was one of our better choices, and we'd do it again in a heartbeat... Unless, of course we a) win the lottery, or b) find the MOST perfect spot out in the wilderness!!  ;-)3 stars for ample space & below. Has Bed room & a separate front room.Decorations from the 1970's. In need of a face lift.If they would replace the ancient stained maroon carpets, out dated drapes and decor furnishings and would put in new heating  it would go along way... I would rate it 5 stars for what it is & provides.It's a basic hotel. With not much on site.Room Does have a mini-frig/microwave.2 ; flat 32 inch tvs with limited channels.Not much amenities on site. (A pool for summer)A location that's good for sleeping...The free breakfast is toast, bagels, cereal and fruit.  Coffee or OJ. Located in a side room of check in area that has only 3 tables; so most likely you will take food to your room. Service to 9:30am. Great staff!!Heaters are old fashion and take and suck up all the oxygen in the room. Can only run them for a short while. FYI Room does have a tub. Housekeeping available daily.Good for those needing a place to sleep for the night or need to be cost effective. Yet perhaps may not be your 1st choice if you want to hang on site to experience the grounds or be inside the room to take in the ambiance for a long period of time. Rooms are cold but do warm up after a bit.If you are on a tight budget or w/kids then this may satisfy your needs.Great location if you are planning on hiking Thunder Mountain and the trails nearby. The bed was super comfy and overall very clean. Can't beat the price and what you get. Rooms are sizeable, has a frig, and while the walls are kind of thin, it's all good. The soap/towels are what you'd expect for a Days Inn so bring your own stuff as needed.They have a free breakfast with oatmeal, bagels/diff kinds of bread. Plenty of parking as well. I would definitely stay here again.Stayed here 3 nights with a deal from Hotwire, much cheaper than most other places in Sedona and we were happy to be away from all the noise in Uptown.Rooms were perfectly clean, great Wifi service and we enjoyed the pool. The continental breakfast provided included oatmeal, breads, cereal, yogurt, bananas,  juice and coffee. Quality wasn't great, but what you would expect for the type of hotel, we did eat there 2 of the mornings and it was ok. The coffee maker, microwave and mini fridge was a plus. We brought some drinks from home that we kept in the fridge and had popcorn with our HBO movies at night.I would not hesitate to stay here again, perfect for the budget minded traveler.Nice rooms and comfy beds. Be careful of the tile outside the building when it's wet. I took one step onto it and slipped and hit my face on the railing and took a massive chunk out of my tongue. Comical yet dangerous. They should really change the tile.Really nice place perfect placing little bit away from the busy down town.Beautiful red mountain in front of the room I was in.There is a patio to sit and enjoy the beautiful weather.The staff is wonderful and really helpful with what to do in the town and where to eat.The rooms were clean.free wifi.The bathroom are a little small but good for the price.Have been staying here for years and it's great! Fairly priced and not far from uptown. Staff is always friendly and the room(s) are always clean. The breakfast sucks and that's the only complaint. Highly recommend!Hey, what kind of traveller are you? If you're pretentious, or difficult to please then just stop reading now. But, if you're a little more easy going, want a quality, clean location-then this is a place for you! Let's not kid ourselves, Sedona is expensive. You can easily pay at least $125 a night at most places. Here, the cost is a little more reasonable (or use points!) and totally functional. The beds were comfortable, the bathroom clean, and the location-central. I totally recommend this stop for the money-wise traveler!I stay here over this past weekend with my mom when when we were in Sedona for a wedding. Overall, I was really happy with my stay at the Days Inn-Sedona. The best part about this place is that they keep the rooms very clean. I've stayed at other budget hotels/motels and they often skimp on cleanliness to keep costs down. This definitely wasn't the case at this location. Also, the WiFi was free and it worked great during our entire stay.The only negative that I can think of is that the bathrooms are incredibly small. So small that it was difficult to get in and out of at times. This normally wouldn't be a huge issue since I tend to not hangout in the bathroom when I'm on vacation, but it's the only private area of the room to change your clothes. Again, it wouldn't be an issue if I was staying there with my wife or by myself, but you definitely want a little privacy for changing your clothes when you're staying some place with your mom. Despite this relatively minor issue, I would definitely stay at the Days Inn-Sedona in the future.A bit disappointed. Bathrooms definitely need to be upgraded. Also buy some new towels.  Some of them were not clean and with spots on them and falling apart.Great price, clean, comfortable.Stayed here on a road trip and was very satisfied. Got a good deal through Hotwire and felt pleased with what we got. Beautiful area, lovely drive in. Room was spacious and clean with refrigerator and microwave. Bed was comfortable. Great deal.I don't expect a lot when I book a days inn.  The hotels in Sedona are all pretty expensive compared to other cities.  I booked out a month ago and had already paid for the room.  I called the receptionist to see if I could get an early check in because we were only an hour and a half out.  The receptionist sounded like a snotty teenager told me, "well maybe by 2 pm but there is no guarantee whatsoever." With that attitude we decided to cancel our reservation...I expect a little less rudeness with my booking.Ditto on many of the other positive reviews, thought I would add as an update to the most recent review that they seem to have ramped up the free breakfast offerings - there was an assortment of bagels, pastries, cereal, hardboiled eggs and more. We booked two rooms the night before our stay through Priceline express deals and were very pleased with the quality of what we got for the money ($79/room plus taxes and fees). The bathroom was quite small but there was a nice showerhead and good water pressure. Our rooms were on the second floor and we had a great  little private balcony facing one of the red rocks. Cable wise there were a plethora of channels including HBO. My teeny tiny complaint is that we were not able to check in early. Regular check in time is 3:00 and when I called at around 1:30 the rooms had not yet been cleaned. Overall we really enjoyed our stay, the area seemed more residential than other parts of Sedona and there's lots of restaurants. Also located not too far from the airport if you're looking to do a helicopter tour.The location of this hotel is ideal. They are right in the center of Sedona. When we arrived five minutes before 3 (check in time) the lady yelled at my mom for wanting to check in early and it would be another 20 minutes later. I was very offended she had to yell at my mother for just asking when our room would be ready. We mentioned we would be right outside to wait. Another staff member told us it was ready and the lady just said it has been a busy day. Sadly though, that was not a reason to yell at my mom and not even say sorry. On the other hand, the morning staff seemed super friendly and very happy to be working there. The room was spacious and very tidy. It does seem to be a little date with its art decor, but who care right? I enjoyed its large screen, mini fridge and microwave as we had bought some goodies from Cottonwood. The breakfast options were OK. One type of cereal, bread, a banana and a pastry are your only options. I would have thought some fresh fruits would have been more ideal but it's free so I'm fine with the options.  If you have kids they will be begging for more options. Overall it's a great place, it just depends who get at the front desk and if they yell at you.For value alone, this Days Inn is astounding!Inexpensive lodging that isn't slummy is hard to find in Sedona. Days Inn is clean as a whistle, with a moderate size room and convenient amenities. There is a fridge, microwave, and cable tv. There is a pool open during the summer months and a jacuzzi which was really nice for a chilly November night. I liked the location. I prefer west Sedona over the cheesy touristy area. Days Inn is located nearby better, more local restaurants and close to some good hiking.There was a good selection of items for the continental breakfast. I personally don't like continental breakfasts because of the major carb overload. It would have been nice to see some yogurt or even some hard boiled eggs or something.When we want to splurge on a super romantic Sedona trip, we will not be going to Days Inn. But when we are on a budget and need to get a Sedona fix, this is where you will find us!We are going to call this one bedroom home.$140. It has a king bed and a giant flat screen with HDMI so I can stream onto our TV from my PC which is connected to the free WiFi. And for the couples wishing to enjoy discrete moments of pleasure under the bright stars of the endless sky, in the jacuzzi and maybe a bottle of wine, with romantic beauty, they got that.Good location, great for the price but the lady at the front desk was SUPER rude. I asked for an extra sheet and blanket since our room was originally suppose to have two beds but instead had one king sized. She actually said to me "Just what are we trying to do here?". After arguing with her she finally got off her bum and got me one.Great place to stay at a reasonable rate. The rooms are in excellent repair.  Staff was friendly.  Everything is nice and clean.  It is in the middle of town, right near everything. Very safe area.  Would have given  stars but the free breakfast was  bit weak.  Not a lot of room for people to eat, so it was packed.
