review_content_40: Primarily a deluxe bed-and-breakfast inn, it also serves superb dinners on Friday and Saturday nights that are open to the public by reservation only. Eating here provides non-guests an opportunity to lounge in the serene courtyard and attractive living room and get a sense of what it's like to stay here. The short menu usually includes about a half-dozen entrees and an equal number of appetizers and salads. We shared an order of baked brie with roasted garlic and raspberry-chipotle sauce, then enjoyed pinenut-encrusted halibut with smoked jalapeo-papaya salsa and lamb tenderloin with a pinenut-mint pesto for our entrees. It's elegantly casual . . . or is it casually elegant? Either way, it's a wonderful alternative to the restaurants in town.

review_content: Stayed for two nights in June on an all girls trip. The gentleman at the front desk who checked us in was very nice and helpful. We were assigned a nicely updated two bedroom unit overlooking coffeepot rock, the only thing ruining the view was the unsightly and obnoxiously lit rear of a lumber yard, some privacy trees would definitely help. We took two great tours through Wyndham, a city tour and a Vortex tour and both guides were outstanding. The pool was great (salt water?) Had comfortable beds. One of the nicest Wyndhams I have had the opportunity to stay at. Sister attended a 90 min presentation, she appreciated the lack of excessive pressure. She received a decent gift certificate. Avoid the overpriced native jewelry sale at the hotel (for beautiful Indian jewelry go to the Dairy Queen parking lot outside of Sedona on the way to flagstaff and buy direct.)I am not a big fan of staying in hotels to begin with but I do admit I get a bit of pleasure coming back from a long day out and finding my room straightened up, my bed made and fresh towels on the rack. Well, if this is something that would also give you pleasure don't book here at Wyndham Sedona. Apparently, unbeknownst to me, their main business is selling timeshares. I thought I had booked a room at a hotel... you know a real hotel! I came back from a long day of vacationing and guess what - my bed was not made, my towels were still on the floor, and the place was still as messy as I left it in the morning! I called front desk to ask what happened to housekeeping services. The woman on the end of the line said they were a time share resort and that they don't offer daily housekeeping, as if that was plain to everyone else but me. Oh sh*t my bad. That explains it. I'll just launder the towels myself." What?! Nowhere on their webpage or my reservation confirmation did they say I had to do chores and pay to do it!Right from the start they tried to sell me on a timeshare, offering me deals if we would just sit through their 90 min. presentation - why the F were they telling me this? Why would I want to spend my precious vacation time sitting through a spiel that I am not interested in? We were invited to their wine tasting and chocolate mixer. What a flop. We were treated to little chunks of fudge and an assortment of cheap wines from the local Safeway supermarket.Their rooms are nice enough, kinda like a little apartment-not that I want to or needed to feel like I was in an apartment when I am on vacation. I wanted to be in a HOTEL and to be treated like I was in a HOTEL. Well, I can see if you have a bunch of punk kids tagging along on your vacation you may want to cook and clean after them. Kinda like the best of both worlds. You can vacation AND do house work! But for me no thanks.Next time? Find me at the romantic little inn on the other side of town.This place ended up exceeding my expectations. Based on the photos on their website, the place looks very dated. I'm not sure if simply got a nicer unit or if the resort really needs to update its photos, but it was a very pleasant surprise to walk into a totally updated unit. We traveled to Sedona for my sister's bachelorette party. There were 5 of us total and the 2 bedroom condo was the perfect size for us. In fact, it was really spacious! We were in the 2200 building and even though we didn't have much of a view, the balcony was really nice to have for our morning coffees. We arrived at 2 a.m. after making the 2 hour drive from the PHX airport. Since I'm from Minneapolis, it was actually 4 a.m. in my time, so I was pretty worried about the late night check in process going terribly wrong. But it ended up being super easy... just make sure you call a few days before your arrival to let them know you'll be arriving late. They have a security guard available to give you your keys and tell you where your unit is. It went smoothly and quickly. Here were some of the highlights of the place: - Large, updated kitchen with pretty much all of the pots, pans, etc. that you need to cook a meal - 2 bathrooms (one with a large jacuzzi tub that we didn't end up using) - Washer & Dryer and soap to use - Comfy beds - 24 hour heated pool - Great location. It's not right by the main drag of downtown Sedona which was great because it's very tacky-touristy and we ended up wanting to stay away from that area altogether - Within walking distance to several restaurants, bars and coffee shops Negatives: - The only real negative is that this is a timeshare which means they'll try to convince you to attend a 90 minute session about timeshare ownership. We had to go pick up new keys the following morning after we arrived for our official check in and while my group waited in the car to go to breakfast, I was trapped into a spiel about attending a 90 minute timeshare presentation. When my sister came in and faked that we had reservations and needed to leave, the guy wasn't happy. Turns out you have to be 28 to purchase a timeshare, so I'm not even old enough in the first place to do it. Anyways, I understand that this is part of staying at a timeshare, but even after telling the man that we definitely wouldn't attending the presentation, it was hard to get away. Another reviewer mentioned paper thin walls... I never heard another soul, so we definitely didn't experience that. The Internet does kind of suck which wouldn't have mattered except I was traveling with grad students who needed to use it for homework. It was an overall great experience and I'd definitely stay here again. Sedona rocks!Great room great price or great views and service. Kitchen was nice room was moderately clean upon arrival but tub needed scrubbing. Second day of four found a dying cockroach in the kitchen. I'm understanding that sometimes you control the world especially the insect world. It was dying and they scooped him up fast. Would have been five stars if it weren't for the dying cockroach.Very good location. Close to shopping and grocery stores. The rooms a great. We stayed in the two bedroom, and it was very roomy. Loved that it had a full kitchen for cooking. The beds could have been a little more comfortable, but overall it was a great stay.Hum.... Let's begin with the phone call asking if my parents are able to check in before us, since we would be driving in hours later. It was denied unless we paid a $45 fee. Strike one. Then comes checking in.... My husband, an owner on my account, wasn't able to check in since I was the one to make the reservation. So they needed me to do the checking in. I was told that Wyndham has tightened up on the policy. What!?! Really my husband can't check in anymore even though he is an owner on the same account? The manager, Carla, sat in her office located behind the check in never did come out to resolve the issue. BIG strike 2. Check In took over 45 minutes. Strike three. All which could've been shortened had Manager Carla bothered to be involve with the situation, rather than sit in the back flexing her muscles, as the other check in lady ran back & forth behind the door getting some type of orders. This situation bothered me so much I felt I had to write a review. I am actually thinking of selling my resort ownership ( owner for 15 years) , and still might if the other resorts customer service dropped to this level. Awful management at this location. First time in all these years was I let down by Wyndham resorts.Stayed here twice once in 2009 and once a week ago. The service here is fantastic! They go out of there way to get you what you need and despite it being a time share they do not pressure you to go to their time share pitches. Perks The pool and hot tub are open 24 hours a day All the rooms have a kitchen All rooms have king sized beds The deluxe rooms have patios and 2 people Jacuzzis in them the views are awesome Decent Gym Located near the grocery store and a few of the better restaurants in Sedona Parking is plentifulGreat place to stay for a week! We enjoyed Sedona and we had the view of the mountains from our porch. I liked the "kid" rule or "quiet hours" - This was extremely helpful as the walls weren't the most soundproof, but everyone seemed to respect it. The tub was great! We had all we needed to just really eat there if you wanted to. The pool was great. Only regret... that we didn't use it more while we were there. Good place to stay!I stayed here for four nights with my fiance and her parents a couple of weeks ago while visiting Sedona. It was actually my second time staying here for a decent period of time. This time around they had just refurbished the rooms and they looked pretty decent. Having the two separate bedrooms each with their own bathroom is nice and then the kitchen, living room and outdoor patio just put a cherry on the top. The first time that we were here we had a room that overlooked some of the famous red rocks although this last time all that we had was the road. What is nice about the Extra Holidays is that they also have a nice pool, always have something going on every night and have board games that you can borrow. That last piece was especially important the last time that we were there as it rained all 4 days and so we ended up borrowing the board game Trouble from them. Yeah, when was the last time you played with the pop-a-matic bubble? For me it has been years but I loved it. The only bad thing that I can say about this place is that the refrigerator broke down the last night that we were there. This was fixed by moving my fiance's parents to another room the next day with a functioning refrigerator since they were staying for a longer period of time than us.The bottom line for me is that I would stay here again in the future. It has a great location as well as good amenities and customer service which makes this the perfect place to stay in the Sedona area.Needs a little updating. Views from rooms in the 1100 and 1300 buildings are beautiful!Very nice! Would definitely come back! Great location, nice rooms. Internet not so great though. Would recommend!This is a nice property with a beautiful view. Our one bedroom suite was very roomie and had a great balcony where we were able to enjoy a nice homemade breakfast with gorgeous view. Nice big jacuzzi tube which I enjoyed. Wish the bedding would have been cotton duvet with a down comforter. Customer service was good. Great hiking that is fairly close. Town closes down early so head out on early side. Loved the restaurant Elote and A Day in the West off road adventure.Great place to spend the week in vacation. Our unit was 2 bed 2 bath and had large living room with patio. Very clean and accommodating for a week's long stay. The kids love it!Ahhh... where to begin... It actually pains me to write such a low review about a property that should easily get 4 or 5 stars.....Let's start with the positive:1. The location-- the location is great! It's centrally located near everything. Also it's a very beautiful location with amazing views.2. The outside of the property is very well maintained.3. The staff is very kind and helpful.4. The room comes with a kitchen (full of dishes and cooking supplies) and a washer and dryer--big plus!5. Beautiful property with business center, pool, workout facility and game room! Now for the not so good...The actual problem with the property and my reason for the low score, lies inside of the room. Despite how beautiful the room is, THE WALLS ARE PAPER THIN!!!! We had a hard time sleeping because we literally heard every single thing that went on in the room next door. When the people next door sneezed, we head it. When they ran their shower we heard it. When they opened their door we heard it. Now there several different people that checked in and out of the room next door to us (we knew this bc we would see them leaving and new ppl arriving and hear the maids cleaning/turning over the room), so the excessive noise was not the result of a really noisy person, it was a result of a poor construction---PAPER THIN WALLS! Not to mention if you were doing something in the living room/ kitchen and you were in the bedroom with the door closed you heard EVERY SINGLE THING- from the dishwasher running, the microwave running-- it was almost like there wasn't a wall separating the rooms because you could hear every single thing. The cable connection wasn't very good, it kept cutting in and out on certain stations--super annoying. Finally, perhaps the most annoying part of the room-- the toilet! You would think you were flushing an industrial toilet with loads of waste in it; due to the excessive amounts of noise the toilet made when you flushed it. It was absolutely ridiculous the amount of noise the toilet makes when flushing.Aside from the poor construction of the room due to the paper thin walls, it's not a bad place to stay. A huge plus for the location is the location-- it's smack in the middle of town. So if the noise is something that won't bother you then is this place is great. If you think the noise will bother you, I suggest bringing earplugs.Me and my wife spent our honeymoon at the Wyndham (3/22-3/24 2014). After the weeks leading up to the wedding, then having the ceremony and driving up to Sedona to arrive at the hotel, I was pleasantly surprised how comfortable our room was. The bed was like falling into a cloud. It was so comfortable. Having a washer/dryer, kitchen with bowls, pots, pans, silverware, etc was nice to have since all we really wanted to do was relax in our room. I called the day before to confirm the reservation and asked for a room with a view. I got a room with a view and to our surprise, a gift from the hotel which was a bottle of non alcoholic wine, drinking glasses and chocolates. Just the right touch. Andy, Jill and the rest of the staff I encountered were very nice, knowledgeable, helpful and very kind. I do plan on coming to this hotel again in the future and I would recommend it to anyone. We had a great time!Cons: For some reason, my cell phone would not connect to the WiFi. Might have been too far from the source, but that is okay. But there are computers in the lobby with internet access.I wanted to extend my stay one more day, but I was told I could not extend my stay for one day. I had extend for 2 days minimum.. Bummer but still doesn't change the fact the hotel resort is nice, clean, relaxing and the staff is friendly. I will still rate 5 stars.Great resort, professional staff, conveniently located, quiet, and clean. We were in the 2400 building on second floor, nice views of red rock mountains. The kitchen came with just about every kind of pan or utensil you'd need to bake a cake, casserole, lasagna, etc. Washer and dryer were handy, everything seemed to work fine. Didn't use the pool, but the pool and area, and actually ALL the facilities (workout room, game room, library, etc) are spotlessly clean. I would recommend to anyone, and would go back again definitely.Another beautiful resort! Definitely would recommend to anyone. Nice that pool and hot tub are 24 hours. Friendly staff. Clean rooms. Great views.We booked through booking.com and I was more than pleased with property. I was amazed at how spacious it was and clean. The staff is very friendly and the rates are more than reasonable. I would love to return. We stayed there March 5 through March 9th for my daughter's wedding. We loved it!Can't give zero stars. Booked in March. They had no record of reservation in July when we called to check since we hadn't received any information. They rebooked us at The Sedona Real. We checked in with Wyndham yesterday. All looked good. We went over to Sedona Real and were told our reservation had been cancelled on the 9th.Just got back from the Wyndham Sedona and had a great time. We were there only 2 nights, but really liked it. The rooms were extremely comfortable and well appointed. The resort has a nice pool and a decent workout room. There was some nice hiking close to property. We will definitely be staying there again.
review_content_20: The place itself is awesome. It's about a 10 min. drive from the Hotel to the Mainstreet where all the shops are located. The views from the rooms are fantastic! Also, the amenities are worth the money you spend to stay there. We stayed there on a girls weekend and it slept all 5 of us more than comfortably. The room had a Jacuzzi in the Bathroom, Plush, clean towels were laid out for us all to enjoy the pool with, and all of their soaps and shampoos were from Bath & Body Works (one of my favorite brands).  The room itself was massive. Two rooms actually in a condo style apartment. Full kitchen and 2 King size beds. The pool was empty (I was shocked!), and clean. Also, the Jacuzzi was fabulous after a long day of driving and/or activities. They also offer a game room with air hockey and fuuz-ball. The only issue I had was that they didn't tell us that check in wasn't until 4pm. So we wound up arriving at 2 and had nowhere to put our stuff. Also, we had an activity @ 5pm so we cut it a little close. This wouldn't have been so bad, but the staff wasn't that nice about it. Once we checked in, they seemed to call and attempt to be attentive. However, upon first impression (which we know count), I was put off my the front desk and their unfriendly, unaccommodating behavior. All in all, I rate this spot 4 stars. Good, and almost great, but still highly enjoyable.

review_content: From the time you arrive to the time you check out and all the time In between the staff is welcoming, friendly, and always making you feel like you are at home.   Each room has its own decor with personal touches. Great location with breathtaking views and grounds. Nestled right on the creek, you don't have to travel in order to enjoy nature; just sit on the deck or on you balcony. When the owners say they want you to feel like you are at your home away from home, they mean it!!!  My highest recommendation of any establishment I've ever been to so far is given to the Inn on Oak Creek!This is the absolute Perfect location for a romantic getaway to Sedona.My husband and I booked last minute and all the nice hotels were booked and actually I only found the Inn on Oak Creek due to a Trip Advisor search - all the travel sites listed them as sold out BUT when I checked their website, the smallest room was still available (YAY!) We are young and well traveled in Europe so the warnings of "small" hotel room didn't phase us at all... I am so happy to report that room is gorgeous and has everything one could need including literally the most comfortable bed EVER!The room was not really too much smaller than an average hotel room, it's just the Inn on Oak Creek primarily has suites so it seems small. But it's so worth it!The breakfast of scones, muffins, fruit, yogurt, coffee and juices was SUCH a great asset as are the amazing views from the deck and most rooms! The friendly guys that operate this wonderful place have an amazing design eye and knack for cozy goodness. We went in May but I can imagine how wonderfully cozy the main lounge would be at Christmas. Over our 2 night stay we went to the Grand Canyon (a full day) so we didn't get to lay around the inn too much but definitely enjoyed the grounds and breakfasts daily. We would absolutely return!Highly recommended!We booked the Oak Creek Suite on our recent getaway to Sedona. This was our first stay at this establishment. The suite is two stories with private balconies overlooking Oak Creek. There are many areas to walk and sit near the creek. This is a very nice boutique property. Upon arrival we were cordially greeted by Brooks who showed us to our suite and explained all the amenities availableThe suite had a king bed (most comfortable) and very large bathroom downstairs while the upstairs had 1/2 bathroom and a kitchen that was straight out of the Food Channel network. Brooks explained that it had been used for culinary demonstrations at one time. Comfortable furnishings, Internet service, big screen TV both upstairs and down complimented by gas fireplaces. Extremely clean and most relaxing. Serene and relaxin overall. Look forward to our next visitLooking for a romantic getaway in Sedona? Start at the Inn on Oak Creek. Located on the bank of Oak Creek that runs through Sedona, The Inn on Oak Creek is true to its name, every room in this quaint inn has a view of Oak Creek. In addition to the view of Oak Creek, the corner rooms also have a view of the Arizona hills that are so famous for its spectacular sunsets.  This intimate inn takes the romantic feel of a bed and breakfast and combines it with the professional feel of a well-run hotel to give their guests a truly enjoyable lodging experience.A continental breakfast is served every morning. Various flavors of Keurig coffee are available in the lobby 24hrs a day. There is also an assortment of teas and fruits in the kitchen along with a refrigerator that is available for guest use. In case, you are wondering what to do in Sedona, there is also an extensive library of travel and hiking books targeting the Sedona and Arizona area. After a long day on the hiking trails or shopping in uptown Sedona, you can go back to your room relax in the Jacuzzi tub and then enjoy one of the movies in the inn's DVD collection. The decor inside and out is elegant, well maintained and tastefully up to date. This has to be the most enjoyable hotel I've stayed at.Next time? I would not stay anywhere else in Sedona.When my boyfriend showed me images of the Oak Creek suite as a potential option for our anniversary trip, I basically laughed at him. The promise of 1,200+ square feet, with a full kitchen (and by full I mean 12 barstools along an island full), living room, and multiple balconies, was something that I thought was far above our budget. Instead, we found reasonable rates, and I can honestly say that after some research, we chose Sedona for a destination based on the Oak Creek suite and accommodations at The Inn Above Oak Creek.The booking process should have been a first clue that we were in for a great trip - the online booking was down when we tried to book our stay (causing a mini panic attack), but when we called the Inn and spoke to Brooks, he was warm and welcoming, even via the phone. The warmth of phone conversations, which added to the excitement of the trip continued when I called for some information about our suite and spoke to Wakyna - during this phone call, I mentioned that BF and I had booked dinner reservations at Timo for our anniversary, and asked for her opinion (she approved). She also recommended Indian Gardens Oak Creek Market during this phone call, which ended up being our favorite breakfast/coffee spot. Even before meeting us, Brooks and Wakyna were so sweet, thorough with answers, and extremely helpful. They also surprised us with a bottle of wine upon learning we were there for our anniversary, another touch that was so unexpected and sweet. The Oak Creek suite was stunning - words can't even express how incredible and breathtaking the suite is. It's two levels, with a private entrance and beautiful entryway. Upstairs, you have an open concept layout with a dining table, windows wrapping around the living room area and opening up to a massive balcony that overlooks Oak Creek, a kitchen with massive island, 12 barstools, Viking appliances, and a hallway that leads to a half bath for the upstairs. The pictures you can see on the website don't even do it justice - the place is absolutely stunning, filled with natural light. We didn't spend as much time here as I wish we had, but the full fridge was a huge bonus, as was the Keurig. Downstairs, the flooring switches to carpeting, but the full windows continue, which overlook the creek, as well as the downstairs balcony. The bed is a king, there's a huge mounted TV on the wall (above the fireplace), there's a massive walk in closet with plenty of hanging space, and the bathroom is literally the size of some NYC studio apartments, complete with double sinks, a jacuzzi tub, and walk in shower. There's also a washer/dryer in the unit, which we did take advantage of as to not have to come back home with a suitcase filled with dirty clothes. The bed was the most comfortable bed I've ever slept in, and the linens on the bed were absolutely incredible (Anthony and I still want to find out where we can buy them - they were so soft and perfect). The Inn itself serves a continental breakfast each morning with oatmeal, pastries, juice, coffee, and tea. We didn't really take advantage of this breakfast, but it seemed like everyone staying in the actual Inn was there. There was also a jar of jelly beans that was always filled, which I absolutely took advantage of, and was a perfect added touch. This truly was a perfect location for a getaway - the staff goes above and beyond and are so accommodating (I could go on and on about how absolutely wonderful they are), the Oak Creek suite is beautiful (overwhelmingly so) and the other rooms looked equally stunning, the grounds are beautiful, and it's in a great location, close to uptown Sedona and within walking distance of so many perfect restaurants. Can't recommend more highly - definitely where we'll be staying during future Sedona trips!We stayed here with several family members and friends for our wedding in the area for almost a week. Brooks was awesome! Always ready with recommendations, umbrellas for monsoon season, Johnny on the spot with any repairs needed. The price of the rooms for the location and hospitality make this an awesome deal. We would definitely stay here again. In fact we gave our wedding centerpieces to them to put on the tables for the other guests to enjoy! All my friends and family enjoyed their stay as well!We stayed here for a quick 1 night when we got to Sedona. What a great spot! The staff was super helpful and Brooks put us in room 11 which was lovely. Beautiful View from jet tub and balcony. It was our anniversary so we thought we would grab a quick bite to eat. Brooks suggested the Mexican place a crossed the street. It was not so great. To be fair we went kinda late. Just mediocre food. But back to the inn, the breakfast was very nice and was perfect after I had done a bit of yoga down by the creek. So peaceful and serene. Overall just wonderful. Would def return and recommend!From the second we walked in the door we felt like family. Amberley even greeted me by name as we walked in! She sat down and went over everything to do and see in Sedona with us, gave us recommendations that were excellent and was incredibly friendly and helpful. Our room was gorgeous. Immaculately clean and comfortable with a beautiful view of the river, a cozy fireplace and a giant two person tub with jets. The inn itself was relaxing and quiet with very nice guests and a nice baked goods spread in the morning. Plenty of tea and coffee whenever you want and a lovely living room downstairs which also has a view of the water. Both of the ladies at the desk were beyond helpful and even gave us freshly baked cookies when we checked out. I absolutely give this place my highest recommendation which is rare.  Enjoy your stay!I am remiss in not having done this review sooner. My sisters and I went to Arizona on our annual sisters getaway. We landed in Phoenix and first stop was Sedona. Quite honestly, I wish we had booked our entire stay there. I spoke so highly of it that a friend from Colorado just booked a 3 night stay there with her husband. I can't wait to hear about their visit! Spence the owner is as warm as his smile and was most helpful. I am bummed that I can't remember the gal that checked us in. She welcomed us and after our long drive suggested that we get comfortable and then come back to talk about things to do. She was very helpful. Just welcoming, friendly and homey all around. While it is no longer a bed and breakfast, it is a quaint, homey, inn that you can sit in the open room with coffee and tea and jelly bellies available 24/7 and a lovely continental style breakfast with bagels, pastries, oatmeal and juice in the morning.  I padded down in my jammies every morning and chatted with the other guests. The two adjoining rooms were perfect for us and nicely appointed. Be sure to hang out on your deck or in the chairs by the creek maybe with a glass of wine and watch the ducks land. There was a wedding across the creek and the fairy lights made it even more special. We wandered and walked around town and the shops. Had dinner at Elote which is a must! An amazing inn with a warm and inviting atmosphere where you want to hang out before and after a long day sight seeing! We'll be back!Enchanting small motel with a view and balcony over creek with ducks. Rooms are cozy with inside hot tubs (some double person) and fireplaces. The staff are incredibly friendly and helpful. They make you feel like you are their sole concern. The staff came across as genuine, and sincere. We were under the impression they really cared.When asked they came up with good hiking options for us and provided clear directions with maps.We wanted orange juice for a late afternoon lunch long after they had put it away, and they provided some no problem.They were flexible and responsive to what we needed.They moved lugguge for us and brought the heavy suitcases Downstairs for us. We did not ask them to do it, they asked us if they could do it for us.Bring your own robe though, none provided as of yet although they are considering adding them, they were very open to a few strategic suggestions.Great location.Across from art galleries, native rug and jewlery stores, and nice although pricey restraunts.  A few miles to great hiking trails and scenic drives. Joint living room open to all has a 24 hr fireplace, tv, and snacks.Booked this place for our anniversary trip and I am SO glad! Received and email en route to Sedona asking about arrival time so they could make a late arrival package for us. We arrived around 6 and found it right on the front door. As we walked in we were greated by warmth, a fireplace, comfortable couches and 24 coffee! Such a cute place. It was easy to find our wonderful room with a creekside view and little balcony. Amazing views from our windows of fall leaves, the beautiful red rocks and creek.Good size room with fireplace,  queen bed, and amazing gacuzzi tub! It made me nervous at first but we showered while looking out upon the view! Cool!The owners are amazing. A small breakfast of bagels, muffins, pastries,  fruit, yogurt and oatmeal is out every morning at 7:30. Then they can assist you with any place you would like to go!We loved that we could walk to almost anything, the main downtown area as well as some interesting bars. This was such a great find!Our stay was good but not amazing. Stayed for 3 nights in 3/2014. PROS:-The continental breakfast is generous with bagels, pastries, oatmeal, and juice!-The rooms are all well decorated and clean.-The toiletries in the bathroom have a separate shampoo and conditioner.-The beds are super comfortable and the towels in the bathroom are very soft!-Free parking lot with plenty of spaces-A gorgeous gorgeous view of oak creek!-Coffee all day available in the lobby-Good prices!-Spencer himself is a major pro of this hotel.  He recommends hikes and patiently answers any questions you might have! A great and friendly welcome!CONS-The rooms were cold as Sedona in march is 40s at night and 60s during the day. They didn't turn the central heat on and we were all frankly miserable and frozen. When we requested the heat to be turned on, Chris was full of excuses (it's difficult to time the heat with the sun setting, sedona temperature is fickle, etc). The bottom line is that your tenants should not freeze on vacation!  Amazingly, the following night, he STILL did not turn on the heat until another couple complained...and he gave them the same speech! Ridiculous. You would think they would remedy it and turn on the heat before everyone froze. Then yet AGAIN the next night, he also didn't turn on the heat until someone complained. The low that night was 40F.-The wifi worked about 50% of the time, depending which room you have and it is sloooooow. I actually turned my wifi OFF on my phone bc it was slowing it down. If you are reliant on wifi to do work, do NOT depend on the wifi here. Other couples we met were having similar problems. -There's no front desk as this is not a traditional hotel. We couldn't find anyone after 5pm to help us with the above issues! It turns out Chris lives next to the office. It's just a bit odd to knock on someone's front door. As a normal person with normal manners, it feels uncomfortable and a bit rude. I wish they had a better contact point, like a hotel's front desk.Overall a pleasant visit but this place is definitely still working out some kinks!First time at Inn on Oak Creek. First, the rates are much lower than other local hotels. Host greeted us at the door and gave us a quick walk around. Nice lodge-looking place. Room #2 was quaint, with balcony overhanging Oak Creek which was brimming with ducks. At one point we counted 60 ducks. The view from the balcony was gorgeous. There are red rocks in the distance, aspen and sycamore trees shading the area, bunnies and swifts during the day and bats at night. The room featured a queen bed, fireplace, jacuzzi bathtub and a table/chair set.  The ceiling fan had a remote control. The TV went ignored but was available. Although they didn't serve breakfast, there was an assortment of bagels and pastries, plus fruit. There was a kuereg and OJ as well. The location was key for us. Right on state route 179, close enough to Tlacapaque, Upper Sedona and a couple of restaurants was perfect for us. Although we never got the host's name, he was helpful in recommending sights, restaurants and shopping. When we went hiking, he provided us with a monthly pass which saved us $10 - nice touch. The next time we are in Sedona, we will be sure to stay at the Inn on Oak Creek.Beautiful Inn, terrific staff and a great location makes this a perfect place to stay in Sedona. Book early and ask for creekside room for best experience. The kitchen has a frig for guests to keep your groceries.Loved our stay here for our 10th anniversary. We were in room 7 which is a "red rock" view room. Our room had a king bed, 2 person jacuzzi tub, gas fireplace and a balcony with a bistro table and two chairs. The room was perfect. It is the smallest of the standard rooms, but was still plenty big, and the beautiful vaulted ceiling made it feel larger.Brooks was great at check in making sure we knew where the best hiking spots were, to confirming we had chosen one of the best restaurants in Sedona for our anniversary dinner. We even had a special note in our room from him.We had planned on going out for breakfast, but ended up eating downstairs each morning. The pastries, bagels, yogurt and fruit were enough to make us not want to go out. Sitting on the balcony over the creek and looking out at the red rocks was perfect.The location of the Inn was great, we were close enough to walk to Tlaquepaque or Creekside if we wanted to, and uptown was only a short drive away.We will definitely be back, and you can bet when anyone asks us about our trip to Sedona, this is the first place we talk about.I can't imagine staying at a better place. The staff (Amberli and Victor) is friendly, resourceful, and very enthusiastic. The place is spotless and has a fantastic view of the creek and surrounding mountains. A small, warm feel located close to some of the best restaurants, art galleries, and hiking trials in Sedona.My husband and I had a GREAT time at the Inn on Oak Creek. We stayed here for one night to celebrate our 1st Year Wedding Anniversary and it was such a nice experience. From the moment we arrived, Brooks (the house keeper) was so welcoming and accommodating. He gave us a quick run down of Sedona by marking up a city map and circling all of the places to visit. Our room was very quaint and peaceful. We stayed in one of the rooms along the creek and a beautiful view of Sedona. The fireplace and especially HUGE jacuzzi tub were a major plus for our experience! The night of our anniversary we found out that our car battery had died! We didn't want to ruin the night so waited until the next morning to call AAA. Unfortunately AAA was booked solid and we couldn't find any local auto shop to jumpstart our car. Luckily the inn owner, Spence, was a godsend and was so amazingly kind. He went out of his way to find jumper cables (even walked across the street to ask to borrow some jumper cables) and really wanted to help us in whatever way possible. His assistant, Andrea, was extremely kind and helped us jump our car and we were on our way home. This was, by far, the most welcoming hotel we've ever been to. From the moment we stepped in the door to the moment we left, the staff was so incredibly kind and welcoming. It felt so nice to be welcomed by such genuine people. We would absolutely stay at the Inn on Oak Creek again and would HIGHLY recommend it to anyone!Great little place, perfect central location, nice staff. Real personal touch without that "I'm staying in a stranger's house" B&B feeling. A Memorial Day visit meant that the roads were choked with thousands and thousands of cars, so it was really nice to be somewhere that was walking distance from good restaurants (Creekside) and hikes (Marg's Draw). We were only in Sedona for one night, but when we go back we'll probably stay here again.I can't even begin to express how happy we were with our stay here. My husband booked us a room for our 10 year anniversary. (Which also happens to fall on the busy 4th of July weekend) He said brooks went above and beyond to accommodate us for our special weekend. We had a sweet note wishing us a happy anniversary along with a bottle of wine and chocolates in our room. My husband had ordered a massive bouquet of roses for me and the staff made sure it was nicely displayed in the room for our arrival. The customer service here is unbelievable. It felt like we were staying with family. The room is updated and are very clean. I also loved the fireplace and the jet tub...Not to mention the Gorgeous views from the patio. We will def go back again very soon! And again thank you to the staff and owner for everything!We stayed in the suite for two days. This was our first time in Sedona and it certainly won't be our last. Everybody at the Inn were all very helpful. The inn is conveniently located within walking distance of several shops and restaurants. If you can, get the suite, it's 1300 square feet and comes with several amenities. We love this place so much that we are already planning our next trip here.
review_content_20: I was looking for a place to stay for my husband and my first wedding anniversary. We wanted something scenic but close to all the major attractions. I also had my heart set on somewhere right by the water. The Inn On Oak Creek fit the bill! My husband and I drove in on Saturday morning and after hiking all day received a call from Brooks letting us know our room was ready. The location was perfect and after walking through the giant copper door we were immediately welcomed. It's a super cute inn with a slight bed and breakfast feel. Very nice furnishings and decorations. After we were checked in we were shown to our room which had a wonderful view of the creek. We were in room 6 on the second floor. The room was very comfortable and clean. After getting settled in, we heard a knock at the door and there was Brooks with a bottle of red wine and a note wishing us a Happy Anniversary! How sweet!!! The evening was quite and relaxing. There is 24 hour access to the kitchen downstairs which came in handy when we needed ice after dinner. In the morning we went downstairs for a delicious breakfast. I enjoyed fresh coffee, some fruit and a bagel while my husband devoured what he said were the best cinnamon rolls he's ever had. If you are looking for a unique place to stay in Sedona with some of the best views of Sedona, stay here! You won't be disappointed!We were warmly greeted by Spence who have us some tips on what we should see while in sedona.  Every idea he gave us was spot on.  The Inn was so fresh, clean, tastefully decorated, and exceptionally comfortable. We had a king size room and it was very large with a fireplace and beautiful bathroom with soaking tub.  The location was perfect for walking to town as well.Our luggage had been rerouted from our flight, and the Inn accepted it before we had arrived in Sedona and it was waiting in our room when we got there.Sitting out on the balcony with a bagel each morning was an extra perk..a quiet and relaxing way to start our days of hiking.  This kind of Inn is the exact experience I would want anywhere I travel, friendly staff - exceptional accommodations - and a feeling like we were at home here.From the get-go, we were blown away by the outstanding hospitality of Brooks and his team at this Inn. From the extensive knowledge given to us about the area (such as the best hiking trails, tips on how to get a seat in one of the best restaurants in Sedona, etc) to giving us some of their last amount of Pu-Erh tea since they found out we are tea lovers, The Inn stands head and shoulders above. The accommodations were beautifully presented, from the small deck overlooking the creek, to the hammock on the bank for use by guests to the shared galley kitchen we felt at home.We stayed in the #3 suite with the cute fireplace and jacuzzi with windows looking out onto the creek.Lastly, my wife is Chinese and what was a pleasant surprise is that Brooks also speaks fluent Mandarin, too!I booked this inn to surprise my sweetheart with a nice romantic getaway. By far one of the nicest places I've ever stayed. I definitely recommend staying in there suite room. I so appreciate this place and the staff were AWESOME! I can't wait to get back!! :)had a lovely two night stay in April - emailed when it looked like we would arrive after the 6pm official closing time and almost immediately got a phone call back saying ti was fine and where they'd leave our room keys and instructions etc. As it was we got there at 5:45pm so it was fine.We had a queen creekside room, view over the creek was sublime, room was clean and substantial in size with a little private balconey on which we enjoyed a chilled glass of wine at sunset.Bathroom had a jacuzzi bath which was AWESOME! Ugh so sick of this country having such tiny baths but both of us could fit in this - we tried and we did and it was brill.Decent continental breakfast though we had to ask other guests about using the kitchen facilities etc, but that was fine. The big deck looked fab but we just got up and went hiking so didn't really utilise it.It's a fairly quite place and we felt like we were the youngest patrons by a god generation or two (we're in our early 30's) but as we were sans kids that was fine by us really.Would def stay againI would probably rate higher but the reason I am not is because of just a couple of minor things. First off, we were there from 7/11-7/14 and stayed in room 5 which is at the top of the steps. During our stay they had repainted/restained the handrails and at the time of our stay the top stair which made it very inconvenient. Also the carpet at the top of the step was very dirty and could have used a good cleaning, Overall though the views were amazing as the Inn sits right on Oak Creek, we would definitely return.We stayed in room #9, and had the BEST stay.  We originally were planning on staying at L'Auburge or Enchantment, and then decided to switch gears.  We are so glad we did! Not only were the rooms more updated, and decorated more beautifully, the customer service was by far the best we've ever received-ever- (stayed at many 4&5 star resorts in the past), the location can't be beat, either.  Walking distance to shops and restaurants, this is the premier place to stay while visiting Sedona.  HIGHLY recommend!This place is great! My wife and I came for our ten year anniversary and love the quite and private rooms with balcony overlooking the creek! Will was beyond helpful with service, food and activity ideas. Beds are very comfortable and rooms are clean and modern. Location is a big plus. My only complaint is an A/C issue that was addressed right away and the single serve coffee bar... We will come back!We had an incredible stay! We arrived late, after the front desk staff was no longer in the office, but we had received a lovely phone call letting us know that this would not be an issue. The key, as well as a really sweet note, awaited us. When we had a question upon arrival we easily reached someone at the # that had been provided and the person who responded was gracious and helpful. The decor is really beautiful, the place is spotless, the staff is attentive, and despite the fact that we had booked the   "bonus" room which we were told was tiny it surpassed all our expectations. The Inn is a perfect place to stay while visiting Sedona!Let me start off by saying their website is not up to date and the accommodations have recently been updated.  The prices also do not match up but they are cheaper than what the website lists.  From the old pictures this hotel is much nicer and I can tell the new owners want to turn this place into something much nicer.  The rooms are awesome and have been recently renovated.  Spence, the owner, went out of his way to make us feel at home and gave us suggestions of things to do in Sedona.  When we arrived after hours he left keys to two rooms (1 was bigger than the room we originally booked) and let us choose which one we wanted.  The hotel only has 13 rooms, which gives it a B&B feel but with hotel accommodations.Being right on Oak Creek, the hotel has a great little spot on the creek with chairs to just relax and take in the sounds of the ducks.  My suggestion would be to grab a bottle of wine or some beers from a liquor store and just sit and enjoy the creek!Overall, if the wife and I make it back to Sedona then we will definitely be staying at this hotel again!Very nice, cosy and clean B&B. Great location and parking for free. Amazing views on the Oak Creek. Situated right next to the interstate, yet very quiet and peaceful. Tastefully decorated. Fireplace and jacuzzi in every room, nice toiletries and comfie bed. We got room 7, which was very affordable and appropriate in size. Even though we did not have the prime creek view, we enjoyed our little balcony overlooking the road and Red Rocks. Small but sufficient complimentary breakfast (bagels and cream cheese, fruit, fresh pastries,  coffee and OJ) was a huge plus, as we could enjoy it on the BEAUTIFUL big balcony (this balcony was for the common use around the clock, with amazing view on the creek,  fantastic company of hummingbirds every morning and amazing stars at night). There is no classic reception desk, yet there was a 'late arrival box' and Spence was still kind to greet us at 10pm arrival and everything was prepared perfectly. The atmosphere was great, very home-like. The owners were attentive and helpful, yet not pushy. Awesome value for the price. Hope to be back!Great experience here. Beautiful, comfortable rooms. Amazingly helpful and knowledgeable staff. Tranquil setting by the creek and centrally located. Highly recommended.I just want to start by saying I don't normally write reviews but based on our recent stay I wanted to go out of my way and write a review about this place.The hotel sits right on oak creek (beautiful scenery), is in the middle of sedona so it's the perfect location.  It has a great deck for sitting and watching the ducks swim below.  Room was really clean and bed very comfortable.  Staff was nice - almost felt like we were staying with family in one of the rooms.We only stayed for one night but our expectations were more than exceeded.  The other reviews on here are spot on - great place would definitely look here first if we ever come back to sedona!Had a great experience!! Very nice accommodations, bed was so comfy.  Sat by the creek in the evening and enjoyed some adult beverages and beautiful surroundings.  Wonderful stay.My husband, daughter, and I had adjoining rooms 3 and 4. It was perfect. Everything was super clean! The balcony was great, and there was a fire place in our room.  There was a beautiful outside deck for the continental breakfast where we watched humming birds. The coffee is available all day with French Vanilla creamer. Spence and Will were very accommodating even though we never met them. The only odd thing was that they steam cleaned the carpet in our room and it was still wet: minor issue. It was a great experience and we would go back.Beautifully well appointed inn. Great service. Beautiful rooms. Friendly.  Georgeous views. I highly recommendThis was our first stay at a small hotel/B & B. The inn is recently under new management and they were great. The view was perfect. We had the angular room (best room they have). The decor is rather....out of date...like 1970s out of date and has that whole country home style vibe. No fear though, the new management plans on revamping the interior decor soon to bring it into the 21st century. We only stayed one night but really enjoyed it. Easy to get to, great view and great staff makes this one place we'll definitely be staying at again.No bar, no restaurant, no room service. Great location and nice rooms, but lacks the amenities I need. You'd be better off at Enchantment or L'Auberge which are full service resorts at comparable prices.What an amazing place, especially for the value!We stayed one night after three nights at L'Auberge.  That is significant because our room view at Oak Creek was far, far, far superior than L'Auberge and for nearly 2/3 less the cost!  The bed was super comfortable and the house was immaculate and updated.  Loved the colors in the room, modern but soothing.  Location is perfect, (walking distance to Elote which is the best food we have had in Sedona or maybe anywhere!).  Liked having tea and coffee available in  The lobby at all times.  Had a nice continental breakfast too.  The owner greeted us and was very nice and welcoming. Would recommend this place and love to return for several days.Cons: there is no coffee maker in the room which is undstandable,  given the great price.  However, by 6:45 am Thursday morning I tried to use the lobby coffee maker and could not get it to work. There was no water I. The reservoir so I thought that was the problem.  I filled it and still could not get the machine to work.  I would suggest having the innkeeper fill the water to the appropriate level the night before as I may have unintentionally messed the machine up.I also wish there were reading lights on both sides of the bed, and mentioned this to the owner.  The space on one side really is tiny though, but I would sacrifice beauty for the privilege of both of us reading n bed!This is a great place to stay when visiting Sedona. Centrally located, walk to everything. Small and intimate right on Oak creek. So much better than the big time share resorts with their constant sales pitches.
review_content_40: We are in agreement with all the good things said here. We went in February and stayed four nights, the first of which was our thirty-fifth anniversary. We also enjoyed the continental breakfast, the coffee, and the views of the creek, taking a creek side room.The advantage of the small hotel, at least in this case, is that the owner is your host. True, it's no longer a bed and breakfast, but it still has that general feel. In addition to the helpful guidance concerning the sights and recommended hikes and restaurants, Spence went an extra mile for us.Our daughter, unknown to us, called ahead form Chicago and spoke to Spence, assuming he was the concierge. She asked for advice on buying a gift card for us to a restaurant of his recommendation. When we arrived, we mentioned a restaurant that had been recommended to us, the Mexican restaurant in town, Elote. Later that evening we passed the office on the way to take another hike nearby. Spence came chasing after us in the parking lot, asking if we were headed to that restaurant. We said no, and he said that was good, as he had just been there and the lines were really lo-o-ong. We thanked him and went our way.When we returned to our room, we found a bouquet of flowers and a gift card to Elote from our daughters and son-in-law wishing us a happy anniversary. Spence had gone home by then, but confirmed his ruse the next morning. He had been at Elote as he said, but had been buying the gift card and had not had time to get it into our room with the flowers. He stopped us so we would benefit from the gift.Anyway, no pressure, Spence. Hope the cost of a nice review isn't that you are run ragged with such requests, or you will need to hire a concierge.Thank you, though.Got a room with a balcony overlooking the creek, which was so relaxing and beautiful. The balcony was also very private, and we could only see trees, the river, and the beautiful red rock around us. Additionally, the bathroom came with a huge jet tub. The owners are incredible kind and helpful, and I love that you can just walk into the kitchen at any hour of the day; there's even a special fridge for guests. There's also tons of boxes of tea and coffee free at anytime of the day or night. I've always been a backpacker/hostel traveler, but this place offered the comforts of a nice hotel, with the coziness, and family-like vibe of a hostel. Also, if you don't get a room with a balcony, no worries, there's a huge deck on the 1st floor. The location is also perfect. I would definitely stay here again. 100% recommend. Stayed in July 2014.My boyfriend and I stayed at the Inn for about 4-5 nights, and it was simply lovely.  Our room was decorated beautifully and was a comfortable/relaxing haven for us.  Outside our balcony were ducks and a breathtaking view of Oak Creek. The location was great- we were able to walk to nice restaurants and a shopping areas.  Uptown Sedona was also really close (a really short drive- a few minutes maybe).  All the hiking trails and other areas of interest (movie theater, etc.) were within an easy driving distance.  The warm hospitality of management (Chris and his staff) made us feel right at home.  As probably the youngest guests at the Inn, Chris made us feel very welcome and happy that we chose to stay at the Inn.  Also, they always have hot tea, coffee, and water for guests which is a huge plus! It's those small details that made our stay so comfortable.  Breakfast usually consisted of fruit, bagels, and sweet treats.  We absolutely loved our stay, and are already planning our next trip out to the Inn :)Beautiful B&B with view over the creek. Every room is themed. Very warm welcoming, breakfast was delicious with possibility to eat on the sunny deck. Mike was really nice and helpful to find a dinner place and the warm homemade chocolate cookies were fantastic! Really quiet and clean, I would definitely come back.When you visit this Inn, try the golf on the rocks! Big bed awesome creek view and nice continental breakfast serve in the morning free.Wife tells me to get off my lard ass and go to the gym.  My knee begs to differ.  Never heard of YELP until last month, now I am a postin fool.  The ol lady and I had a good time, No, I mean really good time, stayin in this place.  I thought the price was high until I saw our view.  The view meant the curtains stayed open.  Had to turn out the lights soon after arrival if you know what I mean.  Women eat this sh** up.  Spent two full days in the hot tub and got all shriveled.  Turned into a well tanned prune.  God what a view.  Seems like a lifetime ago.  Never been back except in my dreams.  Rode past on the way up the canyon last year and almost stopped in.  Only regret we hadn't reached Sedona a bit earlier or we may have stopped off before hittin Flagstaff.  The ride up the Canyon is just to good to miss at sunset.  Damn I love this place.Having experienced staying in each of the separately themed rooms, the best room -without a doubt- is the "Angler's Retreat".  It is the only room you can enjoy the view from inside the room. Although it has changed ownership, still appeared to be well managed. The only negative would be the small room size with limited storage capacities. This presented a problem for us due to our hiking gear & luggage space requirements when on extended trips.My friends stayed there, my husband and I went over to meet them had their breakfast - sitting outside on the deck, it was just beautiful.. Great service.. so was the coffee!

review_content: We booked our room via Groupon and had hoped for a bed and breakfast type cabin feel in the middle of nowhere out in Sedona. So, that is the only reason I did not rate the Lodge a 5...because it was strange to pull off one of the main roads in Sedona, pull through a church parking lot, and then into the gravel road/lot for the Lodge. That threw us off a bit. It was nice and quiet though and once we were in our room we felt like we were away from everyone else at least.But once you walk in through the entrance to the lobby/office area it feels much more rustic and homey. Our room was off the main dining room area, so that weirded us out a little bit. The room has a very cabin like feel with a fireplace and a big king bed with a quilt. But it looked a little bit more like a hotel room than a sort of bed and breakfast type room. We were pleasantly surprised by breakfast though! The chef makes gourmet meals each morning that differ from the day before. On our one and only morning stay we woke up to scrambled eggs with pesto, super super delicious breakfast potatoes with peppers, and then a blackberry bread pudding. I don't think we will stay again, but that's only because we are looking for more of a out away from the main road type spot.I am very very easy-going person, and generally do not give bad reviews if it seems like a place is at least trying to be nice. My husband booked us for a one-night stay based on the rave reviews... we had the Moonflower, which was a cute little room off the edge of the main lodge. The place is run-down, at least the grounds are. I understand that in November, you cannot expect lush vegetation and lots of flowers, but the grounds were unkempt, weedy, with lots of dead brush tossed over the hillside. The bench outside our room had a gorgeous view of the rocks, but it was covered with cobwebs and when you looked down you got a not-so-gorgeous view of a bunch of dead tree branches piled up and the back of a mobile-home looking structure and AC unit. Our room was cute, I will give it that. But there was a bowl of fruit left for us (nice, I thought) with a shriveled pear and a wrinkled apple. Ugh. The bed was saggy on my side, i felt like I was going to roll off. The pillows were ok, but a bit flat. The AC/heating unit clicked + whirred all night, keeping us both up. The next morning was very chilly so we thought we would grab some coffee from the main room and sit in our room by the cute little gas fireplace. The coffee was good, very good, but the gas fireplace was broken and wouldn't turn on. When we were given a tour of the place when we first arrived the young lady took us to a table and told us it was "off limits" and was only for the people that were there for the juice cleanse. Seemed kinda strange. I had read about the rock labyrinth and was excited about seeing it, but another disappointment there, it was weedy and looked unkempt, as was the rest of the backyard area. The fire pit had water standing in it and some cigarette butts floating in the water. The people running the place seemed so very nice, and I hate giving bad reviews for a place that seemed to have a lot of potential, but this "romantic" weekend wasn't so much of that with the price we paid for the room, we should have had a better experience.Secluded, private and gorgeous. Conveniently hidden behind Natural Groceries (a fabulous privately owned grocery store), there is no need to buy anything for breakfast because the complimentary meal you'll receive every morning is just out of this world. Fresh, organic, nutritious and delicious. This morning we feasted on a gluten free blueberry pudding and eggs made with basil butter. Prepared each morning by Devon, an amazing and imaginative Chef. I walked the Labyrinth each morning and then enjoyed a view of the mountains and the chirp of birds from my patio. The rooms are clean and rustic and the bed is so comfy with really nice sheets and down pillows. I didn't see or hear another soul until breakfast where you can meet your fellow travelers. So much more than I expected as the price is so darn reasonable.I usually steer clear from B&Bs, they just aren't for us. But a travelzoo came through my email we couldn't pass up. The Lodge was truly a neat place to stay. Below is the deets....Positives: Cozy, rustic rooms with all the amenities Private entrances Fireplace TV (hubby and I wanted one)Friendly serviceGood locationOutside seating, and labyrinth BREAKFAST! (Gourmet different breakfast each day - delicious!) Negatives:Not the best bedWish there was a cozy blanket to bring outside/on chairI felt like it was a romantic/luxury B&B. I am glad we stayed and would return!Really nice folks and super accommodating. Took a late night last-minute reservation, upgraded us to a suite without asking and left keys under the door mat for us. Nice clean accommodations. Would recommend to a friend.My husband and I spent my birthday at this place last year and there were several problems. First, I let them know in advance that I had food allergies and they reported that they would be accommodating. However, once we showed up I guess the kitchen didn't get the memo. There were NO substitutions, if you could not eat the cheesy potatoes (as an example) then you just didn't eat any potatoes.Second, each morning we were awakened by screaming, loud, children! No, not very romantic, as they claim. Third, check-out time is 11 am. If the place is truly a "luxury B & B" then it should be 12 noon. Staff wasn't particularly friendly or helpful, and there were no birthday wishes, no nothing. It felt like because we used a Groupon, we were basically treated like second-class citizens. We will not return.Stayed here with my husband for our anniversary. We only stayed one night, but I loved the place! It was more like a hotel than a B&B, which is what I thought we were getting.When we checked it, we got a quick (as in very fast) tour of the breakfast area, game/TV room and our room. Which was fine, I don't need to see the entire building.We stayed in the Whispering Wind room and it was very nice. We had a fireplace, flat screen TV and a pretty large jacuzzi tub. We also had our own private patio with a separate entrance so we could come and go without having to walk through the rest of the place.They had snacks out all afternoon, but we left to go shopping after we checked in, so we didn't get to taste any of them. Breakfast the next morning was good though. There was coffee, tea, hot chocolate and juice set up when we went in. Also yogurt and granola. We like the fact that we had from 8-9:30 to eat instead of having a set time to be in the dining room. Our server brought us some kiwi and grapes before bringing out breakfast. That was a souffle of eggs, spinach, mushrooms and goat cheese. Roasted potatoes and bacon served on the side. Good, however I wish you had a option to leave out ingredients if you don't want them. I'm not a fan of mushrooms at all, so I had to pick them out as I went.The only negative besides the breakfast option would have to be the shower. It took absolutely forever for the water to heat up, and while I was in the shower, it kept going from freezing cold to scalding hot. That was the quickest shower I think I've ever taken. I couldn't deal with the constantly changing temperatures!All in all it was a good stay and I would go again. Nice place, nice people, clean rooms and good food. It's also close to the shopping in uptown Sedona and Tlaquepaqe - those are just a short drive away.WOW. I experienced nothing less than blatant false advertising with the Lodge at Sedona. I have had experiences with unsatisfactory service or products in the past but never to this extent. In fact, I have never felt compelled to write a bad review for any business until what this one did to me.In a nutshell:***I purchased a three-night king suite package (Travelzoo.com voucher). They placed my husband and me in a tiny room for two nights and finally, after expressing several times that that was not what I had purchased, they offered to "upgrade" us to a king suite. In addition, they charged my card a "resort fee" of $137.40. The Travelzoo.com advertisement for the voucher DOES indicate a 10% resort fee will be charged. Upon agreeing to these conditions when purchasing the voucher, I assumed it was 10% of what I was paying (10% of $439). I still don't know how they calculated $137.40 ($93 extra). Even if this is based on their standard rates, according to their web site, that would be a total of $777 so they still overcharged me about $60.***This was such a disappointing experience because it was our first time to beautiful Sedona. My husband and I have two kids and rarely get one-on-one time so we had to make a lot of arrangements to make this happen and I did a lot of research on accommodations so we could make the most of our little getaway. There are so many amazing places to stay in Sedona. I'm so bummed I got scammed by this place and missed out on the other gems in the area. When I saw the voucher on-line, I called the Lodge at Sedona to ask about the deal and the king suites. The woman I spoke to had me sold with such an amazing description of these beautiful, spacious suites with fireplaces. When we arrived to the hotel, the key was left for us since there is no one at the front desk after 6pm. To our surprise and disappointment, we were stuck in a small room--just to give you an idea, the bathroom sink is a few steps away from the bed. In the morning, I spoke to the woman at the front desk about it. She didn't know how to handle the situation so she asked me to come back when the next woman's shift started. I did and she said all the suites were occupied and explained that the room we had was appropriate for the package we purchased because it had a king bed in it. I showed her the voucher and how it stated the following: "3 nights accommodation for 2 people in a King suite" and reminded her of how the suites are described on their web site and how they were described to me over the phone when I called to ask about the deal. She apologized, implied it was Travelzoo.com's fault (which it was not), and said all the suites were booked so I should speak to the manager once she was in the following day. We left the manager a voice mail and she came to our room the following day to apologize and offered to "upgrade" us to a king suite! I don't understand how you can be upgraded to a room that you reserved and paid for in advance. So, we got to spend the very last night in the suite and then had to check out the next day at 11am. Enormous disappointment.Very disappointed. Compared to Castle in the Country in Allegan, MI, this B and B falls short of its Select Registry status. My wife and I found this place on Select Registry's website. Due to our stay at the excellent B and B Castle in the Country (a Select Registry B and B), we had high expectations for the Lodge at Sedona. It's cleanliness and service is comparable to a small Best Western or any low budget hotel.Save your money and time and either find a low budget hotel or find another B and BI had always wanted to stay at a bed and breakfast, and this B&B was everything I wanted and more. The staff is so friendly and helpful. The amenities are great. The breakfast was delicious. And the surrounding area was beautiful.I booked the room through their website for the 4th of July weekend. Their rooms are all discounted for Sunday through Thursday nights. So we stayed there on Sunday for $99 in the Sky Dance room. It was the best deal I could find at any bed and breakfast in the area.We were driving down from Las Vegas when we realized that we wouldn't make it in time for the time we said we'd check in. The lady I spoke to was so kind and told me that it was no problem: she would just leave the keys and welcome back at the front door for me. And sure enough when we got there, our keys were waiting with detailed instructions about how to get to our room and information about the lodge.Our room was quaint and simple. I loved the earthy and homey decor. It's unfortunate that we only got to stay there for one night.In the morning we were served breakfast, which was freshly prepared right in the kitchen in front of our eyes. It was so fresh and delicious - better than any hotel breakfast you can get. I would love to stay at the Lodge again. Exploring Sedona was one of the most memorable vacations my boyfriend and I had. I hope we get to visit again!Anticlimatic stay. Price is not indicative of the [lack of] quality of the Inn, the [lackluster] customer service, or the premises. Non-existent check-out procedure. Guests pay the inkeeper for the complete stay just as they arrive. I find this quite distasteful.I flew into Sedona for my Solar Return birthday and decided to stay here. I had the StarGazer room. It was so cute! It had a huge jacuzzi tub that I liberally used. It also had an outdoor shower, but it was a little too cold at night for me to use it. Maybe next time :)All the innkeepers and the chefs were really nice and friendly.Of course since this is a bed and breakfast, you get breakfast in the morning. The first morning I was served a scrambled egg with chives, 1/2 pumpernickel bagel with this fantastic sun-dried tomato spread and a 1/2 dollar-size salmon patty. Okay, there is all the tea, coffee,granola & yogurt you can eat, but I need more than 1egg, 1/2 bagel and a 1/2 dollar-size salmon patty. I heard some woman behind me saying, "Oh wow, I can't possibly eat all of this!" Really?? I asked for another plate. The waitress/innkeeper was really nice and said it was no problem, but they were portioning the salmon and had to give me sausage instead. Fine. I think I would have been fine with just 1 whole bagel, 2 eggs and 2 of those 1/2 dollar-size salmon patties. But, service was great and the chef apologized for not having enough.The second morning I was served an english muffin, split and topped with two poached eggs, chorizo crumbles and hollandaise. It was delicious but why not a side of sweet potato hash or something?I guess my Texas-sized appetite is not something they usually get here.My room had fantastic views of the mountains. All in all, it was exactly what I wanted - some peace & quiet me time to reflect on my new year.I would definitely recommend this place. But, if you have more than a "spa" appetite, expect to go get a brunch on 89A after you have breakfast here. :)Loved this place! We stayed here the weekend of March 18th for our first anniversary. Getting into town traffic was painfully slow and we worried we would not be able to get to Elote (restaurant) if we stopped to check in at the The Lodge. We called ahead and were assured that our keys would be waiting for us whenever we did actually arrive.The room was super nice! No complaints at all! The breakfast served was great and the staff made accomodations for us to have breakfast in our room as it was our anniversary. We would definately stay here again!We arrived late in the evening, and Linda waited for us and welcomed us as though we were best friends. She shoed us around the grounds and the city map of Sedona. Then escorted us to our room, the Moonflower. The premises were sooo clean, and had many fine little touches to make it like home. Great place for spiritual, retreats, or just a quiet getaway. Definitely will recommend and hope we have another opportunity to return.Sorry to ruin the average here... but maybe it would have been higher if they actually let us in to stay there... we showed up with our baby daughter and were turned away after we drove all the way up there & had reservs bc they don't allow kids. They told us it says so on the website but obviously not prominently enough since we didn't see it when we booked. Later, we want on to check and it does say it in super fine print - easily missable. Didn't help that the old lady at reception referred to my baby -as "it"!!! Blessing in disguise though bc we ended up at L'auberge where you can live, breathe and revel in your offspring freely!God bless America!Our first visit to Sedona was wonderful! The lodge was warm, relaxing, comfy and accomodating. We are not usually B&B people but this was all changed by the Lodge and the staff. Sedona itself was just what the Dr. ordered for relaxing and decompressing from work and recent travel. The Lodge made it extra special. We will return!We chose to come here for one night for our first year anniversary this past December.Overall, it was a wonderful experience.Our room was cozy (although this is NOT a very handicap friendly location, just so you know). It was a bit chilly, so the mini-stove in our room was welcome. It was a bit small, but had a lovely window seat, and the theme of "Dreamcatcher" made it all the more endearing. The bed was very comfy, and I loved the little journal that guests have written in throughout the years.The snacks and apple cider in the lobby were welcoming, and we really enjoyed getting to walk the labyrinth together. The grounds were beautiful, with lots of lovely little nooks to hang out, cuddle, and connect with nature. My one issue was that both on the phone and upon check in, they asked about special dietary requirments. Both times, I explained that I was a vegetarian who didn't eat eggs or gelatin. However, at breakfast, the choices were meat, eggs, a muffin and/or yogurt (which usually has gelatin). So while my partner loved her breakfast, all I had was a muffin. This wouldn't have bothered me so much except that they'd clearly made such a big deal of asking me my preference that I had expectations that were not met.We had a lovely time and hope to get to come back to visit (but I'll remember to bring granola bars for breakfast this time).Great place, from beginning to end. Very warm and friendly staff. Breakfast and snacks were amazing along with the atmosphere. The king / jacuzzi suite we had was very clean (First time we stayed at a hotel and didn't take the comforter off the bed)...Very nice decorations and detail, not like a cheap carbon copy room at a hotel. All in all, very comfortable, quiet, private bed and breakfast with great food, facilities and atmosphere.This review is a little delayed but better late than never. My husband and I stayed here to celebrate his birthday in August 2010. Before then, we had little experience with B&B's and weren't quite sure what to expect. Upon our arrival, the owner was warm, welcoming and kind. There was even a birthday card and treat in our room after we checked in. Our room was cozy, comfortable and wonderful. We were disappointed it was too warm outside to take advantage of the fireplace! Our private patio was perfect for star gazing. Breakfast was delicious. No continental, donuts and cereal meal here. Homemade, unique and a great way to start a busy day in Sedona. We will absolutely stay at The Lodge again when we return to Sedona.Had a short weekend getaway at the Lodge at Sedona to escape from the Phoenix heat. This is hands-down my new favorite Bed & Breakfast in Sedona! All of the staff was very kind and welcoming. I took my dog and he was spoiled too! They gave him a goodie bag when we arrived, he had a bed and towels in the room as well. When we went to breakfast in the morning they gave him special dog-friendly scrambled eggs and a treat that the chef brought out herself. For those of you who are not dog owners, not to worry, they put those of us with furry friends on the opposite side of the property so you won't hear or see them. It really was an amazing time from start to finish. The room was very cute and had nice views. You also felt like you were set back out of the way a bit, yet it was very convenient to restaurants, store, and so on. The staff was awesome the whole time, breakfast was awesome, the ambiance was perfect. I have stayed in Sedona well over a dozen times and I would recommend this B&B over any others I've ever been to. :)
review_content_20: I was in Sedona on business and stayed at The Lodge during the week.So where do I even start? The lodge features are reasonably priced the service here are impeccable. The snack bar eating was some of the most healthful, yet delicious, fare around, and by walking outside to my car, I was greeted by staff and asked if I needed anything. They refer me for dinner reservations great Italian 1/2 mile down the street, and generally met any request I had. Though I did not take advantage of it, other services include in-room massages and bodywork. In short, this is the closest I think I will ever come to Heaven on Earth. Whether or not you believe that Sedona is a mystical place (I certainly do), you cannot deny that it has a calming effect, and The Lodge exemplifies this. I highly, highly recommend The Lodge for any type of getaway.Internet/Wi-Fi is available, and the staff is great and alway made eye contact and went out of way to aways welcome you and offer their assistance.This is the type of place you would love to like, but it is just plain weird. Not only is it a Bed and Breakfast, it is also a healing retreat of some sort. This is not advertised or mentioned in any of their online information, but a good number of the guests were at the Lodge for health issues. How do I know this??? Imagine sitting down for a glass of wine in the afternoon and not being able to avoid hearing a consultation between a patient and "doctor" discussing various health issues. Or imagine reading the newspaper in the great room, and listening to another patient discuss their health issues with an employee of the Lodge. . I don't know about you, but my idea of getting away is not to hear other people's problems and ailments. Thankfully we had plans for hiking, rafting, etc. and didn't have to hear this all day long. One gentleman wore his pajamas all the time, and although he was there to heal, he enjoyed a cigarette on the deck where we were having breakfast.
