I also requested an early morning breakfast before we went rafting. I felt as if this was not something they were happy to do. Once we arrived and understood the full experience offered to the patients, I was really irritated. There is someone making them food, juice cleanses, etc. on a continual basis. Sedona itself is majestic, and the wildflowers were beautiful. The Lodge at Sedona was creepy!Very overpriced and false advertisement! The food is okay nothing special and the room was way to hot! It was hard to sleep. I don't recommend staying here in the summer because they are not able to keep the rooms clean. I highly suggest staying somewhere else.The double B (B&B - duh!) usually evokes images of old-fashioned hospitality, pink rooms with quilted bed-covers and flowery wallpaper, a ever chatting host and weird, uncomfortable breakfast around the communal table.The Lodge doesn't fall in that category.Our friends had the wonderful idea of offering us a gift certificate from bedandbreakfast.com for our wedding last year. We waited, and waited and when we decided to take our trip to Arizona, I knew it was the perfect occasion to use it.Sedona sounded like the perfect location for a much belated honeymoon.The Lodge immediately stood out.The propriety is large and stands on more than 2 acres of beautiful gardens dominated by pine trees. The landscaping is just impressive. And the inn itself is built in a very elegant Arts&Craft style - warm and welcoming.Very B&B - but in the best of ways.Our room was detached and had a beautiful private balcony with Adirondack chairs. The Prairie Ranch Suite has all the amenities you can dream about - and a wonderful jet tub.....that I highly recommend after a long day of hiking....Comfortable bed, nice bath products, a fireplace, free wifi, TV, stereo....you name it.As for breakfast - you are free to enjoy it at your own table. The outside patio is an ideal place for it. Generous portions; the food itself is quite forgettable but it does a good job of charging your batteries to face a Red Rock day.Check out their website for specials, and do make your reservation in advance since they seem to be quite busy.A very nice place to unwind and enjoy life....the only drawback is that Sedona makes it hard to enjoy it to its fullest....when you are there you just don't want to stay in your room but go out and walk, ride and marvel!!My husband and I stayed here for 3 nights and really enjoyed the room, the grounds, and the friendliness of the staff. We would definitely stay here again. The breakfasts were tasty and quite healthy. The only reason I don't give The Lodge 5 stars is that we were expecting access to a pool and fitness center (based on their website) and when we arrived found out that there was no longer access to those facilities. Otherwise a great stay!Loved this place. The rooms were clean, comfortable, and beautifully decorated. Every morning, we walked downstairs and were treated to an amazing gourmet breakfast (example: chorizo eggs benedict with poached pears on the side). Then, around 5, hor dourves are set out. After dinner, hubby and I would return to the Lodge and play board games they provide downstairs. The staff could not have been more friendly or helpful. Everyday, someone would ask us where we went, what we did, etc. One night, while I was waiting for hubby to come downstairs, the manager asked if I needed the fireplace lit to keep me warm. They even have a basket with actual menus from nearby restaurants. When we returned from a pizza joint with one of the menus to add to the mix, the manager explained that a menu from that restaurant had not been included because they only carried menus from restaurants from which they get "consistent" good reviews. In other words, they weren't about to clutter the basket with menus from random places - they wouldn't want their guests to be disappointed. How thoughtful is that??? Yes, L'Auberge may be more luxurious, and Enchantment might be swankier. However, you can't beat the price at The Lodge or the warm hospitality.I'm currently a "local" so I've never stayed here, BUT if you enjoy walking labyrinths, and I do, The Lodge at Sedona is home to the nicest one in Sedona. There is a little parking area at the back of the property right beside the labyrinth, so access is easy. The labyrinth is well maintained and has a nice energy about it. The only drawback is that a newer residential area is close by and I've been there on afternoons that house construction noises have made the experience less than peaceful. This is the best kept secret in Sedona!Where do I even start? My husband and I got married here, and stayed for our honeymoon. It is our dream to return for a vacation, sans kids, and for maybe a whole week instead of a couple of days. Actually, it's our dream to live here. But I don't think the owners would like it, given we come with a teenager, a baby, and seven cats. :-)The Lodge features a reasonably priced wedding package that includes a wedding officiate, a bouquet for the bride and a boutonniere for the groom, a wedding photographer, a gift certificate for Rene's at Tlaquepaque, a gourmet breakfast, and one night's accomodations. I loved, loved, loved our minister, Margaret Van Damme! We are not a traditional couple, spiritually or otherwise, and we were so happy to find someone who "got" us in just a couple of phone conversations and emails. She wrote the most beautiful, touching vows for us that I tear up just thinking about them. I did tear up during the ceremony, as a matter of fact, and Margaret saved me by reading something that I was supposed to read, while making it look like it was part of the ceremony. She's a seasoned professional for sure.Our flowers were also beautiful, very simple and elegant. The photographer was awesome, and really worked with us to get some great shots that utilized the striking beauty of the red rocks and Arizona sunset. We chose the labyrinth for our wedding rather than the Celebration Terrace, but either location is visually stunning. We had two different rooms as the one we initially wanted was booked for the first night of our stay. The first room, the Meadow Breeze, was very comfortable and featured a private patio. The bed in that room was unbelievably lush and for the first time in months, I woke up without a backache. The jetted tub for two was perfect for a newlywed couple and had space for candles on the sides. The second room we stayed in, the Mission Grande, was larger and a little more luxe than the Meadow Breeze. It had a fireplace, and a private, outdoor hot tub with the most amazing view of the mountains I have ever seen. There is also a private entrance and we got our own parking space. The bathroom is much more spacious in here; the tub, while large enough for just one, is jetted, the vanity has two sinks, and I seem to recall there being a bidet too (all of the bathrooms feature Lodge lotions and soaps, BTW, which are delicious and natural). Both rooms had mini-fridges. Right after we left, The Lodge opened up another suite that took the best of the Mission Grande and Meadow Breeze and put them together; I am still happy with what we had, however, as the view from the new room cannot possibly beat the Mission Grande. Service here is impeccable. Whether we were at the snack bar eating some of the most healthful, yet delicious, fare around, or just walking out to our car, we were greeted by staff and asked if we needed anything. They took care of dinner reservations and generally met any request we had. Though we did not take advantage of it, other services include in-room massages and bodywork. Internet/WiFi is available, and you can also arrange for flowers/balloons/gift baskets to be waiting in your room. In short, this is the closest I think I will ever come to living Heaven on Earth. Whether or not you believe that Sedona is a mystical place (I certainly do), you cannot deny that it has a calming effect, and The Lodge exemplifies this. I highly, highly recommend The Lodge, not just for a wedding, but for any type of getaway.

review_content: This is a great budget hotel. I was concerned at first when I made the reservation because there was no confirmation number, etc. However, the room was just as we reserved it and there was no problem with check in.The hotel is in a great location and the rooms were older but nice. We had a small refrigerator in the room and the water pressure in the shower was great. This was the quietest hotel we stayed in on our whole trip!There is a pool and hot tub which are great in the evening.There was good wifi and a comfortable bed. Overall a great place to stay and much more affordable than any other options in Sedona!Read about this place in a guide book a few weeks back and made a mental note. Husband and I were taking a road trip to Sedona and we rarely make reservations in case we decide to be spontaneous and do something else. On our way into the town, we passed by Sugar Loaf and decided to see if they had a room available for 2 nights. They did. John the owner was very friendly and made check in a breeze. Even though it was early in the day, we were able to get our stuff in the room before we hit the hiking trails. Room was outstanding for a motel/lodge. Very clean. We had a king bed that was very comfortable and lots of pillows. There was also fridge and microwave, hair dryer and an iron. More than anticipated for a motel. Would stay here again. Price was perfect under $100 since we spent most of our time on the trails and not the room.Went to Sedona without making any hotel reservation... duh.... :-) while there i jumped on my iPad and searched hotels and rates and there were nothing available or everything over $250. We drove around and found Sugar Loaf off the road. Looks very 60s, but when you are desperate for a room, you gotta take what you can. We got lucky! it was the very last room availabile.the room was right in front and the entrance was a sliding glass door and we parked our car right outside the glass door. it has all the neccesities and it was comfortable. we just needed the room for sleep - left the next day for scottsday.Rate $89! you cant beat that in sedona at peak season. wondered why the place didn't charge over $100/night - we would have paid for it. This place is centrally located to everything. it was quiet. one funny thing we experienced was the front desk guy went into the room before we got in there with gloves and a spray bottle of disinfectant :-) again, the room was comfortable. had iron, blow dryer, shower, tv, refrigerator, and comfy bed.Great place, I highly recommend this small place to anyone looking to stay in Sedona on a budget.The nearby hiking trails are fun as well as challenging. The room is small but it is very cozy, the beds are soft and the Wi-Fi is high speed.The location is close to anything you would need, Walgreens, various grocery stores, health food stores.Great experience all around.To the people that complained, I am so sorry that they didn't have HD TV. Maybe you missed the sign out front that DID NOT say Hilton Executive Hotel of the Gods.We had stayed in several different places in Sedona, but this place is my now my favorite.It is a smaller hotel and right on 89a. You can pull right up to the room! No schlepping your stuff across the parking lot and up stairs or down long hallways.It is very quaint. The check-in area is surprisingly small. There is literally only enough room to stand right inside the sliding door in front of the counter. If there is someone else in there ahead of you, you will have to wait outside.The room was clean and neat when we checked in and nicely appointed. I like that fact that they had blue towels instead of the boring hotel white or beige. Rooms come with a fridge, microwave, hair dryer, iron and board, but no alarm clock. Wifi was fast, and the room had flat screen TV with cable. A/C worked well and was not very loud. The sink is outside the shower/bath area. There is no fan or window in the bath room. Inexpensive for Sedona. I will definitely stay again.This was a nice inexpensive hotel. Not a lot to look at from the outside but the room was clean and had everything we needed. Although our reservation confirmation said breakfast was not included it was. The wi-fi was great. The pool and jacuzzi were welcome at the end of the day. The gentleman who worked in the office was very friendly and helpful with the questions we had. We would absolutely stay here again.I travel ALL the time for work, and have stayed in all sorts of places all across the country and beyond. I hadn't set my expectations high for the Sugar Loaf Lodge, but they were definitely exceeded. It is NOT fancy, but the price is amazing for the area and our room was clean and had everything we needed - including a fridge and microwave- and free wifi! Be warned - the beds are really soft.There are few times when my (& my wife's) expectations are utterly exceeded. This was the case at Sugar Loaf. We made same-day (off-season in November) reservations on our way south from Grand Canyon. Our intention was to find a simple place to crash for the night and then be on our way. Well, one night turned into 3! Sedona is a natural wonderland for those looking to get outside and connect with Mother Earth. Sugar Loaf positions you perfectly to get out and about. When it was time to come back for rest, the beds were very comfortable. As others have noted, there is an extremely friendly woman running the place. The rooms are clean, come with plenty of space and nice amenities such as free WI-FI (good too!), a microwave and refrigerator. The BEST bonus was the pool/hot tub and surrounding area. We asked to use the cute fireplace by the pool and even roasted a few marshmallows. There was a large & new-looking gas grill available as well.In short, this place made us feel at home and I'd love to visit again some day. If you are looking for a no-frills spot with a lot of extra charm, you can't possibly do better!Very accommodating hotel in a great area. Surrounded by beauty and wonderful local restaurants. We showed up early after our plans were cut short and the manager was able to let us into our room right away. It was such a nice surprise and we rejoiced to see such a welcome environment. The rooms are quaint and fit 4 people without it being cramped. The beds are probably the best hotel beds I've been in. Practically melted right into the sheets and comforter, which were also so soft and warm. The ac is a nice way to cool down from the hot Sedona sun, as it gets quite cool in the room. The bath towels were different from the usual droll white hotel towels and the shower head ran steady and hot. Pool was beautiful and the hot tub was scorching. All this for quite a great price of $100 for four people. Great little lodge in a great town.We went through booking.com and got a decent rate for a rather large king bedroom. We had a hospitable experience with the check-in desk where he not only made us feel welcome by explaining what makes Sedona great, but he also gave us great restaurant recommendations. The a/c was up to par and the pool is open late so that was super convenient. The breakfast was nothing to brag about and the room itself is due for sone rennovations so thats why Im not going to go for the full 5 stars, but overall I wish we could've stayed more than 1 night!An incredible deal for the money - clean, cheap digs with soft beds, a nice bathroom, and even a mini fridge! The location is great - close to a wonderful the health food store, coffee shop and Oak Creek Brewery locations (with Simon's Hot Dogs!). Sedona has so many super expensive hotels and crappy cheap ones - this is the perfect alternative to both. We didn't get a chance to try out the hot tub or pool, but they looked really inviting. Looking forward to staying here again.I'm not going to tell you how awesome this little motel is. I won't tell you that the beds are really comfy. I also won't tell you how convenient the location is. You definitely won't hear me tell you how friendly and accommodating the woman at the front desk is. Or how the rooms are really quaint and clean and close to the parking lot. Or how there's a mini fridge in each room, and tv and little soaps and stuff in the bathroom. I won't tell you any of these things because it's so inexpensive to stay here and if I come in town and find that all the rooms are booked because I told too many people, I'mma be pissed!Too bad I can't do less than 1 star. I should have known this was going to be trouble from the "hello"; which by the way the kindest thing Jerry said to me. Although the room was clean, the bathroom shower head could use a bit of scrubbing. The TV was NOT HD and shoddy reception. When I checked into the room, I asked about places to eat and if he knew where the Wyndam Hotel was. He grunted out some sort of response having to do with spending too much on coffee and he doesn't do timeshares. I told crabby pants Jerry that I had my little 5 lb dog with us. He gave me the key and sent me on my way. We literally spent about 6 hours total in the room as we spent time in Downtown (with our dog) and at the Wyndam (also with our dog) visiting my friends who were also in town from Vegas. When we checked out, again Jerry grunted something about the weather and off we went.We stopped on the way home for a bite to eat (next review) and I noticed a missed call from the Lodge. I listened to my voicemail and he was rattling on about how we violated policy by having a dog and he was going to charge my credit card a cleaning fee. OH HELL NO! I told Crabby pants when we arrived that we had her with us. I immediately contacted my credit card company to dispute any additional charges. In the morning we found out that he tried to charge $50 and then tried to charge $25. Luckily I had already called to dispute them so they did not process. When we called him to discuss he was nasty rude on the phone and hung up on us. I wonder how many other people he has done this to and they just went ahead and paid the fee or they never noticed it on their credit card statements. BEWARE! This man is a con artist and a Shyster! Check your cc statements and make sure you were not charged for something extra.We certainly will NOT be back!I love this place.1. This place is not only clean, but updated. our walls look like it's been freshly painted the season before, and our rooms were equipped with a newly-renovated looking bathroom. The lighting is bright and adjustable.2. Affordable. Where other lodging options would have cost us $100+ a night for far less value, this place granted as a super soft comfy King (and a single bed in our room; good for a family of 3), with legit HD TV and a micro fridge + microwave.3. Convenient. It has a lot of affordable dining options around the neighborhood and we were even able to do our laundry just a block away.It's definitely no-frills type place, but it's clean, it's quiet, it has a fridge and microwave AND free in-room wifi (which, after staying in several casino hotels that don't offer either, seems like HEAVEN), and the hot tub was definitely a plus. It's not fancy, and for penny-pinching, just-need-a-place-to-crash road trippers like us, it's definitely a lovely oasis.You want lotions and 20 different kinds of coffee served; go next door to the Hampton Inn which I'm sure you'll be pleased with the free maxi pads and tampons available for guests in the lobby restroom. This spot just isn't that.WILL definitely return.It took me all day to book a room at this motel. I called about 8 times before I finally got a hold of a (very) crabby person who stated they had people waiting and would have to call me back (and quickly hung up the phone). I never received a phone call back so I called another 4 times before I was able to book a room. For the price of 65$ a night I can get past a crabby owner. Other than that- great location- tv, mini fridge, free coffee & comfortable beds. If you don't need all the bells and whistles this is a great place to stay in sedona.There's nothing charming about this little hotel, but it is pleasantly clean and bright. We had a very comfortable bed, we appreciated being able to freeze our water bottles overnight in the mini fridge, and we were pleasantly surprised by the variety of breakfast snacks: yogurts, granola bars, juice boxes and muffins. After returning from a dawn hike, it was just what we needed.Looks like "The Loaf" has renovated their rooms! For those reviewers knocking the place, I guess you are used to staying at the Ritz Carltons of the world. While having been there, done that, I go to Sedona to hike, swim, relax, shop, have some 4x4 adventures, and experience the outdoors. The idea of laying around some luxury resort doesn't appeal to me whatsoever, so now you know where I'm coming from. Rooms are clean, spacious, and have all the amenities you'd expect in a modern establishment- wi fi, microwave, HDTV, fridge, coffee maker, blow dryer, ironing board, etc. There's even a gas barbeque out at the pool. Located nearby supermarkets and dining choices, it's in a great location as well. While almost everything in Sedona is overpriced, this remains a great bargain and now, it's even new & improved!Exactly what we wanted and needed. Cheap, clean, quiet, all the amenities we could possibly need. I stayed here with three friends when we stopped though Sedona on a road trip. Close to shops and restaurants and the hot tub was exactly what we needed after a very long day of travel!found this place on yelp and we were pretty pleasedTwo queen beds, round table with three chairs, two lamps, microwave , fridge, iron and board... No coffee maker,iron & board,bathroom had a nice tile counter, but not too many bath products, maybe one conditioning shampoo and two soap bars. One of those heating lights in the bathroom, mmmpool and hot tub looked great but we didnt get to use it, got in too late, but the gate was unlocked so we did go in and check it out.close enough to DT sedonna. Lady at the counter was very nice each time we called.there is breakfast, available, but it is just some oj pastries yogurt maybe fruit etc set on the counter in their very small office. We grabbed a couple pastries and a yogurt for the road.overall, we were pretty happy with this place and the price.Check out the sugar loaf... Jerry is a super cool guy... If you are in sedona looking for a good deal....Here it is...
review_content_20: Whether you're a traveling student or simply looking for a low-budget place to crash in Sedona, this place is THE place to stay.Homier touches, such as the furniture and comforter make you feel a little more comfortable than you would at say, a Motel 6.Quick, clean, easy. Stayed here purely off Yelp recommendations like that other gal did, and everything turned out great. *For the record, I'm not sure whether due to Yelp criticisms or not, there is now complementary shampoo and soap. :DPlease know that I am giving this place five stars based on its category. It is not a fancy hotel. It is a decent hotel which most valuable service is that they accept pets. It is clean and the owners are delightful. Also they let you use their bikes for free. SO NICE!It's tough to find a clean quality room for this price especially in such a convenient location. For the price, you can't beat this place.Question: Were all my fellow yelpers high on peyote when they reviewed this place? From the moment my gf and I drove up to this hellhole I was worried.First the lady who runs the place tried to have us take a room that had a patio door that faced the main street. The door was not at all safe looking. Once my gf and I decided that, that would not work for us, we were taken to another crappy room. This room reeked of piss and something else that I could not identify. The room was clean, so that was a plus. The towels however looked like they had been once used at a dog grooming joint. Other annoying stuff included spotty Wi-Fi, a leaky toilet that got clogged, nasty hair in the bathtub drainer, and my favorite: shower water that went from super cold to super hot. I seriously hated this place.Bates Hotel Spoiler Alert! Stay ONLY if desperate.I can't believe anyone would give this place a 4 star rating!!!  WOW! You need to get out more.  Anyway, this awful little hideaway should continue to be hid away for the horrible service, first just get someone to answer the phone I had to call 5 times attempting to actually get to the hotel.  Then once there, the "gent" at the front desk was rude and lifeless (I guess I would be too if I had to work there) and couldn't care less if we stayed the 3 nights.   Not a good sign.  Once I got a glance at the rooms, we high-tailed it outa there!We stayed here on pure yelp recommendation, and their rates were far cheaper than any hotel in Sedona.  This place truly is a special spot.  Away from the Disneyland that has become Sedona's main street, and away from the mass amount of construction goings on hwy 179.  We stayed in one of the two main front rooms, which had a micro and a fridge, which was great.  Also, there is free wi-fi, so when we were researching our hiking trails for the next morning we were set.They also have a jacuzzi and pool in the rear, where you can star gaze and relax after a long hike.  It's soo quiet and peaceful.  The staff is very friendly and they provide much needed hiking fuel every morning, OJ, coffee, granola bars, fruit, etc.  With such a great price and fine location, Sugar Loaf is the place to stay while in Sedona.why would you stay anywhere else? Seriously? I refuse to overpay for anything and this was TOTALLY worth it!! it got the job done and did it great, bed was comfy and so was the hot tub! Loved it here. if you want a no frills place to stay in the middle of everything for a reasonable price stay here!! The staff was also super nice!This is, by far, my favorite place to stay in Sedona.  I'm almost hesitant to review it for fear of revealing my secret haven to the world.  I've tried many hotels/motels in the region and nearly all of them rape you.  I hike all damn day and prefer cheap, unpretentious, quality lodging.  "The Sugar Load," as my friends and I call it (and as I often mistype on my laptop's keyboard), is family-run, small, humble, cute and within walking distance to a grocery store, 24-hour convenience store, clothing outlet, thrift store, food options, a drugstore with booze and an amazing Indian restaurant.  It's right in the center of Sedona so all the good hiking trails in Sedona and Oak Creek are within easy driving distance.  Rooms are clean and spacious and have microwaves, refrigerators and free wi-fi, in addition to a "Teaching of Buddha" book placed on top of the Gideon-placed Bible in the nightstand.  So appropriate.  The pool and jacuzzi are clean and a perfect end to a day of balls-out hiking.  I am going to wake up hungover and married in Vegas to the heat lamps in the bathrooms someday, they're that good.  In the morning, there's also free granola bars, juice, coffee, yogurt and fruit in the tiny front desk area.  Adorable.Sure, I dream of staying at the Enchantment, but the cost of one night there could buy me a 10-day stay at The Sugar Load.  I've stayed here more than 10 times and will continue to rock this place in the future.Jerry at the front desk is the sweetest and the best, by the way!Convenient no thrills place.  Clean and comfy.  No complaints.  If you're looking for things like internet or gym, this ain't your joint.I stayed here my first time in Sedona. I was on a budget, and thanks to my yelpers I found this place. It was definitely do able for me. If you're on a budget, go for it! It is a little 70's ish, but it does not smell. I love that they have a POOL and JACUZZI. It's like you have your own bungalow. Your car can be parked in the front of your door. I particularly liked that. I will stay here again. Don't expect luxury, expect comfort. Also, It is a lot closer to downtown. It's maybe a 2 mile drive.My husband and I stay at the Sugar Loaf Lodge almost every time we go to Sedona. It is homey and quaint. The furnishings are dated, but it is clean, with a pool and hot tub to boot. If you want hi-flautin this is not the place for you. If you want value and cleanliness, you are at the right place.Great place- especially considering the price.  Nice people work there too.  It was very quiet and a great night's sleep.  By far, the best priced place in the area.Recently stayed at the Sugar Loaf Lodge in Sedona. Reasonable rates for the area - rooms were $60 + tax in September. Clean, well appointed (with fridge & microwave) and quiet, the furniture is not 30 years old as you often find in similar lodgings. The owner/manager was helpful and friendly. The rate included a basic breakfast (pastries, granola bars, yogurt, v8 & orange juice, coffee & tea etc) in the tiny office that you could take back to your room. Swimming pool, jacuzzi, the Sugar Loaf was an all round good deal - I highly recommend it.We concur.  See below.Super clean fun motel with Big TV and nice bed and bathroom. Unbelievable value in overpriced Sedona.

review_content: We have been here twice now. The first time was with my in-laws and we stayed in cabin 17. This cabin was a cute A-frame two-story cabin that was secluded from the others and set back on the property. We had a beautiful view of the Oak Creek from our patio. There was a grill on the patio, an oven/mini fridge inside, and a spiral staircase leading upstairs to the loft.The second time was for our five year anniversary. We stayed in cabin 19 this time. It was cozy and spacious with a Jacuzzi tub. My favorite part of this place is that it is directly on the Oak Creek. Exit out of the cabin, walk down some steps, and BAM. You are at the Oak Creek. I love playing in the water, trying to find fishies, and just general relaxation on the rocks. If you don't want to be on the actual creek, there are several places near the creek to relax and enjoy the view. My second favorite part is the koi pond. I love feeding them! They are located right outside the front office. Overall, it's a great place for a mini vacation - whether it's for an anniversary, a get together, or just a quick spur of the moment vacation. Since it's off the beaten path, you can really relax and unwind here. If you want to go into town, it's just a short drive away. It's a great location!Definitely will be back. Love how close to the creek it is, and the in room fireplace and Jacuzzi were amazing. The staff are super friendly and honest. I accidentally left my new age cards in the room and they mailed them to me. Love this place.My Husband and I decided to plan our destination wedding here at Oak Creek Terrace Resort. We wanted a small intimate affair with our closest family and friends. Oak Creek Terrace rents their gazebo for a nominal fee for about 4 hours of use. We planned this out and ended up having the most exquisite creekside wedding. Our wedding party and guest couldn't keep the tears from flowing it was simply the most beautiful wedding any bride could dream up. The pictures down by the creek with the bridal party are gorgeous and unique. Besides the wedding we had about 8 different rooms throughout the property and everyone of them had their very own charm. All of my guests loved being on the property and claimed to leave feeling rejuvenated... of, course that's partly due to the said beauty of being near all the amazing energy in Sedona... but I say Oak Creek Terrace Resort is itself a hidden Vortex that you have to be staying at as a guest to truly discover all its power. I'll be back again many times in my future.Oak Creek Terrace is a quiet resort  with a beautiful  view.  surrou ded by the majestic  mountains and the calming babble of the oak creek.We started with room 12 where we had an unexpected, and unwanted, extra occupant (spider) and air conditioning  that didn't work.  The good part is that Chris at the front desk was understanding  and was able to move us to room 14, which had a better view of the creek and lights in the tree and on the patio.This was a great place for my wife and i to celebrate  our 1 year anniversary.Great place to stay in Oak Creek Canyon, Sedona, AZ. Stayed in cottage #11, which had a king size bed, kitchenette, flat screen tv, huge two person jacuzzi tub, shower, large private deck with lounge chairs, large glass table with huge umbrella and nice bbq. Room was undated, clean and in good shape. Nice stair case leads to the adjacent oak creek. Only downfall is Wifi only works in shared area. Highly recommend. Staff was super nice. They also have fishing poles for free use.On a scale of 'shitty to awesome', it was 'good'. After reading reviews we were excited about our 1 night stay, at this quirky place... Unfortunately, it fell short as far as cleanliness. It's clearly a little on the older side, (which is what we found intriguing to begin with) BUT we probably won't be returning.  On the plus side, the staff was friendly, scenery and koi pond were cool, and they offered their visitors complimentary Red Rock parking passes for daily use.Wonderful, peaceful hotel with creek access. Even picnic tables & hammock on creek for guests.Very clean, although they forgot to clean our room one day. Lovely little charming get away.I treated myself to a Sedona Trip last week and stayed at the Oak Creek Terrace because I prefer rooms with jetted tubs.  My usual place discontinued those room types so I tried out the Oak Creek Terrace.  Well, the Oak Creek Terrace is now my new favorite place.  Everything about it was perfect.  The location is on 89, but it's on the very quiet end of 89, past the bridge.  There was zero road noise throughout my entire stay.  They gave me a park pass for each day that I hiked and knew the area well enough to direct me to where I wanted to go.  I stayed in room 19, which gave me exactly what I wanted: An apartment-style setup with a fireplace and an enormous jetted tub.  I even had my own entrance with drive-up parking and a private patio.  The patio had a fountain, some lush landscaping that I could see out my kitchen window, and a brand new gas grill on the patio. It was also the cleanest jetted tub I had ever encountered at a hotel.  When I arrive at any establishment, I fill the tub with hot water, a gallon of bleach, and a packet of automatic dish detergent to clean out the hoses.  Usually some pretty funky stuff comes out.  Absolutely nothing came out of the hoses which means the tub has been properly maintained and cleaned.  The water was also plenty hot enough and the water pressure in the shower was great.  Both are tough to find in privately owned places.On my last day, I explored the whole property and found even more surprises.  There is a Koi pond with a fountain.  There are also walking paths, picnic tables, and a really cool back deck with sitting areas.  There is a manicured lawn area with a gazebo and beautiful statues that looked very nice.  While I was walking around it appeared there were room types for everybody.  The rooms towards the back of the property are right on the creek and you can hear the rushing water.  These rooms also have mature trees nearby that surround the patios.  The rooms in the middle of the property have less water views and less growth.  The rooms up front are more desert-y, which is what I wanted.  I am from New England, so I'm sick of seeing trees and creeks.  I want Red Rocks and planned landscaping.  The rooms at the very front of the property are a bit more traditional hotel-style.  They still had balconies and patios, but were not apartment-looking.The place was incredible.  I loved it.Once again, a lovely stay. It was great to escape the heat in Phx and come up for a midweek getaway. I stayed in room 10, which is perfect for me as a solo traveler. Queen bed, big jacuzzi tub, fireplace (with complementary Duraflame logs), fridge and microwave. This room doesn't have a table to set things on, but I tend to grab food and eat on the patio right outside my room. I lounged down by the creek in one of the hammocks, watched the stars, and felt my stress disappear. I highly recommend Oak Creek Terrace for anyone looking to stay near Sedona, without all the new-age-y crap ;-)This was mine and my husbands first time staying at Oak Creek Terrace, and we will definitely be back. There are so many things that we loved I'm just going to list them, (along with the cons.)Pros: The gorgeous view of the mountains and creek from our second story patio.-The clear mountain air with a hint of burning leaves that wafted through our windows. -The generously sized and (CLEAN) hot tub next to our bed. -Lovely fireplace at the foot of our bed, complete with Duraflame logs replaced every day.-Kitchen stocked with grilling utensils/plates/cutting boards/cups/ etc. -Two personal patios with a BBQ grill.-The winding staircase that split our unique two level accommodations. (Room 16, get it if you can!)-Courteous and genuinely friendly staff who have great recommendations for food and shopping without coming across like salespeople. (Abby is awesome!) (They were also very quick to meet our requests for extra towels/pillows, within 10 minutes of calling the front desk.)-Free unlimited Red Rock pass for the duration of our stay. -Pet friendly, didn't feel judged for bringing our puppy in the slightest. -Lovely grounds with hammocks near the creek, (perfect for stargazing on crystal clear Sedona nights, which we did!) Cons: Rooms feel slightly run down and would probably bother some people although not us. -Our DVD player was broken, not that we were there to watch much tv anyways. (We were informed that we were in one of the last rooms which hadn't been updated tv-wise so at least they've acknowledged the problem.)-Floor tiles in both bathrooms were cracked. -Creepy figurines of children scattered throughout the grounds, (this is actually humorous if you've seen them!) -Lumpy pillows. -Slight mold in the downstairs shower. For what we paid, we got what we expected and more, it was an excellent experience and we can't wait to go back!Eh. I had such high hopes for this place.  I get that it's not a new resort. I get that it's a quaint little place nestled along a 2 lane highway with access to the creek. I also get that it's more about where it is than what it is. But could you do something about the smell??? I stayed in room 20, which looked to be their largest cabin with 2 small bedrooms and a sofa bed. I was ok with the fact that one of the "rooms" was a small pantry sized area with a bed squeezed in there and curtains separating it from the kitchen. I was ok with the old sagging couch. I was ok with the outdated kitchen and bathroom. But the dead animal smell that literally woke me up from my sleep was staggering. And what did the management do? ....they handed me an industrial sized spray bottle of room deodorant. Yeah.  They did that. Then during checkout the second morning, told me I could've packed up all of my things and moved to another smaller cabin. Really? Oh, and they did finally agree that it smelled like there was a dead animal in there. But that was it. Eh.We had a larger room, 4 people, 2 bedrooms very small & couch bed. Only 1 bathroom, no doors on rooms only drapes on hooks. Over priced for this room, plus the uneven flooring was dangerous too. Nice location, help was considerate. Red Rock Pass was nice amenity. This was Room #20.I love this place. The ground are beautiful, the creek with all the hammocks us to die for. Great seating space throughout the property with gazebos, reclining chairs etc. Rooms are perfect with just what you need for a romantic getaway. Most of the room have a jacuzzi and fireplace. Prices are very reasonable and the temperature is always great specially during the summer. We will be  back.Horrible wi fi, old rooms with wood laminate, outdated jacuzzi tubs, shower/toilet old and run down. In a quaint area but don't want to be stuck here like we were during a snow storm. Those flat screens mentioned, as well as the fridge: tiny. Stay in town at Hyatt, better bet.My Hubby and I stayed here to celebrate our 5 yr anniversary last weekend. We were looking for something out of the desert heat, some place small and relaxing and pet friendly. This place fit the bill! They only had 1 room remaining when we booked (they only have 20 some rooms). Each cabin is unique, which I like, most, if not all have jacuzzi tubs and fireplaces and a tiny kitchenette. Ours also had a private patio and grill which was great! We got room 19.  I will start by saying the room was clean, the bed was comfy, the linens had no stains, spots, or tears. The AC unit worked great and the water from the hot side was HOT! All good stuff! Here is the reason for only 3 stars... the room needs some work. Maybe they are working on remodeling the rooms and we got the short end of the stick? Though it was clean, I'm not sure what they were thinking with the iridescent gold and pearlescent ivory paint scheme on all the walls AND the ceiling. The maroon and gold boarder in the room was peeling away from the walls, in places, especially the bathroom it looks like they have touched up the paint numerous times, yet each time the paint color is just slightly off making it looks like a patchwork quilt of tacky. The dark blue carpet was stained and in places near the fireplace was completely melted away (carpet in a room with a Jacuzzi tub just doesn't sound like a good idea anyways). In the entryway, the kitchenette and by the fireplace is nice marble tile, however, at one time it looks like they tried to clean it with something you shouldn't use on tile and it stained it which makes it look dirty... a good buff and seal would take care of this. Lastly, we decided on our last night we were going to test out the blue heart-shaped retro-looking jacuzzi tub.... after filling it (because I know how bacteria likes to hang out in the jets and who knows the last time it was REALLY cleaned thoroughly), I ran the jets to circulate all the water through it, then had plans to drain it and refill with "cleaner" water... after turning on the jets and letting it run for about 5 minutes, our room began to stink up. I was so grossed out by the smell, we ran the fireplace to clear the air and we skipped using the tub all together... I think it either needs to be replaced or bleach needs to run through that thing before anyone else uses it.For what we paid for the room, we thought it was a bit over priced given the state of what the room was. However, would we stay here again? ABSOLUTELY! If we tried a different room next time...The room was not what we had hopes for, but it didn't ruin our time there. The whole property is awesome! The grounds are very well kept. No trash anywhere. The creek being right there to fish in or walk along was nice! The grassy areas were all well maintained as well as all the landscaping around the rooms. The hammocks and lounge chairs everywhere made it easy to kick back and relax and enjoy the serenity.The staff including maid service were all very friendly. It was very easy to check in and check out. AND they offer a free Red Rocks pass during your stay so you can park and hike without having to pay fees at every fee area. It was a peaceful weekend get-a-way, just wished the room fit that theme as well.This place is the lowest price that you will find in Oak Creek.  And it is right on the creek too.  It is a magical little place and I love staying here.  The rooms are older and some of them are very small.  But we don't spend much time indoors anyhow.  The property is very pretty.  It is a steep downhill walk to the creek but it's not far.  They have a green grassy area too with a gazebo that is very pretty.I will definitely be back!!We called to make reservations and they were helpful on the phone and recommended a room for us. We had a standard room with a jacuzzi and fireplace. Pros:The staff was friendly when we checked in.Bed is very comfortable.Fireplace comes with a duraflame log. Matches were provided in the nightstand.Jacuzzi in room.Room was nicer and updated since the photos were posted on the website.Nice grounds: koi pond, creek, bbq, lounge chairsLocation just outside of 'busy' Sedona.Cons:No refrigerator Bathroom lay out is a little too tight - toilet nearly bumps sink.TV location is in the corner of the room.In all, we would recommend the room for a short stay for a couple.Spent a couple days here on our honeymoon.  The gentleman that checked us in apologized for all the traffic noise, but reassured us it would calm after dark.  We got a good chuckle at that, because we get more traffic by our house in one hour than Oak Creek Terrace gets in an entire day.  The room was cozy and clean, as well as well stocked, all the way down to a bag of microwave popcorn!  The view down the canyon was amazing, and just sitting on the deck on the swinging chairs was a vacation in itself.  The location is ideal, just 5 or so miles from downtown Sedona, and across the street from DQ. The only bad thing we found was that we had to come home.  We are already making plans to return.Honestly, I was a bit disappointed. I have only stayed in Room 7, so all my comments will relate only to that particular room:The bad: Cleanliness. We did find quite a few bugs in the room. Secondly, I don't think the rooms were cleaned very thorougly; I noticed a condom wrapper left by the previous occupant when we checked in - right next to my bed. Even after two subsequent cleanings, the staff did not remove it, nor did they remove the dirt and debris around the rest of the bed. It made me question how well they were cleaning the rest of the room. Access to the creek: The resort touts their access to Oak Creek as a selling point. However, that particular section was a MESS. There was a broken porch swing plunked down right in the water, and there were piles of debris EVERYWHERE. Frankly, it was disgusting. The bed: The mattress sagged in the middle, which meant an uncomfortable night of sleep that left me with back pain. The shower: Tiny, without an adjustable shower head. Which meant that if you wanted to turn on the shower to warm up the water before getting in, you would literally spray the bathroom with water. You were forced to get in, and either freeze or burn. No table in the room. NONE. We put all of our things on the side of the Jacuzzi or on the bedside. That included the coffeepot, since there were almost no accessible plugs in the room. The good:The Jacuzzi and the fireplace.Cable TVPorch swingsWe could not have picked a better place to stay at for our honeymoon. We stayed four nights in Cabin 12. It was peaceful and quiet - we have never slept better (although we do live in NYC ;)). There were families staying in other cabins, although we never heard them expect when we were outside. The room was small, but big enough for two people.The jacuzzi was more then big enough for the two of us and we loved that they provided free fire logs every night. We used the grill and had a wonderful Easter dinner. We also laid out in the hammocks by the creek which was relaxing and very easy to get to. I cannot wait for our anniversary so we can come again.
review_content_20: We stayed in two different properties in Sedona for two nights each and this was by far our favorite.It is quaint and charming. It feels (and is) owner operated. The jacuzzi tub was big enough to swim in and the fireplace could  be seen from bed or the tub.They decorated with wonderful bronze sculpture all over the grounds. They also have hammocks and comfortable swinging chairs to sit on to enjoy the creek.It is a little ways up the canyon, but close enough that pizza places still delivered. (We did not want to leave our room after a day of hiking and soaking in the tub.)The only reason I cannot give five stars is that they do have some technical difficulties with the shower heat, the heater and such. It is an old place, renovated, but they did not go all the way back to the bones to renovate.We will be back.This is a wonderful place to stay if visiting the Sedona, AZ area. There are hammocks down by the creek to lay in, and the rooms are awesome, affordable and the staff is very kind and courteous. The gazebo area is beautiful, and Oak Creek Terrace is the perfect place to escape to either by yourself or with a loved one. It is simply the perfect magical retreat!I stayed in Room 23 with my kids for two nights. Our girls loved playing in the creek just behind the cabin. The front desk offers free fishing pole rental so they spent a whole morning "fishing" crayfish out of the creek. The Koi pond, volleyball net over sand, hammocks and privacy in each cabins were just perfect for us. The only issue we had was strong moldy smell coming from the bathroom. The hotel offered to move us to a different unit, but we had already unpacked and our girls had already made themselves comfortable so I decided to stay. They ended up giving us a discount for staying in the room. Besides the bathroom issue, it was a great stay and I would go back to the same cabin even, if they fix the mold issue. :)I was impressed by my first contact with OCT.  The guy took our reservation, sent a confirmation within minutes and it spelled everything out.We met him 4 months later when we arrived.  So knowledgeable and content to make us feel welcome and part of "the family".We spent four days and had our two granddaughters with us.  Talk about a circus in search of a tent.  The sisters, 8 and 10, were excited about EVERYTHING.  Our cabin was everything we hoped it would be.  The deck overlooking the creek was fantastic for breakfasts and dinners.  There's plenty of room to walk around, relax on green lawns in chairs or creekside in hammocks and chairs.  If you love the sound of a gurgling creek, you'll love it here.This is one vacation we'll never forget.I must add, the lady who took care of our room was gracious and helpful to a fault.  We couldn't have asked for better service.Stayed here on my honeymoon.. The quiet location of this resort cannot be understated.  Rooms are very clean and cozy.  The location in Oak Creek Canyon is simply divine.  You're connected with nature during the entire stay as the creek isn't far from your room.  The staff is very nice, and very helpful.  I would HIGHLY recommend staying here!!  The only bad thing about the trip was having to go home.  We will definitely return.  Huuzah!!nothing as described, avoid if you can ! plenty of fine places in sedona for same price !Wow, what a great little place!!My boyfriend and I drove by on a Saturday evening so of course there was no vacancies. We called Sunday morning to see if we could get a room for the night and we were able to get a good price on a great room.Our room had a beautiful entry gate and courtyard leading to a somewhat enclosed porch with a grill and patio table/chairs.Our room had a fireplace, microwave (they even provided a package of microwave popcorn), flat screen tv, small kitchenette (as we discovered in what looked like a closet after I began frantically searching for a coffee maker), decent sized bathroom (although the shower was a bit small), king size bed  (the pillows were very nice!!! I hate to sleep on my pillows at home now, and will be looking for some nice fluffy pillows like the one's provided here!) and a jacuzzi tub (red, heart shaped). The kitchenette was very well stocked with coffee, creamer (powdered) and coffee. Nothing like those hotel chains that give you 2 sugars in a little packet. There were paper towels, plates, coffee mugs, glasses and silverware.The Dairy Queen across the street was definitely a plus for an after dinner treat!After awhile we decided to go down to the creek to relax, and to our surprise and delight there was a lawn area with a gazebo, and closer to the creek was a beach area with big trees, hammocks and lounging chairs/tables. This made for a wonderfully relaxing evening with my Kindle by the creek :)We absolutely love this place and will be back! Beautiful!I really wanted to give this place 5 stars but I am dissappointed!  Prior to seeing our room at check in we were told that our room was just remodeled. Yay! .... NOT! The first night was horrible with the freshly painted room smell!! My gosh what were they thinking by putting us in there with NO FANS or ventilation??? It was BAD! When my fiance went to the office to let them know they told him they would have the maid try to do something about the smell and nothing! No fan still and one window in this room is not enough when you're breathing in TOXIC FUMES!  We took it upon ourselves and went to find a market to buy some vinegar after googling ways to help with the fumes. We put vinegar in all four corners of the room and that seemed to soak up some of the smell but obviously not all of it. Whoever did the flooring in the room was NOT  a professional because the floor dropped down like if there was a hole there everytime you would walk by the jacuzzi area into the restroom. Speaking of jacuzzi: It was not used by us, but it made some really LOUD noises in the middle of the night while we were trying to sleep like bubbling and it sounded like it was going to explode or come up from the drain. All 3 nights we were there we had the same issue and were woken up by that loud noise!!    The grounds of this place were beautiful and the bigger cabins looked absolutely amazing to stay in. As for our tiny little rooms, it was not a pleasant stay. We tried to make the best of it as it was my birthday and I love SEDONA. Definitely will not be staying here on our next visit again.This place is absolutely beautiful. Not your average hotel. Rooms are very small, but roomy, there is a fireplace and hot tub in every room. My boyfriend and I absolutely adored this place. The people who work here are so friendly too!Charming little resort on Oak Creek, just outside Sedona, AZ. Wifey and I have stayed here a few times, including 5 days on the first part of our honeymoon! Some rooms are better than others- Not telling which one we like best in case we want it on a particular weekend! Some have kitchens, patios, BBQ gills, and views overlooking the creek. There's a Dairy Queen across the road for those with a sweet tooth! Rooms also have HDTV, ours had a Jaccuzzi tub as well. You can fish in the creek, lounge on patio furniture or a hammock... Very quiet, peaceful place! Our room with the kitchen was $150. Very nice getaway spot!The little cottages are cute and cozy with an outdoor feel and if you get the right cabin, you will have a nice view of the creek. We stayed in to different cabins on our visit they were both nice. The first cabin we stayed in had an awesome blue heart shapped jacuzzi that so said 1985, but it was fun, the lay out of room was nice & bed was comfy. It had a nice porch with grill. The 2nd cabin was set up a little strange, jacuzzi in the kitchen and bedroom upstairs, it was still nice. This cabin also had an upper and lower deck with great view of the creek, also had a grill.All the rooms had fireplaces, flat screen tvs, dvd players, and kitchen supplied with limited dinnerware/small fridge.The staff was very friendly, housekeeping also gave you what you need more towels,ect, The had two gazebos for all guests to use and have table and chairs down by the creek.They have all differnt types of cabins, so check there web-site for interest in cabin or room type. There is a dairy queen and vistor center across the street and slide rock state park just a little ways down the road I would and plan on staying there again.I'm not sure if I want to give this motel a 3 or 4 star review. We definitely enjoyed our stay, but we ran into a few interesting issues.It happened to be snowing, so it was really cold. We walked in our room and could see our breath. It took quite a while before we were able to get it warm.The rooms have jacuzzi's in them with some instructions, but don't mention anything about not putting soap in there. Let me warn you: DO NOT ADD SOAP. You will be shoveling bubbles out through the window, naked, for twenty minutes. Strike two with the jacuzzi is that in our one full tub we used all the water for the whole motel. How this is possible, I will never know, but we got a call from the front desk informing us we ruined everyone's night and nobody could shower.The property is really cute and they have videos you can rent for a dollar. There are tons of popular hits. Also across the street from Dairy Queen and they have a nice Koi Pond.I would come back and stay here in the summer once I felt comfortable that we wouldn't use all the hot water in the place! $105 for a holiday week day isn't bad.We have been traveling between Phoenix and Flagstaff for the week. On our second pass through Sedona and Oak Creek Canyon we had not made a reservation for the night. Our first stop was at Oak Creek Terrace. The place looked small and quaint. A lovely lady in the office checked us into a room with more amenities than we were expecting. Queen bed, real fireplace with a self starter log, jacuzzi tub, flat screen HD TV with DVD player, cable and WiFi. The rooms are smaller but have enough space for two. The grounds are attractive with outdoor TV, grill, seating, Koi pond with many large and beautiful fish. The lower terrace and river side seating/hammocks was a nice place to relax. Great alternative to chain hotels. We really enjoyed our stay!Oak Creek Terrace Resort is rustic and funky. When you first pull up, it looks like there are only 10 rooms. However, the resort spreads out to the back with little rustic cottages for a more intimate stay.There's a koi fish pond with fat, healthy koi fish adjacent to an outdoor patio. The outdoor patio has it's very own 42" (est) television. Perfect for the TV fanatics and sports fans. The TV was still on when we returned from dinner around 10pm with only ghosts watching it. They didn't bother us, so we left it on.In the back of the resort is a huge terrace with comfy patio furniture to enjoy the beautiful weather of Sedona. From there, walk down some stairs and it will lead you to a wall full of painted lizards. F-U-N-K-Y. Then, down more stairs, you will end up in a grassy area with a gazebo. My doggie had fun prancing playfully on the fall colored leaves sprinkled across the lawn. CRUNCH.There is a creek that runs along the back of the resort. Also, hammocks are set up to kick back and relax in the warm Sedona weather.We had a small standard room with a king size bed that was adequate for one night's stay. The only bugger was that the low shower pressure. The room is equipped with a mini fridge and microwave.Overall: This is a rustic, funky, clean, and dog friendly resort. The highlight is the many choices on the resort to relax and enjoy your vacation. Oh yeah, free wi-fi!I took my boyfriend to Oak Creek Terrace last weekend for his birthday and we had such a relaxing time staying here. The rooms are nothing fancy but they are very comfortable and quite spacious. Ours had a jacuzzi, fireplace and our own large patio with table and chairs and BBQ. We grilled out and took a walk to the creek. It's also a dog friendly resort. The front desk was really friendly and helpful and even upgraded our room when it wasn't ready in time for check-in. We would definitely return here for another relaxing night away in Sedona.This place needs updating on some of it's infrastructure. We had an ongoing, frustrating time with the broken ice machine. It is old and needs replacing. It never worked when needed.We held our wedding at Oak Creek Terrace recently.  From the moment we checked in the staff was really helpful, Heidi was AMAZING in making sure we had everyting we needed.  She even noticed a problem that wasn't their problem, and offered a solution for it without my saying a single word!  She went above and beyond every time she came into contact with us.  The TV's and Internet were having issues when we checked in (because of a storm that knocked out the power) and, while not convienent for a bride to be out of internet planning the final details, they stayed on top of fixing it and gave suggestions to help me accomplish what I needed to while it was being fixed.  The area is beautiful, and the rooms are all a little bit different which is nice for those looking for options and price variations.  We checked out knowing we'd be back!

review_content: Great place, good deal, good breakfast, nice rooms, quiet area in the heart of a magnificently majestic place, staff were nice too.Pros:- good location (Big Park, AZ), closer to many hiking trails if you compare it to hotels in Sedona (about 8 miles from Sedona)- clean- across the street from a small shopping center- many items to chose from at breakfast- big rooms with fridge, microwave, efficient and clean heaters- compared to hotels of the same caliber in Sedona, quite cheapCons:- had a bit of a problem with room service (found strange hairs in freshly changed towels and 2 days out of 5 room service thought we didn't deserve shampoo and conditioner). It is true, the first day I didn't leave a tip since I usually leave a larger sum at the end of my rather long stay. The next day, seeing that I didn't get shampoo, I started leaving tips and the shampoo reappeared as by miracle. I would have left a larger tip if it weren't for this "now you see it, now you don't" game.- I would have preferred to keep my towels and reuse them but they do not offer this eco-conscious/money-saving option here.  - very spotty to no WiFi reception- if you come to this area for shopping and not for hiking/nature, Big Park is considered a "commuter-city" by some, therefore may prove not cool enough for the more urban/glamorous types ;-)Great bed!! Good for a one night stay. Breakfast could have been better but does the job.We extended our stay because of the comfort and great value.-friendly owners.-super clean rooms and facility.-great breakfast and outdoor dining area, relaxing.-convenient and clean laundry room.-large rooms with nice linens and furnishings.-comfortable  matress.-quiet atmosphere.-beautiful views.-within walking distance to the village cafes and shops.- directly across the street from the visitor's center.Recommendations-move smoking area. It is the centerpoint of the property and nonsmokers have to pass it to get to the front office and all amenities. I also smelled it while using the pool.-open the pool at 6:30 am so guests can swim before breakfast. 9:00 am is late for those planning a day of activities or travel. We will return the next time we visit Sedona!Staff was very friendly and accommodating for our early morning arrival. Rooms are very clean,  well appointed. We stayed for 2 days and they were greeting us by our names as we would return to the room to freshen up. I'd recommend this hotel to other's that don't need the appointments that a resort offers.Nice quiet hotel. Everything in the area (food-wise) closes at 9pm - so be prepared. We arrived early and our room was ready (clearly seen through window) and they wouldn't let us check in. Quiet irritating and they watch you like a hawk to make sure you don't go in. The hot tub closes at nine and the owner is out there monitoring the entire time - creepyRooms are clean comfy and modern - free wi-fi is a plus!All in all a good place to stay for a quick trip or if you're over 60I decided to go on a last minute mini vacation for the night and so I was looking for a descent hotel for an affordable rate and I saw the Views Inn online. The pictures looked ok so I decided to just book the room. The lady at the front desk was extremely helpful and generous; she stayed a few minutes past her shift in order for me to get checked in. (Since I arrived shortly after office hours). The room was clean, nice and had a great view. The breakfast isn't too fancy - no pancakes and waffles but it's enough to get you through the morning. For the great price you pay you can't expect to have a fully cooked meal in the morning.Got a king sized room on 2nd floor with red rocks view.  The room was very nice and updated.  The bed was comfortable and had plenty of pillows.  Having a fridge and micro was great too. Hotel is within walking distance to several restaurants and fast food places. Also next to a gas station and outlet mall.  The free breakfast was nice. Had fruit,  hard boiled eggs, oatmeal, cereal,  OJ, coffee, yogurt,  toast, and bagels. We would stay here again for sure!Beautiful views, easy access to parking, the pool and hot tub, restaurants & gas station are short walking distance.   Very friendly staff!   Clean property and rooms.  Highly recommend for the price!Nice economical motel for Sedona. PROS: -Clean and cheap-Located next to an outlet mall however the only good store there was the Gap.-There's a small pool and jacuzzi area-Laundry room available with free detergent-Free breakfast available, though the choices are limited. Stock up on the apples and free OJ (found in the fridge where the yogurt is!)Recommend having dinner at Cucina Rustica which is very close by and a wonderful restaurant.Actually I mean 4.5.                               Pros-- Clean modern rooms. Microwave, frige, coffee pot. Desk people very nice and accommodating. Decent (not great) views. Basic simple breakfast choices, cereal, bagel, hard boiled ceggs etc. Near good reasonable prices food choices. (see Pagos) Bed ok. Shower ok.                   Cons-- heater a little noisy.                  Basically a good choice when going to pricey Sedona.I stayed here for 3 days. Great price, very clean, updated rooms. I was actually not expecting the rooms to be this nice. Very nice considering this is a budget property. The breakfast is ok, hardboiled eggs, coffee, yogurt,cereal, juice,Coffee, pastry,bagels and toast. Everyone is very nice. I will definitely stay here again.So here's my thing with the Views Inn:  First, the room I booked included a "mountain view." That's a feature included in their website description, as well as my confirmation.  What would be a reasonable expectation for a room that had "mountain view" included as a feature in its description?  Our view was of the Arizona Tourist Information Center across the street.  That's it.  To be fair, the room itself was as advertised.  Just nothing I would call a view.  Knock off a star.The continental breakfast was okay; the cinnamon "rolls" were about the size of a quarter.  Knock off another two stars for the way we were treated by the proprietor, in a dispute over a certain insect we found on the floor.  It blew up in a hurry.  My wife was called a liar.  No one calls a guest a liar, even if they are one.  The room discount we were offered disappeared and so did we, never to return.They call it "The Views" for an obvious reason,When you look out the window your eyes you'll be pleasin'.Comfortable and clean in a cute neighborhood,I wish I could move in and stay here for good.I recommend waking up before 7am to see the sunset. You will look out the window and lose your marbles. The bright red rocks will be screaming at you as the sun peeks over the horizon and lights them up. Then head to breakfast, where the coffee is hot and the cinnamon rolls are OFF DA CHAYNNNNN. The beds are firm and very comfortable. Very cool southern decor in the rooms. They give you full-sized bars of soap and high quality soap and shampoo. You can tell the owners really take pride in their mom 'n pop hotel.We were able to walk to the Red Rock Cafe for lunch, to the gift shop, to Circle K for a coffee, and to the Full Moon Saloon for a beer at night. Prime location, Prime hotel. Stay here. You can't beat the price for what you get.Hands down, the best deal in Sedona.  Super clean, great staff and the price can't be beat! The breath taking views, OMG!Yay for The Views Inn! It's everything we were looking for in an economical hotel. Friendly desk staff, clean room, quiet, comfortable bed and deep tub. It has a jacuzzi to soak your sore muscles after hiking the red rocks all day. It's away from the swarm of tourists that are in Sedona proper and close to fine eateries and a great coffee shop. If your just looking for a nice clean place to rest after a long day of hiking this is a great place.Here's the skinny. While this hotel is clean, local to Sedona (7 miles out), and touts amenities like free Wi-Fi, a free continental breakfast, and views of the Red Rocks of Sedona, it is all a cover for poor hospitality service and hidden fees.I booked the room with Expedia for four nights, three weeks in advance. I read the online fine print about additional charges, etc. and called the hotel to find what these fees, charges, and surcharges would be. When the woman answered on the end of the phone and I confirmed my reservation I asked about it. Her words: "You have prepaid, so you're all set." She seemed in a hurry to get me off of the phone, so I took her word and left it at that. Big Mistake. We arrived around 9:30 p.m., and because we knew the desk would be closing soon, we rushed to the desk to check in. The woman confirmed that the booking was prepaid, and then asked for my ID and card used to pay for the booking to confirm (standard procedure at most hotels, so I did not blink). When I gave her both, she tried to authorize the debit card. When I asked her why, she stated that there was a $75.00 deposit required in order to book the room. Without this deposit she could not allow us to check in.When I said that we were first of all not informed about this deposit, and second, that we were not prepared to pay it, she flatly said that we would not be checked in. We had to deal with this behavior after driving for 10 hours straight--we were both dead tired. I asked if I could speak to a manager. She said that the manager would not be in until morning. When I asked the manager's name, she refused to give it; her entire manner was very abrupt. My husband just paid the deposit in cash, and we checked into the room. But the entire affair left a bad taste in our mouths. This was only the beginning.The breakfast was anything BUT Continental. Little cinnamon rolls that they bought from the local grocery store; tiny, GREEN apples; boiled eggs; pre-packaged bagels and bread; and packaged cold cereals and oatmeals. I felt gypped, which so far was becoming par for the course with this place.Free Wi-Fi: A day after I patched in, I started receiving suspicious emails that matched some internet searches I had done the day before, so I immediately stopped using it. I always carry my own mobile hotspot, so I was not at a loss--but this only increased the bad taste that started upon check-in.I asked another clerk when I could speak to a manager, and she said he would be in shortly, then asked for my room number, which I gave. She explained that the manager would knock on our door when he arrived. I asked her for the manager's name, and she told me it was Danny. We went back to the room, and stayed for at least another hour and a half after this with no no visit from the manager. We had to leave, as we had a paid tour to attend in Sedona. When we returned to the room later that night, there was not even a phone call. Crappy, crappy customer service.The next night I found an item of clothing missing from my room. We always take any valuables with us, then conscientiously repack our clothes in the suitcases. So for an item that I was sure I had packed in my suitcase to come up missing was very strange. This was after 9:00 p.m., and I encountered the same brusque, uncooperative night clerk we had dealt with on check-in. She said that obviously the maid had gone home for the day (duh), and she would leave a note for the maid in the morning.The next day we actually ran into Danny, who acted as though he did not want to be bothered, then motioned to me to walk to the lobby area. I calmly stated that not having policies written down on paper was not fair to the customer, nor was it fair that I had called ahead to get answers on extra surcharges, and had been told that everything was fine. Danny obviously did not like me, and did not like criticism, because he became hostile, and started talking to me like I was stupid. He then tried to pass it off to Expedia. When I let him know that I spoke with Expedia and they said that any additional policies were the policies of the booking hotel, he became even more hostile, and told me that I must think I'm a queen who deserves special treatment. That this is the hospitality business, and I am only a customer, not a queen. Then he had the unmitigated gall to accuse me of being the one who was hostile, said I was nothing but a problem, and that my issues with him must be with his skin color.Then he threatened to call the police. I told him to go right ahead. He then backed down, but said in so many words that he wanted me to check out. I told him I would NOT check out unless he refunded me IN CASH the last night of my stay and the $75.00 deposit given to them for "incidentals".His desire to get rid of me was more pronounced than his desire to be right, and after the room was checked, he refunded both. No one should have to go through this, and I am still appalled.Great location. The rooms are surprisingly nice and clean. Isabelle was friendly and very accommodating. I would definitely stay here again.This place is good and cheap. Sedona is so expensive and this place is a money saver. The rooms are clean, there's tv and free wifi. (How much more could we ask for? Lol) the bathroom is really small and the beds are a bit uncomfortable though. On the plus side, they serve a decent breakfast from 7 am- 9:30 am. We will definitely stay again when we come back to Sedona!I really loved my stay here! I had a king size bed with spa jet room, also had a mini view of the red rocks which were beautiful. Good price for the location! The staff was very courteous and assisting! They also had brand new furniture arriving the day I was checking out!
review_content_20: Hotel room is clean & very nice for the $85 price. Comes with a fridge, microwave, iron & full size ironing board. Hairdryer, nice TV & free wifi (which we haven't had any problems with). Pool, spa & pretty good views. It doesn't smell & is a nice size room. Bed is a little hard for my taste but my kids think they're fine. We will stay here again!Man behind the front desk was also very nice!Location was perfect, great views and near the Bell Rock pathway trailhead. The owner and staff were friendly and accommodating.  The price was very reasonable and with the clean rooms, pool, spa, free wifi and continental breakfast I really felt I got a great value.  We booked three rooms on the ground floor  for a mountain biking trip so we could keep the bikes in the room.  You can hear people walking upstairs so get a second floor room if you'd prefer to be the stomper instead of the stompee, but it wasn't bad at all. This will be "my place" if we make it back next year. Hot tip, the bar at the golf course up the highway has reasonable food and drinks too.This place was awesome for the price. Just a bare bones motel, but it was very clean (not something I always expect from a small motel, so that was a nice surprice) and just a short drive from downtown Sedona. I would definitely come back here.If you just need a bed while you're out exploring Arizona, I would recommend this place.Stayed here as it is in the village of oak creek and near verde valley school where I was attending an event. Room was clean with fridge and tv. Free wifi. Not the fanciest place but it did the job. Continental breakfast was extremely minimal. Staff was friendly. I would stay here again if I found a good rate on Hotwire. I did not swim in the pool but it was very small. The hotel was also very close to the Bell Rock trailhead.My friend and I love to visit Sedona and although our trips there are usually day trips, we decided to spend the night this time around, especially since we were going hiking though Red Rock country. Since we were traveling on a limited budget, we decided to book a room at The Views Inn. It turned out to be a good choice: the staff was friendly and helpful, the room was spacious and really clean, and the large beds really comfortable. It's just a few miles outside of Sedona proper, so it was convenient as well. And the name is appropriate; there are great views of the famed red rock formations of Sedona from the inn. A really good deal for the money.We stayed here only one night when we were in Sedona for hiking.  It was a very pleasant surprise because it was so clean, fresh and in my opinion, perfect for a one or two night stay.  The rooms are large, the bed comfy,and  the bathroom fresh as if it were just redone. Our room was very clean and tastefully, yet simply decorated.The people who worked there were  helpful and friendly. Our friend left his gps in the room after we checked out and they called us to let us know, I was impressed with that! They had a breakfast of apples, eggs, hard boiled eggs, toast, yogurt and mini cinnamon rolls. It's in walking distance to little shops and restaurants.  I'm giving this a five star as compared with other hotel/motels in this price range. (I would compare this with a nice Hampton.) I highly recommend staying here if you're going hiking for the weekend. It's not a resort as you probably already can tell.  But great place.This hotel saved the day for me.  After weeks of efforts to block off rooms for my wedding at other hotels I got in touch with the Views Inn.  They were very helpful in getting me everything I needed at  a great price The rooms were nice and the views breathtaking...ok maybe that's a bit of a stretch but definitely impressive.The breakfast options on the other hand not so much, but luckily they were within walking distance of subway and I didn't really book them for their breakfast anyway.Clean room, friendly staff, great price and incredible location.  So happy that I stayed here.  Will definitely recommend to anyone who is heading to Sedona and is on a budget.For the price The Views Inn is not a bad deal there were just a few parts of my experience there that caused me to give the inn only two stars.First of all they don't have fitted sheets for their king sized beds so our sheets were constantly coming off during the night and exposing the mattress.  The people at the front desk are not very friendly and when my girlfriend called to ask some questions the front desk attendant hung up on her before even allowing her to ask another question.The swimming pool was dirty and had lots of trash in it.Finally, during each of the mornings of our stay there was at least a few breakfast items that ran out which was a disappointment.The price was right but there were too many inconsistencies for this motel to receive a good rating from me.I have good news and bad news about The Views Inn. First the good news. The rooms are very clean. The beds are new and comfortable. The prices are reasonable for the Sedona area. The staff was helpful and courteous. Now the bad news. Our room smelled like insecticide. The smell is overwhelming when you first enter the room. The breakfast is a miserable collection of itty bitty pasteries, yogurt, fruit and waterery coffee. The wifi goes down ever ten minutes or so.
