Wait a minute, it will come back up.Not sure I'll be back.me and my wife stayed here . we got a ground level room with a king size bed. and it was great and it is right in the middle of the town. very close to all the hiking trails that we wanted to go on. great service at the front desk and the room was nice and clean, i will be back to this place in the future and it was cheap . we booked it about 10 days before our trip to sedona and it wa under 100 bucks.Excellent all around.  Comfortable, clean, well-located.  Staff very helpful.  I would definetly stay here again and would recommend The Views Inn.I gave the views inn 5 stars. My wife and I come to sedona often to take care of family affairs. Denny has gone out of his way to accommodate us every time we come and is very professional. The rooms are clean & the price is very reasonable. Located close to hiking trails and other activities. Need a place to dine or having car problems, Denny can give you a referral. My overall experience was excellent. I continue to come to Sedona & stay at the Views Inn. I would highly recommend the Views Inn. Denny and his staff are very professional, they make us feel like family.$79 on a saturday isn't bad at all. The pic looks just like our room did, although the bedding was slightly different. Mini Fridge and Microwave in room. Plenty of brochures in the lobby, breakfast items avail in morning, although we skipped it and went to a bakery down the road...that's a separate review for sure.Place is clean, newly refurbed - they are doing the pool area now. So, that'll be great by summer.Views are good. Walls are thin - it is, after all an old motel. So, come sun up - you will hear everything as people get up and start to load their cars, shower, perform bedroom aerobics, etc.But, it IS out of the construction zone of Sedona - and the traffic mess that is causing right now. I liked it. I'd give it 3.75 stars for sure.I stayed here back in 2009.  It wasn't anything great but was clean.  This year I was pleasantly surprised with the minor upgrades.  Great staff and super clean rooms!  This is a great location - gas station across the street & eateries within walking distance.  I will definitely be back :o)My husband and I stayed in one of the king rooms at the Views Inn for a wedding we were attending in Sedona. We were very pleased with our stay! From our arrival they were very accommodating, we got in early and were extremely tired and they made sure we were able to get a room, even though they were still cleaning the rooms from earlier departures, which made everything so much easier for us! The rooms were very spacious, comfortable and clean. They have a microwave, minifridge and large TV in the rooms, as well as nice fixtures, so its very comfortable. The only 2 issues I had with the room is the shower was very small and the sheets would not stay on our bed (I have no idea what kind of linens they used, but they refused to stay tucked in, so we woke up on the mattress each morning, bummer) but other than that, everything was very nice, actually more than I expected. They have free wifi, the pool was smaller but extremely well kept and clean, well stocked with plently of chairs and towels. The morning breakfast was fine, a variety of continental items, bagels, toast, fresh fruit, coffee, etc. The location is great, very close to everything, and within walking distance to several restaurants as well as the tourist information center. The back area of the hotel looks out to the redrocks so its very pretty, but I wouldn't say that every room has a view, ours looked at the parking lot, but we didn't really mind. The staff was very friendly and accommodating, my only complaint there is that they literally called us at 11:02 the morning we were scheduled to checkout (checkout it at 11:00), so I sort of felt like they were watching us making sure we leaved immediately, but I know they probably were just trying to get the rooms clean for the next stay, still, a little annoying. We would definitely stay here again if every back in the area and would recommend it!Nice room and close to man part of town without being in the chaos. Only complaint is owners (or maids, or both?) children seem to play all over. In the parking lot (2-ish year old ran out in front of my car and almost got hit-no parent in sight) and the others (at least 3-4?) seem to run around screaming most of the time-all hours of day and evening. It was not that big of a deal but when we just wanted to relax in our room and had to listen to kids screaming, it should not be the maid or owners kids doing the screaming at least!This is a no-frills hotel but it's spotless, well maintained, the room (2queen beds) is comfortable and has a fridge and microwave.  It's outside Sedona about 5 miles or so but easy to get there.  I did hear two women complain that they had the same view but one had been charged extra by Expedia for a room with a view.  They were asking the manager for refund but I don't know how that turned out.  Don't pay extra for a view--who spends enough time in a hotel room to worry about that?  Especially here where the views everywhere outside are so awesome!Stayed here for our first time to Sedona. Keep in mind, that this inn is NOT near thedowntown Sedona area, but about 5 miles from it. However, the rooms are clean, and the staff is nice. Not luxurious, but fit the bill for us for 3 days. The best part of the area is Desert Flour, the bakery/restaurant across the street, where you can use your breakfast coupon.....delicious!We stayed at this motel only one night, but I was very favorably impressed.  It's actually in Oak Creek Village, which is a few miles outside of the traffic mess of Sedona proper; but as the name indicates, it has fabulous views of the local "red rocks", from just about every room.The room was big, the place was clean, clean, CLEAN, and the owners/managers were friendly and helpful.  We had to leave very early to catch a plane, so we didn't get to try the brekky, but the fixings were all there.Check the Sedona Chamber of Commerce website for specials... it cost us only $60 before tax, on the "Chamber Hot Deal" (Sept. 2009).Oh.. a bonus...  "Maria's", about a block away, is a very good Mexican restaurant.  Quite different from what you might find in NY.  Just avoid the carnitas, unless you like them dry.  Large portions, generous drinks, and decent prices.
review_content_40: Very affordable, clean, great views, friendly service.  We paid $84 a night (with tax) for the 3 of us (a room with 2 queen beds).  There was light breakfasty stuff in the morning, a printer and computer to use in the lobby, a pool, and stunning views.  This isn't "The W", but in this price range, absolutely wonderful.

review_content: Stayed here with my dad on a father/daughter weekend trip. Our destination was really Jerome but we couldn't find a room in Jerome that appealed to our relatively simple tastes as well as our budget. We found the Wild Flower via Trip Advisor on a Google search. Great rate... I don't know the rack rate so I won't post what our cost was.Rooms are recently renovated (last couple of years) with great consideration as to what really makes the difference... New bedding and solid surface counter tops. Clean with basic necessities plus a few bonuses.. Flat screen TVs, free wifi, continental breakfast (including a waffle maker), awesome veiw! The beds are very firm (which I love). Front desk staff was so friendly... Shannon checked us in and gave us a great recomendtion for dinner (Chinese... The Red Chopsticks right behind the hotel - check out my review there). The morning clerk was just as helpful. I drink A LOT of (tap) water. I carry a 32oz cup and fill it with ice and water about 6 times a day. They had a pitcher of water but I asked her to fill it at the source so I didn't leave her pitcher empty. She apologized that all they had available was tap water (which is what I prefer) and was happy to help. No doubt I'll be staying again. Perhaps next time with my BF for a more romantic trip to Sedona!We stayed at the Wildflower Inn in the Village of Oak Creek 15 or so years ago---I think it was brand-new, then. We don't remember details, except being pleased. But now my son lives just around the corner, albeit in an apt so small it's tough to have company, so we made a reservation at Wildflower. Still pleased. The room was clean-clean-clean! And you can tell it was recently refurbished. Nothing super-fancy-schmancy---but I think the guy from Hotel Impossible would be impressed. (And frankly, with some of the greatest hiking on earth a stone's throw away, how much time are you hanging in the room?) Furnishings modern and unbattered, linens fresh and white, carpet and draperies well-swept and unstained. (Thank you, Rosa, the housekeeper!) Only "decor" was a nice photo/painting of the Red Rocks---but really, can you compete with what's right outside the window? Amenities included microwave, mini-fridge, coffeemaker, and even a basket with complimentary water and popcorn. Staff very pleasant. And excellent views of Cathedral, Courthouse, and Bell. My son works at one of the 5-star resorts in Sedona, and he was impressed by the attention to detail and service. If you want to stay outside of the craziness of Sedona and aren't looking for a total "resort" experience, this place is highly recommended!Note: This is a great location for hikers. You are within a five minute walk of the trailheads of Bell Rock, Slim Shady, Made in the Shade, Courthouse Rock, Cathedral...On a spur of the moment trip to Sedona, we took a chance and stopped at Wildflower Inn, as they were close to where we wanted to hike the next morning. Friendly, accommodating staff, clean rooms, continental breakfast, and did I mention clean and friendly?!My boyfriend and I decided to take a last minute trip to Sedona. I am sure finding a hotel while in Sedona would normally not be difficult as there are so many however, as we were being spontaneous, we didn't stop to think that it was Easter weekend! We had missed attending a 'sports car road trip' the prior weekend, so as goofy as it sounds, we loaded up with both cars. We arrived in the later part of the evening and as we both called hotels, realized we may be spending the night in our cars!! Finally I reached a very friendly voice, connected to a man by the name of "Jack" at this location, 'Wildflower Inn'. Jack was VERY friendly and stated he had ONE room left and had saved it for this exact reason! (Someone coming into town who had no room) I immediately was over-joyed stating we wanted the room, and jokingly asked if I could get him anything and believe I offered beef jerky and or soda! Lol. Needless to say Jack laughed and stated that wasn't necessary and our credit card information would suffice.The location of the hotel really is great as it is just on the edge of this side of town and though the night we arrived we did not notice, the next morning we could see we had quite a wonderful view of the beautiful red rocks surrounding us!! The parking lot is a little small which did lead us to having an issue with having a spot to park once we returned from finding something for dinner that evening. Jack fixed our problems! The next morning, we explained our parking problem the previous night as well as the phone ringing at late hours (they were having issues with their phone system which we were unaware of) so Without hesitation, Jack gave us a discount for a future stay. We decided to stay another night and use the discount and enjoyed it just as much with no issue! In short, though the parking lot is small and may be over crowded on a holiday weekend, they will make accommodations as Jack explained we could have parked my car in the empty handicapped spot and they wouldn't have towed it under those special circumstances. They do offer a breakfast in the morning, though we didn't partake so I cannot say much about that other than its there. The rooms were BEAUTIFUL, well kept and very clean!! As far as pricing, you get what you pay for here!! Sedona tends to be a bit pricy however, we found that the amount we paid was well worth the comfort and friendly nature of the staff!! We will most definitely stay at this location again should we find ourselves in Sedona!! We enjoyed talking with Jack so much that the morning we went to share our parking issue, we spoke with him for over an hour!!! He really made our trip fun as he is full of life and laughter!!! And yes, I left a bag of beef jerky for him when we left as well as a note thanking him! Naturally I did this to be funny as we had joked about my excitement and silly offer!!The views are fantastic but the beds are super hard and uncomfortable. The bathroom had no fan. Some rooms, our first one had no fridge. Gas fireplace didn't work. Absolutely no early check-in, 45 mins early and they said no. Some in room strobe light went off all night, maybe a motion sensor.This place was great. Large room, king size bed and it was at a reasonable price. Will definitely go here again!This was our first visit to Sedona. We planned to drive through on our way home from the Grand Canyon. Unfortunately, Bell Rock Vortex had other plans for us and we decided we NEEDED to stay the night and venture longer. Wildflower Inn is literally down the road from Bell Rock on the 179S at the Bell Rock roundabout. We decided if the price was right we would stay there. The receptionist (forgot her name) was knowledgeable. Jack (assistant manger) was very knowledgeable and gave us hiking as well as restaurant recommendations. I requested a room facing Bell Rock and chose #107 (2nd floor was sold out). It was a handicap room with a king bed. It was large enough to also include a double sleeper love seat, coffee table, desk, mini fridge, microwave, and large upholstered bench. The bathroom was large with a regular seat, hair dryer, and coffee maker. The water pressure was good. The WIFI was free and fast. The price also included a free continental breakfast with fresh waffles that you make yourself.PROS: Views, location, great customer service, free breakfast, free WIFI, microwave, mini fridge, mini dryerCONS: Towels smelled of bleach/chemical, decor was datedRECOMMENDATIONS: Give staff raises :)my wife and i stayed for a night for a sedona getaway. great place, very clean, great view from our room.Pros- nice staff and very helpful. Good price and an excellent view of Bell Rock. Terrific location.Cons- the beds are so hard I think I'd rather be sleeping on Bell Rock. The internet connection is equally bad. Great place if you love hard beds and do not want internet.I am trying to sleep on this bed and cannot fall asleep even though I am tired, so I decided to write this review.We stopped in here last night on our trip back East. Found a great rate online and booked the reservation. Within 10 minutes the clerk at the hotel called to check with us and give us any information we needed to get into our room. Very friendly. The room was great! Very clean with a fireplace, free WiFi, and a view that can't be beat! One thing that was a huge plus with me was the shower! Traveling across the country we've found it hard to find a place with good water pressure; no problem here! I loved the toiletries offered too; they smelled good and didn't feel "cheap". In the morning we stopped in for a continental breakfast. They had waffles, bagels, bread and apples with juice and coffee. Was a good start to the day. Overall a good experience here and I'd return if we ever come through Sedona again!First i want to say Jack at the front desk was awesome! Best customer service i have experienced in a long time. Next, you have to understand this is a 2 star budget hotel, this isn't the Fairmont or any other luxury brand so you can't compare it to a hotel like that. The beds were nice, rooms were clean. For a cheap Clean hotel in Sedona, this works. Free continental breakfast, waffles,coffee and bagels. The only thing i didn't like was the smell of the room, which smelled like old lady perfume, and made my clothes i had on smell like that. Im assuming it's the cleaning products or deodorizer they use to clean the room..so, if they read this, i would recommend changing that. Otherwise all good, especially if you are on a budget.BED BUGS!! I stayed here in October 2012 and brought 1 bed bug home with me. The bites showed up 2 days after staying here and I immediately packed up all my clothes and called the exterminator. He literally only found one bed bug in my house, but we found about a dozen eggs underneath the second bed (which we just threw away). It was two weeks of hell. We called the motel and they said that their staff is trained to always look for bed bugs and defended that they didn't have bed bugs, but they refunded our money--which makes me think they knew. I wasn't going to post but I just drove by (shiver) and decided to see their reviews on yelp and saw someone else experienced bed bugs here too.Great service! Accomodating owner. Clean tidy rooms. Phenomenal views. Stay here!!! We had issues without Expedia booking so we called the hotel directly and he matched our lower price. They are courteous extremely helpful and overall great customer service. The red rocks are right in your face too and you can walk to restaurants nearby. Love this place!Two words... Bed bugs. Room 207. Checked out immediately. Told front desk and they relocated us to a sister property (which was great!!!) I can't make this stuff up. Check under the bed skirt at night and use your phone as a flash light. Boom!!! There they were. Nasty little blood sucking creepy crawlers. I'll have to wash all my clothes before the suitcase comes into my home. Sedona was off the charts beautiful. Pick a different hotel.We check in November 28th2015. Room is clean and front desk guy so kind. Most good point is walking distance from Bell Rock and nice view. We really enjoyed our staying and will be back next our visit.We booked the Wildflower Inn through Booking.com and the rates were very reasonable. This inn is nothing fancy so don't expect too much other than clean beds. The check-in and check-out processes were very quick which was much appreciated and the desk clerk was very friendly. The room we booked had two double queen beds and it was smaller than the pictures we saw online but who are we kidding, aren't they always a bit deceiving?? The room has just enough space for two beds, a rocking type chair, a dresser, a little walking space, and a bathroom. At first I wasn't too fond of the sink being in the same room as the beds rather than being in the bathroom, but it did end up coming in handy. One person was able to use the shower while someone else could start getting ready outside with the sink. I read some reviews where people were unsatisfied with the beds but I didn't have any issues. The beds were comfortable enough but the pillows weren't that great. They lacked fluffiness and were kinda sad. There were some stains on the floor which I wasn't sure what they were so I wore socks most of the time I was in the room. The bathroom was clean and no complaints. The shower had plenty of hot water and the water pressure was strong. Overall the room is nothing to write home about; it is a little depressing when you first walk in but it somehow grows on you. The room included continental breakfast which didn't have too much but they did have bagels, fruit, waffles, coffee, juice, etc. No eggs, sausage, bacon type of breakfast but for the price of the room I'd say it's a steal that they even include breakfast.What was so great about Wildflower Inn aside from the reasonable prices was the location. The views immediately outside were amazing; you could see Bell Rock and other rock formations. The Inn was also in a prime location since you can walk to go hiking or drive like 15 minutes (which we did because we wanted to hike at Cathedral Rock). There are plenty of places to eat that are nearby. I highly suggest eating at Red Rock Cafe and getting coffee at Firecreek. Overall I would suggest booking Wildflower Inn if you need somewhere cheap to stay in Sedona and want a clean bed. The room will not impress you but the views will and that alone was good enough for me!This was our second time staying here, and yes, we are fans.It's not the most luxurious of places, but the price is super nice and we got a room with a freaking hot tub in it. Holler! Their front desk folks are very nice and have lots of knowledge (as well they should) about the surrounding area and things to do/places to eat. Speaking of eats, they have a decent little complimentary brekky, better than your average continental crap (not just mealy red apples and bruised up bananas), they have bagels and juice and coffee and milk and WAFFLES!!!! Maybe I'm just a sucker for waffles, but hello! Not some janky Eggo business, no no, they have the real deal peeps. Anyway, to the room. The king sized bed was nice, not too hard and not too soft. There's a mini fridge and a flat screen tv, although we didn't really use either. The bathroom is kind of generic, but they offered organic shampoo, conditioner and body soap. We really loved the hot tub, so relaxing and cozy after a long day. If you're not too picky about all the glitz, I would definitely recommend this hotel for your next trip to Sedona!Mediocre. On the second floor we have one heck of a view of Bell Rock. The room is decorated nicely. The beds are very firm. The water pressure in the shower head was very low. The fan in the bath room was very loud and turned on when you turned on the light. It was annoying when i got up in the middle of the night and will most likely wake up who ever you are staying with. The air conditioning worked well and there was a gas powered fireplace. The tv had lots of channels. There was also a mini fridge and microwave in the room.Wow, What an incredible view of the red rocks from the viewing deck!!!This is a cute little hotel in a premium spot, short drive from downtown. They apparently have recently upgraded the rooms, and I loved the neat look with modern furniture, the molding on the celing, the absolutely immaculate housekeeping details.... I can go on and on. The staff was friendly and super helpful with finding local joints to eat and with all local trails and attractions. Made our stay memorable!I would recommend this hotel with no reservations and I am definitely coming back!!This place is located 6 miles from the hustle and bustle of downtown. It is right on hwy 179. The scenery is amazing from the top deck.They need to do some updates to the bathroom. The ceiling was moldy and the floors didn't seem the cleanest.The front desk people weren't the most helpful but that is ok.Breakfast was average. But there is a cafe across the street and a circle K if you get the munchies and need some nachos!
review_content_20: I stayed two nights at the Wildflower Inn recently and really enjoyed my stay. It's cost effective and the staff is very friendly. Another perk is that Bell Rock Trail is close by so you can literally walk out your door and go for a hike. Another perk of staying here is the continental breakfast. They offer bagels, fruit, waffles, coffee, juice and milk. The waffles are the real deal, too. No frozen Eggos here!A big bonus: free wi-if! Just ask the manager for the password and you're good to go!The Inn is also within walking distance of some great shopping areas and restaurants. I'll definitely be back!Clean rooms, firm beds, has burning fireplace in room, great view of the red rocks. Weak water pressure and the hot water takes a little to heat up. Great stay for 1-2 nights, wouldn't stay longer. Breakfast consisted of waffles, bagels, toast, coffee and juice; wish there would have been a bit more variety and/or something more filling.The Wildflower Inn is just OK but then again you get what you pay for.  To make this review quick:Pros and Cons (depending on your point of view and how this is written):No fan in the bathroom (steamy but quiet)Weak Wi-fi (Enjoy the outdoors and hang out by the lobby area)Very efficient air conditioner (loud white noise but kept the wine cool)Refrigerator in room (was planning to go to Circle K but a car drove through their window that night)Room is clean and no surprises here (WHEW!)We did ask for extra towels and were happily supplied.  The front desk person was helpful and pleasant.  Everything was clean and in good order.  Didn't enjoy the breakfast as we left early that morning for a tour.  Bottom Line:  It's your basic 2 star motel that is clean and the rooms are not dingy.  You're there for the night and hopefully not a romantic get-away!We stayed for one night on the 2nd floor, beautiful view, room was cleaned. Room has mini fridge, no microwave, but one in lobby, a rockin chair and flat screen tv. Also on 2nd floor was a nice viewing deck with chairs to relax and enjoy the view. B-fast was good in small area, 1 waffle maker, bagels, fruit, coffee and juices. Price was $150 total for 2 queens, usually would not pay that price, for the type of hotel, but labor day weekend and a great last minute getaway.Made a reservation online 1.5 weeks in advance, but canceled over the phone  the next day. I get a call on the day of my canceled reservation asking if I was still coming  . I explained I had canceled over a week before and not to charge my card. They did anyway.We got here at 8:30 pm after driving two hours from Grand Canyon. Very friendly front desk lady. It's a very compact room with two queen beds. Clean overall and I love they offered free WiFi. Competitive price if book through online travel website. Nice mountains/rocks view!!This is a good hotel to pick if you're looking for something simple, clean and cheap.  Because Sedona is a very small town, this place is not that close to their "downtown" area, however is close enough to their outlets!  They have some nice views of the Red Rocks, a mediocre continental breakfast (bagels and waffles), and nice customer service.  Nothing special or fancy, although at the same time, nothing gross nor a horrible experience.Very clean..  Friendly.  Up to date.  Nice breakfast of make your own waffles, fresh bagels, fresh butter, cream cheese, OJ, apple juice, fresh fruit, good coffee.  Great pizza place nearby.  I'd give a five if not by noisy freeway and had pool.  Great view!We check in June 17th and Check out 19th.We have a spacious room, a King size bed, and a nice Jacuzzi.  All these for 79.99! We enjoyed our stay in the place.Early morning we almost lock ourselves because the deadbolt wasn't working that time. Make sure this doesn't happen when front desk is only available 7am to 10pm. Their emergency phone number is in a busy mode when we made that emergency call.I was getting married on 10-10-10 in Sedona, and since I knew it would be busy I tried to getting rooms blocked off well in advance.  This location seemed ideal at the time so I called to ask about blocking some rooms.After weeks of calling and being told I needed to speak with the manager who was never there, being promised he'd call, we would get a discounted rate and rooms reserved I finally got in touch with this person who refused to block off any rooms unless I paid in full up front for each room.  Not only was I disappointed that I was now weeks behind in finding rooms, but the person I spoke to was extremely rude and practically accused me of lying.  Luckily The Views Inn was able to hook me up with the rooms and a discount! :)The Wildflower Inn...Ok yelpers. My Fiancee is an avid user of groupon, living social, deal chicken and the like. We got a stay at this hotel along with a wine tasting at a nearby local vineyard (the winery was a completely different experience and is in it's own review).  We paid for their jacuzzi suite and a wine tasting. We got a wine tasting and a key to a dirty jacuzzi suite. I'm talking windows open, lights on in the room, bed un-made, wet towels on the floor. The front desk clerk said the maids must not have serviced the room that morning and the hotel was full but that he could put us in an out-of-service room which they just had the carpet cleaned. Having no where else to go, it had to make do. Floors were wet and I had a very unhappy girl for the rest of the night (she was really looking forward to using the jacuzzi).Because we got the room through groupon they would not give us a refund for the whirlpool suite which we paid for. We instead received a free stay certificate, with the catch that it expired in 3 months and could not be used for any holidays. While I live in Phoenix and my fiancee in Tucson, needless to say we were not going to be able to use the certificate even if we would. I loved Sedona it's such a beautiful place, but the next time I go I'll be staying somewhere else.Pros:Nice locationBell Rock ViewsJacuzzi TubAffordableFree breakfastFridge in RoomPlasma TVConsNo sheer curtains so you have to use dark curtains all day unless you don't mind curious humans.Front door opens directly to the parking lot.Chair looks like it belongs to Archie Bunker.Rough dirty carpet.Bizarre Green stains at bottom of jacuzzi. Creepy looking light fixture that hangs from the ceiling.Possessed Air Conditioner that keeps you up all night.Bathroom light when turned on sounds like an jet engine.The carpet is probably softer than the sheets.Lumpy pillows.Hollow bed.This pretty much sums up why we just gave up and are now back on the road at 11:45pm to head home to Phoenix. Couldn't sleep. Office was closed. Lovely.  I guess we won't be enjoying the free breakfast.This cute little roadside motel is just that. A roadside motel. It's not the hilton or the marriot so don't expect it to be. The front desk staff checked us in and told us about the free breakfast in the AM. then we went into our room and it was clean. Had a great king bed. Our bed was firm so maybe all of the past gripes about the bed issue prompted them to buy new. We took in the view of the mountain and then shut our curtains for privacy which was ok because we only stayed in the room long enough to get ready to go out exploring and have some dinner. Not sure who comes to Sedona to sit in their room and gaze at the view but we went there to go out on the town and go hiking. The most time we spent in the room was after dinner and it was just fine for us.Only 2 small issues, we did have a few spiders crawling around, which is to be expected on a ground floor unit. And I forgot my toothbrush and even though there was a sign stating to ask if we forgot those types of items the front desk didn't have any. Other than that it was exactly as expected...it as an inexpensive roadside motel with clean sheets and a nice plasma screen TV. The tub in the room wasn't really a big draw for us because my boyfriend is 6' tall and he really couldn't fit in the tub but it was funny watching him test it out lolSo pleased we found hotel out of Sedona, great location for hiking. Hotel was clean, rooms comfortable and very quiet. Our room had a jacuzzi bath in room. Breakfast was included, just coffee, juice and donuts but keeps you going.Staff very helpful. Would certainly stay there again.I'm basing my rating on the fact that this is a roadside motel. For the price, this is a tremendous value. My room was most importantly, super clean, and secondly, actually quite spacious. It has a comfy loveseat, flat screen, mini fridge. The lady at the front desk was very informative and friendly. A real budget find.Great value and the manager was really nice and helpful at check-in.  Pay the extra $10 and you get a sweet view of Bell Rock.  Better view here than at the Hilton!!! For $120 less/ night!  Rooms are clean and seem recently updated with comfy beds.  What more do ya need?Well, I am re-entering my April review since I see it was removed...and NOT by me. The room, at best was so-so. We did not have WiFi when we first checked in, until I asked the front desk clerk, who was nice, to tweak the connection in an adjacent room until we got it. We had booked the room through a travel service at $135.92 for 2 nights and it was paid and on our credit card bill long when we checked in. Then when we checked out, the desk lady said there were no incidentals and off we went. When we checked our credit card bill, they billed us again $203.17! When I called Wildflower, they said they'd investigate & credit us back. When I checked my credit card statement a couple of days later, I saw ANOTHER bill for $203.17! That's $406.34 for a room I had already paid for long before we even got there. I got my credit card company involved and some two weeks later, including a talk with the owner, I was credited back the $406.34 and all was good.  The owner said for my troubles, he'd give me a $50 discount on my next stay with a Choice Hotel. I asked him to put it in writing. I have YET to see it but hmmm, my review had somehow been deleted. My suggestion to you all is: drive right past this place and stay elsewhere!pretty happy with my choice to stay at the wildflower. but for the price, it's a little farther out from sedona's "city center" (hence the loss of a star). but all in all, really nice place. very nice breakfast, nice rooms, free wifi, and great location to bell rock. i hiked bell rock and courthouse butte the morning of my departure from sedona and the owner let me leave my car in the parking lot so i didn't have to buy a parking pass at the trailhead (it's about a 5 min walk to the trailhead). the views are beautiful and it's only a 15-20 min ride into town. if you can get closer, maybe try but this place is very comfortable and clean.Alright, this place has the roadside motel layout where you can park right next to your door (which is a bad thing in my book), but it has a few things going for it. There's a jacuzzi in the rooms, with a plasma screen TV that can be angled toward the tub. It's also right across the street from the Bell Rock trailhead. But don't look at the picture of the pool on their website and assume they have one. You just can get access to the Hilton pool down the road, which doesn't cut it.However, I'll remember this place mostly for the noisy air conditioner, which kept us up all night and we later realized was far far noisier than the neighboring units, and the lobby clerk saying "Oh, I'll have Maintenance take a look at it", which is decidedly not the appropriate response for a couple that was already in the process of checking out.After a long day of activities in Sedona, this was a great place to stay! Right off 179A. The things that made this hotel great included,: Amazing rock views, comfortable beds, friendly front desk staff, nice contintental breakfast and a spacious room. We will come back!
review_content_40: We reserved the room from the local tv stations special deal, king size bed and jacuzzi.  When we took a shower the water didn't go down and we were standing in ankle deep water (gross); and the knobs on the jacuzzi were broken!  The view from the deck upstairs was very nice, but the patio cushions were torn and very worn! The front staff was friendly, but only there from 7am until 10pm! The hand soaps were great, smelled wonderful!  Overall not a bad place considering it is not a large chain and doesn't charge resort fees.  I would try them again.Great roadside motel. Simple, clean, friendly staff, free wifi, handy fridge, very comfy king sized bed. The jacuzzi tub was a bit small...maybe you could have crammed 2 adults but we didn't try.  It was relaxing after hiking though. We didn't have a view from the room--it just looked out at the parking lot. We'd stay here again.While the layout of the hotel is similar to a roadside motel, the rooms are very clean, updated, plama screen and all!  Fireplace, nice bedding and furniture.  Overall, a great deal.  It is about a 10 minute drive from Uptown Sedona so be ready to drive.  The hotel does have great views of Bell Rock.  Staff was friendly.So my second time around.... I booked this a little less than 24 hours so it's my fault I didn't get many options. It was decently priced and that's because I said I had AAA. I did get one of the best prices though. This place was newer. Note: You either get the room with jacuzzi or the fireplace. So if you care about that, then make sure you request either or.  It's at least 15 minutes! to Sedona downtown! I'm sorry but that was too far for me. I did like the fact that it's close to one of the vortices. View was alright.  I would stay there again but I'll check for another place first. Continental breakfast was cool that you could make your own waffles! Front desk needs to be a little bit more professional. They seem a little too young to be able to handle customer service. I overheard a couple checking out with a little complaint and front desk did not even address anything. You get what you pay for or less. Depends how much your quote is.

review_content: This review is long overdue. Stayed here on a whim, passing through town about 2 years ago. Found the place on an app, while looking for a lower priced option. Adorable spot, walking distance to shops & restaurants. Room was cute, quaint and clean. Owners were very friendly, welcoming & attentive. Fast forward 2 years, during conversation with a work colleague from Sedona, we discover the owners are long time family friends of hers. Small world. HGreat little place to stay. I booked a queen room for 1 night. This is a cozy little place to spend a weekend. It's on a residential street, and is quite for the most part. The room was a bit smaller then expected, and I believe the bed was a full, not a queen as booked. The appearance of the room was clean and well maintained. If I were to be spending multiple nights, I would have liked a larger room, but a 1 night stay was fine. The hot tub was not very hot, luke warm actually. It was not enjoyable. The whole property is non smoking, including the parking lot.Awesome awesome awesome. Why stay at a chain, when you can indulge in a lovely experience at a boutique type hotel?Dick and Misty (the owners) are very personable and involved. They have lived a heck of a life and definitely know how to accommodate. I will return and would highly recommend this place. Excellent location and ownership.Beware. Even though I only made my reservation two days ago for a November stay Misty the owner still charged a 10% cancelation fee. That's 10% of our entire stay!. We were so looking forward to our visit but due to circumstances beyond our control we had to cancel.What could the 10% possibly be for? Just a money grab. Definitely will not be staying there on our next visit.Cute little hidden place on a quiet residential street. Very close to grocery stores and shopping. Very clean and tidy rooms. I slept great in the super comfortable bed and was pleased that the bathroom was so big with a big shower and lots of counter space! Pretty little yard and owners were so cute and sweet. Very enjoyable stay!Very quaint little B&B in a quiet area. Rooms are small but they are clean. Two waffle pattern white bathrobes are in the rooms which is nice for the hot tub. Boyfriend and I wanted a little getaway for Thanksgiving weekend. checked in on thanksgiving afternoon and the person at he desk, James, was very pleasant and helpful. We needed to move our dinner reservations to an hour later and James offered to call the restaurant for us. He was able to change he reservations for us which was very nice. We didn't feel like having takeout dinner in our room. The hot tub closes too early (9 pm tonight) in my opinion but maybe it is early because of the holiday. The office has classic old VHS movies you can watch in the rooms. OK, OK so the Tube tv and VCR in the room is a little crusty and from the 90s but I am paying to get away a few days, not to sit on my duff and watch HD TV.Only complaint is the room we stayed in seemed like you could hear everything. There was a man in the next room who talked so loudly two mornings in a row I thought he was in the same room. Maybe he just is a loud talker but dang at 6am!?! The hotel is owned by Dick Curtis and he was there the morning we checked out. He was telling a story about Desi Arnaz to a group of people when I picked up some fruit in the lobby. When I checked out he autographed a glossy pic he gave me, nice man. They don't serve a cooked breakfast FYI- it is just yogurt, fresh fruit, muffins, coffee and tea. Overall I'd recommend this place to anyone looking for a quiet getaway.I booked a room at the Baby Quail for the same night on Booking.com. Booking.com messed up my reservations and the lady in the front office that works in the AM made a call and fixed everything. She is awesome. The motel is right off the main hway on a residential street. Very quiet though. The parking lot is very small.The grounds are immaculate. Its a small 2 story building with about 12 rooms. Reminds me more of a bed and breakfast then a motel/hotel.When we went to check in around 4pm, nobody was at the front desk. A maid that didnt seem to speak english, walked in and out looking at us but not saying anything. Finally after the maid walked in a third time we told her we need to check in. She went and found the evening front desk lady. The front desk lady finally came into the office. Not friendly and said sorry i was fixing something for another guest. And immediately asked our name. She quickly gave us a key. We had to ask her where the room was located and a few other things. She wasnt friendly.The room was small but very clean. I mean REALLY clean and organized. They really made an effort to remember the small things and the finishing touches. The room had 2 robes, luggage rack, soft and firm pillows, fan, window a/c, large bathroom and shower, little coffee pot, iron, mini fridge and small flat screen tv with cable. The queen bed was very hard and uncomfortable and you sink to the middle of the bed. Not good when 2 are trying to sleep. The room we were in was downstairs, room 3. We heard the older people above us the whole time. They must of had a hard bed too because they were up all night walking and moving around. They were not loud. I believe its just an old building and you can hear everything downstairs. So we didnt get a good sleep.But the grounds were very quiet and beautiful. Very relaxing and lush with trees, bushes, and plants. They have a hot tub and fountain in the courtyard along with some lounge chairs and tables.I dont smoke, but if you do, this place isnt for you. No smoking in rooms or anywhere on the property. If you do, your card will be charged 300.00. They have it written in the checkin paperwork.Also they do not allow pets.They offer a small breakfast bar in the am from 8am to 11am.Dry cereal, oatmeal, fruit, yogert, muffins, oj tea hot chocolate and coffee. Nothing fancy but it fills the hole until lunchtime.The owner, was a hollywood actor who played bit parks in movies. He is 87 now and hangs out in the breakfast room waiting for the guests to come in.Once he sees you, he asks where you are from and then starts to tell you about his life in film. He tells everyone the same story word by word. He has the walls of the breakfast room plastered with photos of himself and he enjoys telling you about them all.He then will try to sell you a 20.00 book about himself.He stands around in the breakfast room waiting for the next guest to tell the same memorized story to while watching you eat.After a terrible night sleep, i really wasnt into being forced into hearing about someones life story.But others may enjoy that kind of thing. When we left, the owner gave me a signed autograph. PROS: The room was cheaper and cleaner than your basic economy motel in the area. And the grounds were beautiful and immaculate. Big bathroom and shower. Quick check out.CONS: Terribly hard bed, Small room, No pets allowed, Owners forced song and dance first thing in the am. Lots of rules printed, posted and verbally noted.My hubby and I came here on our first visit to Sedona for 3 nights. Based on reviews, I booked this spot 'cause, you know, we're on a budget and it seemed like it was a good deal considering how expensive things get around here. We loved it! Friendly staff, VHS tapes, good location (we walked to many restaurants to get food and drinks and it's a short drive to downtown) and a nice outdoor area to relax in. We even locked ourselves out of our room at 9:30 PM and one of the owners graciously and effortlessly drove over and gave us another key, all smiles. It's also very close to Red Rock State Park, Soldiers Pass Trail, Cresent Moon/Red Rock Crossing, and others.If you're looking for a clean place to rest your head after a long day of hiking and exploring, this is the place. Grab a VHS and some wine and enjoy!We loved this place. It was VERY quiet. We loved all the chairs in the cool garden area. The hot tub was a GODSEND after the Jeep tour. Breakfast was simple but filling. The owners were pleasant and helpful. Yes the rooms are not huge but who spends a ton of time in your room in Sedona? They were clean and comfy and great to come back to. We will definiately be back. If you have a choice between chain type hotels and this place you are missing out if you don't check it out!I recently moved across the country so my friend and I decided to make a cross-country road trip out of it. We were at the Grand Canyon when we realized that all hotels between there and Zion, our expected next day adventure, were booked. I was totally bummed, but fate took over and we rather accidentally ended up in Sedona. Thanks to the great energy, amazing views, thrilling mountain drive, and the Baby Quail Inn, it ended up being our favorite part of the whole trip!I think other raters summed this place up very well: it's cozy; owned by a couple, the gentleman who was a Hollywood actor in the 60s, and whose adorable Bichon comes to hang out during the day; there's a nice hottub with beautiful views of the night sky; the bathrooms are very large; the whole place is very clean; free breakfast and VHS tapes (love it!); and most importantly, it's all extremely affordable! I could go on and on about this place, but I think you get the point. Just stay here, you won't regret it (unless, of course, you prefer to stay in stuffy places like the Ritz).Great little inn. The office staff was very friendly and knowledgeable. You must meet the owner, Dick Curtis, His stories are pretty impressive. Rooms are a good size, very clean. Would recommend this place highly for a great stay in sedona.Went to Sedona with my boyfriend for a quick trip and last minute decided to stay the night. The innkeeper was super nice and welcoming and our room was comfortable and clean. The continental breakfast in the morning was supplemented by Dick Curtis and his tales of his days in show business. Overall wonderful.Nice looking small inn tucked a short distance off the main street which keeps the road noise almost none existent. Small breakfast in the morning but had enough to satisfy our hunger. Great selection of classic VHS movies to play in your room. The neighbouring rooms had good soundproofing however the rooms on the second floor did not, could hear the people above us walking around all night very clearly. Good location to a number of restaurants.What a great place! First impression when we got here was the property is very nicely maintained and surrounded by pine trees for a very private feeling. Lots of outdoor furnishings with a cozy hot tub. Check -in was fast and easy. Our room was very nice. It appears to be newly remodeled because the paint on walls was very clean, the rug is very clean with no signs of wear and the bathroom has clean up to date tile. The bed was extremly comfortable (very soft just the way we like it) with quality linens. There were extra pillows and blanket in the closet which was thoughtful and appreciated as my husband and I always sleep with 2 pillows each and I with extra blankets. There were even robes in the closet. The room has a table with 2 chairs, a microwave, mini fridge, and a coffee maker in the bathroom. The bathroom was very roomy with a large shower; there probably was once a tub in its place based on its size. The room itself is not large but totally adequate. In the morning we had the continental breakfast which had more than expected; cinnamon rolls, large muffins, cereal, oatmeal, hard boiled eggs, yogurt, fruit, orange juice and coffee. The owners and employees are very polite and friendly. The room rate was very affordable in comparison to other available lodging. We will certainly stay here again in the future.My friend and I stayed here after a day of hiking in Sedona and we had plans to leave very early the next morning. The Baby Quail Inn was PERFECT for this reason. It's a small inn owned by an older couple. They are extremely nice and they provide continental breakfast each morning. Upon check-in we we're greet by a very nice older woman and I am ashamed to say I do not know her name. She informed us of their no smoking policy which is AWESOME and that they also have VHS tapes that we can rent and bring back to our room for no charge. Nice little perk! She also gave us a yummy cookie. This was my first encounter of how they pay attention to personal detail. Our room smelled and looked clean, and was cool upon walking in, not musty like a lot of hotel rooms I have been in before. There was a red washcloth in the bathroom with a tag that instructed us that it was to wipe out shoes with. How perfect since mine were covered in the red dust of Sedona from hiking all day! Again, personal detail and a nice touch. There were also your basic amenities except there were also makeup removing wipes! Again, more detail :)The room had a mini fridge, microwave, tv, VCR, coffee machine and coffee supplies also. Extra pillows and a blanket were also in the closet. Overall, I recommend this inn if you need a nice, quiet, clean, and functional place to say. It served it's purpose for us and I would definitely stay here again!We loved coming to this Inn. It is tucked away, so it's easy to miss when you drive by but it keeps things pretty quiet. The staff was nice, and everything was really clean. We will definitely be staying here next time we go to Sedona. Make sure that you stay for breakfast here and meet one of the owners, Dick Curtis.My boyfriend and I had a really great experience here. Dick Curtis is very hospitable and the rooms were clean. The price point was great. It's also not very far from up town. We enjoyed this small quote property. It was tucked away in a little neighborhood. We will definitely stay there again.Was drawn to this Inn only for the price, and it was a great decision to stay here. The owner's and staff were friendly and the room was very clean. A great place to stay in Sedona!Really enjoyed this place! Dick Curtis is a hoot. You can find him in the breakfast room every morning (telling the same stories). The rooms are clean, basic rooms. It's right across the street from a Whole Foods and the microwave and refrigerator are a nice touch, as are the complementary robes. Rooms are ample and clean. the whole place has a very homey feel.A great little hidden gem of a place! Stayed here last weekend and had a wonderful time. The owners are very nice and I enjoyed talking to them the morning we checked out. They've got a breakfast and the coffee was very tasty.The price is definitely nice and the rooms and grounds are clean and well taken care of. The only bad thing was that we attempted to sit outside and talk and apparently we were being too loud. I think that because the place is so small, the noise travels.....so we moved! No harm, no foul. But it is a tiny place.Location is great and I loved the idea of being able to borrow VHS tapes to watch in the room.Suggestions: Post somewhere what time the office will be closing, so that you don't miss out on getting a video. And, offer guests the password to login for the Wi-Fi.Other than that, awesome stay! Clean, comfortable and great location!
review_content_20: Searching for a place to stay as a solo traveler to Sedona, AZ, this place is a bargain. While staying in Sedona, you don't spend much time in your hotel room, but rather enjoying to sights! Stay at Baby Quail Inn if you're searching for economy priced accommodations with friendly service, extremely clean rooms and free breakfast! I'd recommend this place without reservations! I had a very pleasant stay, and would return again. Thank you!This place is fantastic! Very clean and extremely friendly staff. It's super affordable and within walking distance of a lot of great Sedona restaurants as well as Oak Creek Brewery. It's got a hot tub out front as well. The breakfast isn't much, just beverages, fruit and pastries. This was my first time staying here and I'll definitely stay here next time I'm in Sedona.This place is awesome. It has so much character. Yes, it is more of a motel, but the price is unbelievable for the location and for Sedona. Our beds were comfortable and for an older place, it was quiet. We were even on the first floor corner room and still weren't bothered by people walking by. The man who runs it is awesome. He is 86 and a retired actor. I would love to hear all of his stories, but for ease, he has a wall set up with all his memorabilia so you can glance while you eat the continental bfast. They have a nice hot tub and on saturday morning, there is an art show right through the parking lot. We walked to eat and to the art show- location was awesome. I am going to stay here every time I come to Sedona!I will keep it simple with a list of pros and consProsClose to allQuiet areaNice ownersHelpful info about areaConsVHS player and micro TV (VHS, really?)Needs longer jacuzzi hoursShower/bath combo made for oompa loompasRooms are kind of cramped for two peopleDon't expect a continental breakfastThe price a little high for what it is. I wouldn't say it was horrible, because you really shouldnt expect much, but I wish it could have been a bit better. I would choose somewhere else if I chose to visit Sedona again.I felt like i was staying at my grandparents house for the weekend.  You will enjoy breakfast whether you eat or not.  I will always recommend anyone to stay there!!!We stayed at the Baby Quail for three nights last week; two nights in room #4 (downstairs) and one night in room #5 (upstairs). The price is right, no doubt, and the rooms and bathrooms are clean and functional enough. Still, I would have preferred to pay a little more for a slightly better experience. The king bed in room #4 is lumpy, but much softer/better than the extremely hard, sloping queen mattress in room #5, which left me with two days of back pain. If you're downstairs you can hear people walking above you, but it's not terrible--I'd take the better mattress. Temperature control in both rooms was difficult--it was mostly too hot. On our last night, a Saturday, there was a loud party going on somewhere nearby. We couldn't figure out if it was a house party on Willow or maybe noise coming from Olde Sedona, but it was so bad I eventually called the police at around 2AM. The owners are sweet and helpful. Hearing the "60 years in 60 seconds" history of Dick's career--followed by the long version and then book pitch--wasn't really my thing at the crack of dawn, but I probably would have been more game if I'd gotten a wink of sleep the night before!We decided to stay here based on the price and reviews, and I'm glad we did; this place was great! We originally booked 2 nights, but ended up staying 4 nights because we loved Sedona so much! Our room was very nice with a big bathroom. The only downside was that the bed sagged quite a bit in the middle, but we slept well despite that, and the body shop next door was a bit noisy at times. The staff was great; they offered great advice on restaurants and hiking trails. Overall an awesome place, highly recommended!Absolutely perfect experience. Room was completely clean, complimentary robes, etc. Breakfast was outstanding, and Mr. Curtis is extremely friendly and attentive. I recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to Sedona on a budget.The gf and I stayed here after the drive from San Diego.  It was perfect. Super homey and they had a hot tub. Clean and toasty. Rooms are basic but with everything you need and great bathrooms. Met the owners in the morning and had a blast talking with them. The place is walking distance to the Red Planet Diner, one of my favorite little guilty pleasures when in Sedona. All in all, a great place with cool peeps you want to support.  Really good price too. Do it.We were happy to find this cute place, off a main road yet tucked away from it all. We stayed here for two nights in December, just before Christmas.After reading what others had written, we got a room on the second floor and had no complaints with noise. Pros:- Getting to meet Dick Curtis & have him explain the collages of his performance life on the walls of the breakfast room- Very pleasant, helpful service- Large bathrooms- VHS tapes to borrow (we actually enjoyed this and watched The Thin Man & On Golden Pond)- Fridge & microwave in the room- Jacuzzi with a view of the trees and the stars - although it was in the 30s, we put on our complimentary bathrobes over our swimsuits and took a nice dip here-Complimentary breakfast-A reasonable amount of outlets for electronic appliances- Across the street from New Frontiers Natural Marketplace (kind like a whole foods - you can pick up sandwiches etc. from their deli)- Good locationCons:-Breakfast is simple: oatmeal packets, pre-packaged pastries, fruit, coffee, tea-My husband thought the bed was old and uncomfortable-Price is a little high, but seems to be a decent deal by Sedona standardsI loved this little place! First, the family who owns it is so nice and helpful. They have breakfast such as yogurt, fruit and cereals in the morning, and what's even better is they have some classic VHS videos if you find yourself hanging in for the night! It's a mile away from the main strip of shopping, so easy access to everything. This is not some fancy hotel, so don't expect it to be. If you're a little quirky and like things a little less mainstream, this is the place to be! Enjoy!Given that this was a last minute booking in the middle of December,  we were pleased with our choice to stay here. I got my booking done through expedia and thankfully got to the motel before their closing time which is around 7 I believe. So call this make sure you're not late. We were greeted that evening by a very pleasant young lady. She helped us by answering questions on what to do, see and eat that night. The room was decently sized and clean. We didn't get cold that night either. The next morning we got to traipse up the airport mesa for a gorgeous sunrise. At breakfast we were fortunate enough to meet the owner. He is a famous film star from the 60's by the name of Dick Curtis. Great man! Overall we enjoyed our stay.It's great for the price. It has all your basic needs and it's super clean. Cozy and peaceful.We made reservations for Thursday, but had to postpone at 3pm the day of. We counted on eating the money, but called and they allowed us to reschedule with no problem. Unusual, but appreciated. We arrived on thanksgiving day at 4pm. There was an envelope taped to the office door with our name on it. My wife said that was the most painless check in she ever experienced. The room was small and the bathroom was huge. Seemed like a waste really. The place was immaculate and cozy with charming decor. The grounds look neat with several patio sets throughout. We stayed ok the second floor (rooms 5-8 I think). Not much of a view (for Sedona), next time I thinly we will opt for the lower level.Solid 4! This place is pretty simple, but personally I really like it that way. It's in a great location, near all the action, yet somehow manages to keep a pretty quiet and serene atmosphere. The zen-like lounging area and hot tub helps a lot!The room was a decent size, nothing huge, but had plenty of room for two even with all our hiking gear. Everything was incredibly clean. The bed's a good size too. I wouldn't have complained if the mattress itself were a little softer, but neither of us had any trouble sleeping. There are plenty of extra pillows, too!The bathroom is super cute, and had every amenity I wanted (blow dryer, shampoo/lotion set, towels). Most importantly, the water pressure in the shower was pretty good. Showers without good water pressure are always a fear of mine in new hotels, so I was relieved when this one felt just fine.Other perks? Complimentary breakfast, free wifi, the service was great and we had a fridge and microwave, which is actually really good for restaurant leftovers. For the price, I think you'd have trouble finding something that compares. Definitely will return!Nice people and great price for the area.  Comfy beds to sleep because the town closes at 9. Big bathroom and very clean.This place would have been MUCH better with a new mattress and later hot tub hours. We stayed in that same room as the photos and you can clearly see how awful that bed is. I wished I had slept on the floor.one other thing... this town dies after 8pm. Everyone here is afraid of vampires.They seem to take pride in being "Pet Free". Not for animal and wildlife lovers.Stayed here last weekend for a quick getaway with the bf and was very happy we did.  While the room was on the smaller size it had everything we needed, was decorated wonderfully and very clean.  It is walking distance or a short drive to everything and because it it not right in the middle of the action it is quiet and peaceful place.  I had the pleasure of meeting Mr. Curtis in the morning and his stories, smile and genuine warmth made my day.  A great place that I would stay at again.Loved staying here! Comfortable rooms with huge bathrooms, very friendly staff, hot tub open late at night, and generous continental breakfast.
review_content_40: I stayed here for 5 nights and was very pleased. We had a nice sized room with a great bathroom. The bed wasn't as bad as other commenters say!! The owner of the inn is super friendly and very kind. A real treat to talk to. And I enjoyed that it's on the west end of town on a quiet street. When I go back to Sedona, I will be staying here!!Very warm and clean Inn in the heart of Sedona. Off the main street so the night is pretty much noiseless. This Inn has two floors with about 18 rooms, a heated jacuzzi outside, and a BBQ area. We stayed in a room with a king size for about $50 a night (it was early February). The rooms have your usual- a coffee maker, TV, microwave, table, mini-fridge etc. Mattress could have been a bit better as the middle kind of sank. Overall, nice experience. Wouldn't mind staying here again!The Baby Quail Inn was quiet, quaint, and located on the quieter side of Sedona. The room was spacious and the bathroom was great! Free breakfast in the morning as well. Overall, very great little inn, I will definitely stay here again if I'm ever in Sedona.

review_content: Hotel prices in Sedona are on the higher side so and this was more on our buget for our family of 4. We only needed comfy beds and a clean bathroom since our plan was to eat out and spend all day at slide rock. This hotel is about a 3-5 minute drive from old town which was perfect because it was really busy when we went (cowboy day...which was actually all weekend). There are plenty of dining options, grocery stores, a few churches near by and a circle k across the street for late night snacks. Friendly staff, clean and quiet grounds, decent breakfast and nice size pool for relaxing. My only negative side to the review isn't a deal breaker for next time. Bring your own swimming towels from home. The ones they provide are fit for a 2yr old. Also, pay attention to the bed description. They are DOUBLE'S. Comfy but smaller than most. There was no way my husband and I could peacefully sleep together so we each shared a bed with one of our boys . To me that was a plus since it's no longer cool to sleep with mom. :)We would stay there again and recommend it to others.My husband and I booked a room here on our most recent trip to Sedona, and had a pleasant stay. The room was only $83 for the night (Thanks Groupon!), and included free parking, free Wi-Fi, and free breakfast from 6:30 to 9:30 AM. The breakfast buffet was a solid spread of oatmeal, waffles, cereal, yogurt, and hard-boiled eggs. Our room was clean, and had a mini fridge and coffee maker. The location is great! The hotel is close to a Safeway, Starbucks, gas station, and several local eateries. The front desk staff was accommodating, and we were able to check-in early and check-out late at no extra charge. This is a dog friendly hotel, with ample space to walk your dog in the grassy area outside. There is a $25 pet fee, which covers two dogs. My only complaint is that the shampoo dispenser was empty in the shower. We would definitely stay here again!Awful! First things first we planned on traveling with our pets we called in advance to see if this hotel was pet friendly the woman I spoke to said yes and there was a designated dog area.!Great so we get there and we get informed pets are not allowed to be in the rooms unattended! Are you joking me we only booked this room since it was pet friendly, the designated dog area is not even fenced! The air conditioning did not work at all!!! Horrible.. The maids were super sweet though!Excellent location, really nice room, noisy, but a great deal with lovely views in beautiful Sedona (especially if you get a groupon like we did). Pros:- Surprisingly nice room with a large comfy bed, a mini fridge, a giant TV, a comfy chair and a work desk - the room is definitely more hotel than motel. - The breakfast area is large and has lots of seating, but we never made it during serving time to see the selection. Cons:- The hallways of rooms are definitely the seediest aspect of this place, but they do have a key-card lock on the doors to get into them.- It's Super noisy - dogs barking, kids yelling, cars, etc. My husband and I didn't mind a bit, but in case you do, it's important to know.We stayed here this past weekend and found this "budget" brand to be quite nice. Sedona rates are a bit higher x summer x weekend making this not so budget. It was still a decent rate considering; and I got a last minute same day reservation.. It's right on one of the main drags through town and close to some restaurants and shops. The front desk personnel were polite, and accommodating. They offered discounts through several programs unsolicited and I was able to get 10% off. The grounds and the rooms were clean. The pool was functional and packed. We didn't use that but it looked very well kept. It was pretty warm but the air worked perfectly (you'd be surprised at how many places don't). The bathroom was clean and had updated fixtures. Beds, linens, towels, and room were all clean and pretty well kept. A little bit dated, and small; but there was a tiny fridge and pod coffee pot. They serve continental breakfast with a little dining area too.I was pleasantly surprised and would stay here again!This room is very decent for the price. It includes a fridge, coffee maker, a 32" LCD TV, a closet unit, secured free WiFi (very slow), and a blow dryer for the ladies and some fellas out there! The area where this hotel is situated is very clean with great views. The only negative I've found thus far will be the lack of power coming from the shower. It's a pretty weak stream but it does get very hot.This will probably be my go to spot whenever I'm in Sedona, AZ.Obviously there are posh options in Sedona. If you're looking for an affordable way to visit the Red Rocks, then this is a nice option. We opted for two double beds, which isn't a huge room but it doesn't feel cramped with the additional furniture. The TV is large if you're going to do any watching while you're there. There's stowage places for your gear so it's not right in the middle of the floor. The fridge is a decent size, too. Our view from the window on the back side of the hotel looked out over houses and into the rocks. Pretty excellent for a Super 8.The sheets are not heavy and the blanket at the bottom is more like a table runner, so if you get cold or visit during the cooler seasons you may want to ask for additional cover.The pool is a little small if there's a bunch of people enjoying the water, but the pool area and seating is clean and access to the pool requires a room key.I got this room at a good rate with Priceline.com. Later I called and ask if I could stay for a second night and they gave it to me at the same good rate. $25 one time pet fee for the entire stay. A continental breakfast had the basics, nothing good. Coffee was ok. The people are great, polite and the maintenance guy I called to fix the he TV (which he did quickly) got all my jokes. I think this place was awesome for the price!The hiking trails are all within walking distance..., lol!Pros: - affordable price- very clean- comfortable- close to alot of restaurants and main streets- continental breakfastCons:- thin walls so you can hear people talking outside in the hallways- there were no thick blankets in the rooms (I guess you can always ask the front desk for some). Would I stay here again? Most definitely.I was very impressed with this hotel! I usually stay at Hilton or Hyatt properties, but had free nights here from business travels. I was a litle worried, as Super 8 is not usually very nice. But this place has been redone recently and was clean, comfy beds. Nice front desk lady. Pool was clean.Only negatives: no protein on the breakfast at all. No eggs, yogurt, nothing. All carbs. Also the air worked awesome. But it was loud. I'm a heavy sleeper, so it didnt bother me, but hubby said it bothered him.The room layout and bed was good. Bed was firm and clean. The place is dated but does not smell like a old motel. Good cheap place to stay for 1 night. Breakfast was BAD. No quality selection and food was cold. The biggest issue was the AC unit and mechanical noise. VERY noisy and ongoing all night. I suggest paying a little more for a lodge across the airport that is 100% better.As a person who likes to travel on budget hotels with good quality this was one of them! (4.5 stars really) Purchased as a groupon and was only under about $90, although it will be changing its name from super 8 to another name soon. The views around the area are breath taking and the front desk was kind enough to give us a map of the city and told us scenic places to visit. Also breakfast has a pretty good selection with the staff always accommodating if certain items are out. From waffles, yogurt, bananas, oatmeal, cereal, cinnamon roll bags, toast to the drinks coffee, orange juice, apple juice, and even HOT COCOA! (Yum!)I travel allot for work and usually avoid the super 8. Nothing fancy but the rooms were clean and updated. Decent pool and facilities. If this was a Hilton I would have given it only 2 stars. This was above average for a super 8, thats why I gave it 4 stars.Yep, a very inexpensive place to crash, but honestly the room was very clean. Rooms are a bit thin walled, so not the quietest of places. The guy at the counter (Nick?) was super friendly and helpful. There is a Circle K directly across the street and in the other direction (still just across the street) about 1 light away there is a pretty nice Safeway.Horrible room and service!!! Our room was leaking, and I mean full-on shower leaking! Front desk could care less and said too bad! Grrrrrr!Great room for a great price! We were here for the weekend for a wedding and got this deal last minute through Priceline. All the hotels in the area were $175+ per night and we came up under $120! I was skeptical about staying in a "2 star" hotel but we had a great experience overall. The room was clean and had a brand new updated bathroom. There was a large flat screen TV, which was better quality than our relatives staying at the Orchards Inn. The beds were comfortable, there was a coffee machine, microwave, and fridge as well as hair dryer in the bathroom. The hotel is clearly older, there are stucco ceilings and plaster walls with limited electrical outlets. The walls are thin and you can hear muffled noise in the room next door as well as housekeeping in the hallways. Also, a lot of light comes in under the door and thru the window, despite the curtains, but we are heavy sleepers and didn't mind too much. Best part was the fact we were on the third floor and had an amazing view of the mountains!If you have dogs and want a mountain view room, they will not tell you until after you book your room. Then they will upgrade your room to a downstairs room at the back of the motel with views of the parking lot.This place is horrible!!!! Got a room on the 3rd floor and all we heard was the fan in the roof all night. The place had a really bad odor in the common areas and the rooms also. After my first night of no sleep I had to fight to get my money back for our second night. The breakfast was horrible. The police woke us up at 2:30 am looking for someone. I will never stay at a crappy 8 ever again!!!!!This is probably lowest price hotel around that area. Its every convenience and close by following-Cafe restaurant front hotel - show room key and get 15% off-Circle K gas station - across street - walking distance-Barking Frog Grille Restaurant - across street next to Circle K-Crescent Moon Ranch at Red Crossing - Cathedral Rock Trail - 5 to 7 mins drive-Devil Bridge Trail - 5 mins drive-Main Street on Sedona - 5 mins driveService is okay-Front desk is very helpful with question like hiking trial -Hiking trail map is available on front desk - just ask for it-Breakfast is okay. Waffle, Bread, Pasties in bag, banana, cereal, yogurt, coffee, milk, orange & apple juice There are lady there to clean and stock up whatever is low.. if you like her service there are tip jar on counterRooms-3 Floors-Clean, neat and new-mini fridge-TV-free wifiI used hotwire and used their secret deal and got Super 8 in Sedona. I was a little nervous since it was a motel and wasn't sure how nice it would be. It was a good location, the room was pretty nice and clean and they had free breakfast. If I go back to Sedona I would stay here again.
review_content_20: This Super 8 location is truly a gem.  You'll easily find yourself paying much more elsewhere for the value you'll get here.  Kudos to the Management of this location for attention to detail placed on all key aspects of the hotel experience.  Rooms are clean, stocked with high-quality linens, towels and modern furnishings. The same can be said about the bathroom.  Other nice features are pet-friendly rooms, fully functional Wifi and a flat screen Tv.  Basically, the rooms do not at all seem like something you'd expect at a Super8- by this I mean the rooms are nicer than what you'd think.  I've now visited this location for two consecutive years during the Thanksgiving holiday and am convinced this is one of the better deals in town at under $100/night.I will never again stay at this fleabag hotel first of all our toilet ran all night and I brought it to the managers attention and they said they would fix it they didn't my husband had to go to the restroom the next day and the toilet got clogged and they blamed us really,  there is other places to stay in Sedona that are much better quality spend the money because I wish I would've spent the extra $50 and got a triple a rating instead this place.. I should've paid attention to the reviews before the manager the front desk and everybody else all the other minions that work there do not care it's all about money to them . I will be sending a letter to their corporate office but again I doubt that helps if you go read super eight complaint department it's really bad. And then general manager Anthony what a joke . He just sent me an email blaming my husband again for the toilet being clogged, accusing me of trying to get a discount all I did was ask do they except AAA discount obviously they don't you have to be a triple a hotel to offer that avoid at all cost there's so many other places to stay in SedonaGood location, clean rooms, nice and helpful staff and good priced!!! Free breakfast in the morning is always a plus too!!!We stayed here in the begging of January 2014 and I am beyond impressed!!! The price is more than perfect and the rooms are very clean. The staff is also super friendly. I didn't have a problem with customer service, we even decided to stay a few extra nights and they were great at accommodating for us. If you're visiting Sedona on a budget then this is the perfect place to stay. It's super close to Uptown and there's a ton of nearby hiking trails. They even have a grill and picnic area for hotel use. The free breakfast is pretty basic but it's free so I wasn't expecting much. They have cereal, coffee, cinnamon rolls, juice, fruit, yogurt, oatmeal and waffles. Sorry if this was too long but I like to be detailed because that's what I look for in other reviews.the front desk was super nice guy i believe his name was phillip or joseph. he knows the area well and his recommendations were spot on. he helped us w hiking and p;laces to eat. we came with no plans or schedule so it was perfect. also our standard two bed room was definitely way better than the budget room idea. it was newly renovated clean and smelled great. nothing was like we thought. it was wayyyy wayy better! also bonus free breakfast. and the location is perfect. we saw mountinas every where!! definitely choose this place!!!We recently stayed here. The room was clean. The facilities were well maintained. We have stayed at many places in Sedona but this has to be the best bargain in town. Our room actually had a nice view of coffee pot rock.. The best part was the young lady at the front desk, Dasia. She gave us a warm welcome and was very pleasant throughout our stay.The hotel is exactly what you get for the price: tiny rooms, paltry breakfast. That's ok. It's the employees that were so rude and made the hotel awful. Woke up early (at 4 am) and wanted to sit in the 24-HOUR lobby and read since the room was too small and would have woke everyone else up. The night clerk had the lobby locked, didn't want to let me in and finally when she did she said she wouldn't make coffee, or give me a cup of water, nor would she let me turn on the light. Seriously? The door battery died on the morning we were checking out and the clerk wouldn't call maintenance or do anything to help us- she said we just had to leave our door open as we loaded up luggage etc. Who leaves their door open and unlocked? Why would I do that? And she was so RUDE about it. Don't stay here.Room is clean enough but our toilet is clogged twice, even after they fix it. Breakfast room is always full and the food is average. You get what you paidGood location, very clean and reasonable. Manager is very understanding with a situation that existed for us. We will stay again!Rooms.are clean.  Breakfast is bear minimum.  Cinnamon roll is good. Nothing to speak of other than rolls. They were doing some construction so don't try to sleep in.Meh is right.Neither the AC nor fan worked in our stifling hot room.
