The lady who checked us out was less than sympathetic. The room eventually cooled down with the window open, but what's the point of having a thermostat in the room if it doesn't do anything.The room was very nicely furnished and clean, but  when the primary purpose of a hotel is to have a place to get a good night's sleep, Super 8 missed the mark here.My friend and I were stranded in Sedona past the time our funds allowed due to car problems. I looked online and came across $75 a night and that fit properly into our tiny budget. I figured clean sheets, shower and a pool for $75 a night I shouldn't complain...but WHOA! our room was beyond lovely and clean, they have a nice little "proper" continental breakfast that covers all of the basic food groups, and the staff is quite friendly. I was SUPER DUPER impressed!Way to go Super 8!Me likey!Yahoo or Google had a bunch of negative reviews, so I was a bit cautious, but booked it anyway. I ended up extending my stay for 7 nights because I love it here. Okay, I think that it had a lot of lousy reviews a FEW YEARS AGO because it probably was lousy, hehe. BUT, that was before the renovations! I am very happy with my room, the bathroom amenities, the comfy bed, the little fridge, the clean and new lobby and with friendly front desk people, especially lovely Ruth. The most wonderful surprise was a brand spanking new bathroom including a bathtub which was a life saver after all the hours long hikes and walking that I did all around Sedona. I really like it here and am getting a great vibe, very casual, light and unintrusive. I plan to book this place again, and I'll def be back in Sedona! Tomorrow I'm going on the Ye Old UFO Store UFO Sighting Tour!!!! I'll let you know how it went too!!!Thee is a Safeway/Starbucks, Jose Cafe (voted best homecooking for a few years in the row), right across.   Breakfast is served for free. Nothing stellar, but orange and apple juice, toasted waffles, apples, bread for toast, boiled eggs, butter, jam, etc. And some cereal - in containers and in packages, both. Coffee and Tea is available 24/7! Trust this place, everybody here looks happy, and so am I.A good friend of mine stayed here in March--the room was small but very nice. (He as mad it wasn't cheaper. Hello--this is Sedona!) The free breakfast was God awful, the worst I have EVER had at any motel, but the staff were fine. Personally for low cost I would stay at the White House Inn, but this is realty close to my house, Not bad at all, in my opinion.I am writing this review on their service alone, as I haven't actually stayed at the hotel.  I booked a room through Hotwire (first and last time ever), ended up being placed here.  The "Hot Rate" was 50% off a $215 room.  This room was booked at $107, which is actually full price.  But that's another review.  Reached out via email to the hotel to determine what kind of room was booked because we are traveling with an infant and wanted to make sure there was room for my little guy as the hotel website didn't say anything about these accommodations.  The GM emailed me back same day (on a Sunday), let me know he was glad I contacted him, there is not, in fact, room in the Single queen room Hotwire had contracted for me, and since it was booked at full price, I could call Hotwire and be refunded and cancel the reservation.  He made arrangements with the front desk to be prepared to cancel my reservation when the representative from Hotwire called.  For this reason, I will consider this hotel in the future when I travel to Sedona and I need a reasonably priced room, and not as much space.If your looking for a one night stay in filth this is your place. Everything is out-dated and over priced. Continental breakfast was so gross my eat anything husband couldn't find one thing besides the cereal that was edible (milk was warm). Coffee tasted 2 days old and juices were basically water. The walls in the hotel room itself looked as though it hadn't been painted since it was built. Carpet was filthy, shower curtain looked as though it had mold and soap scum from previous guests. For the same price we paid for the room we got here we stayed at a 5 star resort up the street the other 2 nights.Yes, I agree this place is a  bit too pricey for a Super 8, but it's also the cleanest, most comfortable Super 8 I have ever visited!The lobby has a computer for guests; the room had a fridge, super-good central heat (not one of those loud wall units), and a giant bathroom with hair drier.The bed, sheets, pillows, and towels were all plush and like new.  The service was outstanding.The only downside was the continental breakfast, which was flavorless and unappetizing, even moreso than most continental breakfasts.After seeing the low rating here on Yelp, I was a bit worried about this one.  I have been to other Super 8's that were pretty dodgy.  However, this visit taking place on Thanksgiving in a touristy town, AND traveling with a dog proved difficult to find an affordable lodging option.  Super 8 fit the bill.  We arrived and were warmly welcomed by the front desk staff.  The room was small but newly furnished, super clean and the bathroom and walk-in shower were huge.  Quiet and comfortable.  Easy and smooth internet access.  Nice sleep and everything we experienced was great. Yes, the price was high for just a Super 8 ($80--though it was a holiday), but we will definitely come back here!This place was very gracious when we arrived quite late after checking out of another Sedona hotel because of bedbugs.  We found this place to be reasonable and clean.  On the way to breakfast the next morning, the incline from our building to the main building was covered in black ice.  Of course I didn't see it and I fell flat on my back.  The management should have salted that immediately first thing in the morning.  They responded immediately when we told them, but ice is ice.  No harm done, but only 3 stars because of that lack of attention.Rude. Long story short they sold our PREPAID room out from under us. The gentleman at the front desk was not only unsympathetic, but down right insulting in his response to our situation. They also lied about trying to contact us "all day". The booking company had no record of them ever trying to rectify the situation even though that is what the guy at the front desk said. I will never patronize Super 8 again. Here or anywhere else.
review_content_40: I decided to book Super 8, since I figured I wouldn't be in the hotel much.  I figured if the room was bad, I only had to sleep in it.  I was pleasantly surprised!  The bed was good, no funny smells, AC worked well, and the staff were pleasant to deal with.  It was the cheapest hotel I found in Sedona.  If I return to sedona and need a hotel, I will likely return to the Super 8 for a great value.  Only downside I see is the breakfast...  juice, milk, cereal, bread, waffles, and apples.  Could use a little more variety, as  with all Super 8's I have been to.I stayed at this hotel out of sheer despair and necessity on hour eight of a 10-hour drive when it happened to be the only affordable thing left in town on no notice. That said, I was shocked by the quality  and value for the price, and visited on two subsequent occasions. The best part about this hotel is its location--walking distance to dining options and a Harkins movie theater, and running distance from a hiking area. The rooms were surprisingly nice, clean and spacious for the price point, and the front-desk service was friendly on the three occasions I visited. The breakfast did leave something to be desired, but hotel breakfasts always do.Stayed 3 days - fine, but accidentally double booked the first night.  The Owner is a real jerk not to refund a satisfied customer - even if it was the customer's mistake.  I told him, "In my business the customer is always right."  I don't think that's so in his.  My advice, don't be his customer!This is an above average Super 8.  We booked here as all of the hotels the weekend we were in Sedona were beyond pricey.  It certainly is not a resort, but the nice rooms, amazing price, nice views (for view rooms), and convenience more than make up for it.  However, this location is very convenient.  The rooms are recently updated and very clean.  Super comfortable beds.  Free continental breakfast is ok for saving money.  I definitely would stay here again and would splurge on things to do while in Sedona.  Highly recommend.Staff was just friendly enough to get by, but refused to keep our bags until time to check in.  Pretty sure there's mold growing in our bathroom.  "Pet-friendly", but when we checked in, we had to sign a contract about all these rules that weren't listed when we made the reservation.  Wouldn't even consider giving us our room before 3.  Even when we came back, our room wasn't ready until 4.  Gets the job done, but really isn't up to par and they aren't here to make your stay exceed expectations.i was forced to stay in sedona because my truck engine blew up on the way to flagstaff. the tow guy brought us to this super 8, not in the uptown area (the main drag), so it was cheaper then having to stay in uptown where resorts & simple hotels will cost a bunch. with a aaa discount, this was $80 a night. still pricey, but not as bad as others. the room had a fridge and microwave. the bed was very uncomfortable & hard. anytime the air kicked on, it sounded like a train coming thru the room. between the bad bed and loud airconditioner, we got no sleep. the front desk was super nice and they do have a full hot breakfast for free. i couldn't stay here again because of the bad beds. so, it depends what's more important to you. nice grounds. has a pool.  so, i don't know.... would $80 a night be moderate in sedona? i would consider it pricey in a different town.

review_content: Not great, but not bad either. Nothing knocked my socks off about this hotel but it was a decent stay. If you are looking for a hotel with all the bells and whistles, this isn't it. If you're looking for a clean, reasonably priced hotel, this will do. This is not a traditional hotel that offers breakfast, room service, etc. These are timeshares as well, so this would be a good place if you are doing a long stay in Sedona, as they have a kitchen and laundry available. Pros: -comfy bed -in suite kitchen -big bathroom -pool -laundry on site -reasonably priced -close to restaraunts/hiking etc Cons: -no continental breakfast -thin walls, can easily hear neighbors -timeshare sales pitch (just say no right from the start) -not pet friendly -early checkout (10:00)Stayed in a studio and it was okay. There were beautiful red rocks all around but we had no view. We stayed near the pool, which can get pretty loud. We could also hear our neighbors coming up the stairs, entering the room, and talking at times, because we had adjoining rooms. Overall, it was a decent room. The restroom wasn't my favorite because it didn't have a bathtub. The people at the front desk were very nice and helpful.I Forgot to mention that the pillows SUCK!!!!. They are way to big/puffy to sleep on.I will definitely come back here again! They have a pool, gym, Jacuzzi and a golf course! The area is great and close to all the landmarks to see in the area! The rocks and hiking area is a plus in the area. It is a drive from the restaurants and shopping area but it's worth the drive! Plus: couch pulls out into a comfy bed, the kitchen has the basics and everything needed to cook up a meal! The actual bed was comfy as well! It was clean and everything the picture showed prior to purchasing. The bathroom is a great size and the water pressure is hot! Must check it out!The Ridge on Sedona Golf Course Resort was in a beautiful area in Sedona in my opinion. The place we stayed at was very nice and had a kitchen, washer, dryer, and fireplace. The kitchen had an oven, microwave, stove, dishwasher, toaster, coffee, and blender. It was nice and definitely a change of pace from other places we've stayed at. There was a pool and two Jacuzzi's (one of which was very close to our place). The Jacuzzi near our place didn't work for one night but was fixed and working the next day. We used the kitchen to cook some dinner a couple of nights in a row since we didn't want to go out to eat. All of the appliances worked fine and looked pretty new. I thought this place was good and was a few minutes from downtown Sedona.If you make the mistake and get a room here- DO NOT get sucked into any of the timeshare presentations!! They will offer $75-$100 just to go, and they will say it's not a "high pressured" meeting, but it is. It's actually a huge scam that Diamond resorts is running! As far as the rooms here, they are nice... But this company is all about getting you to become an "owner". So once you are in their territory- they will constantly bug he crap out of you to try and attend one of these meetings. Do yourself a favor and stay somewhere else. Any location run or owned by Diamond resorts is pathetic and likes to try and scam their guests.When I came to Sedona 2 years ago, I stayed at Sedona Summit with my mom because she has RCI and timeshare with Diamond Resorts. This time around, I was looking into going through her timeshare but it wasn't working out. So i found a good deal for this place on hotel.com. I was a big fan of Sedona Summit, and knowing Ridge is part of Diamond Resorts, I knew I wouldn't be disappointed. I booked a studio for $77/a night. 3 nights + hotel fees = $275. I personally thought that was a great deal!The studio came with a full sized fridge, 2 electric stove tops, microwave, coffeemaker, and a dishwasher. We cooked full meals perfectly fine. We went to the hot tub every night we were there. We thought the pool and hot tub near the lobby were the best. The one hot tub near us didn't have a light, but it wasn't that big of a deal. We were offered the timeshare talk and if we went, we were suppose to get a $100 Visa gift card, but we didn't want to waste our time. Location wise, it is on the outskirts of town, not too big of a selection of restaurants but we made due. It's near Bell Rock, so that was the 1st hike we did on our trip! Also not too far are Cathedral Rock, and the Church of the Holy Cross.Absolutely excellent! We had a one bedroom connected with a studio, so two kitchens and two bathrooms (huge tub), three tvs, laundry closet, two balconies, two living rooms. We had everything we needed for the perfect vacations for our small family of three. The decor was up to date, clean, and Sedona appropriate colors. The kitchens were stocked well with pots, dishes, coffee pot, etc. The front desk man and the house cleaner were friendly. The location was slightly out of town but in a really nice area near the Sedona Hilton. We heard very little noise from neighbors aside from NYE cheering. My husband and child visited the hot tub and pool daily despite the cold weather. We will try to stay here on our next visit to Sedona. On a side note, Sedona doesn't have much for children aside from some parks and hiking.I gave 2-stars because I am a Diamond member, otherwise 1-star would be about right. The shower has mold in the corners (noticeable), and the metal door jamb is basically dirty. The pull out couch was dirty and had hot cheeto stains. After pulling it out there were hot cheeto in the seams. When one of my daughters dropped her crayon behind the pull out bed, what did I find? A ton of hot cheetos, oh and someone's deoderant. The extra bedding was in a plastic bag that was sealed (to prove on some measure that it was clean), but found hairs on the bedding. I spent extra points on this resort because of previous reviews. What a waste :(Driving into the property is pretty, location was ok. Everyone in the front lobby was super polite. But as a Diamond member, the stay was not the best. They were at capacity I was told, so I could not upgrade from our studio. The studio was very small. Although the plus side was it had almost a full kitchen (just no stove...no problem)the blankets for the pull out sofa were thin and very rough. I sleep better with a fan blowing on me no matter how hot or cold it is...and I called the front desk to request one which never got delivered.Good little time share, senior citizen condos, mixed with obviously a resort style "hotel-condo."Once you get checked in, you get to go to the concierge desk and they will try to sell you a time share presentation with a "free" trip to some decent locations within the states (ie. florida but no hawaii).Parking was decent near the condo and once you walk in, you feel like home. Why? because you get a nice sized kitchen, large living space/dining area, and a large bathroom and master bedroom.I def. enjoy staying here because it has all you need (except the free breakfast of course). Will I stay here again? Most likely. They also have a good sized pool and jacuzzi.However, one star is deducted because of the thin walls and ceilings (and resort fees).I've stayed here twice, in two different room styles. I'd definitely opt for the bigger 1br (as opposed to the smaller studio) which is incredibly nice by any standard. A small but nice kitchen, huge living room and bathroom, and comfortable bedroom. A balcony area is a nice touch as well. Although not walking distance to Bell Rock for most people, it is still convenient to walk down to Cucina Rustica (for some excellent food) and the Full Moon Saloon (for some inexpensive drinks). I haven't played the course yet, but it looks interesting, so maybe I'll get a chance next time. Will stay here again, but only in the 1br version.Had a room right by the pool. loved how spacious this hotel was! Stayed here on a bachelorette trip.. had more than sufficient space to live with 10 girls for a weekend!Staff brought plenty of blankets and ice as requested!!Overall, it's hard to say if I'll come back but I doubt it. Pros: 1)Decent price for the accommodations2) Nice heated 82 degree pool until 10pm3) Condo esq rooms with every amenity you'll need 4) very clean rooms Cons:1) front desk staff are full of incompetents.I did an early check in, hoping to be able to check in a little bit earlier. Front desk staff informed me the room is still being cleaned and that they would inform me when my room was ready. I waited for 4 hrs until when they checked me in at the usual check in time. Multiple parties that arrived after Us got their rooms before we did. It was just ridiculous. Solely for this reason, I would not come back.Great place to stay! Located close to restaurants and shopping We stayed a week and really enjoyed it.The unit was spacious and had a great view . The staff was very helpful and always friendly! Highly recommend staying here.LOVE THIS PLACE! Great value for the price of a nice place to stay in Sedona. The one bedroom will be more than enough room, and the studio really isn't that bad either. Full kitchen and laundry right in the room make it a nice place to just hang out as well. When taking along some guests be sure and get the double room lock-off, as it's great space and privacy for everyone. Even the fold out couches are top notch and don't disappoint as well.Super pretty, awesome.. PoorCustomer service. They clean your room once the whole time your there and they aren't every thorough. They had tons of activities for kids but you had to pay for all of them.. And there wasn't any kids. The movie by the pool activity is free end was the most enjoyed by my kids.Very nice hotel property!! We stayed 2 nights. We were supposed to be at their sister property, but they overbooked and moved us here. Wow! Are we gld they did. Our 1 bedroom was small apartment! Full, stocked kitchen, large 2-person tub. This would be a great option for an extended stay or with a family.Rooms were a nice size. Very clean resort from the areas that I was able to explore. Staff was pleasant. I would come back.We go North to Sedona fairly often. I found this place thru a third party timeshare rental for half the published rates (inbox me for details! lol)This is a very well kept Golf Resort. We visited the club house restaurant for just coffee and a meeting. They seemed fairly busy with the golfer clique; it was clean and well appointed with a beautiful outdoor patio and gorgeous views of part of the course and mountains.It is not close to downtown Sedona, but there's restaurants nearby, and accommodations on the strip can be sketchy sometimes. We reserved a studio room with a partial view of the mountains beyond the parking lot. Our room had a small kitchen and was fully stocked with utensils, cookware, etc. The room was clean, nice linens, large updated bathroom and a small patio. Our checkin was fairly fast, and they did direct us to the concierge for the tour promo, and maps. I read other reviews about the tour push, and the wi-fi. I wasn't charged for use of the wi-fi, maybe part of whatever rental agreement I found thru a timeshare holder. They did ask the one time at checkin for us to participate in a tour. After that we didn't hear from them again. The wi-fi can lag at times, but it worked fine for the most part. They are a strict non-smoking property and our room was on the second level of the building, stairs only, which can be a drag if there's a bunch of luggage to haul. Also, they aren't pet friendly, and if you bring the kids they won't let them into the pool unaccompanied. This is currently our new go to place and I recommend it.Watch out they will double charge you. Already paid for a room using hotels.com and they also charged is a 2nd time! When we called no one new what the charge was for and said they need to talk to the manager to resolve. Still haven't heard anything. Not worth the hassle
review_content_20: I am extremely upset with this hotel's corporate office. I booked a room for 2 nights in October and then read online that they had a bedbug problem at one time. I called to cancel my reservations and they refused to refund me, 5 months in advance! I would never recommend doing business with a company like this. I told them why I wanted to cancel and that made no difference5 stars based on location & a Interval International "Getaway" deal of $319 for a week.  Had it been regularly priced, they would have received 4 stars.Great location just outside of town, super close to Bell Rock (a must do hike) and Cucina Rustica, a fabulous restaurant next door.  We got a steal @ $319 for a week in a studio unit.  My sister got the bed & I threw a sleeping bag on the super comfy pull out couch.  The pull out bed was brand new, with a memory foam mattress.  So much more comfortable than the spring kind.Ok pool, nothing special.  We stayed in the #8 bldg, which sported fantastic views.  The kitchen was perfect, small but adequately stocked.  No oven, but I'm fine with that.Bathroom was large, but shower only.  Large closet, room safe, ample sized lanai, updated TV's...... Basically all you need.Pleasant front desk staff.  I truly loved this place.  I'd imagine the whole unit would be awesome to stay in.  However, for two this was more than perfect and well worth the price.2 1/2 hrs from Phoenix and 3 hours from South Rim Grand Canyon.  If you make the trek to the Grand Canyon, realize that if you head back after dark elk are EVERYWHERE and you will need to drive alert & slow.  50+ miles of Elk Hell and the highway also had a few darting by.  Just plan on extra time.  I would stay here again in a heartbeat.  Have a great time, Sedona is such a magical place!*We couldn't do the timeshare presentation bc my husband was not present.  Had we attended it, we would have received a catered breakfast & $75.this place is gorgeous and immaculately clean. the people who helped check us in were the BEST ! totally generous in giving suggestions on what to do, what to see, what routes to take etc. also they showered us with bottled water, chocolates and starbucks coffee. the room was perfect. the bed was super comfy with high thread count linens and dreamy pillows. i'd stay here again ANY TIME !I would definitely stay here again.   The rooms are studios, very clean and the staff was very nice and helpful.  It is within walking distance of several good restaurants and 10 minutes driving distance from uptown.Beautiful location, nice clean and spacious 1 bedroom rooms.  They could improve sound attenuation at the adjoining doors.  The front desk and housekeeping were great but the only negative with customer relations was meeting with the concierge person who was really a timeshare sales person.  Once we told them off the bat that we are not interested in the 90 minute sales pitch the person turned the other way and had nothing more to say or ask us about the resort.  A little more professionalism is needed here.  Just say "no" and stick to it and they will leave you alone.  I would have given the resort a 5 if it wasn't for the poor concierge relations.Great value for $150. Full kitchen. Patio. 1 bedroom with living room. Quiet, clean pool. Great views. Clean room, well maintained. Exceeded expectations for the money.I stayed here back in March with a girlfriend for a spring break week in Arizona.  Although we had our whole itinerary planed the staff was very helpful and friendly in helping us settle in and answer an questions regarding activities in Sedona.  The property is a time share so very private and homey. We did have to listen to a presentation but were rewarded with gift cards to two local restaurants.  The rooms were spacious and the pools were nice.  The kitchen was a great perk for a week long trip for cooking and storage.  I think this place is the perfect stop for a family or friends getaway.  We were close enough to everything around to enjoy the beauty of Arizona.Place was nice.  I don't like the "resort fee"  but at least it wasn't too steep.  Great that there was a kitchen and appliances.  I would stay again.If you can sleep in a bright room, then by all means this is a great place.  If you require a dark room, think again before booking a stay here, as the room is extremely bright!  The kitchen window in the studio room where we stayed had no curtain, merely a shade that lets the sunlight fill the sleeping area.  A blackout curtain over the sliding door but none over the kitchen window does not make for a good night's sleep.  As a matter of fact, I woke up with migraine at about 5am when the sun came out and after attempting to block the light with the laundry basket, towels, and a pillow from the couch, after only having been asleep for a few hours, we eventually moved into the bathroom and slept miserably on the floor in there.  The property is cute, and I would have loved to have had this be a place we would frequent.  However, I found the property staff very unaccomodating after mentioning to them that I was simply uncomfortable paying the amount I had paid when my boyfriend and I had to sleep on the bathroom floor, and were extremely sleep deprived for our time in Sedona due to our stay at their property.  The only compensation that they gave was refunding the $10.00 resort fee, which is about 1/17th of the amount paid.  As a business owner myself, I think this place needs to study customer service and business principles a bit.  I would never dream of treating my patrons that way if they were dissatisfied for any reason whatsoever.  A discount of 30% off of a future stay does not solve the problem, as it is not a future stay that was dissatisfactory, and by leaving a customer dissatisfied, they can pretty much guarantee they will not be a returning customer to use the 30% discount, thus avoiding any kind of compensation for the negative experience whatsoever.Also, a 10am checkout is ridiculous.  I have never heard of anywhere having a 10am checkout prior to staying here, and getting a late checkout here is nearly impossible.  I guess they figure most people will have been awake since 5am when the sun entered their room and don't mind being out by 10.A Balcony,  a View, and That's About It   The Ridge on Sedona Golf Resort is attractive, well situated and well maintained.  The adjacent but unaffiliated golf course, nestled among dazzling views of the area's red rock formations, couldn't be prettier.  But don't expect much service, Just  once during our weeklong stay, they took out our trash and brushed up the room.  There are two heated and pleasant pools but no room service, no bar, no restaurant and no elevator.  Most shops and restaurants are ten miles north in and around Sedona proper.      The Ridge is one of 250-some outposts of Diamond Resorts International, the time-share chain that specializes in selling portable rights to vacation homes, mostly condos.  But nonmembers can often sample the Ridge without committing to buying s time-share.  You can stay a week at discounted rates, though in return, you're urged to sit through an hour-long "presentation" about buying a time-share.  Two salespeople park you and your spouse at a card table and make alternating pitches.      For us the Ridge had one great, irrefutable merit.  That was our room, No. 1408, a second-floor, one-bedroom suite with a fully equipped kitchen in Building 14. Staff told us that the buildings were 20 years old. But 1408 felt new. It smelled new. Everything worked, everything fit.  It was remarkably furnished, down to a gas-fueled fireplace and a flashlight for power outages plugged into a kitchen wall.       Many rooms are studios, albeit bigger and better equipped than many a hotel room, and many first floor rooms face parking lots.  Happily, up on the second floor, 1408 came with an unobstructed view of those glorious rocks.   To gauge our flat's space, we counted the doors. There were nine, including a sliding glass door to the balcony where we savored brilliant pageants of sunsets and stars. Thus if like Proust we wanted to root ourselves to a hotel room--not play golf, hike in the rocks, take the two-hour drive north to the Grand Canyon--the Ridge and our room would get five rocking stars.     One complaint--trivial until it wasn't--is the Ridge's advertised Sedona address.   The Ridge is in the unincorporated and little known village of Oak Creek, not in celebrated Sedona.  The night of trek up from Phoenix, the address drove us and our GPS systems nuts.  Finally the Ridge's telephone operator managed to lead us there, turn by turn.This is a hard review to write because the place its self was very nice and clean.  The golf course is beautiful.  But we had bad experiences with the service, this is why I only gave it two stars.  First, they put a hold on your card for $100 and that doesn't come off for at least a week after your vacation.  They tell you a day or two, that's a lie.  Most places only charge $25, if that.  Marriott resorts never charged me anything and they are nicer.  Then the front desk (intern) was not friendly and everything I asked about he said NO.  Which is ironic, because their business card says, "we are all about Yes".  Then you get directed to the concierge desk who puts on high pressure to get you to their time share sales pitch.  Internet is $7 every 24 hour period (yes you pay for Internet, everywhere else is free) and that is just for one device.  It was a rip off because it wasn't even fast Internet.  At the end of the trip we went in the night before to ask for a late check out because their checkout is 10am (very early).  Hoping for 11am at least.  They gave the person in front of us a 10:30am check out (30 minutes...big deal) and then they told us NO.  So I called the front desk the next morning to request again and they said NO again.  How is that fair?  Others get it but we don't?  And what hotel doesn't give you an extended checkout?  So the Ridge on Sedona Golf Resort is all about the NO.The rooms were decent, nice little kitchen, no view except for the parking lot, but housekeeping was very good.  Location:  If you like Bell Rock, it is a great location, but if you want to go into town a lot it is far from town and impossible without a car because there are no shuttles only taxi's and they charge $25 each way to town.Great experience! When we asked about the view from our room we were shown pictures of the views and were able to pick the view we wanted. Lots of activities scheduled. Unfortunately, we had a lot of other stuff going on and didn't have a chance to experience any of the activities. Very clean! I enjoyed having a kitchen. It's a little bit off the beaten path, but we really enjoyed being on the outskirts of Sedona.What a beautiful place to stay. My husband surprised me with a mini trip to Sedona for my birthday weekend. The room we had was a studio apartment. We were in 1406P and the bathroom was huge (with just a shower) nice bed, decent size kitchen, smaller size tv, but all in all a great place to stay. They are very serious about there pool towels. To the point that they let you know if any one of those suckers comes up missing, you will be automatically charged $25. They tell you how many should be in each room and I was actually afraid to use said towel for fear of actually getting charged just for using it. LOL! Oh cell phone service is interesting at this hotel. Some spots we had a signal and other spots we got nada. All in all, it was a great resort and we will definitely be back again soon.Free internet & free wine tasting for us when we arrive at 8pm.Service is great.  They hand us wine right away. After 10 hours drive, it is what I need. Is a small town so everything close at 8 or 9pm, so they tell us right away that we should eat first before is too late. I was like, wow... These people actually care!!!! So the roomWe have the studio so...... Kitchen is small as excepted. But they got everything we need. Parking, plenty even on a busy week Nice view, nice pool, nice place, and free wifi everywhere, in the room, the lobby, the pool, everywhere.Had a great week here. The property is gorgeous and overlooks the golf course. The rooms are clean and very spacious. Great kids program with activities. Great location. Nice resort. Would recommend.We are first timers.  Great pool and rooms.  Spacious for two adults and two children.  Nice kitchen, living area, bed and bathroom. Close to beautiful views and national park or monuments. A couple of miles from main shops but thats ok. Three days are enough.  Very nice golf course but i wasnt prepared to play.  79.00 fee and has driving range.  Room has 30 in screen, i home and dvd player. U can rent dvds at registration for two bucks.  About 100 reg dvds and about 50 for kids.  Only thing, no free wifi.  I would come back.I booked our stay through VRBO. This was our very first time visiting Sedona and I have to say my biggest disappointment was selecting this "resort". Check in was busy and took forever. They then try to steer you to the concierge desk (aka sales desk) where they try like the Dickins to sell you a timeshare. They are relentless. We were told this was a child friendly place as well as it was advertised "no resort fees". Neither were the case. It was more geared towards an older crowd and they hit me with those $21 in resort fees upon check out claiming it was for wifi. If they mean the super slow wifi that kept timing out, what a rip off!! The beds our horrible, we had no view. I take that back, we had views of the maid quarters and a busy street. The street noise was also very loud. When asked how my stay was, I told them and they simply brushed it off. They could care less about their guests. Just swiped my credit card for their resort fees and sent me on my way.  They care more about trying to sell you a timeshare then caring for their guests! Never Again!!!!This place is awesome!  We only stayed 1 night but the staff was super helpful and friendly! I would definitely come back and definitely recommend it!  Ashley at the front desk was amazing! Free internet, workout room, and pool. There is a $10/night resort fee, but Priceline had already added it to the cost.This place is a pit.   After trying 3 rooms we finally got one that didnt smell but they did have to come back and vaccum.  The first vaccum was broken, and the maids just didnt bother,  so got another one.  I had to sweep the front porch off with renants of tissue and bugs.   Wont stay here again.   All three roooms we trid were just as dirty.   YukEh. We stayed here via a timeshare trade. We own at a gold star resort. I traded a sleeps four unit that has a big, full sized kitchen for a studio at this resort. Pros: nice location, on the edge of town but not far from the main portion of town. Grocery, nice restaurants, etc are close by. Nice, well maintained pools. Most of our 2nd room was fairly maintained. Most of it was clean but the carpet could use an update. We experienced nice staff but some others we spoke to did not. The concierge was very helpful. They offered free washers and dryers at the laundry facility.Skip the welcome wine and cheese. It was a tiny table with broken up crackers, big lumps of grapes that were not broken up for guests to share, the wine was way too young to serve and the woman serving it even said the same. There was virtually no interaction among the guests.Cons: I called a day ahead telling them please give us a nice room, this was our wedding anniversary. Ha, waste of a phone call. When we arrived at 5pm, we were told that there was some confusion and that the person in our room before us had not yet left, or maybe they just checked in...they weren't sure ... What? They asked us to wait 10 minutes while they went and checked the room...again. Then we were told they had another room for us, the only room available which was a "modified" room. A room designed for the handicapped. I said NO. I did not want a room such as that although I appreciate there are rooms available for those that need them. Then we told to go talk to the concierge while they figured out what to do. Then we were told the room was ready. Lol...the only problem was that Goldilocks beat us to our bathroom. The shower was wet, the soap opened and used, the only bath towel hanging on the rack wet, the toilet seat up and the sink wet.  Upon a call that this wasn't going to work we were told again that the only room available was the handicap assessable room. My husband again said no to that. Where were they putting the lobby full of people that now arrived behind us? We got another room. It was clean. Carpet could be cleaner. Sofa lumpy and the seams coming apart. Bed as hard as a rock. Housekeeping brought new towels but no vacuuming, or cleaning the soapy mess the provided yucky soap made. We weren't even there, we had stayed at the Grand Canyon while housekeeping came in so there was virtually an empty room. While the resort offers beautiful views and a nice looking golf course, I don't think it should be rated as a Gold Star with Interval International, and I will be letting them know it. Btw, we met another guest at the pool who told us almost a duplicate story. Beware if you are trading, you are considered 3rd in line behind owners and potential buyers.
review_content_40: Negative stars for the immediate hard sale for time-share ownership at check-in! We were charged $20 to reserve a showing of the condos, refundable if we go to the viewing. All this just to check-in and get a parking permit! We already own a time share and had traded a week here.4 stars for the room decor, bed was so comfy, textured carpet, nice tile and the sofa-bed was different, it actually supported you as you slept!Only 2 stars for sound-proof of walls and ceilings. SOUNDS like no insulation. Two pools a bit spread out for all of the property buildings. We were lucky to be close to the second pool. Hot tub is separated from the pool areas, kinda nice as we were the only ones there each night. It is a walk to get there, but the sunset is beautiful!We were in an updated room that was really nice. Being on the golf course was great, but we didn't take in a round. With the pay for activities, pay for local calls, $20 pressure to get the parking permit, we felt "nickel and dimed" on our stay.For the golf course, updated room and beautiful views, you'll have to decide if you want to go through the time-share hard-sale!It's true, it's a Diamond time share resort. And, we were offered to take a time share tour w compensation, which we declined. Still, everyone was very nice and helpful. It's true, you must pay extra for Internet, only shortcoming. Room was lovely, well apportioned and clean. Pool was perfect temperature! Glorious area, just wish we had a room with a view of the red rocks, but I'm not sure if any studios have views. And, truthfully got so many beautiful views just driving around! Beautiful area! p.s. August is apparently monsoon weather, didn't know. :)Left yesterday and could not have been happier. Its south of Sedona, but just minutes away. Sedona itself is a tourist zoo. The ridge gives you easy access to all the activities and their golf course is pristine. We had a studio which was plenty big for 2 people. It comes well stocked with about anything you could ask for. Every Staff member we encountered went over the top to be helpful. We can't wait to return...After reading some of the reviews we were a little skeptical about this place. Having said that my husband and I recently stayed at the Ridge after looking at a rental ad on redweek.com Instead of paying rack rate going directly through the resort (which is very expensive) we found an great deal for a fully loaded one bedroom unit with an amazing view of the red rocks. We felt completely private and did not hear anything from any other rooms, despite what we read on another post. We found the staff to be really helpful, the supervisor Kiley (sic) even checked with us to see if we were happy with our room. The concierge desk was also top notch, guiding us to activities and restaurants that were definitely among the best that we had researched. They also offer discounts for activities and restaurants that otherwise one would not get. They definitely asked if we wanted to go to a presentation (this is their bread and butter after all) but we politely declined and were not hounded in the least. Having said that, if you do choose to spend 90 minutes of your time they give you a $50 visa card, which beats a sharp stick in the eye! The pool and hot tub were divine. Everything was really well maintained. We stayed in a remodeled unit but having said that we looked at the unremodeled units and they were fine as well. I guess the trick is to talk to the front desk when you check in about where you want to stay and what kind of view you want, because they will definitely do their best to accommodate you.I also heard about two other websites that do rentals, tug2.com/timesharemarket... and myresortnetwork.com People who own these timeshares will make really great deals.Got a deal through Groupon for this resort. I don't think I would have found this resort without the Groupon it is near a Hilton resort. Then again everything is tucked in from the main drag. It was clean and for the most part quiet. We stayed in a studio that was a little smaller there is an adjoining door to the larger suite. Our neighbors were noisy. It is located in the Village of Oak Creek and the views are pretty nice. They supposedly have a nice golf course but we didn't get a chance to check this out. We did however do a hike nearby Turkey Creek.Stayed at this resort just a week ago with my husband and was disappointed. This was a "short stay exchange" through my timeshare management company. We stayed there for 4 nights: checked-in Wed, checked-out Sunday.My review will go along with a lot of other reviewers:Pressure right away to book a viewing of their timeshare. We had to say "NO" at least 8 times (I counted...) and when we refused, the "concierge" (a.k.a. timeshare salesperson) changed her attitude towards us. What a turn off! :-/They do not do a good job at training their personnel. Upon check-in, we were told that we would get housekeeping only on Friday, since we weren't staying for the full week. Well, we did NOT get any housekeeping at all! We stayed there for 5 days!!! I had to take out the trash myself, which is really not a big deal, but my point is that the expectation was created with the incorrect information given by their employee. Besides, really?! This is a "resort". Pamper your clients a little bit, would you? It's just a service you should be providing pretty much everyday in a hotel environment!!!The other bad training moment was when I approached the front desk and inquired about the fact that they have a really well equipped kitchen (including pots and pans, dishes, etc... basically everything), but no place to use the pots and pans. We brought food with us to try saving some money, since we would have a "kitchen". BEWARE: There is no cooking surface in the studio units. So, when I asked the the person behind the desk about it, she simply answered: "We do not have stoves in the studios". My reply was: "So then why have all these equipment available? It seems extremely wasteful to me!" The manager overheard us and approached saying that they do provide a cooking surface, but only upon request. Well, I wish I knew that from the start. I would have taken one with me as soon as I checked-in. They provided an electric two burner portable stove and it did the job just fine.We stayed in one of the non-renovated units. Of course "it did the job" just as good as a newly renovated unit would have done. But it was weird seeing part of the tv programs cut on our 25" tube tv and it was not relaxing to take a shower in a bathroom covered in wall paper from the 80's!! But the bed was comfortable...About the sound insulation... Yeah... THERE'S NONE! We were unlucky to be next to a couple with two kids who woke up at the crack of dawn and everyone else along with them. At the same time, we were feeling super bad about staying up a little late, having some wine and talking, since we knew the "neighbors" were probably being kept awake by us. Not as fun as it could have been...Love the location, closer to Freeway exit since southern Oak Creek area. Makes it easier to jump to Phoenix and Flagstaff activities. Accommodations seem nice at first but not top quality. The pull out beds for our teens were memory foam type mattresses, so much better than you would expect.Not quite as nice as Sedona Summit, but as a sister Diamond Resort, we did enjoy our stay here. Maybe if we were golfers we would have liked it a little bit more. I still definitely have to give it better than average though.Love beautiful Sedona! Initially we were happy with our purchase of a timeshare. So we chose to use our time at the Ridge at Sedona Golf Resort. But when we actually stayed there the annoyance began. Constant calls to attend their presentations, Who wants to waste precious vacation time to attend a presentation? We were talked into attending some presentations--they last over two or more hours. The pressure was major. When we didn't choose to buy more time we were ushered out the back door. No champagne for us cheapskates! One salesman was so furious we wouldn't buy that he had us sign a paper that we wouldn't attend any more presentations. Fine with us. But guess what? We still got calls and invites to more presentations. Their presentations were called "updates". No way. Nothing but a lengthy high pressure sales pitch. Are you ready to purchase more time? Cost is $5000-$10,000 plus maintenance fees of approx $650? The Ridge at Sedona Golf Resort is comparable to apartment living. RSGR is made up of many two story units packed tightly onto the property with the only grounds being the perimeter golf course. Pool and spa were inconvenient--a distance away, up and down steep stairs. So we never bothered. We like the high quality five star Arroyo Roble Resort in uptown Sedona 100 percent better!We stayed mainly in one bedroom units. Beware the inner door leading to the next door unit is not always locked. I tried it and found my next-door neighbor sleeping. Surprise! This timeshare (Sunterra) made for years of annoyance with their constant calls. We finally unloaded it--couldn't sell it but actually donated to charity. We are happy now to be rid of that albatross!We enjoyed our 5 day stay at the Ridge. Only negative is they give you no free Internet or WiFi service which surprised us being such a really nice place. Sheets were absolutely wonderful and I understand you can buy new ones like the ones they use in the rooms there. We were in a 1 bedroom suite and felt like we were in our own apartment, with a beautiful view of the golf course and some of the rock mountains we could see from our balcony.Having read some reviews, I didn't know what to expect. Let's just say that I think we got a renovated studio cuz it had a cooking surface(stove) in the unit. We had some issues(ex. non-cooling a/c unit and a missing dvd remote) with the studio which were quickly attended to by the staff(within 30 min of notification). Upon first inspection, the place was clean and presented well. But the midweek housekeeping was lacking. According to the front desk, the midweek cleaning consisted of sweeping, vacuuming, towel replacement and bed made with fresh sheets. I can't verify the first two, but the towels were replaced and the beds were not made. Maid service was okay. Our mistake was to attend the "90 minute" presentation. The 90 minutes turned into 3 hours of "hard sell" when I finally didn't want to answer any more questions. They gave us a discount for a tour for our trouble. I'll go again sans the presentation.I have no complaints about this place except no free wi-fi. Also there's hardly any cell phone service unless you have Verizon, but that's not their fault. The room was nice and we didn't hear anything from our neighbors except once when they ran the dishwasher or something. They did forget to clean our room on Friday, but I assume that was just a mistake and the usual fair. I like the fact that there's an almost fully equipped kitchen. It saved us a lot of money on food. They did ask us to attend a spiel when we checked in, but didn't bug us about it other than that.We stayed in a one-bedroom unit as timeshare owners in Jan. 2010 during the "Storm of the Century." Our only real problem was that there was not much to do in Sedona nor at the resort during inclement weather. We were able to get one of the newly-refurbished units, and the appliances and decor were top-class. Our view was medium, but not bad. (We were offered a unit with a better view, but older furniture and appliances and without the flat-screen TV).The hot tub is pretty, but the pool was too cold to swim in and while the hot tub was a great temperature, it had no roof and one had to go up several flights of stairs in the dark and cold to access it. The resort should have at least an indoor or partially-protected hot tub and safer way to reach it.They did have a great talk by a Navajo in full costume, and a concert by a Shawnee flautist; my companion ended up buying one of his flutes. It would be great if the resort had more such events.They charged $4 a night to rent videos and $6.95 per day (possibly per computer) for internet [although we were able to use the computers over in the lobby a good bit by going in at night]. It seems insulting after paying so much already to own a timeshare, and since other timeshares offer such things for free and have more indoor entertainment. The resort could provide game nights, more ways for guests to meet each other, show films that were made in Sedona, etc., without much cost to themselves but it would provide a nicer experience during winter weather.On Wednesday night they offered Bingo and Mexican food for $15 which sounded fun, but we were not able to go because we had already purchased tickets for the Verde Canyon Railway.WE WERE HOUNDED EVERY DAY TO ATTEND A SALES PRESENTATION. I FELT THEY WERE SHOWING ME DISRESPECT BY CONTINUING TO ASK TIME AFTER TIME. Unfortunately, it seems that all timeshares are like this. The staff was friendly and polite, especially the valet and the man who helped us carry our things to the car when we left, but no matter how politely people ask you to attend a sales presentation, after you've kindly made it clear several times that you do NOT wish to go, it's harassment to continually be asked.I wavered between two and three stars. The place is a timeshare so beware. They will try exceptionally hard to get you to attend a sales presentation. I had to refuse repeatedly and they even called my room! You know, if I had any interest in buying something like it, I'm sure I would pursue on my own and not have to have someone hound me repeatedly in some hope that I'd buy on impulse. The location is nice, right on a golf course and the grounds are very well taken care of. The room we had seemed more like a studio apartment rather than a hotel room. The walls are thinner than paper, and you can hear a pin drop in the room next door. The decor in the room was old, warn and in dire need of replacement. The carpet was stained in several places and the wallpaper in the bathroom was very dated and peeling. The TV was a piece of crap, 25" tube style TV from the stone ages. Here's the kicker...NO MAID SERVICE. WTF????? We stayed a week and all they did is come one day and replace the towels. The pools and jacuzzi are not even close to being convenient to all the rooms. We had to walk up a long, long hill to get to the pool or jacuzzi. Really inconvenient. The location is nice, right in the red rock area of Oak Creek. But really? The place is NOT a hotel worth the prices they charge. I think they have remodeled some of the rooms, but certainly not ours! They play a trick on you and try to sucker you in to a sales presentation when you go to a SECOND desk to get a parking pass. Parking pass? Really? There's nothing nearby that would cause unauthorized parking so it's nothing more than a ploy to sucker you in. What a joke...... We really loved Sedona, it is just an amazing place, so thankfully the hotel was nothing more than a place to sleep at night and spend a l little time in the pool and jacuzzi. Reminder.....the WALLS ARE THIN AS PAPER !!! I swear you can hear your neighbor thinking.When you walk into the lobby, with the fireplace, warm undertones, plasma TV's, you think "hmmm, I bet my room will be just as inviting." Sadly, that is not the case. We stayed in a Studio unit and the best thing I can say about it is that it was clean. As other reviewers have mentioned, the walls are so thin so that you can hear when your neighboring room dwellers are snoring. The Studio has a kitchenette with pots, pans, utensils, dishes... but no stove. I guess you could take the pots and pans out to the BBQ, but I think they'd get ruined. We made due with the microwave and toaster, but it did feel like just a step up from camping. Initially, our TV didn't work, but they did get a repairman out quickly to fix it. The control on the air conditioning & heat requires that it's either on or off, so it gets really cold or really hot - it also makes quite a bit of noise. The jacuzzi/spa is really inconvenient, up a winding pathway with stairs. I will seek other accommodations for our next trip to Sedona.

hotel_name: Best Western Plus Arroyo Roble Hotel & Creekside Villas
review_content: We were on a trip out west and purchased an express deal through Priceline for a one night stay in Sedona.   It had been a long time since I've stayed in a Best Western and this we found was a Best Western Plus.  The room more than exceeded our expectations.  We were well pleased with room size, bathrooms, cleanliness,  and all the amenities.  The staff were friendly and welcoming.  The view of Oak Creek and the mountains surrounding was outstanding.    The free breakfast, which we usually skip because they are usually totally carbs, is served in an adjoining building and was really done first class.Unfortunately, we stayed in another Best Western Plus the following week which did not meet our expectations so this is a designation that still deserves caution but not, fortunately, at this location.Hello all, I'm posting as a newlywed and honeymooner from Phoenix, AZ. I found this place on trip advisors and man, all the reviews were correct! Our room was the north room with the jetted tub and fireplace! Honestly, probably the only room I would stay in staying at this hotel. It's tucked away with three other rooms off to the side with spectacular views! The bed is EXTREMELY comfortable! The cleaning ladies are amazing and nice. The bathtub and shower is AWESOME! Breakfast in the morning you can't beat. The steam room and hot tub in the clubhouse is well worth it. The only NEGATIVES I give this place is the front office staff about half of them didn't care about their job. We were watching a movie and the tv is across the room from the bed and it only turned up volume wise half way. I get that in a hotel they don't want you blasting your tv. We couldn't even hear the tv, so my husband called. It was late but she was rude and said she would call us back to see if they could fix it and she NEVER did. Also, the wifi sucks. We tried using our Amazon fire stick for Netflix, and it was a no go. Overall it's been a great experience. Stay in the north rooms, you won't be disappointed!They have nicely decorated rooms. We've been here before and always enjoyed it there. For a Best Western its excellent. Its close to everything. Their beds are super comfy. Checking in at the front desk everyone is friendly and knowledge about Sedona. They have a great of selection of rooms. Not your average best western. The Free breakfast is pretty good if your in a hurry. Its basic and fresh. Coffee was good. We normally like to eat breakfast at the Coffee pot.Great view of Snoopy Rock, great location. Sunrise was spectacular from my balcony. Lots to do on site. Almost like a spa. Better breakfast than most Best Westerns. The staff was very friendly and helpful.Multi-level indoor/outdoor hotel. Comes with a beautiful view of the rocks (on one side of the hotel only!), and free access to the Arroyo Roble club house with spa, indoor/outdoor pool & hot tub, pool tables, ping pong, etc.. This hotel also had one of the best hotel breakfasts I've ever had -- actually worth paying for. The eggs with green chiles combined with bacon, home fries, and salsa made a great meal. The coffee was quite good for a hotel too -- I had seconds. PS: the salsas were delicious -- they had two different types, both of which seemed freshly made and one of which was quite spicy! I wish all hotel breakfasts were like this.We absolutely loved this place, though we stayed in the one private "cottage" out back, so I can't speak to the quality of the rooms in the main building. If you can, grab the cottage- it has two big bedrooms, large bath, a kitchenette, dining room and living room. You also have a private driveway for your car and an incredible unobstructed view of the red-rock mountains from a private back deck with patio furniture. It all feels very exclusive and romantic...until you find unsupervised children wandering down from the main building...hanging out on your deck, peeking through your windows and climbing on your car.Be a responsible parent, that's the message tonight folks. Your obnoxious delinquent kids aren't nearly as cute as you seem to think they are.I was very impressed with this hotel. The location is awesome it's a right in the uptown Sedona area if you want to all the shops some great restaurants and also too many activities. The room is a standard hotel room we had two queen beds with the balcony and the view of the red rocks. They have a clubhouse that has an indoor/outdoor pool which was very nice. The clubhouse also has a steam room, sauna and a rec room with Foos ball ice hockey and lots of other games. There are two hot tubs in the clubhouse - one outside and another inside. They offer free breakfast in the morning with eggs, waffles and potatoes. All in all the Best Western Plus was a very nice place to stay. They also have access to the creek which provides great hiking trails just off the property.We just stayed at the Best Western Arroyo Roble Hotel in Sedona, Az.  It was very nice, clean rooms with a terrace to sit on and see the beauty of Sedona!    The Best Western is also dog friendly and they have a nice grassy area with doggies bags for your fur babies.  But call ahead to reserve your room ( with dogs ) because they only have two dog friendly rooms.  Plus!  They have a fabulous complimentary breakfast with all the fixing!!  .  Plus two  pools and many other amenities.  We will definitely return to the Best Western Arroyo Roble when we go back and visit Sedona!I really liked this hotel. Better than ones I've stayed at. Rooms are beautiful, lots of activities, located near the shopping center, and AMAZING VIEW!! Staff is nice! Only think was room service was not to the door just picked up at the front. But honestly the stay here was so worth it. Breakfast was awesome too :)We had the pleasure to stay at your hotel. We are RCI members and weren't able to get in the timeshare section. I have to say the views are amazing and the location to the shops in uptown is perfect and the free breakfast was wonderful along with staff.  The only reason why I gave your property a 3 Star over 5 Star is the playground down in the timeshare part wasn't clean. The playground equipment had a ton of cobwebs and the ladder was very loose. I was able to tighten the nut with with my fingers on the left side. I also find it interesting getting down to equipment wasn't easy for my elderly mother who found it hard to walk down several steps. Why isn't there a ramp?I realize it's not apart of your hotel but you allow your guests to use these facilities and equipment so it needs to be kept up with open communication between both hotel managers.This place is the bomb.Walking in to the lobby, you are greeted by a very professional front desk. They are super nice and accomodating.The entire resort was clean and big! They have a recreational facility with an indoor & outdoor pool, sauna, spa, pool tables, ice hockey, fusball, and more! The gym was not bad either.Room was fantastic too. Great view. Breakfast included.Arriving in Sedona from Wisconsin is nothing short of inspiring. As the vista unfolds it becomes abundantly clear this is a special place. Best Western Arroyo Roble does justice to the surrounding beauty. Comfortable updated villas along the creek were a relaxing home away from home (better than home, really ;) )  Great breakfast, friendly responsive staff. Stay here!So you know the housekeepers  rules the hotel, screaming, talking, laughing early in the morning in the hallways. Do not matter if sign do not disturb is on or not.Bathrooms are very small.Just arrived at this hotel and it's already a horrible experience. After a four hour drive from Las Vegas, the person checking people in in the lobby takes one look at my boyfriend and I. Doesn't ask me for my name and immediately assumes we are staying at the other CHEAPER Best Western down the street. She then proceeds to inform me that our room may not be clean, note that we arrived almost at midnight. I made my reservation a week ago and there is no room, which we have already been charged for and we have paid in full for. She doesn't offer us any comfort or even another available option, just hot coffee or tea. Chose this hotel over other options because of the rave reviews but I am definitely regretting my decision. We are sitting in the lobby and she has not provided us with any solutions and have not informed us of what our options are.Terrific attention from Nicole and Lonnie. Fabulous views from a private balcony. Right in the heart of the entertainment district and walking distance to everything. When I return, this is THE spot!FANTASTIC views!  If you are staying here, request a mountain view room.  Natural Beauty right at your window.  They also have complimentary breakfast that is actually very good.  Clean rooms, great service.  We stayed here during a vacation in late February 2013...We couldn't have asked for more!Excellent accommodations! Perfect in every way. Such a pleasant stay, great breakfast, welcoming staff, serenity, nature, walking distance to the creek and shops! Such a pleasant environment and pleasant people! Claudia is an awesome concierge. Gets ya what ever you need and has answers to all your questions. Love it here!This was an excellent place to stay in Sedona!! We had our 3 month old and our golden retriever and the hotel was accommodating for both. The views were spectacular and the property has beautiful lawn areas and a nice place for pets. The breakfast was phenomenal! The location was great as well! We will definitely be back!!Loved my view, my room,  and my amenities! Would highly recommend to any one traveling there for work or leisure.  We were there for work but all I wanted to do was enjoy the view! Clean rooms and nice staff and great breakfast!Great view... Treated like scum by the best western staff at breakfast. Went to grab some breakfast for my wife and son, asked if they had any paper plates or to go box so I could take the food back to our room. The lovely hostess replied "um, we don't do that here"... I said can I take some fruit for my son? He's sick and constipated"... She said "you can have one banana". Disrespectful, irritating, totally uncalled for.The price of my room definitely wasn't worth it... But again, great view.Holy moly... I have to add to this review...So I got my boy dressed and took him to BW breakfast. Ate a bit, and put a 4 pieces of bacon in a napkin for my wife... Let the bus boy know I was taking my boy to go potty and we'd be right back, so please don't clear the table... Came back 1 minute later... Everything's gone... No more bacon being served... Perfect way to start the day.
review_content_20: Well all I can say is that Best Western isn't just any ordinary hotel any more. A girl friend and I decided to stay in a condo at the Best Western Arroyo and all I can say is wow!! I'm very picky about where I stay. This condo exceeded my expectations. It was a two bedroom, 2 bath condo that say right on Oak Creek. The bathrooms were the bomb!! The master bath had marble sink, jacuzzi tub and a beautiful walk in shower. The lighting in the bathroom was incredible. The condo also had a small kitchen, dishwasher and a washer and dryer.  The living room had Flatscreen w/DVD player. In fact all the rooms had flat screen. When opened the slider to walk about we were but feet from the creek! It was gorgeous here.. To fall asleep with the sound of a rushing creek was beyond unbelievable. The property has so much to offer here. Would stay here In a heart beat again. They also served breakfast. Just wish they would serve a little later, for those who like to sleep in.  Our trip was perfect with the help of Best Western, I use to pay the same amount to stay at Enchantment Hotel and spa and it didn't even come close to what this condo offered. Luv it!! So worth it!!Not your typical Best Western.Recently stayed here for 2 nights during a trip to Sedona.Great location........ walking distance to uptown shops and restaurants.This hotel has 3 different sections to it so I'm sure it is different depending on which area you stay in.There is the main hotel which I think is 6 stories high. Then there is the Roble North Rooms which are 5 rooms that are in their own little area. 2 on the ground floor and 3 on the second floor. These rooms are upgraded and larger than the standard hotel rooms and come with their own parking area.They also have condos which are next door that seem to be part of a timeshare.We stayed in a ground floor Roble North Room.The room was large with a huge bathroom with huge shower with rain shower head and body sprays plus a separate Jacuzzi tub.There is also a fireplace, small fridge and microwave, room safe, sitting area and large TV. ..... not to mention a great view of the red rocks and beautiful outside lawn area.The room was super clean. I am a hotel freak and I do an entire ""Anthony Melchiorri from Hotel Impossible" type room inspection on all rooms I stay in.This place was clean!!...... really clean.The pricing is higher than most Best Westerns... we paid $225 per night plus taxes!$505 out the door for 2 nights.But included in the price is a full buffet breakfast in their breakfast room.Normally we always pass on the included breakfast because they are so bad........ but not at this place. It was very impressive.The food was good and many different choices.... eggs, potatoes, breakfast meat, yogurt and granola, fresh fruit, waffles, egg casserole, oatmeal, muffins and a couple different juices. The food was good. We ate there both days and I'm sure that saved $30 each morning compared to going out. Probably the best hotel breakfast buffet I have ever seen.The hotel has many amenities which are next door at the condo complex... nice pool, tennis courts and racquetball courts. There is also a small creek that you can walk to which is behind the condo complex. It is all very scenic.I will definitely return here on my next trip to Sedona!Great views. Nice location. The grounds are amazing. The room is nice with balcony. When a stranger tried to get into my room at night because the staff double assigned the same room number (during my occupancy), not a fan. Also, there were problems with the keys. After checking in, I tried to get into the room, but the keys didn't work properly and the front desk had to reset the keys. Perhaps the stranger struggling to get into my room ran into the same key issue and that's possibly the only reason why they didn't just walk in on me in the room, thankfully I was able to catch them at the door. Hopefully that was a one in a million and doesn't happen again.The Hotel is very nice. The amenities were very nice. However the staff was not very hospitable. They were not friendly or welcoming at all. Considering, we did pay a lot of money to stay one night, it would have been nice if the staff were friendlier. The breakfast food was  not that great also. I probably wouldn't stay there again.Overall, a good place to stay in Sedona.  Location is excellent, views are breathtaking, pool is kid and parent friendly, nice staff, yummy hot breakfast, and the place is quiet.  I would return without question.The only thing I noticed was that the bathroom floor was not cleaned while we were there.  The dark hairs on the tile floor were still there after two housekeeping visits.Really impressed. I took my mom here and we were booked in a room with two Queen beds, a DVD player, balcony with a view. The room was spacious and clean and the beds were so comfortable I miss sleeping in them on a regular basis. I wasn't a Best Western sort of person but I am quickly learning that they are a more reliable brand to stay at and having a club card doesn't hurt either. The breakfast is served in a nice dining area. They had a large variety of foods to choose from every morning, including waffles. If you get there early enough you can beat the crowds. The pool has beautiful views of the red rocks. I enjoyed having an early evening swim. Music played in the pool area while I floated around and enjoyed the Arizona sky. They also have access to a gym over at the time share area. Even the treadmills have a great view. The location is almost perfect and located right at the end of town. We started at the shops on the hotel side of the street, went all the way down and then circled back and shopped on the other side before returning to our room. The staff were exceptional, talkative, and helpful. Keep in mind you are paying a bit more for the views, this is not a full-service hotel.Fabulous place. Great views of the surrounding area and right next to airport Mesa.  Short drive to downtown. Room was clean, as far as I could tell. They didn't always change all the sheets. Just tucked them in. Maybe hotels don't change sheets anymore? Breakfast bar was fine. Edible. Good variety.  Service was also fine at checkin and checkout.We stayed in a room with a view of the rock mountains and a balcony. It was beautiful and the room was clean and comfortable. it also was a great location to be able to walk through a lot of shops and to restaurants.  We did drive down to the Tlaquepaue village for shopping. The breakfast isn't as grand as it was advertised to be. it is a nice continental breakfast with the usual, cereal, toast, pastries to help your self to. Make your own waffle. Then they had a few hot dishes out, frittata type of things.  It was good.  I would stay here again if we came to Sedona again.No offense, but I almost cannot believe that this is a Best Western!  This is a very nice and clean hotel sitting on prime real estate. The hotel is located right in the heart of downtown Sedona. You can choose to take a nice stroll downtown, or just enjoy the very nice view of the mountains from the hotel pool.  I would highly recommend staying here.I researched a lot and am picky about places I stay. This was tricky bc my mom was joining my family of 4 and trying to find a place that accommodates all of us is not easy. We ended up staying at the Creekside Villas here. They're basically condos facing the creek. Beautiful! There are 2 floors, with 2 bedrooms upstairs. One is the master with it's own bedroom,another with a separate bathroom. The bathroom tile is dated and makes it look dingy, I would opt for an upgrade on the bathroom decor but everything was clean.  Downstairs is a kitchen with a sofa bed, a dining area. My kids slept on the sofa bed so grandma could have her own room. They loved it! It was incredibly comfortable, just like a reg bed. Just a note, we've stayed at the Trump hotel in Vegas also using the sofa bed for our kids and it was extremely lumpy and not at all comfortable so this was a big surprise! The kitchen in nice and there's even a washer/dryer to the side. They even include tide and bounce. No need to bring your own. We stayed 3 nights and did 2 loads, had some detergent leftover. If you're in Sedona, you have to be a nature lover. Along with the great red rocks come cicadas. They are everywhere!  We swam in the pool and went from the indoor to the outdoor pool ( there's a little swim way to go to the outdoor one). We ended up just swimming in the indoor one bc there would be dead cicadas in the outdoor one. Also, there in the screens in the sliding doors too. Ick.Other than than, the stay was very pleasant. Plus, everyone who works there is extremely friendly! I mean everyone! Great stay for families.Great experience!  From the time we walked in the door until the moment we left.  The night auditor was the first person we encountered and she was fabulous!  She was friendly and a wealth of knowledge on the surrounding area.  Every staff member went out of their way to make sure our stay was comfortable and stress free.  And oh my!  We had a view that was priceless.  Definitely would recommend this hotel for your Sedona visit.  My Visit was from 4-8 Jan 15.I stayed here with a couple of friends on an AZ hiking trip in Sept. We all loved this place.The front desk was nice and accommodating when 2 of our friends couldn't make the trip. They also gave me a box and some tape to protect a fragile item I'd purchased on my trip. We stayed on the ground floor of the main hotel with a garden and fountain area and spectacular view of the red rock mountains. The room was lovely with nice amenities and especially comfortable beds. We found the breakfast to be superb -- so much better than the typical complementary breakfasts at other places. The food was tasty with lots of variety. Would definitely stay here -- an incredible deal for less than $200/night.Needed to book a place for 1 night in Sedona las minute and Priceline had 1 room left and I took it.  So happy I did.  The hotel is right at the beginning of Sedona's main street which meant everything was walking distance.  Restaurants, coffee shops, clothing boutiques and tour companys all within a quarter mile of the hotel. The property itself was really impressive for a Best Western.  The hotel has an outdoor pool but on the same property, the time share club house has an indoor/outdoor pool and jaquzzi, a private creek, picnic area and playgound.  All of this is available to the hotel guests and time share holders.  Breakfast is definitely a step up from the usual pastries, juice/coffee. Aside from the amenities, the views are spectacular from the balcony of the hotel and that's why you're in Sedona right?This Best Western is pricey but worth every penny.My now husband and I were wed in Sedona on June 3, 2013. Our parents, grandparents, and brothers joined us there for a wedding weekend vacation. Everyone stayed at the Best Western Arroyo Roble in all different types of rooms. We stayed in a North Signature Room and it was wonderful; beautiful view, assigned parking spot, and a fireplace. One of our families stayed in Standard Rooms and they were fine, certainly nothing to complain about considering the more affordable price  (their Red Rock View was great). However, we found that the best value was to book a Creekside Villa like the other of our families did. The villa had two bedrooms, washer/dryer, furnished kitchen, and living room with a sleeper couch. My grandparents and parents each had a private bedroom with their own bathroom upstairs. My brother slept on the couch downstairs and used the 1/2 bath located on the first floor. The villa's patio was a nice place to sit and relax. The price of the villa ended up being less than booking two rooms at the actual hotel and gave my brother his own space to sleep. Overall, this hotel was exactly what we wanted and we will definitely stay again when we visit. The complimentary breakfast, club house amenities, and location cannot be beat!This is an excellent hotel if you're planning on staying in Sedona. Donna and I spent four nights here and enjoyed it very much. We were planning on spending another night but due to the deep freeze hitting on Friday we decided to skip town before the beautiful snow turns into black ice. Since lots of people were bailing they let us check out early with no extra fees. Hotel is at the end of a very touristy part of town full of shops and restaurants. It was handy since we could just walk to a restaurant to eat and it was a short driving distance from what I considered the more enjoyable parts of town. The issue with this side of town are the time share salesmen everywhere. These parasites are worse than midway game carnies at the fair and really take away a lot of the charm of Sedona. They will literally yell at you if you don't stop in to hear their sales pitch and one followed us down the sidewalk! Make sure when you're walking to a restaurant or shop stay clear of anything saying "tourist info". Stick to the official visitor center unless you want to be called "Brainless" or "stupid" for not taking them up on their free vacation packages. Sedona is so strict on buildings blending in with the scenery and noise levels they really need to do something about these folks. The lobby of this hotel is beautiful with an always roaring fireplace and cushy leather seats. Since we were picked up from the lobby twice for tours it was nice and relaxing.
