Our room was fairly large with an extremely comfortable king sized bed, fridge, coffee maker, and private balcony facing the red rocks, specifically "snoopy rock". The room was spotless, every inch of it was so clean. Bathroom was tiny but comfortable with it's rain style shower head. Our only issue was the thin walls. We were next to the stairs and elevator and would hear folks talking while waiting for the elevator or people stomping down the stairs. Since it was snowing and very cold the heater was a must.... but the heater was so frickin loud it would wake us up every time it clicked on! Overall it's a great hotel with extremely friendly service. There was even a full hot breakfast served in the mornings with eggs, waffles, bacon, juices, fruits, cereals, etc. There is also a clubhouse which has heated pool, raquet ball court, tennis courts, steam room, and dry sauna.  Now that I'm familiar with Sedona I'd probably stay on the southern side of town and away from the time share leeches.I'm tempted to rate this place higher because of its views, but I can't because of its accessibility limitations.  If I ruled out the handicapped accessibility issues, I'd give this place another star or two.My dad is in a wheelchair, and he did just fine in an accessible room (2 queen beds), but the rest of the hotel was tough for us to get around.  Think steep inclines for parking, inescapable staircase if you want to swim, zero accommodation/parking at the workout facility, etc.  The hotel does have an elevator, and we were told that this is fairly unique for the area.The hotel has you pay a higher fee for mountain view versus "sunset view" (read: shop view).  We went on numerous drives and tours of the mountains, so we opted for the cheaper room, but if you're going for a romantic getaway, the incremental bump might be worthwhile.  We did not miss it at all.Breakfast and internet included in the room rate.  Breakfast (in a nearby building downhill) was good and varied a bit day to day--waffle station, eggs, swine, fruit, coffee, juice, etc.  The staff was fine.  No one ever opened a door while we were pushing my dad in a wheelchair, and the staff overall didn't meet the "wow, everybody-is-so-much-friendlier-here-than-on-the-east-coast" expectation our previous Arizona travels had set, but they were adequate.If you're choosing between this Best Western and the one further down the street, I'd choose this one.  I didn't visit the other one at all, but from our numerous drives, we felt this place has a marginally better location.  That said, if I return to Sedona, I'd stay somewhere else altogether.The room we wanted fell victim to lightening so we were moved into the main hotel.  One would be annoyed with this but BW took care of us by saving us 50%.  We still got a room with a view.  We also asked for a crib which was waiting for us.  We walked down to the creek and since it had been raining the past few days, the water was flowing fast and furious.  We were able to get some cute pictures with our child!  Overall, we had a great experience here.We didn't stay here, but the hubby and I attended a wedding here.  It was very pretty and they did a great job with the wedding.  The ceremony took place outside in the courtyard.  The reception took place on the second floor inside, with a very large outdoor patio overlooking the courtyard.  The next day we hung out with the hubby's brother and his wife (the bride and groom) to watch the Bears game.  The game didn't turn out so well, but their room was really nice with great patio!Even though we didn't stay here this hotel will always hold a special place in our hearts.  It was at this wedding that we became engaged!If you are looking for a luxurious hotel, don't be discouraged by the "3 star" rating or the Best Western name.  This is top notch property worthy of a 4 star rating in my opinion.  I stayed in one of their newly renovated suites and it was as nice if not nicer than any exclusive hotel I've stayed in.  Let's start with the breath taking setting.  The view from our ground floor unit over looked the beautiful and unique red mountains of Sedona.  The location of the hotel itself is perfectly set in the heart of uptown and is walking distance to dozens of shops and restaurants.  The room itself was amazing with a sleek contemporary feel and impeccably clean.  The jacuzzi tub, multiple sinks, and a walk in shower with overhead rain style head were just awesome.  When it comes time for breakfast, the included breakfast buffet is about as good as a free hotel breakfast will ever get.  I couldn't have been more pleasantly surprised and delighted with my accommodations.  This is by far the nicest Best Western I've ever stayed in.  From here on out, this hotel will always be the standard by which I compare other "3 star" hotels and Best Westerns.  Next time I return to Sedona, this is where I will be staying.We stayed in the back condo area.  Our Condo was nice.  They were doing work on the parking lot which made parking a real problem by our unit.  Staff was really not helpful with this situation.  The condo was spacious and clean.  Beds were comfortable.  Towels were not very nice and bathrooms were laid out strange,  one was very small and hard to keep consistent hot water.  In our condo, all bedrooms were up some very narrow stairs so we left all our suitcases downstairs.  Staff was attentive and quick with repairs.  The breakfast is pretty good and fresh.  In walking distance to stores and restaurants.  Pool was nice and the kids loved the game room.
review_content_40: My boyfriend took me to Sedona for the first time this Valentine's day and it was incredible. We stayed at the BW Plus Arroyo Robles Hotel & Creekside Villas (full name) and it was fabulous. First and foremost: let me tell you how fantastic the pillows are! So good in fact, I'm currently working on trying to buy some for my bed. I usually wake up with a stiff neck or back because my pillows suck but I slept so well here. The bed is great but the pillows are like heaven. Even my boyfriend liked them and he's super picky.The full free breakfast in the morning was really good, although I will say that I wasn't a fan of the potatoes. Something about them was too sweet. Possibly too much rosemary but the waffles were great and it was nice to have a got breakfast on a cold morning. The room was pretty standard for a hotel room. Good size, maybe bigger than most hotels I've stayed at. A nice little balcony that gives a great view of the red rocks.The indoor pool was a little disappointing. I was expecting something grander than what it was and the outdoor portion of the pool was closed because of it being February so the inside only part didn't seem big enough for more than one person to swim in. (the pool has a pass through that goes from the inside to outside). The rec center, where the pool is, is fun though. They have pool tables and ping pong and Foosball and all that other kind of stuff for entertainment. I think one of my favorite parts was the lobby having 24 hour hot chocolate and coffee. Coffee with REAL CREAMERS! Not the grainy generic creamer that most hotels give you. This was actually International Delight caramel and vanilla creamer. (I know that seems like a little thing but for someone who won't drink coffee without creamer, it's huge). The hot chocolate was really good too and helped defrost my fingers at night. Their location I think is both good and bad. It's in uptown around tons of shops so it's fantastic for shopping and walking around enjoying the views. However, we had to go down the road quite a bit (a past at least two roundabouts that drive me crazy) to get to the grocery store or to the restaurants we went to, like the Hillside grill and such. The look of the hotel is fabulous and it's much bigger than I expected. There's also a creek that runs through it (hint the name) and it was so relaxing to go sit on a porch swing sort of thing by the creek and the trees and just chill. Overall, I highly recommend it to those going to Sedona. It's a beautiful hotel with beautiful views and friendly staff.They can be expensive since they are right on the main "tourist" strip of Sedona, and right by Oak Creek (seriously, just a walk past the pool and you are in the creek - AMAZING) but here is a tip - even if they try to get you for a ton of money, just tell them you want a better deal.  Work them, ask what kind of discounts they can give you etc.  They tried to charge me 249 a night (standard I think) but after some wheeling and dealing with them I got it down to 169/night ... and for Sedona ... during Labor Day - that's a steal!  Just remember you can haggle them and work them down.  Tell them you will go to the "other" Best Western or something.  They have rooms they need to fill and want you there.  Trust me :-)A very solid value for the area! I wouldn't hesitant to recommend it to friends who want a comfortable base to explore the area & aren't seeking a retreat/resort experience.Pluses:a) room:-standard hotel room with comfortable bed-fridge so you can get items from the grocery store-free wifi-great view from the balcony of rocks-facing rooms-reasonable prices for Sedona (about $170/night over Veterans' Day weekend before taxes)b) extras:-clubhouse with ping pong, air hockey, pool, some photocopied hiking maps, etc.-free breakfast (even you have a restricted diet, it's nice to sit down with tea and fruit, and the breakfast staff are very friendly)c) location:-walkable to restaurants/galleries and across the street from Harmony Park (public xylophones)-near the "Y" highway intersection so easy access to all parts of SedonaMinuses:a) general:-front desk staff a bit curt (for example: surprised me by grabbing my car keys when I said I didn't know my rental's license plate number, which is sometimes written on keys but wasn't in this case, and grabbing them was not appropriate)-a bit of a walk up stairs from the parking especially if transporting luggage (there is supposed to be temporary parking for unloading but it happened to be full when we arrived, though afterwards it was not full)b) during cold weather:-motel style hallways mean you have to go outside whenever you leave your room, and it's more cozy not to have to wear a coat to breakfast-you have to walk a way outside to get to the clubhouse so it's not ideal to run back & forth to the hot tub in your swimsuitThis is really an interesting place to stay.  It's a combination quaint little motel and pseudo-resort.  My wife and I had a room in the motel part.  The price of the room was pretty high, so I expected some luxury, but the only thing luxurious about our room was the view.  It was spectacular.  We had a very thin balcony overlooking the red rock panaroma, which was a great place to sit and enjoy the ambiance.  Our room was small, probably about 20% smaller than a standard nice room.  There was one bed - a queen.  A king bed would not have fit and still have room for a desk or a chair.  The bathroom was a tile square with no dividers - half toilet area and half shower.  No sink.  The sink/vanity was outside of the bathroom, right by the bed, which could be a problem if you and your roommate keep different sleep hours.  Oh, the shower.  Rainforest head, with two horizontal sprays at strategic body areas.  Also a separate portable adjustable shower unit and a fold down seat.  Pretty much everything you could want in a shower.   Best Western has apparently partnered with a timeshare property next door/down the hill, and motel guests have full use of the timeshare clubhouse facilities, which is a really good selling point.  There's also a lot of property, playground, barbecue/picnic area, and 600 feet of Oak Creek running through the property.   It's too bad they couldn't have added a few of those square feet to our room.  Only negative about the clubhouse/recreation area is there is no food or beverage service at all.  There is, however, a complimentary breakfast in one of the adjacent buildings, and it was hot and excellent.  So, five stars for the view, the breakfast, and the shower (???).  If it were half the price I would have given it four stars, but the room was just too damn small to really be comfortable, especially if you were planning to stay for several days.  And if you want to have a drink by the pool you have to plan ahead.Clean rooms, friendly staff, beautiful views. Really enjoyed our stay!Only stayed one night but loved it! Comfy beds, great pool, awesome breakfast! Beautiful views from every floor. Steps from shoppes and restaurants. Will be back!Great location. Friendly, helpful staff. Rooms are clean. Views are amazing.  Breakfast is plentiful and the staff working the breakfast room keep things well stocked and tidy.  It is under construction and extremely noisy!!! Yikes. Don't plan on  peace and quiet.For a Best Western, this hotel was pretty nice. The views from our hotel room were awesome. The beds weren't totally comfortable but that's expected. It's right on the tourist strip so it's in walking distance of a ton of stuff. The service was nice, my boyfriend and I wanted to stay an extra night and when we went to book it, they gave us a deal.Great location in up town Sedona, stayed in a creek side villa, clean, well serviced spacious accommodation, kids loved the club house and pool, both really added to the break.  Breakfast, included, was fresh with plenty of choice, great service, never too busy.  We would definitely recommend it! Do a pink jeep tour!Best Western has really stepped up lately and it shows in this little hotel.  It's a bargain with free breakfast.  I felt safe, had wi-fi, anything I wanted to watch on TV, great beds!  Clean, non-smoking rooms and some will accept your little furry friends too.  Great location and we were happy with our stay.  We also went to Scottsdale AZ and stayed in a Best Western and I have absolutely no complaints.  Also had wi-fi in every room and in the main lobby several computers with printer.  woo-hoo.The best Best Western ever.  Great location - central & with a view of the creek & red rocks.  Not so cheap - $245, weekend nite.  But clean & roomie.  Big deep bathtub.  Comfy bed.  And free internet access!  You know what?  This place doesn't nickel & dime you!  The ethernet cable was delivered to my room for free - unlike Portola Inn in Monterey that charge you $5 to buy the eternet cable so you can connect to internet at $10!  Also, if you forget stuff like tooth brush, tampons, etc., they'll give them to you for free....  OMG!  What a concept.   Free breakfast was good!  Sausage patties, eggs, make your own waffles, cereal.  Really good for kids.We climbed Bell Tower rock & it was stupendous!We put the "DO NOT DISTURB" sign on our door and every day of a 7 day stay that we shortened to a 6 day stay we were called by housekeeping asking if we needed towels.  The ultimate irritation was being awakened on our 2nd to last day by housekeeping at our door trying to give us 2 wash cloths.  We hadn't asked for any wash cloths. When I said we didn't want any the housekeeper, then, wasn't sure if it was our room who'd asked for them.  Clearly, it was not.  We're checking out early because of it and I talked with staff at the desk about it.  I let them know that do not disturb really meant do not disturb.We had a great five nights in a standard room with a view of the red rocks. It was better than the views from the colocated Arroyo Roble Resort - they have more plush, spacious accommodations but the views of the mountains are nowhere as spectacular as the much cheaper standard rooms. The hotel was very helpful in giving advice and solving special needs. The breakfast buffet is a definite step up from the standard complementary ones provided at similar hotels.stayed with family, nice hotel wish I would have done the villas but still very pleased with valueWonderful, clean hotel for Best Western.  The most comfortable bed I've ever slept in.  And I'm not kidding.  Towels are ivory colored, soft and thick, coffee pot in the room.  Service was great and a complimentary HOT breakfast in the morning.  Rate was only about $100 for a week night and it's right in the heart of the touristy part of Sedona.  Would highly recommend staying here.Look, I don't stay in a lot of Best Westerns (or such similar hotels), but I was on a budget conscious men's weekend.  This does the trick.  Their is a view, which anywhere else in the world would be considered amazing.  But for Sedona it is average.  But really, you are going to get viewed out in Sedona after a couple days.  Their is a balcony, but I can't imagine hanging out on it.  It was just kind of sparse.  Their is a very good pool (two I think).  And it is heated.  It was downright cold, and some crumb muncher was enjoying himself mightily.  If you also don't often stay at Best Westerns, know this: the front door opens to and outside hallway and therefore to parking lot and road sounds in the morning.  It wasn't hugely loud, but it was not a hugely busy time of year.  This is an OK choice.  And the price is right.  Oh yes, no mini bar but a mini fridge... Go down to the Circle C and get a six pack to stock in the room.

review_content: Read the reviews on this place and decided to take a risk on this one.  I know a reviewer said it was far from the main drag, but I like to avoid congestion at all cost as I like to find parking and not walk a mile to my room if I decide to go out for dinner and come back after 9pm.  I truly think this is the best value in town, and for the following reasons.  1.  Can you say soft water???  I believe these guys may have the only soft water system in the area.  Coming from Cali, the dry air works wonders on my skin (not positive), so it's great to have soft water.  2.  The showers are solid granite with glass sliding doors.  The maids clean this room so well each day, one one of the days, I was reaching for some liquid soap in the shower that I brought and jammed my finger into the glass shower as it was so clean, I didn't even notice it... OUCH!!!!!    Fire Places in the room, DVD players in the rooms for each tv, immediate hot water (no warm up process), and full breakfast included.  I mean eggs, sausage, a waffle maker, etc...  Can't believe they do this for the price of the room.  Do these guys make money???  But lastly, The Staff are amazing at this place.  Very warm and they make you feel like family.  Part of their own.  If you like quiet, great service, but most importantly most bang for your buck, this is the place... well it was for me.This place was fantastic for the basic room I paid for.   I live on a budget and this was one of the best places I have stayed at for what I paid.  Continental breakfast was much more with egg choices, oatmeal, waffles, cereal, bagels, fruit (fresh) and more.  The microwave and fridge were great and it was not with the toilet; near the sink but I have no concerns with the location.  They have a great clock that has different phone charger options and a couple of USB outlets, it came in handy. The walls are thin - thankfully we did not have kids next to us.  The strong jets were needed after a four hour hike but the hot tub was nice and hot.   GoodCleanFriendly staffFriendly/helpful concierge Awesome breakfastAC Lots of towels in roomGrounds cleanRooms very cleanClean shower/tubGood water pressure from showerFree parking WeakSpa jetsThin wallsWe, a family of 5, stayed 1 week at the Sedona Real, it was definitely more than expected! It's not luxurious but it's extremely clean and comfortable for the price. I was in a ground floor (2nd floor should have a nice view of the rocks) suite with 2 queens, 1 queen sofa, fireplace, balcony, refrigerator, microwave, TV, DVD, tile floor and balcony. There were little amenities that made  the room more enjoyable like double sink, spacious room even with 3 queen beds, and huge trash outside the room, which made it easy to unload our bigger trash. I particularly enjoyed to have the room cleaned early! This is a must for us when on vacation. The ladies did an awesome job refilling the shampoo and towels abundantly. Well deserved tip! Very knowledgeable concierge, plenty of choices for breakfast. Oh, and they are really pet friendly! My little dog got a leash, a few cookies and a collapsible water bowl during check-in, which was really handy during our outings during extreme heat. Cons:The pool is small and full of children on the weekends, but they were having fun! It was only ours during the week.Spa is not really bubbly or with strong jets but still, did the job. It would be nice to have a bigger pool since it's so hot! And.... the AC, it's a little noisy and kept going on and off during the night so we'd wake up hot then it'd come on again, like magic. We found out a button to have the fan running continuously, it got better then.I'd definitely stay there again and recommend it!Ideal if you are traveling with your furry friend.  Gifts for the pup at check in, very large fenced in grassy area to walk the dog, bbq grill, picnic tables.  Our ground floor suite was clean, huge and comfortable.  Great location...just on the edge of town coming in from Phoenix.  Close to trail heads.  Great restaurants nearby.  Concierge and staff courteous and helpful.  Hot breakfast.  Would definitely stay here again.This hotel was okay, nothing fancy, nothing bad, something basic and priced right for what's it's worth.  I was in town for the day and stayed here one night.Ken who checked me in was very nice, gave me information on the town, where to get dinner and walked outside to show me where the building was that I'd be staying in.Hotel is clean, kind of needs a remodel, the shower was a little odd, I'm thinking I was maybe in a handicapped room as there was a bench in the shower stall.It was one of the cheaper hotels in the area in the category above the motels, had a comfy bed, a desk, coffee in the room, a TV and a fitness center. They also include free breakfast.  I would say it's a 3 star but I'm going to give it 4 stars as I left my jacket in their fitness room, they found it and are in the process of mailing it back to me which shows they have great customer service!Very EXCELLENT experience with Sedona Real! Decided to have a nice weekend with the Mrs this weekend. Took a chance on this hotel and I'm very happy that I did.Check in was very easy and the staff was very helpful and knowledgeable on local restaurants and points of interest in the area. The room was immaculate. Looked like a small apartment. One tv above the fireplace with a nice couch. Another tv in front of the bed so you can catch a program while in comfort. Very nice wet bar with sink and mini fridge. The shower and bathroom were very well kept and spacious. All in all, this was an awesome place to stay in sedona.Very great experience with Sedona Real and I for sure will be returning. Awesome views too!!! Go check them out!!!Great location. Included tasty breakfast. Friendly staff. Stayed 2 nights and would return.  Close to most trails and shopping. Concierge service. Most importantly, very clean. Drawback: no safe in room.Excellent experience, clean and quite. The pool and hot tub were a pleasant surprise. First hot that didn't smell like chlorine. It was so clean you can see the bottom clearly.This is actually a nice looking place with a small river that drowns out some noise.  However I picked a bad day to stay here, because a bunch of noisy ATVers just landed here shouting to each other all night (I'm told there are about 40 of them spread out in the compound).   Honestly couldn't they be considerate to other guests and tell them to keep the noise down?  Guess I'm not getting any sleep tonight.  I should have stayed at the cheap crappy motel from last week.The good thing is the free wifi works, that's how I'm typing this review.This place is a bargain considering we came during holiday season and pretty much every single hotel was booked to the max. The room we booked is suite style with two full size beds and one pull out. The setup is a little strange with the sink of the bathroom separated and located at the entrance. The toilet and shower are in a separate room across from the sinks.Pros:- Free WiFi throughout the entire property- Small Fitness Facility - This closes at 10pm, but technically you have access 24/7 and can workout if you're quiet.- Free Hot Chocolate and Tea in the Lobby- DVD rentals - the room comes with a DVD player. You can rent a movie and get hot chocolate and microwave popcorn all for only $2.19!- Hairdryer- Lots of towels and pillows- Decent Continental Breakfast - They serve your typical eggs, sausages, make your own waffles, muffins, cereal, oatmeal, bagels, toast, coffee, juice, etc. No bacon though.- Good location to get to most places in Sedona (with a car of course)- Knowledgeable and helpful conciergeCons:- They only gave us 1 bar of soup for 5 people- Breakfast gets really crowded and it's hard to find tables- Pull out bed is uncomfortable, but they usually are- Somewhat strange setup of roomsOverall, very clean and quaint. I really liked the cozy inn feel to it.Nice place,  but not quite as fancy as the pics showed for the price.  Still a nice stop-over for us after a long road trip.  Wish we would've stayed longer to enjoy hiking.  The breakfast buffet was good, but one suggestion...get new coffee. My mom and I have 2 very different tastes in coffee and both agreed the coffee did not have very good flavor. I know there are a lot of coffee machines out there and I've never heard of that kind,  but it might be time for a change.  The coffee in the room was actually better.  Oh, I can't forget the best part...the desk employees were very friendly/easy-going.  The breakfast attendant was also very helpful when I asked for a plain banana for my very picky father who doesn't do most breakfast foods.Wonderful staff, beautiful room!!! The room was very clean the breakfast buffet was really good. My husband and I were very pleased and would recommend this place to any one and will definitely come back!This place is awesome.... Very clean... Best customer service we've had this trip... Great breakfast... Large, spacious room.... Lots of towels... Would recommend this place to friends and will stay here next time I'm in Sedona!Very nice place to stay if you have a pet.  We got an online deal for $159 a night for the suite.  It was nice and large with a tile floor for our pet. Lots of pets there.  We were in Sedona Nov 30th and the weather was perfect for hiking.  There are a lot of the hiking trails only a couple mile drive from this hotel. We hiked Devils Bridge, great first hike and awesome views. The free breakfast was typical and OK but the room was always packed and we did a lot of standing and waiting.  The next day we just went out to eat.   But that was the only lil bump in the road.Oh and the room fire place was on all the time.  Nice.Was not a fan of this hotel. We stay in Sedona a lot and have frequented several local hotels and B&B's. Compared to others it did not live up to the price. We will not be staying here again. If you are a mountain biker check out other hotels. Hauling bikes up and down stairs sucks..The Good:CleanFriendly staffLocationFree breakfastThe Bad:Small roomFridge and microwave in the bathroomNoisy AC / heaterThe bedThe shower head The towelsThin wallsPriceBeautiful place. Very impressed with the curtesy of the employees. The free breakfast is very good - better than most and way better than bagels and doughnuts. The concierge worked for over an hour to try to book my wife and daughters some spa time in Sedona. Thanks Tonya!I give this beautiful place a 5 .. BEST CUSTOMER SERVICE EVER!!!. room , restroom was clean and helpful house cleaning women. Thanks to BRIAN AND KEN .. the gift for our 1 year wedding anniversary was awesome ( upgraded to a king suite as a gift ;) !!!) I can't wait to return .. thanks for making this trip the best ever!!!!!!God bless  Mrs.and Mr. CarsonGreat service. The staff was so friendly. We had never been to Sedona before and they mapped out our entire trip for us! We had a great time. Pool is refreshing, rooms are clean and spacey. Our room had a fridge, microwave, hair dryer, free wifi, DVD player, flat screen and a very comfy bed. The free complimentary breakfast is from 7-10am and it was delicious. The location is also perfect being within 15 minutes of all the state parks for hiking or family day trips. Overall, great experience. We will definitely stay there again next time!Nice rooms! the staff/concierge were very friendly and helpful. They guided us to an amazing hike that fit exactly what we were looking for. The continental breakfast was okay, but better than nothing! The rooms were very clean. they also have a nice hot tub and pool- very wonderful as it was so hot out! Wish the rooms were equipped with safes, but they do offer access to lock boxes behind the front desk counter.Nice, clean hotel, reasonable rates, and convenient location with easy access to the heart of Sedona! This was the designated hotel for my friend's wedding two years ago.Nice array of breakfast items in the morning, which was a great cure for the morning after hangover. Don't judge, I was the Maid of Honor for my wigged-out, but well meaning Bride BFF! The only thing I'd knock a star off for was the pillows at this place were rock hard. My own fault for forgetting our pillows down in Phoenix, but don't think my Dude slept a wink that weekend.Will definitely come back next time we're in Sedona.
review_content_20: The housekeeping staff was excellent.  When we checked in the room we were given was not what we had paid and reserved for. We reserved a king suite with a balcony. We we forced to take a roon with 2 queen beds and no balcony.  My husband and I always stay in a king suite and get a balcony if the hotel offers it. We would never of reserved a room with 2 queen beds. The queen bed we slept on was very uncomfortable. we will never stay at this hotel again because management did nothing to solve the fact that they gave us the wrong room.Located in uptown Sedona, the place is near a lot of red rock formations hence hiking and biking trails too. They serve good complimentary continental breakfast. I didn't like the coffee though it tastes stale and bland eventhough it's from a coffee machine. I like my coffee strong! The roomWe got is a studio type king size bed. The room is newer than Bell RockInn but lack some amenities that you may want if you want to stay a long time. Also it is weird that the fridge, coffee maker and microwave is in the bathroom. The tv was not working and hair dryer not working. I don't think I'm booking here againBeautiful property away from the chaos, but still close enough to anything and everything. Clean rooms with comfy beds, friendly staff, and delicious breakfast buffet. Our room had a fireplace (and it actually gives off heat!) and was pretty quiet throughout the morning and night.This place was so convenient. Huge breakfast, laundry facilities, microwave, fridge, fire place, patio with a gorgeous view. There is even a little park with a fire pit and grounds to walk your pets. They have their own concierge everyday and the staff is very helpful and friendly. It is also located very close to everything. For the price you can't get any better. I will be staying here everytime I visit sedona!Dude, come on? What some people write about this hotel is comical. You get what you pay for. In Sedona, unfortunately, not even the Super 8 is cheap (over $100 dollars usually). So, I paid about 160 a night for this place. There is a hot breakfast and a fridge and microwave in every room. You go to Sedona for the Red Rocks and all of the amazing sites, not for the hotel. Don't be scared away by the one star reviews, especially the pillow review. Who writes an entire paragraph about a pillow? Not anyone I want to go to Cathedral Rock with.Before I get into the cons, I'll note that the staff was extremely helpful, courteous, friendly and offered good concierge-type advice (which is why I'm giving the extra star).Booked an expedia deal for any room available (assumed this meant either a basic double queen or king room).  Did not expect to be stuck with a handicap room where there is a vinyl bench in the shower with detachable flimsy showerhead only going up to top of my neck, big empty bathroom at the cost of a smaller tiny bedroom and fridge mounted on top of desk that was small to begin with.  No space in room for even a small seat.  Expedia room description misleading (which I assumed the hotel signed off on).  Staff did try to move me but hotel was sold out.Aside from issues specific to handicap room, the room generally smelt dank/musty, poor air circulation, cramped and the refrigerator froze everything we put in it.  Rooms definitely need an update.Pictures online of the "dog park" and fire pit area are misleading (does not look like that at all and is small).  Pool area is fine (but also small).Included breakfast everyday was good with eggs and such.In a decent location on edge of Sedona near some of the less popular hikes.  The main part of town and most of the hikes are about 10 minutes away.  Good thing is that on the way to that part of town, you pass supermarkets, bunch of restaurants, etc.Would consider this place a slight upgrade over a Super 8 or budget motel but definitely below a Best Western.Stayed July 20, 21, 22 2015. Enjoyed my stay. Booked through hotel tonight and then upgraded for a very reasonable fee to a king suite. The bed was extremely comfortable, there were plenty of towels provided, and the suite was very spacious. The rooms were clean and everything was in good working order. The Inn was very quiet. The location on the west end of town is convenient to the western canyons and hiking areas, and not in the middle of the noisy tourist district. The only small complaints I had were the loud air conditioning unit in the bedroom, and the breakfast was rather mundane. The solution to the AC was to run the smaller unit in the living room area and shut the large unit by the bed off at night. The solution for breakfast was to eat down the street at Chocola-tree. I used the pool and spa each morning, and found them to be clean and nicely laid out. This hotel offers a discount for repeat customers, and there is the opportunity to check a box to provide a small donation for each night you stay to raise money for developing local mountain bike trails around Sedona. I will definitely consider staying there on my next visit.Location is ok. motel type of rooms with bed right in front of door, with parking in front of rooms.Small Room in second floor without any views. AC is very loud above the window. Bed is an inexpensive version of memory foam. very uncomfortable.Pictures on website are misleading. Would try many other places before staying here again.We enjoyed our 3 night stay here. We had a room with 2 queen beds. It was plenty big for a family of 3. I love how they provide a continental breakfast (eggs, cheese, sausage, bagels, muffins, juices, coffee, and a waffle station). The concierge was super helpful as we had to get creative with activities for our 5 yr old since we were snowed in. We wish we could go hiking but unfortunately it's too snowy. It's in walking distance to lots of shops and restaurants (not the main strip downtown). We had a beautiful view of the red rocks outside our room. The electric fire place was awesome to use to warm us up after playing in the snow! There's laundry on site which is very convenient. We'll stay here again as we must return to Sedona so we can hike those beautiful trails!!Booked a night here at the last-minute on Hotwire. I think it was about $160, which, once I saw the place, I thought was absurd. It tries to be nicer than it really is. Yes, it has a pool (I was looking forward to this until I saw it was crawling with bratty kids, so I opted out) and is situated in such a way that there are multiple buildings that you drive to, which might make it feel more like a resort. But I've stayed at plenty of Hyatts and DoubleTrees for cheaper with nicer rooms. The rooms are dated-looking but clean. My door wouldn't deadbolt unless I slammed my body against it. And at first I thought the toilet wouldn't flush - until I turned it so hard I thought it would break off (it probably will next time someone stays there). The desk staff left something to be desired. When I arrived, two people were at the desk and one was helping a confused woman who was taking forever. The other didn't say anything like "We'll be right with you" or anything until I'd been standing there for a good five minutes wondering what the issue was. When I got to the desk, someone behind me asked the staff where there was a good place to get ice cream nearby, and the desk clerk said there wasn't anywhere, only at the grocery store. I later looked on my phone to see if there was a place nearby, and sure enough there was about five places, one of which I went to. You'd figure the staff gets asked questions like this a lot, and to not know seemed pretty unprofessional. In the morning at checkout, the clerk didn't smile or seem friendly at all. The breakfast looked unremarkable, so I spent $5 on a bagel down the street.The room is less than I expected but the friendly service made up for shortcomings in the room.  Geoff F's review pretty much nails it, it has the vibe of 1980s motel - clean and maintained but not updated.  Pricewise, it is no bargain but I think room rates throughout Sedona are pretty steep due to the proximity to the red rocks and other natural wonders.  Breakfast included with room is slightly above average.  Grounds and gardens are nice.Pretty good location, affordable, nice rooms, and extremely friendly staff. We booked very last minute as the local Days Inn had no one at their front desk for 30 minutes to check us in. We cancelled that reservation and read good reviews on AAA about Sedona Real. Those reviews were correct! The concierge gave us good tips of what to do in Sedona and when we checked in Kenneth suggested a delicious restaurant down the road. Would recommend to anyone--especially if you plan an extended stay in Sedona.Never being to Sedona before, my friends and I really had no idea what to expect in a hotel in the area.  We got a great deal (2 queen beds and a sleeper sofa, a fireplace, and a balcony)- they even have a Yelp check-in bonus too!  WiFi is free, and so is breakfast- its decent enough to get you on the road!Check-in was easy, and parking is free.  When we got to our room, it was spacious and clean; however the fridge wasn't working.  We called and they sent us a carpenter.  And then we met Dean- he seems to be the go-to guy around this place- like the hotel knight in shining armor.  He was friendly friendly and a bad ass in general.  Make sure you say hi to him if you see him (he has also been renovating the rooms there- great job!).This place isn't a Ritz by any means, but it is comfortable and affordable, and the people are nice.  There is even a pool!  Did I forget to mention its a block from the Jeep rental place I went to?  Awesome!Quick summary: A clean version of a low end motel, with typically poor noise isolation, room finishes, and overpricing of many Sedona hotels.The bad: As other reviewers note, the pillows are hard. Really hard. We're talking sandbags. Maybe they're stockpiled here by the city in case area creeks flood. We asked for softer pillows, which the staff happily announced would be delivered while we were out for a day trip. More pillows were delivered -- more of the same sandbags. "We asked for softer pillows," we cried, our necks and shoulders begging for relief from the previous night. "That's all we have," we were told after a second call. Why get our hopes up? Why charge nearly $300 for a room with WEAPONS GRADE PILLOWS?Yes, that's a paragraph dedicated to pillows, but you'll be sleeping a lot in this town since it shuts down early. The pillows alone are worth a lost star.Other problems: nearly 0 room lighting (see photo of sign proclaiming their poor quality in exchange for being "Green" -- we simply think the proprietor is cheap!). No view at all (our patio looked at some large storage shed and a tree in a dog park). At least put some landscaping in to hide this, folks! No staff between midnight and 6 am -- not generally a problem, unless it turns out your Green toilet suffers from water pressure so low you'll swear it clogs simply from water itself. Maybe bring your own plunger?Want a good shower after a dusty day outdoors? Nope. Enjoy the Green (that means "cheap", once again) shower head with what can't be more than 1 gallon per minute flow. You couldn't clean a coffee mug with that thing! Plan on Green 30 minute showers. The towel awaiting you after is child-size at best, and also doubles as 100 grit sandpaper. Which is better than the hand towels that have to be 50 grit and actually took paint off the wall! (Yes, we tried out of curiosity. Yes, the paint was also cheap.)Our building seemed to have a bonus feature: an earthquake simulator. That's right, every time the guests next door closed their door (they all slam -- hard) the entire wall supporting the bed violently heaved. I dreamed multiple times of earthquakes collapsing the building onto my neck (between the wall shaking and the pillows, it seemed real at the time).We didn't particularly care, but the rooms don't even have HD channels on their Best Buy/Insignia TVs. The internet access is also painfully slow.Don't plan on walking anywhere from here either. It's pretty much the farthest hotel away from town.The air conditioning worked but had to have been diesel-powered. I've never heard a louder in-room unit, anywhere. The floor shakes from it!The good: high ceilings. Relatively clean. Relatively large room. Friendly if unprepared staff. Relatively close parking to most rooms (and there seemed to be enough spaces, though I wouldn't park a large truck or RV here).We gambled trying to stay here due to our usual spots being booked, but it wasn't a pleasant experience.We live in San Diego and had my Mother and Sister- In-Law visiting from NJ & PA. We decided that we wanted to expose them to the rugged beauty of Sedona's red rock country. My wife & I enjoy the freedom & versatility of traveling in our Class C motor home. However, we felt that my  Mother-In-Law & Sister-In-Law would be more comfortable in a hotel room. By chance we stumbled upon the Sedona Real Inn & Suites. Two of the hotel's staff, Jake & Todd, were stellar in their friendliness, assistance & recommendations. We booked the room for our guests and were allowed to park our RV in the parking lot. The reserved RV parking spot in immediately adjacent to one of the most beautiful and well maintained dog parks I have ever seen. As our two little furry four legged children were in heaven romping on the lush grass, we were too. With one exception, a female working the front desk at our check-in, the staff has been nothing but amazing. They have gone out of their way to make us feel welcome and address any needs that have arisen. We will be back. Jake and Todd, thank you. In our eyes, you guys are Rockstars!Can't complain about my stay here. Great location, good breakfast and a very friendly staff. Not only do they offer pet-friendly rooms, they have a park for their guests complete with dog waste stations. My only complaint were the pillows on the bed. A little firm for my taste. But I would stay here again.This would not be my choice for future accommodations in Sedona.  Pros: the park next door is nice, with easy gated access from the parking lot.   Great if you travel with a pet.  The whirlpool suite was large and clean with a nice sized spa in the room and a toasty fireplace.  The room was clean and lots of towels- I always appreciate that.  The bed was also very comfortable.Those were my pros but unfortunately, I had an overall uncomfortable stay for a few reasons:When I arrived, my reservation had been canceled for some reason and I was told the only room they had left was the whirlpool super suite about $150 more per night for the week; more than double the rate of my initial reservation.  This was a surprise, but I kept a smile on my face and said that would be ok- Afterall, I'm always open to a nice suite.  Check-in was not overly welcoming and it felt a bit odd that the desk clerk asked me multiple times if I would be having an extra person in the room and explained the "penalty" repeatedly- it was obvious he didn't believe I was traveling alone. Come on now surly hotel guy-  some people do travel alone and aren't trying to save $15 by hiding their spouse in the trunk.Since I was at a seminar all day I opted not to have my room serviced for the first two days.  Both days I returned to coldly written notices taped to my door telling me my room would need to be "inspected for my safety."  I don't believe I've ever stayed at a hotel the required mandatory room inspections before.  Classy, very classy.  There's a small self serve breakfast included in the rate- it was not edible and the juice was actually rancid.  Bland egg beaters with bad grocery store salsa, cereal with warm milk or stale muffins and coffee are the options.The fitness center is an empty guest room with a few pieces of equipment.  Nothing wrong with that but if you'd prefer, you may want to bring appropriate clothing and head outdoors.  There are a number of really great trails nearby for hiking.I've stayed here twice now (about 4 years apart)  and had a wonderful experience each time.The first time was with my Siberian Husky, two teenage girls, my mom and I in one room, and my cousin and her husband in another. We were all happy with the grounds, how clean and well appointed the rooms were, the quality and offerings of the breakfast and the good rates. Last weekend was with my sister. I opted to book us the delux suite - so I could sneak out and smoke without waking her and we could both have some privacy. WOW. The room was huge - and probably overkill for just two of us.The concierge was wonderful, checking in and out was quick and easy, I was once again impressed with how clean and well appointed the room was, plenty of selections at breakfast (fruit and yogurt, oatmeal, various dry cereal, bread and bagels, waffle maker, sausage and scrambled eggs as well as juices and coffee), and once again - was impressed with the value. For the rate paid, I would have not expected it to be as nice as it was.Good location, easy access and staff eager to help and please.This will definitely remain my lodging of choice in Sedona.Stayed there this weekend for business, and thought my room was quite nice. Enjoyed just kicking back when I wasn't knee deep in paperwork and watching a little TV and just taking a relaxing nap. Didn't really eat much at the all you can eat breakfast buffet as they didn't have breakfast fare that I personally prefer, but everything I did have was good. If I had to make a suggestion, it would only be that the coffee they serve in the room (packets that make one cup) need to be switched out to something much more flavorful. My coffee in the room both mornings was extremely weak and flavorless. Had to go to the buffett to get decent coffee. Other than that, nice clean place, quiet for the most part, and when I go back up to Sedona next time on pleasure, I will probably stay there.Cannot get a better concierge! Debbie helped us navigate through Sedona, book our Pink Jeep Tour, and recommended awesome restaurants. After the closure of all National Parks/Monuments she helped make our trip a blast. Also, the hotel is clean and nice. The morning breakfast was good. Definitely go for the fresh bagels and muffins. They are from the local bakery.
review_content_40: We were looking for a place to stay in Sedona on the busy Cinco de Mayo weekend.  Several higher-cost nationally branded hotels were already full so we tried Sedona Real Inn.  What a wonderful find.The level of service and attention was first-rate, unlike the "faux" luxury services provided in many of the pricier hotels.  Their concierge desk was attentive and helpful, as was the front desk staff.  They are set up as a high-end motel with a nice pool and spa.  The rooms are clean and simple but attractive without too many frills - perfect for Sedona where we want to spend most of the time out of the room.  The pool and spa area is basic but very comfortable and available from 7am to 10pm.Speedy Wifi was free and the room had a refrigerator where we could put our drinks instead of it being filled with $14 miniatures of Scotch and $6 Snickers bars like so many hotels do now.  There is an attractive and roomy park/dog park in the rear of the parking area; next trip I'll bring the dog.This was a great pick for a Sedona get away.  It's tough to choose a hotel online without previous experience in a city, yelp really helped out with this one.  Nice sized rooms, very clean -- all the comforts we needed for a five night stay.  A couple miles from the congested 'uptown Sedona'. The location was perfect and access to great restaurants.   The included breakfast was a surprise and a real bonus... Saves big on an extended stay.Loved this place.  The staff was awesome, and accommodating, and the rooms were very big and comfortable.  The pool was great, too!!We plan to stay here again o our next trip to Sedona.I stayed at this hotel and was very pleased with the room, service and overall experience. I had a room overlooking the pool area and only seemed a bit loud during the daytime, when I was out so it did not matter much. I would stay here again if in the area. Lot's of nice shops close to it and it is far less expensive than some of the other local hotels.Good hotel, reasonable cost, really nice staff, a good experience and a good value.This is like a Hampton Inn but with older buildings and decor. Sedona Real was neat and clean.  I liked the breakfast, altho the layout of the food stations leads to a lot of congestion when it's busy.  The concierge (Debbie) was very knowledgeable and helpful.  We had one of the larger rooms (a suite) and it was really big and comfortable.  Our only complaint was the noisy AC unit, but that is typical in this price range.This is a gem in Sedona. Our room was meticulously clean, large and upscale with two toned walls, expensive furniture and elegant decor. They had the best most comfortable hotel mattress I've ever slept in. Their pillows were perfect for proper neck alignment. We had the a/c on constantly due to the heat and it definitely kept us cool. This place is inexpensive for what you get. It is a few miles away from the downtown part of Sedona so it's secluded. Highly recommended!3d/2n here. We were sent to room 613 (2 queen beds). We got a discount (mentioning yelp) and ended up paying $160/night (+tax) for the room, which was on the cheaper end of other hotel prices in the area. Sadly, we got what we paid for. The room was very tiny and motel style. I was super surprised because the night prior we came from La Quinta in Prescott which was $90 a night and weren't expecting much because we were just sleeping there, and that room put this to shame big time! So, we decided to call the front desk and asked how much would it be to upgrade to a bigger room, perhaps the one with a jacuzzi in it that I saw online. I spoke with a lady who's name started with a 'T', I think Theresa..? She said it would be $85 more a night. I asked if she could cut a deal and she said ok she could go to $60 more a night but that's the lowest because she knows she could sell it for higher. Ugh..ok. Thanks...? So first she offered to let me see the room since it's only a king and we had a baby and 4 yr old. So I went with her. The room was much more open and had a nice looking jacuzzi in it. I told her we would definitely keep it. So we switched to room 111. It was already late so we watched a movie and passed out. Next morning I opened the cupboards under the sink to find a fridge full of prior tenants old food, a bug, and a trash full to the rim. I was disgusted by it all, but especially the bug. It was a tiny bug, but still why is there a bug in the fridge?!!  So, when we went to have breakfast at the hotel (which is included), I talked to the front desk supervisor 'Ram'. I showed him pictures of the fridge (old food and bug) and the trash. He was apologetic, assured me that wasn't how they run their hotel, and told me he would contact housekeeping then call me in my room. Not long later he called me, saying housekeeping is detailed oriented and they don't know what happened but would be in to clean the room entirely and also would comp our upgrade difference ($60) for the night. I told him it was much appreciated, I wasn't looking for a handout I just wanted it taken care of and for them to know for the future because when you get a suite you don't expect it to come with this. We ventured around Sedona all day, came back to the room and I opened the fridge and what do I see? The bug is still there and the fridge is still full of old food. The trash next to it was dumped and our bed made, so I know housekeeping did come. So I called the front desk, Ram was gone for the day and a female supervisor was there. I don't recall her name (she was an older lady with black hair). I politely told her the situation and that the fridge was still dirty, she was familiar because I guess they notated what was going on. She said she spoke to Theresa (the one who first showed me the room) and that there was no trash around. I told her that I told Ram that the room looked clean, it was in the cupboards that was dirty. Her tone made it sound like I was lying and I got highly offended. I asked her if she was accusing me of lying and she said no. She again repeated what Theresa told her. I asked her if Theresa said we looked in the cupboards when we went there and she said she wasn't sure but would clarify. I informed her that there wasn't anything to clarify because we didn't look in the cupboards, we just looked in the room. She offered to come clean it out herself, at first I told her no. I got off the phone and my bf and I were discussing everything and he was upset. He said he wanted them to come see the old food and bug in their, so I called her back and politely asked if she would come and clean it out. She came herself and had a completely different attitude and was polite. I was tired of dealing with all this, on what was supposed to be a relaxing vacation. That evening we decided to go in the jacuzzi.  We were wondering why actual bubbles (like soap) came out when we turned on the jets, and were grossed that our skin felt slimy, and I smelt mold when the jets turned on---well to our horror the jacuzzi emptied and I see all this black gunk in the bottom. You could blame us for being dirty or something, but 1) we showered for bed before deciding to get in the jacuzzi 2) this was not dirt, this was like mold and buildup. I was so disgusted, but after dealing with the situation prior I knew it was useless to mention it to them. They just get defensive and play the blame game. So we go to check and out the gentleman asked how our stay was and I chuckled and said not that great and Ram was next to  him and said he would take care of my check out. We talked about how when he left they still didn't clean the fridge out, he said he read the notes and felt so bad because he assured me it would be taken care of. He said he would comp both $60 upgrade fees. Very nice of him, but I'm sorry we can not recommend this place! I understand the initial oversight, but it wasn't taken care of, & I was talked to like I was lying..not cool..Nice location and nice, clean rooms.  There are a lot of options at breakfast (including a waffle-maker) and they're all really good.  On a side note, the nighttime front desk attendant is hilarious.We decided to save money but made a big mistake.. You get what you pay for! The beds are way too hard, so uncomfortable, the older brunette lady at the front desk was rude and unfriendly. We asked her if we get a choice of which room and she looked at us like we were stupid for asking. She swiped our keys for the wrong room and we had to return back to the front desk to fix her mistake. We waited to go to the male employee there and he was actually friendly and apologized while fixing the issue. Only positive was the free breakfast. Will not ever return.Comfortable rooms, at a good price for Sedona, in a convenient location.  When we checked in, they upgraded our room at no charge to a very spacious suite, which included a fridge, microwave, and a countertop bar area.  There were 2 TVs, one in the "lounge" area with the sofa, and one in front of the bed.  The bed itself was nice and comfy with lots of feather pillows.  Breakfast is included, and includes hot food such as make-your-own waffles and scrambled eggs.  There is also toast, bagels, and muffins.  For drinks, there is hot coffee, and various juices such as cranberry, orange, and apple.  A very wide selection of breakfast items for free!  The quality is as you would expect, not the greatest, but hey, it's plentiful, and free!  The front desk staff was friendly and helpful.  I'll definitely be staying at the Sedona Real in the future!We were not expecting much for this hotel when we booked but we liked it!!You can tell hotel rooms are remodeled so inside is modern and very roomy.4 adults and 1 kid had plenty of room.Breakfast was not bad also. We will stay here again when we go to Sedona.decent last minute spot. tales of the crypt front desk worker freaked us out. asked for a king, and got two doubles. in-room A/C was great when working, but didn't kick on overnight which was obnoxious. also sounded like a jet engine taking off. in the plus column, free bfast from 7-10. Next time I'll book earlier and get a place worth the $$.The room was ok but it was overpriced.  We checked in without a problem but the receptionist ended up giving us the handicap room.  They never even asked if that was ok.  The problem with it was that the bathroom was huge and made the room small.  The shower handle wouldn't stay in place and the water kept on turning hot and cold.  I complained when checking out and the receptionists didn't seem to care.  I gave 1 star for the bed and 1 star for the breakfast.  I don't think I'll be going back.Nice big rooms! Breakfast time is quite crazy busy. Love that they allowed dogs.Our room was right by the back gate which backed onto the main road so it was noisy at times. Location was awesome - away from all the touristy stuff but close to all the good restaurants and hiking etcFriendly staff. Room was clean and smelled good. Stream outside the room covered up noises.   Nice pool and jacuzzi. Breakfast was not great. Coffee was bad.So we typed in Dog Hotels in Sedona.  Only a few popped up.  We called the hotels available and told them that we had two siberian huskies and that we were going to be here over the holidays.  The only one that could make accommodations was Sedona Real Inn.  So we went.Our Experience could not have been more positive. Service, We were greeted with a smile every time we entered lobby, ate breakfast or ran into the maid service.  Ammenities.  Our room had a fireplace, it was clean and had a refrigerator and very comfortable bed.Dog Park.  When we check in we received a two leashes and water bowls for our dogs.  We took them to the dog park that is behind the hotel.  This was not your fenced off dead zone...This was a fully manicured, landscaped and fully stocked with poop bags Dog Park.We love you guys and will be back.ThanksThey had a deal on Expedia, and the ratings and rooms advertised and shown looked pretty nice.  Once we got there, my husband and I were sadly disappointed.  The rooms were tiny, and the view and amenities were less than stellar.  We were not expecting something at this price to be like a Days Inn or Motel 6, but that is exactly what the rooms felt like.  The built in air conditioning unit was mounted right above the window, which was right above the bed and was so LOUD.  Some of the time we just turned off the air and sweltered in the heat, just so we could sleep without the noise.  Perhaps they have some nice rooms, but don't be fooled, clearly all of them aren't so nice.  The price you pay, even with the deal, is not worth it.  We would have spent much more time relaxing in the room, if it was more roomy and comfortable.  We thought of relaxing in the outside hot spa, but it looked to fit about 2 people.  Staff is nice enough, but not nice enough for us to come back here.  Very disappointing.Nice place.  Booked online based on some positive Yelp and Trip Advisor reviews and was not disappointed.The daily breakfast being included helps so you can get the day started right before heading out to see the beautiful scenery.Even better, the mentioned you get a 15% discount when you come back to stay again.We stayed in a 2 queen suite and it was very nicely appointed and comfortable with a fridge as well as a pullout in the couch if needed.We didn't use the concierge, but talking to some other guests, they indicated he was very helpful with suggestions for local activities.Great people. So friendly and amazing breakfast (included). Want a great a great waffle breakfast? Wake-up here. Want great service? Stay here. Want good pizza, walk across the street. Really great experience!What's not to like...huge rooms, free wi-fi, cable t.v., free breakfast, a decent pool and tons of stuff within a short drive. The hotel is very convenient to multiple hiking trail heads, restaurants, tour locations, etc. And the price is lower than what you'd pay in most other hotels in the area.
review_content_60: This is a great spot. Great up to date rooms. Our room overlooks the pool and great sedona red rocks. The price includes a generous breakfast- eggs, sausage, fruit, waffles, bagels, juice, cereal, yogurt. Great way to start the day.A great replacement when the Hyatt is full. :)Friendly staff, but don't expect to sleep. The walls are paper thin and all I heard all night was other guests. Not worth the time and effort to stay here.I've stayed here two times in the past 6 months and both times was pleased with the friendliness of the staff and cleanliness of the room. I have never stayed in the standard room so can not comment on the size of it but the Jacuzzi suite was huge! Not only did it have a fireplace and private patio but the tub worked very well and was a great way to relax after hiking. The only negative about the Jacuzzi rooms is that they are all the road so sitting on the patio is not peaceful. I was a little disappointed during my most recent stay is that neither of the two concierges were there. The rest of the staff did their best to try to guide me with a few questions that I had. The front desk staff, Brian, Daryl and Luke, and a woman who I am sorry I can not remember her name, were wonderful. I have never felt an entire staff was so helpful and friendly. Overall a great place to stay and convienient to hiking, shopping etc.My best friend and I took a road trip from SoCal to Arizona without any clue where we were going to stay when we arrived. We found the Sedona Real Inn on yelp and it was affordable so we decided to stay here. Upon arrival, we were very pleased with the overall look and feel to the hotel. It was very clean and inviting. The breakfast here is free and great! Take advantage of it. Overall it was a very satisfying experience. The staff is lively and very inviting. They were the icing on the cake! Thank you for an awesome stay with great staff and a clean environment!! Will definitely return here as well as recommend this hotel to anyone who's looking for a place to stay in Sedona. Thank you!Stayed here on our recent vacation. Very nice hotel at a reasonable price. The room we had was great as we had 5 people (3 adults and 2 kids) and between the 2 queen beds and the sleeper sofa it was very comfortable. The only real problem was the street noise as our room faced 89A. Put since we were up early for hiking and out most of the day it wasn't too bad. Plus, the view was worth putting up with some noise. The complimentary breakfast was the best. The staff was very helpful in pointing out some good hiking trails and on directions. I would definitely stay here again if I am back in Sedona.We came here primarily because they allow dogs, but would stay here even if we did not bring our dogs. Check in was a pleasant experience and the employees were helpful. The room had a fireplace and the area around the hotel is well maintained. Breakfast comes with the room and is tasty although busy. Great location walking distance from a few good bars and restaurants.Reserved a pet friendly room here this weekend. After approximately 30 minutes of being in our room, my sig other started having a major allergy attack, he is allergic to dogs. (our dog is hypoallergenic) We have stayed in pet friendly rooms previously with no issues. We let the front desk know. They were accommodating, gave us a full refund and found other pet friendly rooms available at other hotels! The room appeared clean, maybe the products they use aren't strong enough? Maybe the dog that was in the room prior? Not sure! Disappointed we couldn't stay.We loved staying here. It was clean, the staff was so friendly and helpful with what to do in and around town. The complimentary breakfast was delicious eggs, sausage, waffles, etc. Completely worth the money.We booked through Hotels.com as this was a short notice trip to Sedona. We booked a 2-queen room for a decent price relative to all the other available places in Sedona. Check-in was friendly, quick and informative. We were a little disappointed in the size of the room. 2-queens and is with a small duvet like couch. The fridge is a mini-bar fridge and is located in the bathroom underneath the sink. If you want a Coke, you will have to wait for the bathroom to get free. The air conditioner is LOUD! Luckily we came in October so it was needed infrequently, but it WILL wake you up. Breakfast is included and was decent. Eggs, sausages, cereal, bagels, juices etc. One turn off was the massive Tip jar (old pickle jar) for the cook that makes your omelet to order. Nice touch with the make to order, totally cheapened by the huge tip jar. A few good restaurants are in the area (Yelp them), and it isn't too far from attractions. Overall, I would look for other more spacious accommodations before I stayed here again. I realize that I probably got the Hotel.com room deal, but even so I think the Yelp check in deal here would have been a better value for the money. If you blindfolded me and took it off once I was in the room, I would have told you I was in a Motel 6. Once you walk outside and see the beautiful scenery of Sedona, you realize that you will have to pay a little more for that room.My family and I recently stayed here on vacation. The hotel was very nice, clean and comfortable. The hotel staff are friendly and willing to recommend restaurants and activities (which is what you should do, lots of the "tourist info centres" in Sedona are actually timeshare traps). They have a delicious hot breakfast menu every morning which includes scrambled eggs and waffles, and it's all free. The Sedona Real is also in close proximity to gorgeous red rock mountains which are iconic to Arizona's landscape. If you want to go to Sedona, stay here!I would like to give this hotel a 2.5 star rating, but I'm giving them the benefit of the doubt and making it a 3 for lack of the option.PROS: Good location- while it's not in uptown Sedona, it is in an area that has a ton of great things to do (if you're OK with a little drive, versus the uptown walking). We did not use the concierge services, but I did email with questions and they responded almost immediately with a ton of helpful info! Check in was quick and simple, desk clerk was pleasant and told us about the main important points of the hotel. They offer a morning breakfast, but we did not eat there because we had other plans that morning. The desk clerk recommended a restaurant to us the night of our stay, which was a fabulous place we'd never been to before. Very grateful for that! We were also able to obtain park passes right at the desk, which was very convenient. Rooms were clean and had simple, relaxing decor, and a lot of great local area info on the desk.CONS: I don't know what the rates are during other times of the year (we stayed last weekend), but paying $200 for that room was insane. From what we had read and saw online, we expected a much different experience. We have stayed at comparable hotels in the area for half as much, with the exact same amenities and service. I would not call this place a "resort" by any means- no restaurant, room service, spa, etc...NOT a resort! The bed in this room was a flat box with jabby springs. We had two queen beds, and tried both in case one was just an older mattress. We both slept poorly and did not enjoy the evening there. Not comfortable at all!! Also, this is by far the LOUDEST hotel I have ever stayed in. While I don't hold to hotel responsible for the large herd of screaming children that were running up and down the stairs and sidewalks at 6:30am (though it would've been nice if someone asked them to be respectful of the other guests...), the housekeepers/maintenance were just as disruptive. They were yelling in to 2-way radios, banging on doors, slamming doors shut, clanging around with their housekeeping carts, and yelling across the hotel to each other. After a night of little sleep, being forced awake at 7am was not appreciated on our vacation. Also, the rooms themselves have zero soundproofing and we could hear everything above and alongside us, including each car in the parking lot in front of the room. Paid extra for the patio "upgrade"- total waste of money, as the 1990's patio furniture was worn out and there were 6 earwigs on the wall and floor area. No thanks!We will not be staying here again. This was not the worst place I've ever been, and there are a number of good aspects to this place. But, for the (INSANE) amount of money they're asking, lack of comfort and disappointing "upgrades"- it just isn't worth it. There are other places in town that provide far more for far less money.My mom and I spent a week in Sedona in August, and picked the Sedona Real Inn & Suites because it was inexpensive, had a complimentary breakfast, and was reasonably close to what we wanted to do. It was absolutely fantastic. We got a suite with a balcony, which overlooked the pool and then the mountains. Really nice to sit out on the balcony in the morning or while the sun was setting and read with a beautiful backdrop. The continental breakfast also had a waffle iron, eggs and sausage (in addition to traditional continental breakfast fare). There was plenty of seating, and even though breakfast was crowded, we never had a hard time finding someplace to sit. Anytime anything was out, all I had to do was ask the attendant to get more, and she'd bring more out. Two weeks before we went, they posted a discount code for a last minute getaway. We had already booked our hotel with a different coupon code, and when we called, they changed it to the lower rate - no problem. The concierge were always helpful and friendly. There were no elevators, but we requested a second floor room so we could have a better view of the mountains. We had no problem pulling our suitcases up the stairs to the second floor. I know the hotel is pet friendly, but I didn't hear a single dog barking while we were in the room. (I heard some while we were out of the room, so I know they were there somewhere!!) We requested foam pillows and a feather free room, and that was all correct when we checked in. I accidentally turned the fireplace on and couldn't figure out how to turn it off - the front desk came up immediately and turned it off for me. All the pictures of the pool and the mountains? If you're looking at the hotel in those pictures, the room we stayed in is just off to the left. We did a bunch of self guided driving tours (sedonadrivetours.com, walkabout audio tours of montezuma well/castle, sunset crater, and petrified forest). I feel like we just barely grazed the surface of what Sedona has to offer. WHEN we go back, we will definitely stay at the Sedona Real Inn & Suites again. =)Went for a quick getaway last weekend and stayed here. The place was pretty cool. We got the whirlpool suite which we affectionately named the perv suite. The room literally had a big ass jacuzzi tub in the living room area, 2 leather chairs around it and a huge mirror on the wall next to it. The room was clean and nicely done though, 2 flat screen TV's, kitchenette comfy bed, and all the other standard stuff. We got the room for about $180 for the night- call for your reservations, we got a 10% discount by asking for it ;)The staff was all friendly and the included breakfast was pretty good- simple, but good. They were definitely understaffed in the breakfast area though and they ran out of coffee, a big no no in my book. I would definitely stay here again though, I keep the places that are clean!Expectations are everything, and for the somewhere around $130 I paid to stay here a few years ago, I was unimpressed. While the hotel is conveniently located across from a shopping plaza with dining options in Sedona's less touristy section, it offered nothing else that might have set it apart, and lots that I found detrimental to enjoyment. My room was dark and dingy and the bedding not as comfortable as I'm accustomed to at that price point.Good breakfast included with room. Queen suite was roomy, had refrigerator, microwave, DVD player and a good sized bathroom, AC unit kinda noisy. Only in Sedona this time for one night, decent value for the money, I would definitely consider staying here again.Just spent four nights here with my wife and kids. Good family hotel, clean, safe area. West side of Sedona out of the way from all the happenings in "up-town". The concierge was great providing us a lot of great ideas of things to do in Sedona. The morning breakfast was okay to start the day, although after four days I was getting a little burned out on the selection. If it was just a weekend with my wife, I might pick a little nicer place to stay, but for a family on the go, it covered all the basics and was very comfortable, and they gave us a great rate.Very comfortable, good price and a great breakfast! The rooms are spacious, the beds were amazing and held a million pillows. They also provide a great amount of towels, so you do not need to ask for more after you have gone swimming or soaked in the hot tub.Except for the very disappointing complimentary breakfast, the Inn provides a very good level of service. Its location is a bit distant from the center of Sedona but is right at the intersection of Dry Creek Road. That makes it a good location for many of the hiking trails that are reached off of Dry Creek. Price is good. Concierge is very knowledgable. Next door restaurant "Relics" provides room service but the food is over priced. the only thing in favor of the restaurant is its proximity to the hotel.We absoulutely loved our stay here. We traveled the beginning of February and were treated to some light snow. This was our first time in Sedona and it was for a very short visit. The room was clean and even though we didn't use it, I loved that there was a mini fridge, a microwave and a coffee maker. The bed was very comfortable. There was also a small closet, which I might have found useful if I was staying longer. The main reason I loved this place for two reasons: location and service. It seemed right in the middle of town and when we walked out of our room we had an amazing view. We checked and and the girls behind the desk were nice and checked us in quickly. When I asked about what kind of hikes we could do on our short visit she referred us to the gentleman right behind us at the concierge. I think his name was Todd. I wish I remembered because he gave us such great suggestions. We traveled with our 6 year old boy and didn't want anything too difficult or dangerous. The hikes he suggested were perfect. He also told us about a FREE guided hike at the Red Rock State Park.The breakfast was really good and we made sure we filled up before our hike. The best part is we get a 15% off discount for the next time that we stay there. This is a trip that I will plan again. Maybe in Spring when it's not snowing or too hot. The next trip will be a much longer and we will definitly stay here.
review_content_80: At first I was disappointed with my room -- bottom floor, shabby bedding (small tears in the sheets and loose threads in the comforter).  The one window opened onto the walkway so I had to keep my curtain shut the entire time for privacy.  But after a few days, it grew on me.  It was clean and had a decent shower, and I slept well.  Except for the neighbors who slam their door at 6AM -- what is up with that?! The complimentary breakfast had a lot of choices and good coffee, and I could take my plate to my room if it was too crowded.  It was a nice routine to start my day with eggs or a toasted bagel and the newspaper.The pool was small and uninviting to me, but if there hadn't been so many kids I would have at least tried it.The concierge ladies were both very nice and helpful and gave me great suggestions for dining, nightlife and hiking trails.I can't remember exactly how much I paid -- probably around $130 a night.  It was a good value and a comfortable place to stay.  If I come again I would only book a room with a balcony and a top floor.The free breakfast alone warrants five stars! Waffle iron, eggs, yogurt, juice, coffee, tea, bagels, sausage... Amazing. The staff was also incredibly friendly and helpful. They have a nice selection of movies to rent for $2 from the front desk and even give you a bag of popcorn to go with it. The rooms were nice, clean, and comfortable. Would definitely stay again!Last minute decision to stay in Sedona on our vacation and got a good rate here.  If we ever go back to Sedona, I would stay here again.  We stayed in one of the rooms with a single king sized bed, not a suite.  It was clean, nicely furnished, and as soon as we stepped out of our room, have a great view of the surrounding red rocks!  The staff was extreme helpful is suggesting places to go hiking.  We used the pool/hot tub - nice clean.  The place was well landscaped.  It was also easy to find and close enough to downtown for us (a 5-10 min drive).  Breakfast was fine; however, we were told breakfast was at 7am, it wasn't until 8am, so we got a late start on that day's hike.  That might have been our own misunderstanding, though.  I would recommend this place!My husband and I were celebrating our anniversary with a several day stay in Sedona, and stayed for four days in this hotel. The room was a spacious mini-suite -- two queen beds, dresser, desk, mini-bar with small refrigerator and microwave, couch, small table, chairs, and gas fireplace. It was spotlessly clean. The breakfast (included with the room) featured scrambled eggs, sausage links, and waffles as well as the usual continental breakfast stuff.
