Also, the pressure was perfect, and I felt like a new person walking out of that room. Just wanted to thank all the staff and spa staff for a smooth, great start to my birthday trip! You will be referred to everyone I speak too:):)Had a wonderful stay! Will go back and stay there when I can. Salt-water infinity pool was a hit with my 10 year old and view was spectacular. Great downtown stay but the hike up to the main road is pretty steep.I love this resort. I stayed here a couple days & it was absolutely beautiful!!! The view of bell mountain from the spa and heated infinity pool is awesome!!! So relaxing. Everyone was so friendly from the valet to the front desk people, bartenders & cleaning staff. They are also dog friendly and you don't have to pay extra for your pet. I would gladly stay here again and the resort is also walking distance to downtown. Highly recommend!Friendly & helpful staff, amazing views from courtyard, free wine hour, fairly comfortable rooms (though beware of the thick duvet unless you like sweating in your sleep), the quickest valets in all of Northern Arizona. Highly recommend.Not only was the place beautiful but the staff was so friendly and helpful. We especially loved this woman at the front desk named Julie! She was so friendly and helpful and is just a great person. She was warm and really helped us on our stay when it came to all the questions we had. The spa facilities are great, take advantage of the steam room and the hot tub is beautiful as well. What an amazing experience and they brought anything to the room we wanted, like a razor that we forgot! Great experience and loved Julie! thanks for the great stay! We also went to the restaurant for dinner. A little pricey but delicious. also we had the "S'mondae" - a mix between a S'more and a Sundae, AMAZING! a must try! beautiful location and friendly staff!Boutique hotels can be so hit or miss. So often the focus is on things that really don't matter to me, with the result being a lack of attention where it counts. Not so here. Amara seems to have dialed in a level of comfort and service that, for the price I scored, is a great deal. I paid around $200/night (including taxes and such) for a well-appointed room facing the parking lot. Super comfy king bed, flatscreen, subtle design, tub, balcony and the standard amenities you'd expect from a 4-star (in the classic sense) hotel. Also included in a $20 "resort fee" that I prepaid is valet parking, wi-fi, in-room water bottles (!) and a few other amenities that most chain hotels still think should be sources of income. I can't tell you how annoying it is to stay in a hotel paying upwards of $200/room and be asked to pay $15/day for wifi. That's bullshit. Not here. The facility itself is quite nice, with a courtyard looking out over an infinity pool and incredible red rock scenery. Interior it's well-decorated and has some common areas for chilling out. I didn't really eat at the restaurant but I can tell you the drink prices at the bar are a total rip (+$3 or more on average per pour of spirits than it should be). That said, bar staff are plenty friendly. In fact, all the staff here is 100% on point. Great customer service all around. Especially the valets, who have a cooler full of free water bottles. Again, the little niceties that other hotels try to nickel and dime you with come as part of the package here, which is proper when you're paying premium for the rooms. In fact, originally I was going to drop a 4-star on this place but as I think back to the comfort, style, and customer service I experienced here, I have to say, it's worth a few extra bux.Friendly valet and breezy check-in, we were told that the hotel would be only 30% full, so why do we get a room overlooking a parking lot? I called ahead to hotel about the pool, I was told it was open year-round at a temp. of 75*. Not on our 3 day stay. We were told by an employee that it had been down for over 3 weeks! Not acceptable! After hikes you want to come relaxin a pool, it is called a resort/spa. Oh, and we tried to get massages, we were told nothing was available, what a joke.ROOM: Broken media chair, closet light switch in the opposite closet, broken toilet paper holder and NO soap or shampoo. I called for soap, they brought ONE (we have a shower and a sink) The towels were not spa soft, more like sandpaper.HOTEL: Dirty carpets throughout, really needs a refresh.When I called ahead about pool I was told that the "resort" offered free valet parking. When you get the bill you are charged $20. a day for a "resort fee". RESTAURANT: Very nice service, however the food is lackluster. The shrimp wellington is horrible! My steak was ok but the sides were uneatable. Overall good service and location. Nice complimentary am coffee and 5-6 wine reception. The overall amenities were very lacking, I would not call this a spa/resort.Very nice room, food, pool and atmosphere. You can walk past the pool and down the stairs to the beautiful creek. You can also walk along the creek to the next hotel and they have a wonderful outside lounge and a high end restaurant as well. For some great exercise walk up the stairs to the main road.
review_content_80: What a great hotel! Reasonable rates for the weekend as well as great perks. They typically have a code word on their Facebook page and when you say it they bring you a bottle of champagne to the room, what a nice touch. We also have two very large dogs which they gladly allowed us to bring. The rooms were clean and the staff was very friendly. I love the happy hour. Enjoy a glass of wine on them from 5pm-6pm every night. They also have a coffee and tea bar in the morning. The views are spectacular and it's worth the short walk down to the creek. We will certainly be staying here again!Beautiful property ... However I took Away a star due to the spa saying they "request" a 20% discount on their services.. You should never tell a client how much to tip. The food is alright ... Nothing special for the price . Love the pool ! Great scene !This resort has beautiful views off the back patio and from the restaurant. The rooms are spacious and the bed was comfortable. They serve free wine every evening to enjoy while checking out the view! The food at their restaurant is very good and the service is nice as well. I recommend you ask to be seated on the patio. The only downside was the margaritas which need some work.I bought a 4-night package through Priceline.com. It turned out that the price would have been about the same if I had booked through the hotel directly, and Priceline would not let us modify the reservation once the cancellation deadline for the entire package has passed (we wanted to shorten the stay). So I will book directly through their website next time.The resort was very conveniently located with beautiful scenery as background. The Uptown area is a 2- minute (uphill) walk. Grand Canyon was about 3 hours drive, and we visited Antelope Canyon and Monument Valley on a different day (I wish we had an entire day at the Monument Valley, though).The staff was very friendly, and the service was great---free coffee/tea in the morning, free wine in the afternoon, free shuttle, free valet-parking, etc., (although these services are not technically free because $22.55 per day is added to the bill as a resort fee.) Wifi is free if you sign up for their InTouch membership (free to sign up). Overall we really enjoyed our stay here, and will be back. The only drawback was that the furnace was so loud.Stayed 2 nights in Jan. Location is great as right downtown. The reason for only 3 stars is this does not live up to Kimpton quality. Place needs a facelift which they told us is scheduled for June '14. Plants were in need of serious tlc.Worth booking a room with view as our room felt like a dungeon.Staff is very responsive and good yoga class.Very nice experience despite a rough start. We were here to celebrate two monumental occasions and were assured there would be a celebratory bottle of champagne, and "a little something extra special" waiting for us upon our arrival as we would not be arriving until after 10:00 p.m. and their bar would be closed. Once in our room there was a lovely card saying enjoy the champagne and chocolate covered strawberries, only problem was there was no champagne! After a phone call, a trip to the front desk, and many tears they were somehow able to procure the promised champagne, and to those involved I am very grateful! From there on out it was an absolutely wonderful experience.We had a jacuzzi bath and king size bed overlooking a grassy knoll and fire pit area. We only ate breakfast at the hotel, but on both occasions the food was very fresh and tasty, and the service was excellent. The menu was a bit limited, but selection was nice. The saltwater pool was clean, as was the jacuzzi, and the wine happy hour was really a nice touch. Definitely would stay here again, and would recommend it. Don't have any negatives.Sitting here wishing I didn't have to leave today! Friendliest staff and the most beautiful scenery. Everyone went above and beyond to create a very special birthday getaway for me. The pool is amazing, and the creek is so romantic. Love love love. Will be back for sure.We stayed only one night on our way back from Flagstaff. I'm a huge Kimpton fan and wanted to check this place out.Pros:- check-in and valet were great- good location (close to restaurants, shopping)- beautiful views of the red rocks- wine happy hour staff very good (as always)- lobby very nice- sitting in the courtyard in the late evening was divineCons:- our room reminded me of a upgraded "motel" (didn't get the usual Kimpton vibe)- we had to keep our patio door closed because of "staff" from the adjacent hotel constantly taking "smoking" breaks (ugh)Notes:- the pictures of the pool make is seem larger than what it really is- the best rooms appear to be the ones on the 2nd floor that overlook the pool- if you stay, don't eat at the restaurant there, take the short drive to Ken's Creekside and order the pork chop (best pork chop ever - dinner simply divine)I have never been to Sedona, AZ before, so really - any hotel would do, because we planned to be out everyday touring, hiking, and traveling to nearby attractions. So when I discovered the Amara Resort, I felt it would be adequate for the needs of my stay. Amara turned out to be a vacation in and of itself. The chambermaids left lovely notes in our room every day when they came in to clean. Meanwhile, we were treated to a free coffee/tea/hot chocolate bar every morning, complete with the NY Times. When we initially checked in, our room was not ready yet and the concierge presented us with free Margaritas at the hotel's bar. When we decided to have dinner at their restaurant, Salt Rock, we found out that there was a free wine hour with entertainment from 5-6 p.m. every evening of our stay. When we complimented the food to the waiter, he brought back the chef who explained how the dish was prepared and offered to email us the recipe. The resort was so beautiful that we didn't even think to check out the spa until the last day. Boy, were we annoyed at ourselves when we realized that the spa offered complimentary yoga classes twice each morning. On top of all of this, the doormen and valets never failed to give us advice about the general surroundings and the free use of the shuttle service to a wide radius of restaurants and local attractions. If you're planning a trip to Sedona, AZ - do not hesitate to reserve Amara Resort as your place to stay. You will not be disappointed!Great location! Right behind downtown area and next to creek on the other side. .. beautiful! Rooms are great! Creekside or courtyard rooms have the best view. Front desk I'd very helpful and they are also pet friendly...no breed restrictions and no extra charge! Would definitely stay here again!This hotel appears to be recently re-branded, it seemed to have been "freshed up". It had a lot of modern looking furnishings and seemed very clean. The pool is beautiful and looks directly over Oak Creek as well as some of the infamous red rock mountains. There is also a large grassy area right outside from the bar that has a lot of chairs and even cushions to lay on during the day and at night which was really nice and a good place to relax. The resort allows dogs, and doesn't have a weight limit, which was really nice, as long as you have a well behaved dog.The staff was very friendly and helpful when it came to giving us rides to restaurants and suggestions on places to go and things to do. Only complaint would be that the bar closes really early, however that seems to be a city wide trait, not just this resort, at least in the touristy area.Stayed August 2014, traveled as a coupleI stayed at the Amara Resort and Spa four three nights and four days. I pre-paid my stay when making my reservation, it was $400/ a night. I have stayed at other Kimpton properties but this is by far the worst experience I have had. I would start with the fact that the hotel is hard to find --- a very narrow road which leads to the lobby. They have valet only. No self-park available at all. I am here for business and having to call for my car as I am in and out of the hotel is not only annoying but time consuming. My room, Room 205 has a great view of the parking lot with a balcony. The sheets are the worst I have slept on with a thread count so low it's probably shameful to print. Not what I would expect for $400/night. The air in the room is difficult to regulate and the closet is awkward with the in room safe pretty much at the floor level. The air conditioning in the room is so loud when on it requires on to turn the television up quite loud to hear it over the roar. When you look online you will see the beautiful pool.... I couldn't use it as it was continuously crowded by families with tiny children splashing about. I would like to remind them this is a resort & spa ---- there was no tranquility when I could spend time by the pool as it was like a Disney resort. I decided after realizing I would not be able to use the pool a nap would be nice. But the housekeeping staff came back to my room three times on Saturday after they had cleaned it. They forgot one of the glasses in the bathroom, then later to change the towels again? Why? they were changed when they cleaned it in the early morning at 9:00am. If I had no pre-paid for this over priced hotel I would have checked out after the first day.I cannot say enough about our stay at this resort. Everything from the best location, to the views, the hospitality, the food, the vibe, and the stellar guest service was incredible. April, the PR woman that served wine during wine hour from 5-6pm every night, was so endearing and genuine. The views from our room were captivating. The staff were so helpful, inviting, and cordial. I would stay here ten times over, well worth every penny.Anniversary trip.Loved this place.Service, attention to detail, atmosphere, scenery and location were fantastic.Would stay again without question!Stayed here while they were going through renovation so there was no pool and no gym. If you go to breakfast here, you're also treated to a pretty view of the red rocks and the big hole where the pool once was.However, service and accommodations were very nice. The rooms are clean, the towels plentiful, and toiletries were above average. I especially liked the unlimited Crystal Geyser water they make available for guests. The only complaint I have with the space is that the walls and floors are very thin - so I could hear my neighbor's children screaming through the walls at 7am.They offer a daily complimentary yoga class to guests. Be sure to sign up a day or 2 in advance as the classes are often full if you try to sign up the night before.The location is great - surrounded by the beautiful backdrop of dramatic, red-tinged rocks and mountains (are they considered mountains? I don't know). And it's walking distance from a lot of stores & dining & ice cream options. Walking to the shops is straight uphill, but thankfully it's not far, should take less than 5 min.Our rooms were clean and had a flat-screen TV. The air conditioning worked well.There's complimentary valet parking.There's a spa attached, and they offered a complimentary yoga class every morning.I guess the only downside is that it's expensive.We stayed here for two nights during a lovely weekend in September. The service was wonderful, the staff as far as front desk, wait staff, valet service, housekeeping were all friendly and great. The location is very convenient, centrally located to the main shops and restaurants in Sedona. Nevertheless they offer complimentary shuttle service to anywhere within a mile at the snap of your fingers! The drivers were great and also gave us extra tips on the area. There are so many great hikes within miles of the resort.As far as the food, we had two meals at the resort. Dinner was really nice outside with all the stars, the warm breeze, the live pianist/singer. We had the french onion soup and the burger which were both good. The Breakfast we had really hit the spot for my craving of banana pancakes. I'd been craving them for a week now and was unsatisfied somewhere in boston the previous weekend, but this was it! They have also have a free wine hour from 5-6pm. We got a creekside room, ooooooh la la, which had a balcony over the creek and was enveloped by trees. I loved it... it was so serene to sit out there and fulfilled my desire to have a naturesque getaway... despite staying at a man-made resort.... I want my future home balcony to be identical. Well, minus the cicadas. The only only downside I would say is it's not as "resort-like" as I imagined. I have only stayed at a resort in Palm Springs and maybe the two cities aren't comparable, but the room was smaller, the resort was much smaller, though enjoyable for a weekend. The room is clean, with a california king bed, huge shower/tub.IF ever you get a chance to visit Sedona, PLEASE PLEASE PLEASE stay here!!! It was an amazing experience! The fact that it's a resort AND spa should be enticing enough...and the spa is just a small part of the entire property! The views are amazing...Sedona is ridiculous in its beauty...and the outside lounging areas are many with a great pool for relaxation. We were there in December right after Christmas and it was still warm enough to enjoy an afternoon dip in the pool when the sun was still out. We didn't eat at the hotel restaurant for dinner, but enjoyed a very nice nice cap complete with some local bites (cactus, rattlesnake...which was good!) Our room was merely steps from the pool but was still very quiet and beautiful. I would happily stay at this resort again and again--and especially when the weather is even better than it was! It is a quick drive through some of the best desert country from PHX to Sedona, and once you're there, you feel very relaxed...and the Kimpton staff makes all that possible.I had some trouble printing something at the concierge computer, but the staff helped me resolve it and refunded my room the charges, which was a very nice courtesy. We also utilized the shuttle to get to and from the shopping area which is just up the hill but it's a H I L L, so better to use the shuttle and not be out of breath at the top :)BEAUTIFUL place to visit and relax. DO ITJust finished a bachelorette weekend here with my girlfriends and we had the best time! The staff was amazing and the resort is very well kept! The pool has an amazingly beautiful back drop and the town is so cute! Will definitely have to go back for a romantic weekend with my love!Beautiful property that has a small trail to sit by the river and listen to nature!! Great pool, nice rooms, and excellent service - will definitely return. Morning's they have yoga that's included with a fabulous instructor. Went straight to the sauna and then in for a spa treatment; amazing. This place has awesome views, is within walking distance to shopping district, and great food in their restaurant. Would definitely suggest the stay to anyone visiting Sedona.

review_content: We stayed at Sky Ranch for one night on our way down from the Grand Canyon. We checked in fairly quickly around 5pm. This place is located right across from the Sedona airport however there wasn't much traffic. The room keys are actual keys and not key cards. Our room at two queen beds and was very spacious. It has a microwave and desk. The bathroom is somewhat small. We had the "garden view" room which is a view similar to you walking out your front door. They have a private area so that guests can go watch the sunset and the view is amazing. I called the hotel to make my reservation after looking online at the different types of rooms they had on their website. The prices they quoted me over the phone was a little more expensive than what they quoted me over the phone. I was able to get a two queen bed room with garden view for $116. This was the price Expedia was offering (I compared prices after making the reservation) so I'm assuming that is why the girl on the phone offered me that price. She also mentioned that the pool area was closed for renovations and that she wanted me to be aware of that. We stayed here in February on a Sunday.I didn't go into the wine area because it was so cold but I don't believe they serve food here.Sedona is beautiful. My boyfriend and I took our first trip ever to the city (and for me, the state), and really enjoyed the scenery. It was an altogether bummer that the weather didn't cooperate (we traveled to escape the MN cold only to experience a snowy Arizona), but vacation is vacation and we were happy for the change of scenery. The reason I chose one star for this lodge is because I am SO disappointed with the staff. This stay was not cheap, and we were informed that the hot tub is under construction. This was our vacation--a splurge. We would not have chosen this place to stay if the resort would have had this information listed anywhere on their website. I brought this up to the front desk to get our bill adjusted, and he said (unapologetically) that they were unable to do anything because we purchased through a booking site.I then brought up that they really need to put this information on their website to inform others so this doesn't happen again, and they said it is up there. Later that night I searched the site again (and took screen shots)--there was nothing listed. I'm disappointed in my stay here because of the construction and lack of enthusiasm from the staff to realize this disappointment, but I'm MAD that they're not making an effort to avoid this debacle again. It appears that they know less people will stay if they have this information, so they keep it to themselves. Happy Vacationing.Nice location, good view, friendly and informative staffs, big room.........    Those were the first impressions about this hotel.  However here i am giving one star for the following reasons:Number one.  I could not take a shower.  There was nice hot water for about 5 minutes and it was getting colder and colder and colder.  I had to jump out fromthe shower, having shampoo on my hair.  I called and office and a maintenanace guy came.  He said that because of small sized water tank, i need to take a quick shower.  I donot even have long hair.  Shower in 5 minites?  Is it a joke?Number two.  I could not sleep.  The fitted sheet of the mattress was wrong size.  I had to fix the fitted sheet three times per night.   Otherwise i had to sleep on dirty ( does look clean at all) mattress without any covering.   Paying more than $200 per night and no shower and no good night sleep.  I wont go back.No.Unless you're guaranteed a full rim view... actually, no. Still no.The check in process was slow and the workers were unfriendly. We were immediately told what we couldn't do and where we couldn't go. "Don't go to the view area because it's closed for a private event." "The pool & jacuzzi are closed." etc.The garden view room ($160/night) had no view and no garden. It was near the "wine bar" which played loud radio music all night. The drawers in the room were broken. The bathroom was dirty. There was a weird spill/water stain on the night stand area that they didn't even try to hide. The fitted sheet was the wrong size so it wouldn't stay on the mattress. The room was DARK... maybe trying to hide the lack of cleanliness. I had to open the windows in the morning to get dressed. Awkward.You can't walk anywhere from the "lodge" as it's up high on a dark, windy road.No no no.My name is a Christina Cho and I was the photographer at a client's wedding at this venue in April of 2014!Where to start!?! The VIEW WAS BREATHTAKING!!!!!!  There was less than 50 people present. The ceremony FACED the RED ROCK!! People stopped on their way across the lawn JUST TO TAKE PHOTOS!! The day went by so smoothly. Chairs were set up, sun was beautiful, venue was private. It was everything we could ask for! Photos came out beautifully as well! Thank you so much for accommodating the bride and groom!Our family stayed there last summer. Great view but room is old. Overall- great experience. Also very close to the hiking trails and the view point by foot.Great location off the main road. Has a convenient lookout for a gorgeous view of the red rocks at sunset with a convenient parking lot right across the street. Checkin was quick  and efficient and they were able to accommodate an early check in for us at 1 pm instead of 4 pm. The room itself was fine. However we had a lot of issues with the plumbing and the toilet. First, the toilet still had stains and clearly hadn't been thoroughly cleaned. We called the front desk and this issue was quickly addressed and the woman at the front desk informed us she would issue a credit for this inconvenient. As our stay progressed, we started realizing the toilet was not really flushing. We called the front desk again and she said she would send maintenance to the room. Maintenance did not arrive for over 30 minutes! He worked on the toilet for about 20 min, left to get some more supplies, came back and applied drano and told us that the performance would improve throughout the evening. We came back after dinner and the toilet was still not flushing effectively. We were basically afraid to use the toilet during our stay. Considering we paid almost $200 a night, this was completely unacceptable. I informed the front desk woman of all the problems we encountered during our checkout and her only response was thanks for letting us know. The entire property needs a complete overhaul and renovation.Check-in was quick and easy. Parking was right behind our cottage and free. The room was spacious and the bed comfortable and clean. The grounds are gorgeous, very well kept and the view is spectacular. I wish we could have sat overlooking the city all night but for some reason they close it up at 10. There's a smaller seating area but its not exactly the same and you're closer to the rooms. Unfortunately our sleep wasn't very restful;  our air conditioner was so incredibly loud. It wasnt a constant loud, more a rattling that would wake me every 20-30 mins. Finally I turned it off and hoped it wouldn't get too warm but then the dripping started...a steady drip that kept hitting the saturated floor...it just drove me crazy.Lastly, I'm not sure if the previous occupants smoked some skunky weed in our room all night or if a skunk died under it but it permeated the room.It's a lovely motel, great value, with gorgeous views but I'll probably look elsewhere when returning.Nice location, good view, friendly and informative staffs.  Great size room (King Bed) with fireplace and great views.  Hotel was pet friendly $10 per dog per night.  Looks like they are re-modeling pool and spa.  Look forward to staying in the summer!   Rate was around $160 with dog in Jan.Our "garden view" room had no view, but if we walked down further there are amazing views. When asked for another room with view they wanted to up charge me $30 for just a second floor room. We reserved 5 months in advance and they couldn't get us a better room. The room is very outdated. The bathroom is nasty. There was a dirty bath tub with some type of patchwork done on it. Why don't they just replace the old tub? The carpet is old. On the first floor, you can hear the person upstairs walking around. The walls are thin.It is a good hike/walk to the airport vortex. Honestly, if you go anywhere in Sedona you have views, but again our room did not. We booked through Expedia, and there were no mountain or canyon view options.  I should've just called directly and asked for a view room. Disappointed.We came from San Diego as we try to come to Sadona, Az. at least once a year. Our first time staying at Sky Ranch Lodge-this has been the Most Magnificent place ever. From the grounds to the Magnificent Views of God's country. Every Employee was So Friendly it just made for a Glorious Stay... Thank You!Check in was quick and easy, only positive  comments in this review!Jacuzzi closed and by past reviews this remodel has been going on for months! Walls are PAPER thin. If you want any privacy don't plan on getting it here! I could hear EVERY word our neighbors said and children running down the balcony sounded like they would come thru the walls. VIEWS? NOT! Paid for a "view room" funny, all I see is debris from the supposed remodel. I wouldn't waste your time or money driving up to this hotel. Stay in town!We stayed for one day out in Sedona .Check in was @4(which was kind of late). We booked a room with a fireplace. It was so cozy with the fireplace inside. It was a nice room. Had a microwave, table for one to have breakfast,lunch or dinner. The bed was comfortable and there was hot water unlike some of the other reviews had said. They also have washing machines to wash which is great if you're hiking. Overall it was a nice room wish we could've stayed longer. Has a nice view as well and close to the little shops in Sedona .First off, lets start off with saying the views are GORGEOUS! However the rooms are extremely dated, HORRIBLE customer service (witnessed by bridal party and guests while the hotel staff argues behind the desk) AND THIS IS ABSOLUTELY NO PLACE FOR A WEDDING! Now to the more serious reason as to why I am actually going to review this location.. We found this venue on The Knot and decided to use it for our wedding venue in January! Started initially talking to Amanda, who would take a bit to reply to any emails or voicemail but she got the job done. Amanda moved towards the middle of us talking and getting things in order and we were transferred to another wedding coordinator for the venue Meagan. (We live in the valley and had to drive to Sedona and had an appointment to meet Meagan) When we arrived, we were told that Meagan was no longer in that position and that they were in between people. No phone call. I then had to call Amanda who apologized and said she was going to stay until they could find someone to actually replace her. So we went about our way until they found Kris. Never received a phone call from Kris, just an email and it was only in response to my email to them. Should have cancelled the venue at this point but we were so in awe with the views that we decided to go further with this venue. After being through 3 different people and getting different answers each time we got everything paid and now it was a waiting game, When we finally arrived to the venue and got settled in is when the real issues started. First off, Amanda guaranteed that if we booked rooms as a wedding party we would get the better rooms. Yet people booked ONLINE, got BETTER quotes, and when it was brought up to KRIS, She said  SHE WOULD ADJUST THE RIM ROOMS to match the better price because they cant keep up with all the online prices. THE ONLY ROOM TO GET ADJUSTED WAS THE MOTHER IN LAWS. THE BRIDES ROOM WAS NOT AND NEITHER WAS THE BRIDAL PARTIES! So onward to 5:30 PM when rehearsal started. No mic no music, just a run through. Someone complained and they sent a member of the lodge out to say we were being too loud. It is a wedding rehearsal at 5:30pm, how loud could we be. So we ended the rehearsal and went back to the rooms. The real issue is the wedding day. Kris, the coordinator never showed up to the wedding like she said she would, never came out when issues arrised and never kept up with anything. The ceremony was beautiful and on the the recpetion. Again at 5:30pm Tom came into the tent to say the music is too loud and guests are complaining. The bar manager PROVIDED BY SKY RANCH says they never complain this early. So you now have an upset bride and bridal party so we went to the office where TJ apparently the gm was called back to the site. Went back and forth about how ALL THEIR PAPERWORK SAYS VOLUME TO BE LOWERED AT 9:30 etc and he wasnt willing to do anything. So he eventually came out of the office after arguing with the 4 people in the office concerned for their reception and the money spent, and OK'D THE VOLUME FOR OUR DJ TO PLAY THE MUSIC and the party went on. NO MORE THAT 10 MINUTES LATER, THE COPS CAME BECAUSE THE MUSIC WAS TOO LOUD! MIND YOU THIS IS AROUND 6:30PM!!!!!!! So TJ once again shows up with the cops that he called because his ego was hurt that he got called out. So the cops sent one cop to the bottom of the hill and the other stayed on top, they again OK'd the volume and left. At this point everyone was so upset that the bride had to deal with a HORRIBLE venue with HORRIBLE SERVICE AND THE POLICE on one day that was supposed to be special that we ended everything by 7:30pm. THIS IS ABSOLUTELY NO PLACE FOR A WEDDING! I WOULDNT EVEN RECOMMEND STAYING HERE UNTIL THEY REMODEL AND NOT THE POOL OR HOTTUB LIKE THEY DECIDED.. THE ONLY POSITIVE IS THE VIEWS.  YOU PAY WAY TOOOOO MUCH TO HAVE TO DEAL WITH OUTDATED ROOMS, RUDE STAFF, INCOMPETENT OWNERS AND A RUINED WEDDING DAY! SERIOUSLY RE CONSIDER THIS VENUE FOR A WEDDING!!!!!! I should have gone with my gut and gone elsewhere. THERE ARE TONS OF VENUES IN SEDONA ALL WITH VIEWS AND BETTER SERVICE. SERIOUSLY GO THEIR. ITS ONE DAY THATS SUPPOSED TO BE THE BEST DAY AND SKY RANCH WILL LET YOU DOWN!The website does not tell you that not all rooms have a view and they are not very private but they are lovely none-the-Less. Tried to get a room changed and were told no other rooms available although not everyone has checked in and/or unless we pay for it even though the info that led me to book the room was misleading, this was not the hotels fault but Pricelines. Overall a nice spot and pretty grounds. Nice well maintained pool and spa.NOT CLEAN!!!I Made reservations here for out 10th anniversary. We checked in an hour early and they said the room was ready. We got the keys, went to the room and began to look around. The room looked ok, the exterior was a little dated. But when we looked in the bathroom, there were a pair of dirty underwear hanging in the shower. Absolutely disgusting!!! We immediately grabbed our bags and left for the front office. I discretely told the manager about the offending matter. She said, "oh sorry." I stated we were not going to stay here. She offered to find us another room elsewhere but it was late in the afternoon and no rooms were available. My wife and I drove back home to Phoenix. Thank you Sky Ranch for ruining my anniversary.Pay a little more for the rim view- priceless! Beautiful grounds with gardens and koi ponds, friendly and helpful staff, incredible view and the lovely Sedona energy all added up to a fantastic experience. I will definitely be back to Sky Ranch Lodge.I had my wedding at Sky Ranch Lodge in November and we stayed there for a few days after we got married.  The venue was stunning - I am so happy I picked SRL as my venue site.   Even though there was a staffing/wedding coordinator change in the middle of my planning everything was perfect the day of and they were all very accommodating.  Jerry is especially awesome.  Did I mention how awesome that view is!  Amazing! The only reason I am not giving 5 stars is because the rooms/patios are a bit older and outdated - but what else can you expect when you are staying at a "lodge". Overall my experience was wonderful and  I would not have changed a thing.This post is only for hotel and not the staff. The room had no view and is very outdated. The air conditioning unit was not even turned on when I arrived to my room and the temperature is in the 90's. It took awhile for the room to cool down and it still felt muggy. It has a dirty feel to it. You can stay at other hotels in Sedona for a better price and with a better view.Stayed here for 3 nights on our recent trip to Sedona.  This place is a lodge so although it lacks some of the amenities of the bigger hotels in the area, it has the best views of Red Rocks.  The views from this lodge is truly impeccable that many visitors drive to this lodge for the views.  We stayed in a  double queen, garden room.  The room was of good size.  It had a microwave, coffee maker, and a small fridge.  The grounds were beautiful, and had many nooks and crannies with great views.  The hotel had a decent sized pool and hot tub.  We also loved that this lodge was feline friendly with a pet fee of $10 a night.  If you want amazing views of Sedona, this is definitely the place to be at an affordable price.  Will definitely stay here again.
review_content_20: Altho an older motel, it's a very nice comfortable place to stay.  They offer nice amenities in the form of a sunset overlook and a wine bar.  Both are so nice to relax at and sit and talk with fellow travelers. The pool was very nice...heated...and nicely landscaped. The airport Mesa Grill restaurant is within walking distance and there are a couple of pull offs on the road that you can stop and enjoy the landscape, one with a very large parking area and panoramic view, (also within walking distance) and a much smaller area on the way up/down that is a vortex site.  Love this location for the amazing views and being able to walk around the immediate area.Stayed here for 2 nights with friends. Awesome views, nice gardens, super close to the Airport Rd Vortex. Rooms are older but clean. Cute decor in the rooms. Room has a front door by the parking lot and a back door to a semi-private back patio and gardens.  Pool is older but cute with shade trees and towels provided.A few things to be aware of:1. Hotel staff does NOT tell you that front door to the room locks automatically. Back door does not have an exterior lock at all so only the front door can be unlocked from the outside.2. Hotel staff does NOT tell you that if you lock the deadbolt to the front door and leave out the back door with your key...you will be locked out. The key they give you does NOT work on the deadbolt. They just don't give you a key to the deadbolt or even give you a heads up about the key / door situation.3. Cleaning crew turns the AC on the lowest possible temperature while cleaning and then leaves it, so the AC unit freezes up. Then when you arrive and turn it to a regular temperature it unfreezes and drips water all over the floor.4. Maintenance man, Tom, was our savior. He quickly addressed each issue as we ran into them. He was curteous and knowledgable. True handy man. And he apologized profusely for each incident we had, stating that he had made suggestions to management on how to avoid each situation and make the guests more comfortable....they just have yet to take his advice. I guess that's just job security for Tom!Overall I had a good stay, enjoyed the relaxing surroundings and would totally stay here again. I just wish I had read a review with this info in it before arriving for my visit!This place was just Ok for the money we paid to stay here. The ladies at the front desk weren't rude but they weren't friendly either. The place is very beautiful and very well kept. The pool closes at 9 though which i personally thing is way too early considering EVERYONE here is on VACATION! why not keep it open til 11?? Our room was nice enough and the beds were moderately comfortable, however my mom would disagree. My main complaint about the room was that we could hear every single step and movement the people above us made! Any time they walked, got into bed or went to the bathroom it sounded like they were gonna come crashing through the ceiling. VERY VERY ANNOYING! It made it extremely difficult to sleep since our upstairs neighbors didn't sleep at all it seemed. It sounded like 3 people constantly running the length of the room for hours and hours on end. The hotel is in a great location for any fun Sedona activities you are looking for. If you don't mind not getting any sleep stay on the first floor! I, on the other hand will not be staying here again.The only redeeming qualities of Sky Ranch Lodge is Jerry, his staff, and the beautiful view. Since we first booked our wedding, the wedding coordinator position changed through three different people. Each new coordinator said items in our contract were no longer permitted under new ownership. We had the overlook reserved the Friday before our wedding for the rehearsal, they overbooked and we were told we were no longer able to use it. We reserved the room right next to the overlook the Friday before and that Saturday for the wedding. When we went on Friday they told us they overbooked that room and we would not be able to get in. When we went on Saturday, we were not able to check in until noon. The wedding coordinator said she is at the venue the whole day of a wedding - she was no where to be found the entire day! The manager would not respond to any calls or emails.That being said the view is absolutely amazing and Jerry (the man who should run this place) was the most amazing guy ever! He was there for 9 am to 11 pm and made sure that our magical day was as perfect as it could be! We had an amazing time the day of our wedding but we did do everything ourselves!So far so good! The rooms are modest but clean. The staff all seems very nice and helpful. When we come back, we'll ask for a cottage. The views are great! If someone is looking for a wedding venue....look no further! It's perfect for that. If possible, bring your own pillows. These aren't the most comfortable.Ended up finding this gem on Tripadvisor! It sits at the top of a mountain nearby all the sightseeing. The views really are the best in Sedona. Customers of SRL get their own private lookout! They have their own bar, lots of garden trails and outdoor seating for guests as well. We stayed in the deluxe king room complete with a mini fridge, microwave, cooking utensils, and dishware. The bathroom is spacious and there is plenty of shelving for all of your things. The bed was gigantic! We were supposed to have a view from our balcony but it ended up being mostly of trees in the garden below. However, the view from our front door was spectacular! Very quiet and friendly place. If you stay and get to experience the private lookout, there's a second trail just out to the left if the patio gets too crowded.Stayed overnight Easter weekend for a quick romantic getaway. When we first pulled up I was a little concerned. But once we checked in and got to our room, I relaxed and all worries went out the door. The grounds are older, but kept up and really pretty. The views around the property are incredible. Unfortunately our room did not have a view, which was disappointing but the room itself was pretty nice. We had our dog with us, and they are a pet-friendly hotel, so we were pretty pleased. Right outside the lobby is a wine bar and a good sized seating area. It's only open in late afternoon/early evening. We got a nice glass of malbec and went to the viewing area to watch the sunset. So did everyone else, it was pretty fun socializing with people who were from all over. Everyone was enjoying themselves, taking pictures of the views, drinking some wine, having fun. The bed in the room was comfortable and so were the pillows. The room had a nice flat screen TV with basic cable, also had a few other amenities, most importantly, a coffee machine and a bar sized fridge. I would probably stay here again, it was a good value for the money we spent and in a very good area not far from the airport and some hiking trails and a vortex.We knew the rooms were older when we booked the room, we didn't need all the frills for one evening. I thought the room was cozy and even had a fireplace. One of the lamps and one outlet didn't work. We had a garden view room on the second floor and the views from our back patio were incredible. The balconies are only semi-private because the dividing wall doesn't go all the way to the railing. We liked that the hotel was on a hill and had breathtaking views of the red rocks. The grounds are immaculate and the hotel is dog friendly which is awesome. The hotel had quite a few guests but we never really saw anyone else and everyone was so quiet.The hotel pool is pretty standard hotel 6 type design and wasnt anything to write home about. No room service or breakfast, but that's not a huge problem. We had a pleasant stay and thought the staff was very friendly.I was recommended this place a couple years ago and on this trip around decided to check it out. The place has a great location and really cool access to a beautiful sunset, that's about it. Pretty mellow surroundings and beautiful grounds, but the staff was very rude (like horribly rude to a ridiculous level). The rooms a poorly updated and overpriced. Sedona is beautiful and this place could be a lot better, it's a shame it's not. Oh, the closely located Mesa grille which is pretty good and worth checking out.LOVED staying here!!!! The hotel sits up on the Mesa next to the airport overlooking Sedona and the red rocks. The view from our room was AMAZING!! The beds were so comfortable, I slept very well all three nights. The grounds were clean and quaint. The staff friendly and helpful. Our stay was VERY quiet and peaceful. We would most definitely come again.Most of the rooms here don't have a view - something that you don't realize until you get there. However you're right near one of the vortexes and walking distance to the best view in Sedona.We came to Sedona wanting to stay a few days but just booked one night to try out Sky Ranch. I'm glad we did because our "pet" room STUNK like dog pee. Considering you have to pay extra for a dog, I'd expect a clean room. My dog doesn't shed and certainly doesn't pee inside, so it seems unfair. By the morning with the heat on, the smell was overwhelming and we decided to leave and stayed elsewhere.Also, the picture of the rooms shows a fireplace but there was no fireplace, just a very basic motel-like room.Second stay. Super friendly staff. Clean, renovated rooms. Incredible views! Convenient location, but off the highway. We would absolutely stay again.Wow- this place is a gem! We were driving through with our 2 dogs and not only was it a dog friendly hotel, it was gorgeous! The room was clean, comfortable and spacious. But the views! We arrived at night so didn't see much, but did some great star gazing. We woke up the next day and just walking around the place was amazing. And the staff was super helpful with tips about where to go, what to see etc. We had a fantastic time!This place was PERFECT for us! Me and my friend were here on our annual girls trip and the room was nothing fancy but it was clean and large and had a mini fridge and microwave and plenty of closet space and drawers. The views are amazing from the outlook and we enjoyed watching the sunset. The grounds and gardens are very well kept and pretty. Next time we plan to get a rim view and I KNOW I will be back here one day! If you are looking for fancy,4-star service, etc this is not your place but if you are looking for a low-key peaceful place with amazing views, stay here.We had one incident with very rude neighbors (just one night). They were yelling and talking extremely loud after midnight and didn't quit so we had to call the after hours number. About 10 minutes after our call the after hours employee came (we heard the knock on their door) and after that it was perfectly quiet. We appreciated the swift attention to the issue by the staff. The Mesa Grill is closeby, at the airport and has a good breakfast. If you want a really good inexpensive meal in Sedona, try Cafe Jose as well! If possible request a one story room (I think all the rim view rooms are 1 story) or top floor, you can hear every footstep above if you are on the bottom floor of a 2 story. The walls overall are pretty thin but it was not anything that ruined our trip. Can't wait to visit Sky Ranch again!We had a fireplace room right next to the wine bar & pool. It was great! You can tell that the rooms are older, but they are very clean and well-kept! Our king bed was very comfortable with oversized pillows. There was a mini-fridge and microwave in our room, which was perfect for leftovers and for the case of water we picked up from the grocery store (a must!). TV is an old box tv, but we were so busy we only turned it on once. Fireplace is gas and super easy to operate...we really enjoyed having it! The winebar is small and outdoors, but it is enclosed with heaters and there is a tv that had some games on. The sunset view is awesome, but there is limited seating so if you want to sit, get there about 45 min before the sun goes down. There wasn't any drink service at the sunset location, but the winebar is nearby and you can bring drinks over. Just note that you can only drink your own alcohol in the rooms and if you want to drink on property, you have to purchase it from them. We didn't check out the pool or hot tub, but they look average. If it were warmer we would have definitely spent an evening in the hot tub. The rest of the property is really cute, with winding paths through the gardens and views of the red rocks. Mesa Grille is walking distance from the hotel and they have great food! It is small and last seating was at 8:30pm on a Thursday, but it was worth it. Overall, a great experience (and great value) and we will definitely return!We always try different hotels while in Sedona. That may have come to an end with this lodge. First off don't expect a nice new modern hotel. No asphalt in sight, only crushed rock driveways and parking areas. It's an older motel style with real door keys (remember those?).  Now that I dropped your expectations of this place let me tell you why you should stay here. First off it's located minutes from town and it's the only place to stay on top of the plateau next to the airport which has a very nice restaurant, bar that will even provide room service for you. The staff is most friendly, both on the phone who helped us with a train tour package and in person. By the way the train package this is a fabulous deal and good up to four people on the train. It's a must. But if you're staying multiple nights don't try to arrange it yourself on the website, call  the lodge.  The rooms are very clean and from what we can see all come with microwave, refrigerator, coffee pot, and free Wi-Fi. The grounds are maintained well and include lots of walking areas,  streams, and lots of places to sit, and a very special lodge only viewing area to watch sunsets on the red rock mountains with the view of the city below. In fact the road up to the lodge becomes very crowded at sunset because everyone wants to get to a small public viewing area next to the lodge.  If you're looking for a place to truly just relax this is it. And with prices in Sedona being all over the place this is a very reasonable place to stay.   We now know where were staying the next time we visit  Sedona.Great views of the valleyQuaint lodge that was nice but very old school.  Clean rooms that were from times gone by, outside doors in units built together in sets of four.  Only one floor, small, but had table, bed, TV, sink, bath etc.  Grounds were flowered, guests were friendly and the setting extremely quiet.  Near the airport and on our first night a wedding took place.  We all slept through any noise!For Sedona, I felt like this place was a really nice hotel to stay at.  Especially if you are big on the Vortex.  The hotel is just up the street from the Airport Mesa Vortex.  We walked there.  A little scary because cars race up and down this 2 lane road.The hotel allows for people to bring their dogs.  Pretty cool.  There is a wine bar just right of the main check-in door.  At sunset you can grab a glass of wine and mosey on out to the lookout area.  Which I might add is super beautiful.  Just 100ft up the street they ask for donations to use their lookout area.  I felt super lucky to have such a nice area to watch Sedona's beautiful sunset.Hotel rooms are very simple and to the point.  There is some kind of smell, I think from the air conditioner?  But it reminds me of Asian boba.  LOL.  I happen to like that smell, so works out for me.  Didn't get to swim in the pool, but I touched the water and it was a good temperature.  Bonus I found out if you are a repeat customer, you mention it and get a discount off your next stay.Five stars for overall value. Best prices in Sedona with amazing views. It was nice to have our own little kitchenette to keep drinks and snacks cool. The room was very clean and basic. Who needs to spend time in a hotel room when you could be out hiking in Sedona?!?! Front desk was very helpful with questions. The grounds are beautiful and the pool looked refreshing even though I never had time to dive in. Only frustration is that the #1 rated spot to see the rocks at sunset is located a few hundred yards from the property and if you are trying to leave or return you have to dodge cars and pedestrians. Minor inconvenience for the amazingly low price I paid.Beautiful location with amazing views.  The rooms are cute, but it's really all about the views.  The hotel is located at the top of a mountain near a little airport.  Looking down on the town is just perfect.  I took more pictures than necessary.
review_content_40: The views are absolutely amazing! We took our beer and wine outside with us to watch the sunset. Gorgeous! The room prices are very reasonable for the service, views and accommodations.Second time stayed here over the past three years. Love this place. Away from the noise and crowds. Best place to view sunset is from the back of our Room. Large sitting areas behind your room plus an overlook  The wine bar is a great place to relax, have a glass and enjoy the view. The folks at the front desk were very friendly and helpful. I have no problem recommending this spot. It's not the four seasons but the views, hospitality, location and the price name it great.I want to compliment the front desk staff!  After checking in and getting settled in our room, a large party moved into the room next door. When I went up to the front desk they were so accommodating and more than happy to move us to another room. This is a beautiful spot and all the staff are so friendly!Great location and view.  Rooms comfortable.  Property was well-kept and charming.  Bathrooms a little sparse but clean.  Best part was friendly staff and the most delicious apples at check-in.  Great location near the vortex!We drove up on a Friday afternoon for a sunset wedding. If you are a couple looking for a venue look no further. This place will make your wedding photos, which last a lifetime right? As we pulled into the lot the property staff was very helpful, directing us to the correct parking area, which there was plenty. There was staff everywhere for questions and directions. The public restrooms were large and clean.I comfortably stayed in a room near the garden and fish pond. The shade and fresh breeze was refreshing after being in the desert and canyon sightseeing! Another reviewer noted the room as "outdated" but I call it vintage - reminds me of the clean but simple motor lodges of my childhood.Located next to Sedona Airport, Sky Ranch Lodge was a perfect place for me to stay when I went on my spontaneous solo trip to Sedona.  Since the trip was unplanned, I called the lodge as I was driving out of LA to get to Sedona which was around 9pm.  I booked the room, got to Sedona around 6am and had no problem checking in.  I WAS lucky because they actually had a room open that early in the morning, but everything went so smooth, I was able to completely enjoy my stay in Sedona.It's no Hilton or Ritz Carlton but a very comfortable and beautiful lodge.  They have a pool, jacuzzi and the most wonderful view of the whole valley.  I went into Sedona in pitch black so when the sun started to rise, it was one of the most amazing things I have ever seen.WOW, wow, wow, is what we said when we first walked into our room.The fireplace & view of the beautiful rock formations from the back porch is the reason for five stars.  It's not a fancy or new place, but it's really comforting, peaceful, & the room definitely has character.  There's also a mini kitchen & a "heater" option in the bathroom.  Regarding the heater, it may not sound like much, but believe me, when it's like 30 something degrees outside, it's a feature you really appreciate!We got here right before sunset, & immediately sat outside to just stare at the awesome view we had.  Not only is it picturesque, but right away you notice how quiet it is too.Drove five hours to get here from Vegas, & as exciting & fun as Vegas is, I had a hard time leaving this place.  I found myself excited to get up early in the morning, just so I could watch the sunrise.If we ever are blessed to come & visit Sedona again, we won't have to look for another place to stay.  This is THE ONE!We stayed at Sky Ranch on a recommendation from a friend.  We stayed for two nights.  Our room had a partial view with balcony at the end of the road.  Wow, it was so fabulous.  First the hotel is secluded up Airport Road.  No lights, traffic or noise.  We slept with the windows open.  The views are stunning!  The hotel is older, but our room was very clean and spacious, everything worked just fine in the room.  We had a small fireplace and table.  What really sold it for me was the location of the hotel and how quiet it was in the evenings.  You felt like you were truly out in nature instead of the busy main parts of town.  Staff was very friendly and the grounds were very well kept.We stayed here on our way to the Grand Canyon.  It was a great choice.  After the Four Seasons, we needed something a little less luxurious to bring us down to earth.This is a clean, pretty, well-laid out motel with extraordinary views. I found it absolutely endearing that they use the old keys(no cards yet!) for their rooms. It brought me back to my childhood road trips with my father, where we always stayed in motels with keys! The knoll area gives a stunning view of the surrounding red rocks, with a wonderful sunset, while there are nice garden grounds with lots of chairs and benches to relax. There is an interesting restaurant next door with a view also of red rocks and airplanes. Although we only stayed one day, fellow travelers were diverse, friendly, and down to earth. Prices remind me of the 1980's.Best view in Sedona. Be sure to grab a bottle of wine, and watch the sunset. The service is excellent! When my fiance and I arrived for my birthday weekend, they even upgraded us to a room with a view of all of Sedona and the red rock. You can even order from the restaurant down the street, as room service. my fiance got the ceviche and I got a large salad with salmon. Delicious. I must say, I am incredibly impressed by the seafood in Arizona. I was not expecting it to be so fresh!The rooms are clean and rustic. The whole lodge is quiet, and perfect for a relaxing weekend away. Plus, there's a vortex you can walk to, right down the road. The whole place feels like the Big Sur of the desert. We will definitely be coming back to Sedona, probably in the winter, to enjoy the cooler hiking temperatures, a relaxing stay in the jacuzzi post-hike, and and the romantic in-room fireplace at night.Great value, they upgraded us our room free since they accidentally overbooked. Thank you for a great two days. The service was great.We stayed here for 2 nights, staff from friendly, room was clean and the view at sunset was possibly the best in Sedona.  The room decor was nothing fancy but hey we were not here to stay indoors so for the price I would stay here again.  As for the location it was close to downtown, but not downtown so it was quiet and had minimal traffic.We had a very nice stay here. It is off the main streets so it is quiet and peaceful. It also boasts one of the best views in town. Being right next to the airport we were concerned about noise but apparently the airport has little traffic, especially at night. The only airplane we heard was in the morning, around 8AM. The only negative is that the property is old and can use a bit of work - nothing major though. Just things like a loose doorknob. It is very clean and the staff is very nice and pleasant. Will stay there again. There is not a restaurant on the property so you will have to drive to eat. Note: do not eat at the restaurant at the airport (Mesa Grill).For the view and price, you can't beat it. The rooms reminded me of of really nice camping cabins because the decor was outdated, but clean. They room was sufficient for my needs and the shower water pressure was strong, which I love. The staff was nice. The landscaping was pleasant, including the flowing water feature and fish, but thought the fake concrete boulders were a bit tacky.After driving from New Mexico for hours, with no idea where to stay, I did a quick search for hotels in Sedona. The Sky Ranch popped up, sounded nice, so I visited the website. The site listed an available room for $90, but I had an error when booking.  I decided to call otherwise, I wouldn't have anywhere to stay that night. Alex answered the phone with a friendly tone and warm greeting. I explained where I was driving from and that I had an error when booking the $90 rate. He explained that there were no rooms available & that he could give me a $135 rate room instead. I thanked him, but declined as it was just too expensive for me. He said he understood and asked how long it would be until I arrived. After estimating an arrival time, Alex asked me to hold on for a moment so he could see what he was able to offer me. About 3 mins passed before he came back to the line with an amazing rate. It was in my price range and I could absolutely afford it. I thanked him, said yes as quickly as possible and continued on the drive to the lodge.   I arrived with my sister after she navigated us through the winding canyon roads of Sedona and we were greeted by an exuberant, smiling Alex. Not only did he serve as a bright spot in our tiring journey, but he had an even lower rate when I checked in to our room. He was our Knight in shining armor and saved our skins that night.This place wouldn't be much without the outstanding view. I was surprised that it was on the expensive side considering the rooms are old and there isn't much offered onsite other than a small beer/wine bar and snack shop. Although the Mesa Grill at the Sedona Airport is within walking distance, it would have been nice if there was room service during the morning/daytime, especially for people who are staying there for a wedding, like I was. On the Saturday morning of the wedding, my boyfriend and I wanted to order something to eat around 10am so I could shower, get ready, and head over to the bride's room where I knew I would be for several hours before the wedding started. I then realized that room service is only offered at dinnertime. I certainly didn't have time to walk to the nearby restaurant and wait for takeout. Similarly, my boyfriend wasn't ready to go anywhere since he had just woken up and I wouldn't let him use the bathroom while I was getting ready. If it weren't for my best friend, the bride, sharing her bagel with me, I would have starved until the reception, like my boyfriend did. He decided not to go there even after I left the room because he didn't want to have to spend $10-$15 dollars just to eat breakfast/lunch. Other than that, I like the setup of the hotel and the wine/beer bar is REALLY inexpensive. You're allowed to walk anywhere on the property with your drink as long as you purchased it through the hotel. If you bring your own alcohol, you can only drink it in your room. I forgot that small detail and brought a 1-shot flask to the reception since I was nervous about giving a speech. One of the employees saw it and was completely rude about it even though I apologized and put the flask away. She then had another employee use the microphone to announce that outside liquor was not permitted. Calm down lady, it was a 1.5 ounce key chain flask! Someone also said that they heard this same employee talking badly about our group for bringing the alcohol and threatening to shut down the whole wedding, which she did not have the authority to do anyway. She was extremely unprofessional but, the wedding was absolutely beautiful with the breathtaking view of all the red rocks in the background.  We had such an amazing time and despite some of the issues we encountered, I would still say this is an excellent wedding venue. Additionally, the pool is quite small, but not a deal breaker. I really wanted to give this hotel 2 stars due to the rude employee, the outdated rooms, and lack of food services onsite, but I'm giving it 3 because it probably has the best view out of any hotel in Sedona.Stayed at The Sky Ranch Lodge this past April. The rooms were very clean and the staff was very friendly. The views were incredible. There is an awesome sitting area overlooking Sedona's Red Rocks that we enjoyed with coffee in the am, and a cocktail the night before. Nice jacuzzi and pool, and just very quiet and perfect for what we were looking for. It's far enough off the beaten path to still be secluded, but close enough to downtown so you can grab dinner and shop without having to drive too far. There's a beautiful hike a quarter mile down the road that took us about an hour and a half to complete. "Airport Loop."  We got lunch at the Mesa grille as recommended by the Sky Ranch staff, and was very pleased with the food there. Overall, this place was priced appropriately, peaceful, and I would absolutely stay again when I return to Sedona.The Big Bear Airport Pilots Association booked several rooms, from the cheapest ($90) to the most expensive ($160) and all were excellent. All 13 of us enjoyed the experience. The property is VERY well maintained and a pleasure to walk through. The Mesa Grill is a nice place to dine and serves breakfast, lunch and dinner. We stayed in a view room, which with a deck facing the city and bluffs to the south, was worth the few extra dollars; however, the other rooms on the property face incredibly tranquil landscaping with brooks, ponds, patios and outside wine bar. Free coffee in the lobby and the rooms.This trip made for lifetime memories. I would NOT hesitate recommending Sky Ranch Lodge to anyone. We will be back in the future.an awesome place. Honestly, we picked it for our 2 night Sedona stay because of the price. it was way cheaper than other places in town. But holy cow, this place was fantastic. the views, and even the drive to the hotel were beautiful. there is lush greenery with a stream running through the property. the wine bar was great, and served beer to the joy of my husband. we didn't use the pool/hot tub but it looked great. the rooms were large, and the amenities lovely. it was such a pleasant stay- relaxing with the most amazing sunsets in town. even the locals showed up for the views/wine.
review_content_60: This past weekend was one of my sisters 21st birthday.. in order to celebrate in style, we had planned on a road trip to Vegas, but being the Sedona freak that I am, I suggested we spend one night there before heading off to the city of sin. Of course, as usual, I got lost trying to find the place. I am the most terrible person in the universe when it comes to directions, so it took a few bitch flips before I found it. Its up on Airport Rd. and has the most incredible views of any other hotel I've ever seen there. Its not like a hotel at all either, its little cabins scattered around a beautiful property with pathways, streams and like I said, places to park your ass to take in the beautiful red rocks. I will say the actual rooms are extremely dated, so if these guys invested a little cash to give it a more modern update, I would have given it that 5th star. After dinner and half a bottle of rum, we decided the hot tub would be a good idea. I am kind of paranoid about public swimming pools, especially spas cause you know what kind of ish that goes down in them, but their facility was extremely clean and well maintenanced. My germaphobe fears went away, but I think that probably had something to do with rum :o)Staff, amazing. Totally accommodating, and wicked friendly. The woman at the front desk immediately gave off a relaxed comfortable vibe about the place. Even though the Sedona airport is a few steps away, the noise wasn't too bad. I think I heard a total of 2 planes cruise by. No big deal.I would totally stay here again. Aside from the retro flower tiles and TV's from the 80's, its situated in a fabulous location and the prices are extremely reasonable.What a great place to stay! The decor isn't modern... far from it. "Rustic" is closer to correct, I think. Standing on the deck in the evening with a glass of wine, watching the sun set over Sedona... Wow. Horribly, terribly, awesomely relaxing.Friendly, helpful staff. Neat, funky grounds. Off the main drag.Can get a little noisy during the day because of the helicopter tours. Otherwise, a great place to stay!Love this place!! Its beautiful, quiet, incredible views. Relaxing & romantic too. We didn't want to leave...its a slice of heaven there!! Won't stay anywhere else now.It's hard to rate this Lodge - as the views can be 5-star and the rooms are "OK" - We stayed in one of the multi-level units for a couple nights and then moved to a rim-room with a mini-kitchenette (more expensive than the multi-level unit) for a couple nights.  The rim room was actually supposed to have a better view than our previous room - and it didn't.  Somehow our rim room was situated in such a way that the view was blocked unless we were outside and moved along the pathway.  The view was spectacular - All of the staff was very pleasant and helpful.  The rooms are dated (carpet, bed spreads, lighting, etc.) - and appeared to be clean.  While close to the airport, we were not bothered by air plane noise in either of our rooms.We would stay here again for the views.Beautiful grounds and spectacular views. The room was a little dated but clean and cozy. The only thing I would advise is to request a room on the upper floor as the college kids that stayed above us were like a stampeding herd of elephants until the wee hours of the morning. Not easy to sleep with the racket even with ear plugs in. Otherwise a nice stay.I loved everything about this place!  The location is high above everything and just steps away from the most amazing views.  The grounds are well-manicured and inviting.  The rooms are clean and spacious though the decor is outdated.  No matter, it actually added to the "experience."  Very "ranch-y" feel, which let me know I was in AZ.  Free WiFi.  Great price.  Excellent service.Loved the place, try to get rooms facing the mountains. Rooms are simple but cozy, open fireplace is great. Staff super nice and accommodating. For breakfast check out the restaurant at the airport, great views and modern interior. Good serviceStunning views and tons of fun. It's an older place but very well kept and I prefer it over newer and fancier places. Give it a shot and ask for a room with the best views!I love this place.  The kids had a blast and the sunsets are the best from our patio.It was actually nice getting to know the neighbors and it was great to see that people could bring their dogs along, too.The best hotel on our trip so far. I'm a little fearful of posting this review as it may make this little gem of a hotel too popular so I can't get a room here on my next trip!Sky Ranch Lodge is located next to Sedona Airport, up on a hill. It's located right next to a great viewpoint that tons of people drive up to catch the view, especially at sunset. The airport mesa halfway up the airport road is also worth a short hike for the views back south.We splashed out on a room with a view. Wow!!! I doubt many other hotel rooms in the world have a view to match this. There's a small deck outside to sit and admire the view.The hotel room was spacious enough for 4 of us. Bathroom wasn't huge but fine for us. Just be aware that the bath isn't full size if you fancy a bath.There's a heated pool and jacuzzi. A computer is available in the lobby.Fantastic hotel.I don't have much to add that will be any different than other Yelpers have already said.It's a great bargain for the low price.The room on the rim with the private patio had an amazing view!There are no frills here but we didn't need anything!We stayed two nights at the end of June 2011 and we would definitely go here again!Stayed here for a relaxing night while visiting Sedona with a friend. Amazing views, spacious rooms with many amenities, clean, comfortable, fireplace, comfortable beds. Nice pool and Jacuzzi...enjoyed walking the grounds and drinking wine on the patio. I'll be back and would recommend to all!!!I was a bridesmaid in a wedding held at Sky Ranch Lodge recently. I have been in many weddings and never have I seen such an awesome staff that is so willing to help in whatever the bride and family needed. Jerry especially was incredibly helpful and patient with all of us and our wedding craziness. He was on standby to help with any little detail we needed and when we forgot something or didn't have something he was there immediately to help us with a solution. I want to personally thank Jerry for all he did, we could not have made it without you! The front desk was also very kind in helping with deliveries that we were expecting and also very helpful with room arrangements. My sister and her new husband had the most amazing day of their life and I truly am grateful to Jerry and the rest of the staff for making that happen. My husband and I will be returning soon for a wonderful stay at the Sky Ranch Lodge!HOT HOT HOT.... Sedona, Arizona has lots of HEAT and fortunately the Sky Ranch Lodge provided some relief. This quaint lodge didn't have luxury amenities, but they have a spacious room set up, air conditioning, a pool and A jacuzzi! The Room-Two queen size beds-Air conditioning-Tons of dresser and closet space-Porch with patio furniture-No refrigerator in room, but they can deliver one to your room to use during your stay!-Free wifi (didn't use it though)Lodge & Surrounding-Nice grounds with patio furniture to picnic -Pool & jacuzzi -Scenic points just before the lodge -Diner close by (though they weren't open on Sunday when we went)The Staff-Hospitable. They accommodated our party of 8 and provided us with items we needed like a fridge, a lighter, etc. Yes a lighter to light a birthday candle! Price-Rates were moderate during summer (August), but can easily be split between four people in your group.The grounds here are lovely.  The view from the lookout is spectacular.  The proximity to the airport vortex is good.  But the room is a dump.  It's shabby, dark, run down and just kind of depressing.  I don't want to touch the bedspread.  I had to call the front desk to request a remote control for the old tube tv with bad reception.I'm supposed to stay here tomorrow night too.  I'm hoping I can move to another hotel without having to pay for a second night here.Loved it!! We stayed there from March 31-April 4, 2013 in a King bed with a fireplace and partial view. We were able to bring our pooch with us and she loved it too. Like everyone states.... The rooms are very clean and they look cabin-y. The view from the second floor was great! Even though they are dog-friendly, they ask that the dog not be left alone in the room by itself. It's a good thing that Sedona is a very dog-friendly town!!We would definitely go back there again!! The wine bar was a great little extra. The restaurant at the airport was great! Since the hotel is above the town, the view is Amazing!! Thanks for a great time!!! :)My husband and I got the garden view room with a fireplace and loved it! The fireplace was perfect. The views were amazing! The room was not flashy or modern by any means but had a homey comfortable cottage feel. The balcony is not private its sort of shared with neighboring rooms but it was a very sweet quaint experience. I loved the wine bar and the breathtaking views. It was perfect for our valentines day adventure but I would not suggest this for someone that is planning on walking wherever they go. Its up on a hill and away from everything.The views are fantastic! Other than that, the rooms are okay. Nothing really fancy, which is okay since I was only in my room to sleep. I paid about $90 a night which is average I guess. I would ask that maybe they can include foot lights in the quad area in the back and more seats. There were only 4 chairs out there so not much room to sit to admire the stars and Sedona.Love this place.   It has the best views located high above the city.   Quaint place almost like a mom and pop place.  The grounds are beautiful and peaceful.  We enjoyed the jacuzzi after a long day of hiking.  We can't wait until we return to Sedona because we will be staying here again.This place has great views of the area especially if you run or hike the 5 mile loop around the airport.  However, the cancellation policy is 48 hours which is not standard practice in the hotel industry, their WIFI is like dial-up from the 80's and housekeeping can't read the please do not disturb placard.
review_content_80: Very nice. Nice place. Nice people.The hubby and I stayed here and loved it! We were attending a wedding in Sedona, but found this hotel to be more of what we were looking for than where the wedding was held. We are smokers and this hotel is grandfathered in so they had smoking rooms. We drove up from Queen Creek after staying with a friend for a few days. I was not feeling well and when we arrived our room wasn't ready and all I wanted to do was lay down. The staff hustled and our room was ready in 10 minutes. The only thing missing was the fridge we requested which came about 10 minutes after that. We really appreciated how well they took care of us.The buildings are cute. Kind of like little cottages. The rooms are spacious and we had all that we needed. The pool was nice and we were happy we got to use it.There is a small plane airport just past the hotel and they have a little restaurant. We got to eat breakfast outside watching the planes take off and land. You can drive there but it's a short walk from the hotel. Also a short walk is an observation area that is VERY popular at sunset. You can get some great pictures of the valley below during the day and at night..All and all we were very happy with this hotel.
