It was our first trip to Sedona (and where we got engaged!) and I know it won't be our last. We plan to return to Sky Ranch Lodge on our next trip!The sky ranch lodge is a amazing place to stay while you are in Sedona. The rooms are very nice and very clean. The pool is nice, clean, and cool. It is a bit costly but it is a excellent place to stay. There is a nice wine bar to relax at. There is also a place to look at the stars at night. This is a overall really great place to stay.We chose the Sky Ranch Lodge because it was affordable and pet friendly, so we weren't expecting a five star hotel. But, we were pleasantly surprised with the immaculate landscaping and the amazing views. The grounds are green and lush, complete with a stream and fish pond. You can enjoy.a glass of wine from the wine bar anywhere on the grounds, including the pool or hot tub. The most surprising perk was the Sunset Overlook that has jaw-dropping views of Sedona anytime of the day.Despite all the positives, there are a couple of negatives that keep the SRL from getting 5 stars. The room decor was pretty dated/did not feel clean and the front desk was slow to answer calls.Bottom line-- it's a great value for someone on a budget.I visited Sedona with my sister. We stayed at the Skyranch Lodge the whole 7 days. Things I liked:It was cleanThere is a pool and hot tubAmazing view and a nice patio to watch the sun set from (I think sunrise would be good too... I just did not get up early enough.Hot water came fastPatio outside room was really nice Good job of landscaping Free wifiFree and easy parkingThings that could be better:Mainly the rooms need a bit of upgrading. They are comfortable and clean enough, y but could look less cheap.If I come here again... And I would definitely consider it... I would ask for a room near the view (or even the pool or office) Our room was a way at the back near the airport, so it was far from the patio, pool and office.We stayed here for a wedding and it was interesting. The grounds are beautiful and they have breathtaking views. The rooms were not very nice and are in need of some much needed renovation. The staff was nice but I got the vibe they were walking on egg shells around the management. The front desk had a mix of people. Some were nice but there was one woman who wasn't. We didn't have a car and so we requested to take the shuttle to the store. She blatantly told us we could take it down but we would have to take a cab back. It cost us 15 bucks to get back from being maybe a mile away. Don't offer a shuttle if you can't man it during your said hours. Also they claim to have poolside beverage service with menus and a number to call, but the only problem is there is no phone at the pool. They have a great piece of property but I don't think it is ran well. I could see this place on hotel impossible.We had the deeply unfortunate experience of being on the first floor of a 6 unit building. ALL NIGHT LONG, Clump, Clump. There was simply NO insulation and the folks above us were heavy footed and up LATE.The setting is nice, the rooms are relatively clean, the prices are reasonable. On check-in, we asked to not be below someone. We had reserved this way, but "so sorry, we had a flood of people come in without reservations, so the room you wanted is not available."I like writing good reviews, not complaining. IF, and ONLY IF, you can confirm a room with no one above you, then this is a great place to stay. Otherwise, stay somewhere else. Oh, and the wi-fi is a JOKE.Stayed here for several days around Thanksgiving. The major draw for us was pet-friendly, which it was, and the fabulous view, which was fabulous.The units are fairly dated; it's nice that they have fireplaces and small kitchens. The bed was really hard and uncomfortable, and the comforter was slippery so it kept sliding off during the night.The kids enjoyed the pool.We got to drive by the airport mesa vortex about a dozen times, and hiked it twice; one day we did the airport loop hiking trail which was a fairly easy four miles, my favorite part of the trip.It was suggested by the young man at the information office in Oak Creek. We were skeptical because of the location to town.... However---This place was magikal! The staff was friendly, knowledgable, and dedicated! The room was spacious, clean and peaceful. I can't say enough about the tranquil grounds and the majestic views! It's a short 5 minute walk to the airport - which was a bonus for us (airplane lovers).... I'd recommend this place to any and everyone! Well worth it!!Me and three friends spent this past Saturday night at Sky Ranch Lodge and enjoyed the stay.Although the drive up the mountain on Airport Road was kind of scary (two narrow lanes, with one railing separating cars from the edge of the cliff) it was a scenic ride. We booked the double queen "Rim View Rooms", and got room 236 upon check-in. The price was $154.00 a night and with taxes, it came to around $172. It was so nice to open the back door of our room, step outside to the balcony, breathe in the fresh air, and take in the beautiful views of Sedona's mountains and the city below. There are many photo ops, and the sunset was so gorgeous! This would be a great place to come and stay with your significant other; so romantic. As another reviewer mentioned, our room was a bit dated, but for me, didn't detract from the ambiance of the place. I loved that the shower spray was strong, but, with four girls sharing a bathroom, the hot water ran out by the time the third gal had a go at it. The grounds were well maintained and the employees we encountered were friendly and serviced us with a smile. The pool is kept heated to about 90F and the Jacuzzi to 110F and both are open until 9pm. I would definitely stay here again if I ever decide on another trip to Sedona.4.5/5 stars. Could have been a 5/5 if they had the king bed/fireplace room open for the two nights we stayed here. Otherwise they accomodated to us very well. They called us the night we were checking out of the room with the fireplace to check us in immediately into our similar room without a fireplace and had everything ready and set to go for us. The lodge was absolutely beautiful. This had to be one of the best weekends I've ever had. My boyfriend surprised me with a weekend getaway trip and for any of you boys out there looking to romance your girlfriends you should bring them here. The views are phenominal, very cabin like features, great hiking, right next to the sedona airport, and approximately 5-10 minutes away from Tlaquepaque and Uptown where everything is going on. It's great for a relaxing getaway. Kudos to this place and to my boyfriend.Great quality hotel for a very reasonable price. The room was rather outdated, but it was clean and really large! It had a mini fridge, coffee maker, and a microwave. All that stuff came in handy! However, no iron and ironing board. I wasn't in dire need of one, but I imagine that they had them available at the front desk.The staff at the front desk was very nice and helpful, despite a small snafu when we checked in... I was given my keys and sent to the wrong room. I went back and the clerk was very apologetic. It was a simple mistake; he transposed the last two numbers of the room. Oooops.Additionally, the staff offered up useful maps of the city and recommended some sight-seeing stops... very glad that I took the map and the advice.Okay, I'm sure you are asking by now... "what's the deal with the 4 stars"? Great value, decent room, decent service... what makes this worth it? It is the VIEW! The hotel sits on a bluff that overlooks the entire valley and the views blew my mind. See, we drove in at night and having never been to Sedona, we didn't really know what to expect. When we walked out of our room the next morning and headed to the overlook, the valley just opened up in front of us all we could do is gasp. AMAZING! Yeah, this is why you stay at the Sky Ranch Lodge.It's a decent set up. The cabins are old by have been revised. I think it could be nicer for the $$$ but its sedona-everything here is over priced! The immentities are good tho. Great view from the private viewing area they set up & it has a pool & spa. If you like wildlife it's perfect for possibly catching a site of some. Next to the airport so it can be a bit noisy.View is awesome and people are very nice. They even have washers and dryers located there! It's not the Hyatt, but it's very good accommodations. Not someplace where you're going to be spending all your time at the hotel...but that's not a big deal because you should be out enjoying the beautiful scenery and wonderful hikes that Sedona has to offer :)It's the only hotel with such a view! Located on top of Airport Mesa in the heart of Sedona, it's located next to the prime spot for watching a romantic sunset over the red rock! Everyone was incredibly knowledgeable and helpful! They have a list of restaurants they recommend in Sedona with super helpful tips. The rooms are small but cozy with nice porches out to the Garden area. We didn't get one of the rooms with a view, but I can only imagine how spectacular they are!I'm afraid to write a review for this place and hope that it doesn't get too popular so I can still get a room for the next time we visit Sedona. This place was terrible ( If you enjoy paying too much for a hotel stay). The customer service was just unbearable ( if you prefer cookie cutter customer service over friendly mom and pop service). They were so inconsiderate that they actually taped room keys on the front door for guests who were checking in after office hours. The rooms were dirty( if you consider an operating room the only acceptable level of cleanliness.) The sunrise view at the top of airport road viewing point which is walking distance from the drive was was obstructed by some huge red rocks in the distance that seems to be lit on fire by the morning sunlight. ;-) Considering that this place was about 1/4 the cost of the local best western and had more personality than the little hippie trying to sell us crystals at the vortex, we'll defiantly be back next tim were in Sedona- hoping that they're not booked up!Nice find away from town but close enough. What a view! Nice staff, grounds are impeccably maintained. Even though it's dated, it's very clean and quaint. Very reasonable and if you wanted to walk to the Mesa Grill at the airport, it was only a few hundred yards away. Would stay again. Quaint and peacefulWe have been staying here for the past 20 years and will not stay anywhere else. It is a small quaint peaceful place.This place is amazing. We got a great price on Priceline.com for $70/night, and it was great. The rooms aren't super fancy or modern, but ours had a fireplace, nice vaulted wood ceiling and super nice. If you want a room with a view of the red rocks, try for one of the rooms number 240 or so - they have amazing views.Airport Mesa is THE place that all the tourists come to for the view, but you can get a private view of of the amazing sunset on the red rocks from the viewing area on the hotel property...Definitely worth the stay here! Plus the wireless is great!Stayed there the first week of June in a room on the rim with a deck. Wow! What a place for breakfast and to see the sunset. Very quite and relaxing with a nice pool and attentive staff.Will definitely be my place to stay when in Sedona! The facilities are simple and the atmosphere, view and location are the best in Sedona.

review_content: Alan and I just returned from a week's stay at Sedona Summit w/ my brother Jim. It was our first time staying here. We owned a timeshare at Los Abrigados before it was bought by Diamond Resorts and have stayed there several times. Earlier this year we stayed at the Point at Poipu, also a Diamond Resort. We attended one of their Events of a Lifetime, which culminated in an owners' update at which we decided to switch our timeshare points from the Mainland (Sedona) to Hawaii. When it was time to plan our Sedona trip we decided to stay at Sedona Summit rather than Los Abrigados. I must agree w/ the previous reviewers about the timeshare pitches. After you check in you are herded toward the concierge in an effort to involve you in timeshare updates/sales. This is true whether you are an owner or not and it's annoying. We had signed up for a dinner/lunch/outing before arriving. I wasn't feeling well and we canceled. They were cooperative w/ that and we appreciated it. This review would have been 5 stars if it weren't for the not so subtle timeshare pressure and the absolutely unreliable wifi. Their provider is Windstream and it was out for hours if not days at a time. Aside from those two caveats our stay was wonderful. We stayed in room 342 in Building 41. The apartment was huge, w/ two well appointed master bedroom suites. Each bedroom had a king size bed. Linens are the usual high Diamond quality. The beds were very comfortable, w/ a variety of pillows to choose from. Jim requested a flatter pillow and one was brought. There was ample amount of storage space for clothes. There was even room for suitcases under the beds, as there is on ships, though we stored them in the closets in the entry hall. The bathrooms had twin hammered copper sinks and large triangular bathtubs as well as showers w/ angular mosaic tile floors which provided secure footing. Jim's bathroom had the toilet/sink which could be used by company, sliding doors closing it off from the bedroom and the hall. It had a hammered copper vessel sink. The toilets are by Toto, although I doubt the toilet seats are Toto, because they don't have the "soft close" feature we're used to and we had to be mindful not to drop them. There are ceiling fans in the bedrooms and the living room, though their speed is not adjustable. They probably are quite useful in the summer, but not in a cool fall. The furniture in the living room was very comfortable and the light is good for reading. There are large flatscreen TVs in bedrooms and living room. There is a stacked washer/dryer combination in a closet in the hall, which was very convenient. They provided small boxes of soap. The kitchen is fully equipped w/ stove, refrigerator and dishwasher. We requested a tea kettle and it was brought quickly. As has been our experience w/ Diamond Resorts in the past, the staff were helpful and friendly. We had a jammed garbage disposal and Kenny and Richard were rocks stars, fixing it like magic. Jim and Alan had more contact than I did w/ the front desk staff and found them helpful. They also used the hot tub and other facilities and liked them. Read as 4.49. We would return sometime in the future, although we'd check to see whether they have a more reliable wifi provider. It was free and worth every penny.Everyone please be careful with this hotel!! My friends from Japan stayed at this hotel from July 22nd 2015 to July 24th 2015.My friend booked room 121P.When she checked out of hotel on the 24th, she forgot to pick up her important items (passport,credit cards, and cash) from the safety box. She also left her bag and clothes in the closet. As she started to make her way to PHX, she realized that she forgot her belongings at the hotel, and called but learned that the lost and found office was already closed.The next day she called the hotel again, but the lost and found office staff informed her that they did not find any of her items. This was upsetting to her, so she drove back to the hotel because she felt that her belongings must still be at the hotel. Upon arriving at the hotel the staff was not very open or helpful. She was given the run around when she tried to ask who opened the safety box. The staff eventually told her the housekeeper must have opened it, but did not find anything. My friend went to Sedona police and filed a report at which time the Sedona police contacted hotel in front of her. This is when the hotel staff found her bag and clothes, but continued to claim that there was no passport, credit cards, and cash. After a week, hotel found her passport and credit cards, but not the cash.A week after ??Why?? No cash !? lolI know the fact, staffs were thief. I reported this matter to Diamond Resorts but they totally denied. Sham on Diamond Resort and Sedona Summit Resort. Everyone just be careful with this hotel. Do not left anything at safety box, it not safe!!!!I would actually give this place a 4-star if it wasn't a front for a time-share sales pitch. It was very annoying, and uncalled for.An advice --- When you go there to check in, and they ask you to see concierge for some discounts on something to do around town, say NO THANKS because they are trying to allure you to buy the time-share. Also, you can find better discounts on activities around town on Groupon(Such as PinkJeep,etc. ) Disregard their voice msg left in your room phone...you get my point by now, right? ~_~I won't spend a lot of time on this review.I'm disappointed in a room that should have had two queen beds along with a pull-out sofa in a studio suite.Upon check in I was told none of their rooms have 2 beds. I then asked if I can be changed to a king bed hoping for a bit more sleeping space. I was told by Brandon due to a full house I could not be accommodated. Knowing I was upset at check in I was still asked to speak to the concierge to be reeled into a time-share. ugh! not happening!I'll add my positives here only because any negative is definitely bound to have a positive attached.1. nice room.2. decor is nicely updated.If you make the mistake and get a room here- DO NOT get sucked into any of the timeshare presentations!! They will offer $75-$100 just to go, and they will say it's not a "high pressured" meeting, but it is. It's actually a huge scam that Diamond resorts is running! As far as the rooms here, they are nice... But this company is all about getting you to become an "owner". So once you are in their territory- they will constantly bug he crap out of you to try and attend one of these meetings. Do yourself a favor and stay somewhere else. Any location run or owned by Diamond resorts is pathetic and likes to try and scam their guests.Stumbled on this little gem for an impromptu trip. Was pleasantly delighted to see how well kept the grounds are maintained and how much nicer the rooms were given it was one of those timeshare type of resorts. We had a sunset room equipped with everything I needed to feel like a staycation without missing the comforts of home. The bathtub alone made me want to be the star of an adult movie. Staff is stellar and never overly pushy about taking their vacation ownership tours. But if you want to buy in, definitely let Patricia or Leah charm you why you need to invest here. Their infectious smiles and enthusiasm is hard to refuse. The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars is the check-out policy. I've never had a resort make you check out at 10a. Makes no sense to me when you can't even check in the room until after 4p. Perhaps it was busy and overbooked for Father's Day. My suggestion to the the front desk personnel is have some diplomacy and tact when guests inquire about late check-outs. It's not unusual that hotels have check-outs til as late as 4p. Mind you, we would be willing to pay you for that extra beauty sleep. I did appreciate the offer to access the pools until we departed. In any event, this is a wonderful little spot to escape to in our own desert backyard.Great place, wonderful customer service! I've traveled extensively and this is the most beautiful spot in Sedona.Gracious front desk greeting, easy check-in and lots of people to help with luggage, etc.Friends and I thoroughly enjoyed our stay!Gorgeous resort! All the amenities you could ask for! Beautiful views! So quiet! Great hiking trails! Would love to come back!The worse experience ever. We stay here three times a year, and their system for booking is terrible, so we book through booking.com then the front office waves our resort fee since we are members. This time they said they cannot do this. They showed policy for non members booking this way. They would not listen. Next our carpet was worn, we had two different paint colors on the ceiling, and the list goes on. By our unit we had to stand on rocks in the dark BBQing vs a nice slab, and there Wanda rattle snake in the general area. The worse they should had credited me, and said next time we will not do this. Then made a note of this.Pros:-Condo was nice-Pools and resort facilities were solid-DVD rentals Cons:-not within walking distance of anything. Had to drive into town-hotel manager-diamond resort time share lady was pushyWe had an issue with our neighbor. I tried to contact the hotel manager about the issue to see if one of us can move, I never got a call back after calling multiple times. So that was disappointingAwesome place to visit. Rooms were really nice with all amenities. Infinity jacuzzi was a highlight due to the view of the red rock mountains. This is truly a place to go to retreat from reality. I would go back in a heartbeat.This is a huge disappointment. First, it is not a resort, but time shares. Our first clue was a high pressure sales pitch called a "complementary check-in gift". The salesmen are deceptively called concierges and they outnumber the front desk staff 3:1. They were relentless and rude. There is no housekeeping-- none-- and the nightly "resort fee" pays for absolutely nothing. Seriously. Listed amenities are simply public facilities, eg a Safeway, entirely off premises. All are unaffiliated with the time shares. Units are somewhat attractive, but views are of other units and parking lots, not scenic in the least. A busy US highway is less than 30 ft from some bedrooms. It is aggravating to be in a congested area knowing vast open lands are just out of reach. If you live in a noisy, densely populated city you will feel at home, but otherwise stay home. We visit Sedona frequently and enjoyed staying at many other places that are quite an unflattering contrast. I would not return here if paid to do so.Great motel at a great price. We ended up paying 136.00 for one night. Pros: - laundry facility free on site (just but detergent, but front desk said just ask and they will give you detergent for free)- nice pools with separate adult pool- my room had a nice kitchen with large fridge and freezer- nice staff- DVD player (we rented red box at Walgreens a few miles away)- pools were very cleanCons: - concierge tries too sell you another vacation (like the blue suit people in Vegas)- hot water takes awhile to come on- bad lighting to room at night (room 129p)Good stay for the price.I would give it a 4-5 stars, if they had not acted like jerks while checking us in. We had booked two condos, of the same type, in the same property. But it took us 30 mins of back and forth arguing before they gave us 2 close to each other. They clearly had those available but somehow had made up their mind to not give those to us and were giving us condos in two different properties. We had kids and family with us and that us not acceptable to us. No amount of evidence would convince them, but finally we pointed out the logical flaws in their excuses and managed to convince them. Seemed like they were doing us a favor by giving us what we had paid for.Overall the resort was nice. I might go stay there again.The only unit available was a studio, which is okay for 2 people but no more than that as it is small and dark. Could use some updating too.Housekeeping never showed up for the weekly "cleaning" and towel restocking. When we notified front desk they said they would let them know but no one ever showed up. The front desk person was also very rude and had an attitude on the phone when I called with some questions about our stay. Didn't appreciate the $25 daily resort fee when nothing was done for us- we had to empty our trash, go to front desk for more towels,missed out on the weekly cleaning; not sure what we were paying for. Sedona and Oak Creek are gorgeous, but our stay at this resort was disappointing.Love Diamond Resorts. Since my sister in law is a member we always go. The unit we had was A ONE Bedroom and the room we had was the studio. So nice and there where multiple pools. We ended up walking up a few units to the big pool and hot tub. At night you could see the Milky Way and all the shooting stars. Amazing!!We couldn't have asked for a better place to stay!!! Our room was beautiful, very comfy beds..... the little pool and hot tub were PERFECT and just steps away from our door. The views around the complex are breathtaking and there is an easy short walk to some trail heads and a gorgeous hill to watch the sunset. Location is just a mile or so from the "Uptown" area. You walk there, but it's hilly and several miles. Great places to eat in the area as well. We did visit the "Indian Jewelry" show - which was very over-priced. Skip that. I was able to attend the Guided Meditation session (with Crystal singing bowls) and I have to say it was one of the most beautiful experiences of my life. (i'm very much into Yoga and Meditation!). What I didn't appreciate was that after class, the instructor pushed her "new CDs" on the class to buy. Kind of ruined my Zen... Can't wait to return to the beautiful area and really enjoyed my time there.I understand that not too many rooms have a "views" but even though our room faced the parking lot our long distance view was breathtaking. Don't accept the welcome packet and they never bother you about the timeshare speech.We booked our room through VROB so we used someone's timeshare. We have a two bedroom lockout and it was awesome. The place is about two miles out of downtown Sedona. Not too far and not too close to the hustle and bustle of the town. I'd definitely stay here again.My family and I had a great time at this resort. Services were very good. Staff was very friendly.I came here with my boyfriend and his family for Memorial Day weekend and it was a very enjoyable visit! There were 14 of us and we managed to fit comfortably in two rooms. If you're planning on coming with a big group like us, they're likely to set up a one bedroom suite connecting to a studio that has a queen-sized bed along with a sofa which could be made into a bed. The studios also had their own fully stocked kitchenette. The bedroom had a HUGE bathroom with a shower stall along with a nice jacuzzi. Too bad my boyfriend and I couldn't get that room :P The living room has a sofa bed as well and a dining table. The kitchen was fully stocked and much bigger than the ones in the studio. Throughout the resort, you can find plenty of things to do. They had several pools at different spots. The jacuzzi is nicely heated and it wasn't so excruciatingly hot that you had to get out of there 5 minutes after you had just gotten in. There was a much bigger pool which had a waterfall down the street from our room but it was closed. You can also play ping pong, shuffle board, pool, and many more games at the activity center. You can also play with an enlarged chess board and horseshoe where the kids playground is. I've been to a few timeshare resorts now and this is one of the great ones! It's not the best but definitely spacious and family-friendly! The staff is awesome and helpful. I would definitely come back if we decided to get a timeshare.
review_content_20: This place is awesome, great staff.  We stayed 1 week in a 2 bedroom suite.  It was fantastic.  The staff came by and asked if they could refresh our towels and gave us more supplies.  The room was gorgeous.  The grounds were great. My kids and I played checkers on the life-size checker board, hit golf balls on the mini range, played ping pong, pool and bumper pool sat in the sun and swam in the pool.  I loved having my breakfast outside on the patio and playing games that we brought with us. We hiked several trails we had never been on before.My only complaint is that cell service isn't that good in Sedona, but that is not the resorts problem, it is Sedona in general. We own a timeshare so we had no issue with the presentation thing.Stay at Sedona summit!! They're rooms are beautiful and the resort is very accommodating. We were so impressed, I'm not a diamond member, but after our stay we are strongly considering. I am so happy that we found this gem. Don't listen to the negative reviews, you have to see it for yourself. Thanks again for our wonderful stay and to Nina for signing us up for the seminar. It's definitely worth it to go and check out what Diamond has to offer!This is our home away from home. We come to Sedona and stay at the summit every time. The suites are beautiful and homey. They will accommodate in anyway they can. I always cook while we are here, so if I need any type of dish or utensils they make it happen. The staff is wonderful and attentive. We really love the fact that you can check out games at the activity center and keep them for 3 days. I highly recommend this place!We stayed here for a week, and loved it. We had our 9month old with us. The laundry room was convenient. We were on the first floor and the person above us had a child who ran around in the morning but it wasnt too bad. I went to check out the special guest who made flutes. He taught us a history lesson about the Native American flute and brought many of them to do a  demonstration. Sedona was amazing and staying here made it a great trip.First, the good. Helpful, friendly grounds and maintenance staff. The view from one of the jacuzzis, one which of course was not near our room, but we made a trek to visit. Second, the not so good. If you are looking for a romantic getaway with a fireplace, THIS IS NOT IT. Although it is advertised they have a fireplace,  it is in fact a screen that plays a video of a fire. Awesome. (note sarcasm) Killed a big part of the romantic theme I had wanted for my VDay getaway with my SO. I specifically looked for a place equipped with one and was completely disappointed.The beds are hard as rocks. Perfect if you prefer that type of firmness in a bed, however I do not. Two nights I tossed and turned and woke up sore as can be. If we had not taken so much stuff I would have packed everything back up and headed over to the Hyatt or a cabin where they do have real fireplaces. It also seems the hot water is controlled. I could only get the shower fixture over so far before it stopped and the water never got steamy. Cheapos. You couldn't sell me on a timeshare here for nothing. There are so many  better options in Sedona for what I paid, I know I could've done better.To start, this place has some of the worst customer service I have ever experienced. We asked for early check in and showed up at 2 for check in, they told us that are room wasn't ready until 4 and that they had no proof of our reservation. We waited around till 4 for the room to still no be ready until 5. When finally checking in the man up front said that it was not his problem. When finally checking in we pulled out the coach to find 2 little COACH ROACHES in the bed. The place is a cheap price for a reason and even though it will work for a night I wouldn't suggest wasting your money but to rather spend 20-40 more and actually enjoy your time!I have been a Platinum Diamond Resort member for many years and decided to gift my daughter and her friend a stay at the Sedona Summit this past weekend. Everything was fine with check in, they had to wait a little longer for a room to be available, but once they went back to the unit after dinner they discovered 2 COCKROACHES in the bathroom.  They called the front desk who said that there are no rooms available to move them to since the resort is at full capacity for the weekend. They said a maintenance man could come take care of the roaches, but that they are not "authorized" to spray the unit. Once the maintenance guy showed up, he mocked my daughter and friend saying that they were over exaggerating , claiming that this is very common in all units since we are in the desert, and to be "happy it wasn't a snake". An hour later, they found another HUGE cockroach in the bathroom and called the front desk demanding to switch units (this is now 1 AM). they said they had a room that they could transfer us to . So in other words they lied the first time they requested to move. Once they were in the new room , they found a large dead cockroach in the bathroom. the next morning they found another dead on the carpet, and that evening found one dead near their luggage on the floor. I am guessing they sprayed the unit quickly before my daughter moved into the second room.They ended their trip short and left Sunday night because they could not handle staying in a roach infested room and went to the front desk to check out. The front desk gentleman did not even flinch when we described our experience and just brushed it off . Overall, I was completely embarrassed and shocked that my daughter and her friend had such a horrible experience with a resort that I spoke so highly about. For such a great resort you would think they would take better care of their guests and maintain a clean atmosphere.Found a good deal online for this resort. It's not as nice as other places I've stayed but it did the job. It's nice how there is a kitchen and a full size fridge. There are lots of pools and hot tubs which is nice. We didn't get a good view room but there are a lot of rooms that look like they would have a beautiful view.Aftwr booking a reservation explicitly wanting to be away from kids. The room we got was next to the 21+ pool.  But later that night guests check in with a screaming baby.So we requested to move to another room. And got onebwith a broken closet and a broken toilet.  After a day of fun hiking. We returned to yet a family of 5 kids next to us who kept trying to open our door. While our other party was put across the hall/walkway.  Worst service in sedona.Stood here 2 nights with my boyfriend & we loved it! You can't beat a resort studio with everything you need. Refrigerator, stove, microwave, dishwasher, sink, kitchen table, pull out sofa, and balcony. It was perfect. Our view of the red rocks from our balcony was honestly amazing. I'd stay here again!On a weekend trip to Sedona from Tucson. Reserved a studio, huge bathroom, shower with a tub, all in excellent condition. Great kitchenette, nice to have to save a bit on eating out.Living room couch a plus, with dining room table with 4 chairs.Bed comfy and ceiling fan a real plus.The pool and hot tub were close by and welcome after we came back from dinner.The wifi is free,A number of items would have made this five stars:Closet doors were off the tracks,Not clear where the living room wastebasket was,Bathroom make up area a real plus, yet there was no stool or chair, had to bring a chair from the kitchen table,The web site descriptions of the room choices are not very detailed.The phone signal, ATT, none in the room, erratic in the parking lot, be aware,Update: this morning my wife talked to the manager, Scott Lopez, who was very attentive, apologized for the inconvenience and accepted the room was not in good condition to stay. He even stepped outside to go to the car where I was waiting for my wife to apologize. He offered a compensation on the spot. I can tell he does care for the satisfaction of his customers. Too bad he wasn't on duty last night when the incident happened. I'll update the 1 star rating once the compensation gets credited.Spent the weekend in Sedona for my birthday. The resort made it a great one! Excellent customer service. Very hospitable. A lot of fun activities to do. From the pool to hiking, arts and crafts, meditation, yoga, concierge is willing to help you plan a fun vacation. Everything was clean and presentable. View was amazing and breathtaking. Complimentary cake's (plural)!We booked our rooms through Airbnb-loved it! Great rooms(connecting rooms), terrific customer service from front desk, attention to detail from beautiful landscaping , fitness room, and pools. We will definitely be staying here next time we visit Sedona. Located in West Sedona.We stayed here for 2 nights while in Sedona. Our rooms were nice with a kitchenette and enough room for us. The grounds are very nice and I appreciated that they had several pools so it was not too crowded. I recommend the pool with the waterfall and infinity spa as it was the largest and nicest. I didn't like that they are using Styrofoam cups in the lobby for coffee and tea... it's 2015 we should be beyond that. Would stay here againMy entire family booked rooms at this resort for my wedding. We booked the our room months ahead of time. Showed up a couple hours after our check-in time, got our keys, got to our room, and it hadn't even been cleaned yet. We were told by housekeeping to wait outside or we could come back in an hour or so. I called the front desk, so they would know there's some sort of miscommunication over which rooms are actually ready and the concierge was very rude about it. The room itself looked like it hadn't been redecorated or remodeled since 1983.  Frankly, you might as well stay at a Holiday Inn or other chain hotel rather than this resort.  You would save money, get better customer service, and have a room that's just as comfortable, if not more so.LOVED our stay at Sedona Summit! Got a 1 bedroom....and it was HUGE! Full kitchen, dining area, living room that has a queen sized sofa pull-out, washer/dryer unit....THEN you still have a FULL MASTER SUITE! Jacuzzi tub that's SEPARATE from the shower???? WHAT?! We happened to be in building 11, which had a little mini-putt putt, a kids playground, big chess/checkers board, and horse-shoe. Walk yo the little hill, and we have an adult only 21+ Serenity pool and hot tub. Walk across the road and there's a big family pool and a big spa atop. Walk down the parking lot, and there's 3 huge propane BBQ grills. Great customer service from check-in to check-out. Anna, Patricia and Patricia at Concierge were SUPER knowledgable and fun. If you're looking to go to Sedona, make SURE you look at staying at Sedona Summit!We booked 2 rooms for 2 nights at this 'resort'  as a 1 day break from our week & a half driving tour of the south west. At first glance, the accommodations seem fine, but as you look closer, you can see the wear and tear. I would suggest you avoid the concierge like the plague--the time share speech made me miss out on pool time with the kids. I was amused by the "american Indian jewelry" sale...The resort was packed...many people at the pools. However, we did enjoy a dip & my boys liked the activity center's ping pong table, pool table & foosball. On the plus side, the suite's bed was comfortable, there were plenty of pillows & towels, and the room was clean.Avoid this place !  You'll get accosted with a time share presentation. Don't go here. I made the mistake :(Excellent customer service, Scott the manager at the front desk went the extra mile to make our stay really enjoyable and memorable. Great view from the valley-facing jacuzzi, excellent knowledge and help from the concierge staff. Again, Scott is a top-notch guy and the primary reason that we will be staying here again when we visit next year, we appreciate how much you care about doing a great thing for your customers thank you!
review_content_40: Its a nice property the rentals are very dated. The most uncomfortable furniture I ever sat on. The bed was good. The HIGH PRESSURE sales was a big turnoff. This is a timeshare place. Have know idea what most of the light switch's do. PS this chair is killing my back. The chair and couch could have been a medieval torture device.Booked a room about 1 month in advance. My room was supposedly "guaranteed for late arrival". When I got to the front desk to check in around 7pm I was told the hotel overbooked. I wanted a refund so the concierge who was helping me went to look for the manager. 20 mins later the same concierge (NOT the manager) told me I was being walked to another hotel and that I was being upgraded. Got to the new hotel and it's a run down dump. Called Sedona Summit to complain and spoke to the manager. I didn't catch her name but she told me that's all she could do and hung up. Disorganized, lack of communication, ignorant concierge.I'm not sure how we booked this place since it's a timeshare and we're not owners.  The place has the feel of condos/apartments with several small pools. It is on the outer edge of Sedona. Each unit has a kitchen with cooking equipment - it's great because the restaurants in Sedona aren't especially interesting after you've been in town for a few days. According to the pictures some units are pretty posh. Ours was not. It was about the quality of a 90's style apartment. Not bad, but could use a refreshing.  I guess the nicer units have views. We did not.The concierge will repeatedly leave messages on your unit phone to come pick up your welcome pack. That's just an excuse for them to try and talk you into a timeshare. Skip that part if you hate being sold stuff. Overall it was a comfy place to use as home base while we went on hikes and explored the town. I wouldn't think of it as a destination in itself though, as the sales people suggest. The best part was being able to cook my own meals after days on the road. And the unit has a washer/dryer.I am so happy with this place. Our studio is so comfy and clean and the staff is absolutely wonderful! So nice and helpful. We love the location! Close to the middle of town but not directly in town. The views just from our room are breathtaking! Laundry rooms and a great activity center where you can rent movies. The concierge has tons of maps for whatever you are looking to do. Dined tonight at Dahl and Di luca after comcierge recommended it and it was amazing! We are loving our time here so far and would definitely stay at a diamond resort again :)Incredible resort to stay in. As a testament to how incredible it is - while we checked in for only two nights, we extended by two more nights. All of the staff are great, very positive experience with check-in and concierge folks. Want to make a call out to Ashley at the front desk, and Ashley - her manager. Very patient, friendly, and wanting to make you, the guest, feel welcome. As an added bonus - and this came as a welcome surprise - resort provides free access to a day spa at one of their sister properties. Very welcome relaxation after a long day of hiking.This is our first trip to Sedona and we are so happy we came!  Our room here at the resort is really nice.  Easy check-in process, easy to find our room, and very comfortable accommodations.  We like to do some cooking while on the road and the kitchen is well-stocked to do so.  Wifi is an additional fee but it's a strong connection. The view from our room is part resort and part mountain range.  We also like to use the fitness room and this one is well outfitted with four cardio machines, free weights and other weight machines.  There seem to be pools at every corner of the resort.  We had a small problem with our shower door that was resolved quickly by the maintenance staff.  The resort is just outside the west side of town where you can find Safeway, Walgreens, the movie theater, and many restaurant choices.  If we get a chance to come back to Sedona, we'll definitely stay here.This resort is beautiful, and would have been even better if we hadn't had four days of incessant rain, some snow, and freezing temps.  Still, the quality of the fixtures in the unit made for a wonderful stay.The kitchen has stainless-steel appliances, and the small ones are all Cuisinart:  blender, toaster, electric can opener.  There is no dedicated dining area or table, but the kitchen has an oversized granite island that doubles as the dining table.  The bathroom is bigger than many NYC studio apartments!  We loved the jetted bubble tub, the shower big enough for four, and the hammered copper sink on the granite-topped vanity.We had a one-bedroom unit.  The bedroom was on the small side, but with plenty of storage and a comfortable bed; the living room was also small, but big enough for our purposes.  One complaint is that the sofa wasn't comfortable and I slid down each time I tried to sit on it, and the two arm chairs were way too deep.  There is also no real coat closet, just a closed, very shallow cabinet containing the ironing board and a pull-out, sort of like a tie rack, for hanging a coat or two at most.  The problem was that since we had so much rain, we couldn't hang the wet jackets in that cabinet, so the stool backs had to be our coat rack.Maintenance was terrific:  it seemed as if we had problems with a few light bulbs - in the bathroom and on the patio - that were out.  Both times maintenance came immediately.  But it turned out that the light bulbs weren't out.  The recessed bulb over the bathtub, which looks like every other recessed fixture in the bathroom, turned out to have its own switch, which we didn't notice until it was pointed out.  Likewise, the patio, which had two recessed bulbs (and a ceiling fan - nice touch!), had a separate switch in the bedroom for the second bulb, which again we hadn't noticed.  It would have been helpful if the info sheet we got at check-in had this information, or if there were small signs near these switches.  It would also have helped save maintenance from those two trips to our unit.Despite the near-freezing temperatures and the rain, my husband and other guests took advantage of the heated pool and the hot tub, which was open until around 10 p.m.  When the sun finally came out, on our fifth day, there was a gorgeous view of Sedona's red rocks from the pool area.Lack of connectivity was a major problem.  We were told early on that our carrier, AT&T, had almost no service in Sedona, and we found this true not only at the resort, but many places in town.  That, and the very spotty wi-fi, made it very difficult, because we were trying to conduct some business while we were there, and time was of the essence.  Luckily, it all worked out, but not without some harrowing moments.Re the timeshare presentation:  we were offered first-class tickets on the Verde Valley Railway for the discounted price of $71 and change.  We bit.  The next night, before the train ride, we met some people who told us that another timeshare resort gave them the same first-class tickets for free.  My husband went back to the person whom we dealt with, and she did refund what we had paid.  We managed to get through the presentation in less than two hours, only because of our unique timeshare situation.  They released our prison bonds when they were smart enough to realize that there was no way on God's green earth they were going to sell us a timeshare.We have stayed in many timeshare resorts, and they are always varied in their amenities and the quality of the units.  Overall, Sedona Summit was a winner, and we wouldn't hesitate to go back.  Just not in January!Wife, baby, and I really enjoyed it.  Very clean, great amenities, super friendly staff.  Relocation nice right by red rock state park as wellNice place, good location and comfy bed! We were luck enough to use someone elses time share for the weekend that they couldn't use and it was a great expereince. The check in desk was very nice and helpful and the room was clean and nicely stocked. The grounds were nice and we were able to sit on our patio and have a great view of the red rocks. They give you a calender of events and classes that they have but we were not there long enough to take advantage of any of them but they look fun.We really enjoyed our 4 night, 5 day stay at Sedona Summit.  Keep in mind, however, that we had read a lot of reviews about how terrible and forceful the Concierge is re: timeshare presentations, so we avoided the front desk like it was the plague.  Aside from checking in and checking out, we didn't visit the front desk at all.    We did, however, receive two voicemails about a "welcome packet" the concierge had for us but we just ignored them.  We heard from another couple that the 1.5 hours the concierge promises you for the presentation is actually 4 hours, so we are really glad we didn't take a chance.We asked for a room with a view, and that is what we got.  Building 1 Room 203P is great in terms of location and wifi access.  We read that other guests couldn't access wifi at all, but we had no problems with it.  Our room was a studio, which was smaller than the pictures indicated, but fine for two.  The appliances all worked and they had a few I wouldn't have guessed they'd have, like a blender and mechanical wine bottle opener.  They also had a dishwasher.  I would have preferred more utensils, but no big deal.  They make sure to leave dishwasher detergent, soap for handwashing dishes, extra garbage bags and an extra paper towel roll too.    Bathroom was clean, shower was great.  TV worked fine. We really had no issues at all.  Parking got full but was never totally full that you couldn't find a spot.  The view of the rocks is amazing from the hotel.  Oh, we also used the Jacuzzi every night and had no issues with it.  The temperature of the water was great for the cool evenings.   The pool was supposedly heated, but it was kind of cold, even on one of the days where it felt like 75 degrees.  It didn't seem like many people were using the pool or Jacuzzi, but it is the end of February so it was a little bit cooler out anyways and that could have been why.All in all, I would definitely recommend Sedona Summit.We stayed here for a few nights.  We found out that this was a time share property and ended up going to a meeting to learn more about it.  The sales people were not too aggressive.  Room was cozy.  Nice comfortable bed, decent shower room with the tub, small living room and a tiny kitchen that we never used because we ate out everyday.  Gave it 3 stars, we specifically picked this place hoping we would get a room with a view, I guess those are offered to people who own a property and on their site, the pool looked huge, with the jacuzzi... It was Tiny!   Plus, we were on the first floor and we heard every single thing they did upstairs!  Annoying!Study unit location, our unit was at the corner of two highways with noise all night.  Well appointed unit somewhat dated.  Good price point.We rolled into Sedona and used Expedia to book a room here, including the resort fee (this is added after booking so beware) total was $140/night.Pros* Nice rooms, nothing special but it was clean, comfortable, roomy compared to a standard hotel room, and had a kitchen and a little patio area.* Decent fitness center and the pools and hot tub look nice, but we didn't use them so I can't comment further. * Free wifi, although a bit slow.Cons* Check-in - the lady at the front desk looked like she was on drugs or very tried She couldn't keep her eyes open and couldn't find our reservation in the computer because she couldn't spell our name right.  We ended up waiting 30 minutes before someone with a higher ranking came out and helped. The checkin process took way to long.* Check-out - is at 10AM and I called to see if we could stay longer sine we rolled in so late and they weren't very accommodating, only willing to go to 11AM. * No cell phone service. This is a must. I'm not sure how folks can stay here for a week without phone service.* View - No view from our room.Stayed here for 5 days and have been to many other timeshares. The place over all was nice with good views. If you have AT&T don't expect service. If you aren't a diamond member then you'll have to pay 22 dollars for internet that is the speed of dial up and has a super weak signal. Half the tv channels didn't work and the others had such bad signal they cut in and out all the time. I saw it on other tvs in other rooms as well. Hard to do business in my roomToday marks our 5th day in Sedona, AZ at summit. The experience has been really good so far other then a few problems but nothing to big. My wife and I came here with the whole family. By that I mean 3 adults 3 kids and a baby. The first problem is there are only a minimal amount of grills. I found only 3 and one doesn't work. So for some it is a very long hike if you want to grill. The second problem was with at the pools. If you have kids swimming under 18 then you have to been present at all times. My kids which is a 11, 13 and 16 year old went to the pool about ten minutes prior to us arriving got kicked out because we were not present to watch them swim. But I can see why that is a concern for insurance reasons. As far as the amenities and resorts grounds are concerned they are great. I believe there are 5 pools with spas and one big spa. The concierge was very nice and informational. We currently use RCI as our timeshare host but decided to see what diamond had to offer. They are extremely expensive and in our opinion not worth it at this time. We didn't find them pushy at all and when we said we didn't think it was a good move at this time they gave us some information and their card if we ever decided to go to diamond and that was all. We received a 2 night 3 day stay at a few places and a free 100 dollar gift card to a restaurant of our chose. I've already talked about the grills but you can get grilling utensils at the front desk but do not have a brush with them. All in all we enjoyed our stay here besides the 110 degree temperature outside. I do recommend summit resort. Hope you enjoyed this review have a great stayWe stayed in a one-bedroom suite for a week and loved it!  The bathroom was huge and had both a large jacuzzi tub and a walk-in shower.  The appliances and furniture were also very modern.  My favorite part of the resort was the infinity hot tub, about the size of a small swimming pool.  It was part of the "family hot tub/pool", but the noise of the waterfalls kept a relatively serene, peaceful ambiance. The two things that were a little strange to us were that our fireplace seemed to be emitting cold air and that most of the resorts pools/hot tubs were being remodeled the week we were there.  Otherwise, we loved the gorgeous views of the night stars and Red Rocks!My boyfriend and I stayed there this weekend for Memorial Day.  The place was pretty beautiful.  The room was a nice size and the location was nice.  There was a beautiful area for star gazing behind our building which was quiet and very dark.  The only part I really didn't like was that we only stayed for one night and within that time found three cockroaches in our room.  It was a little uncomfortable going to bed knowing that there were that many cockroaches around.  If you plan to stay here, just know you might have some uninvited bugs staying with you also!We stayed there as hotel guests , not time share,Check in is at 4 pm,we got to our room@ 4:45,Check out is 10 am,they clean rooms , every five days,room was great,amenities were good,service was POORSo we check in to our room , the place is beautiful, but somewhat overwhelmed by the surrounding natural beauty of the Sedona mountains. Everything is great, checking the town out, doing some spectacular hiking, eating some great food at one of the many food establishments in the area. But, the second day there, we're required to attend the "time share presentation". This is where everything went bad! I am already a Diamond resort owner, have spent thousands already, so when the "vacation counselor" was introduced to us, I told him straight out from the get go that " I am not buying anything today, that we just came cuz I had to, to get the free 4day/3night vacation.  He then tells me " we'll I don't want to waste my time" or your time. I say good, we are on the same page. I then ask if we're done then, and " can we go now". He says it's not that easy, so we sit down at a table. He scribbles some numbers    On some paper, and for the third time he tells me" I don't want to waste my time". But, before he can finish the sentence, I cut him off, and said" your wasting my time, telling me that your not going to waste my time"! At this point he said I was rude, unprofessional, and that he never had to deal with someone  like me before. He also told me that he had been doing this a loooooong time. I ask how long, he says "five years". That is not long!  So after he gets up and bring the next person in line, she isn't much better telling my fiance to "tone it down " as she tried to explain to her the situation. Not good! She then brings the manager, and she was great. Donna, I believe . The guy that"helped" me, his name is Sue David Ono. A "boy named Sue"!  He actually looked at my fiance and asked her" you wanna be with this guy"! He told me if I don't sit here and listen to presentation, he was gonna charge me full price for the room. I told him " bullshit"!  He told me again and I said "bullshit" again. He said if I cussed one more time that it would be over, and they would charge me full price. I told him what, "there aren't any kids here, what, are your virgin ears bleeding?" I then said " bullshit". I then told him that by telling anybody that they would have to pay full price, it would make them angry, and that it would make me angry! He told me" I would like to see that" basically calling me out. He said " I'd like to see what happened if you got angry!" I told him " read some police reports or any newspaper and you'll see what can happen when people get angry. The guy insulted me. So when the manager came over I calmly told her1. I am already an owner, is this how you treat your owners?2. I have spent thousands already (paid off loan)I.e. Maintenance fees, points fees3.I'm not going to buy anything today! Finally after that, she cut us loose. This guy Sue Ono, who goes by David, what I would call a prima Donna , who never has had his soft hands dirty. I'm guessing a college grad, trying to sell timeshares. Good job Sue! Not! I hope Diamond resorts reads this so they can take the appropriate action towards a BOY named Sue!Where do I start! We checked in on a Sat and were sent to the wrong kind of room. I am mobility impaired and needed an ADA room, we went back to the desk, they apologized and moved us. We got into the second Studio unit and it was perfect. Nice layout and space for 2 people. In the first 18 hours the AC quit 3 times. This was in September, maintenance was quick to respond and so nice. After the 3rd time my husband went to the front desk and they upgraded up to a better unit that was amazing! They also sent someone over to help us pack and move. Kim at the front desk ROCKS! We had a small issue with parking but Kim and the GM took care of it. They also sent over a gift basket when they found out it was our 10th anniversary. The pool areas were awesome and we spent every night in one of the spas.Thing happen that are out of our control and are no fault of anyone. What defines a business is how they handle the customer service end of it. These guys were great. We will be back! It was a perfect celebration of our marriage and was that much better because of this resort and their staff.I gave 4 stars because I had no cell coverage at the resort, but the second we pulled out to the light I had 5 bars. The service was being intentionally blocked to sell their internet coverage, in my opinion. Which I refused to pay for. Free wifi and cell phone access would have given them 5 stars.
review_content_60: Booked a room here for one night in January, but cancelled in advance of the 2 day requirement due to a change in plans. Then I discovered charges for 2 nights on my credit card. Called the hotel and received a complete run around even after they acknowledged my cancellation in advance. Contesting the charges and keeping this hotel off my list. Beware in working with this hotel and check all charges on your bill.Really nice place too bad we only stayed one day. Multiple pools great view and we had a two room condo very nice!!! Would be nice if they had a restaurant onsite. I would defiantly come back but is a little pricy. But you only get what you pay for.We had a two-bedroom suite with a gorgeous view of the red rocks. There was great hiking and trails right out the back of the property. The inside of the suite was very nice and very modern. My wife loved the fixtures in the bathrooms. Only complaint she has is that the steak knives have sucked at every Diamond Resort. Other than that, though, the staff was wonderful, the pools were great, kids had fun at the activity center and we just LOVED it there. Sedona Summit will be seeing these Californians quite a bit.We are owners and this is our third visit here (we live in Chandler). This time we have the larger one bedroom on the first floor. Very nice space except that it needs better soundproofing! We hear very step of the people upstairs which is pretty annoying. It's a bit dark in here but some prefer that I guess--at least in the summer. This area is spacious enough. We've also had the smaller one bedroom and it's a little cramped. That time we had noisy neighbors in the adjoining (locked) bedroom and that was really annoying. If you stay here your best bet is the 2bedroom kickoff ion the second level. We had our best stay there because noise was not an issue.Beautiful room, great bathroom, abundant storage and spectacular views! We really enjoyed our stay and would have stayed longer if our work schedules had allowed it! The only reason I didn't give this resort 5 stars is because there is not a restaurant on site therefore, no room service; I would have loved to wake up and enjoy breakfast in bed! Next time we will be sure to bring snacks and maybe make a grocery store run! Can't wait to stay here again!We came here expecting it to be as nice as the Hawaii time share....wrong.The consIt's so far out and away from everything absolutely nothing close enough to walk to, you get in your car and drive everywhere..No restaurant on the propertyThe concierges pretend they're there to help you but really they're trying to get you to attend a sales presentation. (We didn't bite and after reading others exp. I'm glad we didn't.Internet service is almost non existent.Cell phone service was horrible.The couch/sofa bed was the most uncomfortable you could ever sit on.We arrived early and was told they would call when room was ready, of course they didn't.Our view was the side of the buildingThe prosComfortable bedCleanMidweek maid serviceTV workedNice gymGame room with ping pong, pool and moreNice laundromatThat's about itWould I stay here again, probably notHad a great stay, the shallow kiddie pool was a huge plus! Great service all around, they even had bbq tools for us to borrow. Well appointed room and the entire family loved the jetted tub. Only thing was out daughter was able to easily open front door and run out, good thing mommy was quick on her feet! Overall great stay!Disappointed with my experience at this hotel. We arrived early to the hotel and asked if the room was ready, and they said no but that they would put priority on it to help us get in early. After an hour we went back and they said it still wasn't ready. 15 minutes before 4 the room wasn't ready. At 4 the gentleman had to call out to see if the room was ready and proceeded to ask us if we would like to be upstairs or downstairs. I was confused why we had options, since we had waited for so long. I understand that we arrived early so I shouldn't expect that we could get into our room earlier, but I was disappointed because while waiting I saw families and couples all getting to go into their room earlier, which made me upset, because I didn't understand why we had to wait. One lady came up to us and said we could use the pool, which was nice but everything was packed in our car. I do think their concierge part was nice, she helped us find some nice locations to go too. Our room was next to a family and we were able to hear all the kids, which I understand is uncontrollable. Also, they have poor connection to the Internet, and an additional charge of 12 + tax for using the pool and Internet per day, which I didn't know until we arrived after prepaying for our trip. Overall, I am disappointed in the Sedona Summit, because of the poor service we received when coming to the hotel. I felt that we were treated differently from the other couples arriving to the hotel early because we were younger.Great place ... Very clean and comfortable and the pools/spas are well maintained and relaxing ... Recommend highly !!!Actually, a beautiful property. Traded in through RCI so we got a studio for our usual 1 bedroom. Kitchen area was a bit smaller than we are use to, but workable. My one complaint was no bathtub. But overall the room was quite comfortable. If we come back I will try for a 1 bedroom.We did sit through the timeshare presentation to get a discount on a jeep tour we booked through the concierge. The 90 min stretched to 3.5 hours!!!! They toured us through the two and three bedroom rooms so we could see they were very nice. But it was a very long drawn out presentation.We went in the winter. One of the nice things is that we use the hot tub in the evening which was kept warm, even though the temperature outside was below 17 degrees F. The pool is also kept heated, but we did not venture in.What a beautiful resort! We are Diamond owners so I consider ourselves lucky to have access to such a beautiful resort. From the customer service to the amenities, I feel like you can't ask for anything more! One of the best things we enjoyed on this visit was the grills on site near our room & I notice about a dozen people loveing the hot tubs next to the grills! If you get a chance to here, do it! I'm already planning our next stay!It is a good resort, but (unless you have a room with a view, maybe) nothing to write home about. Services was reasonably accommodating, the did move us to a quieter room . BTW, if you are sensitive to noise, do NOT stay on the 1st floor!Location was great - easy to Sedona restaurants and to all the hiking. Everything was clean and functional, just what you expect at a time share resort. Their sales pitches weren't as numerous or as aggressive as we've seen in the past at other places, so nothing to complain about here.Ah, yes, one thing: their wifi (by AT&T) is sloooooow and barely working, pretty much anywhere in the resort. Just assume no wifi :-)I stayed in a studio with no extra rooms. Upon arrival during check-in my girlfriend was bugged by the concierge trying to force you to pay for more things you don't really need. Thank god she is pretty outgoing and put them in their place pretty quickly. That was the end of that problem. Apparently wifi costs money because it is AT&T wifi. Somehow the lady who checked us in have us a code for free wifi for the weekend. Once we reached the room we were very impressed to how how nice the room was and the amenities that were offered. We had every appliance except an oven. The room was very quaint and perfect for a couple on a vacation. There was a nice flat screen TV which is always nice. The bathroom was great and offered a shower with a sink and toilet. There is no bath though. No couples baths on vacation. Sorry guys. We were on the second floor and there was a balcony. The view was great from it. There is two pools here. One is an adult pool that offers a nice spa. Everything was quite impressive. I would definitely come back.Sunset suite is FABULOUS. Clean, new, luxurious, comfortable. Huge jacuzzi, huge shower, fireplace, patio. Just a very comfortable accommodation!Met my kids here to swim and jacuzzi. Had a great time. The area was clean and equipped with a clean restroom. The pool was a bit cold but the jacuzzi was perfect. They also had a small pool for toddlers. I stayed with them for about 3 hours. Never had a problem w/ management. They were very visible, nice security. Made us all feel safe having them drive around in their golf carts.While in Tucson, I decided to attend a conference in Sedona: I was under the gun, as hotels were booking up quickly for the event. After a very arduous search for a decent, and affordable hotel, I decided upon the Sedona Summit Resort. I booked through hotels.com. I thought they were offering a good deal for the 5-night stay, and loved that they were offering a visa gift card 'rebate,' which made it much more affordable. I was told to stay at a hotel on 89A, but I am really glad I chose to stay here. I like that it was located just before the center of town. Less traffic, less noise. Reviews suggested it could get quite loud, so I requested a room with a mountain view and that was in a quieter area, near the adult pool. They werent able to give me a room with a view (I imagine they save those for their current and prospective time share owners, and also for the bigger suites they have. Despite that my room was really nice! Turned out it didnt matter about the view b/c I was kept so busy at the conference I never had a moment to take the hotel view in. (I more than made up for that on the last day, with my own personal vortex tour- which was awesome- but that's another story!)It's a huge property! They have 5 pools, 2 infinity jacuzzis- 1 with a rocks and a waterfall built around it- and at least 1 other jacuzzi in the adult pool area. (I went on my own personal jacuzzi tour too. :)I loved that the adult pool area was truly honored as 'adults only.' It was much quieter, more tranquil and darker. The stargazing from the adult pool area was pretty spectacular. As one of my favorite pasttimes this was pretty cool! I didnt enjoy how rowdy the kids were in the jacuzzis, or how the parents were allowing them to splash and jump around the other patrons. I think it's important for families to have a fun time, but their fun shouldnt come at the cost of mine. Since those areas had the nicest hottubs, I had to endure it. I was actually a bit appalled by one of the patrons who was throwing his son across the hottub very close other people/me, and then teaching him that having a good time screaming and playing was an indication that he was behaving like a little 'B-I-T-C-H.' Yes, he spelled it out- probably to protect his son from hearing the curse word, but still, why are you saying that at all to a 7-yr old?! So, I wasnt impressed with the demeanor and behavior of some patrons in the family areas.I stayed in a studio room: it was very clean and modern. The little patio was cute too- although I never had time to use it. The bathroom was big! The couch was a bit odd.Maintenance was very quick to respond and help, late night, when I was having repeated problems with my tv, which I greatly appreciated. I love that the rooms have a kitchen- they have everything, except an oven. Stovetop, yes, but an oven, no. And I was missing icecube trays, which was a bit annoying, but easily got some when I ran into housekeeping.Regarding the time share facet- Yes, they want to find new timeshare prospects. However, it's pretty easy to step around this. Tripadvisor reviews suggest avoiding picking up the welcome package/gift- which I did. It was basically a bottle of water, so no loss there. And I unplugged the cord from the phone. Problem solved! They only left one message: I was not hounded at all. It was a non-issue.But the 'time share' element is part of the reason they dont clean everyday: it isnt a standard hotel. They come once, mid-stay and they tell you that upfront, upon check-in. It's not a surprise.Complimentary internet in the lobby, available all night. Complimentary coffee also, but I did not partake and a whole calendar of activities to participate in for kids and adults- many charge an additional fee.Cell phone signal isnt great in Sedona, but that's par for the course.I enjoyed my stay and wish I'd had more day time to explore the grounds and hit all the pools. My only two real gripes: 1st- that check out is 10am and non-negotiable w/o a late charge. 2nd- that they close the pools at 10pm. I'm glad it made things quiet, but there just arent any other lounge chairs to sit, or lie, on. (They are all locked up in the pool areas.) I wish they had some lounges or relaxation areas (in addition to bbq areas), where I could recline at night and stargaze, watch for meteors, etc. I would stay here again if I was looking for an affordable place, just outside the heart of the town. Definitely! ...and if I was rolling in some bucks and splurging, I would stay at the Enchantment Resort near Boynton Canyon! You can stay at the pool area all night there and it's very dark! :)Dont forget to visit the 4 vortex's. Detailed walking trail/vortex maps available at a local new age store, just a few miles down the road from the Sedona Summit.My girlfriends and I stayed here for a ladies get away weekend and mostly it was perfect.... great location, easy access, clean rooms and fun pools. The staff was friendly but there were a few things that could be improved easily to make a good experience great... Don't add in 11 fees to your cost. Just add them in the quote that you give at the beginning, I left feeling nickel and dimed instead of happy with my stay with you. We were threatened with all kinds of other fees that could be applied if we did not follow the instructions. We are married women in our thirties... not singles looking for Vegas that got lost in Sedona. Treat your customers with some respect. If you are going to market this as a VRBO, you need to leave more that the worlds smallest salt and pepper shaker and one load of laundry detergent and ONE extra roll of toilet paper. We were not sure how to use the great kitchen with so little to cook with. The whole point of paying more than hotel prices is to get more than a hotel offers, so step up your home-away from away game and stock your kitchens with at least the bare necessities.If you're looking for a room with no view, thin walls, a 10am checkout, a surly front desk staff, and animals making scratching noises in the AC, then Sedona Summit Resort is the place for you! But really, we made a priceline reservation, paying nearly full price. We stayed on a Wednesday (midweek, so not so busy, right...right?) checked in around 4pm, and were promptly met with a front desk clerk who seemed to loathe her job/life/generally everything.. Super! We get to our room, and hey, it's nice. Definitely not $120-nice, but I digress- the view out of our room is of the lovely maintenance garage/staff on their smoke breaks/golf carts full of laundry/the units across the way. Cool. We go back to the front desk and politely ask if we may have a room with something of a view. Surly girl informs us that there are no rooms with a view left, you get what you get and you don't throw a fit! Well, I'll admit she didn't really say that last part, but it felt that way. Ha. Ok. So we decide whatevs, yo- we'll make the most of it. The room, upon first trial seemed at least quiet. Right? Wrong! Swiss Family Robinson is staying next door (in one of the rooms with a view, no less), they arrived/stomped/cartwheeled/cirque du soleil-ed with nary a care for the noise that traveled through those incredibly thin walls. Sweet. Fast forward to bedtime. Swiss Family has ceased making noise, we turn on the fan for air movement, and it has some sort of issue causing it to creak and groan. Yay! In the morning, we call for a late-check out. Most hotels I've stayed at allow this, and alllow about a noon or 1pm check out. No problem, right? Not here! Your late check out is 11am! Because "normal" checkout time is 10am and there is "Someone waiting for your room." And the piece de resistance? In the morning, we heard a small animal of some sort through the AC vent. Must have been a lizard or small rodent. As we got into our car and prepared to leave, several staff members appeared and walked towards our building carrying what appeared to be some sort of extermination-equipment. Bottom line? Next time we'll skip it.Me and my fiancee enjoyed our 7 night stay here. The check in process was extremely slow after our 2 hour commute from Scottsdale even though it was VIP. We declined the timeshare presentation and the concierge never asked again which was nice. Our studio view wasn't too great but that's no biggie, we took a walk every night around the neighborhood and saw greats views of the red rocks. Jacuzzi was nice at night. Only bummer is sedona is a sleepy town at night lacking nightlife for us twenty something's. But I would stay here again, clean and a beautiful resort that I got a great timeshare deal on.The staff was very friendly and helpful during check in. The concierge desk gives you a welcome package with a map and postcards and gives suggestions of places to go, activities to participate in, and great restaurants. However, they will try to sell you a sales pitch to purchase a timeshare but the lady concierge was very friendly. The Studio Mesa room was a very nice and comfortable size. Actually, very spacious. There's a small dining area to eat. Separate seating area with coffee table. The bed is a full size bed so it wouldn't be very comfortable for couples. The couch was a bit worn on the armrests. The suite has a Sharp flat screen TV with DVD player and large sized refrigerator with dishwasher. The shower was very large. The bathroom is huge. The entire suite was very clear and appliances and fixtures looked very new and modern.They offer a fair amount of activities on the premises. Resort includes jacuzzis, pools, and laundry.I wasn't able to get any cellphone reception from my room. There's ample parking for the different buildings. Lights in the parking lot gives some security at night. WiFi is available at a charge through AT&T.
review_content_80: Love the layout of the 1 bedroom we stayed at. Having kids in the living room on their comfortable sofa bed, they had such a ball. And it's so nice to have our own space away while kids enjoyed themselves. I loved to use their huge pool with the water falls and their jacuzzi every night. Check in and check out was very easy and they were so pleasant and accommodating. I would definitely stay here again.Our unit is a studio unit. Just the two of us so there really is enough room. But I would have preferred the bed in a separate room. But since we went thru RCI, this is all they give. Checking in was good. Even let us check in a little early. We did attend a breakfast to listen to the timeshare talk. Our gentleman shared with us some things we didn't know. Which was good. Then a sales rep got us. A lovely young lady. Not pushy at all. We were very pleased with that. Then she gave us to another man. He was pleasant but insistent. Then he brought another man.....long story short. We were able to leave finally without my husband being furious.The first night we were here, no telephone service & only 3 channels on TV. None that I wanted to watch. We called the front desk on our cell, they assured repair man would come. Late next morning I went to the front, again they would send someone . Finally we say an employee in the parking lot & he said he'd take a look. He fixed our issues.Bed is comfy, bathroom a nice size. Kitchen for a studio is adequate . Accommodations are great. Wouldn't stay here again just because of the sales force.We booked a two bedroom through RCI and was pleasantly surprised to vacation at such a nice property. A little hard to find, since their are no signs to the resort and a very small sign for check-in.
