We read the other reviews about the timeshare volchers at check-in, so we avoided the concierge desk and phone calls our entire stay. The two bedroom was gorgeous. We were upgraded at check in and thoroughly enjoyed our accommodations. We would stay here again and recommend to a friend. The pack and play was a nice touch for my infant.This organization has no idea what customer service means. The "concierge" is a joke and she gets bitchy if you try to avoid the timeshare sales pitch. She literally chased me out of the building to try to get me to talk to her about going to the sales pitch.If you stay here, tell them you are interested in buying- you might get a better room and a good view.I asked if we could check in a couple of hours early. Sure, but your room is not ready. So the answer is no? We'll call you when it's ready; they didn't. Housekeeping came one day but did not clean the shower or take the old linens, one of which was on the floor! We met some really gloomy pissy people. There are many choices in Sedona and I will definitely choose someplace else next time.My family & I have stayed here three times in the past few months. We've just discovered the beauty of Sedona and we love coming back which makes the 4-5 hour drive from Las Vegas an easy one. The three times we've stayed at The Summit has been pleasant & unproblematic. The staff has always been friendly. The pools are heated. The rooms have been great! The layout for us is especially functional for my family. We had the 2 master bedroom suite separated by the kitchen/living room. The grand parents stayed in one master, we stayed in the other, and the kids stayed on the pullout couch in the living room. All 3 times we stayed on the bottom floor, so our room backed up to the green and desert landscape, which is beautiful. We will be going back next month for another several day stay.We purchased a Living Social deal for two free nights. We were able to redeem in March. Checked in late Friday and had no problems. We were prepared to turn down the hard sales pitch we heard so much about but they did not bug us at check in. Room was much nicer than expected. Big size, full kitchen, perfect for two for the weekend. Spa and pool was really nice. We did receive a call Saturday asking if we wanted to see the timeshare presentation. We respectfully declined and they didn't push. All in all it was a great weekend! We drove up from Phoenix so had the car to drive into downtown Sedona. We gave it 3 stars for location - it's a bit off the main road and if you were anticipating walking you will be disappointed. A vehicle is needed to get around.We are time share owners with Diamond through another property. Diamond now owns this property. This is the classiest property we have visited in the history of our time share experiences. The quality of the interior decorations were superior to any other facilities I have enjoyed elsewhere. The room was also well maintained. I could not find one fault with it. It is a beautiful, contemporary accommodation. The property is located on the southern end of Sedona, about 15 minutes' drive north of Cottonwood. It seemed well kept, with killer views.Check in was fast for us, as we hit a quiet time. I can see how it gets really busy sometimes. This is a large property, so they handle a lot of checking in's and checking out's! The lobby offers a wonderful free coffee machine, complete with liquid cream and various sweeteners on the side. That is a generous perk. Amusing aside: the resort used to have an espresso machine, I hear, but the employees gave it such a work out that they had to abandon that perk. But it shows that the mangement really wants to give a good experience.We enjoyed the "turn on the switch" fake fireplace that delivered subtle heat and ambiance, without the mess or expense of firewood. Our room had a Jaccuzzi type tub and a separate tiled shower. It contained a full kitchen with extensive granite counters, oven and a sizeable refrigerator. Certain rooms also contain washers and dryers, including ours (yay!). It is very nice to have that option. The Summit even provides laundry soap. Thoughtful touch. This room had beautifully tiled floors, complete with inlaid multi-color designs, and carpet in the living room and bedroom.This property contains many pools; the one near us was heated nicely. It was quiet and peaceful in our room, despite the full occupancy. We used the fitness center, which you access through the guest laundry room (that fooled us for a few rounds of the building!).Their equipment is minimal but of excellent quality. (I think they use CYBEX brand here, and it worked well and covered most of the key body parts -- OK, I mean muscle groups). They had two treadmills, and two ellipticals. I think there is a locker room to store belongings next to the fitness room. I didn't explore that. The resort offers some activities during the week. We did not take advantage of that as we had our own itinerary planned.TIP: Internet in Sedona is not the most powerful and speediest. Plan for that. This property offers internet at a charge, but don't count on using it for major graphics or video usage. The speed won't accommodate it very well. Our Verizon cell phone worked OK-reception was normally OK with a few snatches of phrases cutting out. TIP 2: If you walk up Navoti Dr. and turn right (away from the street light onto 89A), you will eventually encounter a hiking trail. It's on your right, right near a dirt parking lot. This property sits on the edge of development, so it's a great location to find a quiet space. Bring your hiking shoes, hat, sunscreen and sense of adventure! Sedona has something for everyone.I'd give it a lower rating if I could, but let's see what you think:* Made reservations 10 months in advance* Called ahead a few weeks in advance to confirm a late arrival* Upon arrival, the room wasn't ready. Waited around for over a half hour to check in. While waiting, my wife politely asked if there was any chance to get a room with a view, the response was "you're lucky to get a room at all". Seriously? Who says that?* Was finally told "good news and bad news, you can have a room but you need to move again the next day." Dragged our luggage up/down the stairs, got to the room, went in, and there are people sleeping in the room. Nice. * Dragged luggage back to car, drove back to desk area, to discover that Diamond International overbooks by 5% and there are no more rooms. After another 30-45 minutes, we were told to go to a motel/resort called Poco Diablo across town for the night and come back tomorrow. Finally got to bed after 4:00 am. I should add that this was on our wedding anniversary - not quite what we had in mind.* Next day finally got checked in at Sedona Summit. Called the general manager, Mario Gonzales. He apologized and asked why I wasn't happy with Poco Diablo - wow. I didn't swap out my Hawaii timeshare to hang out in a motel room. He then sent up two $25 gift vouchers for a mediocre restaurant also on the other side of town (Steaks and Sticks). Upon reiterating my displeasure, Mario said he'd see what else he could do. We never heard back although we did receive a gift basket with a small bag of doritos, six small oreos, and a DVD rental coupon worth $3.00. Not only will I never go to Sedona Summit again, but I wouldn't consider any Diamond International resort. Beyond the mishandling of this situation, the accommodations were simply average - nothing special. The fitness center has but two ellipticals and two treadmills, the lobby is closed for renovations, and there's a bit of noise between rooms. Also, they shut off the water to our timeshare for a few hours, though I suppose those things happen. There is no restaurant within walking distance, and as others have mentioned, the cell coverage is spotty and the pay as you go internet service is terrible (over 1000ms ping latency when it works at all). Don't go if you need to work.I will say that one bright spot is that the maintenance staff was friendly, quick with a wave and a smile as they putter around on their golf carts. But that's about the best I can say for the place. In short, you will do better elsewhere.We spoke with the manager, Michael Pena, and we discussed the issues which occurred on our visit. After we talked, he offered us a three day comp and promised our stay would be very different from our first. We'll have to wait 14 days for the certificate and then book our stay. We'll see what happens.Beautiful place - we had a two bedroom suite with a stunning view. Beds were super comfy, bathrooms were luxurious. We had no maid service because we were only there for four days - but hey! That's cool with me. Kitchen was very well stocked. Pool was great.Only four stars because you have to pay for Wi-fi, which I felt was a bunch of BS personally....only other part is it is part of a timeshare organization - I HATE timeshare presentations. BUT, the young man we had was actually pretty darn good - no hard sell. Just straight up told him I've got two in college and a mortgage payment - he backed off immediately. Just showed us the property and pretty much just shot the breeze with us the rest of the time - HOWEVER, I don't think this is the norm. I think my husband and I just got lucky....it's a time share/hotel property. avoid the "concierge" they'll just try to pitch you on the time share. outside of a pay day loan or leasing a car, one of the dumbest financial decisions one can make.the rooms were nice. very clean. kitchenette in the studio was perfect. you have to request a cleaning if you stay less than three nights. would stay here again if the price was right.We had a week in January (2013) and would have loved to stay longer! We pre-paid a promotional 'deal' through SkyAuction.com upgrading it to a one bedroom. That was a GREAT decision because we enjoyed a full kitchen and a stacked washer/dryer unit.Check in is 4 PM and there were LOTS of people flooding the desks. The desk clerks were very organized, processed us quickly and we were out of there in no time. When handed the key cards, I was told to 'join [name] so I could get in on the VIP card ' or something like that. Having read these YELP reviews helped me to know that that meant the presentation for their time share 'opportunity', so I politely said 'no thank you' and kept walking. There was a very short, friendly 'pursuit', but I just kept walking back to the car, and our vacation began from that moment forward.I'll tell you: these units are gorgeous. There is a LOT of room for two people (one in the bedroom, the other on the foldout couch...both very comfy), the bathroom was HUGE with hi-end tile designs, bubbling spa-tub, and a hammered copper sink...very nice. Great lighting, nice fans to keep it well aired, etc. Starter-set of complimentary shampoo/soap (bring a shower cap). All VERY clean.The kitchen had everything we needed (except, get this: a funnel, which I could have used more than once but just improvised): cookware, glass/dishes/bakeware, soft supplies (dish soap, paper towels, sponges). And VERY upscale appliances (Cuisinart everything). In fact, it was so complete that we decided to cook ALL our meals in the unit but for one dinner out, and that saved us a TON of money.Our cell phones didn't work in the unit, so we made sure to make our calls while out. TIP: give others your telephone and extension in the unit and they can call you with no charges applied. Internet? I got as far as seeing the warning that it wasn't a safe connection (from the unit) and stopped. Others say there is a fee...The combined loss of outside, easy communications rendered an isolation that is good for some and others not. I'd opt to have both as an option (for free) and go silent as I'd choose.Would I look into another visit with Sedona Summit? Absolutely. The staff was stellar and we were left alone to contact them if we needed them. We did twice for very minor things, and they responded IMMEDIATELY. We had GREAT service.If and when I am in the market for a time share, it's very likely that I'd look into Diamond Resorts first...just based on this 'introductory' visit.Very clean and great amenities. Service is very fast. Only problem is that the beds are very hard.Second time staying at the resort, we are Diamond owners & absolutely love this place, the staff is very welcoming, and the location is perfect on the edge of town, mins to everything but the views of the red rock mesas are incredible. I highly recommend staying here whether its a couple or large family, this resort is made to accommodate your needs.After a week at this resort, I feel compelled to share that our room was truly "jaw-dropping". I have never stayed in such an elegant, luxurious room even after years of corporate travel. We stayed in a Sunset 2 bedroom Suite that had to be over 1200 sq. ft. Everything was beautifully designed, maintained in like new condition and very clean.The staff responded to requests we made for minor things with lightening speed. In particular, I'd recognize Eli for demonstrating the kind of customer focused spirit a guest would hope for. We spent about half our time at the resort and half our time away on day trips. Plenty to do in Sedona.I would "wish" for free WiFi instead of the $30 per device, though Internet access is offered for free in the lobby. It also would have been ideal to have a simple diner on the premises. This is definitely a stay I hope to repeat!This place was better than good but not great. We had no cell phone service in our room or on that side of town (AT&T) and we would have had to pay for wifi but we already have uverse account.We were very happy when we arrived, but it went down hill fast. First they charge for internet that is so slow that it is almost useless. Took 3 days to fix the t.v. The employees and the service they provided was excellent. Here's the stopper. Don't go to the time share presentation. After 3 hours and 30 mins. with four sales people it was enough. I have been to many time share presentations and have never seen a harder sales group. They gang up on you and never let go. It was a night mare and ruin our view of Diamond resorts forever. We travel 8 weeks of the year and could not believe this was really happening. the people that give this resort 5 stars are owners that want you to go. They gave up and bought it and want you to join them to keep this place running. Maintenance fees are $1200 a year. Where could you stay for a week on just this fee?I was a little scared about booking this place after reading about the reviews on yelp, but luckily we didn't encounter any of the time-share or concierge problems. The only drawback of this place was the unit we stayed in was SUPER hard to find!! Other than that, the place was awesome!! We got the 1 bedroom room and we arrived to a clean & well stocked place. Even the kitchen was well stocked, which gave us the option of staying in instead of fighting the crowd at the restaurants, a big plus for us since we had our newborn with us. The bed was super comfortable...even the pull out sofa bed was comfy. Definitely a place we would consider staying at again.Had a bad experience here sadly. First trip to Arizona and we booked our stay here. First of all the office was very chaotic and we noticed many others complaining as well. When we finally got our keys after an hour of waiting....we walk into our room only to find out that it was currently someone else's room. Immediately we went back and told the office staff and wanted a refund because we didn't want the same to happen to us if we stayed their! Looked like the property would have been nice had it have been run better.I very much enjoyed my stay at this hotel/condo. I am not a timeshare owner, but found a great deal online for a studio for $44/night and the room was WAY worth it! It had a giant bathroom, nice sized kitchen, bed with extra pillows and comfy couch! The property is HUGE so it was kind of hard to find the reception and our room after dark. We managed to escape the timeshare sales by not going over to concierge to "pick up a parking pass." We did notice that they left us a few messages to call them, and once even called at 10:30 at night (wtf?!) but we ignored it the whole time and were fine.The room was a great deal for what we paid and I would do it again if the opportunity came up!Things to note:- There is no housekeeping service unless you stay over 4 days.- You are expected to wash any dishes you mess (there IS a dishwasher in the room!) - The fridge makes a little bit of noise, but its a white noise that you can sleep through. - Lots of extra towels and pillows and blankets.

review_content: My wife and I loved staying at this hotel. The Frank Ghery room was perfect. Comfortable, clean, affordable. We will be back.Not bad...This is a comfortable, well-situated hotel in Sedona. We booked this particular location because the price was right and it had decent reviews.The decor is a bit kitschy - the architecture mimics the pueblo-style and the interior decor reminds me of a Mexican restaurant - but the beds are comfortable and there are fireplaces inside the rooms. The actual ventilation system was pretty annoying - it was loud and would waver from cold to hot randomly, leaving us boiling hot or frozen solid throughout the night.The staff are really friendly and happy, which is a nice way to be welcomed. They did not have any local maps though; we were given a less-than-stellar copy machine copy of a map, which did the trick, I suppose, but wasn't super helpful as it was kind of blurry and did not show the smaller street names.The bathroom is tiny and my friend said it creeped her out (like the movie Psycho) but at least it was clean, which is honestly the most important part.Beyond disappointed!  We were literally left out in the cold...We were en route from Santa Fe, NM to Palm Springs, CA and decided to stay overnight in Sedona instead pushing through our 12 hours road trip.  We booked a room at Southwest Inn at Sedona via Hotel Tonight app because of the great discount and the property looked beautiful and comfortable from the pictures.We arrived around 11:30pm and there was a note on the lobby stating it was Closed... And if you have or need to make a reservation, to please call the phone number provided.  We called the phone number and the man that answered said he didn't see our reservation but to go ahead and take a room and he'll see us in the morning.  He went ahead and gave us a room number and advised us that there is a key under the doormat.  There was no key to be found and the lights were on inside as if it was already occupied.  We told the man and we double-checked.  He apologized and suggested we book a room at the hotel/motel across the street because there's no one in their lobby.  We couldn't believe what just happened and ended up booking another room at a different hotel.Just out of curiosity, we checked out Southwest Inn on Yelp and it shows they're open 24/7... False.The Southwest Inn is a quaint, one-of-a-kind place in a nice location with very good views of the gorgeous rock formations from most rooms. Service was good, the breakfast was good, and the place was clean and nice looking. Only problems we experienced we're minor ones: the little gas fireplace was not in good working order and the fire had to be manually ignited each time we wanted to use it, the ceiling fan switch didn't work so the fan was on full blast all the time, the chain inside the toilette tank broke at one point (making the toilette unflushable)  so we fixed it ourselves. The one thing that was a bit troublesome is that the office totally shuts down at 9pm, and the instructions are to call the number guests are given after hours and the owner will respond immediately. We tried that when the ceiling fan malfunctioned, and nobody returned our call. Next morning, the guy at the front desk assigned somebody to repair the fan and it was taken care of.None of the minor issues ruined our stay by any means, and we might even stay at the  Southwest Inn some other time. For one thing, the little imperfections we experienced kind of reminded us of the hundreds of privately owned Pensiones we stayed in while living in Europe, especially in Italy. Thanks to the Southwest Inn, we were reminded of our former life as tourists in Europe...which is certainly not a bad thing! Mike O - AtlantaI stayed there during the Memorial Day weekend.  Kenny was the front desk guy, and he was particularly helpful, professional, friendly, informative, personable.  My room was on the second floor with a view of the mountains.  I could sit on the balcony and marvel at the wonder of nature.  Ahh.   Such peace and quiet.  Too bad Sedona has not buried its telephone wires and poles.   Interfered with the view of the mountains.   The room has a gas fireplace.   A nice touch.  It would have been romantic if I had someone romantic with me.   Plenty of room for me to roam in the room.   King-size bed came with lovely duvets and shams.   Very plush and comfy.  Bathroom was clean and had plenty of counter space.  The price included breakfast, which was yummy.   Enjoyed sitting on the patio in the breakfast room as well.   An even better view of the mountains.   Would I stay there again?   Absolutely!!   I would say the only downside was it was hard to use the wi-fi cause I was at the end of the resort.  And when the gas fireplace initially came on, it made a loud banging sort of noise.   Rather startling at first.Stayed at the Amara twice and loved it however this place for the money was great. Very clean, close to the Boynton Canyon trails. I like it quiet at night, was nervous when I pulled up and saw Inn so close to 89. Ended up sleeping with the door open to enjoy the cool fresh air, road noise was minimal! Breakfast was great. Sorry Amara, love your place but I will come back to Southwest Inn!Stayed here after reading the reviews and wanting to stay in a pet friendly hotel with our small dog. We have been to Sedona several times before to relax and get away.  Well you can't do that at this place because it is right on the highway and the traffic is super loud all night long.Room size was nice however the fake fireplace is on the whole time via the pilot light and while there is a fridge the rooms do not have a microwave. Bed was comfortable and bathroom was a good size. Nice to have a balcony but it was right on the parking lot and street. So again very noisy !Breakfast was a joke- frozen food that you had warm up and horrible coffee. Signs all over the room letting you know you could purchase their coffee cups and robes. The place is very dated and needs maintenance . The light a over our room door outside never worked so we had a hard time getting our key in the door. They use a usb type key- who wants to carry that around  when you are hiking.Staff was friendly enough but we have had an overall better experience at other places including a great hampton inn down the street . Won't be back.Private patio and jetted tub were amazing! Very friendly and attentive staff! Received a welcome letter before my stay and a thank you letter afterwards(Including a discount coupon for a future visit to share with friends and family!) Loved the knowledge around must do ' s while in Sedona.  The staff here genuinely care if you enjoy your stay! Thank you Southwest Inn! You have a loyal guest every time we travel to Sedona!I needed to find a place to stay in Sedona and after reading a bunch of reviews on Yelp choose the SW Inn.   I stayed for 3 nights around X-mas time.The +'s+Room was tastefully decorated and spotless!  The fireplace was super a pleasant surprise and good feature during those cold winter nights.  +Shower gel and soap smelled great. +I paid $140 for a second floor unit which I thought was very reasonable.+Free wifi.+Staff was very friendly. A few -'s-Slightly more road noise than I would like.  I'm pretty anal about quiet tho. -I'm a big breakfast person (because I go on long hiking trips) and although SW Inn included one with my room... I ended up going elsewhere after my first morning.  The simple, free, continental affair was well presented and  fine for some.. but I'd rather pay a little extra and get eggs & potatoes. Overall, I thought this was a really cute and reasonable place to stay.  Can't say i loved Sedona itself (not enough rural hiking for me) but if I do come back I'd stay here again.I had no idea what to expect when I booked my stay at Southwest Inn (the website needs a redo), but it was across the street from my intended destination (the Sedona Marathon) and the only reasonably priced hotel in Sedona that welcomed my labrador. But the amazing customer service, by the owner himself, when booking the room, was refreshing. He even tried to direct me to running resources in Sedona! Also, when I called for advice on local restaurants, the new concierge at the front desk was likewise extremely helpful and knowledgeable. Then when I got to my room, I was pleasantly greeted by the charming touches--a fireplace, a jetted tub in the room, beautiful white comforter, tasteful art, a microfiber face towel, flat-screen TV.It also turned out to be walkable to some restaurants and on the side of town I prefer to enjoy when in Sedona. The breakfast was better than what you find free at most chain hotels. My husband had what he reported was an amazing home-cooked vegetarian burrito, and I had the option of granola instead of the usual sugary cereals. The public rooms were cozy and charming as well. While I don't usually go for the rustic bed-and-breakfast, this turned out to be an amazing, cozy value, and one I definitely plan to patronize the next time I travel to Sedona.Others have more eloquently reviewed this place so I don't have a lot to add.  Great customer service, great vibe, great breakfast burrito.I reserved a spot here based on Yelp reviews and because I got a good deal on a room. At first, I was put off that the hotel was so far away from the main area, but it turns out it worked just perfectly. "Inn" is the correct term because it didn't feel like a hotel at all. It had a very bed and breakfast feel with rooms complete with a big bathroom, shower and also a jacuzzi tub, fireplace and a comfy bed. It even had a little semi-private porch area for our room. Also, the little things like bath salts for the tub, fluffy bathrobes and bottled water really make a difference to making a stay more comfortable and enjoyable. The rooms were clean and this may sound weird, but smelled great - like a spa almost.The breakfast area is up the stairs from the lobby with a great view and had options including Belgian waffles and breakfast burritos (which were really good). It was set up sort of cafe style, also with two computers off to the side for those wanting to check email or print off documents. They have a free concierge on-site, which we didn't have time to take advantage of, but they have plenty of brochures and magazines for visitors.There is plenty of parking and you can walk to a pizza place on the corner and a bar across the street for a drink. Sedona is a pretty area, wish we could've stayed longer. I was pleasantly surprised and impressed with our stay here.They have got to be kidding! This would be a three star place if they advertised as what they are, but they try to make it sound like a "boutique" hotel or bed and breakfast. It is a nice motel, like best western or a large chain property.The fireplace was the type you flick the switch and gas comes up from behind fake logs.The spa tub was small and the jets did not hit my shoulders.The outdoor spa was slightly warmer than luke.The breakfast was horrid. The burritos they raved about online were frozen and you popped them into the microwave. Even the hardboiled eggs were frozen. I swear this to you.The bed was comfortable and things were clean. They did give some bath salts to add to the tub. That was a nice touch. But for the money, stay somewhere else.We stayed here April 2014-- SO AWESOME! We were not expecting how nice considering dogs were allowed-- but were surprised with nice CLEAN white down comforters, spacious bathroom w/ great lighting, huge jacuzzi in the bathroom & cozy fire place. Morning breakfast was good, fresh & clean!! 5-stars for a little Inn from me!!--(the biggest neat-nick & hotel critic!) Would absolutely come back for a romantic get away with my sweetie & pup!!Our stay was for mostly hiking and sight seeing so we knew we wanted a friendly and cozy place to recoup each day.  This was a great value at about $220 per night for a suite with a fireplace.  Separate sitting room with a master bedroom that had a balcony starring at the red rocks up by Devils Bridge!  Breakfast each morning was included but simple.  If you go for coffee, oatmeal and maybe a bagel or make your own Belgian waffle it rocks!!  Staff is friendly and can suggest many good hiking trails to get going.  And the pizza place on the corner has excellent pizza and craft brews within 100ft of your hotel door!!  Will stay again!!!My girlfriend and I stayed here as our first stop on a cross country road trip. We came at a very quiet time and were thrilled to have such nice accommodations. The bed was extremely comfortable and I really enjoyed having late night access to the jacuzzi. Prices are very reasonable for all the hotel provides.I look forward to returning to Sedona and will definitely stay here again.We stayed here in early November. It was a lovely place, with comfy terry robes and a complimentary breakfast. The people in the office are extremely nice, very congenial and so helpful. As a first time visitor to Sedona, I feel fortunate to have stayed in the comfortable room with a large bathroom with very nice soaps,wi-fi, and fireplace. the bed and bedding were very nice and comfortable. Nice to be on the second floor and enjoy the view.We spent two nights here. We picked out this place because of the reviews on Yelp and the price. It was cheaper than other hotels around the area. On our way there, we passed by the other hotels near the main st where all the stores were located. We were pretty disappointed that this inn was further away, and was actually regretting choosing a hotel that was further out. When we got to the inn, the guy at the counter was very nice and welcoming. Showed us places to go eat and visit and gave us recommendations. The usb-like key for the rooms were pretty cool too. Since we weren't expecting much out of the place, we were all pleasantly surprised at how clean and cozy the room was. The bathroom were stocked with travel size toiletries and also had a single coffee machine with coffee pods and tea. Little things like complimentary water bottles (2) and robes really gave us an impression that the inn really cares about the guests' experience. The linens were clean and the interior design of the room was unique and special. The breakfast has selections like waffles, toast, burritos, eggs, fruits, cereal, yogurt, fresh coffee, orange juice, etc. We thought it was only a tiny bit above average. Since its complimentary, we really can't complain. The pool and jacuzzi is pretty small, but its better than nothing. We were truly impressed with this place, but most of the credit needs to be given to the housekeeper for our room- Gabriella. There is nothing better than coming back to a clean well kept room after a long day of hiking. We usually stay at large chain 4-star hotels, but Sedona West Inn has the best housekeeping in my opinion. Even the breakfast area was well kept. The nice lady who takes care of the breakfast area always came out to check if the place was clean. I guess since this place is small, they can give better customer service to their guests. I really recommend getting the upper floor rooms because you get a view from the balcony. Even though they are facing the parking lot, if you look to the side, you can see view of the mountain. The bottom rooms have zero views.So why not a 5 star? This might not matter to some people, but here are my reasons:-Internet was somewhat slow. But it might be the normal speed for the area.-Lobby closes at 9 pm (which means no access to microwave after 9)-Air conditioner pretty loud-Small pool and Jacuzzi-Bathtub seemed hollow and creaked every time I moved my feet. -Not a walking distance to main shopping/dining area. (Wasn't a big deal after visiting the stores)-The view from the balcony wasn't impressive.Anyways, it's not really a big deal, I would give it a 4.5 if I can. This place will be the place to stay for all our family if we ever go back to Sedona. I would recommend them to anyone. Just go there without any expectations and get the second floor room. You will be pleasantly surprised!Awesome, arrived via other yelp reviews. They showed us the rooms they had available before we signed on. Once we got our upstairs suite at a discounted price they got reservations for us at a really nice local establishment and also told us where some amazing hikes were. The bed was super comfy, clean rooms, big bathrooms, fireplace in living room. They even left the jacuzzi open late for us only asking that we lock it up when done. For the price compared to other local establishments it can't be beat. Oh the continental breakfast in the morning was great too! Great views highly recommend!This was a seamlessly beautiful experience. I reserved online, and check in was smooth and easy. The lady at the check in even made sure that I read the agreement about no smoking before I signed the document (extra plus points to make sure I understand what I'm signing). I booked a two room suite (Hopi) which was simply HUGE for the price. The bathroom was also big, and was self contained (unlike in other suites I've been in), with two sinks (perfect for couples). The room was lovely. The gas fireplace was a definitely romantic. The bed was a king size, nice and soft with great linens (nice touch with the copper borders guys). It's a great building, and a great hotel. We only stayed one night, so didn't get to check out the spa or the pool, but they looked very clean. Keep on doing what you're doing guys!
review_content_20: My wife and I travel here often as we are building a home and we always stay here at the Inn. It is clean, comfortable, well maintained and the pool is nice as is the hot tub. The rooms have a small fireplace and jetted tub, as well. The room has free wifi at a decent speed. They offer a very nice complimentary breakfast which includes, self-made waffles, cereal, juice, milk, toast and a terrific breakfast burrito. It is located above the office and has a nice patio that you can enjoy the morning air. The front desk folks are always thoughtful, helpful and accommodating. What really makes this stand out for us, however, is the price. Check around and see. You will find that to get the same level of accommodations, you should plan to pay more....especially in Sedona. We love this little jewel!Hands down the most magical hotel stay I've ever had.  Southwest Inn at Sedona is a botique hotel, and after staying a night there, I understood what "botique" actually entails.  This is definitely not a chain hotel.  Southwest Inn at Sedona only has about 20 rooms, which equates to a higher level of guest service available to guests.  My boyfriend reserved our room ahead of time and the receptionist suggested a great restaurant for our anniversary.  She spent plenty of time recommending other local places for us to enjoy, like she actually cared about our vacation - how rare these days!On to the specifics.  First botique touch - the room key!  Had a great little boot key chain that I ended up buying for my own key chain afterwards.  So cute!  Ok ok, more substantial details.  You walk into the room - clean, smells good, fireplace in the corner, Native American music softly welcoming you, robes laid out on the bed.  I'm in love instantly!  Went out on the patio and loved the view of the mountains.  FYI, you can never have a bad view in Sedona unless it's completely obstructed.  I could barely wait to finish dinner later that evening because I was so excited to come back and relax in our room.  And that we did.  We turned on the fire place, put our robes on, had a few glasses of wine, and took in the peace and quiet.  The next morning, we woke up for the complimentary breakfast.  It was by no means an elaborate setup, but as far as I'm concerned, if there is a waffle maker I'm ok.  Had all the other basics like eggs, bacon, sausage, pastries, plus breakfast burritos!  At this point, nothing could dissapoint us.  We got a nice little table on the outdoor patio and enjoyed ourselves.Other "botique" touches that I enjoyed: a nice woven blanket in the room & a DVD player (most chain hotels force you rent $15 movies only - my bf and I watched a $1 Redbox after dinner).I know "magical" seems a little corny, but that's just what this experience was thanks to Southwest Inn at Sedona.  I'm not interested in trying any other hotel in Sedona.  I'm thankful that they helped make our anniversary so special and can't wait to go back!Super friendly service, clean spacious 2 room suites!This place had clean rooms and included breakfast. I had to say ceilings were a bit then so we heard our upstairs neighbors walking around. There was free WiFi in this location, but it didn't work very well. Overall we enjoyed our stay here.Disappointing stay after reading reviews. Yes the fireplace was nice with the snow falling but the room was only mediocre. Even though a small fridge was included there was no microwave. I haven't stayed in a room at even half the price in years that didn't include a microwave. It was absolutely the worst breakfast options I've had, cold cereal and waffles and stale bread. I asked to be upgraded as we were forced to stay in the area for a third night and was told there wasn't any other options. Amazing considering the parking lot was almost empty and the no vacancy light never came on. Will surely look elsewhere next trip to Sedona.I stayed here once before on a romantic weekend getaway, and had a great time. So when I planned this past weekend's jaunt, I had to say just one thing to convince my companion to stay here:"Best. Beds. EVER."They have these incredibly soft mattresses that you just sink into - perfect after a long day driving and walking. There's a kiva fireplace in the room, and we sprang for a jacuzzi tub, too. (My companion tells me it's good.) The staff there are unfailingly friendly and helpful. I keep meaning to try the complimentary breakfast, but I keep going there with people who aren't particularly early risers.If you're staying in Sedona, this is a great place to stay.PRO:- Great value for the rate. Me and the lady just stayed for three weeknights for $79 nightly in a king room on the first floor. Gas fireplace, mini-fridge, iPod alarm clock, DVD player, flat screen tv- Very comfortable bed and blankets.- Great location at the west end of town on the 89A. Still close to many places, but just outside the heart of the crowds- Outstanding housekeeping - I couldn't believe how clean and organized the room was when we got back to it at the end of each day.- Average to above average free continental breakfast - Standard stuff- Three computers with internet available until 8pm above the lobbyCONS (mostly minor)- Pillows were way too thick for me - I winded up sleeping with no pillows by the third night. They're so thick, my neck rested at a 45* angle on them when I laid down- Wireless internet was not working in the room - I asked about when we checked in and she said it probably wouldn't work and it didn't. I got the feeling it was a normal issue and not much was done about it, but I could be wrong.- Well equipped rooms, but a microwave would be nice- The lights above the sink in the bathroom could be used as heat lamps. I could literally feel my scalp burning when I had the lights on.All in all we were very happy with this place and would return again if the rates are right.We stayed there last year for my birthday; and were really disappointed with the place. As someone noticed - the only good about this hotel thing was the room sizes. That's exactly right! Location is very remote from downtown Sedona, views are obstracted by the building and you have to literally fall out of the balcony to see the mountain view. Breakfast was pretty bad, cold hard boiled eggs, bread, and cereal. We wil pay a little more next time but will make sure to stay at a better placeThis is a lovely hotel with very helpful staff mmbers. I had a concern over a billing matter. The front dest was quick to try and help until it was resolved. I will recommend this place to anyone! I love the inroom fireplace also!Adorable place to stay in Sedona. Definitely not a resort type of place (more bed & breakfasty), but totally darling. The folks that worked in the front were so incredibly nice and helpful. One night one of the girls even offered to drive this couple into town because the wait for a cab was over an hour. How is that for service? They serve breakfast in the mornings from 7-10 which includes homemade breakfast burritos, whole fruit, different cereals, fresh waffles, toast and oatmeal. In the afternoons they have iced tea and lemonade in the front office. The rooms aren't anything fancy, but they are clean and nicely appointed. Loved all the towels in the bathroom! The A/C may be just a wall unit, but it  rocks and gave us the best nights sleep. I'm sure the comfy bed helped, too. If you want a better view of the red rocks, snag a room on the 2nd floor otherwise your view will be of the parking lot. Hint:  If you have a 1st floor room and you want to chill out on your patio on a warm evening, turn off your A/C in the room and the patio will cool off a ton!  You'll see what I mean.Pool and hot tub close at 9pm, but if you're in there at that time they'll just give you the padlock and ask you to lock up when you're done. Nice! Also, they have towels already out there so you do not need to bring any from your room. Just a heads up: while it's on the main highway, it's not on actual Main Street where all the little shops are. This really is an adorable place!Best deal, best rooms, best place in Sedona!Wow, I rarely give five-stars but this little Inn deserves it for the wonderful three-day weekend we had there.  Based on yelp reviews, decent price and pictures my husband and I picked this hotel for our one year anniversary trip to Sedona.  We had such an fun, romantic weekend and much of the credit had to be given to the Southwest Inn whose attention to detail made all the difference.  For the price, it's a worthwhile pick.PROS:  1.  Seamless reservation process on line which included an automatic upgrade to an upstairs room with a view when we mentioned yelp in our reservations.  We arrived after hours and the person at the front desk called to let us know where to find our keys and let us know that we can check in the next day after breakfast.  Doesn't get much more easier than that.              2.  The people at the lobby were always nice and pleasant and that goes a long way.            3.  The rooms were cleaned and organized really well and smelled good whenever we came back to the room after it was cleaned.            4.  The breakfast had enough variety so that we weren't bored in the three days we were there and the burritos were a unique and delicious touch.  The women who took care of the breakfast area did a great job keeping everything clean and filled.             5.  Facilities and rooms had its own southwestern motif which created a pleasant atmosphere.  Our room had a fireplace which was easy to use and safe.  The a/c worked well and wasn't particularly noisy in my opinion.  They had neat alarm clocks that you could hook up your ipod to and had options for ambient noises. We enjoyed tea and dinner on our patio one of the nights taking in the view of the red rocks.  The jacuzzi was nice and there were towels provided in a container by the jacuzzi.  We didn't have a chance to try out the pool.  Loved their bath products-they smelled so good and the soaps had a scrub side which felt good on the skin.         6.  Cool memory card type key with a colorful boot key chain.  Robes were laid out and they had apple-cider in ice waiting for us with two wine glasses and a nice note for our anniversary.  All these small, special touches made us feel welcome and like we had picked the right place for our special trip.  A big, fat recommend.Nice bed, clean, great breakfast. Must try the breakfast burrito.I may be biased, since this is where I spent the best Valentine's Day I've ever had, but I really liked this place. I had been "kidnapped" by my boyfriend the day before Valentine's Day. I wasn't told where we were going or what to expect; just to pack enough things to make it through tomorrow. I liked the spontaneous attitude my boyfriend was having, aside from him telling me we were going "camping." Being under the impression we were going to be "roughing it," I was really impressed when this was where we wound up. He tried to make it seem as though we just stopped in Sedona and this was the first place we stopped to stay, but I saw the printed receipt from the internet. Anyways, the hotel is cute! I loved that we had a fireplace and that the beds were comfortable. There was only one strange thing about the entire stay. As you opened the door to enter the room for the first time, a chanting/mood music was playing on the radio. We didn't mind it, just thought it a bit strange.We loved the fireplace- we're easy to please and thought the breakfast was fine for what it was. I know people say the balconies overlook a parking lot, but look past it! We had beautiful mountains all around us! The staff was friendly, the room was nice and clean, and the beds and bathrobes in the room were both super comfortable! And as an added bonus, I left the hotel an engaged woman. Yup, he proposed! Right there in the room.I'm happy to say that if my fiance and I are ever in the area, we'd love to go back and stay at this hotel! ; )We reserved a room here with the owner who was great. Our dealings with him and everyone there was second to none at any Sedona resort. The reservation was set for our honeymoon! We went up a week early to see the different resorts and what they had to offer. We were unable to see any actual rooms at any resort. Therefore; we had to base our decision purely on panoramic views and the outside aura of the resort. We did end up going to another resort because the other resort did have a view that we could not turn down.  However the other resort did not offer a fireplace in the room like Southwest Inn has. We will definitely consider Southwest in the future as the people there are fabulous!!We stayed here 4 nights and loved the place.  Great atmosphere, the room was nice and clean.  We opted for a simple room for my wife and daughter.  We weren't planning on spending a lot of time in the room.  The staff were very nice, the continental breakfast very good (love the waffles).  Would highly recommend.The best feature is the room size.  After first time there it was a treat having more space since we have hiking gear. But if you want a view, you better get an upstairs room. Last time they stuck us in the end unit-downstairs directly behind the pool. Seemed like we were in a dark cave about five feet from the gate of the pool everyone had to access through to get to the pool, therefore no privacy on our porch. The AC was extremely loud every time it kicked on. We love hiking Sedona & have stayed here a number of times, but that experience made it our last. They would not let us change rooms.  Beds are comfortable but breakfast is just OK at best.I was in Phoenix for a business trip Thurs through Saturday and decided to spend Sunday hiking in Sedona. .  I stayed at the Southwest Inn for one night. As a previous review mentioned it's not a resort but is a step up from the creepy motels I try to avoid when traveling solo The room was large, the bed was very comfy, and I had a pretty good view of the rock formations from my second story room balcony.  The young man at the desk when I checked in was very helpful, he gave nice suggestions on where to hike.  There were also nice spots to grab a bite within walking distance.  The inn was very close to Boynton Canyon and Doe Mountain trails.  I wish I'd brought a mountain bike, I'm sure I could've ridden to both trails easily from the Inn. I didn't have time to get in the hot tub or pool but other guests seemed to be enjoying them.  My only complaint was the wifi.  It was painfully slow the night I was there, and I couldnt get my post-conference work done using their connection.  In spite of that I would definitely come back the next time I'm up in SedonaModern rooms, fast free wifi in-room, and great (free) breakfasts.  Middle of all of the action in town.This is a small inn full of charm and sincere hospitality. We stayed here for 2 days and found the room comfortable and the complimentary breakfast buffet filling and delicious. The host I believe is an East Coast transplant who has taken well to her new city. She recommended good restaurants and things to do. Highly recommend this inn!
review_content_40: This is the perfect compromise between a really expensive resort and a scary motel for cheap. The rooms were very nicely-sized, the beds were incredibly comfortable, and the bathrooms were lovely! You even get robes to lounge in, which I think always takes up a hotel experience up a happy notch. The pool and hot tub were also very accessible and uncrowded. We had it to ourselves. Even though the hotel is right in the city of sedona and there is some traffic, you can't hear any noise and it's close to tasty restaurants. The front desk staff are super nice and helpful; when I asked about a place to donate all my food that I had not eaten when camping, the clerk (named Brie, I believe) searched and called places for me and even mapped out how to get there. The best part is the hot buffet breakfast that's included - vegetarian friendly! Vegetable burritos, boiled eggs, toast, coffee, and a Belgian waffle maker. I enjoyed taking my time eating and reading the paper and drinking coffee. Food always raises the bar in my hotel experiences :-D I highly recommend this hotel!I stayed there over the Thanksgiving holiday and I was disappointed with the room and location . The "Inn" is situated right off of HWY 89 and far from the village of Sedona . It was noisy and had the feel of a Motel 8 but priced at Hotel rates. The jacuzzi is kept under lock and key and requires guests to ask for it to be unlocked . In addition our room was uncomfortably warm because the guests that were staying below us in another room had their heat on....we actually had to open our balcony door to regulate room temperature. The view of the rocks is only capable if you lean over the balcony rail. Next time I'm in Sedona I think I'll spend an extra $50 per night and get something with a lot more to offer for the money.Lovely hotel, with service more akin to a very good bed & breakfast inn than anything I've come to expect of a place with more than a half dozen rooms. My husband and I were celebrating our anniversary, and since winter is the off-season in Sedona and rates were low, we splurged on one of the Southwest Inn's suites with a king bed. The bedclothes were fluffy and oh-so-soft; the towels were rich and cottony; the toiletries were spa quality.The breakfast buffet was a surprise to me, a diabetic who normally finds little she can eat in hotel breakfast buffets. There were hardboiled eggs and tasty and healthy black bean breakfast burritos, as well as homemade Belgian waffles and other goodies for those with a sweet tooth. My husband was less thrilled; he's an unregenerate carnivore and the breakfast buffet had no meat. However, given the other sources of protein, I don't think most people would miss it.About the only weak point in our week's stay was the hotel's Internet service; it was poor and extremely slow. If you are a businessperson who needs the internet to work, best go elsewhere. However, this place isn't a business hotel -- it's definitely geared towards vacationing travelers. And Sedona is gorgeous, so you shouldn't be wasting all that time online anyway. ;-)Very nice, clean and well cared for. The room was nice sized with a gas fireplace that added heat and ambiance. The front office people were more than helpful and very responsive. The complimentary breakfast was wonderful-waffles, cereal, burritos, toast, yogurt-pretty much anything you would want. We left before 7am and were able to take breakfast back to our room the day before and keep it in the room's refrigerator. I would definitely stay there again.We stayed here a few days after Christmas and were surprised at how busy the town/area was. The folks at Southwest Inn were nice and accommodating. We had a first floor king with jacuzzi. We loved the Southwestern charm and decor of the room -- especially the in room fireplace! Our only disappointment was the broken wi-fi. The folks at the front desk did comp a DVD rental for us, though. All in all a comfortable and charming stay. We would definitely recommend.We are staying only one night in Sedona.  We didn't want to pay a huge amount at a resort.  Due to the rave reviews on Trip Adviser, we booked a night at the Southwest Inn at Sedona.  The rooms are huge, nicely appointed in southwestern style, and the staff is very friendly.  If I were ever to venture through Sedona again, I would stay here.Agreeable.  A few notches above standard budget hotels at a reasonable price.  Large, clean rooms with a jacuzzi bath and in-room fireplace.  A helpful concierge willing to make restaurant recommendations and call in reservations.  She seemed to have limited knowledge of easy hikes nearby, but for more serious hiking, do your own research.  The sign in front claims "bed and breakfast featuring Belgian waffles" --- really it's just a typical continental breakfast with DIY waffles.

review_content: #BlownAway #Refreshed #BlessedI know when using hashtags, you typically post them at the end of your post, but I'm starting off with those above as there is not a better way to describe how I felt after spending a weekend at L'Auberge.While we'd been on the property a handful of times before for lunch, this weekend was the first time I'd ever stayed overnight at this resort, and it was quite a special and extremely memorable experience.From the sincere and friendly service all around, gorgeous property and scenic views, five star meals, comfortable and spacious rooms (hello indoor and outdoor shower!), incredible amenities, serene spa, etc... there was not a detail that was overlooked.The talented Executive Chef Rochelle Daniel's passion for her craft shows in every plate she sends out from her spacious newly renovated kitchen.  We had an incredible 9 course wine-paired dinner on our first night there, which deserves a dedicated review to follow.  We also had a delicious room service lunch upon arrival, a delicious breakfast in the restaurant on Saturday, a bottle of wine and charcuterie creekside on Saturday evening, and the infamous Sunday Brunch on Sunday before we left to return to reality.  Our weekend at L'Auberge is one we'll remember and cherish for years to come... I'd recommend it to anyone looking for a get-away and I hope to do a repeat visit (or several if I'm really lucky) in the future as well.The staff at the restaurant was very kind, but they did not have any available seats for dinnerso we were excited to have a good experience in the bar; however our experience was awful.We have never had this kind of the worst service ever before.We wanted to get seats but servers were just busily walking around and pretended not to notice us.A few minutes later, we talked to one server and asked who can take care of us and finally took seats.For the next five minutes after we took our seats, nothing happened.The bar tenders who must have noticed us seating at the outside open bar never talked to us even though they served other people at the bar. We talked again if someone can take care of usand finally we got menu. Another five minutes passed but no one took care of us and we were so disappointed and left the bar. This hotel/restaurant/bar seems to offer wonderful experiences but actually they provided very RUDE, UNPLEASANT and UNPROFESSIONAL service. We were so disappointed about how this hotel trains their employees. STAY AWAY FROM THIS BAR.For weddings this location has breathtaking views of the mountains of Sedona for the ceremony site. Just a thought for the hotel event coordinator, but in warm weather it would be helpful to have a canopy of some sort or some sort of shaded structure so that the bride, groom, and bridal party don't melt! The reception site is also quite beautiful as you are bordering the creek that runs along the hotel. The food we had was nicely presented, and the short rib entree was flavorful and very tender. The cake was part of the wedding package and it was a stunning creation. The cake inside had a lovely dark chocolate mousse-like frosting with vanilla cake. The cake itself was slightly dry but overall enjoyable. It doesn't seem like there's any self-parking here, so it is all valet. The service is fairly speedy and efficient, and this service is included with your stay (i.e., no tips allowed for the valet per hotel rules). They also offer a shuttle service which is convenient as they can take you to various locations close to the hotel.The room itself is spacious, airy, and very luxurious. It's the first time I've seen a hotel room with an outdoor shower! I was here for a wedding as part of a bridal party so I can't say about the prices for a regular stay here (I'm sure they are quite expensive) but the experience here is one of a kind if you are staying in Sedona.Wow. The quality of service we received is arguably the best we've ever had. L'Auberge has the ticket. Quality of personal service from all aspects is what's memorable. It can make any less than luxury aesthetic a favorable event. So to enjoy this type of service at a 4+ star resort really solidified our luxury experience. The beds are comfortable, the grounds are dreamy, and the amenities are incomparable. We really enjoyed the stargazing opportunity and being so close to the downtown. Splurge! Go for it!Celebrated a milestone birthday here & stayed for 3 nights. Everyone from bellhop to check-in clerk to housekeeping to shuttle drivers to spa personnel to restaurant staff made me feel like a queen. I was upgraded to a cabin overlooking Duck Beach. The room was spacious. Fireplace ready to spark a fire. Great in-room coffee. Fluffy bed & pillows, turn-down service. Four newspapers delivered daily. Enjoyed room service for lunch. Superb. Treated myself to dinner creekside. Fine dining at its best. Facilities perfect. From massage to steam room to the pool & hot tub. Even enjoyed yoga several times. This resort is a splurge and totally earned its reputation for grand service & high quality. I've travelled extensively & stayed at ooo-la-la places. This ranks among the very best. Should I ever win the lottery, I'd move in permanently. Well done, L'Auberge. Well done.Fantastic resort and location in Sedona. I would highly recommend staying creekside. Its absolutely perfect with a deck overlooking the creek. You can walk to the creek and just enjoy the nature.Its absolutely a great environment for relaxation. The only knock...is the rooms are a bit dated...kind of rustic..but it maybe  more of a style issue for me, in addition the pool is a bit underwhelming. I would go back here in a heartbeat, its absolutely one of my favorite places in AZ.We were disappointed in our overall stay.  The room regularly wasn't cleaned until 4p.  Our room was right by a service drive so we could not even enjoy our balcony because there was constant noise outside.  Several "projects" going on including repaving the walkway during a whole afternoon where you could not even get to the lobby without cement splashing on you.  I felt the bathroom was very small for this luxe hotel.  Only one sink & very little counter room.The bed was comfy but they didn't even have black out shades??Some people were exceptionally nice (Chad, Joel, Beau, Joe, Laurie) but some were just not.  We did experience the spa & restaurant.  Spa was really just ok.  I was hoping for more of a luxe spa experience.  The restaurant was really excellent.  The best upscale food we had in Sedona.  It is pricey though.For the price we paid & the experience we were expecting, l'auberge did not meet our expectations and I wish we would have stayed elsewhere.  I would not recommend this hotel.  If we go back to Sedona, we will not be staying here.Stayed 3 nights in a cabin with our dog. One of the big draws to this place is dining outside by the creek. We were there when it rained most of the time so we dined indoors in the not-quite-finished dining room and in our room. Dinners were good. Burrata interesting but not again, lamb neck ravioli interesting but not again, corn and crab bisque good, filet was great, cheese cake good, apple galette OK.  Service gets a 10. Coffee and pastries good in the mornings. Eat by the creek any time you can.  Cabin 30 was good for us, especially the wood burning fireplace. Also suggest 29 and 31 as these three are a bit less expensive but you can hear the creek and the creek is easy to get to. Wifi worked great. Not a fancy place but well cared for, great service, good food, terrific location. Definite go back and recommend to friends.Very nice place to stay if you are in Sedona.   We stayed in the cottage and itwas very roomy and clean.  Enjoyed the walk along the Oak Creek.  Staff membersare very friendly and courteous.  My wife booked under her name and I don't knowhow much she paid but her parents from Japan definitely enjoyed their stay here.Unfortunately, for someone who has stayed in Sedona before,I preferred the hotel next door (Amara Resort) for couple of reasons.1. Long and steep climb up to 89A.  I don't think you can walk up.  [If you stay at Amara Resort, walk up to 89A is much do-able]2. Car has to be valet parked.  We were told that no tipping is allowed on the hotelproperty so we didn't tip but still it's a hassle to have someone go get yourcar.  [Amara Resort, they have self park option.]There is a restaurant on the premise and we tried to eat breakfastthere but the lady at the front was totally clueless and rude so we decided not to eatthere.LOVE THIS PLACE!!!  You're paying for the location which is right alongside a creek.  It's the most calm, fancy place I can think of.  We went for brunch which was a little hefty but it's all you can eat including a raw bar.  The other food items were ok but I wouldn't go for any of them.  There was one item on the dessert table that I loved.  I just can't say enough how awesome it is to just hang out by a creek and eat.  I will definitely be heading back!!Very nice resort! We stayed in a cottage. They are very clean, spacious and have a wood burning fireplace in the room. A very nice thing for a cool evening. A very spacious deck out our door. We can walk a few steps away to the creek.  The scenery here is beautiful! Lots of beautiful trees, flowers, jasmine growing up trees and walls of some cottages. I would definitely choose this place to stay again!We ate breakfast and dinner here also and both times it was very good!  At dinner my husband and I split the Caesar salad, the flat bread and each got a salmon dinner. We enjoyed it all so much, and we left very full. Well worth the money.I can't seem to get my mind off of you...Five-star hotel; Red Rocks for viewNow that I'm awayThinking 'bout our stayOne of the best places that we've ever stayed inBought a Travelzoo deal for four days and three nightsGot a detached cottage; what a delightPrivate shower outdoorsDual sinks; hardwood floorsJacuzzi tub, four-poster king-size bed, and soft fine linenLush trees surround you; hard to forgetIt's only been a short time back, and I still haven't gotten over you yet!A vacation's that's all I ever wantedA vacation's that's what I really neededA vacation spent with my precious loveI swam twice in their small salt-water poolAttended stargazing class that was real coolAt the creek we fed ducksIt was so hot; we were in luckBy the valet, they had ice cold bottled water for the takingHad a romantic dinner for two outside by the creekFor the tasting menu I dressed real sheikFree shuttle service to townFor about half-mile aroundHiked up to the vista to see the views breathtakingRed rocks surround you; hard to forgetIt's only been a short time back, and I still haven't gotten over you yet!A vacation's that's all I ever wantedA vacation's that's what I really neededA vacation spent with my precious loveWhere do I begin? First off, let me just say that I love the L'Auberge branding, it's so elegant, so simple, but so wonderful. When you hear the name, you just want to go and stay there! L'Auberge in french means "the Inn" but it's much more than that. This place is listed on the list of the top 100 places to stay in the world. I can see why, really I do. This place is also the top 3 places to stay at in Sedona based on TripAdvisor, again, I can see why. It's won many awards for it's service and beautiful surrounding, and again, I can see why. I've been wanting to stay at this place for several years and every year, I would shriek at the price. Finally, I was able to find a deal where I was able to get vouchers for my stay to test it out first before I come back and spend $400-600 a night at a place I thought I'd like, but end up feeling ok about it, that was what I was worried about. But now that I've stayed here with the vouchers, I would come back and pay full price, hands downs, no questions asked. The place is kind of hidden, it's goes down into a private narrow driveway and you'll miss it if you don't carefully look for the sign "L'Auberge". It's right in the center of town, but at the same time, it's so quiet and peaceful. There's a valet greeting you and you don't have to tip them because it's included in the resort fee so no need to fumble over your wallet to find change to tip the valet guys. The valet guy got my stuff out for me and walked me over to the concierge desk to check in. The check in lobby is small with cucumber water greeting you and beautiful furniture for you to sit in. They explain to you how the resort fee works, the internet, the restaurants, etc. Then you're to walk to your room with the bell boy and he gives you a tour of the fitness center, the salt water pool, the restaurant, etc. Walking under the flower trees made it feel like heaven. It also kept us cool the entire stay. Once we checked in to our gorgeous french style room, we immediately changed into our bathing suits and got in to the salt water pool. It's a small pool but it was so perfect. We decided to peruse the town afterwards for dinner and it was such a cute and quaint downtown area. I loved it and no rowdy morons to ruin it for the rest of us, very peaceful. Later that night, we went to the lobby to meet for the stargazing and the man who worked there knows his stuff, he even built the telescope himself. On top of that, we got to see a close up of the moon and even see Saturn, sooo clearly too! I had an amazing time! The common area has games and a fireplace for us to open some wine and play chess and scrabble. I thought it was wonderful! Lunch at the Oak creek restaurant was also really nice (see my review for that). Every morning, we got to feed the ducks and my daughter loved it so much, we had to drag her away from there so that she won't overfeed the ducks. They serve scones, pastries, coffee, and tea every morning in the lobby. We loved it and would take our plates to sit by the creek on the swing and enjoy the view. They do yoga stretches every morning and I heard wonderful things about their spa services, I'll have to come back for that. The first day we were there, we were offered ice right to our room and bottles of water, they had their waters every where to keep people hydrated. The amenities in the room was wonderful, even the shampoo and body wash was so nice and they refilled it for us everyday. When we wanted to go hiking, the concierge was very helpful and gave us maps and where to go. The valet guys had iced cold water bottles for us ready to go for hiking. When we forgot things in our car, the valet guys would take us in the golf cart up to our car and back so we didn't have to walk up ourselves. When it was time to check out, they put our suitcases on the golf cart and took us out to the lobby, riding in the golf cart, my daughter really enjoyed it. Customer service was spectacular. I will say that this is one of the best places I've ever stayed in and I will come back to enjoy it once again.Unbelievable customer service. Top notch from top to bottom. We were greeted by the valet who were all incredibly friendly and helpful (most notably Beau and Makoa). Alexandria was such a delight at Check-in. She was welcoming, polite and knowledgeable-fantastic at her job. Makoa escorted us to our room while explaining the property. Such a gentleman and sweet young man. He also drove us to Uptown shortly after check-in which is a service the resort offers to their guests free of charge. Also free of charge is the use of the spa facilities, resort activities  (boccee ball, star gazing, duck feeding etc.) and newspaper to name a few. The grounds are incredible! We had a Garden Cottage and got a great rate! We were steps from the creek where they have lounge chairs and bench swings. Nice in the morning or at night to enjoy the sounds of the creek. We took a blanket from our room one evening and just enjoyed the sounds of the tranquil creek. We ate Creekside twice for breakfast- a tad on the expensive side for breakfast but you can't beat the setting. We failed to make reservations for dinner beforehand (tried for a dinner reservation Thursday for a Saturday night dinner reservation and they were already booked up)so be sure to book WELL in advance(not needed for breakfast). We hit up some other local restaurants so all was not lost! The cottage was very spacious with a deck to sit out and relax on. I was a little disappointed that we didn't have an outdoor shower as I thought all of the cottages did- I didn't see anywhere where it specified which has them and which didn't. Didn't ruin my stay but it was a bummer. Turn down service was nice. Toiletries were all nice. If they didn't have something you needed I'm  sure they would have brought it for you. Keurig with a few K-cups but you could always ask for more. A little note, all but wait staff at the restaurant and spa service providers do NOT accept tips. Which is a bummer because they're all outstanding. I hope they compensate well because they all MAKE this resort. My husband and I needed a little getaway and I couldn't have put together a more perfect resort myself. Absolutely wonderful!Gorgeous views.  Excellent service.  Restaurant was delicious.If I can stay in this hotel forever, I really would. It has the best food, best service, best review, Best of everything. Don't get me wrong, these luxuries come with an expensive price tag + 20% gratuity + $15 parking fee. Trust me though - it is worth every penny of it. I will consider myself a regular in Sedona and this is definitely the best hotel to stay at if you can afford it.L'Auberge is La-Boushie La-fantastic La everything! Grand place to stay.  This is that desert mirage oasis but in real life.  It's built along a creek and the sounds from the running water, birds and the echoing Cicadas in the trees while star gazing made me feel like I was in a jungle book adventure. I love romantic places and this is romantic! I luv nature and art and L'Auberge must've known because everywhere I looked.  I was surrounded by nature and it boosted my creative urges to take pictures everywhere, paint and write. Thank you universe and Spirit I found a place to call home while in Sedona. L'Auberge de Sedona is well worth a visit.  Sit by the creek.  Reflect.  Set your intentions.  Breathe and let go.  Then get your yoga booty up and go eat at the restaurant. Indulge coz you've been meditating all day on autopilot not even noticing because you've been hypnotized by L'Auberge's enchantment :)This is the second straight year that we traveled to L'Auberge de Sedona on Valentine's weekend.  Once again, we could not have been more pleased with the accommodations, services, staff, and food at this top notch resort.  The cottage rooms have all been completely renovated and are truly amazing whether alongside Oak Creek or high up on the hillside with unobstructed views of the gorgeous Sedona landscape.  From the valet to the front desk to the waiters, every member of the hotel staff could not have been more professional, caring, and courteous.  The Sunday Brunch is truly memorable with a very diverse selection of the finest foods.  The quality of the massages provided in the spa are among the best we have ever received.  If peace and quiet are what you're seeking, you will find it at L'Auberge de Sedona.  We will be back again and again.  We offer our highest rating to this fabulous venue.This review is only for dining at L'Auberge as we did not stay at the hotel.Let me preface my review by saying we have dined here twice. The first time we came was for lunch and we were pleased enough to return again for dinner on another visit to Sedona. The ambiance and atmosphere of the creek side dining is incredible. It might just be one of the best settings for a meal, not just in Sedona, but anywhere in Arizona. That said, I feel compelled to warn anyone who might be lured in by the setting because I have never been as disappointed with the quality and value of a meal as I was when we again came for dinner.Don't get me wrong, I don't mind paying for a good meal. The food was good but nowhere near as good as it should have been for what we paid. My wife and I each had the three course meal, which was the only option available on their fixed menu. Your first two courses were smaller portions and the third course was a more generous portion. I say that with complete sarcasm as my third course was only a meager 4 oz. portion.My meal consisted of a tiny piece of bacon wrapped Lapin (which was their fancy name for rabbit), a sort of Dungeness crab & spinach salad which was followed by a 4oz filet mignon. The three courses combined were probably less than 10oz total of food. My wife was served the same crab salad followed by a clam chowder (which would be more appropriately called clam broth as there was practically no clam in it) followed by a Ricotta Tortellini. They only had a "verbal" children's menu where we ordered a salmon filet and chicken fingers for our children.Again, the food was decent but it certainly was well below par for what we would expect when our total bill for the above meals, two beers and two children's drinks was $280! Yes, that is TWO HUNDRED and EIGHTY DOLLARS!!! I have had fine dining experiences in some of the most expensive cities in this county: New York, San Francisco and abroad: London, Paris and I have never seen such a high dollar bill for such average food.If you try dining at L'Auberge, please do yourself a favor, look at the menu (and prices first)! Oh, I forgot to mention, when we made our reservation, we were also asked to provide our credit card as we would be charged $40 if we didn't show or if we decided not to eat there. So, don't make a reservation before you know what you're getting yourself into. You can't beat the setting but it's not enough to make up for how they gouge you for the barely above average meals.I really wasn't expecting to have this miserable of an experience at L'Auberge. I have stayed at numerous resorts over my lifetime, and I always dreamt of staying here!Cue the travelzoo email I received months ago advertising a decent rate for their cottages and lodge rooms. Maybe my first mistake was going through travelzoo, or maybe it was booking the $100 a night cheaper "lodge room" instead of a "cottage". Anyway...I receive numerous e mails in the weeks leading up to our stay- all very professional, reminding us of our stay, reaching out to see if we had any specific requests... etc. All of these e mails remind us of the 3pm check in time, but if we would like to request to check in earlier or later to let them know...So we show up at L'Auberge at 3:30pm. There we are greeted by a friendly 17 year old who starts going over our reservation, and we are told our room is not ready. And that it won't be ready for about 40 more minutes or so. However, they offer us free cocktails, which we take them up on, and proceed to the bar area. We sit outside, and we get a couple glasses of wine. I'm annoyed- but I'm on vacation so I'm trying my best to enjoy myself. 45 minutes later, the concierge stops by our table, mumbles something really quickly, hands me an envelope and quickly walks away. It's our room key and a map of the hotel. No explanation on how to find our room other than the map, we set out to find it ourselves. After getting lost, we make our way back to the lobby and ask one of the valets where to go. He kindly points us in the right direction. We walk through the beautiful, gorgeous, manicured cabins, past the spa, and up to a super creepy looking horror story murder lodge. We walk in- it's dead silent and super super creepy. There seems to be an area for a concierge, but no one is there. We find our room, open the door, and are knocked over by the fumes of 10,000 cans of fabreeze. After joking about how disgustingly dirty our room must have been previous to our check in, my boyfriend and I put our things down and start to look around. The room is gross. It's weird. It's cheap. I've stayed in nicer rooms at the La Quinta while on spring break in college. Oh well, we figure we bought a coupon, we're on vacation, let's make the best of it.Then we open the door to the patio. Our patio is directly over the staff service entrance to the murder lodge. We sat outside for probably half an hour before we couldn't stand the annoying golf carts, trucks, and obnoxious employees going in and out. Loudly talking, cursing, ugh. So we go back into the room, only to realize it's somehow even louder inside. After wondering what the  hell is going on, we open our front door, only to realize that there is some weird reception/conference going on in the middle of the lodge. This immediately made us feel super uncomfortable- like we were crashing some work retreat. So we decide to get outta this situation by throwing on our swimsuits, bathrobes, and heading to the pool. Unfortunately, since there apparently are no employees manning the lodge, we don't know where to exit other than walking through 100 people wearing suits, cocktail attire and name tags. In our robes. Yeah. So the pool area (here's a positive!!) is super cute, and we had the entire thing to ourselves. We hung out in the hot tub for a bit and it was really nice. After about an hour, we head back to the La Quinta- I mean- the lodge- and AGAIN have to walk through all these peeps rubbing elbows. Kill me.
