Things improve from here, as we changed and headed to the veranda bar for some delicious wine and burgers. Our server was really awesome, and it was so beautiful and relaxing. Then we sadly have to trudge back to the lodge :( where we just want to relax and drink some wine on our balcony since it's now late enough that the staff is no longer scream talking about breaking bad 10 feet away. We go out to the deck- the lightbulb is burned out. So instead of calling the concierge again (we called down numerous times with questions/complaints) we just went back inside to watch some movies on the tube. The awfulness doesn't end yet guys! I know, this is a long one. So it's about 8 o clock at this point, we've been running around wine tasting/hiking/swimming/trying not to get murdered all day, so we turn down our own bed since no one has show up at this point. An hour and a 1/2 later at 9:30(!!!) theres a knock at our door for turn down service- ummmm thanks for waking us up! Trying to fall back asleep- we notice the loudest banging/slamming sounds I have ever heard coming from a building. Over and over and over again. This went on until at least midnight, when we finally fell back asleep. I was so frustrated at this point I wanted to cry/check out and drive home. It does get better tho- we had an amazing brunch the next morning which is the only real reason for 2 *'s. We couldn't wait to check out after brunch and gtfo! Never again!! I'm so dissapointed.
review_content_20: I am absolutely in love with this hotel! It's just so lovely. The staff is super nice and go above and beyond. The rooms are cozy and luxurious and the grounds are green and lush. The restaurant on the creek is one of the most peaceful and beautiful locations I have ever seen. We will definitely be back!!Customer service reviewHey guys, we just left! My husband and I were staying on their sister property Orchard Inn which literally had the most breathtaking views but spent 99% of our time here. 1. Serious SHOUT OUT to a fella named Cody, he seemed to be the guy over seeing all the events of our wedding party. There was a wine and cheese social, wedding day, and a brunch. He was so professional, a wonderful gentleman, extremely helpful and everything turned out great! If there was a way to request him to over see your event- Do it!!2. Valet guys, SHOUT OUT to Beau- he drove us back and forth server all times on different days and he made our ride very enjoyable! He had great information about Sedona and fun facts about the mountains and the town. 3. Our Bar Tender, SHOUT OUT to Johnny- He was a busy guy! Thank you for pouring perfect drinks, keeping the flow of the bar steady and efficient. I would recommend Johnny to be the bartender for your special event!We had breakfast by the creek and it was absolutely beautiful and romantic! Everyone is so incredible and our experience overall was awesome. Especially on a holiday weekend a great team such as, Cody, Beau & Johnny, is needed within an establishment such as L'auberge and they nailed it. We will return one dayThis resort is absolute perfection. This has become one of our favorite spots. The rooms are luxuriously appointed no matter if you stay in a lodge room or a creekside cottage. I absolutely love the outdoor showers and the spa tub. Every single person on staff is a complete professional. The complimentary yoga class was relaxing and the pool is quiet and relaxing. The food is phenomenal! The specialty cocktails are fantastic and always changing. Bottom line: this place will cater to your every need and tailor an experience that is suited to the kind of vacation you want to have.Came here for my bday and this place has amazing baby kale salad and their Lauberge burger with fries is so good! Don't forget that their tables are outside next to Oak Creek with amazing views to the creek and a nice relaxing sound of running water!What a great hotel.  The ambiance is beautiful.  It's set on Oak Creek and has cottages along the creek and lodges set further back.  I must say that it's breathtaking.  The dining service is first rate.  We had breakfast near the very wide creek which provided the soothing water fountain sound that one needs when you have a toddler with you.  The hotel also had duck food so that kids could feed the ducks wading in the creek while waiting for their meals.Although it was pricey, the food was excellent and well worth the $100 for a family of four -2 adults, a 12 year old and a 2 year old.  We walked the premises and decided to come back in the Fall for our anniversary sans the kiddos.Upon retrieval of our car, our tip was declined. We were pleased to find out that when dining there, that valet is free and that employees at the hotel do not accept tips.  Wow. We will definitely be back.The Sunday brunch is definitely a bit pricy and the food is not too bad.  If you're looking for pretty good food at a higher price with some great scenery, this is your place.  Our waiter was very nice.Oh and if you want to eat here you will have to make reservations or you'll be sitting in the back.Husband brought me here after our winter holiday in Park City Utah, and I fell in love. We came back again for my bday and I commented "if we ever got married, this would be the place".  Well it was, and I am so at peace when we are fortunate to get away from the valley and spend some here.  The staff is amazing and the accommodations and grounds are wonderful...nothing comes close other than Sedona's red rocks.We stayed at L'auberge for a girls get away weekend. We had one of the cottages. Beautiful property, right on Oak Creek. (I believe it's Oak) I can't stress enough how gorgeous this property is. I actually brought my dog as well. When we checked into our cottage there was a knock on the door, and we were greeted by someone with a dog bed, dog toys, and hand made baked treats from the doggie bakery in town. Great touch for an animal friendly resort! We enjoyed a meditation class, and a yoga class. When you check in they will give you a schedule of complimentary classes....they are great! Every morning I took my dog for a walk down by the creek. So beautiful with the sound of the water, the ducks, and beautiful foliage. I would stop in and get my complimentary green tea, and that's how I started every day during my stay. Peaceful.We had lunch and a dinner at the restaurant. It was very good. If you do the brunch buffet, get there early as they do take their time bringing out items that are empty. The pool was beautiful. They did however only have four lounge chairs. We called and they said that's all they have, so we had to put our towels on the concrete pool deck...BUT a few minutes later a man came in with two more. Perfect! The concierge was VERY helpful with mapping out our tours of the vortexes. Also, if you need to go anywhere in town the Valet can take you in the resorts suv. (We had a few wine runs, lol) Great resort. We will be back next year.From dropping the car off at the valet to check in at the lobby all the way through checkout this hotel was great. The service could not be beat. Valet was quick with service and helpful with recommendations. Lobby staff was warm and welcoming. I took a yoga class which was lovely and personalized. The spa was beautiful and services were good. We ate twice at L'auberge restaurant right by the creek. Scenery was beautiful with water running and ducks swimming by. Lunch and dinner were both very good with great service again. The grounds of the hotel actually feel like you're in a fairytale with ponds and flowers and cottages. Valet was also very accommodating in giving us a ride wherever we wanted to go in town. Overall an excellent 5star hotel!All the great reviews pretty much sum it up.  The thing that sets them above the rest is their excellent customer service. No matter who it is or what you need, they do it without hesitation.A definite must is to go down to the river and just enjoy the beauty of it no matter if it's winter or summer. If you can spring it, get a cottage. Some of them have an outdoor shower which is really refreshing. Courtesy car takes you to nearby stops so no need to find parking or being the designated driver. L'Auberge is a getaway in itself. Highly recommend.We had such a wonderful experience here. We stayed in the spa cottage, the out door cedar shower was amazing and the room was beautiful! Breakfast and dinner at their restaurant was delicious! We spent the afternoon at their spa too! The facial I had was the best I've ever had at any spa! I can't wait for our next visit, we want to try a different cottage along the creek next! We highly recommend this place for a romantic get away!What an amazing experience. Customer service, food, ambiance and amenities are all 5-star.  I came for a relaxing get-away with friends and can't wait to return again.  The cottages are very private. We had the best time sitting by the creek talking, sipping wine and eating the best homemade hummus I've ever tasted.The positives: Great setting. Very quiet, well manicured lawns, and exceptional food. We never had a bad meal at the restaurant. Heated pool was very nice and not busy (even though we were there during a busy season).The negatives: Valet parking only. I was with a bunch of kids and needed to frequent my car for left over items and found the valet annoying and cumbersome.  Apparently you can park your car yourself if you sign a waiver which seems pretty funny. The rooms, while clean and equipped with the best pillows i've ever slept on,  definitely need an update at this price point! The hotel is non-tipping, but the multiple types of fees assessed on my reservation were difficult to keep track of. My email confirmation from the hotel didn't even have a break down of my stay with the fees, and when I called it took ten minutes for them to figure out.This was a wonderful experience. Arrived on a cold rainy night. The staff was warming and wonderful. All levels of staffing were extraordinary. The facilities were up to par but it was the service that make this place. Great job. Can't wait to go back.Absolutely amazing staff! Helpful and very pleasant. Very small but sometimes it's nice to have the intimate experience.The setting is lovely and the people are very nice, albeit something always seemed slightly off. Now granted, we grew up in NY and Ct. so perhaps we're just not used to the the south west vibe. I have nothing against, in fact all for, a laid back relaxing feeling. However in order for it to APPEAR that way to guests it has to be anything BUT that behind the scences. A craftily constructed management style done right will go far to make all appear easy and casual from the outside without belying the work that makes it happen.For example, there are muffins and coffee in the lobby every morning for a few hours for those who are not interested in a full breakfast.  The first morning there were no small plates or napkins for the muffins. The hostess who normally stands at the podium to the restaurant wasn't there so I mentioned it to one of the servers. He said he would bring some right out. He didn't, but eventually the hostess did. OK, a small annoyance but certainly something understandable. The next two mornings every time we arrived for coffee, there was none. When I went to pour the coffee, it was empty. I turned to the hostess and she said, "oh...empty?" It shouldn't have to be brought to her attention that the coffee is gone. Her podium is directly across from the bar where the coffee and tea is set up. Common sense would dictate that part of her job is check the coffee and when she sees it is getting low have that second one ready to go. You don't wait until a guest informs you and then be told that they're starting to brew a second one! Come on, even a Travelodge on the highway has it figured out. Day 2, same thing. People were starting to get impatient. We were heading out on a hike and  finally just left. And what's with the 2 tiny individual jelly jars that were always left out there practically empty? Either place a big bowl of little jars out there or some bowls of jelly.  Not rocket science,On our last night we ate dinner on the porch off the regular menu. We had the steak sandwich and pastrami sandwich, both with fries. The meal was very tasty and we really enjoyed it. The server could not have been more sweet. Now comes the example of bad organization. I asked her for salt and pepper. Poor girl did not know where to find them! After probably 7 minutes I asked another server if perhaps he could remind her. He promptly came back out with salt and pepper that he said he had taken from the bar and that she probably can't find them because they're always hidden. What??? It's a restaurant for God's sake. It's like going to a doctor's office and them never being able to find the blood pressure cuff. Come on...someone here needs to get on the ball. And if the chef feels that it is an insult to ask for salt and pepper..get over yourself. Two nice little salt and pepper cellars on the table would save you from the confusion.Someone needs to tighten things up there a little more for it to be the experience that it's certainly capable of.This place is heaven! Stayed in a cottage. The bathroom was huge! It had two different types of showers and also a jacuzzi tub.  I love this place!!!!  I wish I lived in that cottage.The staff is super nice too.The location right by the creek makes this property quite special. They run a type of a very formal service though, which can become odd at times. Upon arrival you are seated at a short of principal's office and have to be explained the rules and sign some paperwork. This vibe did not agree with me. I booked the vista suite for two nights, not sure it was worth it. It is huge, but with the exception of the bathroom which is majestic, is very sad and sparse decorated. The "vista" part is partly justified, you have a view to the rocks, yes. You are also on the first floor above the parking lot, with everything that this entails.  Their room dining was ok, the breakfast ( tried both buffet and a la carte) was very bad, albeit served in a very beautiful outside location right by the creek. If you have a dog you are not allowed to sit with the rest of the people there, but have to sit on a sad side patio, which as you have guessed is empty and unattended. At dinner time you have to book in advance a place at the beautiful creek patio- committing to a 4 course menu- or ...rightly guessed it is the outsiders patio for you again. Last order is at 9. After that nada. These kind of procedures make no sense to me and quite frankly turn the whole experience a bit sour. If you like flexible, uncomplicated service and like to plan your vacations on the go, probably not the right place.I loved this resort. L'Auberge is such a unique brand and I am so happy/fortunate to have stayed here at such a young age! First of all, the location of this hotel is very exclusive - it has a private driveway and is valet only. Since they (fortunately/unfortunately) charge a daily rate for your car, they record what room you are in. Which means no weirdos walking around. Since I would now consider myself a resident of Vegas, Arizona and Vegas have pretty similar weather patterns. I wouldn't be exaggerating saying that both of these places can push 100-110 degrees in the summer. when grabbing your car they always stock your car with water. If you're just passing by you can always grab a bottle as well. Tourists in Vegas on the strip are always spending endless amounts of money on water to avoid passing out from dehydration.Another thing I'd like to rave about is the spa...we visited the weekend right before it got super busy but it was just myself and my mother to use the steam room and spa area. In addition, they serve tea, an assortment of trail mix, fruity spa water, and an assortment of fresh fruits.I would say that the only downfall of this place is that it is a little dated. The bathrooms need a little upgrade and the living room furniture doesn't look that new. Additionally, they offer morning duck feedings by the creek at 8am daily. A nice little activity after getting some fresh coffee and scones. I know most hotels provide complimentary coffee in your room so it's just a little change of scenery to walk to the lobby which overlooks the creek. I also participated in the morning yoga which I thought was rather boring but thats just my opinion.I would definitely recommend this resort and Sedona because the town is so so beautiful.My fiancee and I have frequently stayed here at the L'auberge de Sedona many times over the last few years. We've always had a nice and relaxing time.  However on our most recent stay we've noticed a few things that definitely changed. We booked a winter/summer package promotion that they had where you stay in the winter and come back in the summer time on them. (Keep in mind, we've paid closet to $400 for the spa cottage) so by no means are we staying free on them. Before arriving they sent me an email to advise to call them with an expected arrival so that they can accommodate accordingly. So I did and requested to be checked in a little early. They said they will note it. The day of our arrival we got Brianna, she wasn't friendly at all. She saw that we were using the promo voucher, to put it simply she wasn't too accommodating. She said the room isn't ready yet (we arrived at 1:30 pm) I requested  1pm which was noted. She said we will put you on our priority check in, so we will call you when the room is ready. By the time 3:20pm rolled by no phone call, guaranteed check in is 3pm. So we went back to the reception area, I saw her and asked 'is the room ready yet?' She said  'let me check,' she went into the office for several minutes came out and I saw her walk to the little slot where the room keys were kept. She grabbed it and handed it to me. I looked at her and asked if the room had been ready all this time and she said 'no it was just now ready.' I know this was a lie.  We stayed in cottage #70, there were a few things that needed repair. The outdoor shower knob needed repair. One of the logs needed to be replaced. Overall the room itself was clean and immaculate. However I am not sure if the cottages are worth the price point that they are charging. On their high season the cottages are running close to $600. In the past I would haven given this place 4-5 stars but now I believe it's under new management it is lacking the world class customer service it is known for. I am not certain if we will be visiting again.
review_content_40: Hate to say but this place used to be great but is now resting on its laurels. In all fairness they are having a remodel but for what they charge there should not be any complaints. While service was still above average they seemed out of sorts and not up to their usual standards. Rooms did not get cleaned on time. Dinner was a small disaster, starting with a long wair for a reserved table, getting orders mixed up and food that was much too salty. Hopefully they will get it together before the season picks up.It's fine. As with many fine French restaurants, the technique is good, but flavor is not that strong. Most of the courses were disappointing for me. My wife fared a bit better.The foie gras course was a grand disappointment. Some kind of fried and thin sliced foie, like truffle thin. Didn't even have flavor. When you are expecting luscious foie, this is a huge letdown. The tortellini was nice, rabbit was nice, carpaccio was the best course. Service was fine but not elite. Both of us left nearly full servings of awful peas on our plates and staff didn't notice or ask if there was an issue. It makes for a fine romantic date. But at $360 after tip, it won't be a repeat performance.It is really hard for me to leave 2 stars at this place, because I don't like leaving bad reviews, and the staff and grounds of this place is amazing, but here is my reasoning why:$30/day gratuity is added to your room, which is nice because you don't have to keep pulling out $5 for valet, baggage, room service, etc. everyone is very helpful and very friendly!! The staff earned a star for being amazing at this place!We had dinner at L'Auberge, and then walked the grounds a bit. It was very romantic and peaceful! The grounds are beautiful! I love the little walks between the cottages to the river, and they also had a nice koi pond with a waterfall, and sitting areas by the creek. This earned another star.We wanted to go checkout the spa and pool, however because of a large wedding that was being held the same weekend it was swamped with drunk loud people, and it wouldn't have been the romantic weekend experience we were looking for, so we just headed back to the room for the remainder of the evening. Although it is not the hotels fault, this is where a star was lost because we couldn't use the pool or spa so a star was lost.We stayed in the lodge, and we were put on the first floor, with huge elephants on the second floor!! I don't know if it is an old hotel, or if the people above us were overly noisy, but we could hear every LOUD footstep they were making. We began wondering how many times they were going to walk back and forth and what they were doing up there!!! Around midnight, they went to bed, and so did we. However their footsteps woke us up in the morning and is what we heard while getting ready until we checked out. We also realized we never received the nightly turndown service, but didn't mention anything. This defiantly lost a star!! For the price of the rooms I would expect a much more peaceful experience!!! Also, in the morning, we opened our doors to the patio hoping to get some fresh air in the woods, but our room was facing a maintenance car, and all you could hear were maintenance workers rolling trashcans back and forth outside our room, not relaxing at all! They need to find a new place for their maintenance and storage area!!! Regrettably, another star was lost... :(I've been fortunate enough to have stayed at L'Auberge de Sedona twice and have loved every moment! I'm not sure where to begin with how wonderful this place is. First and foremost, the staff is incredibly friendly AND the rooms are amazing. Second, they allow (for an extra fee) furry family members to join their humans and also provide homemade dog treats from a local Sedona Barkery.  Because there are so many great things to say about L'Auberge, I'm going to summarize my comments by category below. ROOM- For both of our stays, we were in the cottages on the hill and the rooms are spacious with breathtaking views. It's such a treat to be able to wake up and take a shower outside (yes, there is an outdoor shower that is AMAZING) and/or to drink a cup of coffee on the balcony with the beautiful red rocks of Sedona. Note: each morning there were complimentary coffee and pastries in the lobby and they were DELICIOUS. :) WALKS/FITNESS ROOM/SPA- The grounds are beautiful and pet friendly. We walked our two boys several times throughout the day underneath the trees on the shaded walkway. Also, there is a grassy area that the boys seemed to really enjoy. The workout room consists of weights, two treadmills, and an elliptical. We were able to get in a good workout without any problems. The Spa is also really nice. We treated ourselves to a couple's massage, but honestly it was a bit pricey (then again, that's to be expected at a place like this). :) STAFF - The staff is amazing here. They are friendly and willing to quickly help with whatever you need. One thing we liked was the automatic gratuity charge which was nice for us because we didn't have to worry when we didn't have cash. :) Overall, I cannot wait till our next weekend getaway in Sedona. We will definitely be staying at L'Auberge again.ROOM 443 worst experience ever!!I wish we would have stayed somewhere else! I would not recommend this location/resort to anyone. It's sad because this trip to Sedona was our "baby moon" it was suppose to be relaxing and enjoyable. It was the least bit enjoyable.  I relaxed more Away from the resort then inside.Our first day here we checked in everyone was great, we located our room in the "lodge" area (worst location of the resort) I noticed right away the room was very small no view and our patio was directly across from the service area (loading trucks, workers etc in and out all day). The bathroom needed minor repairs, our shower nob was loose. The bathroom was so small theres about a foot of clearance from the shower to the toilet-being 8 months pregnant I was concern I was going to fall. (Honestly I think a 2star hotel has bigger bathrooms then what we had in our room) that afternoon we decided to go down to the creek where they have a sitting area. I asked for a menu to be brought down to us, the hostess said no problem she would bring someone right away ( they weren't busy at all) we waited 30 mins and still no one, so my husband goes up there to order another glass of wine and asks for menus again. 15 mins later still nothing. Finally I go to the front desk to ask for help. 10 mins go by and we finally get a menu..... That night as we head back to our room there was a wedding going on, i didn't think anything of it until we got back to our room and heard the noise even louder from our room, this went on till about 11pm. I would think that you would inform guests who are staying at the resort that there is events going on, especially if you're location right behind it...... I didn't get any sleep that night..The next day we were in and out, we come back to our room and much to our surprise our keys don't work.... The last day I just wanted to go home, I was so upset and emotional that we had spent over $1000 to stay here for 2 nights when we could have stayed at a $100 hotel with better service and experience then we received here. As we checked out the front desk asked me how was our stay, I got emotional and said we won't be returning or recommending this resort. (This next part is what got me to write this review) her response to my comment was shocking!  "Well Mrs. Madsen if you don't tell us what we did wrong then we can't fix it, right?"  I thought to myself maybe a better way to phrase that is starting with I'm so sorry, and following up with is there something I can do.My wife and I stayed here last year and it was simply one of the best places we ever stayed in the US.Set apart from the busy Sedona experience, this tranquil respite offers peace of mind and body.  Spring for the cottage.  If you're going to do luxury, do it right or don't bother. Sorry for the late review  :) Don't miss Elote or a PInk Jeep tour!Went there a couple years back for anniversary. It was great, both the stay and the restaurant for dinner and breakfast. However, we've gone twice for lunch during day trips. I don't think I'll come for lunch again. The service is poor. Last time we were there for an hour and a half for lunch. Our server never actually stopped at our table. He would just take orders in passing, standing at the table corner positioned to move to another. He never stopped to ask how the food was, but just gave me the "ok" sign as he walked by once. Weird. Maybe they were understaffed? There was only one server I saw, though a ton of water servers and bus boys. My wife had the avocado and heirloom tomato sandwich. One of the tomato slices still had the sticker on it.UPDATE: The morning we were checking out, a gentleman struck up a conversation with me over the complimentary coffee and scones. When he asked how I enjoyed my stay, I asked if he worked for L'Auberge. He said yes, he was the general manager. I invited him to sit with us as we drank coffee and went point by pint through the resort's missteps. Still did not address our experience, but I was impressed with his genuine interest and how he owned that they had fallen short.For that and how he handled our situation, I upgrade my score. Here is my original review:One star. That's for the bed in the $300+ a night "spa cottage."You come to Sedona for the red rock views. There are no views here. Some of the other cottages get to see a creek. Maybe they paid more.  You can see pine tree-covered creeks in many places in America.Two days in a row, OUR view from our deck was the housekeeping staging area including piled up champaign buckets and room service refuse.We knew we were in trouble when we arrived and the valet boys were more interested in being boisterous than providing attentive and professional service.In fact, that is possibly the biggest complaint I have here: bad customer service. Everything is about the staff and what is convenient for them or what helps them look good.Service carts clambering down uneven sidewalks, past your bedside table at 8:30 a.m. "Complimentary" coffee and scones not replenished and not tended to. Calls regarding the aforementioned room service refuse being returned with "You wanted to talk to us?" No, we reported a slip in your service standard with hopes it would be addressed. Light bulbs out in the cottage. Deck chair faded from sun and filthy. Not-great food from the kitchen. A wacky gratuity policy that automatically charges tips to you room without being able to reward good service ... or penalize bad service.I could maybe ... MAYBE accept this standard if I were at a budget motel.It is inexcusable from a place that charges these rates and purports to be an exclusive enclave.We'll leave Sedona feeling taken. Don't repeat our experience.This experience has less to do with the hotel and more with the creek side dining. We traveled up with another couple this past weekend to celebrate my friend's wife birthday. We had heard of the creek side dining and amazing food experience of others but ours was not so memorable. Essentially I am sure the weather had a lot to do with it but the weather does not account for the bad food. 1st let me begin by saying all seating is outside (this is amazing if the weather permits). As we were waiting to have our order taken it began to lightly sprinkle. We were brought a large pool deck type umbrella that covered only 3 of us in our party (and we had to request another one), let me briefly mention that all the lighting is tied into the trees. So the umbrella blocks out literally ALL lighting and the only way to see is with the small candles at the tables (which there were only 2 of, and we had to "request" more as they were not offered). The candles eventually burnt out as we were waiting for our courses and we were subject to using the flashlights on our cell phones to actually see what we were eating. I will start and only mention my food and choices as the others at the tables had similar experiences. Course #1 36-Day Aged Beef Carpaccio -Cured Egg Yolk, Caviar, Pine-Fermented Garlic, House Rye Bread (a course which I did not finish I had about 2 bites of this before pushing it away as I could not handle the seasoning), This was ridiculously salty, My 1st bite of this caused me to cough and immediately reach for water to wash it down...a bit heavy handed on the salt for the 1st outing. Course #2-Smoked Lamb Neck Ravioli- Goat Cheese, Apricot, Maple Demi, all in all not a bad dish aside from the fact you are given 2 pieces of ravioli (mine was fine, while another party at our table complained of saltiness and not being able to take it down. #3 Creekstone All-Natural Filet Mignon *Pommes Puree, Red Wine Mushrooms, Sauce Bearnaise, served on a bed of potatoes...Dare I say it...Yes another overly salted dish. So of all 3 course we had I actually ate only 1, as well as a few others at the table. We dared not even attempt to take in dessert and went on our way. A few things to mention the menu states #1"Twenty Percent Gratuity will be Added to Parties of Six or More."; there was only 4 oat our table and the tip was already included in our bill? #2 Please Refrain From the Use of Cell Phones in the Dining Room- We actually had no choice as this was the only light we could use to see our food, and when the waiter came by on the 1st occasion he said "good idea, I've never seen someone use their phone like that" and did not once try to resolve the issue. All in all a bad experience, I am sure the waiters didn't want to be running back and forth in the rain, let alone be in it period. We will most likely not return there. For the price in food we expected better, way better.There is nothing bad to say about the stay my boyfriend and I had at this resort.  Everyone was friendly and the service was exemplary.  The pictures online don't do the grounds justice. It's truly beautiful and relaxing.  I only wish we could have stayed longer!The location is fabulous and the restaurant down by the creek is beautiful.The rooms are very pleasant, but we wouldn't pitch it as a 5* - even though it is actually really nice :-)We were there for a wedding and had no hot water the morning of the wedding day, so had to traipse down to the spa for showers.... not what you expect of l'Auberge :-(The staff are super friendly and helpful and we definitely will come back as we like the location and loved the restaurant (especially breakfast down by the creek!) - it's by far the best place in Sedona in our humble opinion.We visited the Spa and were told we could wait at the pool, and order a cheese platter.  We ordered the platter, but half hour later, after no one showed up, we called.  "Nathan" apologized and told us that the platter will be there in ten minutes.  Twenty minutes later, nobody showed up.  We cancelled the order because we did not want massages on a full stomach.  But really, does it take 45 minutes to get us a cheese platter?  Apparently so!  Anyway, we were not the only ones complaining.  Other couples who ordered food were waiting as well.  Just so you know, their customer service is really bad!L'Auberge de Sedona goes above and beyond the write-ups and pictures online. The resort property is beautiful! Flowered walkways, waterfalls and a great seating area next to Oak Creek is only the beginning. The resort also has a great location; you can walk right up to the shops/restaurants or the friendly staff will drive you to and from where you would like to go.We stayed in a Spa Cottage, which was absolutely delightful. Upon arrival to our room, a personalized welcome letter and a box of chocolates greeted us. The room was gorgeous and had all high-end finishes, like the flat screen TV, gas fireplace, double sinks, jacuzzi tub, and outdoor shower. The pictures online and luxury amenities listed are all correct, but getting to enjoy them yourself, like stargazing on your private balcony in your comfy robe and slippers, really made the spa cottage experience your own. We had dinner at L'Auberge Restaurant and were seated right next to Oak Creek. The menu is fixed choices for a 3/4 course dinner and each dish was absolutely fabulous. For the main course I ordered the Creekstone All Natural Filet Mignon and it was to die for. They also had a very extensive wine list and great dessert choices.We had an overall exceptional experience at L'Auberge de Sedona.Serious royal treatment here... This is by far a 5 star resort and the best place we have ever stayed. We actually got an awesome three night stay deal from TravelZoo, and boy has it been well work it. We got to stay in the Spa cottage, which is AMAZING! It has a wonderful jet tub, a huge shower and even a private outdoor shower. The room is very modern and tranquil. They have slippers and robes ready for you. They even do a turn down service every night. It's so peaceful, located right along oak creek. I love the fact that they have a salt water pool and jacuzzi.... No need to worry about my blonde locks turning green :). The fitness room isn't too crazy... Just a couple of treadmills, an elliptical and a couple of benches and weights. Everyone has been so friendly and helpful. I had a wonderful facial from Amanda at the spa (the antioxidant facial is well worth it!) The Resort does charge a daily fee as well as parking fee, but it's not too bad as the fees cover gratuity for housekeeping, valet and the guy that helps you with your luggage (do they still call that a bell hop??) The only times you need to worry about tipping is at the spa, restaurant and bar. Words really can't describe how wonderful this experience has been, you will just have to come here and see for yourself...My husband surprised me with a trip to Sedona for four days/nights at L'Auberge for my 40th birthday. Pros: Absolutely gorgeous grounds that do not capitalize on the "southwest" look of so many other establishments - it is more of a rustic charm setting and I really enjoyed the "feel" of the place.  We stayed in Creekside cottage/suit #2 and the view off the huge deck of the creek and the mountains was stunning. They restock your mini fridge with complimentary bottled water which I appreciated. The staff are genuinely helpful and personable. We enjoyed many interactions with them. Other than restaurant and spa services, it is a "no tipping" establishment. In addition to valet, they offer a complimentary shuttle to many shops and restaurants. Cons:The mini fridge in our room had an odd smell to it. I found myself holding my breath every time I opened it. We also had to request an area of our room be cleaned three times; the spot between the headboard and the bottom mattress had quite a bit of dust and crumbs. We found it only because we were looking for a pair of misplaced socks. We initially left a note for housekeeping and then had to alert the front desk when it still wasn't cleaned. After housekeeping came again and it still wasn't attended to, we had to go to the front desk again. We stocked up on wine that we kept in our room, however, housekeeping continually left our dirty wine glasses behind.The Sunday brunch is very good and, with the mimosa, champagne, and Bloody Mary (plus refills) included, it is worth the $50+ per person price point. The service was also excellent - my only critique was that we noticed a ceramic plant holder on the floor that had a very thick ring of dust all around the base. It quite literally looked like it had never been cleaned. We pointed it out to our server who seemed to address it immediately. Daily, right on the path to our room, there would be a golf cart parked that we continually walked around. I appreciate that they need an ability to get around the grounds but it was nearly always there and the placement felt like an eyesore. In addition, as you walk by, the cart had trash and debris in it (paper, empty plastic bottles, etc.). Overall, I would return and it really is a beautiful property with polite, service-oriented staff. I wonder, however, if L'Auberge relies a bit too much on its scenic locale as I think greater attention to detail could be paid - especially for the price.My husband and I stay here annually. I can't say enough good things about this resort. Everything is perfect- the employees are genuinely friendly, professional, and accommodating. We stayed in the Vista Suites, which overlook the red rock mountains- an absolutely stunning view. We were upgraded due to it being our anniversary, and also given the cabin at the far end for extra privacy.They delivered a bottle of champagne and chocolate covered strawberries, much to our surprise.The room is beautiful. Hardwood floors, separate living room with a fireplace. Sliding doors from the bedroom and living room that extend to a large outdoor patio. My favorite amenity is the bathroom.. Jacuzzi tub, walk in shower, and best yet- a beautiful, private, outdoor shower. We will continue to make this an annual getaway.This review is not of the hotel but of the service or lack of service at the restaurant. For a five star resort I would expect better service from their  staff.My best friends were  staying for a week at Hotel celebrating the New Year as well as a milestone birthdayI wanted to arrange for a bottle of champagne to be delivered to their table on New Year's Eve.It took me 3 attempts to accomplish  what I thought would be an easy feat.  I left messages for restaurant manager, concierge  and I  never received call back.  I had to persist in calling , Good thing I started calling 3 days in advance .I was finally able to arrange with the hostess t(Chelsea ) that I wanted a  $100 bottle of champagne  at the table at the time of the dinner reservation. NOT during but at their table as my friends arrived.Fortunately I had alerted my girlfriend's husband that there would be a bottle of champagne at their table. Well there WASN'T. .. He had to inquire with his server about the champagne, at which time the response was "we're 'working on it" . Okay I get it , it's New Years Eve it's busy. But to make matters worse, I had asked for a note to accompany champagne wishing her a "Happy Birthday  Enjoy." What she received looked like a 3rd grader wrote a note and instead of "Enjoy " it read "Happy Birthday & Joy." Now it is, comical  but  I would be embarrassed if my staff could not execute such a simple task on time and with some degree of pride and elegance. Very disappointing I would expect more from  L'Auberge.It was our first time in Sedona and thought we'd stay in one of the best rated hotels in the area and L' Auberge did not disappoint. The place is classy without trying too hard. It sits by the Oak Creek and takes advantage of its natural beauty. It works with the environment, not trying to mold it. Feel free to wander around creekside, feed the ducks or just sit by the comfy chairs with a cup of hot coco/coffee in the morning listening to the waters flowing. It's almost poetic. The room we had was clean and spacious although the bathroom was a bit small, the door barely missing the toilet. The staff is friendly and engaging. From the valet to the concierge, the service was excellent. All in all, this place is awesome. We're definitely coming back.This place is absolute heaven. Luxury in Sedona at its finest. The staff are super helpful and attentive, and the grounds are absolutely beautifully kept. The dinner and breakfast were amazing. Very pricey for dinner however, but totally worth it if you are at a place like this. The only thing that really kept me from giving five stars was the room itself. We had something wrong with our air conditioner it seemed and it kept making this weird noise which made it difficult to sleep. Also the bathroom was suuuuper tiny, and you could just barely close the door without hitting the toilet seat (literally I don't think there was even a centimeter in between). I cannot remember what room we had, but I know it was one of the cheaper ones. Anywho, not a super big deal since we only stayed for one night, and we spent most of our time out biking and at the pool.Probably my favorite part was the pool. Absolutely beautiful. And no kids. Just adults, drinking, and peace and quiet. The trees and view surrounding the pool were gorgeous as well. We would definitely stay here again!I love this place we had a special weekend away from Vegas and this place made it even more special!  We arrive to the property and see an amazing view just from the valet area not even to our room yet.  The staff is very polite and kind and explain all the amenities and activities within their resort.  I was pleasantly surprised to find they had sunrise outdoor Yoga and with a view like this I have no problem getting up at 5am to do yoga!Ahh the room, beautiful... we had a private cabin on the top of the hill on their property overlooking the amazing valley a patio to sit and have wine or coffee.  The whole cabin had wood floors though out.  The living room had fire place with a couch and a TV, coffee maker, fridge and free wifi   (a huge plus in my book)   The bedroom a King size bed with down comforters and pillows a settee a walk in closet and a safe.  The bathroom oh the bathroom... huge double sink, whirlpool tub, private toilet and a closed in outdoor shower yes an outdoor shower.  The shower is completely enclosed and private but is open on the top.  Let me tell you whats it's like to take a hot shower at night looking up and the stars in Sedona, AMAZING! One of the activities I enjoyed was star gazing a local gentleman is a astronomer he had two large telescopes it is a class but so much fun to have him tell you what your looking at.  I had a clear view of saturn rings and all with his telescope.  He does this for free but I gave him a nice tip ($20) because I enjoyed his knowledge so much.  He gave me a picture of sedona night and stars that he took in return.  The other activity I really enjoyed was sunrise Yoga they have it on a patio over looking the valley the sun is coming up and the red rocks are beautiful I felt at peace like I haven't felt in a very long while.  You do your poses listening to birds chirp a light breeze blowing, oh I wish I could do this every morning...They made this an amazing experience I will be back in the future.
review_content_60: From the moment you pull in, being greated by the valet to take your car and them saying they do not accept tips, let's you know, that this place is different from the rest. A lot of our interaction with he staff was with the valet team because our plans included seeing different parts of Sedona and outside of Sedona. Each time we spoke with them we received genuine reactions and suggestions of places they would recommend around town and their thoughts of places we were thinking about. This was extremely refreshing. When we were not traversing throughout Sedona and we were on property the view was second to none. We later learned, L'Auberge de Sedona is one of two resorts in the area that offer the type of landscape, views and service we were experiencing. The property is tucked away from the main road, where you almost miss it driving in to. The resort is backed up to a creek and the trees provide the much needed shade we were thankful for during our stay in the beginning of August. If you are looking for a quite, secluded and serene place to stay in Sedona, this is a tough spot to beat.If you can afford it, stay here!! We stayed in the villa suite and it did not disappoint. My favorite part of the room was the large window above the jacuzzi with the gorgeous view of the red rocks! Outdoor cedar shower was pretty nice too.Very nice creekside hotel and spa with great views of the famous red rocks.AMBIENCE: 5 stars. Great location along the creek, beautifully maintained grounds with great trees. We stayed in a spa room, which was pretty big, with king-size bed, fireplace, flat screen TV (which we used to watch the U of Az basketball team beat the U of Michigan!!), a bathroom that was literally bigger than my college dorm room--separate shower and soaking tub, and a really awesome OUTDOOR shower (fully enclosed on the sides for privacy, but open to the sky). The hotel lobby is nice, and there is not a typical check-in area, there are several concierge-type desks where they serve you. The restaurant is small but well-appointed and intimate, and there is a nice little bar with outside seating available as well.SERVICE: 4 stars--the vast majority of the staff I would give 5 stars to--the bartenders were great, the server we had in the restaurant was definitely in the top 5 servers I have ever had in my life, and the spa staff was top notch (from the folks who check you in to the people performing the services). The valets deserve particular praise--very quick and polite, and happy to give advice on local attractions, bottled water, etc.My one quibble is we had checked in a bit early, so our concierge told us we could wait for a few minutes and he would get us the keys--no big problem. We waited in the very comfortable lobby area (and wandered down to the creek), but he never came back to us, and I couldn't find him at his desk. There was another concierge there, so I asked her and she seemed quite annoyed with the entire issue. My wife and I tried to soften her up by getting her chatting about hikes, etc--but she was not having any of it and basically just handed us a map with a list of hiking trails (I wanted to say that they actually have this new thing called "the internet" that works almost anyplace and can get me the same information that she just gave me but faster and with much less attitude, but it was my anniversary so I let it slide)!They also have enrichment lectures that are free to go to, and my wife and I went to one with a past-life expert that was a little outside of my comfort zone but was very interesting to learn about.FOOD: 5 stars. This restaurant is everything the other reviews say it is--amazing service, top rate food and wine selection, very comfortable dining room. Great place for a romantic dinner.ALCOHOL: 5 stars. The bar is small, but man, they have a GREAT selection. My wife is a bourbon afficiando, and they had a bottle of 20-year old Pappy Van Winkle (they release a very small amount of these per year), and she was able to enjoy a glass of this and it is not an overestimate to say that it was life-changing (definitely NOT cheap, but how often do you have your 15th anniversary?!?). I love their margaritas (fresh juice, agave nectar, etc)--and I think I had about six of them in the 3 days that we were there.SPA: 5 stars. It is a small spa, but the service and services are amazing. The front desk staff were helpful and seemed happy that we were there--we actually walked in there on our first day without reservations and they were able to get some stuff going for us that afternoon. We had two sessions of couples massages, and they were both amazing. VALUE: Listen, this place is not inexpensive, but it is a beautiful hotel in an incredible location--really worth every penny we spent! It is a great place for a romantic weekend, and a really good launching place to explore one of my favorite places on earth--Sedona!We went for a wedding and it was beautiful. The back drop for the vows was breath taking. The staff is super friendly and attentive and there before you could even think to ask for something. When we went to the reception we had a bartender, I think her name was Elizabeth, who was also great. She was fun, fast and friendly. The food was okay, the property is beautiful and we would definitely come stay her the next time we are in Sedona.I recently visited this hotel with my husband for our anniversary trip and it was a wonderful and magical experience. We stayed in a Red Rock view room and the view off the spacious balcony was breathtaking. The room itself was just perfect. Spacious and open with tall ceilings and a nice large bathroom - including an outdoor cedar shower, which my husband loved. Everyone from the valet attendants to front desk staff and restaurant servers were helpful, professional and attentive. The only negative part of my experience was the spa. I would not recommend going to this spa if you are looking for a luxurious spa experience. They have few amenities at all, and on the day I came, the steam room (which is all you get besides showers and a toilet) was broken. They knocked 30 bucks off my massage to apologize for the steam room problem (I had specifically asked about the steam room when I booked), but I still wonder why I'd spend $120 for a massage and no amenities??? I could have gone to a low budget spa and had essentially the same experience. So the lesson here: Spend 10 or 15 bucks more and go to Enchantment for your spa experience if you stay at L'Auberge. The other negative part of this experience, which everyone should know is the daily car parking charge of $15 plus the daily resort fee, which I think was around $35. This is supposed to cover tipping and Internet and the free rides around town they include for you, but an extra $50 a day is ridiculous no matter how you look at it. Since we came to visit with a Travelzoo voucher which made the rooms cheaper and included a resort credit, I didn't particularly mind the additional cost, but I do have to honestly say that if this resort would have been priced at its normal price point and then they would've gouged me with all of these fees, I would have been really disappointed. I think if you stay away from the spa and can visit this resort in the low season when the rates are reduced and you understand there will be fees, then I know you'll have a wonderful experience. It just oozes romance and the beautiful landscape and babbling creek are just so peaceful. It's a total zen place! Oh, and make sure to dine at the restaurant - it's magnificent! Truly world class!We've only stayed one night at L'Auberge, but had the most amazing experience. The hotel staff were very professional yet friendly. Just loved where the hotel was located. The best part was having breakfast at the hotel restaurant next to the creek. It was the most relaxing moment. The property is pretty and well maintained. I would love to stay there again!This is a gem of a resort in Sedona, AZ. My husband brought me here for a birthday surprise and it is absolutely delightful. This is a gorgeous property on the bankside of Oak Creek. Every morning of our stay we walked down to Oak Creek to feed the ducks, watch squirrels climb trees, and spot other wildlife who decide to make a magical appearance. The cottages are light and clean, and have a fireplace, spa tub, indoor shower, and an outdoor shower as well. It's a thrill taking a hot shower in 27 degree weather with the sky, sun, stars and trees overhead...loved it! The restaurant on-site is elegant and the food is scrumptious...the salmon, filet mignon, pommes, venison, pumpkin cider bisque, cheese platter, and chocolate molleux with pistachio gelato are amazing. The staff are courteous and accommodating...top notch service all the way around!Charming resort, stunning views, very quite very, good service from check in to checkout.Scones are baked fresh in the morning and coffee is complimentary at the bar, and you can have your breakfast or any meal for that matter creek side.Food .We were presented with only a Five course menu for 69 pp or so and at 9 pm after traveling all day was not a great idea, other options is room service that I did not find that great. As the options are pretty limited or you can have a very limited bar menu .Bed was not that comfortable and rooms are a bit dated .Tipthe town has lots of dining options , looks dark if you arrive at night however the next day we spotted all of them.This review is for the weekend brunch here only since we didn't stay here. We were seated along the river in the shade. It was a beautiful place to be among the babbling brook, happy ducks, and other patrons enjoying some shade away from the hot AZ sun. We had some ricotta beignets and eggs benny. Both were served hot and were delicious. The service was also good. Best part was the truly free valet parking. When I tried to give them a tip when they brought our car around, he kindly said valet was a free service and they couldn't take tips. I wish other places were like that too.We only stayed at L'Auberge for one night but it was well worth the splurge. The staff is very welcoming and made sure that our stay was nothing short of perfect. Our dog was treated like a puppy prince. He was given a leash and hiking bowl as a gift as well as a bag of treats from the Dog Bakery in town. The setting is gorgeous and puts you in instant relaxation mode with the sound of the creek always present. We ate lunch, dinner and breakfast at the restaurant and enjoyed every meal, but dinner was the highlight. Our favorite touch though was having a cheese plate waiting in our room for us after we checked in. I have never had that happen at any resort/hotel and it definitely made us feel very VIP.This has been a magical retreat from the hustle and bustle of home. From the moment we arrived at the Valet and were greeted by name, to the crib that was already in our cottage when we were brought in we have thoroughly enjoyed our time here at L'Auberge De Sedona.As people who travel extensively both for business and pleasure, it was an amazing departure from the "corporate" resort experience staying at L'Auberge. Our room was not a room, it was a stand alone cottage with ...get this awesomeness... an outdoor shower! This week during our stay it dropped below freezing and I think I am in love with showering outside under the stars when it is 21 out. Our cottage was called a spa cottage and this was very apparent in the level of luxury in our bathroom. An indoor spa-style shower, a beautiful jetted tub, the aforementioned outdoor shower as well as wonderful soaps, scrubs, and salts.Across from our cottage was a two story "lodge" building with a wood burning fireplace and as this is the holiday season it was also decked out in the holiday greenery one would hope to see.Every staff member in the resort knew us by name and seemed almost excited to assist us with whatever we needed whenever we needed it. There are activities planned each day for guests such as an 8AM duck feeding at the creek, which I wanted to talk about now for a moment.About 3 cottages from where we were was a path down to a private creek-front bank with outdoor bench swings, chairs, tables, and room service ready to coddle you while you watch the ducks quack lazily by... amazing.Room service which I touched on in a different review also was rich, filling, and wonderfully fresh. The dining room was also fantastic and I recommend you read the reviews and try it yourself.At one point there was apparently a leak where my vehicle had been parked and I was called and asked if they may take my vehicle to have it washed or reimburse me for a carwash... All in all, we will absolutely return next Winter to L'Auberge Du SedonaThis place amazes me every time we come. What an experience to be surrounded by such a caring staff. They spend time to get to know you (without being overly annoying!). We're traditionally able to get an early check in, and in the rare instance it's not available, they go out of their way to let you know the status.The grounds are immaculate. I'd recommend staying in a creek-side cabin. Very spacious... living area and an outdoor shower!Overall, I'm not sure what this place can do to improve upon anything!Albeit overpriced, this is a lovely resort and location deficient in customer service. The "no tipping" policy, which is replaced by a mandatory 10% of room rate fee applied daily, is most likely the chief factor here. Employees are guaranteed tips so are not particularly attentive to the needs of guests. (Socialism vs. free enterprise at work - the difference between the postal service and Fedex). The facilities could use updating, especially the pool - too small for laps. The gym is sparsely equipped with two treadmills, an elliptical and free weights. The complimentary shuttle service sounds like a good idea but is extremely limited in range. Beware of their 11:00 A.M. checkout! Although we paid for three rooms, including a cottage at $480 plus tax, we were only able to secure a miserly 12:00 noon check-out upon request.I have to admit that I knew nothing L'auberge when I booked a 2 night stay. I found a deal on travelzoo.com and when I compared the rates and location to other resorts in Sedona, it ended up being the best deal. Turns out, staying at L'auberge at full price would have been worth every penny. The resort gives first class service from the moment you pull in to the second you check out. It was like getting VIP treatment all weekend long. The lovely views and tranquil setting made it the perfect place to take my girlfriend on a weekend trip, where she would leave as my fiance.The room is fantastic. I ending up booking a lodge room. It's in a house that consists of four rooms, and a living room with a fireplace. It felt like we were staying a cabin rather than a resort. If your having a wedding or some other big gathering at L'auberge, I highly recommend making sure you get a group in this house. The room was a pretty good size and just a couple of feet from the creek and the restaurant. Other rooms may offer a nice view of the mountains but this was still an great site. It certainly doesn't have a modern feel to it, but I actually appreciate the classic atmosphere. Having a Keurig coffee maker in the room and two bottle of water each day was also a nice touch.The service is awesome. The extra 10% fee (based on your room) is worth every penny. This acts as gratuity with all services except the restaurant and the spa. Not only was it nice not to need cash to tip the valet, the bellhop, shuttle driver, the maid, etc., but it also allowed me to take advantage of L'auberge's services instead of avoiding it. I was also amazed at just how accommodating the staff is, despite the fact that they are not working for a tip.The location is also a major plus. L'auberge is literally under uptown Sedona and just minutes from everything. We took advantage of the shuttle service a couple of times, but since the weather was pretty good during our trip, we ended up walking to quite a few places as well. If my fiance and I decide to go on another weekend trip to Sedona, L'auberge will definitely be one of the first places we'll consider staying.The hotel was nice enough and the restaurant was lovely. However, after we complained about the valet taking something out of our luggage that we had left in the car, the customer service was dreadful.I got married here 2 years ago and we still talk about how amazing our time there was. the wedding was perfect but it was the small things they did to make the experience a WOW! one instance was I needed some tape for a bag that broke before our rehearsal dinner so just as a last resort called the front desk and asked if we could borrow someones tape roller for a quick fix on the way to a restaurant in town... they did WAAAY better! They sent someone to our door with a roll of tape like its something requested everyday. Everything is 5 star, the food, atmosphere, spa, people, rooms. Was there again in April, we fed the ducks, wandered around and took in the beautiful creek setting. Definatly a wonderful resort!This is my third stay there and wow what a fantastic place. The staff is excellent and courteous and always there to assist you. The hotel and restaurant is right on the creek with ducks and other wildlife all over the place the rooms were amazing each one was a cottage. This was a wonderful weekend I would highly recommend staying hereAbsolutely and unquestionably an exceptional retreat.Came here for a long weekend spa retreat, and this place was highly recommended by American Express. Availability looked a little sparse, so I rang the hotel directly, and the fantastic lady on the phone offered me an even better rate than what Amex were giving me, and thus my reservation was booked for a spa cottage.Upon arrival, I found the check-in process to be lovely, discreet, and highly personalized. Valet staff were totally on point, and walked us to our cottage with bags in tow, and assisted in explaining where everything was, how it all worked, and offered any help necessary. The spa cottage was amazing. The linens were lovely, making getting out of them an exercise in willpower. The outdoor shower was quite interesting, particularly when the mornings were a little cool, but a wonderful way to wake up. On the other hand, the luxurious Jacuzzi tub was perfect for relaxing and soaking in, leading one to just pad over to the fireplace and relax after getting out. Each cottage is well-positioned for maximal privacy, and even the outdoor deck, overlooking a koi pond, was discreet and perfect for kicking back and taking in the peace.The spa was spectacular, and I cannot speak poorly about any service offered, although the best would have had to be the creekside massage. 90 minutes of wonderful work performed on you, while soothed by a burbling creek alongside your massage table.Interestingly, they'd had a computer glitch, and a few months after my visit charged me a no-show fee. A quick call to the property and chat with the GM, who remembered me and warmly asked how I was, resulted in everything being reversed without needing to get Amex involved in the process. All in all, this is a place I would be keen to go back to on a regular basis.Very pleasurable experience here. When you are here you forget you are in a desert. The restaurant is right on the creek and is very romantic.Stayed here with my family last weekend. It was our first visit. This place is top notch. My favorite part was the cabin with the Red Rocks views. The cabin had a wooden deck with three chairs, a table, and an umbrella. The room had a regular shower, an outdoor shower, and a jet bath tub with views of the Red Rocks. My wife loved the restaurant with creek side tables and the spa. She got a creek side massage. My boys enjoyed the 8am duck feedings and the pool.I liked the $30/day gratuity policy. It was easier that tipping throughout the day. The service is perfect. Everyone is friendly and helpful.Since the Red Rock view cabins are up a small hill, we used the golf carts the first day. After that first ride, my 1 year old would only travel by golf cart. They also have a Mercedes shuttle for drop offs/pick ups in town.In the morning, they are complimentary scones, muffins, coffee, hot chocolate in the lobby. We would stop there after the 8am duck feeding. Outside the lobby, next to the valet, there is a wooden chest full of ice cold bottled water. We would stop there a few times a day. They also provided little chocolates and bottle water during the evening turndown service.The salt water pool is on the smaller size, but fine for a small resort. They could use a couple of more umbrellas out there.The restaurant was great. We got the four course meals which included two apps, entree, and desert. Dining next to the creek was outstanding. We made an early reservation since we had kids, but the creek seems to relax everyone, so our dinner was quiet.When we return to Sedona, we'll stay at L'Auberge and get the Red Rocks view cabin.
review_content_80: Excellent in all aspects. From the property's stunning creekside beauty to the incredibly friendly and accommodating staff. Our room was located in the lodge on the top floor and had a stunning view of the beautiful red rocks behind the property. We fed ducks in the morning [don't laugh, we're city girls], star-gazed with Astronomer, Dennis Young, and jacuzzi'd under the stars until midnight.We were celebrating my daughters birthday and graduation combined, and discovered champagne and chocolate covered strawberries waiting for us when we entered our room. Every member of the staff we passed during our 2 day stay greeted us with big smiles, and the concierge service was impeccable. Staff gratuities are included in a daily resort fee, so we never had to worry about reaching into our pockets for bills.Cottages are all the "rage" at L'Auberge, but we actually think our room was the best value. If I were to invest in a cottage, I would only get the best...which are the units facing the creek [I think those are like $1500.00 a night...ouch]. The other cottages don't have views, so I can't see the point of paying the $600.00/night price tag. We spent just over $250.00 a night [inclusive] and couldn't have been more pleased with our room.On top of that, L'Auberge allows pets. I know...I know...at first you might be turned off. But once the kids leave home, our pets become our babies and management at L'Auberge understands that. While I didn't bring my dog, I could have. That goes a long way for pet lovers.Thank you L'Auberge for your 5 star service. You truly deserve all those diamond awards hanging on your walls!We'll be back. You can count on it.My wife and I just checked in yesterday for our 30th Wedding Anniversary getaway. So far this property is AMAZING! We purchased a package deal for 4 days and 3 nights through Travel Zoo. Valet met us on check-in and were fantastic. They made special accommodations for our bicycles as there really wasn't a place for them at our detached cabin. As we walked around the resort our first night we were astounded! Beautiful creek side sitting areas, serene creek running next to the property. Bottled water placed for guests throughout the property, what a simple but thoughtful gesture.Out Vista cottage is amazing as well with a beautiful view of the red bluffs from our private deck.Unless something changes drastically during our stay, this is definitely a 5 Star rating! I'll update if anything 'falls apart' or I feel the need to reduce the rating for any reason.Thumbs up L'Auberge De Sedona!We've just returned from perhaps the most enjoyable resort getaway I've ever experienced! The L'Auberge De Sedona is absolutely wonderful, in every way. As other Yelpers have mentioned, the staff members were genuinely friendly, addressed us by name and were anxious to help make our stay as enjoyable as possible at every opportunity. The property is perfectly located on the banks of beautiful Oak Creek with lots of trees and privacy yet conveniently located within walking distance to downtown Sedona.  If you prefer, the resort provides free transportation anywhere in the local area. The view of the red rocks is obstructed in some areas due to the trees, however there are rooms on the upper level with balconies that appear to have fantastic views if that is what you're looking for. The Spa Cottages are individual units with a fireplace, deck, luxurious bathrooms and of course the private outdoor showers! As others have said, there's nothing like showering in 22 degree weather, after soaking in a hot jacuzzi tub! The small, intimate bar in the main lobby is a wonderful place to enjoy a cocktail or glass of wine and visit with other guests. We had two delicious meals (don't miss the pumpkin cider bisque) and wished we'd have eaten in their restaurant rather than one in town where we were very disappointed. The resort fee covers gratuities for housekeeping, valet, shuttle service, bell hop, etc.  All you have to do is arrive, relax and enjoy! This was a wonderful place to spend my birthday, I felt pampered the entire time and hope it becomes an annual birthday celebration tradition!Just got back from a "mini" honeymoon for a few days.  Awesome location, service and dining.Sedona is a beautiful place to go to this time of year and we truly enjoyed the creek-side cottage we stayed in.  The sound of Oak Creek running by was added music and we were able to focus on each other and not worry about being taken care of.Thanks Staff at L'auberge for everything you did to make this a great quick getaway.The BrewersWe came with friends to celebrate my husbands birthday.   This was our first visit to Sedona. We were captivated by the beauty of the red rocks as soon as we entered the high desert.  As we drove into  Sedona, we found the steep driveway to L'Auberge De Sedona.   I knew upon stepping out of our car that we were in for a special treat.  The resort is situated on beautiful Oak Creek with ducks swimming about.  Porch swings and chairs line the bank of the creek for your relaxation. The pool and hot tub are set right off the exercise room. There is 8am yoga for no extra charge, as well as star gazing at night with a very knowledgable guide.  The spa cottages are spacious and warmly decorated, including a gas burning fire place. The large deck has a table and chairs and a lounger for relaxing.  I enjoyed a bubble bath in the  jetted tub that overlooks a beautiful outdoor garden area.   Feel free to take your shower inside or out! The room includes both options.  The setting is quiet and peaceful like a little slice of heaven.   There is a $25 per day resort fee which covers all tips except the dining room and spa.  Many hotels are now charging this fee and you get nothing in return. Our car was filled with bottled water every time we went out. All the staff were extremely friendly and helpful.  I highly recommend this hotel for a romantic getaway. We were fortunate to experience two days of beautiful sunshine and then to wake up on our third morning to a deck full of snow in March! It snowed all day and we went out and about to capture the scenery in the snow with the back drop of the amazing red rock. Don't miss this very special spot. Book your room now and enjoy the beauty of the hotel and Sedona. I'm already planning my next visit!We've come back again as we love it here! We just had to point out what a great job each and every staff person we engaged with does here at this resort. We were celebrating my husband's birthday July 4th and the resort was under remodelng so the staff had to accommodate under these circumstances. Everyone from the time we pulled up to valet....Makau, J.P., Beau, etc do a FANTASTIC job!!!!  Thank you! Many of the staff who do turndown or room service were so incredibly gracious...thank you to Edgardo.  Before our room was ready and every meal (which we love the restaurant and have dined there numberous times) we spent time in the bar area and CONNOR WAS SUPERB!!!! Thank you Connor for taking such good care of us each and every time we saw you. You made our stay great!  We so enjoyed our time with you while we were waiting for our room...you have an electric personality and super customer service. Thanks for also making sure our July 4th birthday dinner celebration was fun.  On that note...thank you to Gem for waiting on us at lunch and dinner --- you are the best!!!!!  Finally, thanks to Marlo - the manager - who made sure repeat guests such as ourselves ultimately would enjoy our dinner on this special evening. L'Auberge management....please express our gratitude to these fine folks!!! See you again very soon!!!!This is my new favorite hotel in the US. I loved how peaceful the entire resort is from the creekside dining and swings to the large rooms and balconies. All of the staff was friendly and helpful. The grounds are so clean and beautiful. They have a car service that can take you into town for dinner and they bring you bottled water and anything you need to the room. We felt so taken care of! The views are also stunning, the beds super comfortable, the jacuzzi tub and outdoor showers are amazing as well. Lots of luxury!I will definitely be back again. I want to go every year now. Sedona is wonderful but staying at L'Auberge De Sedona made it extra special. Give yourself a treat and stay here!Just stayed at L'Auberge for our second time within the past 10 months. We stayed in a cottage, which we liked very much. The option of the outdoor shower is a nice touch. Also , the staff was overall nice and helpful and the atmosphere is pleasing and relaxing. There were , however, a few negatives associated with this stay which we did not experience during the last stay. We were not aware that the property is undergoing a major reconstruction of the lobby, bar , kitchen, veranda and dining room area. The check in is in a temporary location and was a bit disorganized. The first morning we went looked for an area to have breakfast and were directed to the cheek side . A buffet was offered tag $35 per person. We did not want a buffet meal so we attempted to order from the menu. My wife wanted the" Chef's Quiche" and was advised that none had been made. She then tried to order one egg with toast and was advised that  the chef would not prepare that. We then asked what we were allowed to have from the menu and settled for some side orders. Having dined there for breakfast and riverside dinner during our last stay, this experience seemed unbelievable. We then noticed that the chef and cooking staff are operating out of a tent. Thus they are probably doing the best they can in view of their situation. Based on the breakfast experience, we cancelled or reservations for four at the creek side for that evening . Would advise anyone  considering this hotel during the next few months to be aware of the construction situation in their decision making process. Also, think the hotel should have advised those with reservations of the limited service and disruptions associated with it. No doubt, this will be an excellent choice for  a relaxing, upscale stay once their major project is completed.Holy fancypants, Batman! Sedona itself is gorgeous. Add a creek-side resort like L'auberge into the mix and you've got yourself a wildly romantic setting. I've been taking a lot of beautiful vacations lately, but this spot takes the prize. From the personal greeting in the lobby to the chic toiletries in our room, the entire experience was exceptional. If you're not impressed with L'auberge after just a few moments, you're either anti-romance or just one of those people who's never going to be satisfied. We stayed in a gorgeous "rustic" (hardly rustic with a four-poster bed and crisp, white sheets) cabin near the water. Yes, we could watch the ducks from the comfort of our front door. When we walked in, there was even classical music playing from the flat screen TV on the mantle. They even had dry firewood ready for us to throw into the fireplace at night - and you'll need it since it does get chilly once the sun goes down. Keep in mind that there's not much to do here besides spend time with your S.O., so if you're a little unsure about someone, this is NOT the place to go - the potential for awkward interactions abounds. Expensive awkward interactions. And don't bring the kiddies, 'cause they'd hate it. But I digress... If you are sure that you like someone (or even more than like them), L'auberge is the place to just soak in all the romance. You can get massages, drink champagne on the patio, use the outdoor shower, eat a fantastic meal at the in-house restaurant or just watch TV in bed. Although our stay was only one night, this was definitely a memorable spot. I would absolutely stay here again or at one of their other locations. Five-star service and accommodations for sure!Amazing French restaurant on the Oak Creek river. Not cheap. But worth the visit especially if you get to sit outside.The most beautiful and romantic resort I've ever stayed at so far! Wonderful service and the food at its own restaurant was excellent also. We stayed at the creek side cottage where we could see the beautiful creek and nature. The room was cozy with a fireplace and had an outdoor shower. The resort offers many activities and my favorite one being the duck feeding at 8 am. I know it's kinda silly, but the duckies are so adorable :) The place is just out-of-the-world romantic, quaint, lovely and an once in a lifetime experience. Thanks to my man, I'm a lucky girl!You get what you pay for, right?  That's what I'm told anyway.  During our Sunday brunch last week, we definitely spent some $$$ and it was money well spent.  The service is impeccable, the tables and chairs comfortable, and the  sights and sounds of eating next to the creek was super relaxing. The silver and flatware were top-notch, and of course the food.  That's why we came, the food!  Well at $54 a head plus tax and tip, I'm definitely anticipating some good eats.  And the chefs and entire staff delivered.  Everything was expertly prepared and seasoned to perfection, without a missed beat.  Usually I browse a brunch and find one or two good things.  Not here, everything was tasty from the eggs Benedict to the sausages and Mimosas  and Bloodys.  Even the coffee and OJ was far above par.
