Check it out!Had high expectations and was very disappointed. Service was sub par and sloppy. The room was fine and really liked the outdoor shower. But had a real issue getting our room cleaned the day before our departure. We slept in late and when the cleaning person knocked on the door around 8:30a we asked her to come back later. We left around 10a to go hiking and came back around 3p. The room was still not cleaned. We called the front desk for clean towels so we could get ready for dinner and let them know we were leaving at 5p so they could clean the room then. The cleaning person arrived about 30 minutes later and we asked her to come back at 5p. Had a great dinner at Elote and arrived back to the room around 7p. We were met with a pile of dirty towels and an unclean room. Delightful! Called the front desk to complain and no one answered the phone so scooted on down there in person. We explained what happened to the young lady at the front desk and she asked if we would like to speak with the manager on duty. We said yes and then had to wait another 10 minutes. We told our story AGAIN and she apologized and that was it. She did not seem genuine and just ticked us off even more. So sad! Stay somewhere else. Not worth the money. Sloppy and subpar service.This review is for the restaurant only. I'd probably need a sugar daddy to be able to stay at a place like this.The lunch experience at the restaurant outside is exquisite. My friend and I were seated right alongside the creek on a gorgeous sunny day, and were immediately served breadsticks with an insanely delicious dipping sauce. It was some sort of olive tapenade aioli concoction. It was so good, I had to order fries just so I could have more stuff to dip into it.We both had salads: the seared ahi tuna nicoise and the dungeness crab. Neither one blew our minds; I'd give them 3 stars at best.But the setting and the service have earned this place an extra star in my book. Now, if I can only find that sugar daddy.Side note: valet is complimentary and the attendants cannot accept tips. The fact that they are still so friendly and accommodating (try finding that back home in LA!) makes it all the better.The wife and I went to the Spa here for some services and relaxation.  The spa has a very cozy feel to it.  The services we both got were amazing.  It was fitting to be at the spa when we went due to the cold weather outside.  I would definitely go back!This place is pure heaven! From the second we arrived to the moment we left they made us feel like royalty. They personalized our entire stay, it was like the hole staff knew it was my birthday. Every corner we turned someone was saying "happy birthday" or congratulating us on our baby on the way making me feel extremely special! A beer was even dropped out of our bag as we arrived to check in and they ran to the bar to replace it for us immediately. We would have never expected that, so we were pretty impressed! Check-in process was so easy & quick and everyone was extremely nice and welcoming. We stayed in a lodge room because of our budget, we were a little bummed before because the cottages were so beautiful, but the lodge rooms were so nice and cozy we were so pleasantly surprised! We had a beautiful view and the bed was extremely comfortable. We were even greeted with chocolate covered strawberries & sparkling wine in our room, such a nice touch! We enjoyed couples massages at the spa which were incredible! I had Nora, and she was fantastic! Made me feel extremely relaxed and comfortable and I enjoyed every second of my maternity massage! We even made our own body scrub afterwards with a different blend of healing scents & spices which was such a fun experience! Breakfast, lunch, & dinner were all FANTASTIC at the creekside restaurant. Dinner was so fabulous I would give it 10 stars if I could!!! Everything not only looked beautiful on the plate, but tasted incredible! It was too cold to have our dinner by the creek unfortunately, but the next day we were able to enjoy lunch outside, and seriously nothing beats that creekside dining experience! The entire property is just so beautiful and serene. This place is perfection and went way beyond our expectations, and we will definitely be back!I stayed in this wonderful property on my last visit to the area.  The staff was professional, attentive and extremely helpful.  We loved the cabin like room (espeically the outdoor cedar shower!)The restaurant was delightful, the food was superb and the service was top notch.  My only complaint would be the slow service in the bar while waiting for a table.  But that aside this place deserves the great reviews.I highly recommend both the hotel and restaurant.JoyA few aspects of the hotel bumped the rating a star. (The restaurant, Day shift lobby bar staff, lack of microwave)My husband suprised me with a trip to Sedona for my birthday and did a great job when he picked this hotel to stay. We stayed 3 weekday nights. Staff was very attentive from start to finish, they include tips in the daily rate, which I usually don't like because staff tends to slack if they know they already have their tip, but it was not the case at this establishment. They have little electric carts to drive you up the hill to town whenever you want, just give them a call and they'll pick you back up. Staff is always ready and willing to offer advice of where to eat and things to do.Our cabin was cozy, loved the quiet environment down by the creek. We put our wood burning fireplace to good use. We didn't get to use our patio but we did take a stroll by the creek, just a few feet away from our cabin. Lots of seats by the water, to just relax and watch the ducks.We didn't get to partake in any of the hotels free activities, but we did score some cookies from the lobby in the evening. Yum!The bed was huge and super comfy. I'm not a lazy S.O.B. but I loved they had a remote control for the air conditioner/heating system. I was bummed they didn't have a microwave in the room, but we dealt with it fine.A few aspects of the hotel bumped the rating a star. (The restaurant, Day shift lobby bar staff, lack of microwave)We encountered a bit of rudeness from a male bartender during our first day and we had issues with the restaurant (see separate review), but it didn't ruin our stay one bit.There were definitely positives about the lauberge, but given the price you're paying per night and the reviews of the resort, we were not impressed. We first encountered nicole at the reception and if our experience had been that good the rest of the time, i woudl have rated the place much higher. We stayed in a spa cottage, which was a great room with a luxurious bathroom and outdoor cedar shower. The scenery by the creek was also a real treat for dinner, and our server, Cheryl, was very professional and hospitable. The shuttle driver, berto, was also a friendly staff member and was the most helpful of all the valets. However, these positives were few and far between. Our room had no mini bar beverages or snacks, so we were bound to the restaurant (which sat the terrace intermittently) if we wanted food - or we had to take the shuttle to restaurants in Sedona. We did take the shuttle one afternoon and asked to get a ride to a grocery store, which was 1.2 miles from the resort - they said the shuttle only transports within 1/2 mile of the resort. It took my husband calling back and speaking with the manager to make it happen. Second, we returned from a day out around 2:30 to find that our room was still not cleaned. Again, we called the front desk. There were a number of times when we passed the valet stand or entered the restaurant and no one acknowledged us. It was very uncomfortable. As another review mentioned, the tipping policy is confusing and leaves you wondering who to tip and when.Overall, the service was just not what you would expect from a top-rated resort and when you're paying upwards of $600 per night. While I certainly wouldn't classify this as a horrible experience, I would suggest to anyone expecting 5-star service to stay somewhere else.L'auberge is TOP SHELF !!!!!!There is not much to add to all of the glowing reviews below. There was not a single negative aspect to this peaceful, decadent hotel. It is expensive, and worth every penny. The service is unbeatable. You can call them for any thing you need - big or little. A few adds to others reviews... GET BRUNCH!!!  The brunch was so incredibly yummy, by far one of the best I have ever had. Sitting nestled at a quiet table by the creek, enjoying oysters, organic salads, prime rib, flourless chocolate cake, and endless mimosas. Wow. We spent one of the best days I have had in a very long time staying on the property all day on a Sunday.  Woke amidst soft cotton sheets with fluffy pillows, ordered mimosas from room service (they arrived in under five minutes), sat in fluffy bathrobes on the deck beneath the trees as the creek babbled by, dressed casually, wandered 50 yards down to the restaurant for a world-class brunch, shared quiet conversation as the sun dappled down amidst the trees, tossed on swimsuits to lay in the sun on the deck and read the NYT, meandered over to the spa for body scrub and massages, followed by more sunbathing, naps, and then an amazing dinner creekside with a fabulous wine list, delectable scallops and duck, and then back to those comfy slippers and sheets for a quiet night listening to the creek and cicadas. Totally peaceful.L'auberge is extra.ordinary !!!!!

review_content: This place is so well kept and the customer service is fantastic!  So dog-friendly as well, they gave my doggy a little welcome bag with treats and a travel bowl - how sweet!  The rooms are large, and feel luxurious, they smell like warm fresh laundry too, loved it!  The outdoor area was vast so London (my pup) could run around and play with other fur-friends.  We grabbed some grapes and cheese from Whole Foods not too far away, and sat outside in the sun and snacked.  It's beautiful here, and so affordable.  It's near the town shops, restaurants and trails are only about a mile away. I can't say enough nice things about this place, love-love!**One thing I was upset by, but management handled EXTREMELY WELL - I forgot my engagement ring like a doh-doh brain. I was sweating bullets, my fiance spent a fortune on it and I felt so irresponsible = (. I only realized I left it when I was already 2 hours outside of Sedona, when I called about my ring they said that house-keeping only found my earrings and other jewelry - NO ENGAGEMENT RING - my heart dropped to my stomach.  FUNNY THE HOUSE-KEEPER CONVENIENTLY DIDN'T TURN IN MY ENGAGEMENT RING BUT DID TURN IN EVERYTHING ELSE (LESS VALUABLE).  It's a beautiful custom ring, so I can imagine anyone would be tempted.  When I expressed my anger and disappointment, demanding to speak to house-keeping, it was somehow magically "found by the door".  Shame on the house-keeper that thought she could get away with it.  Either way, my fiance and I are sooooo grateful management handled this and got my ring back!We would love to come back here! Just don't forget your valuables hah!Stayed at Poco for a few nights in October. The staff was very nice and helpful. The views are beautiful. The breakfast and dinners were good. Our issue  was when we decided to go out on our balcony before dinner to have some wine and cheese and take in the beautiful views. Unfortunately the couple next to us came out to sit on thier balcony. Both of them smoking. The smell pretty much blowing into our patio the entire time. I called the front desk. Front desk said they can smoke on the patio not in the rooms. Bummer. I am not going to sit outside if there are people pretty much right next to me smoking. Also, the smoke was blowing into the rooms.We decided to go to dinner and sit outside to see the beautiful views. Great dinner until about four people light up right below us.  Waiter said people can smoke down on the concrete area below the patio. Dont see why Poco can't make the smokers move to the other side of the pond. Instead they are allowed to smoke right below people dining. You might as well let them smoke in the outside dining area. If you are a bothered by cigarette smoke Poco would be a bad choice.Poco I wish you could make a non smoking section for customers who want to sit on their patio and not have someone lighting up on the patio right next to them. I did find a few very nice smoke free properties during my three days at Poco. If Poco does not change their policy regarding smoking at least we found some places we can go to in the future.My first impression of Poco Diablo was very positive... the grounds are beautiful with views all around, the service on the phone was extremely courteous, and the amenities were plentiful.  When we checked in our rooms weren't ready yet (we were there early in the day to catch a wine tour) but the staff helped us put our luggage out of the way so someone else in our party could check in later, and they didn't mind a couple of people and a baby hanging out in the lobby/restaurant area until the rooms were available.Once we got settled in to the rooms, one thing because quickly apparent -  the walls are paper thin.  We learned a lot about our next door neighbors, and our neighbors learned a lot about babies hehe.  Our room overlooked a large outdoor fireplace, which attracted a late crowd.  This would have been fine, but for the aforementioned walls.  Every word they said floated up and into our room as audible as if we were sitting next to them by the fire.  Maybe I could have slept through all these things if the beds had been softer...All that said, the rooms were really nice.  They were huge, with a large desk area, fridge with counter space, a couple chairs, and lots of open room in the middle.  I wish we'd had time to enjoy more of the resort.  If I was looking for somewhere nice to stay in Sedona when I'm not just after the best price, I would probably return...as long as I could request a room farther from common areas ;)We just had a wonderful time staying at this resort, and the views are simply resplendent!From the moment we walked in, although it was late at night; the staff was polite, efficient, and cheerful.Check-in was a breeze, and the place was just serene. We could not have asked for a better place to stay in Sedona. We had a single story suite right by the Green, and the only minor annoyance that we experienced was the lack of nearby parking. We actually had to park at the other end of the row of the two story complex. Not too far, but a minor annoyance nonetheless. At first, I was concerned with security because mine was the only car over at that lot in a dark night, but my concern was unfounded - my car was fine in the morning.Speaking of the morning, when we opened curtains that covered the door to our private patio, we were greeted with just a marvelous view of the golf course and the surrounding mountains. Just simply spectacular!Our room was well appointed and spacious. Very ergonomic; especially for those of us that are workaholics and work during vacation times.My only quibble was the high speed internet was not very high speed. It was only good for checking email, but nothing else. Unfortunately, Suddenlink appears to be the only Internet Provider in Sedona, and they are constrained in their facilities. This may not get resolved anytime soon. But, for those that enjoy the atmosphere and the facilities, this place is top notch. The staff is just extremely congenial; especially William who handled our checkout. Another notable part of our experience was that all the guests we encountered, and had the pleasure of chatting with were just so friendly. I think they serve happy pills in this place. Even the couple whose wife was on wheelchair, whose vehicle I happened block with mine because we were loading up the car were just so patient and never minded the slight delay.I would truly recommend this as a great destination and a quiet respite from the hustle and bustle of life.As we were driving here I started to call around and the first place I called was Paco Diablo resort. I figured I might get a cheaper price by calling than booking a hotel through Hotwire last minute. I was right. Got the AAA discount and it was well worth it. For a room with a hot tub and it was awesome. The jets were OK and it was loud but definitely worth it for a one time thing. William who works the front desk or concierge depending when you come is awesome and so helpful. Make sure you tip when he spends 10 min mapping out all the sites for you.Stayed in one of their red rock view suites with fireplace, and really enjoyed myself. I had a little flock of ducks that hiked across the golf course from the pond twice a day to see if I wanted to share any bread with them. Be aware they will walk right in the room if you leave the screen door ajar. Nicely appointed room, phenomenal view of a gorgeously landscaped course, great breakfast buffet on the deck of their restaurant "T Carl's".As a side note, I extended  my stay an extra night (Saturday) and was given a steeply discounted rate without even asking. Gratuitous kindnesses like that go a long way with me.Two small complaints - the freezer in the mini fridge was essentially useless, and room service got two of four orders wrong.Overall, the minor complaints didn't detract from the sheer gorgeousness of the property. I'd stay here again in a heartbeat.What an amazing time at Poco Diablo. We selected this hotel based on the dog friendly reviews. Originally booked 4 nights but enjoyed it so much that we stayed another night.The grounds were amazing and our room was fantastic. Close to the doggie relief area, beautiful view of the golf course and close to the out door patio with fire place and water fountains.The customer service was outstanding, especially Mary at registration. My dog Max loved her! She was so welcoming and the food and food device was great. This will be are go to place when we visit Sedona again in a few months!My fiance and I stayed at the Poco Diablo Resort on August 14th, 15th and 16th. It wasn't until the 17th when we were driving through Nevada that my fiance recalled that I moved his collared shirt some where, and asked if I grabbed it. I immediately called Poco Diablo and explained what happened and that I left his shirt in the closet on a hanger. I asked that if they found it to please mail it back to us, obviously I would pay for postage as it was my bad. Last week I received the package with the shirt in it. The customer service they gave was incredible, the next time we are in Sedona, we will definitely be going back to this place! It was gorgeous, relaxing and just all around amazing!Thank you Poco!What a beautiful resort! I had a wonderful time here while I was here for my Brother and now Sister in laws beautiful wedding. The weekend we were here the weather was bad and rainy but it turned out nice for the ceremony so they were able to have it out by the gazebo. The photographer took a lot of pics by the nice red rocks and little streams as well as the pretty trees on the property. Our rooms were very spacious, we had the king rm with the jet tub. It had a nice couch, and a chair with an ottoman. The desk also has a nice vanity make up mirror that lights up with different settings.We also had a wet bar in our room. I really liked the round coffee table, it looked really elegant. The only bummer was that our bed could have been a Little more comfortable. It wasn't the worst we've ever slept on but it wasn't the best. All in all the resort did a wonderful job with helping my inlaws with everything, including the Service!  It was an enjoyable time, and a weekend of memories that will last a life time!Just checked in and immediately got upgraded to a king room with a spa inside. The woman working the front desk was so helpful and accommodating. I've only been here an hour an I have been blow away. This place is a must stay!We booked through a secret Hotwire deal and this was one of those times where we were happy with what we got. When we checked in... we automatically got upgraded to a king suite! That was so nice. We had a private balcony, fireplace, jacuzzi, mini fridge, and the room was spacious with high ceilings. The location is further from most of the very touristy parts such as a uptown but still close to a few trails especially cathedral rock. They offer free coffee and fruit from 5-8 AM but it's nothing worth waking up early for. There's a restaurant located inside but we never had the chance to try it. Very happy with our stay and I would be glad to pay the regular price.Stayed here with the boyfriend and absolutely loved it!! We were checked in by a guy named Garrett and he was so friendly and loved that we brought our puppy with us! The first night unfortunately our air conditioner wasn't working so the next day we called and were helped by a nice guy named Jon and he moved us to the suite right next door which was nice! We also got room service for pizza and there brownie sundae and Fernando brought it both times and he was so nice and the food was delicious! We loved our view of the golf course and also our room and how friendly everyone was! We will definitely be back and recommend it!Beautiful place with nice rooms - reasonable cost.  No shuttle service and not within walking distance of town however.My family and I stayed at Poco Diablo in May. It was an absolutely amazing experience. From the first phone call I made to the resort through our three day stay I was amazed by the hospitality. My favorite part besides the huge gorgeous room, breath taking view or kind staff was how above and eyond they went for my dad who is a Vietnam Veteran. Not only did we get a great rate but we also got a very sweet card thanking him for his service. It made his entire trip. Such an amazing visit and stay. We will be back soon.We looked at several hotels online to stay at and picked this one because our first pick sold out.  I am so happy about it!  This resort was perfect!  The staff at the front desk was extremely courteous and gave us a free upgrade!  We were traveling with another couple and requested to be put in rooms near each other.  They obliged with no problem what-so-ever.  They also gave us maps of the area and a list of great hikes to try.  Our room was very nice and clean.  Large, with a King bed, seating area, patio, and a jacuzzi tub!  We loved it.  I also really liked that there was a large closet with a full length mirror door.  Across from this was a little "bar" type area that had it's own sink and mirror- outside of the bathroom. This was nice so I could do my makeup in the morning and my husband could still use the mirror and sink in the bathroom.  The bed was very comfy- a little on the firm side, which I thought would bother me, but it didn't.  There were several areas for lounging- a couch, two chairs, and a small patio which lead onto the golf course.  The room was decorated modernly with photos of the Sedona area.The location is a little bit off the main road in Sedona, but that was fine with us.  We were still within 5-10 minutes driving of every place we wanted to go.Unfortunately, we didn't get to try the pool or hot tub, as they closed at 10pm and we were too late.  All in all, I would definitely stay here again!We came for a wedding in Sedona so our schedule was a little hectic. Housekeeping was not very accommodating. They came just before we were ready to go to breakfast (abt 9:00 am) and said they would come back. We came back abt 2:00 to get ready and the room was not done. They came again abt 3 and they told me they were leaving early and could not do the room. It was not a huge problem but an example of poor customer service. Other than that how did you like the play Mr Lincoln?  My wife is in a wheel chair so we need an accessible room. It was nice but a little crowded for the chair. Also the shower was VERY tiny.  The breakfast was very good and the view was good. Handicapped parking was lacking for the number of rooms available.  I might stay here again but may explore other options also.My biggest pet peeve when it comes to hotels are the beds. When your sole business is to offer a place tho sleep, the beds should be amazing. The bed was extremely hard. Woke up with a backache. The internet was spotty at best and their paper products were cheap cheap cheap. However, the room was clean and beautiful. The view from the patio was amazing.  Mary at the front desk was very accommodating.Stayed here for a wedding. The wedding started at 4pm and we got to the hotel at noon. We requested an early check-in since we had to get ready for the wedding. At noon, our room wasn't ready. Come back at 130pm and our room still wasn't ready. We were told which room we were blocked for so we went to the room and the room was clean (door didn't shut completely ). We come back at 230pm and were told the room still wasn't ready but then the front desk agent called housekeeping to check the room status and it was indeed ready.  The resort itself is nice. Pet friendly which is great. Just wished that we were able to get into our room that was clean 2 hours earlier.The telephone in my room is a Cisco IP 7940 office phone, the volume on the television doesn't work, concierge has never once answered when I've called, the front desk answers maybe half the time, and I'll be surprised if I'm even able to post this via their pitiful wifi connection. Based on the price, I expected more. The furniture in this suite feels like it was bought at the same place the phone was; a used office furniture superstore. Poco Diablo feels like a retirement community on barbiturates. Look elsewhere.I can not say enough good things about this place. Everything was amazing. I got married here and working with Jill was an amazing experience. The staff and the food were excellent. Will definitely be staying here in the future!
review_content_20: The rooms are super spacious and have great views. Pet friendly and close to everything, but far from the busy tourist section of Sedona! The restaurant has good food and well mixed drinks (I liked breakfast more than the dinner). But the star of the show is the massages.This was a bday surprise, so I unsure of what to expect. I was initially disappointed that this was not a spa and the massage rooms are located within the tennis court area and gift shop. However, once you go into the room, you are transported to peaceful, tranquil realm, you completely forget. I had the Healing Energy massage by Kim. It was spectacular and very healing! She was an expert and dare I say it, I think a bit psychic.The resort fee is a ridiculous charge as it only covers 2 water bottles per day and tennis (the charge is per day; per person).Offering complimentary coffee goes a long way. I was waiting for my husband while he was in a meeting. I asked one of the employees for a cup of coffee and the reply was "I'm going to have to charge you for that". I gave her a $20 and she asked if I had smaller Bills which I didn't. She gave me $17 back and said she will forget the coins I still owe her since she didn't have change. My coffee had the flavor of coffee cooking in a pot for awhile. Another suggestion would be to invest in milk froth machines and cappuccino machines. I would gladly pay for a good cup of coffee and would feel like I was indulging in a resort setting. The other thing I would suggest is to count your cash drawers in private. In 24 hours I saw cash being counted on the counter In front of guests 3 times. Entire cash tray out on the counter being counted. At a resort. Positive notes: loved the view from our room. Bar tender super personable. Front desk clerk helpful.Delightful experience. Clean, quite, comfortable. Definitely will return.My husband and I had a blast here. I only wish we could have stayed longer. The pool and hot tub were set at the perfect temperature. Wifi connection was excellent and it was so close to uptown! We will definitely be back !This is a beautiful resort to take your dog too ,Wide open spaces with lots of walking.A great dog park with river next to it..Green green, trees and 3mim to townStay in the 400 rooms and run on golf course at nite...Reservation agent Olya was wonderfulAs were Front desk upon check n..The fella and I booked a night here through Booking.com and thought it was a nice place. I upgraded our room through Booking.com a couple days prior to our arrival, and the front desk staff answered my emailed billing question almost immediately. Check-in was easy, the room was pretty big with a gas fireplace and a whirlpool tub, and everything was very clean. Some of the lower walls and the tub were a little scratched up from age, but otherwise it was fine. Our room overlooked the little golf course and had a sizable balcony with a table and chairs (unfortunately it was too cold out to use!). There were the standard issue coffee maker with coffee, hair dryer, and bath robes. I think this is the first place I've actually taken any of the toiletries with me afterward -- I love the lotion they provide.We'd forgotten to pack toothpaste so I called the front desk to ask if they had any for sale. The guy at the front desk arranged for someone to drop two complimentary toothbrush & toothpaste sets at our door 10 minutes later.T. Carls is the on-site restaurant which served pretty darn good breakfast for a reasonable price. They also serve dinner and I believe lunch, but we partook of neither. We ordered a pizza and beer through room service pretty late; both were enjoyable and arrived quickly.Poco Diablo Resort is a nice place to stay and a good value for the price, and fairly close to town. We experienced excellent customer service and would stay here again.Loved this resort! The rooms are new and very nicely furnished. The view was amazing!! Very nice staff who are very helpful.Had dinner tonight at Poco Diablo Resort. I am a local and a foodie. Ordered shrimp cocktail, crab cakes, ribeye steak, and poblano chicken. The crab cakes were terrible-no crab. All bread. The waitress got our salad dressing wrong. The ribeye (ordered medium) was cooked rare and was flavorless (tastes like old dirty grill)! Overall a bad experience. I do not recommend the food at all-terrible! I spoke to the manager and she only made excuses and failed to comprehend that there was a problem (hello McFly!). Wine was good.We stayed at the Poco Diablo for a wedding plus mini vacation and we really enjoyed it! Overall, nice large room, decent food, gorgeous property, excellent massages & very nice accommodations for the military! We brought our two dogs and stayed in a king pet-friendly room with the military rate. The room was huge and had a large jet tub! When we checked in they gave us a cute doggy bag with cookies for the girls. And in the room we were welcomed with a very nice card & fruit/cheese plate. For active duty, they also waived the resort fee and gave us a daily credit towards room service or the restaurant. There was a cute little outdoor seating area with a fireplace and a large grassy area for the dogs right outside our door. We each had a 1hr massage, which we thoroughly enjoyed. The golf course looked nice, but we don't play so no comments there. We ate at the restaurant (T Carl's) for dinner our first night and the food was pretty good; we had the salmon and ordered a bottle of wine. We ordered room service for breakfast and the omelettes were good and pretty big.This place is old school, comfortable, nice. The staff are amazingly friendly and down to earth. They allow pets here so lots of guests were walking the grounds with their dogs, and the grounds are lovely, with a golf course, if you're into that. I was here 3 days and my routine was to leave early and go on hikes and see the sights, then come back, jump in the pool, soak in the hot tub, then have a lovely dinner on the patio overlooking the mountain served by nice ladies that remind me of my mom. Very relaxing!Awesome hotel! We ended up staying here a few weeks ago after our plans to camp in Flagstaff were foiled by a snow storm and there was no availability to camp in Sedona. They were able to get us in last minute and were very accommodating with the dog in our group. The hotel and rooms were excellent. Right outside of our room was a fire pit, an area where we were still able to cook our "camping meals", and a picnic table. All of this was overlooking the golf course and beautiful red rocks. The rates were even reasonable, as they were able to match the rates from Hotels Tonight. Although we typically don't stay at resorts, we were very happy with our "glamping" experience, and would definitely recommend this hotel!When we pulled up to the hotel, it didn't look like much. But, WOW! The room was huge and elegant. The decor had a natural and elegant look to it. The grounds were gorgeous! The best part was that they were a completely dog friendly hotel. They had "pick up" bags everywhere for your convenience and lots of space for our dog to play. Additionally, there were no stipulations such as "don't leave your dog in the room alone" so we felt perfectly comfortable walking around town to the less dog friendly places while leaving her in the room for an hour. The restaurant was decent but overpriced. The view and peacefulness made it worth it but the food wasn't anything to write home about. I shared the fruit platter and an omelette with my boyfriend (the fruit plate was around $11 and the omelette was around $10)This is a great place to stay if you want a resort feel and your dog by your side! I wouldn't recommend this place if you don't like dogs - they are everywhere!Beautiful hotel , wish we had more time to enjoy as we were only there for 1 day , beautifully nestled in between red rock , very majestic . People were friendly and attentive. Great deals on hotels.comComing from Holland we had an issue with another property and the Poco Diablo Resort was a last minute reservation. They made us feel at home, comfortable, and welcome. From the phone reservation, to check-in, to check-out, the service was amazing and when we return to Sedona we will definitely stay here. The grounds were beautiful and the scenery outside our room was spectacular. Thank you for a wonderful stay.We spent two nights at Poco Diablo Resort and really liked the resort. It was clean, the receptionist was very friendly, the location was good and it was quiet. The resort was spotlessly clean, the room was really nice with a office area, the beds where really comfy, nice shower, toiletries, kettle, fridge, safe and flat screen tv , free wifi , and a back yard people that was open during late house. The reception staff are all professional and gave lot of information on what to see around town. We didn't eat breakfast there as it seemed a bit expensive and there are lots of restaurants in the area that serve breakfast. I would certainly recommend this resort to anyone visiting Sedona.I will definitely be staying here again! The female manager was fantastic and very helpful, the ladies who cleaned the room were fast, efficient and friendly, and Mario the waiter was great! My children LOVED Mario. He was so friendly and nice! We had an awesome view of the golf course from our room. Highly recommend this resort! Can't wait to return.Booked a last minute stay at the resort during MLK weekend and could not have had a better experience. Everyone from the front desk to the wait staff at T Carl's were extremely friendly. This resort is also very military friendly and I would highly recommend it. Thank you Poco Diablo resort!Booked a room online through Travelocity, but found out from the front desk attendant that we could've received a better rate by booking directly with the hotel since we were repeat guests (lesson learned for next time). In a town full of $300+ per night rooms, this hotel is one of the better values in Sedona. It's been recently remodeled; the rooms are nicely decorated, very spacious and clean. The beds are very comfy too. The king suites have a jacuzzi, fireplace and a beautiful view of the mountains/golf course. The location is good, just a short drive to the center of town. Tip: if you're a member of the military or are a veteran, mention it upon check-in and they will deliver a fruit/cheese plate to your room. They also comped our breakfast at their restaurant the first time we stayed. Although it wasn't very good, at least it was free and the views were A~MA~ZING! Will definitely stay again. Maybe next time we'll bring our dog since it's pet-friendly :)For a "resort", this is definitely not what we expected. The rooms are set up motel style. We had a standard double queen room overlooking the golf course and above the pool area. It was pretty quiet and mostly clean, however we kept finding rogue hairs on all the linens (sheets, napkins, etc) which is a HUGE pet peeve. Though the rooms left something to be desired, the grounds were immaculate and very pretty. Though not very large, we wandered around a bit and stopped by the creek which is tucked behind the villas. Very peaceful and the hotel's hidden gem in my opinion. We had a quick drink in the lounge then ate dinner on the patio at T. Carl's. The meal was good but the ambiance made it that much better as it was a beautiful evening and for most of the night we were the only diners outside and had a private serenade from a lovely guitar player. The staff was friendly and welcoming and we checked out the next morning to head to breakfast in Tlaquepaque which was a two minute drive up the road. Not sure we'd stay here again but for a one night mini-cation from Phoenix it served our purpose.Awesome experience. Comfortable rooms. Excellent view. Very friendly and accommodating staff. Managers worked hard to please.
review_content_40: What a great find.  Decided to stay in Sedona and had our dog with us.  We tried several hotels and either no pets allowed or they wanted $50 extra for the one night.  I went on Yelp and put in pet friendly in Sedona and found this great resort.  The woman at the front dest was so nice.  We are just outside of the grassy, raked, clean pet area and they gave me a gift for  Sharky!  Our room is large and has a huge jacuzzi, free internet, comfortable bed, and is clean.  The price was fair and we will sleep well tonight.  Thank you.My bf and I stayed here for a one night mini vacation. My expectations of this place were definitely exceeded! The resort was nice and clean. The staff was very friendly. The room was big, clean, and modern. The view from our little patio was amazing. About 15 minutes after we checked in, there was a knock on the door and it was a complementary cheese and fruit plate as a gratitude for my boyfriend's service in the military. We don't have any complaints about this place. It's very central to the downtown area. We would stay here again for sure!My boyfriend and I stayed at Poco Diablo this past weekend, and overall it was a great stay. We had his dog with us and the dog-friendly nature of the resort impressed us from the get-go. When we checked in we were given dog treats and a travel water bowl, and then our room was in front of the dog-friendly outdoor area, which made it easy to have her with us during the trip. The room and amenities were nice. My boyfriend thought the room was going to have a king size bed, but I guess the hotel didn't see needing a "dog-friendly" room on his reservation, so they had to scramble to find a room. We ended up having two full size beds, which is obviously not a problem, but took away some of the luxury of the stay.Also of note, neither of the hot tubs seemed to be working properly. The one closest to our room was lukewarm and the jets were broken. The main one was also lukewarm and the jets squirted obnoxiously everywhere, which wasn't exactly relaxing. When I stay at a hotel one of the things I look forward to most is the hot tub, so it was disappointing to have such mediocre ones.Beautiful place!  Danielle in reservations set up our group of four couples with gorgeous rooms (upgraded from the room rate we paid for), king comfy beds, fireplace, kitchenette, deep jacuzzi tub, couch, patio... It was so wonderful!  The pool and hot tub area was clean and had quick poolside service!  The drinks and food were really delicious, especially the strawberry margarita, hot wings and shrimp cocktail!What a wonderful resort to stay at in Sedona -and it is only about half the price of other resorts.The location couldn't get much better, it was about a mile away from downtown Sedona and all the shops.  It was also minutes away from great hiking and exploring.The rooms are surrounded by a small golf course, tennis courts, pool, Jacuzzi and tranquility.  Our room had its own Jacuzzi tub, huge living area and outdoor patio that opened up to the golf course.  What a great place to drink wine as the sun was setting.The staff was friendly, there was a concierge that helped with maps, hiking trails and other information.  I highly recommend this cozy location.Rooms: 5Location: 5Value: 5Restaurant: 3Bar: 2There are many options for lodging in Sedona and I've stayed at most of them, this place just rocks. Friendly staff, adorable, and very nice accommodations. They have a  fun 9 hole executive course right on prem, and they don't charge you an arm and a leg to play it. Also 5 min drive into town. A+A pleasant experience. Room was nice and clean, lots of counter space. Pool was pretty good as well. A very family friendly resort and nearby things to do in Sedona.This is a really nice hotel where you can tell they made the effort to remodel the place into something special.  I'll try to keep this easy...Pros: -Check-in went smoothly and whomever checked me in was very informative and helpful-Lots of parking, and it's free-The rooms are large, super clean, and have recently been remodeled-Didn't really hear the neighbors-Mini-fridge-Free Wi-Fi-Allow dogs and they even get their own little doggie-bag with treats-Check-out went smoothlyCons:-Very noisy air conditioner-Outside areas were not so clean-Can hear people walking by outside-Sleep Number beds are overrated-$25 pet fee-Pet rooms are in a little cove of the hotel with no view (our room looked at a wall)It is not located in the downtown area, so you will need to have a car to get where you need to go.  There is a restaurant, pool, hot tub, fitness center, tennis courts, and a golf course on premise.I really enjoyed my time here and think this is a lovely property.  I got a great deal on my room, but after looking at some of their pricing online I might have to say that it fits in with the rest of Sedona - overpriced for what you get.  This is why I'm docking a star.  Perhaps if you stayed here several days and really made use of the facilities the price would be more fair.  But I don't play golf or tennis- I would rather pay less for the room.I would stay here again, but would need a deal in order to do so.Great location, nice rooms, decent restaurant. We really enjoyed our stay here. The staff are very friendly and helpful.Stayed here with 2 kids and a pooch. Very friendly hotel and had all the basics. We were quite surprised by how delicious the lunch was we ended up eating on site there yesterday. Not too badly priced for hotel food, and really quite delicious. They say they're dog friendly and they're not kidding! They are so welcoming to furry family members and those guys received treats and pets around almost every corner. We will definitely come back the next time we come to Sedona.The rooms were large, the decor is dated but the beds are comfortable. The views are great.  and it's a great location, but the restaurant is mediocre. My main problem is that they added resort fees when we checked out. We didn't use any amenities. I assume most nicer hotels in Arizona should have pools and not charge for using them, but regardless we didn't use the pool at Poco Diable. I'm not sure what the "resort fees" covered since we weren't told at check-in that we'd have to pay resort fees...or what additional resort amenities were available to us. At check in, the staff claimed they wanted our card for incidentals. They should have just told us they wanted our card to charge us extra fees. The hotel was OK, but we won't be going back. We moved onto an Air B n B situation and were much happier. (No surprise fees.) However, I would recommend it as a pet friendly place. Our friends who also stayed with a large dog were very happy with their experience.I stayed here for an anniversary. The staff at the hotel went above and beyond. As soon as we were greeted in the hotel lobby we received a goody bag for our dog. The resort is very pet friendly. We then asked for some great trails to hike with dogs and we received a wealth of information. The room was very spacious and the hotel grounds were very clean. We also received a happy anniversary card and a complimentary cheese and fruit platter. I would defiantly recommend this hotel!We stayed for 3 days and 2 nights. Place is nice with heated pool which was great for the kids. Rooms were nice and updated.The rating is because the restaurant food there is awful. I mean really bad. We went there for breakfast the first morning we were there and they had a buffet. Cheap for the kids, $6, but the pancakes had been sitting there so long they were stuck to the pan, eggs were nasty and the adults ordered off the menu. I choked down my biscuits and gravy, but only because we were in a hurry.The wait staff didn't really know what they were serving and couldn't answer any questions. A friend with us ordered half a grapefruit for breakfast and they brought her grapefruit juice instead.Overall, really great views, place was well kept and service was good. I'd go back to stay, but I wouldn't eat there.But, BEWARE.Not recommended. The facility is very nice, rustic, with nice features such as covered patio dining in the restaurant.  Room amenities are high quality and the rooms are spacious.  All in all our stay was a pleasant one for the wedding we attended down the road.However, at checkout the bill had extras tacked on for parking and wireless availability.  This was not for useage just for them being available.  I made a small fuss about these undisclosed extras but management acted as if this were the new normal.  Beware, add 20% to any rate that you think you are going to get for surprises when comparing hotels.I love the Poco Diablo!! We have stayed here multiple times and have been very pleased every time. Our last trip was Thanksgiving Holiday. We had a Poco king which has a King size bed, gas fireplace, sofa, chairs, large round table, mini fridge, and wonderful patio area that opens to the beautiful green grounds. There were a lot of families playing golf which was fun to watch.  We decided to open a bottle of wine and then remembered we didn't bring a cork screw or glasses (duh!). Called to the front desk and had it delivered to our room within 10mins. The guy even offered to open the bottle for us if we needed. I thought that was really sweet. Later that night we went thru the movie channels and although steep (19.00 a movie!) its all movies that haven't been released on DVD yet. I hit the wrong button and ordered a movie on accident. Another call to the desk and the movie was taken off our account, no questions asked, no big deal, done. The jetted tub was big enough for us both to enjoy a bubble bath together. Although it did take about 20mins to fill : /  in the end it was worth while. My only con is the restaurant on premise. We had a horrible experience dinning there for thanksgiving dinner. HORRIBLE. This is not our only bad experience with them. We made reservations for 5:00pm - we sat on the patio, it took 20 mins just to get our server to greet us! Fantastic, we are off to a great start! We ordered Prime Rib off there holiday menu. By the time the food arrived which was around 6:00pm I was ready to walk out. My prime rib was overcooked, tough, and all fat. Carrots looked dehydrated and like they had been sitting under a hot lamp far to long. They ran out of horseradish and said the cook was making more. It came out 12mins later once our food was completely cold. Our server never came back to ask how our food was.. Lucky her! She returned to tell us that, lucky us, all of the desserts had run out! AWESOME! No pumpkin pie on thanksgiving? Travesty. I requested our check. I just wanted out. Upon receiving our check I nearly choked. My husbands drink was 14.00!! For an old fashion! And they also took the liberty of adding on a 20% tip to our bill for the all time WORST SERVICE I HAVE EVER RECEIVED IN A RESTAURANT?!?! This is when I lost it! Requested the manager immediately. He was flabbergasted by my prime rib, the amount of fat was ridiculous. He comped the entire meal and asked if we would like meals to go, which was a very nice gesture. He actually thanked us for complaining because "if he doesn't hear WHY people are unhappy, he can't fix it." . Upon leaving at 6:30pm! our Thanksgivinng meal had been destryoed.I'm stunned this Poco Diablo doesn't have more 5 star reviews.  I thought they did an excellent job, albeit a bit pricey.The service was excellent.  I'll give an extra thumbs up for Charles and William but all the staff were courteous and accommodating.   Staying there felt like a vacation and a home at the same time.They treat their dogs like kings (OK, slight exaggeration).   Dogs can stay there with an extra fee, get a bag of treats, and even a Do Not Disturb sign designed for dogs.  The staff loved to stop and say hello to the dogs.Food is good.  They have a restaurant (T Carls) that is a good bang for the buck.   Normally, I expect overpriced blandness at hotel-restaurants.   Hey, look, everyone, it's my first five star review on Yelp.  And it 's  well-deserved.   I've stayed two different times there and both times they did a superb job.We stayed at this hotel over New Year's eve. It was a decent hotel that has had some remodeling done to the suites, but I wouldn't go around town calling a resort...The rate we got wasn't the best for the type of hotel and had I checked other hotels I wouldn't have stayed there.On our last day there, there was a dead roach on the floor, when I mentioned it to the gal at the front desk upon checkout, she said that she wished I had told them before and that since I had pre-paid for my room there was nothing she could do.How about offering and apology and thanking me for letting her know, after all, I wasn't asking for a refund, in fact when I mentioned it to her, I did it in a very discrete fashion. She was silly enough to make a big deal for everyone in the lobby to know... I guess they need to train their staff a little better.The rooms were large and the beds were comfortable, the resort is pet friendly, but the best part was the stunning veiws!  For the price paid I thought is was very reasonable my only complaint would be the on site restaurant,  not very good at all.We got a great room with a jet hot tub  in the room! Sedona is beautiful and this resort is just as gorgeous.  I plan on having my wedding reception here. There is a restaurant and golf course here too.  They are pet friendly and have an area just for your pets.  I didn't bring my pet and from what I can tell,  there haven't been pets in this room.  The front desk was so nice to us when we checked in.  They even called a local shop to see how late they were open since we needed a bathing suit! They also gave us a map of sedona and drew a path of how to get there. The bed is so comfortable.  We ended up watching movies on the free HBO for a while since it was raining out.  It was so cozy. There is a fridge and an iron in the room and we ended up needing both.  I also really like that they give you bottled water along with coffee and other expected hotel amenities. One thing I like is that the wifi requires no password or extra steps to link up to. It's actually a strong signal , unlike the weak signals we normally get in hotels.   We'll definitely be staying here again!The Poco Diablo Resort is an older resort that's been rennovated, with comfortable & good sized rooms. We attended a wedding here that was on the golf course under a huge weeping willow tree, the scene was beautiful.Our room was modern, with a nice bathroom & plenty of room to get ready. The shower was a bit dark lighting wise, but other than that we definitely enjoyed our stay & would return the next time we are in Sedona. For a little more than the motels down the street, it was a great value!
review_content_60: Poco Diablo Resort is a solid bet if staying in Sedona. I have my own reasons for giving it three stars, so I'll try to list out the goods and some drawbacks, below.The good: The resort is in Sedona, not too far from the action. The prices are reasonable, the grounds are beautiful and quiet, the WiFi is dependable, rooms are large and full of amenities, and the staff are very friendly.Needs improvement: The exterior look of the buildings could use some touching up. This place looks a little outdated. Also, the beds are the "Sleep Number" kind, but no matter what I did, I could find a comfortable setting. Finally, while the hotel is in Sedona and is peaceful, it still requires a drive to get pretty much anywhere. Overall, I am not sure if I would stay here again. I did book it through Hotwire, so I did not know what I would be getting in terms of the specific location. If I were to use Hotwire again and were matched to Poco Diablo, I wouldn't mind, but I think I would like to try other places if I did my own bookings next time.i don't even know where to begin with this hotel, spent $80 on a nye party ticket which was explained to me that there will be dinner included, which was not. charged me over$800 for pre authorization charges bc i made reservations with debit card that was not made aware to me. over charged me an extra $75 for the dog fee on top of the $100 i already paid.Great value and nice location.  It's within 10 mile proximity to the quaint Sedona Uptown and several famous attractions like Chapel of the Holy Cross, Bell Rock trail and the Airport Mesa vortex.  You can get a great view of the red rocks from the resort.  The facility is very clean and nice.  We really like the super King sized bed, firm mattress and the additional reading lights over the bed.  Room amenities are good quality.  We requested a quieter room and the receptionist gave us a great private, second floor location.  We paid through Priceline so no additional cost included.  Got free parking, complimentary bottled water and Wi-Fi in room.We plan on staying here again on our next trip to Sedona. We stayed there on a trip at the end of June. The price is excellent for the service and amenties. They have a decent gym, jacuzzi, pool and scenery. The service was beyond our expectations and the view,especially nearby mountains were jaw dropping. Right behind the hotel is Oak Creek. It was beautiful!! I got a great photo shots and enjoyed a small hike. The front desk provided us a map and pointed us towards Cathedral Rock for our first hike. It was so beautiful.  We are looking forward to staying at this hotel again.i've stayed here twice and no, its not five star, but its close enough to downtown sedona and yet far enough away to get a little of both worlds.  the rooms are HUGE and it feels remote and super dark....its peaceful like camping.  the brekky is decent but the gym is a little on the lower end though spacious.....it has tennis courts that i haven't used, but i did jog around adjoining neighborhoods which was niceWe had the pleasure of getting to stay at the Poco Diablo Resort just before our Fourth of July trip to Palm Desert.  We had a gift certificate for two nights stay.We got a nice room really close to the parking area, lobby, restaurant, pool/spa and workout facilities! Our balcony overlooked the ninth hole of their course.  Our room had two queen "sleep number" beds, very comfy, two sinks (very nice for the wife and daughter to get ready), flat screen tv, desk area and mini-fridge (it was roughly installed, but was cold).  the only thing we really missed from our room was a microwave.The pool and spa were really nice!  Several tables with cover and enough lounge chairs that several were always available.The workout facility was great!  It had free-weights, treadmill, elliptical, stair machine, steps and a multipurpose strength training machine.  There were plenty of towels and water to keep us on our workout schedule.  The best part for us, was the proximity of the workout facility to the pool, we were able to workout and watch our kids at the pool, win-win for us!We did have a good time at Poco Diablo, but there were some issue, the grounds around the pool needed a bit more attention.  Luckily we had already planned our weekend, the front desk didn't offer much in the way of recommendations.We didn't eat in the restaurant, but did have pool side service.  It was nice that a server came out to the pool area.  Our food arrived nice and quick, but without any condiments.  We survived, it was a vacation!Overall we recommend the Poco Diablo Resort, we had a really great time in Sedona and were able to get rested for the next day's events on those great Sleep Number beds!Location will be good again once the construction ends, but for now it's a royal pain to have all that noise and flag person in order to enter/exit the hotel.  Location is more run down from the outside than the inside.  I admit my first impression before entering the lobby was quite bad.  It's rather nice inside though, including the car and lounge area, as well as the mini golf course that the "resort" surrounds.Rooms were clean and somewhat small, but adequate.  Nice views of the fairways of the mini course, though you must know that one of the greens is at the end of the fairway right by the small parking lot, and they've clearly posted signs about parking at your own risk.  Also, the A/C is very, very slow in the rooms.Staff was very friendly.  Pool was decent, but not very inviting from first glance.  Selecting a room that faces the golf course would be highly preferable to one that faces the pool.Many ducks/geese on the facility so watch where you step.  Location is 5 minutes from the main downtown Sedona attractions.Was told it was built on a native burial ground?Hopi or yavapai?I loved this place! My BF, Puppy and I came up for a long weekend and enjoyed every moment of our stay! The rooms were clean, it was a dog friendly resort, the staff was so accommodating & friendly. Its in a beautiful location & the breakfast in their restaurant was delicious! I cant wait to come backThis place was very cool - able to get us in on a crowded holiday weekend last-minute in Sedona - and for cheap! We got a room with a jetted tub and gas fireplace for under 2 bills, and it sat right on the golf course. Tip: if you turn the tub jets on before the water level covers the spouts, you will spray a jet of water across the room. Try to get your gf/bf - it's so fun!The resort is beautiful and peaceful BUT the reason why I'm giving it 5 stars was because of the staff. Everyone that worked here was so nice and friendly and so accommodating. I had brought my dogs and they were so wonderful and sweet with my animals. I love pet friendly hotels and this place offers pet friendly dinning and menus for your pets as well as welcome gift bags for them. You also don't have to worry about house keeping letting your pets out accidently here, they have that covered too. I would love to stay here again and cant wait to go back to Sedona.I found this hotel to be a good value.  Our room was clean & except for the carpet, the furnishings, bathroom fixtures, and bedding seemed relatively new.  The staff was wonderful, very accomodating.  The concierge, Gene, was prompt in responding to questions prior to our stay and making recommendations. We slept well, the bed was comfy and our room was quiet.  We were only there one night, so weren't able to use the golf course or dining room, but my son enjoyed the hot tub. The wi-fi was free and worked great.Other reviews, perhaps on another site, have made statements about added charges.  We didn't experience anything like that at all; the staff was great.And if you haven't been to Sedona, what an amazing place!  We hiked up Bell Rock (only need a $5 Red Rock pass to park near rocks, and there is a machine that dispenses the passes right in the lot!), visited the Chapel on the rock, airport mesa at sunset, Cathedral Rock, and I recommend that you try to drive north along Oak Creek Canyon for a bit...breathtaking.  We didn't have time to do a longer hike or jeep tour, but hope to visit again and do so.Not worth the price! I'll start by saying the staff is really really nice and the location and views are nice too.. Ok, now the issues:The room itself was ok. We had paid for a jacuzzi and fireplace upgrade for our anniversary. Unfortunately, the water temperate made any showering or relaxing in the jacuzzi impossible! It goes from scalding hot to cold and back again without even touching the dial! The tv only worked half the time and would cut in and out. The food in the restaurant is also BEYOND terrible. Every single thing about our order was wrong. Plus, when I ordered a pasta with a "creamy tomato sauce" , it came soaked in Alfredo with a few tomatoes in it! When I brought it to my servers attention, he brought me marinara to mix in with the alfredo sauce over my pasta (seriously!) We had also extended our stay by a day, and even though we let them know that at check-in, TWICE during a day of our stay, even though we had do not disturb on our door, they knocked and asked us when we are checking out that day.  Also, the neighbor next to us was smoking cigars on his patio the whole time so we couldn't even open our door to enjoy the scenery. The first time I called the desk, the employee said as long as they are outside there is nothing they could do about it. A few hours later, I go to the desk to speak with a manager and THEN am told, that they in fact are not allowed to smoke within 20 ft of a door.  Would have been nice to know before we had to hide in our room in Sedona all day and not see the views. The gym is also out of the 1970s. Not at all worth the price.I stayed at this hotel during the late summer of 2010 and I enjoyed the service from the staff.  They were very attentive and eager to help in any way that they can.  I think that the hotel is a bit dated, but the management has made a good attempt at staying current.  But there are some minor gaps in the overall delivery of the premise. I know price has a lot to do with experience, so I'll go over that.  I paid $124/night.  They had a little devil special that gives you a $30 breakfast coupon.  When I arrived, I was told that I had to buy the little devil special rate with is $28 more.  So I showed them their website and how it appears, and they happily obliged, acknowledging that their website is confusing.  No problem.  So, if the $124 with $30 breakfast credit was the deal, then I got a decent deal.  If it wasn't, then it's fair market value for the area.  Again, the staff are extremely helpful and are always trying to help.  I enjoyed their attentiveness.The room we received was updated.  Clearly, it is newer.  However, the sleep number beds seem to be a great idea, but it's a bit odd.  I'm not sure if I really like the bed.  It seems to be a nice bed, but you pump up the air in it with a remote control.  The thing is that my wife and I like to sleep on separate beds sometimes- like on this trip.  It gives us a little more freedom to move around in the bed while asleep.  But with the sleep number bed, you can feel the center where the two sleep number air bags meet.  It's not horrible, but I'm sure these beds were expensive and I'm not sure if they're more comfortable than a nice traditional mattress. Another thing that bothered me when I got to my room was the nightstand clearly had crumbs on it.  They looked like cookie crumbs or something, but it should have been wiped down before we got there.  Not a big deal, but it just shows a little lack of detail by the cleaning people.  The whole room is nice and updated, but we did have this old fridge which stuck out like swollen, sore thumb because the fridge looked like it was from the 80's.  My wife needed the fridge to store her breast milk for our baby.  The fridge works perfectly (and had it been in my home, I'd be hesitant to toss a perfectly functioning fridge).  But it did stick out.  All in all, I enjoyed the hotel for the price I received.  I know for the area, the hotels appear to be a bit older and pricier than, say Scottsdale, AZ.  But we're not in Scottsdale and Sedona is a lovely city.Booked one night for my girlfriend's birthday. I chose the room with the indoor jacuzzi (which is awesome by the way) and on top of it I ordered a bottle of champagne and chocolate strawberries (was a pleasant surprise for her).The golf course view was really good. There is a restaurant in the resort with a nice outdoorsy atmosphere but you can also choose to stay inside. The waitress was very friendly. We really enjoyed our stay there. It was also closer to the shopping areas and downtown. In some previous year we stayed at Diamond resort (which was really good by the way except for the timeshare pushing staff but I like PD better), and it was a little bit further away. Oh and the sleep number bed was fun and comfy. The fire place would've been romantic but it didn't work.Now what I didn't like. Most of the staff we met were extremely friendly including the guy who checked us in, but when I asked him one innocent question he got a little bit defensive and wouldn't give us a straight answer. Later thinking about it, we thought that he may have thought that we wanted to change the room and I understand how much of a hassle that could be for them but he could have handled it a little better especially that we had no intention to change the room. It was just a curious question in case we decide to come back again.Our room also had a fireplace which didn't work and the jacuzzi water wasn't very clean. Unfortunately we discovered that after the water has drained and we realized the black spots at the bottom. Yes we were bathing in this relatively dirty water.These are probably isolated incidents and I don't think they happen to everyone. I just wish that before handing the room to us they would have checked those things.When I mentioned that to the guy at the checkout desk he took off the champagne bottle extra from our bill, no questions asked. We felt that this was adequate compensation and were happy. It's more the attitude than the money. The fact is we weren't looking to take money off (yeah we're that nice), mentioned it casually since we thought it was an accident, but he redid the bill just to take this item off.I would definitely come back again, and I don't think those problem will happen again. It was just bad luck (or so I think .. haha).Here I am in Sedona, AZ, toiling away at work, attending and presenting at a conference. It's hard work, but someone has got to do it!9 hole golf course, lighted tennis courts, pool, jacuzzi in the nice AZ fall air with the bright moon sneaking in and out of the clouds, quiet and peaceful, no noise and hustle of the big city.Whew, this is hard work! People get jealous of my traveling, but hey, I have to drive for 2 hours from Phoenix, schlep luggage around, bring my computers....it's not that glamorous, I tell them!I didn't expect much from a Radisson Hotel, as they are not my first choice for lodging. But this place is pretty nice. Amidst the majestic red rock mesa and rock formations in this scenic canyon, this multi-terraced property has everything you could want, and at moderate prices. The rooms seemed to have been updated recently, as the decor is fresh and doesn't show signs of wear and tear. They are pretty good sized, too, with his and her robes, fridge, king size sleep number bed with dual spot reading lamps, tasteful dessert tones, 2 lounge chairs and an ottoman. There is even a back door hallway that can adjoin 4 rooms together into one big party room or family habitrail set-up!There is a restaurant on site ("T. Carl's"), and a bar with several large screen TVs. There also a few meeting rooms and a ballroom for a conference. Free Wi-fi, free local calls, unlimited incoming faxes, free parking, a pretty decent deal. Although I got a group rate, the price was reasonable, too.I'll have to come back again when i am not working so hard! Hehe!I had a bad experience.  After our stay, the GM settled with us.  All I can say if you are in your 20's or early 30's, this is not the place for you.  They don't want you there and you don't want to stay here.  I have also read and heard first hand of people getting extra charges after checkout.  Claiming they had a dirty room or some other pathetic excuse.  Of course you can't argue with them because you already checked out.Sleep number beds are also a joke.  It's an over sized air mattress.I really enjoyed my stay here at Poco Diablo.  We brought our two dogs and upon check-in, we received a little box with doggie treats, a plastic bone-shaped container and a water bowl which all came in handy because we forgot our doggie bowls at home, not to mention super nice and thoughtful of the hotel (although they do charge a $25 fee per dog / stay, not per night).  The room was nicely remodeled, beds were comfy with super clean white sheets, there is a mini fridge and our room came with a jet tub, free Wi-Fi.  The air conditioning is a bit loud, but that did not bother me much.Restaurant not good at all, resort staff is hit and miss, if you stay here definitely go somewhere else for food!My son's wedding was held there, we were very happy with the resort.  The staff bent over backwards to help us.  We had handicapped members of our wedding party and they provided golf carts to transport our guest.  They had pet sitting for a golden retriever puppy.  All of our needs were addressed.  The resort is older but it is in excellent condition and well maintained.  The wedding package was the best value we found in Sedona.
review_content_80: Stayed at Poco Diablo Resort for my one year wedding anniversary. Room was great restaurant was a big disappointment. I am the assistant GM of a restaurant in flagstaff and We decided to try T. Carls because it was right there and didn't want to drive into town for dinner. We got to the restaurant and waited at the host stand for around ten minutes without anyone acknowledging us. At that point we decided to try the bar. I mentioned that it was our one year anniversary to the server and sat down and ordered a bottle of Pinot Noir. The server came back with a bottle of wine started opening it until I stopped him to let him know that this was not the bottle of wine that I ordered. He explained that he just grabbed a bottle of Pinot Noir. He brought back the correct bottle of wine and poured it for us. We then ordered food. As the server was putting it in my wife and I talked about it and decided that this was not a very good place to enjoy our one year anniversary dinner. I went to the server and asked him to cancel our order and we wanted our bill for the wine. The server did not care that we were leaving. Didn't ask about us leaving just said ok. If this happened in my restaurant someone would have got a serious talking to. I would give the hotel 4 stars but the restaurant service was really bad so overall they get one star. Probably won't go back.AWESOME!!!The only gripe about this hotel would be getting there, due to construction on the main highway, but it would not count against the the hotel, other than that grade A.Initially we were setup a standard room, but the wonderful girl at the front desk upgraded our room to the Suite knowing this was the first time being in Sedona. Huge room, Jacuzzi, Fireplace, Refrigerator and all other inclusive ammenities. The back has a patio that leads to the beautiful garden where squares and ducks freely roam around. Had some bread so I started feeding the ducks, before I knew I had 25 ducks near the room 'Oh Shit!' It was cool, throw some bread and these ducks literally catch them, let me say, there impatient because one little son-of-a-bitch bit me because I did not toss the bread to him. lolAll in All, beautiful and relaxing establishment. Must recommend. Oh yeah, free Wi-FiI expected a lot out of this resort. The pictures on the internet were nice, and its a Radisson so you would think it would be nice. We stayed in one of the suites that had a fireplace and jacuzzi tub in the room. The fireplace is a gas one that you flip a switch and its supposed to light. Ours didn't work :( Also, either the last person who stayed in the room before us OR the cleaning crew found it funny to point all the jets in the tub upward...So when I was leaning over the tub getting it all set up, the hubs flipped the switch and I got sprayed, make that doused with water, our room got sprayed and the floors were soaked. Not cool. They have sleep number beds in the rooms. It was my first time sleeping on one and it was one of the worst night sleeps I have ever had, super uncomfortable. When we came back to the room after getting engaged the hubs went up to the front desk and asked for a wine opener...he was given the run around and finally after 20 minutes or so the staff was able to round up a disposable wine opener after giving much grief to the hubs. They did take care of us at check out which was nice, but the whole experience just wasn't great.We stayed for one night and had terrible service from the front desk staff and had a bug alive in the bed.  This was not worth the $180.00 we paid to stay there.  On a positive note, the room service was fast.I absolutely LOVED this place!  I went for an alternative (gay) wedding and was treated so lovely by the entire staff.  Everyone is polite and they chef is MAGNIFICENT!!!  I don't play  golf, but I love to relax and I highly recommend this resort if you are in or near Sedona!The staff rules!  Jan was so nice and helpful.  She is awesome.I wasn't expecting much but this place was really clean, spacious and great.  Didn't enjoy the sleep number bed though. I'd come back again.Great experience at this beautiful hotel/resort in gorgeous Sedona!  First of all, we booked online (through American Express travels) for $134/night in July 2010.  Our plans changed and we arrived one day early -- and the staff offered us a walk-in rate of $119/night for the extra night we stayed AND gave us a free upgrade to their king suite!  The suite was gorgeous with a high vaulted ceiling, small patio overlooking the beautifully landscaped par-3 golf course, and jacuzzi tub. The resort offered a lot of amenities (fitness center, pool, spa, tennis courts) which we didn't have time to use.  Their restaurant, notably, offers food until 11pm, which was later than the vast majority of the restaurants in the Sedona downtown area.  The staff was super friendly and extra helpful.  The front desk person (was it Jan?) who gave us the free upgrade also gave us some maps of the area and pointed out the good places to eat and the popular trails to hike.  Very attentive!Just note that this resort is a few miles south of the downtown Sedona area, but not inconvenient to get to despite the construction on Hwy 179. Excellent experience for a great price (for this upscale touristy town)!   Would recommend and would stay again!Beautiful views, quiet, comfortable and affordable. They offer all the amenities you need a pool, small gym, golf course, and tennis courts round out the offering. While it is close to the highway (the tennis courts are right on top of it) it was remarkably well insulated and the proximity went unnoticed from my room. The concierge staff was helpful, knowledgeable and cheerful making great recommendations and setting up excursions for us. A stones throw from downtown and the beautiful views of Sedona coupled with the comfort and affordability make this hotel a great stay.its a quiet remote place for locals like me and I always enjoy going for the excellent service, sometimes the food is not quite up to par, but they try very hard. I really like the people the best.This is only for the restaraunt...NOT the hotel.  The hotel was average. Here is how the story goes...Once upon a time I woke up in the Poco Diablo hotel on vacation in Sedona Arizona, very hungry. I thought...I want a nice breakfast, attentive service, possible view to enjoy gentle conversation without being overheard from other patrons and not overly pricy! I want to eat something very yummy and a waiter who can deliver a fantastic latte to my liking! After much reviewing online I decided to give the Hotels restaurant a try as we had a coupon for 20%off. I walked up holding my breath hoping to see other people as you all know that if it is empty that is NOT a good sign...the patio to my liking was PACKED. ; ) We were greeted by a smiling individual who was kind and attentive and later I found out he was Charles McIntosh the restaurant manager!! He asked us for our drink need then sat us to be served under the care of Jose Mendoza. Very quickly after that he hand delivered the most BEAUTIFUL presentation of a layered latte I have ever seen. I was delighted and asked for another in which he prepared side table to show me exactly how it was done. I will be forever grateful for this as I love my coffee. Jose took our order and we were served in an expedient manner getting everything exact. My son and I are the particular ones and wanted special orders and my less maintenance husband ordered basic eggs and sausage. It was surprisingly inexpensive and the presentation pleasing. These two individuals must be recognized they are 5 STARS at best! The end.Your average room, decor and resort. Nothing to be impressed about- rooms are tiny, old, Golf course is rather small, no real landscaping around.Service was exceptional! We were greeted by a funny, sweet woman who upgraded our room and sent us a bottle of champagne. She also gave great tips for making the most of our only day in Sedona. She suggested a late check-out to give us the most flexibility. It was wonderful!. The service the next morning was equally as great. The restaurant sent us on our way with free coffee to go and  the concierge  was very helpful. The rooms show minor signs of wear and tear but the service and the price more than made up for that. Beautiful grounds!My husband and I stayed here for one night last weekend. I found this place after a lot of searching because I wanted a room with a jacuzzi tub and fireplace. The value was good, compared to the prices of the other hotels/B&Bs in the area. Poco Diablo is located in Oak Creek--great location, just a short drive into town, and very pretty. We booked an Elite Spa room, with a King size bed (Sleep Number--we were pretty ambivalent about the bed though others swear by it, but it was comfortable), jacuzzi tub and fireplace. The fire place is gas and has a little light switch that you flip. Kind of hokey, but nice once it was fully lit. The tub was a nice touch.
