But, like another reviewer mentioned, the jets were pointed upwards (or we didn't have the tub filled with enough water, not sure which!) and we ended shooting water all over the wall, floor, in our wine glasses...everywhere! I should mention that the tub is next to the nightstand, so it's pretty much in your living space. The room itself is spacious and nice. The bathroom was great, very large, and had a separate sink outside it with a mirror. Plenty of room to get ready without taking over the bathroom. Overall, I would stay here again. I'm a very picky person so I don't know that (short of spending $500+ a night) I would be perfectly satisfied with any hotel. But it was nice, the front desk was helpful, location great, gorgeous area, and clean. If you are looking for good places to eat, go to Open Range (Chicken Taco salad AMAZING!) or Orchards Inn (get the green corn and chicken tamales, they are great!)first of all, i would like to say that this radisson booked our hotel room as we were driving from the grand canyon or something ridiculous, at like 10pm. amazing! so nice! our room was a good size, with an enormous spa bath in the bedroom. awkward? a little. but believe i was in that sucker the minute my bags were down! we couldn't figure out the ac at first, but the people at the front desk were helpful when we called to clarify. the ac ended up being ok, not good enough considering it was 90 degrees outside even at 11pm. the bed was enormous and super comfy! the staff was also helpful in explaining the red rocks-where to go, what to look for, what they're all about, etc. it was great to get the info even though i kind of think that stuff is a sham.all in all a good experience!A nice place to stay- beds were very comfortable and room was moderately priced.  This is only a 3 star as there is no complimentary coffee or continental breakfast.  We did eat in the restaurant for breakfast only because it was convenient.  Food was fair and I feel expensive for the quality- typical hotel food!  The one thing that really irritated me, was that our reservation was for the Raddison- between my reservation and our arrival (about 8 days), the hotel transitioned and was not a Raddison any more.  We drove up and down the highway looking for the Raddison.  I finally called the hotel from the car and was told, the Raddison sign had been turned off and to look for Poco Diablo.  Would have been nice to have been informed before spending 40 minutes looking for the hotel.  This will not be a problem for anyone arriving now, but I was so irritated, I just needed to write about it.  Location is good- nice and quiet, away from all the touristy areas. I would stay here again, but bring my own yogurt and bagels.

review_content: Believe the hype. Affordable by Sedona standards (we paid $135 per night on a weekend), rooms are large clean and modern. Very central, two great restaurants across the street and a touristy cluster of galleries down the street.The person at the desk was Bill, and he was helpful and friendly. For the money, you'll do no better in Sedona.Okay, so I gotta be honest.  Based on the overall experience, I would have given this place 4 stars, maybe 4.5.  But when you factor in the low price I a high-cost tourist destination, it totally rises to 5 stars.  You absolutely can't beat a room in the heart of Uptown Sedona for $120 a night!!The owner was incredibly nice and helpful. He gave us maps and recommendations on where to go in town.  The rooms were super clean and had the amenities you need.  Our one gripe was with the bed.  Not only was the mattress itself not great (thin and hard) but the sheets were terrible quality. My husband would tell you that I'm a snob about sheets but the ones in the motel were not up to par,  they were scratchy and it kept me up much of the night. Other reviewers have commented on noise....we didn't find that at all,  it was quiet all night and early morning.  The views from the motel are killer and the location can't be beat.  If you want luxury, this isn't for you, but if you want a phenomenal value, definitely stay here.This was a great yelp find! The hubs and I stayed here for just one night but found the room to be clean and the owner very friendly. He gave us great suggestions on where to go around Sedona to see great views of the stunning landscape. And the bed was super comfortable for us. We both slept really well; the best on our trip. And the views outside the motel were spectacular. Definitely recommend staying here while in Sedona.Great views and awesome service.  Second time here and both times Don helped us out and was the one to check in.  He gave us a map, told is where the tourist attractions are, and let us know where the best places in town are. We will definitely stay here again.The best place to stay in the red rocks. Over the years, Ive stayed at much more expensive places in Sedona, but I have not stayed at any better for the price.Very clean and quite, well appointed rooms with comfortable sleeping, an in the middle of town location, with easy access, convenient parking and a friendly staff, this little motel is hard to beat.This is a true old style motor inn motel and at around 100$ a night (a little less in the off season) by Sedona standards is on the inexpensive side by comparison. As this is a market where you can easily spend in excess of 200$ a night.Like I said, you can stay at much more expensive places in town but why... This cool little motel offers one of the more pleasant stays around, and is way more relaxed and unpretentious than most of the lodging places in the red rocks. A solid 4.5 stars. Rounded up for being the cool place that it is.00226I loved staying at this place. It's very clean, organized, close to everything, and among the cheapest place to stay in Sedona. Hell, it might be the cheapest. During my Sedona trip, I was out exploring all day and just needed a basic room with a nice bed to sleep at night. Bummed this place is already booked for my upcoming Sedona trip. I recommend it fully.This was such a great choice for our nights stay in Sedona. It was the perfect distance from restaurants but not TOO close to the super packed town center. We walked across the street for lunch and tea. The location was perfect. Right in the middle of the most scenic part of sedona. The room was very clean and adequately heated in 20-30 degree winter weather. Appears to be locally run by some very nice people. I think our 1Q room was around $150.Went to Sedona for the first time for Memorial Day with my wife..or first overnight trip away from our one year old.After looking at prices for the holiday I was apprehensive because we just wanted a bed and a shower as we were going hiking and off roading. Well lucky us we found this place! First of all it was wayyy nicer than I expected. The owner is one of the nicest people I've dealt with in a long time. And the views from this place are amazing! It's a gem. Definitely recommendThis motel is amazing! It's clean and inexpensive and right in the heart of Sedona. The staff is extremely helpful and friendly and our stay here was very enjoyable. I will definitely stay here again!Location, location, location! Located next to the shops at the Hyatt resort. This motel is clean, reasonable priced, and good costumer service. The owners are very knowledgeable of the area, gave us great tips. The rooms were well equipped with Safe, TV, Microwave, Fridge, Coffee Pot, Coffee, hair dryer, Iron and Board. Free wifi. Check in 3 pm and check out 10 am. No online reservation. Beds could be better. No shampoo and conditioner. However, did have organic soap. No pool. Wifi was slow. And no breakfast but plenty of choices nearby. We just wanted a place to sleep and shower to enjoy hiking in Sedona, Grand Canyon and Antelope canyon. We were skeptical with the "motel" but after arrival we weren't disappointed. We will definitely come back.I've stayed here twice now. Once a couple years back and then last night. Clean, modern and quit. Very friendly and helpful host. No pool, but you didn't come to Sedona to swim ;) You'll be in the heart of old town Sedona. Every single room has a view!I have been around and coming to Sedona for a long time.  This is why you come to Sedona, relax, small local business owned by local residents, location, clean and comfy.  Stayed two nights and all was well. Bring your own stash of hotel shampoo but all else is here. Price is around $100 more or less but cheap for Sedona. I posted a couple photos, 30, 31, check the view from the from.Booked this place online at the last minute because it had good reviews, was cheap, and had a vacancy.  It's an old motel but very clean.  It reminded me of motels we used to stay in when I was a girl and they didn't have all the chain motels.  The only thing missing was that the bed didn't have a slot to put a quarter in!  That was a biggy when I was little,lol.The mgr. couldn't have been nicer and very knowledgeable and helpful of what to do.  Highly, recommend, especially if you like quaint and aren't really going to spend a lot of time in your room.  Very convenient to things to do.Such a lovely place to stay in Sedona.Bill at the front counter is just great. As soon as we arrived he gave us a map and great advice about where to go. The room and bed were extremely comfortable everything perfect in the room. The motel is set back a bit from the main road so you can hear the traffic but it doesn't affect the quality of your stay. It's the view that really blows you away- it's something else. This really is an awesome place to stay and you won't meet a nicer person than Bill.2nd time I stay here. 1st time was great--great value for price. Not a 5star chain but great basic room. 2nd time a/c went out. Host is always pleasant and helpful. Brought in a portable unit. Worked ok but very very loud--didn't allow for much rest. Coupled with a higher price made this stay feel like I should have looked around. Still recommend but I'll look around next time. Host and hospitality still gets 5 stars.We stayed here recently on our way to the Grand Canyon, and I would definitely recommend this place.   They don't do reservations online, so you'll have to give them a call.   They have a great location that is within walking distance of shops and restaurants, and a great view on their patio.   The owner was super nice and really wanted to make sure we enjoyed our time here.All-in-all, a good value for the money.  Conveniently located, great view from your room, and a nice covered patio.  Staff was helpful.  Parking in front of your room.  HVAC was good, bed was comfortable, cable and TV were good, and internet was good.  Only complaint was the lack of a comfortable sitting area in the room - two chairs with no arms and a small, short, round table.  A taller and larger table would have given you a desk for the laptop and for writing.  Not sure if would stay again unless I was only there while sleeping.Exceeds expectations! Big Bang for your buck!!!! Rooms are clean, comfortable and modern. AC and wifi!!!! Patio with great views!!! Why pay more?!?!?!  Owner is nice and helpful.Have to concur with the reviews above. Clean, beautiful rooms, friendly, helpful owner.  I don't know why you'd want to stay anywhere else. This is a gem!  Not what you'd think in a motel!The Sedona Motel is a beautiful place to stay in the heart of scenic Sedona, AZ. Staff and management are friendly and helpful. They really made me feel safe and at home on my first solo trip. The rooms are clean and beautifully arranged, and this location is close to everything you will want to do when you visit. Enjoy!!!
review_content_20: A bit nervous when I booked this  "motel" for our Sedona vacation but the location and price were so good I wanted to give it a try.  Firstly, set aside the word "motel" since this place is nicer than most of the hotels I have been to.  Suspect fairly recent renovation since everything seems on the new side and immaculately clean.  Flat screen TV (with HBO) fridge, microwave and coffee pot with GOOD coffee make this place just awesome.  Loved grabbing a cup then setting in their patio area with the awesome views while my spouse slept a bit longer.About a 10 minute walk to the main part of town which will save you a ton of time and frustration trying to find parking (trust me, don't even try it).  BBQ place next door is the best you will ever have!No pool so no noisy kids, no smoking anywhere-LOVED THAT! Close to the road but since Sedona basically closes at 8PM it becomes silent from 9ish to 6ish and even then it's not super loud.Note* no shampoo so bring your own but other than that everything you need is there and you really can't beat the price.  Highly recommend this place to anyone.This is a great budget-friendly motel just a few blocks away from the annoying touristy bustle of the main drag in Sedona. It has GREAT views from all the rooms, overlooking the red rocks. There is a small lovely patio area where you can watch the sunrises/sunsets with your coffee or wine. The wifi is great (fast, strong connection), the rooms and bathrooms are spacious and very clean. The motel faces the street, but Sedona completely shuts down by 11pm and so it's pretty quiet. This motel was the opposite of impersonal chain hotels. The proprietor was so friendly and welcoming and even lent my husband and I the use of his own personal hiking guide books and his national park pass. He was full of great hiking information and restaurant suggestions. I will definitely stay here should I find myself in Sedona again.I found The Sedona Motel by Googling best hotels in Sedona.  If you want a great location, a clean and comfortable room, which includes a refrigerator, coffee maker and microwave, all at a VERY reasonable price, this motel is for you!  The grounds are also in great shape, Bill, one of the owners is great and very friendly.  They also have a covered patio with a fabulous view of the red rocks, a fun spot to sit at any time of the day and enjoy the view.  Creekside restaurant is right across the street, we only were able to try breakfast and it was wonderful, plus another nice view as we dined.  We highly recommend The Sedona Motel and plan on staying there, the next time we visit.I had read the reviews on Yelp so my husband and I were hoping for the best. The best it was. The proprietor was very accommodating as we had to rearrange our trip more than once. Our room was huge and the bed was very comfortable. Bathroom was large and well lit. We had a covered carport which was great as it rained. We loved the area and found really good dining options across the street. I'm sure the resorts are fabulous but we really enjoyed the Sedona Motel. I cant imagine why we would stay anywhere else.You don't have to be rich to enjoy a good night's rest in a quiet, clean room in Sedona proper.  Staying at the Sedona Motel proved it.  It wasn't fancy, but for $110/night, we had a good sized room with a refrigerator, microwave oven, flat screen TV, free wifi, a coffee pot and coffee.  The front desk clerk (who also lives on the property) was knowledgeable, friendly and informative.  A hot shower after a long hike, and we were in heaven.  We will be back, and we will stay here.We absolutely loved this place!Clean, cute, gorgeous view very reasonably priced and very centrally located downtown. The owner (Bill) was available 24/7 for any questions we had. He even loaned us a few hiking books and gave us his recommendations which was soooooo helpful. He also pointed out a few great resturants for us which we went to and loved! Would definitely stay here again, great experience all around.This is the place to stay if you are visiting Sedona on a budget.  It was the cheepest place we could find, and right in the middle of the town.  The views are spectacular right from the room windows and the place was VERY clean.  There is also a great outdoor spot to enjoy your morning coffee and watch the sun come up over the mountains!  The owner  (who also was working the front desk) was one the most friendly, helpful, and knowledgable people we met in the area.  Next stay for us will be the Sedona Motel for sure.This place is great!! There so much within walking distance and very close to the Main Street with all the little shops. The dude at the main desk is extremely help and will get you an info you need about Sedona and surrounding areas. From maps to menus for dinning to loco hang out, so you don't have to do the tourist thing which I can only do for so long. Anyway, great place to stay!The Good:  Very clean and convenient location.  TV was fine, free wifi,  and the room was pretty comfortable with nice views.   The man at the desk was very cordial with a low soft voice that reminded us of a psychologist.  The price was lower than most in the area.  The Bad:  Neither of us slept.  The bed mattress was about 4 inches thick and when you laid on it, you felt as though you were lying on the springs.  I always carry a very thick foam topper with me so that helped some.  But even with that, I was so uncomfortable it was just useless.  Hubby likes firm mattresses but he awoke after a couple hours complaining about pain in his hips from the mattress.  We had hoped to get eight hours and go out for a day of sightseeing and hiking. But after only about four hours, we drove around and tried walking but no way.  We gave up and drove home, completely exhausted.I realize there are a lot of folks who don't mind the mattress issue and if that's the case, it's a great place to stay.  But for us (late forties btw) we won't be back unless the mattresses are upgraded.My first motel experience was surprisingly great. My motel room 35 was clean, free ice and WiFi. Bill and Don are always there so you can ask them anything about Sedona.  The location of the motel is perfect just near the "Y" so you can go uptown or west Sedona easy. I'll definitely stay here again when I'm in Sedona!If you're looking for a place to stay while you're visiting Sedona, you know that there are lots of fancy hotels around town.  Forget about them.Look at it like this:  Take an older, cheap motel.  Revamp the whole place so that each room has a nice bed, nice furnishings, a small fridge and microwave, and maintain it well so that it is absolutely sparkling clean.  That's the Sedona Motel.  It doesn't have those pain in the ass electronic door locks, but the analog pin card keys work just fine.  Sedona doesn't offer 3G service for iPhones, but there is wifi here.  Service is provided by a very friendly gentleman in the office, and you get the "cheap motel price" for a little place that is just full of awesome.No, nothing fancy here at all--don't expect lotions and potions and a complementary hairnet in the bathroom--you get SOAP.  Spartan Luxury, to coin a phrase.  This is the best lodging deal in Sedona, you get great, kind service, and you get it all for a song.Booked this motel at the last minute and had no idea what to expect.All expectations were met and exceeded.I was online searching for Sedona accommodation and came across this motel. Unfortunately there is no online reservations, so you need to call and the proprietor calls you back. I was skeptical.....until he called back within the hour. "Bill" who's deep calm voice wins you over before you hand over your cc info was lovely. $120 for 4 of us in a double room with no extra charge for a cot. Best deal in Sedona!The location is central and ideal. Right across from Ken's (best peach crumble in the world), a bottle shop and pizza. Just the right walking distance from uptown Sedona. The room was spotless and looked recently renovated. Microwave, fridge and coffee pot were on hand. Oh....did I mention free wifi!This place is a MUST for convenient, value for money.Go see BILL!!!!We booked here based on reading reviews online and it held up to its reviews and more.Booked for one night but added a second night when we arrived and saw the view from the motel .Bill is a wonderful host , gave us great tips on things to do and places to eat , everywhere he told us about was top notch ... He is a very laid back and pleasant person. The room was extremely clean !! Best nites sleep on my vacation , town gets very quiet and no worries over safety , felt very safe.Great price for a room with this view , located pretty close to everything.Take away the Frou-Frou, the lavender-scented toenail lotion, the 400 channel, air-conditioned TV; but keep the comfortable bed, thick bath towels, tasteful furniture and artwork, and genial host. Sum the two parts and you have exceptionally good value for your dollar.Now tour Sedona or Oak Creek in peace, knowing there's no better place to stay.Second time staying in the King Suite (sits just behind the main building)... can't beat it for the price! Great central location too! Don't get me started on the view out the front window as I write this...This is a diamond in the rough.  I know that the word "MOTEL" immediately brings all sorts of unsavory thoughts in a weary traveler's mind.  However, I read amazing reviews on another travel site about The Sedona Motel.We had never been to Sedona and upon driving onto Highway 179 we were floored at the rocks immediately.  As we drove into the heart of the town and past Tlaquepaque, perched at the top of the hill, across from Snoopy Rock was this cute little place.Clean.  Functional.  Central locale.  Budget Friendly.  Gorgeous Views!Not for high maintenance folks.  No mini bottles of shampoo, conditioner, lotion or shower caps.  No gym or spa.  Just the basics.  The biggest plus, was Bill, who checked us in and gave us a rundown on the best of Sedona.  We were given a map and orientation which was incredibly helpful for first time visitors.  I would recommend the Sedona Motel to anyone who asked and I look forward to staying there again on my next visit!What an accommodating motel in the midst of over priced resort in the scenic sedona, az. The manager gave me the grand tour and was super friendly, the beds were soft but comfy. the rooms (we had the 1 bedroom units in the back) were kept tidy and clean. I just can't say enough about this place.. WILL be coming back and staying here again..The location cannot be beat.  The man who runs the office (owner?)  was super friendly and helpful.  The price for what you're getting is amazing.  The beds were comfortable.  It was quiet at night, even being near the gorgeous patio.  The housekeeping staff did a great job.  There was a small empty fridge that we were able to use for yogurt and beverages to save us some breakfast money.  I also noticed they had a safe.  I had not a single complaint and would not hesitate to stay here again when I make it back to Sedona.Great location.  Very clean!  Very excellent value for the money.  Liked the covered deck that afforded a great place to sit and relax.  Wonderful man at the check in desk was very personable.  Only issues is that it was too easy to hear other guests and the shower head left much to be desired as it was more of an uneven trickle, but at least the temperature was good.  I travel a great deal, and this was the best drive up to the door motel I ever stayed.  Refrigerator and microwave were a perfect touch.  The bed was what I needed, and I felt very safe.  Make a reservation as I was glad I had because they had NO vacancy sign lit up when I pulled in at 6 pm.Just stayed at the Sedona Motel and I agree with the other reviews that its not the place to stay if you are high maintenance. Since we are not, it was fabulous for us. If you are going to Sedona to hike, dine out, and enjoy nature, then this place is perfect! Very basic but also very CLEAN. I also really enjoyed the hospitality of the owner who welcomed us graciously and recommended several great things to get us started on our trip.There is also a large common area with several tables and chairs where you can eat and relax and take in beautiful views of the red rocks; it's also a nice place to meet fellow travelers staying at the motel. Parking is also great- you park directly in front of your room. I'm giving this 5 stars because this is definitely as good as it gets at this price point! Great value for your money.
review_content_40: Convenient, newly refurbished, fabulous host.We were looking to spend 2 nights in Sedona and didn't want luxury but wanted clean, convenient and not expensive. We looked to Yelp and read reviews of the Sedona motel. We called and made a reservation and then drove 2 hours from Mesa. We found it easily - it is right on the main highway. Parking lot is easy, you park right in front of your room. I had mobility issues at the time we went so that was important to me.  We met Bill at the front desk and he lived up to his Yelp reputation. He was friendly, knowledgeable and was used to talking to people who have never been to Sedona. He gave us recommendations for restaurants and activities. We went to find our room and were pleasantly surprised. It was newly refurbished with a flat screen TV and nice bathroom. It was very clean too. Happy!The only things that were not a "10" were the king size bed was not as firm as I like (used to higher end hotels like Hilton, I guess) and the noise from the highway and the motel parking lot outside the door was surprising - not sure what the motel can do about that. If you are a light sleeper, bring earplugs! The customers like to stand by their cars or motorcycles and talk. There is a liquor store right across the highway and a great restaurant called Ken's Creekside. I highly recommend the motel and Ken's Creekside. In Oct, we paid $120 a night for a king bedroom with tax.  Bill was very up front that the tax is high in Sedona for tourists so don't be surprised!I hate to break the string of 5 star ratings here, but I just cannot justify that many stars for this property.  Yes, it is clean, convenient and a good value, but the same can be said for the La Quinta Inn Sedona/Village of Oak Creek, where I am currently staying.  The price point is about the same for both properties, but at La Quinta you get a free breakfast.  If you must be in/near Uptown Sedona, then the Sedona Motel has that advantage.One criticism I do have about this hotel is regarding street noise, especially in the morning.  All of the rooms face the main road, Hwy. 179.  It is not well insulated for noise.  If you are the type of person who enjoys sleeping in, you might want to pack some ear plugs; beginning as early as 5 AM, I could hear the noise of trucks lumbering up the hill on 179 north.  This was not a steady stream of traffic at this hour, but it did become more noticeable approaching the 7 O'clock hour.  Other observations:  the furnishings were dated, but all in good working order.  The rooms were clean.  The owner is very friendly, accommodating and helpful, as other reviewers have noted.  If this is your first visit to Sedona/Red Rocks Country, his insight and assistance will be helpful.  Sedona Motel is within walking distance of Uptown Sedona shopping & dining.  It is just a short distance downhill to the Tlaquepaque Shopping area.  There is even a trail head within walking distance, for those interested in a hike.Yes, I would stay here again! Heres the thing, average rooms but right in the heart of Sedona. Next door to Tlackapaque (ok who can spell that?) And yes, the owner was simply put, a really cool guy. He suggested a few places to eat, and really helpful about everything in general. You can step outside your room and see beautiful views, and there is a patio at the end with breathtaking views. Room had a fridge and microwave. Good shower, average motel bed. Sedona is pricey so for $100 a night we were quite happy.I wanna give this 3 stars because while the location was perfect, I'm pretty sure there were bedbugs in the bedroom.  At the very least, the room wasn't inviting, and all I ask for in a room is a bed and restroom, no bells and whistles.  But we heard the cars on the main road easily, the AC was extremely loud, and the bedsheets needed to be washed in our opinion.  The views were nice and the owner/manager was extremely nice, helpful, and knowledgable about the area, but the room itself was nothing special, even for a motelThe location is great - gorgeous views right infront of you!  Rooms are simple, but clean.  Beds are decent - it's a motel - won't say that they are the best I've ever slept on.  The owner, Bill, is super nice and helpful.  If you can't afford to stay at some fancy hotel, come to Sedona Motel.  I'd say this is one of the nicer motels I've ever stayed at.Great Hotel!!!! The room's are clean and if you're coming to Sedona to see the outdoors and don't  plan on being at a hotel/motel except to sleep and shower then I recommend this place. Note: bring the following because it's not supplied in the rooms: Shampoo.  If you have a problem with it not having Shampoo then I will sell you all the $100 mini-shampoo bottles you want because that's the difference between this place and the next closest priced motel in the area. The owner is very nice and is usually working the front desk. He is very very helpful in suggesting places to see or visit and overall a really good guy. He also gave me a few books about Sedona and the Vortexes to read over while I was stayed here as I wanted to learn more about the area since this was my first visit. I was driving through the area around 9:30pm New Years Eve and he was closing down for the night and opened the door for me and said no problem at all and then proceeded to answer the 100 questions I had about the area, the vortexes, where to eat, have a drink. It's feels more like a mom and pop place vs the larger chains. No you don't get the spa treatments or continental breakfast but seriously if you want that then plan on paying a minimum of $100 more at any other hotel/motel in town or instead go to a place an eat breakfast which will save you beau coop bucks. I for one will be staying here again in a few months when I come back with my friends from San Diego.  The rooms range from $79/night  to approx $120/night for a suite. I promise you're not going to find a better deal because believe me I checked!!  I would also recommend calling ahead to reserve because he said he is usually booked solid for weeks in advance. I gave the Sedona Motel one $ because it's the cheapest around and 5 stars because for the money you cannot beat it and the rooms are very clean and the owner is more than helpful with all aspects of my stay and answering my questions. Enjoy your time in Sedona and the Sedona Motel.

review_content: Phil and Janet, the owners, run a great Bed and Breakfast. Their establishment literally transforms you to seclusion to enjoy the views. They serve a to die for breakfast made by their son and Phil is a seasoned chef as we dined on eggs florentine today. We unfortunately had a flat tire. Not only did Phil hear out my problem, he drove me personally to his friends auto shop to get a compressor to bring back because it was a holiday weekend and all the tire shops were closed. He made breakfast for the mechanic for helping me out. This was on a Sunday mind you during Labor Day. The accommodations for their rooms were unbelievable. They were open, yet had their privacy. This isn't a put together by budget room, couch or bed. It had furniture in there you'd want in your home. Customer service is a lost art, but not by these owners. I will be writing a positive review for the mechanic that helped me out as well. Thanks for making us look forward to our next vacation here, we will be loyal to the Chateaux!Way too expensive for the room or service.  It was Valentine weekend and we should have booked ahead but I was trying to surprise my bf with a last minute trip to Sedona (he had never been).  When booking I inquired if they give any discounts for AAA or  Military veterans.. They gave us 7% off so the base rate was $279, (which is still the most I have ever spent on a hotel room).  Last year alone (2014) I have stayed 30 plus days in Sedona and never paid that much or been treated so poorly.  Real Bummer.When we checked in (no one was there for 5 mins), the gentlemen arrived spoke to my bf not me which was odd since it was my booking and I was paying. He told him while I was using the restroom that we should have called?  Why should we have called?The room was ok, the electric fireplace is really tacky.  Scratches on the wall and the outdoor lounge chairs looked like someone just got out of them complete with nice dirty butt prints.  My biggest issue is that they are constructing 2 more suites right adjacent to our suite and the construction began before 9 am so we couldnt even relax in for a bit.  I would NOT have booked the room had I known that fact.  (the grounds are obstructed by the construction too, so you cannot enjoy them as well either)Breakfast was crap.  A small bowl of fruit with melon, orange juice from concentrate?  I can get better at the Days Inn.  We asked the kitchen if I could just have a piece of fruit or something since I am allergic to melon and they said no that it was premixed. The "gourmet" breakfast was cold french toast with mushy thawed frozen fruit on it.  I am not going to eat that. I asked again about any other alternatives and we were told sorry.  The female proprietor came around to several of the tables but not ours and I made mention of that to my bf.Upon check-out, I conveyed my dissatisfaction and was confronted with an extremely poor defensive attitude of "what time did you wake up", "I wasn't in the dining room, I was busy booking plane tickets."  She said the construction was not supposed to start till 9:30 am and that she would have fixed me something. Ya that's bull and I saw the nice organic whole grain muffins she was chomping on at the desk, not the slop she was feeding her clients.  It makes me sad, that people do not care about customer satisfaction in such a high dollar tourist area.UNDER CONSTRUCTION: 04/22/15-? Don't plan on being here 7am-4:45pm because the noise is unreal.   With only 23 Rooms and Rooms 22 & 23 being completely renovated DO NOT STAY HERE until it's completed.Besides that, I Love everything about this place and can't wait to return when it's quieterWe had front row access to the most beautiful views of Sedona from the inn, which truly can't be beat! When we got there at check in time, front desk was closed (to run errands as there was a house emergency) so we patiently waited outside. It was cold and I wanted to get settled in.  Twenty minutes later, we were in our room! Don't get me wrong - the room was cute, southwestern, and very quaint! However, throughout my stay, there were things about the room that just didn't make me feel comfortable. For example, there was a lack of light in the living room, bathroom and bedroom. There were a few lights, but even when you turn them all on (Which by the way, you have to turn on one by one. There isn't one light switch that turns on two or three lights), it was so dim! I felt like I had to take a shower and get ready in practically the dark.  We tried our best to watch tv and lounge on the couch, but the couch wasn't very comfy. Even the bed looked pretty comfy at first, but the two nights I was there, I kept tossing and turning. I don't want to seem like I'm complaining too much - hence, the three star rating. The room was cute, the views are outstanding, you have access to hiking trails and it is a very small distance from restaurants, and the breakfast was restaurant quality! The first morning, we had breakfast burritos which were delicious and the second morning, we had french toast. However, when you pay $280/night, being comfortable should not be compromised.  So I'm not sure if I would stay here again if I visit Sedona.If it were left to just the room and accommodations, this B and B would easily earn 5 stars from me. However, because of the behavior of the male owner Phil, I have to give it 3. Twice during breakfast he talked us, which is fine, but these conversations mainly consisted of telling us why he does not trust those of the Muslim faith, and why he believes Barack Obama is a Muslim. Regardless of weather or not you agree with his views, this conversation is absolutely unprofessional and uncalled for. Other than that, we had a nice stay with nice amenities, and Janet and her son were both very nice and helpful, however we would not return because of this nuisance.Stayed at the sunset for a short but well needed vacation. Let me tell you...it's absolutely fantastic. Rooms and beautiful and have all the necessary items. The hot tub is beautiful which is rite next to a beautiful gas fireplace for the cold Sedona nights. The breakfast is beautiful and the owners are extremely accommodating for your dietary needs. Definitely a must stay for a nice relaxing get away.We really enjoyed the Sunset Chateau. The room was great. Very cozy and spacious. The bed was super comfortable, the bathroom nice and roomy with great products; shampoo, soaps,etc.Everything was clean and well maintained. Our only small complaint is that the breakfast is too limited. It would be great if a tray of rolls, Danish, etc. was available and maybe have 2 choices on the entrees. Otherwise, we would recommend this pretty B&B to anyone visiting Sedona.We stayed in the Casablanca room # 1 and it was lovely.  Quiet and peaceful.  Room was clean and hosts very helpful.  Breakfast was not quite what we were hoping for.  Poached eggs not our thing.  Not till the second day when we went halfheartedly with the breakfast of the day did we see another guest get plain eggs and toast.  Was looking forward to the french toast from reviews.   I think that should be made a little clearer to guests.  No one mentioned that.  We stayed for two nights.  Parking was easy right by the room.  Grounds were lovely.  Would stay again.After reading multiple reviews and scouring multiple travel sites for the perfect hotel, I decided on this place for our weekend trip to Sedona.  The hotel sits near the end of a very dark street off the main drag in lower Sedona.  The outside is rustic and charming, with redwood gates in front of each room.  The lobby is jammed packed with local artists creations, all for sale.  It looks a little cluttered, but there were some beautiful works of art.  We were greeted by a very friendly young lady who offered suggestions of things to do in Sedona while handing us our keys.The rooms are more like miniature cottages, yet attached by adjoining walls.  In front of each room is a set of chairs and a small table, along with some decorations to make it look homey.  There is also a beautiful garden with a walking path behind the hotel. Our suite was beautifully furnished and each suite has its own theme.  We selected the romantica suite.  A small kitchenette, a sitting room with a comfy leather couch, a breakfast nook dining area and a canopy bed are just a few of the accoutrements. The room was clean and neat, but had that smell that is synonymous with hotel rooms (travelers know what I'm talking about).  A nice jacuzzi bath and stone-tiled shower were also present.A few things that prevent a five star rating:  I found spider webs in the corner of the ceiling in the bath room.  I also found some bright red stains on the canopy drape of the bed, and one of the chairs at the dining table had a bad crack in the arm.We only made it to breakfast on our last day there, but it was well prepared and tasty;  a delicious bowl of fresh fruit and a savory breakfast burrito with tangy salsa. Overall, the hotel was peaceful, clean and met all of our needs.  And the view from the rooms is nothing short of breathtaking.  Should we visit Sedona again, we will certainly stay at A Sunset Chateau again.I really hate rating this B&B so high, because it will make it harder for us to get in the next time. If you want beautiful and calm, close, but far enough away from the hustle and bustle of downtown, this is it! Tucked up in the hills of Sedona, this gem is a beautiful facility. Our room, Bella Vista 21, had gorgeous views, as well as lovely furnishings. Look at their web site, rooms are described, pictures provided (and they are accurate) as well as the prices are listed. Many rooms have a jetted tub, which ours did, which was great after miles of hiking trails. The B&B provides EO Products for shampoo, conditioner, soaps. and skin lotion. They also provide a EO facial soap bar. Look up EO products, good stuff! We had never used them and are looking into buying their products If you're looking for the uniformity of a Hilton (where we normally stay) this isn't it. Each room is distinctly and beautifully decorated. You are close enough to stores, but far enough away. Breakfast is served from 8:30 AM to 10:00 AM, so, if you're like me and rise early (normally 5:00 AM), there's an excellent bagel store 1.5 miles away, NY Bagels and Deli. Opens at 5 AM in summer months, 6 AM in other months. Excellent bagels and pastry! Some days I would go there and just get coffee and read the paper in the morning so my wife could sleep a little later; I'm pretty noisy. If you have kids with you they have nice donuts at NY Bagel as well; not that I sampled them! :) Loved the bagels. Breakfasts at A Sunset Chateau always has a special entree, but you can always get eggs, etc. All meals were very good. You can eat inside, in a well decorated dining room, or outside on a beautiful patio. This is where you most likely will run into the owner, Philippe Buillet, where he is always present, asking questions. Then again, you might run into him fixing a sprinkler line leak! When you leave you feel like you have known him for years! Super nice guy, as is all of the staff! Beautiful manicured gardens. Salt water pool and Jacuzzi. We left it two days ago and are already looking at next year's trip, but for more days (we were there 4 days)! "Uptown" (what they call it) is 3 miles away, which is basically the tourist location, with hotels, stores, and lots of traffic!Take a 1/2 hour trip to Jerome, but be warned, lots of hills, and a mountain ride! . It may not be good for kids or older people, although I am 65 and did fine. Get a burger at The Haunted Burger! Excellent! Read about Jerome, cool history. Again, we loved A Sunset Chateau and can't wait to go back!This place is Amazing!!! We had awesome views from our private little suite. The service was awesome. They knew about all the best places to hike and a list of things to see. We had a hit tub in our room with a large shower. The kitchen was great and fully furnished with pots and pans along with all the dishes you will need. The gas fire place was so nice.  We already booked our second weekend in February. Many more visits to come.We loved our stay here! The room was immaculate. The breakfast was great. Friendly and accommodating staff. I would recommend it. There was a breathtaking view from every angle.Stayed here in March for a girls trip with my mom.  This place was amazing!! The owners and staff were highly accommadating and super friendly.  The place was very zen and peaceful and everywhere you looked you can tell they took careful consideration to the decor and peacefulness.  It's off the main road and super quiet, with stores only a couple of blocks away.  The rooms were very spacious and decorated with thought.  Even the towels were high quality. We had a patio outside our room facing the beautiful courtyard in front of the man made waterfall/stream.  So we were able to hear the water as we sat and relaxed.  The pool and spa area is all inclosed around landscape and trees and there is even a nice fire place to sit and enjoy under the stars.  Across the street is one of the trails that lead straight to one of the Sedona vortexes. Very convenient.  And if you climb to the top can see 360 degrees of the beautiful mountains.They also have hammocks to relax in and benches under trees, so relaxing somewhere isn't a problem.  We stayed for four nights and every breakfast we had was amazing! If you didn't like what was being served just ask and they will make whatever you like! Only downside for me was they didn't start serving until 8am and have a very small kitchen staff. So the meal took longer to get than I would have liked, especially if you want to go out and explore or hike for the day.  I like to get an early start!  During breakfast you will always see the owners walking around and talking to people and helping them make their time there the best they can.  They are very helpful and anything you need ask. They can give advise on the top places and where not to go! I will defiantly be coming back! PS... you pay for what you get!! ( regarding some of the reviews that said too pricey)Sunset Chateau is the REAL deal in elegant classy southwestern art experience on the grounds and our room was SO beautiful and relaxing and the decor set the mood for sweet heavenly bliss!   We stayed in the Room #1 which had an excellent view of the Sedona Rocks....BEAUTIFUL!   Well worth every penny!!!    The owners are a Family and hands on, very personable, nice, helpful and this owner family was on site every single day @ breakfast.  And the breakfast was home made chef  level cuisine, simply delicious!!!    The pictures of the B&B property are the REAL deal, what you see on the internet is what you see and get when you get to Sunset Chateau.Sunset Chateau was very conveniently located on the top hill in a secluded area but had access to various hiking trails, park, tennis, basketball, walking distance to shopping.  The mornings were cool and crisp perfect for morning walks!!!Our getaway dream come true was the BEST!   There are other B&Bs to stay at in Sedona, but if you are looking for quiet, elegant, artiistic, fun  and convenience for walking trails and quick trips to town....Sunset Chateau fits the bill!!!We would Highly recommend this B&B, when we return we will stay here again!!!Stayed in June 2015. I loved this place! Super clean, beautiful rooms, great service. Delicious breakfast. Feels very cozy. Beautiful property.  Convenient location to restaurants, food shopping, trails, vortexes. No complaints.I planned a last minute destination wedding that was on the property at this quaint amazing hotel. We stayed the weekend with friends and family. It was intimate, easy-going, beautifully landscaped and romantic. The views were amazing. I rented out the dining hall for an unbelievable price, hosted a reception for two hours with the assistance of a local chef. The price was unbelievable and the hosts did everything to accommodate our party. Now, -- guess how much that cost? Nothing. If you want a romantic weekend or a special reunion, event. PLEASE consider this place. It's utterly perfect. Oh,yes, it has all the normal stuff that hotels/resorts have, free gourmet breakfast, spa, jacuzzi tub, views to die for and its right in the middle of Sedona, but utterly peaceful and quiet.  My only complaint? I don't have a reason to get married again there!Found this B&B on yelp as a last minute overnight and was pleasantly surprised. The owners son checked us in and was exceptionally pleasant, friendly and helpful with identifying local hikes & restaurants in the area, even gave me a free stamp to mail a post card:)Our room and the public areas were decorated in an eclectic southwestern theme and I loved it. Our room had a large jacuzzi tub & small kitchen that made me wish we were staying longer. The bed was very comfy and there was even a mock fireplace that added a unique charm to the room. There was a sitting room with a 32" flat screen viewable from the bed. Breakfast was tasty we had eggs over English muffin with a hollandaise sauce and salsa. Coffee was Starbucks & great. You had the option to eat on the terrace outside or in, but both had a spectacular view.Would definitely recommend & would stay againThis bed and breakfast is clean and has a great view. Love the hammocks outside. Breakfast includes an omelette with ham veggies etc., instant oatmeal, cereal, orange juice, tea and coffee. The breakfast dining hall also has a great view of the red rocks.  Love this place except my only advice if you don't like firm beds it might not be the place for you.I highly recommend this place. The view from the rooms are spectacular. Lots of fun, centrally located. The Proprietors are very accommodating. The wife and I had a couples massage in our room. Very nice I might add. Breakfast is a real treat. Can't wait to come back. Love Sedona ThanksWe have stayed in Sedona many times. However this is our first time at Sunset Chateau. I found it by accident on the internet. The description on their web site made it look inviting. We stayed in the Vista Montana Suite. A large nicely decorated room with a patio that has a great view of the red rocks. The property has a number of paths leading to patio areas with lounging chairs and hammocks. The pool and hot tub provides a relaxing place among the flower gardens. The running streams and lush landscape adds to the ambiance. A full breafast is included and served in a colorful dining room or on the outdoor patio. Phillippe and Janet are hands on people, always available to chat or help with tours or dining suggestions. Thanks to Phillippe and Janet, Sunset Chateau is a hidden gem in the hills of Sedona and our new found place to stay.
review_content_20: I will stay here everytime I visit Sedona! Absolutely gorgeous location, vibe, art, decor, garden, and a friendly staff. Sitting outside on one of the many hammocks with the red rocks as the backdrop is amazing. So cozy.Sunset Chateau is as good as it gets! I've stayed in many places in Sedona but nothing has the charm of Sunset Chateau. The freshly made breakfast of high quality ingredients by a chef, the delicious coffee and juices while sitting at the top of the hill overlooking the gorgeous red rocks is just one great prize in this Sedona treasure. The owner, a lovely woman, greeted us at breakfast to be sure we were content. The sparkling clean rooms have new beds that are top of the line. The salt water jacuzzi awesome! Really, I can't say enough great things about this place. Take a drive and visit, you'll be blown away and booking a room!Stayed here last week, and had a beautiful time.  Stayed in the Bella Vista #20 room, and the views were spectacular.  It was a treat waking up and seeing the mountains first thing in the morning.  Breakfast could use some help (too salty sometimes), but it was extremely convenient when you want to get your day started. The staff was super helpful and accommodating, and our room was always cleaned.  couldn't have asked for more.This place has a strange mixed vibe of "resort" and family b&b.  It felt like a resort how there were so many communal spaces, driveways and entrances for each room, manmade rushing river, instantaneous service for breakfast in the morning, etc.  But then down-homey family b&b as far as the front desk service staff who were mellow and casual and sometimes helpful, sometimes not so much.The rooms themselves (we stayed in two different ones) were comfortable and super clean.  It seems outfitted for parties with lots of floor space, foldout beds, murphy beds, etc.  Although when we were there it was all quiet couplesNice hot tub which you can use at any time.  Only issue it is uber-chlorinated.  Turned my rings grey.Loved this place and everything about it. The owners and staff are friendly, the landscaping and room decor are beautiful. The breakfast was tasty and the vegetarians and gluten-intolerant guests were taken care of without the staff batting an eye! I plan to stay here again in the future! The only request I would have is to provide guests with robes for back and forth from the hot tub or pool.My wife and I booked this through a travel broker online as we were looking for a spontaneous weekend trip to Sedona.  The room was great and the staff were very nice.  Very nice location; we saw a Gambel's Quail family right in front of our doorway and hear coyotes at night.  The gardens on the property are very scenic and full of wildlife.  Bring some binoculars for bird viewing.  This property is also on the outskirts of town and some decent star gazing can be done from it.Booked the Bella vista room a month ahead of time.  This unit is located up the hill behind the check lobby and the views are amazing.  The room is very spacious and tastefully decorated.  Oversized tub for two was a godsend after a day of shopping and hiking.  There was complimentary breakfast every morning but we didn't take advantage.  Overall a very we'll kept property with a good amount of privacy, a nice pool and spa and several private chill areas with chairs, hammocks and lounges.  Great location right off the main road close to everything.  Loved waking up to a view of the red rocks every morning.  Would recommend for couples or groups.The room was very nice and spacious, the grounds were beautiful, the staff (owners?) were friendly, helpful and informative, the breakfast was delicious.  The only slight disappointment was that the wifi was not working properly - not really a big deal as we didn't spend much time on the internet.  Also - I left my rings in the bathroom when we checked out (wedding ring included), we got a call about an hour later that the rings were at the front desk waiting for me to pick them up - so I give them 5 stars just for being honest and having honest staff!  Thank you!!!!  We will be back.I highly recommend A Sunset Chateau. This BandB is an absolute gem! For the last 5 years my buddies and I have taken a trip to Sedona for a winter mountain bike trip. This year, we found A Sunset Chateau and were blown away by the accommodations. The breakfasts were fabulous and large enough to fill us up before our all day mountain bike rides. The owners were there every morning to offer up advice about the town or to just chat it up. The rooms are VERY new and clean. The wall beds are hand made by Phillipe (the owner) and are truly pieces of art .The hot tub and pool are gorgeous and feel very private. The best part is the view and of Sedona's amazing skyline.Totally a Southwestern experience.  The location is perfect and the scenery wonderful.  The staff is beyond pleasant and helpful.  Our room was tastefully decorated and with all the special attention to detail we were in awe of the level of cleanliness.  It was impossible to find a speck of dust (not that we spent a lot of time looking), but you can tell when a place is well cared for.  The owner takes time to greet her guests their first morning at breakfast.  It's a great place.  The breakfast could be expanded a little.  I'm very fond of food in general and each mornings breakfast had a Southwestern flare, my husband usually had to substitute with the offering of granola.  That aside...we loved the place.An all-around great experience.  My wife and I were there over President's Day weekend.  The rooms and facilities were cozy, quaint, and clean.  The staff were very courteous and helpful.  They go out of their way to help you with suggestions on what to do in the area.  The breakfasts were great.  We would definitely recommend A Sunset Chateau to anyone and would definitely go back.This is the most welcoming and beautiful B&B I have ever been in. The views are spectacular and the staff very gracious. And the breakfasts are delicious.(although the coffee could be stronger) It is conveniently located off 89W near great restaurants.  I highly recommend this place.We stayed here 2 nights for NYE.   The Adobe Romatica was a great room - nice jacuzzi and the view from the balcony was definitely worth the money.I booked the room 2 months well in advance and the conceirge staff was amazing responding quickly to all my emails.  They'll help you book dinners and plan activities.Unfortunately, the weather nixed plans of having a hot air balloon ride on our check-out day.  I was frantic but Rochelle helped plan a helicopter ride for us which ended up being better.  The service is amazing.  The breakfast was really really good.  My only complaint is that the walls were thin in my room.  I'm not mad though - most people go to B&B's for special occasions and i cant fault people for having a good time but maybe putting some more insulation or stationing the beds opposite sides.  I'm sure they felt the same way...It's all good.  I'd definitely come back and am a fan of B&B's!For my birthday, I decided to treat myself... What a treat!  This place is top notch, absolutely beautiful and the perfect location.   We arrived early afternoon, and just sat outside on the swing near the pool in the sunshine.  The grounds are well kept, hammocks, lounge chairs, even a small bed near the pool.  Everyone working was wonderful.  Upon check in, the gent immediately booked me a dinner reservation before I could finish my sentence, and got us checked in quickly, gave us maps and ideas for drives and walks.  The B&B is directly across the road from Airport trail, so we took that hike early in the AM, and it is an easy walk and beautiful!   Breakfast was served by the sweetest woman I believe we met all weekend.   Continental is there as well as a made to order breakfast.    There was a high maintenance woman behind us complaining, so we were extra nice to our server, as well as very vocal about leaving her a tip for working so hard (sometimes, you've just gotta set an example).  My only regret was not staying a week!  The rooms have everything you need, and you can even keep a little nosh for your late night wine drinking on the front porch or swing while you bask in the amazing view.   There were plenty of places to choose from, and I'm so glad I chose this place!My husband and I wanted a quick weekend get away for our anniversary.  We have been to Sedona many times and decided to try a Bed and Breakfast for a more romantic atmosphere.  The property is easy to find but is located in a strange area surrounded by the Humane Society, a mini-storage place, apartments, and a mobile home park.  On the plus side, there are many good restaurants near by and a natural grocery store just down the street.  Our room was well appointed and the view of the red rocks was amazing.  I had recently started an exercise regime so I was looking forward to the jacuzzi tub to soak my aching muscles.  I started the bath but was disappointed to find that they did not include any bath jell in the room.  Why have a wonderful tub with no bath products?  My next disappointment was when I pushed the button for the jacuzzi to start and nothing happened. My husband called the front desk and they told him to press the little breaker by the tub.  He did so but it switched off again immediately.  I didn't want to be electrocuted so I sat in hot water with no bubbles and no jacuzzi jets.  Not really what I would expect from a $300 per night room.  We went down to the jacuzzi by the pool, again hoping to help my aching muscles.  The water was not even hot, just luke warm but at least the jacuzzi jets worked.  My next irritation was the nasty smell coming from the armoire.  I hung my clothes in it but decided to leave the doors open so the smell would not get on my clothes.  I later wore one of my shirts and all I could smell was the mildewy smell from the armoire.  I promptly removed my clothes and lived out of my suitcase for the weekend.  Saturday morning we woke up refreshed and went down to breakfast a little early to have some coffee and discuss the time for our massage with the front desk.  We were hoping to move the time back a bit because we were going to book a tour that would conflict with the massage.  When we got to the breakfast room it was locked and several groups of people were waiting outside.  You couldn't even get in to the building to talk to the front desk or sit down or have a cup of coffee.  Right at 8:30 (a bit late for breakfast especially in a place where people enjoy getting up early and going hiking, biking, etc.) the doors opened.  Coffee, milk, juice and some dry cereal were available.  We were served a wonderful omelet but the overall offerings were a bit limited.  I went to the front desk to ask about our massages and before I even finished asking if we could change the time, the rude owner behind the desk, who would hardly take his eyes off of the computer screen, began shaking his head negatively.  He started to say it was too difficult and why did I want to move it.  I explained that our tour would be back at 2 and our massage was scheduled at 3pm.  Again, before I could even finish my sentence he interrupted me and said I would have plenty of time to get back and there shouldn't be a problem.  Obviously, if our tour was scheduled to return at 2pm and we were across town, and we were hot, tired and needed showers, there would not be enough time to get back for the massage.  The owner was very rude and kept barking at me about the time and it would be fine.  He finally said something like...well I guess I could call them but it probably wont work.  I was boiling mad and just walked away.  At no time during our stay did the owners ever follow up about the broken bath tub or follow up about the massage issue.  We ended up moving our tour to the next day and had our massages as scheduled.  The masseurs were amazing and are one of the only reasons I am giving this place 2 stars instead of 1.  One other thing to mention, the owners walk around during breakfast and stop at each table for a friendly chat.  Which I would normally think was fine except they would stand there and talk and talk and monopolize your breakfast.  It was really frustrating to see table after table have their breakfasts interrupted for 5-10 minutes while the owners tried to engage them in conversation.  Again, a nice hello and how are you doing would have been fine but to stand there and bother the patrons while they are trying to relax and have their breakfasts was just too much.  Obviously others have had good experiences here but I would beware if you are expecting a high end experience.My mother and I are on a trip to the Grand Canyon and wanted to stop in Sedona to break up the drive. I found A Sunset Chateau online. They are not cheap but I wanted a good experience for my Mom. They were efficient and friendly with the reservation and again when I called to extend by a day. The experience continued when we arrived with a warm greeting and lots of helpful info. I was slightly worried that their website over-stated things - but it doesn't! Lovely first-class rooms, well landscaped with beautiful views, fun art and decor throughout the property, conveniently located, and providing a DELICIOUS breakfast. It is not cheap but it is a great place to stay if you can afford it.Sunset Chateau bed and breakfast was amazing, beautiful hill top villa with a majestic view of the Sedona mountains. Loved the southwestern decor and casita style landscape! Thanks to Jean for your warm welcome and personalized greeting! Be back again soon.I wanted to take my husband to Sedona for his birthday, and after researching all of the hotels, resorts and bed and breakfasts in Sedona; I settled on A Sunset Chateau. What a wonderful choice that was! We were awed by the beauty of the location of this boutique hotel. We were even more inspired by the architecture, decor and grounds. My husband commented that it looked a lot like a Chateau he had stayed in in Switzerland, and we were thrilled to meet Philippe and discover that was exactly what the place was modeled after! Our room, Belle Vista, was LOVELY and the views were incredible. We savored every minute of our time there, resting in the hammock, soaking in the Jacuzzi under the starlit sky, dining on their outdoor patio, enjoying our delicious omelette at breakfast. It was more than I could have hoped for for my husband's birthday. He was genuinely overwhelmed! Thank you Philippe and Janet! We look forward to coming back!my stay here was my graduation gift from high school and it was fantastic. The owners are soooo nice and the place is beautiful. The pool overlooks the mountain, the rooms are cozy, and it is located near everything. I have been wanting to come back every year since! Oh and the breakfast was really good. When I was there they had a chef preparing the breakfast entree of the day or if the option doesnt suit your fancy you can always have the standard continental stuff that is provided. If you stay here you must try the pizano's pizzaria that is near by, MMMmmmm so yummy!Chose this place because of the rooms! Amazing patio with gorgeous view of the red rocks, the B&B has a vintage/rustic feel and the rooms are modern and new! Every part of this place has the Sedona theme tied in, so much attention to detail! We stayed in the premium casita, it has a kitchen, two tvs w/ DVD players, mini fridge, pots and pans, dishes, coffee to make for the morning, yummy smelling lotions, the list goes on! The family that runs the place is so accommodating! I could not find one thing wrong with the Sunset Chateau,  pool with jacuzzi and fireplace, super close to trails (teacup trail) and downtown Sedona! I am coming here again, felt like a 5 star resort with the quaintness of a bed and breakfast!
review_content_40: My wife and i simply cannot understand the plethora of positive reviews. From a cobweb-rich room with sunken mattresses to a curt, rude young owner, and the worst coffee with burnt taste, this place simply does not live up to its reputation.Breathtaking views, beautiful rooms, great breakfast. I can not say enough great things about this place.We stayed here two nights, and had different rooms both times. The adobe romantica room is the most amazingly romantic and perfect room I have ever stayed in. Each detail is considered and very well done. The jacuzzi next to the bed, the shower, the extremely comfortable and romantic bed... the fireplace (which is for aesthetics only, it doesn't give off any heat), the couches. Everything was great. Not to mention the view. Absolutely breathtaking. The grounds are nice as well. When we first arrived, we were a little skeptical because the building looks like a motel. The inside, however, did not. There is a pool and hot tub outside. The second room we stayed in was Pueblo bonita. It was on the second floor and the view from there was incredible. So incredible that we got engaged on the balcony there that night. The room itself was not as romantic as the Adobe but still charming and comfortable. The breakfast was insanely good. Fat slices of French toast with fresh fruit and eggs florentine. YUM.I'd recommend a Sunset Chateau to those who want a romantic getaway in Sedona. It really is worth the several hundred dollars you'll spend to stay.Loved this place!  The rooms really are as lovely as they appear on the website, and even though the place was full the weekend we visited, we felt like we were the only ones there.  The view from our patio was spectacular and we spent both early evenings there on the patio, taking in the view with a bottle of wine.  Breakfast is served from 830-10 am and shouldn't be missed.

review_content: It was a beautiful and wonderful trip... If it wasn't or the extra fees this place charges.... We booked two nights for almost $300 but when we got here they told us we had to pay a resort fee. Also we booked a king size bed but I wanted to change to two queens... Of course this isn't Vegas but I thought slight changes would be comped..... they "upgraded" us for an additional $10 per night... Yay...... Our total two night stay was a lot pricier than expected. We checked in the first night at almost 10pm because.... We were coming from far... The room was spacious, honestly expected a little bigger for the price... And it did not have a tub...  For a spa resort I thought it would have a tub so we can soak ourselves after hiking through the beautiful canyons with their soaps. The service was impeccable but due to the fact that we went on a monday and tuesday... we were probably the few patrons there hahaha! The front desk delivered a bar soap when I asked..personally haha and there is no ice machine so they deliver it to you. Anything you ask for is given to you hahaha but definitely is included in your extra charge.. remember that.On the website it says that we can use the pool area and the steam room but I couldn't figure out where the steam room was...and plus I was too tired after to look for it but when you're there please go look for it and use it on behalf of us.They offer a free appetizer at the restaurant. ONE free appetizer with the ticket... or it's "small dish" but you must purchase something. I, like another reviewer went out of spite to get the small dish because I felt like we were getting over charged. Luckily I did not have a problem with the view or the roof patio. Yes, it was freezing..but my mom and I wanted to have our full vacation experience so we bundled up and went up on the patio to drink our wine. Overall this place was great! I had no complaints, the beds were comfortable and the place was clean. The heater doesn't go over 80 though... I'm sure they have a reason. Their Wi-fi worked perfectly fine. They give you one free movie heehee.. I watched 2 but didn't finish it.... so it won't get charged HAHAHAAHA I just... really didn't feel good about the resort fee they charge or tell you when you get there...they should just state it when we book so we know and it doesn't surprise us. No ones going to turn away from the resort fee of about 20 dollars a day but...it's just an unpleasant surprise. Beautiful place with amazing views and breath taking canyons... Next time I'll make sure to plan thoroughly and research more. I recommend... IF you have money to spend.. after all it's a vacation!I will start with a negative and end on a positive. Upon arriving, we were tacked on a mysterious $20 resort fee, and explained that in addition to the rate we had payed it gives us a free app at their restaurant (so it forces you to go out of spite to get some of that 20 back, the spa, pool, etc). We were explained this supposedly gives an edge for competition in the area - in short, their place appears cheaper initially compared to surrounding hotels/resorts, but when you arrive you are forced to pay, what other choice did we have? Didn't help the staff didn't have the knowledge to properly explain it, making us feel duped. The fitness center is outdated. On a positive - the food at the restaurant we got lured into had good quality food as a saving grace with excellent staff and wonderful pianist. The room itself was wonderful with an extremely comfortable bed and amazing shower. You can find cheaper and better accommodation elsewhere. It's a shame, because it left a bad taste to an otherwise beautiful 5 star potential hotel.This review is mainly for my visit to the Rouge for a 3-4 day writing retreat that was being held in two of their big conference rooms. Also for eating in the restaurant.   When I was planning my stay in Sedona for a writing retreat, I was given special room rates to stay at the Rouge ($148 a night discount for retreat attendees). I'm on a strict, smaller budget so I declined and stayed at another hotel a small drive away. The Rouge is a really nice looking hotel. I didn't get to see any of the room accommodations but the conference rooms with their comfortable chairs, rooftop terrace, and restaurant were very nice. I had the buffet lunch in the Reds restaurant. The lunch was good and filling but of course with myself on a budget, my $15 could have been less spent by going across the street to the Safeway or to any other eateries around the area. But the Rouge is an expensive hotel and the price of the food is expected to be high as well.   From my point of view, The Rouge was great. The staff was nice and answered any questions I had.This used to be my favorite hotel with 5 star rating. Unfortunately I am dropping it to a 3 after my experience last weekend. (1) First off, I love their stand up shower next to the tub. The last few times I was here, they gave us a plastic place mate for use to prevent from slipping. It wasn't there.(2) When I reach for the complimentary shower items, they mistakenly gave us 2 bottle of lotion rather than the shower gel. I ended up taking a shower with a hand soap. (3) The luggage holder hidden in the closet was broken. One of the screws felt off and obviously it would not hold the luggage. Sigh....(4) The front desk was service by few inexperience teenagers. (5) lastly, their ventilation system in the bathroom was extemely noisy. We can also hear the water pipe shaking when our next door room is taking a shower. Eventually it woke us up 6:30am in the morning. Rating: this is the first hotel I usually make reservation at when I come up here to Sedona. Now...I am not too sure I want to come back again.What a nice little spot! Great location in Sedona. Walking distance to some great coffee shops and restaurants. Very nice spacious room. The shower was amazing. The pool and hot tub area were very nice. Spa was wonderful. I wish the facilities had been just a little bit bigger, but really I should not complain. It was very relaxing and peaceful. The esthetician I saw was very skilled. The staff was the friendliest I've seen at a hotel in a long time. The hotel ran a leap year sale- it was such a bargain! We will definitely be coming back to Sedona and will stay here again!* Good, clean room/bed/bathroom.  Quiet, pleasant stay.* Supermarket, Starbucks, Pisa Lisa Restaurant, all a few steps away.* One young front desk staff with an attitude that can make you forget that the rest of the staff was very polite.* Pet Friendly!  Pet fee not mentioned on website is $50 per pet, per night.* Imposed resort fee, you may or may not find useful.I'd stay here again, but have second thoughts only because of the snarky young guy at the front desk.This hotel is pet friendly & that's the main reason I picked it. From the outside its very beautiful with a gorgeous courtyard but the rooms need some work. Everything was clean but the bathroom was old & looked it & the towels were worn out. The furniture could use an update too & the biggest problem was the patio pet area. We happened to be in town when it was raining & our patio was soaked each day of our stay. The grass area was total mush & my dogs couldn't use it because when they stepped out each day it was a large puddle of mud. This was super inconvenient because we had to leave our room to walk them several times a day. I also paid a lot of extra money to have a pet area but we couldn't use it. The service was very friendly & the hotel is centrally located. I hope they update the rooms & redo the pet area.Wow is this place expensive! We stayed here for one night for close to $350 per night. Compared to hotels I've stayed at in Sedona where the price is closer to $150-200/night, the only differences I noted were:- Slightly fancier soaps and shampoos- Fancier ice buckets with tongs- Unique furniture and glassware- Granite countertop bathroom- Turn down serviceIs that worth another 200 dollars to me? For me it's not. In terms of noise level, I couldn't hear any of my neighbors next door, but I could hear some banging of the water pipes and the sound of the shower running from other rooms early in the morning. In addition, the A/C unit was really loud, and the A/C remote very non-intuitive, which meant it took quite a bit of random button mashing to turn it off.The bathroom itself was a large size, but the tiles in the shower were larger than typical shower floor tiles and too smooth, a possible slip hazard. The shower itself was an odd tub/shower combo. On one side was a dedicated tub, and right next to it was the shower head. It seemed like they added the shower head as an afterthought after tiling the entire floor and walls with the same beige smooth tiles. In addition, some of the grout on the bathroom walls had suspicious black spots on it... possible mold? The bed was comfortable and included a light comforter and 4 pillows. I had no problem falling asleep. The TV was a decent size and had a good selection of channels to choose from.Overall, this place is OK but for the price point, I'd rather stay somewhere else.I came here for a spa appointment but wasn't staying at the hotel. The grounds are pretty and the spa is immaculate and very pretty. They have a beautiful steam room, hot tub and sitting area. I had a hot stone massage with Gilda, she was German and was friendly and did a wonderful job. I have very sore muscle and felt amazing after. The entire experience was wonderful. Thank you!!!Too expensive for all the reasons I'm about to list:1. WiFi doesn't work (apple devices don't like to connect to the network for some reason... Ok, a lot of people have iphones and macs)2. Construction right outside out our window starting at 8 am.3. We were told the rooftop terrace was a great place to have some wine, look at the stars, etc... It was closed.4. Elevator was closed.5. Blackout curtains wouldn't close. Hello 5 am wake up call!6. Had to have our room keys reprogrammed 3 times. Remember how the elevator was out of service?To be to be fair, we didn't eat at the restaurant or use the spa and I guess they're nice. We won't be returning to try them.Don't stay here. Over priced. Total commercial reality at its best. All about the benjamins. You will not feel a spiritual energy here. Under construction. Pet fee 50 each a night and you have to have a real service dog like mine not a companion pet. Charged for coffee at restaurant if you take it away it's free, but if you sit at restaurant you pay 3 bucks a cup. Heavy equipment noise. Small property and way overpriced.  Comfortable beds that you jump out of from the construction noise! Hotel manager argued my sister over coffee charge. Total ass! 600 dollars for 1 night on 2 rooms with no bell hop, no wet hand cloths upon arrival NO PERKS AT ALL. And your pet room is just that a room that someone else's pet pissed up and they masked with deodorizer! Run away!Excellent service! Near our first room, portions  of the hotel were under construction during our visit, subsequently aggravating my fiancees allergies. When we brought this concern to management They accommodated us with no hesitation, offering to move our bags and holding the doors!  The attached restaurant had the most mouth watering food, in a subtle laid back ambience - jazz music and the like with amiable waiters and bartenders. We highly recommend the Hotel and its environs we will be back if not just to enjoy the "build your own" chicken quesadilla while listening to the smooth toons of Benny Goodman being played live by one of the featured musicians! Kudos!The staff were friendly and helpful. Hotel is nice. Rooms are quiet. It's a bit pricey I feel for it's standard but maybe this was a busy weekend.Restaurant "reds" food is good, service is friendly and QUICK. Kitchen faces out into the restaurant and adds to the atmosphere Love that.BEWARE:  It doesn't say anywhere that the hotel is under construction on the site that we booked. I'm staying 3 nights in a Spa Suite, paying a pretty steep premium. We have a spectacular view of the... parking lot. We can hear the sweet sounds of ... construction. At night we like to go up to the observation deck... or we would if it was open.
