The staff was completely unhelpful when I pointed all of this out, I was told I was wrong, the construction and closing of the observation deck are disclosed on all sites. It is not. You only get a few vacation days a year and we came here to relax, the stress of having to deal with this is really awful. Stay away from this hotel, four star prices with one star service.The Sedona Rouge was a very nice hotel, and we would definitely go back. The hotel, both outside and inside, was very pretty, and the location is excellent. It was a quick drive to all the scenic spots, and it was centrally located in Sedona so we had easy access to everything in the town. Breakfast in the morning, while not part of your nightly rate as in some hotels, was good, and they offered us a lot of really great local restaurant recommendations (rather than just try to keep us in their own restaurant). I will just say one thing to those thinking of making a reservation here: we reserved a room with a mountain view, which is a little extra nightly. When we looked out the window, we could see some mountain peeking over another building, but it wasn't a mind-blowing beautiful unobstructed view, which you'll probably find at some of the much pricier hotels. So bottom line, you'll see some mountain, which is more scenic than the street on the other side, but it may not be what you're imagining. Take that into consideration when choosing a room and decide whether the extra money is worth it. I wasn't unhappy with my decision.I would recommend this to anyone traveling to Sedona!My dog and I stayed the night here recently. We won it so it was free.I brought everything I thought my dog would need but I was delighted to see that they put a set of dog bowls and a dog bed in the room prior to our arrival. The grounds were lovely - we enjoyed the Column Garden, the pool area, and reading in the center courtyard. The bed was comfortable and we slept great. I used the fitness center to get in a run on the treadmill.I had the macaroni and cheese at Reds for dinner - very good but a little excessively greasy.I had two minor quibbles about this hotel - #1 - There is a lack of power outlets in the room. I was glad I packed my extension cord to make it easier to use my phone while it was charging. I had to crawl under the desk to plug it in.#2 - I came to this hotel to do some writing. I was disappointed by the lack of lighting in the pool area after dark. I was hoping to sit by the water and write. The water was well lit, but not the surrounding area beyond what you need to see where you're walking.This review is for the spa only. I make it a point never to be someone's last appointment so I was nervous when I booked a 6 o'clock hot stone massage but I was pleasantly surprised! My therapist was Giri and she was wonderful. Her pressure is firm but it's what I needed and prefer. *During the lower back massage she does massage your upper butt but I was fine with that lol also massages the side butt cheek when she does your legs so if and of that makes you uncomfortable just tell her. The spa itself is really nice and clean. They have a nice steam room and private jacuzzi. *I wish she would've done some scalp massage and jaw massage. *Also in the beginning of the massage she had to mess with the music because they still use CD's. Overall I was really happy with my experience.* It's the next day and I'm super sore... I guess she was to firm. I hope I feel betterI had a very pleasant stay here with my parents. The rooms are very big, and the bathrooms are enormous. The hot water is piping hot, so you can actually take a really good bath that creates a sauna like atmosphere. What a treat!After reading a lot of reviews before our stay, I felt like the hotel made a lot of changes to address the complaints. There were plenty of outlets in our room due to them putting in extra outlets. The wifi was great, and had a very strong signal.  In terms of the resort fees, it was $19/day which I didn't think was that much after reading another review saying the charge came up to much higher. The resort fee evened out since we made good use of the facilities. We got a small plate at Reds, used the jacuzzi and checked out the observation desk with a fireplace at night. Reds is next door which is conveniently located, with a comforting pleasant atmosphere. After driving for the first half of the day, we just didn't want to go hunting around for a restaurant so Reds was perfect way to the end the day with a glass of red wine and some music.All in all I really enjoyed our stay here. The one thing they can't change is the location. Someone complained about it being next to a Safeway, which can be a little strange, but honestly, I would rather be by civilization. If you want to be out in the booneys, there are plenty of resorts there (I saw them on the way to Cathedral Rock) so you can look for that. But I like being by things, coffee shops, shopping, etc, so I didn't mind the locale at all. Plus, there Java Love across the street with legit espresso/coffee for the mornings. If you want a place with comfortable rooms then this is the place to stay.*Spa only* My daughter and I both had hot stone massages. The staff made us feel comfortable and did an amazing job. Matthew and Bobbie were both wonderful. They made sure to ask us what we would like to have worked on and their magic hands did the rest. I'd come back to see them again for sure :-)We've had a great two evenings at Sedona Rouge. The location is within a comfortable distance to all the lovely shopping and art boutiques Sedona has to offer like Tlaquepaque. Also, next door is a grocery store where we stocked up on supplies before our next destination.Even if you don't have a room with a view, the third floor terrace is perfect to capture a view of the red rocks. Why the 4 stars? The bed lacks comfort. I think it is supposed to be a pillow-top, but I'm not sure. And, the $19.00 per day resort tax. Most places offer free wi-fi and water but these are a part of that fee. I would suggest just rolling it into the rate as opposed to annoying people like us with a fee attached to things we don't/won't use like the spa and daily newspaper...they still print those?!? The rest of the room is awesome. Huge walk-in shower, gas fireplace, mini fridge, chaise lounge, chair with reading table, desk, quality toiletries and very friendly staff. We also had a small balcony which was a nice bonus.
review_content_20: My husband used airbnb for the first time and unknowingly booked us in a shared space for our anniversary. The place was small, hot, was under construction and had no privacy. It turned into a stressful situation so we decided to move to a hotel. When we arrived a lady with blonde hair in bangs was working the front desk. I had a migraine at that point and was holding back tears. She upgraded the room we booked on hotels.com, gave us free food and spa viscount vouchers and sent a complimentary bottle of wine to the room. She was so sweet and the hotel was much nicer than expected. I highly recommend this place!Wasn't too impressed with this hotel after a recent weekend getaway stay. The Hubs and I decided last minute to spend a weekend in Sedona and scoured the internet for a good deal. After looking for several days for a deal, we settled on the Sedona Rouge based on how nice the hotel looked for the price. I did feel the "resort" fee was a bit excessive considering this really isn't a resort. I'm pretty sure they only can call it that since there is a restaurant on site as well as spa facilities, but oh well.When we arrived we asked for a room with a view of the rocks, but none were available. We were put in a room overlooking the near by houses and it was pretty disappointing (as far as the view is concerned). The "balcony" is a joke. It's basically a window the has a sliding glass door. The room was pretty clean and spacious. The air conditioning unit was very loud and made all sorts of funny sounds. One of our lights didn't work (the one in the hallway). We were disappointed that there wasn't a tub in the bathroom, but I found the shower to be very nice with the rain-type shower head. The extra amenities they provide were also nice and generous.The location to town is good, only about a five minute drive. Being close to Safeway and other food options is also nice, but it was a bit odd. All in all, I can't say we'll be back. There are a lot of options in Sedona and I'd probably opt to try something different next time. Set your expectations for a Holiday Inn or Courtyard Marriott when arriving at Sedona Rouge.6:30am with luggage in tow I walk into the lobby and ask "do I need to check out?" Normally I am met with a "no sir, you are all set" or a "yes sir, let me get you a receipt". Here I am met with an "I don't know, do you?" In a sarcastic insulting tone. I'm thinking to myself who hired this rude bell boy and let him sit at the front and come to find out its the General Manager!!! Plain and simple, He should be fired.Everyone else was nice and so was the room. I really enjoyed everything except the incredibly rude GM. Also they charge a resort fee on top of all the other fees even if you book through an external website.This is an attractive, clean hotel and the staff was friendly and responsive. The beds and pillows and linens were not comfortable, but the real thing I could not get past was the bathroom. The bathroom door did not lock or even latch, there was no bathtub, and the shower was very odd. The shower did not have a door-it was not a snail shower-it just didn't have a door. It also had two shower heads which meant by the time you were finished showering the entire bathroom floor, which was slick ceramic tile, was awash in water. It wasn't aesthetically pleasing and it wasn't functional. So strange.Very friendly and knowledgable reception staff. Beautiful facility with great ambiance. Massage therapists were great at pre-identifying pain and stress points to focus on during session. Responsive throughout session. Great, 1 hours, very relieving Swedish massage - would do deep tissue if I went back. After you have full access to resort pool amenities including a hottub, steam room, private showers. Not overly expensive and well worth the money. Will definitely be returning, possibly even a second time on this trip!Did a mother daughter weekend trip here. We've done several spa get aways over the years. When we first arrived I thought the hotel was a little modest on amenities but we wouldn't be spending a lot of time in the hotel so no biggie. The service immediately on arrival was friendly and fast. We had our first spa treatment that afternoon. Again, the amenities in the spa were modest but, hey, we came here for the treatment so, no biggie. I have to say, my massage was one of the best I have ever had. My masseuse Barbara was extremely knowledgable and her experience not only allowed for a spectacular massage but left me with a new understanding on how to maintain a healthy and balanced life. I was really inspired. After our treatments my mother I decided to say in the hotel and enjoy the restaurant and lounge instead of venturing out. The food, service, and live entertainment was very impressive. The next morning we started our day with free morning yoga. Our instructed Heather was amazing and again, I felt inspired. We had our next spa treatment that morning and again... Absolutely fantastic! We didn't feel rushed or obligated to buy product which in most spas we have visited the 60 minute churn and burn is a priority. The drive from the hotel into town and to a few popular hiking spots is relatively short and easy and on our return back to the hotel, our welcome was friendly and accommodating. I have to say, Sedona Rouge was one of our best stays and we will be visiting again!This hotel is fine. Checked in on NYE for a quick couple's getaway. We were immediately happy with the set-up of our "red-rock" room. One problem: no view of the red rocks! The "balcony" was about seven inches deep and overlooked a grocery store parking lot. Romantic. Decidedly over-priced at $220 during the off season, and the photos displaying fireplaces are wildly misleading. Also very strange: the catalog of the room's furnishings...which are apparently for sale?I'm giving the Sedona Rouge a solid 'meh'.Good things, which earned stars:-Barbara at the front desk is knowledgeable and delightful.-The pool is quiet.-The entryway with the fountain and star jasmine is gorgeous.-Beautiful pillars and architecture-Pina Coladas at Reds-Across the street from Safeway to get groceries-Fluffy towels and Bathrobes-Pet-friendly with a doggie bag station outsideNot so good things:-The resort fees added $300 to our total, which we had to negotiate to have taken off (after we had booked though a site online, it added that unknowingly).-Everyone else in the staff seems timid or too buttoned up. Too stiff.-No view of the red rocks from the outside patio. It was just grass and a fence.-Cost is higher than normal for Sedona, I guess. I'm used to traveling to cities so $300 is okay, but apparently that's high for here. After this I found a hidden gem that was better and 1/3 of the cost.-The pool was freezing. I couldn't get in.-Not the best food at Reds. -I found a better place with free wifi & free breakfast.Didn't try the spa though. I think there are a few good things about this place (mostly Barbara) but will not be booking again.This hotel considers itself a resort and as such, bills a mandatory daily incidentals fee for "resort" services. These include "high speed" Wi-Fi and several other "amenities" one would expect as standard in a hotel that charges over $200 per night.Nevertheless, since I'm paying for it, it's not unreasonable to expect the Wi-Fi to work. It doesn't and when I asked at the front desk shortly after check-in, I was told that the signal in the ONE router they have sometimes doesn't reach rooms like mine in the far corners of the building! On the other hand, they did offer to move me to a room closer to the router (and closer to the noise of the open air lobby). I don't know about you, but I believe that reliable Wi-Fi service is pretty much mandatory today for both business and leisure travelers. If you're reading this, you know exactly what I mean.Until they fix this problem, I say stay away if you expect to use any device requiring a working internet connection. FYI, I'm writing this on the landing outside my room, which is the only place I can get a reliable connection.If you're going to book here, do yourself a favor and shell out that little extra for a room with a view. Waking up to glowing red towers of rock outside your balcony window, that change by the hour in a play of shadow and light, is absolutely worth it. But, bear in mind, if you've stood atop the tallest man-made wonders, or you've hiked the summit of several world-renowned mountains, it's doubtful the view will be badass enough for you. Even still, it's impossible not to breathe it in deep and relax.And that's the entire feel of the hotel: relaxation. The overall, famed good vibe of Sedona is sweetly complimented by the Rouge's lovely amenities. The simple fact that I was able to soak it in, decompress and de-stress while traveling with a toddler (whose mission in life is to break the mommy) is a testament to its glory. I look forward to returning, hopefully with a suitcase full of more lingerie and less sippy cups.Absolutely horrific. What a terrible hotel and even worse management. We booked our family from Holland to stay in Sedona on their way to the Grand Canyon. The booking was one day incorrect and we tried to make a change. They told us they would not transition the day and we would also have to pay a cancellation fee. Nice way to ruin a thanksgiving. The reservation agent, Jennifer, was cold and unkind.Sedona Rouge was fantastic! My significant other took me here for a short weekend away from Scottsdale, AZ. I recently moved from Oklahoma and was in much need to see flowers and GREEN haha. Barbara was the front desk attendant and upgraded our room to a Spa room. It was WONDERFUL! We ate and had drinks at the RED restaurant. Everything was splendid other than our drink refills at the bar top. I'm a drinker and usually expect when my drink only has 1/4 left, I'm usually offered another drink. Besides that it was great. They also had live music which was an added bonus. All in all a great experience!Absolutely love this place. We brought our french bulldog and stayed in one of the pet stay rooms. So nice to be able to walk out onto your patio and have the dog area right there. The room itself was great, nothing lacking, plus a very friendly staff. I got a massage at the spa with Giri, who was amazing...she knew exactly what I needed. The only reason I'm giving 4 stars and not 5 is because of the construction. Relaxing by the pool wasn't quite so relaxing due to the noise. But other than that we loved this resort.From the warm greeting from Jane at reception to the fabulous massage from Giri I had wonderful spa day. The facility is gorgeous, I enjoyed just sitting outside next to the spa tub and listening to the wind run thru the bamboo trees. Excellent service and very clean. Might put a screen in front of the waiting lounge, seems a bit odd to sit in your robe as folks pass through.I work in the industry for a highly-rated property so my personal standards are very high for the hotels that I stay at. Sedona Rouge met and then exceeded my expectations in every way. This does not include a review of their restaurant Red's, however, that I will write about in a separately. We were set to stay at L'Auberge for our wedding and honeymoon until they charged the full total of our stay onto my Amex... After fainting, I picked myself off of the floor and knew we had to find somewhere else to stay. At first I wasn't TOO excited about staying here, we took our dog with us so that confined us to one room type on the first floor. But once we checked in we were thrilled with our room, the property and room look even better than the pictures online. Because we were in Sedona for our wedding, room service brought us champagne and chocolate dipped strawberries within one hour of checking in. They also arranged for a small table and linens to be placed in our room for our wedding cake at no additional charge. Room service is quick and efficient and everybody at the front desk was friendly and sweet, especially Sienna, Michael, and Daniel, they were all a huge help to us. Even though the hotel isn't within walking distance of the shops and galleries, it is conveniently located across from the Safeway shopping center and we were able to walk to Dahl and DiLuca for dinner. Also, because the hotel is a bit further away from the town it seemed to me the nighttime star viewing was even better than in other parts of Sedona.The spa is lovely, high-class and relaxing. Do try next time you visit. Also, they have specials on their website that are not advertised elsewhere and cannot be booked by calling the hotel. I highly recommend you check out the website first to see what deals you can get. We scored huge for our 7 night stay; they also gave us free appetizer coupons to use during happy hour at Red's, one for each night.I booked this hotel because if it's professed "spa" atmosphere and views but was incredibly disappointed. My overall impression of the hotel was that it was a glorified motor lodge that can over charge because of its Sedona locale. Beds are great, but any real view non-existent, pool like a kiddie pool, and "resort" staff virtually none existent if not rude or indifferent. I wish we had booked anywhere else. We even had to pay a "resort fee" to use the pool and another $20 per too. To ensure our view was not overlooking a brick wall. Would not recommend at all.I don't know why this hotel doesn't get higher ratings. I found it to be a warm, welcome hotel with great service and large, comfortable rooms. Stayed here during construction and never heard anything. The walk in shower and separate large tub was nice. The bed was very comfortable. I highly recommend this property.Staff was extremely welcoming and provided excellent service. The room we stayed in was really clean and ac was perfect. The pool was very close to our room and had more than enough toiletries for 4 people. The bathroom and shower was awesome. The shower was in a little area next to the tub but was seperate. The only problem was the pool closing at 10 pm and security guy was not really nice about it. Other than everything was fabulous.I'm only putting 1 star because I can't put negative 5 stars which is what this place deserves. Someone deleted my long and detailed review that I left at the end of August. That's odd. Basically, this place sucks, the staff are young and inexperienced and there is never a manager on site to handle anything. The rooms are not that great and not that clean. The Hilton is waaaaaay better so I recommend going there next time in Sedona.A really nice hotel, turndown service, pool and fitness included. The only problem we had was occasionally with noise. Not sure if that was specific to the location in the hotel building, but it surely was annoying.
review_content_40: How this resort received [AAA] 4 diamonds is beyond comprehension. The service was dismal and at times, rude. Service aside, Sedona Rouge is a mid-priced gem in the desert (diamond in the sand?). My hunch is that the overall staff grew tired from serving guests coming in with daily deals.ROOMS: the standard room was a bit small given the $450/night busy-season rate but cozy and inviting. POOL: disappointing that this type of resort doesn't offer saltwater pools or spas. Also, no waiter service in the pool. What a shame of how much business they lost from people wanting to order drinks. SPA: It's a tiny spa. The $15 day pass isn't worth it...they don't even have a hot tub or pool. The lounge area is awkwardly small and uncomfortable due to the volume of people.  TV: who watches TV on vacation but we had a voucher for a pay-per-view movie. Not the best since they have HDTVs but without the HD setup. FOOD: breakfast was pretty decent. We had some sliders before dinner and they were terrible. Terrible to the point that  we didn't return on the second day even though we had vouchers for free appetizers.LOCATION: it's right on the main drag and close to everything (relatively speaking). Run out of wine? You can walk to Safeway that's literally steps away. Less than a 10-minute drive to a couple vortex sites. BATHROOM: this is worth mentioning. Even for the small standard room, the bathroom is gorgeous (again, keep in mind the price point). Dual showerheads including a "rain" showerhead above you. The shower is very spacious; you can easily git 10 people in there (mind out of gutter please). BAR: again, vouchers. Nothing to brag about to Dionysus. Service was unflattering. Again, how they received multiple 4-diamond awards is beyond my intellect.The hotel was nice and clean however based on travel website reviews the hotel was expected to be much nicer. For the price the hotel was not as nice as expected. The pool area was nice but small. No complimentary breakfast was offered. 20 dollar resort fee per day. The location was get nice with central access to all main tourist attractions!We had the perfect room, king suite with pool access. Literally we walked out our patio to the pool! The hotel was clean and the staff was efficient. Our small frig in our room didn't work and the air conditioning took a long time to get to the desired temp. Otherwise family and pet friendly, we traveled with 2 kids and our dog and it was perfect.Aside from the fact that this "Resort and Spa" is on an 'any road in America', commercial strip, I do not like the 'got-chya' resort fee charged without notice, upon checkout.Upon relaying my dislike of this underhanded revenue enhancement tactic with the GM, I received a canned response. You know, as if my comments were written in Hieroglyphics - " I thank you for writing to us. We use your feedback to applaud our staff and improve where we can.....". Oy vey, please. Though a fairly nicely planned property, I'll take my $400/night somewhere else, thank you.Save your money; or spend it somewhere else.  Food at Reds was horrible.. The GM of the hotel's response was that most people like their food... Based on a nearly empty dining room on a Thursday, I'd say the locals don't like it either.  Rude at front desk and after checking out-- a week after--- 20.00 was added to the amount I signed for at  the front desk. Their response was that I should have known the correct rate.  I've been offered a lower rate and an upgrade if I give them another chance.. FAT CHANCE.  Bad service, Bad Food  and changing rates makes it NOT worth my time or money re-book at this hotel.The service here was excellent. Everyone was very professional and courteous. The facilities were fine. Coming from the Arizona Biltmore, the Rouge felt a little shabby but it was clean and comfortable on the whole. The heater was a bit loud and our tub was leaking. And there is this strangeness in the bathroom where the tub is next to AND inside the shower stall... Like I said though the friendly staff made up for a lot. The breakfast at REDS was pretty good. They gave us free breakfast for our two kids.Nine of us came out and booked 5 rooms for a long weekend "retreat," and overall, we had a really good stay.  We had a Travelzoo deal that included massages, yoga and breakfasts.  Positives:Loved the small spa - great massages, nice teas, infused water, private outdoor hot tub, very friedly service.Room had a super comfy bed, wonderful shower w/ rain and regular showerheads, black out curtain liners for great sleep.Yoga was a great way to start the day - very relaxing and positve.The views - there are beautiful views of the red rocks right behind the hotel.  Observation deck - the deck has great red rock views if you look straight ahead, but right over to your left is a big Safeway in a strip mall, which detracts significantly from the tranquility of the views.The pool and jacuzzi - nice, relaxing, never crowded.  Would have a good red rock view, except that they built the 2-story spa behind it -- seems they could have designed that better.Negatives:The food at Reds - not good; we had free breakfasts w/ our package, but the food was not good, and neither was the service. They took our drink orders, but my tea never arrived; I ended up getting my own from the self-serve dispenser.The location - the location is good in that it's pretty central to everything, but not so good in that it's located right on the busy highway 89A, so you get the traffic noise. Wait staff - very inconsistent. One day by the pool we ordered small plates, and service was fast and friendly. But our first night there, we ordered a bottle of champagne on the observation deck; the server brought up warm champagne in an ice bucket, said we should wait 10 minutes to let it chill; added himself a 20% gratuity, said he'd be back to open the bottle for us, and never returned.Overall, the positives outweighed the negatives for me, and I did enjoy the hotel. Would I stay here again?  Not sure; I might try somewhere new, a little further off the beaten path, or the highway.I got a room here for less than $120 a night using the Hotel Tonight Ap. I am moving across country and stopping at on my bucket list destinations.  I checked in late but the staff let me use the small plate voucher even though it was only good for 4-6 pm. They froze my igloo ice packs from my cooler. My sweet puppy was sick from the drive and while I was eating on the patio at Red's, she got sick... they were totally understanding. The facility is clean, the staff is friendly...and when you are tired after a day of driving-- its worth it.Oasis in the desert! After endless research for a one night stay in Sedona, I chose this place and it did not disappoint! This boutique style hotel is further west from what we wanted to see and do but well-worth our stay. We arrived late Monday night (June 24) and we called to confirm our reservation and were pleasantly informed our room was ready and they were expecting us and to drive safely (windy drive).  Great attention to detail from everything from the bright orange leather headboard to the walk-in overhead rain-shower.  Aesthetically-pleasing. Posh. Plush and lush!My only gripe was the "walk-on balcony." The balconies are 2-3ft at most with a view of a lawn??? :/ The coffee in the room was sorry to say but cheap. I am sad we did not have enough time to experience the spa but the service menu is really inviting! There is a Safeway grocery store conveniently across the street.Sedona is a quiet town, had an older/retired community feel (we had no idea until we checked in). Everything closes at 9pm. This would be great for honeymooners/couples or people traveling on business. Would love to return here.Stayed a few nights in this boutique hotel on Rt89A. Very nice. We had a 3rd floor room overlooking the pool and the adjacent Safeway; thus the "urban setting" in the hotel promo blurb. Not a distraction however. Room was nicely appointed with cathedral ceiling and gas fireplace. Bathroom was big with oversized walk-in shower. Pool area was nice. Hot tub. Could have used more chairs. Pool side service from the bar. Another plus. Spa area was nice, but we didn't partake in any of the services. There's an observation patio on the roof of the restaurant with a fire pit for night time star gazing. Close to shopping and restaurants. "Reds", the house restaurant is a good choice. All in all, a pleasant experience. We'd stay there again.Great place.  Highly recommend it.  ask for a third story room facing the rocks.  made opening the blinds every morning awesome to see the coffee pot staring back.the free breakfast vouchers for the kids made their morning fun since we used room service- they don't get that type of treatment at home....didn't use the spa but the fitness room, pool and hot tub were pretty nice.  there was a lack of pool towels every day we were there so going to the front desk was really annoying.we were not expecting the $30/ nt resort charge and the 13% room tax when we checked out.I was "assigned" the hotel by Priceline. When I arrived, they took an imprint of my credit card for incidentals. A month later, a $40 charge (about 15% of my bill) shows up on my card as some kind of general  "spa fee ."  They did not mention any such fee when they took my card.  Tacking on a surprising 15% to the room rate for nothing is "gotcha" to guests. I called, requesting a return call to talk to the appropriate manager. Still waiting for that call.  Chalk this up to poor customer relations.I've travelled around the world and been to many places that bill themselves as spa. Among the things they have in common are luxuriously appointed rooms, quality bath amenities (fine shampoos, soaps, etc),  great views, and a staff that bends over backwards. Sedona Rouge Spa has none of these, though its location next to a Safeway on the main road, does put it near a Starbuck's. Now I know why the "spa" seemed eerily empty during our stay.This is a pretty good option if you're not going to go nuts with one of the super opulent spas in town.All the basics are here.  Good sized rooms and nice beds.It's also located a little bit off the really crowded main area of Sedona which is nice.Great place and great views! Everyone was very helpful and nice. Love the huge shower!!I'll preface my review by mentioning that I rarely ever stay in hotels this nice - so consider the source. My favorite things about this hotel are the beds, the shower/tubs, and the view from the room.The beds are an experience of their own and one of the biggest "pros" of this hotel. The quality of the mattress, the sheets and the pillows is very five-star-worthy - super comfortable.Each room offers cozy Kashwere robes (one of Oprah's Favorite Things) and decor that is elegant and matches the Sedona scenery. I've stayed at this hotel twice and each room offered a different combination of shower/bath - both were amazing. The rain shower head is really neat but I prefer the bath! The tub is huge and is right by the windows in the room - it has temperature control and jets. Other perks: The curtains have 'black out' liner so you can sleep in total darkness, the soaps/shampoos are top notch, and they have a lighted make-up mirror (the magnification kind) in the bathroom. This hotel is very romantic and was perfect for an anniversary and then Valentine's getaway with my boyfriend. We thought it was worth the splurge so much we stayed twice. My least favorite things about this hotel (aside from price), would be the restaurant, the pool, and the staff service wasn't that great. I don't usually stay at nice hotels, but I guess I'd expect better service for $300+/night accommodations. The staff was just not that friendly or helpful and the service was lacking. However, I did like the e-mail confirmation for the room and recommend visiting the website and trying to browse deals/specials through their e-mail subscription service. While the amenities at this hotel are fun, I would probably have given 5-stars if there was a little more attention to detail. As a $300+/night hotel, I wouldn't expect to find little things like a broken thermostat unit, stains/tears in carpet, broken blinds, etc. - all of which were little dampers in our stay. I would absolutely NOT recommend "Reds" the restaurant, which is kind of a bummer, but it's worth a drive to eat somewhere else. It's very expensive and is definitely a huge let down! Very disappointing - in the service, long wait, and the quality of the food. We stayed in the Spa during our second visit for the tub-room but we didn't use the services, they look fun though!Just spent a couple days here for our honeymoon and have to say that we are happy with our experience. The balcony on the thirds floor does have a great view of the rocks and is a awesome place to have a drink and enjoy Sedona.The rooms are pretty big and very clean. Also loved the double shower heads.The room was great , the staff was timely and polite. The upsetting part was the random resort fee at check out. We booked the room through Expedia , we paid the room rate, taxes and fees...so we assumed that the room was paid for. I wouldn't mind paying the fee if it was clear and upfront  during booking that there would be one. The room was fine. but it was a little dated. I probably would not have forked over $170 a night instead of $150 which is what I thought I was paying. I mean, for $180, we could have stayed at the Hyatt . Just make sure they are clear with you on fees before you book here. Also if you aren't using the amenities, I wouldn't say it's worth staying at this "resort".This hotel was cute and the bed was comfortable. Nice little pool/jacuzzi area. Our room backed up to it and with a little patio area. The door to the patio worked with the room key, which was convenient. The bathroom had the most bizarre set-up we had ever seen: a shower behind a glass wall with a drain in the floor and a tub behind that. Worked fine, just super odd. Furnishings seemed a bit outdated but still pretty clean.This is a good hotel to stay like any other resort type hotels in Sedona. When checkin you can ask for rooms facing the mountain. ROOMS are small for the price paid and balcony is "really Small"POOL: Very disappointing. Hot Tub was extremely HOT and people could not get in. Asked the waiter about this and as per him, that's how they do it  You will need to Pay for Breakfast. Bathroom was really big and very neat. Even though its free WIFI, when check out they add a Resort Fee which is $20/Day. This was not mentioned while booking or check-in. Very surprised to find out at the end.My review for this place is just for the spa. I think the resort is quite conveniently located , though not necessarily beautifully located. Its right on the streets so you arent overlooking the red rocks as much as the traffic going by. However, once inside it has the look and feel and sound of any regular spa. My aesthetician was good and gave a good facial. She recommended some products but wasnt salesy. I wish there was some more reading material in the waiting room but maybe im missing the point around switching off competely! :) Its also quite reasonably priced and I like that they have 30 min options as well. Overall a decent experience but maybe not on the list of 'go-to' place yet.
review_content_60: Enjoyed the Rouge and found it to be a good value for Sedona.  Very nicely appointed rooms with comfortable beds, nice linens, and great bathroom with rain shower.  Beautiful view from fitness room. Pretty pool area.  Nice roof-top patio.Hotel seemed understaffed (early October)--no bell staff visible, no one attending to people at pool or in patio.Enjoyed our stay here in Sedona.  The staff was friendly and accomodating, even letting us check in early.  The room was spacious and nice, great amenities and great view of the rocks.  The hotel was quiet and a great price for Sedona.The lounge had a nighly "act" who was quite superb, as was the food and drinks, also moderately priced for the area, which is always a good thing.Everything is just OK at this hotel.  The beds are good, the morning coffee is good and some rooms have a nice view.  Be careful with some other rooms because they are just right by the parking lot and with street view.  The service is what I don't think is up to par for a 4-star hotel.  For example, I called the spa to ask about a yoga class for my family.  The lady told me that they have a complimentary class every morning for hotel guests.  I go to sign up in the morning and the front desk person tells me that there is a charge per person for the class.  I told him what the spa has said and that I would be OK paying for 2 adults and see if he could do something for my two kids who had never taken yoga.  He said he would talk to the instructor.  At the end, I get charged for all 4 persons.  Anyway, the location is also just OK.  Close to stores and supermarket but not the main shopping street of Sedona.  I love Sedona but would look to stay someplace else next time.I love this hotel.My husband and I were going to get married here, and had put down a deposit. We decided to elope instead! Evidently, we misread the cancellation policy - our fault. The deposit is non-refundable. We had only paid half of a $2k deposit.As upset and frustrated as we were to possibly lose $1,000, we set off to plan our elopement. It was going to be in Sedona anyway. Once we stopped playing phone tag with the sales manager, Daniel, we ended up super happy campers. They heard the story that we just wanted to elope instead of plan a wedding and allowed us to use the 1kdeposit for our stay. They HEARD us, and adapted to our needs rather than try to get the full $2k deposit we had not paid yet. We would have had to stay somewhere anyway, and that saved us a lot of money on our total elopement, as we thought we'd have to shell out another 1k somewhere else!When we walked into our spa room, we were beyond excited. They had already laid out champagne and strawberries. The rooms were a perfect size for a couple. There was a jacuzzi bathtub in the ROOM as well, which was relaxing and wonderful. I got a spa treatment the same day I went there. I called and they were able to fit me in quickly, and give me exactly what I wanted. I got a full body wrap with facial, and was able to just walk right back up to my room to continue relaxing. The therapist was sweet, and did a wonderful job. The treatment rooms were warm, relaxing, and soothing. I could easily be a spa junkie with a treatment like this. I should have gotten another!!That night, it was chilly... But we went out to the rooftop terrace to see the stars and enjoy our wine. The staff upstairs was very accommodating and helped us get the fire going.They also gave us complimentary appetizers at REDS, but there wasn't much on the menu for a gluten-free vegetarian. No bother on me, as I'm used to it.We had a wonderful experience, and will definitely be back again. If you're into spas, the spa room is worth it!Expectations management is the name of the game with the Sedona Rouge.  If you look at their website or their glowing write-up on Jetsetter (through whom I booked), you would think this was a resort on par with a Four Seasons.  It isn't.  It's a very nice boutique hotel, on par with the Viceroy in Palm Springs.That having been said, once we realized we weren't staying at a resort (and glad we weren't paying full price), we were extremely pleased  with this chic, comfortable, well-located hotel with all the amenities.  Like the Viceroy and hotels of its ilk, great care was taken with the design and color scheme in this hotel.  Rich reds and Andalusian decor elements are throughout the property and it's just really pretty.The hotel occupies a small property in West Sedona on a busy main street.  It's in a commercial district, across the street from a minimall that contains a Safeway and a Petco.  Next door is a doggie day care and a pet grooming spot (which, since we were traveling with our dogs, we appreciated).   Our room was spacious and private, with a small patio in a grassy area that was perfect for us.  Dog waste bags are provided, and overall having dogs with us was a non-issue, which was really nice for an upscale hotel.  We were really pleased with how well-planned the dog areas are.  Because we were in a pet-friendly room, our room did not have vaulted ceilings or a rain shower, so if those are important to you, request a top floor room and leave the pets at home.One thing I always look for are the toiletries provided by the hotel, and the Sedona Rouge's line of lemon mint soaps and shampoos was refreshing and spa-like.  The robes are chenille-like and super, super plush.  The pool is small but when we were there, it was never once crowded.  The pool area is well-appointed with comfortable and commodious recliners and poolside service during the heat of the day.  There is a great workout room with treadmills, bikes, yoga mats and weights.  Every morning there is yoga!The spa was very nice -- small but it had everything you want in a nice spa (steam rooms, sauna, hot tub, showers with all the amenities) -- and I really had fun in the spa shop, which sells a variety of designer and locally-sourced bath and body items.  My husband and I both got two-hour long custom massages (in both our cases, a mix of hot stone, deep tissue, cranial and traditional Swedish) and we were sooooo pleased and relaxed.  Our therapists, Michel and Barbara, were very talented professionals.  I was pleased that a two-hour massage was an option, because not every spa offers it.If you want a massage and you're on a budget, next door (doggie day care side) is also the massage school for Northern Arizona, which provides inexpensive massages.  I didn't try it but I was tempted.REDS, the hotel restaurant, was solidly good.  The dining room was small but the bar area was spacious, and we enjoyed appetizers in the bar for dinner, which was a great way to keep the tab down bu still get a taste of the restaurant.  We liked the decadent crab dip and the Bloody Marys.  Finally, the property offers some hidden gems, like a medicine wheel by the spa, where you can pray or meditate and get your Sedona on, and a third floor observation deck, which is a great place to take a cocktail while you watch the sunset.its a decent place; nothing extraordinary but it was a normal, nice room.   the knock is that it's way overpriced. the $19 "resort" fee is ridiculous. it's essentially a scam to lure you to a lower initial price and stick you with hidden fees.  our front desk person, Raul, was very nice, but a few employees were kind of rude.Sedona Rouge is a good place to stay. Really, it is. Don't let the website fool you though because it's not opulent. My standing room only balcony had a view of the parking lot. The "viewing deck" is a great place to share a bottle of wine and to see what's going on at the Safeway next door.The rooms were very clean, the bed comfy, and the shower is large enough for two.Breakfast at the on-site restaurant, Reds, was always good. The daily yoga was a great way to start the morning and realize how uncoordinated I am.The spa facility was fairly large and the massage was relaxing, but once again, not opulent.The staff was always polite, the location is good, and I'd be happy to go back.There are many places to stay in Sedona keep looking!  The resort fee is ridiculous this is the farthest thing from a resort, not to mention food poisoning from their restaurant and a staff that is sure they are doing you a favor!  I have traveled for over 25 years for work and pleasure internationally and have never felt so compelled to write a review and warn people, Sedona is too special to have a negative experience and I am their frequently.Recently stayed at the Sedona Rouge Resort and it was fantastic. However, as others mentions, it's not truly a resort but rather a very nice boutique-y style hotel. We only stayed one night, but wish it had been longer. We had a king-bed one the top floor with the rain shower. Must say - the shower was a-mah-zing though between the two shower heads I kind of felt like I was drownding. Also enjoyed the complimentary toiletries - I'm a big fan of aromatherapy/natural shampoos and soaps and these smelled heavenly. The balcony wasn't really a balcony - i was expecting some chairs to sit and enjoy the views but its barely big enough for more than one person to stand out on. There is an observation deck above the pool but was closed due to a private event.Also visited REDS for drinks and breakfast - it was a little toasty at as the heat was turned on (it wasn't even that cold and I'm from Texas!). In the morning I had a simple breakfast but enjoyed it. The service, as with the whole stay, was great. Unforunately, I did not get to try the spa as I had recently gotten a facial/massage at home.Overall, enjoyed my time in Sedona and at the Sedona Rouge - I will def. go back.We spent 3 nights here and it was perfect. Rooms were clean and comfortable. Staff was friendly, helpful, and accommodating. Spa served up great massages for my girlfriend and I. The location is central and close to all the action. The only thing that could have made this place 5 stars is if we had a better view (we had one of the parking lot). Definitely recommend to others!  Thanks, Sedona Rouge!Using a great Travel Zoo deal, we stayed for two nights in the beginning of our honeymoon. The deal included spa treatments and breakfast.  I think because we got a great deal, they stuck us near the highway with no view. What up wit dat?! The room was nice but nothing too impressive. The highlight was the smell of the soap. LOL. Spa treatment was outstanding...one of the best I've gotten...the hot rock treatment was cool...my first time. We almost had a scheduling snafu but they made up for us by offering us some free massage oils and teas to take home.The low point - On our first night...tired from traveling...we order room service. We called back to ask for a second set of silverware....they told us to come to the restaurant to get them! WTF! What's the point of room service, if I have to go to the restaurant. They said they'd deliver the silverwear in 20 minutes...WHATEVER! My new bride and I shared silverwear and of course, the 2nd set never came.For your honeymoon...go to L'aubergeLow key and well staffed newer facilities and fair pricing.  Small but still feels big so you get the benefits of a larger Spa without having to compete with lots of other guests while you're using hot tubs steam room and lockers.  Etc.  Incredible massage. Fair price.  I will be coming back.Disappointed in checking in. Had booked hotel a month in advance with specific requests. Upon checking in I was given a handicapped accessible room which I had NOT requested because I don't have the need for one and don't feel right taking one, not to mention it wasn't what met my travel needs. I don't park in handicapped spots! I talked with the office staff and was told there was nothing that could be done. I found it ironic that they were not willing to help rectify the situation (they had caused) as I looked at their awards for customer service. Really? Completely disappointed for my return trip to Sedona. If you're wondering where to stay go to the Amara. Customer service and accommodations outshine this place.I agree with Brian K.'s review somewhat.The hotel and spa were great. But as far as the dining staff is concerned, if the GM had a brain, these people should be fired. The day we got there we settled in and went to the pool patio to have lunch. We were treated like as if we disrupted their quiet afternoon. After sitting down and ordering a burger and chips with salsa and 2 beers, which by the way took longer than it should, considering there was no one else around. Our waiter came with the food, with no napkins and 2 warm beers. My wife asked for a glass of water to which he turned around and pointed at a cooler sitting 2 tables away. Really, are you gonna make us get up and walk to get water? And $4.50 for 10 ounces of warm beer is a bit much. After the meal, our waiter was no where to be found. We waited for about 10 minutes before he came out from wherever, and I asked for the check, to which he didn't have, so we waited again for him to return. Looking at the lunch bill I noticed they included a 20% service/gratuity charge for eating poolside. Needless to say, that's all this lame waiter got. You give someone crappy service, well you're getting a crappy tip.And that evening we went to the bar to use our drink voucher. The bartender was sub par as well. She seemed annoyed we presented her with this voucher that the HOTEL GAVE US!I ordered a margarita and boy was I disappointed. I could hardly stand to drink it. I took one drink and left it. My wife ordered a mojito and that was ruined as well.It seemed to us that in a small tourist town like this that the staff would go the extra mile to make you feel welcome. I mean 90% of the people there were tourist and spending tourist dollars, which I assume keeps this town afloat. Groupon or not, money is money, and this hotel got very little extra from me.I went here with my best friends and I kept comparing this place with Burke Williams and I really shouldn't do that. This place is a hotel/spa place so I really can't compare it to a place that is specifically a spa place. The staff (aside from the receptionist) were super friendly. I got a Classic Swedish Oil Massage and it was so good; made me so relaxed (not just the feeling of being relaxed, but it just completely relaxed my whole body). Then I got a facial and that was just so...interesting. They tell you what they are about to do and apply to your face...and it's no lie. One part of the facial just feels like my face is on fire...too much senses going on for me. The lobby was a decent size for being a hotel/spa place. The shower area was a bit small. The steam room is small. The spa area was decent (I guess in terms of size). Extra towels and such were always restocked. The room where you get your services are big. There was plenty of pace and it was clean and organized.I just visited Sedona and this hotel last weekend with my wonderful girlfriend. The hotel was very nice, clean and spacious. We both agreed that we felt as if we were in a nice house in Sedona versus a hotel room. The appetizers were probably good but I didn't find anything I liked on the menu. The breakfast was perfect. Service was great especially by an older gal who was super sweet. She seems to run the place pretty well. She attended to our needs even if the other servers weren't. The one thing we could not get there was a glass of water. I don't know if water is scarce in Sedona or what but that was our predicament. We went to Oak Creek in some Indian named village I cannot remember, say or spell. Food was moderate. Kinda cold and beers were average. Just wasn't for us. The service at the hotel was perfect. They called a "Quick Ride" cab. Steve was our guy. Very nice and accommodating. "Quick Rides, this is Steve." They were there where we were quickly. However, make sure you need the ride because it is a flat rate so make sure the place you are going is far enough and be safe with your drinking decisions. I don't know how far the 15$ rate goes however. We took it anyway! The shower in the room was very impressive, nice view and great for drinks before dinner! All in all I loved Sedona and this hotel. Breakfast was cramped next day for checkout early in the AM and tempers were high, but everyone got served in a timely manner. But, gota say my company made my trip. Thank you Sedona Rouge!Enjoyed our stay here.  The staff were really nice and the place looks great.  We didn't eat there because the restaurant was too pricey for our tastes and they didn't seem to have many healthy or veggie options.  But it was close to everything, so we got take out from Picasso's Italian and brought it back to the room to eat and have wine in our warm cozy room.  The price was good, they had yoga in the morning, and everything was great.  I highly recommend this place.  It is like a hotel and not like a resort even though they do have a spa.  Maybe in the summer when you can walk around and enjoy the pool it will feel more like a resort, but in winter we basically hung out in the room or on the trails.I booked a 4 star hotel through priceline. NOT a Priceline auction.....a priceline "Express Deal" where they offer an unnamed hotel in 4 stars in Sedona for 150 a night........When I get there, they try to put me in the worst room they have and when I refuse to stay in a room with 3 sides to hallways....the guy says "well, you booked on priceline".....I'd rather stay in the best room of a 3 star than the crappiest room in a 4 star. It didn't say "we'll sell you a crap room for $$---." It said that there was a 4 star available at 150 a night (and don't forget the resort fee $20) so it should have said that you can eat sh*^) for $170 a night. but we'll give you the second floor looking at trees that you can't see through for an additional 20 and a room with a reasonable view but homes that are right there looking in your windows for 20 more. Look, there are only a couple rooms that have a view in this place. You don't go to Sedona to have a "view" room overlooking the pool. You especially don't book a 4 star in Sedona to look at a pool or have 3 of your rooms walls in hallways.  A terrible example of what you should expect for your money.  There are so many good places to stay in Sedona. This wouldn't be in the top 20. Add in the "better than you" attitude and this place should be bankrupt in a short period of time.I had an amazing time at the Sedona Rouge. It's a great hotel, and most importantly, everyone who works there is incredibly nice. I would highly recommend it.Things Sedona Rouge does well: * Clean, well-appointed rooms. A bit overpriced in my opinion ($220), but I realize we are in the busiest season for tourists. * Smaller, but nice pool area. It was a beautiful day in Sedona to hang by the pool. So we did...for an hour or so before our Pink Jeep picked us up at the hotel. * Reds, the hotel restaurant. We enjoyed a few appetizers in the afternoon and headed back for dinner that evening. We had an amazing meal and dessert was a fabulous way to end the night. (Review for Reds to follow). I would return to Sedona Rouge again, most likely in the off season.
review_content_80: I can't say enough good things about this place - I've been back 2x in the past 2 months and can't wait for the next trip! Our recent stay was upstairs in a room overlooking the pool and Safeway - mostly safeway - but still had a balcony and some mountains in the view. The shower was incredible- rain shower head & regular one - great for sharing! Fireplace - not needed this time of year, but ideas for when we come back and valted ceilings & comfy beds!Sean at the pool brought us ice water and offered snacks and drinks for a fee - very nice - Food a Reds Sunday morning was great - the boytoy loved the chilikiles (I can't spell)  - Highly recommend!Just got back from a trip to Sedona and booked a one hour massage appointment with the Sedona Rouge Spa, along with my mother in law and sister in law. We showed up early morning for the (optional) yoga class to sort of "get in the calm" before an hour of enjoying the hot tub and steam room. The "waiting room" (where you sit in your fluffy robes before being called into your appointment) was clean and quiet, and a variety of fresh fruit, teas and lemon water was available to us. After our massages we regrouped and all of us reported very positive non-cookie cutter massage experiences. I will definitely be back! Plus we scored a great winter special, so if you're visiting in the off season, make sure to look into those!  Lastly my therapist's name was Giri (pronounced Gary) and she was excellent! She used a variety of different massage modalities and had strong hands and a very intuitive touch. She clearly has LOTS of experience. And being in November, there were some winter specials in effect, so keep that in mind if you're visiting during the winter months.My wife arranged this as a birthday trip for me. She talked to almost every hotel in town and was telling the names as we rolled by into the town. But, THESE GUYS ARE GREAT.I have had a fabulous birthday. There is a great spiritual significance to the place as it lies right next to the Heart Chakra. You can see that Heart setting in stones very beautifully set right outside the compound. No wonder, the staff are super friendly and very nice. We loved the whole experience from the concierge on the phone prior to arrival, the front desk, the bellman, the housekeeping, the spa... OMG, and ofcourse the Reds restaurant. That is pretty much where we ate all the 3 days.Tips: Look up Luxury Link and you will get a great combo kind of deal, where you get lots of goodies like food at Reds, Spa, Yoga and welcome drinks all wrapped into it... and most of all the rooms with the most amazing view facing the Red Rocks. You cant beat that.We Stayed here and really enjoyed it! We got a couples massage at the Spa and it was wonderful! They also have restaurant that we ate at and was pretty good! They have a nice fitness center as well.Great stay here. Location was really nice...you could walk to the market next door, the foods at reds was awesome! But the customer service was where they really excelled!The Sedona Rouge gets its high marks mostly for the outstanding staff. Robin the Concierge knows everything about Sedona and is very thorough, Nikki and Steven at the front desk were extremely helpful. My wife mentioned in passing that it was our 20th anniversary when she was making arrangements and there was a bottle of champagne and strawberries in our room when we checked in. Thank You! The rooms are appointed very nicely and the beds were extremely comfortable. The Spa is professional but not pretentious. The hotel even has a rooftop lounge where we went to look up at the Sedona night sky and we were able to see meteors. The hotel itself is in West Sedona and is close to everything but removed enough from the Uptown area that becomes crowded with tourists. Although we did not have a chance to experience Reds, the restaurant, it offers compliementary coffee and tea for guests and it appeared to be a lively place for dinner and live music. Staying at the Sedona Rouge made our inaugural trip to Sedona a very pleasant experience and we hope to stay there again on future return trips!I'm glad I read reviews on this hotel because they helped my expectations.  It is a nice place--definitely not a dive. It is not a Four Seasons or a posh spa resort, but for the price---it is well worth it.  Service is pretty good. People are courteous. The spa is very good (Peter and Justin are probably the best massage therapists in the world!).  It is a pretty place.  Like many other hotels in Sedona, Sedona Rouge is located along a main street/highway so there is noise pollution. So we choose a room away from the road and it was well worth it.  Also we had a great view of the amazing Red Rocks. If we return to beautiful Sedona, we would definitely return here.I stayed at the Sedona rouge over the Valentines Day weekend and REALLY enjoyed my stay. It started with Matt who booked my reservation and really helped me put together everything I wanted including the wine tour. i also have to give kudos to Cierra, the concierge, who took care of restaurant reservations and gave some wonderful recommendations for breakfast. The hotel itself was really nice and relaxing, I loved the the huge rainfall shower head in the shower. I highly recommend reds restaurant. Ate there twice and recommend the scallops and the seafood bisque.....YUM. If you are in Sedona and want to stay at a stylish place with fantastic accommodations then the Sedona Rouge is the spot.We loved our stay at Sedona Rouge. We booked a king bed room with Red Rock views and loved it. The service was great, the staff was very helpful and I loved the spa. My husband and I got a couple's massage, and loved the experience. We also didn't feel that we spent too much on too little. All in all, a great experience.Great resort...and they allow pets...which is a HUGE bonus.It was very clean and boutique-y. The front desk staff are extremely helpful and will go out of their way to satisfy whatever need you may have.The bed was ridiculously comfortable with a nice fluffy down comforter...you sink right into the bed. The flat screen is also a nice touch (just an fyi...on the ppv movies the volumes is very low. we had to strain to hear even with the volume turned all the way up)The bathrooms have a nice shower and bathtub. Only problem here...the shower is like a half glass wall. It "looks" very cool....but when you take a shower the water seems to go everywhere. Overall....great place...we got a fabulous deal which made it even better :)I want to give this place 3 1/2 stars, but it's getting four for service.  I didn't feel that the entire place was worth what we paid - there weren't any amazing views and the Reds restaurant was alright, had breakfast there, not bad.  What really helped was that the staff were VERY sweet and communicative and helpful.  They are truly what makes this hotel wonderful.  I even forgot my glasses and they found them and will soon be shipping them to me via UPS (charged to my credit card).We had a funny schedule and wanted to go to the spa so they helped us find a schedule that would accomodate our needs.  Very pet friendly and had a nice area for the dogs (all on the first floor) - there is a $50 pet cleaning fee.The room was a bit small (but we just came from a bed and breakfast where the rooms were big), the bathroom was really nice with a tub and shower combo unlike other hotels.  The water pressure was GREAT!!The location of the spa resort is also wonderful, we were very close to scenic drives and Cathedral rock and lots of hiking trails.  The front desk staff helped us figure out where to go and they can definitely help you put together a day of fun activities, no matter what your budget. :)The Spa - My friend and I booked spa treatments and they have a very nice facility - with lockers, showers, steam rooms and his/her jacuzzi's.  The massage was a wonderful way to end the trip.Just came back from a 2 night stay here. The hotel is nice and in a great location with beautiful views. However, a couple of issues with our room: it was DARK. I am not old, do not wear glasses, yet felt like i needed a flashlight.  I get they were trying to create ambiance, however when i leave wearing 2 different colored socks i know there is a lighting problem.  Also, the heater was ridiculously loud, so loud we had to shut it off to sleep and woke up freezing (it's cold in the desert!).  We did try the spa out there and had terrific massages so that was a plus and the restaurant was great for dinner as well.We love this place and come here at least twice a year. The service is great, the staff remembers us and it is dog friendly. The Reds has good food and the spa is great. The only reason I wouldn't give 5 stars is that it is not smoke-free and it is a bummer to be sitting at the pool and have people smoking by you.My husband and I stayed at the Rouge for a one night special advertised via Travelzoo that included a one night stay, two spa treatments, yoga and breakfast at REDS. The room was clean and very nicely decorated, the bed was nice and comfortable plus coffee, tea and a refrigerator are part of the room amenities. The Front desk staff was very nice but not super chipper, so I have to agree with the previous comments on this page. The spa amenities are okay, not a place to really hang out to relax. I had a Swedish massage by Allen and he was one of the best therapists I have ever had!!!! Yoga was also a great experience and a great way to start the day, however 8AM was a bit early and I would have preferred a 9AM class instead. REDS restaurant for breakfast was pretty good and I have to say that the bloody mary I ordered was fantastic and the eggs benedict were also very good. Overall I would definitely stay at the Rouge again provided that there are special rates available, as I think the resort at it's regular rate is a bit over prized. On a side note, if you are looking for a great place to go for dinner that is in walking distance check out the Barking Frog :)Awesome! The hotel was in the perfect location in town, with every thing just a mile in every direction. They set us up with a exellcent tour of the vortex's. And the package we got was reasonable.The rooms were clean and well decorated. My  massage was fab, the spa rocked. The lobby had a beautiful water feature with lit columns and tables.My only regret was not asking for a room with a view. I will just have to do that next time!We just got back from a 3-night stay over New Year's weekend, and overall we enjoyed the Sedona Rouge and its amenities very much. This is the second time we've come here - last year we came over Christmas, and also enjoyed the hotel and really everything.First the positives:  the rooms were delicious - wonderful beds, wonderful bedding, warm and fuzzy towels, and great robes.  And, with the curtains closed, it felt like midnight at 10 in the morning! Also, at least for me, the room seemed almost sound-proof. Our kids, who were in a separate room two doors down, said that the sound of the fountain in the courtyard kept them up at night. But that sound barely registered for me - it was just white noise that helped me sleep really well!  Their bath soap is wonderfully ginger-scented, and while I usually avoid the lotions and shampoo, etc., at Sedona Rouge it was all really very nice.The maid staff and the staff at the hotel restaurant, Reds, were fantastic. Very efficient, very thorough, very courteous. (The food at Reds was also very good this time around. Last year we were kind of disappointed by the food at Reds, but this time around, it was really very good and we were pleased.) Other staff were also helpful - the bellboys brought ice to the room, Mike at the front desk was wonderful when he checked us in and helped us get additional keys when the kids locked their keys in their room. He also shared information on great hikes in the vicinity and was friendly and helpful.Also, the hotel is dog friendly, which is incredible. Poop bags provided all over the grounds, no complaints about the dog barking or her presence at all, no difficulty checking her in. Of course we pay for it, but still.... not all hotels are as helpful about dogs, especially nice hotels like the Sedona Rouge.Now for the downside: the young woman who served as concierge on the day we arrived and departed, and another young woman who checked us out, were less than courteous. I don't want to say rude -- and they were efficient and helped us accomplish what we needed to accomplish -- but for a bill like the one we paid at the Sedona Rouge, it would have been nice to hear, "Thank you for staying with us," or "Have a nice trip home," or even just "Thank you." They were both pretty much silent in every way except in the specifics of the transaction. They weren't friendly.  Again, not rude per se, but not friendly, either.  I noticed the issue with the attitude of the concierge at the beginning of our stay, but it didn't effect me too much. However, as we were leaving and especially as I had just signed a huge credit card authorization, it REALLY struck me at how un-courteous the office staff member was during the check out. I almost asked for the manager, but decided that I would call the manager once I got home instead. That's my next step...My boyfriend and I were road tripping from east coast to west in the fall, and we were most excited to break up our journey with a two-night stay at Sedona Rouge. I've stayed here before and loved it then, and it didn't disappoint this time around either. The room was clean, spacious and airy with a balcony that overlooked the red rocks. The toiletries smelled wonderful and were of good quality; the decor was desert-themed, but not too kitschy; and the grounds were beautifully kept. We especially loved unwinding in the hot tub to star-gaze after a long day of hiking--and the water was prickly hot, which I love! Though the location is not entirely walkable to Sedona's main drag, we didn't mind in the least since we prefer to visit busy areas in the day and come back to a quieter area at night. (Could be problematic if you don't have a car, but there are plenty of restaurants within walking distance and you could just cab it to the main part of town.) As for the spa, I appreciated its Ayurvedic approach to wellness and indulged in a customized body wrap. Loved it. For breakfast in the hotel's restaurant, I had a crispy, corn flake-battered French toast that was delicious. I continue to recommend this place to friends and family, and I look forward to staying here again whenever I have the urge to escape to the desert!I Just stayed at the Sedona Rouge Hotel and Spa for the third time in about 5 years, and once again it was wonderful! The staff is so friendly and accommodating, the rooms are immaculate and have every amenity you can think of or want. And this hotel has the most comfortable beds you may ever sleep on!Sexy, but not trashy sexy.  As befit our one-year anniversary trip.Loved that we could go outside directly from our room and overlook the beautiful courtyard.  The bed was nice, the pillows were marvelous, and the staff was friendly.  A bottle of champagne was waiting for us when we arrived!  A magnificent table lamp that I would have totally jacked if it fit in my suitcase.  The restaurant was decent (see that review), but they close at 9!The only minuses: no room service; mirror set too far back from the sink (how am I supposed to do my makeup?); a shower hook that I had no way of reaching from the shower because I'm not in the NBA.I have not stayed at this hotel yet, however I had a very nice customer service experience with Wendye Mox today.  The room I requested was not available the weekend of my stay.  She took the time to rearrange a few things, and was able to get me into the room I requested!  If the customer service at the hotel is all this great, I'm sure my stay will be a delight.

review_content: Nice property, great location, comfortable, and courteous staff. After reading some of the Yelp reviews, I was worried this place would be disappointing. However, we had a great stay. Early checkin, late checkout was no problem.  Room was clean and comfortable with decent linens. Gas fireplace in room looked nice but flame was ok. Has kitchen area with refrigerator, microwave, and coffee. I had to call room service for some bowls and spoons since plates, utensils are not in room.Excellent concierge was very helpful with maps and suggestions of must see areas. Resort has pools, and large gym. Definitely would stay here again.Not thrilled with the snooty staff. As long as we don't need anything, the stay is fine. Ask the front desk for anything and you'll feel.....less than. We arrived back to the room to find both of our keys demagnetized.  WE KNOW BETTER THAN TO PUT THEM NEXT TO OUR PHONES.  The lady at the front desk was not polite in correcting the issue and insisted, needlessly really, that we must have put them with our phones. We weren't asking for a reason why, we just needed to get into our room. I just think that they could have been more courteous from the time we checked in to now, we still have two nights to go. I hope they can change my mind. It's a nice property and a special week for me and my husband. The restaurant is good, mixed feelings on some of the staff there as well.Maybe we aren't "resort material".  Don't let this review discourage you from staying, it is nice and it is convenient. I just think there's an unwritten bias somewhere in the fine print that we didn't read.Stayed here for an extended friends weekend! All I can say is this place is top notch! The staff was all friendly, courteous and there to help! ALICE at the front desk went above and beyond to help us with a difficult situation! She is warm, inviting and made us want to come back for another visit!  If you are staying here definitely ask for her! She will not disappoint. The views, pool, spa, and restaurant all were amazing. We will most definitely make this our stop when we come back to Sedona!Cool nice resort, interesting decor thou.  Very modern in the lobby, but not so much for the rooms.  That doesn't mean the room wasn't nice, it was and thankfully not as modern (cold design) as the lobby.  Great view from our room, quiet and loved the suite (think small apt)$698 for 2 nights....This is not a Resort or Spa.   There are no amenities, there was no service,  the fire pit is infested with roaches at night.   The restaurant staff did little to welcome us even though there was 1hr & 15 min. before restaurant closed. The hallways were littered with dead insects in the morning and when I informed my concerns with Daniel at the front desk he did little to change my mind.  In his defense he was polite, but was not the manager. The decor and HOTEL....NOT RESORT OR SPA is beautifully designed.  Non Service for price and false advertising was my issue.   ROACHES did not help either.  STAY AWAY.We stayed here for a company retreat in mid July. The service at this hotel was terrible.  Several people in our group called ahead to see about early check in. (They Absolutely will not allow early check-in and check in is not until 4 PM) I went in at 3:35 to see if  I could get my room, there employees at two of the desks- but only one was assisting people. There was only one couple in front of me and it still took 15 minutes.  She told me our room was not ready, but she could get me pre-checked in and call when my room was ready- but it would be ready no late than 4 PM- which was 10 minutes away at that point.  4 PM rolls around, no room. 4:30 rolls around no room. I had to go up and complain when I saw other people from our group getting their rooms, and she finally assigned one to me.The room was fine- we had a suite with a kitchenette.  There were a lot of doors separating the areas, which we really liked, so you weren't stuck laying around in a dark room when the other person is sleeping.   However there were a lot of bugs. Okay by a lot- we probably saw 7-8 in our room during our 3 night stay, they were mostly dead you could tell- but still disgusting. If you didn't wear shoes you were likely to step on one. One of the people in our group was given a dirty room, with dishes and dirty sheets at the door- She was not happy about that- especially after waiting all day to check in. The service was just terrible all around. One of the girls in our group was having trouble connecting to the wifi and called down to the front desk and the lady told her its easy and she should be able to figure it out then hung up on her.  She then took her computer down to get help- because she couldn't find where to put in the code and the woman just looked at her screen and told her that's right and went back to what she was doing. We had asked the concierge for suggestions for a few dog friendly hikes in the area- and she only would give us one suggestion, which was frustrating since we all know the area decently well and wanted something other than extremely well known popular hikes. During our buffet dinner on site at the hotel- the staff was very rude. They ran out of chips for the appetizers early on and when asked if they were going to put out any more the response was 'this is all that was paid for'. 1) They are chips. 2) There is a much better way of putting it- "This is all we have for this portion of the meal, but the main course will be available shortly."The food was terrible anyway, I tried a bite or two of most everything they served and couldn't eat any of it.  They had a creme brulee cheesecake for dessert, it was runny and raw in the middle, and the topping was soggy. We also had to go get or room keys re coded every day because they would stop working for our rooms. It was extremely annoying, there was no reason for the keys to be deactivated. When we went to check out it was a hassle as well,  the company was paying for 2 nights of the stay and subsidizing the third night.  They people working the desk could not figure it out. They told us at first we had no charges, then they looked somewhere else and told us we owed for the full stay, we old them the company paid for the 2 nights, and then half of the 3rd, and they tired to charge us for a full night for the 3rd night, we had to argue with them until they figured it out. We were the first of our gorp to check out- so hopefully they had it figured out by the time the other 15-20 people in our group that stayed the additional night were checking out. All in all it was terrible. We were treated like we were an inconvenience to them, and we should not be interrupting their business or day. We absolutely will not stay here again.I always stay at a Hilton property but this one doesn't live up to the name.You walk in and it looks great but the rooms are not well kept, the bars and other places to grab food are not worth your time, and the gym if fine if you way to pay a resort charge of $18 on top of the 13 you already have to pay.Bottom line not worth the money here. In Sedona lots of other options.Spa is cold in the room where they hold classes, and the tennis courts are not usable most of the time due to the surface when wet!In 15 years of visiting I've never stayed here and I honestly don't know why. It is a great hotel and the nicest one I've stayed in in Sedona. The complimentary head and neck massage when you arrive is fabulous. The rooms are great, the outdoor fire pit is great and the restaurant will happily give you wine glasses to use with your own bottle of wine. The food is way overpriced and there are other good places to eat, so I didn't eat in the hotel.
