I highly recommend this hotel.I seldom write reviews on my hotel stays, but this was such an unpleasant  experience,  I felt I have to let others know: I stayed there this pass Saturday night, Sunday morning, I went for a hike at the Bell Rock, got back to hotel at 10am, asked "Daniel" at the front desk if I can check out at 12pm instead of 11:30am, so I have enough time to shampoo and shower without being rushed. His reply was "NO" , the parking lot was almost empty, most guest checked out, 30 minutes was not alot to ask for on a Sunday morning. When I asked to speak to the front desk manager,  Daniel  said manager will not be in until later, there is no manager on duty. Seriously?  Was I in a Hilton Resort? I left my name and number to have manager contact me, I wanted to bring this to his/her attention.  Sadly, 5 days later, no one called me. Good bye Hilton.What a lovely surprise to discover Sedona's breathtaking beauty surrounding this location!We arrived and were checked in promptly by the super efficient staff.  As requested, our room was ready early and on the ground floor, conveniently located near the ballroom for the Chopra Center event we were attending. Our room was equipped w a mini kitchenette, living area and separate bedroom in the southwest style.All was well - until we got to the actual bed quite late that evening and realized it had a sagging mattress and dip in the middle, so our first night was quite uncomfortable and restless for us both.We had a courteous conversation w the helpful manager on duty, Delia Enriquez, before our course began early the next morning and surprise!  Delia handled the issue quickly and the staff completely changed out the bed for us while we were in the morning session - terrific service without having to move from our lovely room.  Hurray!I've always said the measure of a great company is NOT how they handle people, situations or circumstances when things are great but rather how they handle challenges and difficulties for a peaceful equitable resolve.  Hilton did a wonderful job and we deeply appreciate that.The food that night was quite enjoyable in the hotel restaurant and service excellent as well as the following morning. The double bacon spinach omelets we ordered were rich and tasty, and the restaurant had a spectacular outdoor view to the surrounding Red Rock mountains, truly breathtaking.A shout out to the wait staff who took care of the Chopra event folks (while a smaller group than usual - normally around 450 of us attending, there were around 150 attendees plus the Chopra speakers and team) - they were flawless!  Thanks particularly to Maria and Josh, pleasant, funny, kind and so helpful.I would have given 5 stars to this location except for a couple of small things.  Our last day we had a meal in the restaurant.  My husband, a native Texan, is quite particular about his beef and his ordered medium rare bacon cheeseburger was well done to burnt in places.  We had to head on to Phoenix so no time to reorder a replacement.We had requested a delayed checkout w time to complete packing since our event ran long but the reception staff was not particularly understanding or helpful.  While courteous, it was clear they weren't interested in finding a solution, which is off putting and a small sour note in our enjoyable Sedona visit.  While we totally understand check-in and check out times are usually quite hectic for the staff of these busy hotels, we only needed a few extra minutes to finish up and it was refused...it's important for them to be aware of conversations w guests who like us.  We base our assessments of these properties on every detail, including how the staff handle the unexpected.We didn't have time to go back to the manager on staff on our departure day - instead we hurriedly packed up to accommodate their requirement for us to check out promptly and then had a 40 minute wait due to the lengthy checkout lines - ironic, since if they HAD accommodated our request, we would have had the requested extra time.  So we went to the restaurant and mike had his crunchy crispy burned burger.  :(((((Overall we would totally stay here again, with more time and less departure stress for all involved.This hotel was mediocre at best. The decor looks great when you walk in, but if you make a wrong turn down certain hallways, you will feel like you stepped back in time and into a scene from The Shining. It was weird. The staff at the front desk and at the bar/restaurant were totally rude and mostly unhelpful....The customer service here was really atrocious. What is really strange (especially for a town that makes most of it's money on tourism) is that we found the business owners and workers at most places we visited in Sedona to be really unfriendly and rude. Anyway, back to the hotel....our room was pretty big and had a great view. The bad parts....well, the shower leaked so badly I nearly slipped and fell while getting out...not safe for kids at all! Also, I've never stayed in a hotel room that had so many doors! Weird design flaw. There were so many rooms under construction, with banging and tools being used as early as 8am. So inconsiderate for the guests in the nearby rooms. I would never stay here again, mostly because of the horrible customer service....and that darn leaky shower....you wouldn't believe how it flooded the bathroom!One positive...this hotel is right up the street from an awesome restaurant called Cucina Rustica (owned by the same people that own Dahl & DiLuca)...super good and pretty much the only nice waitress we had in Sedona!!!I am a Hilton Diamond member so purchased this stay with points. This includes $27 credit for breakfast - essentially two continental buffets (no warm food).  We were upgraded to a view of the Red Rocks which was great!  There are two pool areas. One is supposed to be the quiet, adult option of the two but it felt a little dated. The hot tub is also right next to the breakfast area so not a ton of pool privacy. The other pool is much larger but also extremely packed during the day.  We used our free coupons at the pool bar and I wouldn't recommend the margaritas. The room itself was nice with a decent amount of space, but a little dated as well. The shower design is awful and leaks water all over the floor every morning. Just something to watch out for! I really liked the location but you are a bit of a drive from the local Sedona attractions. It worked well for us though! Again, I paid with points and I do not think I'd recommend this hotel for the price they were charging when I booked.  I also had a random room charge on my bill which I'm not looking forward to dealing with this week - hopefully the customer service improves a bit.We were tired and this place was close. It was spendy. However, you get what you pay for. Pizza and the fish tacos were awesome. We ordered the flourless cake to go and were disappointed in how small it was, but pleasantly surprised how wonderful it was!!On arrival Julie got us checked in and helped us arrange a couples massage for the morning. We freshened up and met Jacob, who enthusiastically shuttled us to our restaurant at a speedy but delightful 9mph. Dinner at Cucina Rustica Sedona was fabulous! Our waitress was a gem and the staff made sure we wanted for nothing! The restaurant even called our escort Jacob to drive us back to the hotel. Truly Jacob was a very kind, polite, family oriented, pro-military man and his gentle nature and easy conversation made the 7mph ride (going up hill) very enjoyable. My husband and I set the temperature, started the fireplace and slept soundly throughout the night.Upon morning we showered, dressed and took advantage of the breakfast buffet. Jesus, our waiter was a big guy with a even bigger smile that could light up any room. He made sure that everything was made to order and that I was fully informed of which foods would effect my allergies. After breakfast he offered to walk us to the spa, but his directions were all that we needed. Spa - OMGoodness! These ladies had hands blessed by God! My husband and I melted into the tables and the stress of driving cross country soon became a faint memory. Afterwards they suggested 5 minutes in the hot tub or sauna. Well next thing I know my husband is texting me from the sauna saying that I had to try it (and he rarely says that to me)! So I took his advice and spent 10 glorious minutes stretching, sweating and talking to a beautifully seasoned woman about her spa membership. A quick shower later - My clothes felt like Egyptian cotton against my skin! Oh my life is indeed full of unexpected blessings! I turned in my locker key, and was able to purchase face wash and toner that I left at the previous hotel. My only suggestion, have more travel size items available.Upon checkout Chris made sure our receipt was correct and reflected our military family package, which we appreciated her taking the time to make sure everything was in order.All and all, this Hilton was well worth venturing off the 40 to experience! La Via Hilton Sedona!Situated well away from the hustle of Sedona, you get beautiful views and nice greeters welcoming you. Parking is very limited but we seemed to find a free spot. Room was nice and clean and very appealing but to find that the toiletries were not in place was the first drawback of more to come. Went downstairs to the pool and it was very family friendly. The poolside food and bar had a decent choice of drinks and fair but incredibly slow service. Non hotel guests attending seminars are slightly annoying asking for favors letting them into the pool area to relax around the water. Ordered breakfast and it was limited in choice and expensive. Coffee was of the military caliber, horrible. Was impressed with the presentation and taste of my waffle with chorizo and over easy eggs until I flipped the egg to find what appeared to be dog hair on my eggs. Picture is posted. Deserves a 1 and half star rating.My husband and I stayed here for our honeymoon...we picked this place because it was advertised as newly renovated and kind of away from the busier parts of Sedona. It was so disappointing. It is so frustrating that we spent money for our honeymoon on a place that was completely not worth the price. The staff did not make us feel very welcome. We told them it was our honeymoon and she just rolled her eyes and handed us a voucher for a free drink. We went to them later that day to ask for suggestions on good places to eat and you would have thought they never have visited Sedona! She just seemed perplexed we were asking the question...we learned we were better off asking people outside the hotel for help. It was so disappointing and frustrating that our honeymoon was ruined by such a lame location and snooty staff.This hotel has been absolutely perfect. I came here for a relaxing weekend away from Phoenix and was not disappointed. The property was beautiful and easy to find. The check in was very quick, allowing me to get to my room and unpack before heading into town.The room is in fantastic shape with granite countertops, a living room with fireplace, small kitchenette, and a huge bedroom and bathroom. Additionally, there is a small outside patio off of the living room. The room pictures looked great on the website but can't describe how great it is in person.I had a small issue with my booking as the Hilton associate that had booked the room for me did so incorrectly. Randy at the front desk was above an beyond helpful in clearing up the issue and ensuring that everything was corrected in a timely manner. She is a real asset to this property. This stay has been extremely nice and I would definitely recommend that you stay at this hotel.The Hilton Sedona is located about a mile from Tlaq and the "Y" intersection in Sedona. For the most part it is a typical hilton resort hotel. The room was nice, there was a living area, a separate bedroom and a fireplace (a plus). It is an older property which has been renovated and one can tell. I am taking a couple of points off for a couple of reasons. First the pressure in the shower was week - keep in mind we had done a bit of hiking in the area, so it would have been nice to have a normal or high pressure shower head. The internet service was choppy at best- constantly in and out. 3 stars.We had the best customer service! Starting from the front desk to maintenance, maid to restaurant and bar. You guys awesome! Thank you for your service!
review_content_20: Overall the stay was okay. The wifi was atrocious (needed to reconnect every few minutes) and we asked for our resort fee to be comped. The lobby is well appointed, but the rooms are a bit dated. The fireplace is a nice addition but it had a bit of an awkward placement. I would have preferred it in the bedroom. The staff was happy to give maps and recommendations for hiking trails. I wasn't a fan of the breakfast system for diamond members. They place a credit on your bill that covers the continental breakfast - but not the buffet which is all in the same area. They seemed to nickel and dime with this and the resort fee. I would stay somewhere else for my next visit to Sedona.What we liked:  it was good to stay in Oak Creek and drive up to Sedona - not far and what a better view during the trip?  By the way,  if you need food for your room there is an IGA off of Verde Valley School Rd. The room was nice (upgraded to a suite with Mt view). We enjoyed the fireplace as well. What we didnt like:  many rooms under renovation. We always had to walk away from the lobby due to the construction. This was tolerable but irritating when you are paying a $20 resort fee. The staff are nice but never put forth any extra effort. "How's that new restaurant down the street?"  We aren't sure - we dont have a menu yet. Need a drink at the pool?  Good luck finding someone. A waitress walked by and didnt even say hello!   The spa people dont seem to associate with the hotel. The hotel discount for spa services is only for certain treatments. Overall it just wasnt what you would expect from a Hilton. The people can make a difference and in this case, they made it worse.This hotel was a life saver for me and my family on our trip through Arizona. First, the front desk staff was excellent.Probably my favorite Hilton property, and I have been to many.  Huge, nice, clean, rooms. Great views, nice outdoor restaurant / lounge space.  Live music outside.  Had the beet salad and sweet potato fries.  Both really good and the salad was huge!My recent stay was to attend a conference at the Hilton.   Everything from our room accommodations to the breakfast, refreshments and desserts during the conference were top notch.  I did hear a few complaints that refreshments did not include soda pop!   I eat a mostly a vegetarian and unprocessed food diet, and I am usually the one finding it difficult to find healthy selections.  I was more than pleasantly surprised. All of the staff that I encountered were incredibly polite and friendly.  I think that this establishment must follow the 5 foot rule. Every staffer I encountered offered a good morning or how are you.  During my stay I required frequent use of ice packs.   Although we had a fridge in our room, there was not a freezer.  I was constantly bothering the front desk staff to ask for an ice pack. They were always accommodating and not once acted put out.   As I was dealing with some painful health issues, this was a life saver!  My husband played golf daily on site, while I attended meetings, and he was very pleased with the course.  If we come back to Sedona, we will surely stay here again!We stayed here for a weekend getaway, and the hotel did a decent job.  Given we are Gold members and stay at Hiltons around the world we have a good point of comparison when reviewing one location versus another.  They did go over and beyond to make sure we were comfortable.  Issues were we had to beg for bottled waters and basic Gold member perks that were easily provided staples in any other location in the world.  Hotel phones and Internet were spotty and cell phone reception almost non-existent.  Not a bad experience...but also not uniquely memorable.  We will be back unless we find a great rental on AirBnB or Flipkey or VRBO--which is almost comparatively the experience of staying here.  Service was almost no different than having no service at all.No room service after 10pm, if you arrive after that you have to walk to a bar on the property for takeout. In the time it takes to walk there you could drive to Wendys and the food would be 100x better. The view from the parking lot is awesone, from my room was ok. The small local hotels in the heart of Sedona offer better views and are closer to tours etcGreat hotel!! Beautiful and clean. The location was perfect -- close to all the action but not right in the middle of it! The restaurant in the hotel was delicious and the service there was great. The spa and their staff were also spectacular. My only complaint is the concierge service. They were incredibly unhelpful and even rude. They couldn't even do the simplest of tasks - such as suggest a restaurant or give directions to a store down the street.If they change the concierge staff, I would gladly go back!This is a nice hotel and I have stayed here many times over the years since they opened. I just have a few suggestions if you are thinking about staying here... The hotel restaurants and the room service are okay, but Sedona has some great restaurants -- go and check some of them out instead of staying in the hotel.  Though the rooms are fine, I suggest spending a little extra money and renting a suite. The suites are much nicer than the rooms and having a separate bedroom opens up all kinds of new possibilities. If you are planning to stay at this hotel for its pools, don't believe the photographs of the pools on this hotel's website. The photographer was very good and he made the pools look very spectacular. They are not. They are pretty much just hotel pools. If you want spectacular pools, go to Hawaii. There the hotels have great pools, this hotel does not. But, overall, this is nice place to stay and I never have any complaints.Great place for families or couples looking to relax. In the center of Sedona it has several pools designated for families/kids and not so what ever is your pleasure, quiet or play, its here. The staff were also super helpful, food there was great and also great food within walking distance. I was on a trip with me a my mother and had a great spa experience. If you are looking for somewhere to relax while you are not exploring the nearby red rocks, this is it. Also look into triple A discounts. We got a great upgrade because of it at a reasonable cost. Worth every penny!!Loved this place, wish I could have stayed a few more days. This was a rest stop on a trip with 12 other people. We had traveled from Chicago on our way to Santa Monica working with ministries along the way. This was a real treat! The room was clean and comfortable, the amenities wonderful, pools, spa, hot tubs. I spent a good part of my day doing laundry in the onsite laundry room which is why I would have loved another day or two here. I certainly intend to come back on my own some day soon.Hmmmmm, my family drove 7 hours and arrived at 2:45, we were told they would guarantee a call by 4:00pm latest. We didn't get a call until 4:30, and were told "sorry we forgot" ...what??? Isn't that really the only thing reception does ? I have two little kids with me :(Ok so we pull up to he front and look for a bell boy, "Sorry he's on a break." My husband asked if he could use the dolly . Ok so now we are bringing up our own bags! I know it's not the Four Seasons, but it's not exactly a best western either ! Not at $320 a night :/Room: weird layout (to many doors ); no bath tub but leaky shower door that spills everywhere, stained floor tiles.Customer service : If you don't mind never hearing a hello, or vacuuming while entering the lobby ( which they don't stop and you need to step around) then it's fine . Pool: dint date order a drink at the pool without going up the bar! As we were told by the bartender, they only take food orders. Ummm, the pool attendant asked if we wanted to have a server sent up. We replied yes. She can up and I asked for lemonade and the look I got was.....how was I supposed to know she wasn't a server :/When we did go back down and ask for nachos , it was quick but I know why! The store bought blue chips were covered in COLD liquid cheese . How ow that even possible ? Was it someone else's order that for sent back ? Who knows ?Let's end with this. I cancelled a previously scheduled message. If this was foreshadowing of things to come , I didn't want to blow another  couple hundred for mediocre ! I'm mean if a prickly pear margarita was bleh (which it was) , then how good could a full service be :/Super disappointed in the Hilton chain... The property, lobby decor, and rooms are very nice (just like I expected). We got in around 9pm and were taken care of immediately by probably the only nice employee in this entire place. We walked into a room that was pretty decent (in size with a living room that had a fireplace, separate from the bedroom) but smelt a little stale, once the AC was lowered it was fine. The first thing I notice was the dirty floor in the bathroom (don't let the weird streaks that look like dirt on the tile trick you, that's not what I'm referring to) there was hair from the previous guests all over. Wanting to relax I called downstairs to ask about pool hours (family pool closed at 10 and quiet pool closed at 11) When I went downstairs I asked for directions to arrive at a chained up pool that was closed due to weather. You would think that one of the two staff members would have informed me of this. The next morning we were on our way out and stopped at the front desk to ask that housekeeping pay extra attention to the floors. Instead of being concerned with our request the lady explained, with attitude, that house keeping wasn't there yet. We let her know it wasn't a big deal as we were heading out. We asked about breakfast and again with attitude were told sorry it's not open yet. By the end of the conversion we had to offer our room number to her because at no point did she care to find out what room needed the bathroom floors cleaned. In the afternoon we went to the pool for over three hours and not once did anyone walk by to offer us towels, food or drinks. I'm glad I have two legs and two arms to do it myself.  At night we ended up with a leak I our bedroom (monsoon season) the grounds keeper was there right away and said he would notify the front desk to move us rooms. We get a call asking if we would like to be moved. Umm, if you are trying to sleep and your roof is leaking, wouldn't you? I know they have no control over the leak but they do have control of how they treat their guests. This place needs help!We had a really nice stay at this hotel.  The rooms were spacious however they are rather dated .  If u visit this hotel there Stone massages are a must.We stayed one night, and I'm gonna say it was "just okay" , definitely nothing special. I'd look around before I would stay there again. One major turn of was the cockroaches I saw out in outside dinning area, totally grossed me out. The breakfast buffet is overpriced and the quality of the food is sub standard.  Just keeping it real....I was quite disappointed after staying here. I paid a little extra so that we could have a nice experience in Sedona and I was severely disappointed. After checking in late, I was getting my 3 year old ready for bed and when I went to get her into the bed, it was FULL of ants! ICK!!!! At midnight I then had to pack all of our stuff up and move rooms, well they moved us to a SMALLER room?!!! I didn't want to bother asking for a nicer room since it was already midnight and no one offered to help us move rooms. I wouldn't spend the extra money to stay here next time, I'd rather stay at the Hyatt or somehow that will have better customer experiences.The best fish tacos in Sedona . They have really good cocktails and food . Wednesday and Saturday there is good live music in the restaurantI'm pretty liberal with my five star ratings, but there's just no way I could do that in this case.  Firstly, let me say that our stay was "fine".  The people at the front desk were great; friendly, helpful etc.I thought the lobby was cool, zen like and I loved the organic art.  So, we walked into our room, (the pictures are totally accurate.) and it smelled nasty.  I said it smelled sort of mildew-y and my husband said it smelled like something died there. Because I really don't complain about things unless it's pretty bad, we decided to open the  window and air out the room. It was nice though.  We had a suite and the two rooms, one of which had a small balcony, were  comfortable.  It was clean, the bed was very comfy, and the views were grand!  No kidding! That's the word that comes to mind when I see the mountains in Sedona.  We decided to check out the rest of the resort.  We weren't disappointed.  There were two fabulous pools, one with a bar, the other was on the spa side where the fitness center/spa is located.  The restaurant seemed to have a good atmosphere with nice decor, but I thought the menu was boring  I don't eat meat and there wasn't much choice for vegetarians.  Anyway, when we returned to our room, the smell was still there and my husband decided to call and see what could be done.  They were genuinely concerned and told us they could move us to another room.  Well, we were already unpacked with the fridge semi full.  When we hesitated about that choice, they told us they would send housekeeping up.  Some guy came with spray and looked for the source of the smell.  Not much luck though.  I asked him if he could smell it...He said he couldn't but he was having sinus problems.  After he left, my husband actually moved the fridge where the smells seemed to be coming from. What he saw was water that spilled from the evaporation pan and he thinks there was a "dead critter in that evaporation pan".  He couldn't take the pan out because of the way the fridge was made. ANYWAY, the spray helped a little.  In the morning, the coffee maker didn't work.  It just kept turning off, wouldn't stay on.  That wasn't a big deal though.  I have a great husband, he went out and bought some strong coffee.We did the Yoga class at 11 and asked for an extended check out time. They were very gracious and said there was no problem.  They also let us check in a little early when we first got there. The Yoga class was fantastic!  My husband and I have been doing Yoga for a while, and Andrea was a wonderful instructor.  All in all the stay was fine.  The decor was "okay", but I would have thought it would be a little more upscale.  However, I think they indicated that they were going to redecorate all of the rooms.   Honestly, it really was fine.I stayed at the Hilton Sedona Resort & Spa for five nights during my stay in Sedona.  I requested a suite with a nice view and was given one with a spectacular view!  (I posted pictures)  The suite was wonderful, I am handicapped and unfortunately the room was extremely far from the lobby elevator.  I requested another suite that was closer and they happily obliged.  On my second day I was moved to another suite, the view was beautiful, but not as gorgeous as the first.  It was quite cold on the nights of my stay and I loved being able to use the fireplace.  The staff was very friendly and went out of their way to make my stay a great one.  The beds were extremely comfortable, I slept even more soundly than I do at home.  I was surprised at how quiet the suite was, it was just two doors down from the main elevator but I didn't hear anything at all.  They have a great gift shop that carries a little of everything.  I found a great gift for my mother at a nice price.  They have some beautiful jewelry, a nice selection of t-shirts and sweatshirts, a nice selection of gifts, great postcards, snacks and drinks.  My favorite was the tiny dream catcher jewelry, very intricate.  They have a great restaurant and offer the full menu for room service.  My suite had a refrigerator and a microwave, so leftovers didn't go to waste.  Overall, my trip was wonderful, I enjoyed my stay at the Hilton very much.  The only thing that I would change is that the Hilton isn't actually in Sedona.  I didn't have a rental car and the taxi trips to Sedona can get pretty expensive.  An average of $25 each trip.  Other than that, everything was pretty close to perfect.  I would definitely recommend it to anyone traveling to the Sedona area.I would stay here again. There is a lot of facilities, ranging from the heated pool, the golf course across the street, the bar, the restaurant, the spa and a much appreciated balcony on each room that provides an excellent view of the red rocks.I stayed for 2 nites and paid with my miles, it was rather pricey but worthwhile.The weather plays an important factor when visiting Sedona. I would prefer to have visited when it was warmer so the pools area is much more fun. Unfortunately, i was there during Spring and it was still chilly.  The pools are heated, there is a hot tub, but it was still cold in the evening. They even have plenty of fireplace / firepits to keep you warm.If you do visit, try to get a tee time across the road and make sure you visit Bell Rock trail.
review_content_40: Wow!  I guess I needed to stay here when all of the other folks giving this place 4/5 stars where!  Completely sub par experience for what I thought the standard of a Hilton should be.  Maybe it has something to do with the lousy hotel restaurant employing the ignorant waitress by the name of Kelli from New York (as her name tag shown) who decided to exhibit blatantly racist attitudes toward my husband and myself---when all I wanted was my order to be taken and to eat--whether she had a personal problem with folks of my complexion or not!  The food is just about edible anyway.  Hilton---what happened?!!Or, maybe it was the ridiculous, most inconvenient planning by management for accommodations to guests needing to make their way through the hotel while undergoing renovations?!  Walking through guest rooms and business offices just to get to the gym/pool/lousy restaurant, etc.  is not my idea of vacation or my vision of what it means to stay at a "Hilton Resort and Spa!"  Could've just spent the money at a Garden Inn.  The set up is frankly for lack of a better word---ugly.  Some of your staff clearly exhibits that "ugliness" as well.Note to Kelli from NY: Keep that $&@! at home Kelli!  It's 2014!  You can certainly wait your shift through until you can put on the white robe and pointed hat!  Since it is that serious apparently.Oh! And I musn't forget to mention the 4pm housekeeping visits to our room for cleaning!  Really Hilton?!  Last thing anyone wants to do is spend a day hiking and come home tired to a dirty room!Hopefully, this hotel will return to its glory days of 15-20 years ago once this renovation is completed.  Crossing my fingers that the upgrades will not only include the lobby but these outdated rooms as well.I dislike having to write so negatively---but, the level of disappointment with this "Hilton experience" warranted my speaking my mind.  Good luck if u choose this place as there are much nicer in the area!The hotel is nice...I'm giving 2 stars bc the restaurant on the other hand is HORRENDOUS! Keep in mind I'm 7 months pregnant. We got to the restaurant about 5 mins before our 8pm reservation and were seated immediately. We then sat for over 20 mins before our server came over to take our drink order since we waited so long for any service we went ahead and placed our whole order at that time. After another 25 mins of waiting for our drinks and appetizer my husband complained to the manager and mysteriously within mins we had our drink and appetizer. Again we placed at our food order at approx. 8:20pm at 9:05 the table next to us complained and got their food. About 10 mins later our food came. At this point I was too nauseous to eat and got it to go. While the manager took care of our bill there was no apology whatsoever from her or the server. The only person to help us or apologize was another server Shelly who had seen us sitting there and tried to do all she could to help. Shelly and the guy would kept our water glasses full were the only bright spot of this $80 dinner.Spent Christmas Holiday here with our geriatric dog on a package deal.  The hotel remodel is very nicely done.  Staff was great even with the crush of holiday guests.  Restaurant was very good by big resort standards.  And of course, the views were the icing on the cake.My complaint is about CONNECTIVITY.  Our AT&T cell phone reception flipped back and forth between one bar and "No Service", all the while showing either LTE or 4G for data service.  In other words if you could connect, it might be fast.  Inside the resort we had free internet as part of the package, otherwise it is $12 per day.  Even by using the wired ethernet connection in our room, the fastest connection I achieved was .67 Mbps (note the decimal point).  Good dial-up is .56.  The FCC definition of Broadband service is 4Mbps or higher, so this was definitely not Broadband.  Having said that, the WiFi signal was very strong everywhere, just really slow.  The internet service was better than nothing, but we drove to Sedona twice a day just to check our phone messages and email.The staff here is excellent.  Very friendly, always smiling and ready to help.  The view is great and I do like my room.  I upgraded a King suite with a view so I see the Red Rocks from the little balcony.Having said that, the King Suite itself isn't all that amazing.  Pretty standard room.  The tub was pretty disappointing.  I expected better of the bathroom for the room type and price, but it was just a regular, boring tub.  Not even worth a bubble bath.Don't get room service.  We all expect room service to be incredibly over-priced, that's pretty typical, but the food should at least be cooked well.  $65 for one steak and Gorgonzola cheese hash browns?  Give me a break.  One morning I ordered breakfast and the bacon was under-cooked, the toast was semi-burned on one side, and each meal I ordered from room service arrived lukewarm to cold.I did have a massage and that was lovely.  Again, the staff has been wonderful.Oh!  The in-room coffee is horribly weak.  Double up on the little pod things if you want coffee that isn't brown water.  Coffee machine also doesn't get the water very hot.  Just sort of warm.We just arrived home from a holiday at the Hilton, and I have mixed feelings about this place. Gorgeous views, updated rooms, lovely pool area, and super spa employees! Here's the negatives with this Hilton; if you are going to call yourself a resort, be a resort. They have more programs for people's pets than they do kid stuff. The beds are horrible!!! Need a massage and a chiropractor to get over my stay! Thank goodness I did get a massage while staying there - great services, although the prices are pretty steep at the spa, and I have been to better appointed spas that were more affordable than this. The restaurant service at the hotel was slow and the food was mediocre - for the kind of money we paid for the breakfasts, I expected more. If they were a regular restaurant, they wouldn't last 6 months. The pool food is also mediocre. Thank goodness Miley's Cafe and Cucina Rustica were close by! But thank goodness most of the employees were very nice, and the concierge was helpful with our day trips. Would I stay here again? Good question. Since we were able to use reward points towards our stay, maybe. But if I am looking for more of a resort feel, this is not the place. Pretty much just an overpriced hotel with a good view and a golf course.I am an exclusive Hilton property guest and have high expectations on all fronts of the experience. This property is beautifully appointed from the lobby to the guest rooms. My wife and I stayed for a weekend getaway and upgraded to the king Suite with fireplace. The service was Hilton quality from check-in to breakfast server. The only negatives about the property: it is not in Sedona. The property is actually in the village of Oak Creek that does not have many restaurants or bars, this forces you to drive 10 minutes give or take into Sedona to wander about. The other negative was the bathroom did not have the same luxury as the property, it was not bad just not 4-5 stars. Finally a bit of personal gripe, the room we had was a suite with a kitchenette, however there were absolutely no utensils or kitchenware..... It was empty drawers and cabinets?I wish I'd read the reviews here instead of relying on Trip Advisor. The place isn't terrible, but it is a far cry from what I'd expect from Hilton. My boyfriend referred to it as the Applebee's of hotels. That says it pretty well, but if you're looking for details...The room was mediocre at best - thin carpet, cheap-looking furniture. I had been lured by the idea of a fireplace in the room, and while we did use it, it was nothing like the cozy experience I'd imagined. In fact, nothing about the room was cozy except the bed itself. Unfortunately, it had a rather pointy metal headboard, so the only time it was actually cozy was when you were lying down. I worried that leaning back would result in a head wound.The restaurant (The Grille) had really poor service during the 2 times we ate there. Both times the hostess/host was nowhere to be found, so a member of the waitstaff had to seat us. Granted, that's no biggie, but it was indicative of the general sense of disorganization. No one seemed to know what they were doing, parts of our meal were forgotten, and the waitstaff communicated to each other by yelling across the restaurant. We couldn't help but laugh because it seemed like we were caught in a scene from a bad sitcom. Still, I will admit that the roasted chicken I had was really quite good, so there's that. (See, I said something nice.)On the drive home today, I noticed we'd been charged the $18 resort fee for each day even though we did not use the wifi or any of the resort amenities. I'll be calling them about that because the way the woman at checkin represented it, that was an optional expense. Perhaps I misunderstood.In any case, that is the last time we'll stay there... and probably the last time we'll stay at a Hilton. The good news is we still had a great time exploring Sedona - a truly gorgeous place. Will be looking for recommendations on better accommodations for our next trip.First time to visit Sedona, AZ and stayed here at Hilton. The location was very nice and away from the busyness of uptown Sedona.  The staff were very accommodating especially Jackie at the restaurant. I highly recommend this hotel and will definitely come back given a chance.The location of this hotel was just about perfect for us.  We had many activities planned in the Sedona area during our stay and we were never too far from any of them.  The hotel is very clean as you would expect from a Hilton.  It is a little small for a business that advertises itself as a resort, but we weren't planning on spending a lot of time at the hotel anyway.   The breakfast buffet was average,  but adequate.  The wait staff was hit or miss, some were excellent and others were slow.   Most everyone in the hotel staff was friendly and cheerful.As far as Hilton resorts go this place is top notch. Great view of the red rock, a nice lobby bar with great food and in one of the most beautiful places in the world.Great place right along Sedona. Can't beat the view of all the Red Rocks...although our room was facing the golf course. It is kind of smaller of rooms compared to other hiltons. The bar does have happy hour 3-5!One of the best stops on the book tour. Comfortable, relaxing, great rooms and great prices. Lamb Bison Burger was excellent and the views were beyond beautiful. Staff was also top notch and very helpful.As a Hilton Honors member, I am used to  getting good service concerning reservations from Hilton, this was not the case. I called Hilton Sedona to cancel a reservation we had made because I was unable to do it online. I told them I needed to cancel the reservation and was told, "yes, the computer is really slow". They were having trouble also, but canceled the reservation. A few days later I received an email "welcoming me on my upcoming trip". I called back and was told there was no cancellation, but it was done now. On my next credit card bill I was charged the one night fee. I disputed the fee to my credit card company and Hilton STILL CHARGED ME AGAIN!  I called and was put on hold for 10 minutes, transferred and disconnected.Our suite was spacious and comfortable, the Spa and Fitness Center are fabulous and the outdoor patio space is very inviting.  We highly recommend this hotel! We were very impressed with the excellent guest services provided by Katie, the Manager, Jessica, the Front Desk representative and Christie in Lost and Found/Housekeeping.  Katie and Jessica professionally handled a room rate problem caused on our end by speaking directly to the third party with whom we booked our reservation.  When I returned home, I discovered I was missing my favorite white shirt.  I called the Hilton and gave the information to Christie.  She called me back within the hour with good news, that she'd be happy to ship it complimentary via UPS Ground.  I had my shirt back within a week.This is my first visit to Sedona and I feel in love with the city. Is so quiet and serene. Hilton has just been renovated, the atmosphere is very nice, they have 3 pools and a wonderful spa. The staff is very friendly and helpful. We did 2 days back to back hiking and the views are amazing. I will recommend the Hilton and we will go back again. The suites are very spacious and very clean, they have balconies overlooking the golf club or the red rocks. If you want a look of the red rocks you have to ask for a room that has it.Been coming here once a year for years, it is slowly going downhill and is down to just "ok". If it wasn't the site of the conference I would look elsewhere. They've now instituted a "resort fee" to enjoy things like wi-fi and the gym. Seriously, 2013 and internet is an add-on? Fortunately for us it was included with the conference. Have also noticed they've removed some niceties from years past, the big firepit out back is gone, the nice booth seating area in the bar is gone along with the sculptures.I stayed here with my brother and his wife. We were in a suite and it was very nice, very posh. The view of the red rock is amazing. The lobby is very pretty. Rooms came with many amenities. The front desk staff was very friendly. Check in and check out was a smooth easy process. I can't say much more because we only stayed one night. But it was a good one.First, my husband is DIAMOND level with Hilton, staying weekly at their properties.We loved Sedona but had an incident at the Hilton where we were put in a less than Diamond level room, asked to be moved to a better room, the staff said they'd handle our bags - and items were stolen. They moved us from one end of the floor to another, and we're out a $400 item! The manager wasn't helpful, we filed a police report, and she told them they assumed no responsibility! The bags were out of our possession for 8 hours (we hiked and they moved us from one room to the other).. how are they not liable? We filed a claim with their insurance company and they state that the burden of proof wasn't met, and in fact claims are very hard to prove. Even my insurance company is shocked they refuse to reimburse us. If they treat one of their most loyal guests this way, I can only imagine how others are screwed.. Bad experience at this hotel.. Bad customer service. Beware!Great hotel with very nice rooms. To bad it is so far from all the action in Sedona.This hotel is ok.. I liked the steam and sauna and the open pit fires at night but.. nothing to write home about, it's just a little outdated and tired and needs an upgrade in it's rooms and common areas... I would spend the extra money and stay at a nicer place as this hotel is outside of the center of sedona.. Though that works in your favor as you are by a beautiful mountain! Overall if you need a night then thats cool but longer than a night and I would find a more beautiful place..
review_content_60: My fiance and I spent three nights at the Hilton in Sedona.  It was a serviceable hotel, if not particularly ideal.  Our room cost $250 a night, and it wasn't really nice, but I guess you pay out for a hotel in a resort town.Here are a few things I liked.  First, the hotel was very dog friendly.  We got a room on the first floor, where we were allowed to stay with our dog, and it was easy to take him out.  We weren't allowed to leave him home alone, but this is pretty standard.  When I asked the concierge about dog-sitting services, she recommended someone immediately.  The concierge was a definite asset to the hotel.  We got a lot of guidance from Marilyn, a friendly woman who gave us tips on what to do and where to eat around town.  She booked our Pink Jeep tour for us, and she printed out a list of dog-friendly Sedona restaurants she had on file.  The hotel common areas, including the lobby, pool, and fire pit, were pretty nice.  They felt resort-like, and they were never crowded.  The parking lot was also relatively easy to navigate.  Our room was large, much larger than expected.  It was an apartment-style space with a separate bedroom and living area with a little kitchenette.The room, though, was not great.  It felt shabby, dingy, old, and the bed was remarkably lumpy and uncomfortable.  For the amount of space we had in the room, we were unable to locate a single drawer.  If they were there, they were well hidden, and there weren't many.  We ended up leaving our clothes in our luggage.The other issue with the Hilton is that the location was just not ideal.  When we booked our trip, we didn't realize there was a place called Oak Creek, separated from central Sedona by a distance of several miles.  It took a long time to drive from our hotel to anything else we really wanted to do, and so we drove back and forth a lot during our trip.I'd like to come back to Sedona in the not-too-distant future, but I wouldn't stay in this Hilton again.  I'm sure there are worse hotels in town, but there must be many that are better, or at least better value.  I didn't hate this place, but next time, I'll try my luck elsewhere.Location wise, this place is about 15 min driving distance from the downtown area. Not a big deal-it's a beautiful drive. The rooms were ok. Nothing spectacular but clean and comfortable. I'm giving them 2 stars for the complete indifference of the front desk clerks (they don't even look up to say hello) and absolute lack of family activities. Yes, there are jeep tours etc downtown, but you are paying a hefty price to stay at this hotel and getting very little back in terms of service ON the property. There are pools of course but they are FREEZING in the fall/winter time. They'll tell you the pools are heated but it's not true.Also, they have local seniors sitting in the front lobby watching TV all day long, so the hotel guests can't come down and relax in the lobby (because guess what, once you are back at the hotel in the evening, THERE'S"S NOTHING TO DO...but I already said that). Same situation in the gym and group fitness classes.I was taken here as a surprise get away for Valentine's day. We had gotten a suite with a fireplace and fantastic view off our private balcony. Everything was beautiful, a little out dated but still nice. They were remodeling the lobby so we had to check in in a little side room which was a little confusing but worked nonetheless.  Only a couple things really stood out to me negatively. The first was the couch in our room smelled awful, like sweaty gym shorts, especially in one corner. I refused to sit on that side even though it was the best angle to view the tv. Second the tv in the bedroom was not working properly. All of the channels except for maybe 3 came through. We placed a call to the front desk and informed them of the issue. They sent someone up immediately, which was very nice considering it was almost midnight. The gentleman they sent up could not figure out the problem so we were issued a credit to use in whatever way we wanted. The gentleman suggested we get the breakfast in bed. After a brief deliberation we decided breakfast sounded like a great idea. So we picked our choices and hung the door hanger with the breakfast choices outside the door prior to the 2 am deadline (it was midnight by then). Thus, leading to the last issue, our breakfast never arrived. We had asked for it to arrive between 9:30 and 10 time frame. At 10:30, still no breakfast. We opened the door to find they had not even taken our order off the door. So we called down again and let them know what happened. They apologized repeatedly and had someone contact us for our order which would take a half an hour to be prepared. Our check out time was at 11 which caused a little bit of a conundrum considering we wouldn't get our breakfast until then. Called down one last time to see if it was possible to extend our check out time. They promptly adjusted it so we could check out at noon giving us ample time to enjoy our morning. Another issue we couldn't do anything about was when the air conditioner kicked on the sink in the bathroom made a loud tapping (like a Jumanji drum beat) the entire time it was on. Overall, there were some minor hiccups but the stay was decent. They did their best to make the stay worthwhile. I kind of wish we could have stayed another night so we could enjoy the amenities more (the Spa and golfing). The pool however, was also being renovated.Awesome place!  Check in was quick and easy.  We travel with a small dog. He is treated as well as us. Love this place! Great service as wellWe were pretty unimpressed with this hotel. Pros: front desk people were very friendly. The location is perfect if you're looking to enjoy Sedona without the crowded feeling you get down town. Great restaurants in walking distance (we ate at the schoolhouse which was very good). Rooms were ok but nothing spectacular. Cons: construction and renovations in the hotel are ongoing. There were huge bed frames, microwaves, and other construction materials that stayed in the hallways the entire time we were there. No valet people. No luggage carts. A crane sitting outside our window (def took away from the view). Concierge was often unavailable via phone or otherwise. The worst part of the stay was getting a drink at the bar upon arrival. When we asked if we can sit outside for happy hour, the staff looked at us confused and without a real answer. After talking to the third, and fairly impolite staff who didn't really have an answer for us, we just resigned ourselves to sitting at the bar. While we were trying to enjoy our beverage we witnessed the bartenders and staff blatantly arguing with one another. It was embarrassing and highly uncomfortable for us. We drank our drinks quickly just to get out of the bar and away from the wretched display of unprofessionalism. Overall, my husband and I agreed that if we had to pay for a hotel (we got this hotel from points) we would not stay here again. It's a Hilton but really you can't put lipstick on a pig....Had a nice visit! We did bring our kids and it worked out well! I would def love to come back and spend a weekend with just the hubs and I for a bit more romantic weekend! The room was great with a fireplace and balcony! Very relaxing and comfortable place!For the two nights my family and I and stayed here for, Hilton served us well. We stayed in a suite and the room was perfectly clean and supplied with lots of towels. If you stay on the first floor, instead of access to a balcony, you will have access to the parking lot. Which is a good thing because it saves you the trip of walking through the lobby to exit and it is a quick walk to grab something from your car. Service is ok. The staff  is friendly. Though we were given notice of noise complaints from other guest one night, security was friendly in regards to it. We ate at the Blue Water Cafe which is pretty good. It is located in the pool area- perfect place to relax in the sun with a cocktail. Don't be fooled, it looks like a bar but they also serve food. My sister and I tried their Sangria and it was alright. Really sweet.The chicken nachos is good too, but nothing spectacular. We also tired their sampler plate of chicken tenders, onion rings, fried mushrooms and french fries. On an empty stomach, the food is great and their portions are pretty big so share!Second time we have enjoyed this hotel in two years. Staff goes out of their way to ensure everything is perfect from the room to the food to the pools to the fire on the outside deck. Not one thing could be mentioned negatively, this place knows how to treat their guests.  We have told others about it after our first experience and will tell even more now after an equally perfect stay this year. Thank you all at Sedona Hilton for an excellent time!As a business traveler, I've stayed at hundreds of Hiltons and cashed in my points to stay at some of their more posh properties, and I expected the Hilton Resort & Spa to be one of them. Sadly, the website gives the illusion of luxury, when in fact it felt more like a mountain-themed Residence Inn. Thankfully I didn't pay cash for my stay, but I did spend a boat-load of points on 3 nights here for a mother-daughter summer vacation. The room was large, but had zero character...just your basic tacky hotel furniture and a view of the parking lot. I walked in and my heart sank. I was expecting a little more class, maybe a spa-serenity theme, but no...even the Hampton Inn properties had a better feel than this room. The pool area was much smaller than the website photos imply. They must have done some tricky angles, because it was a small pool with a waterfall into another small pool and the seats fill up fast. They have food and drink service around the pool, but you'd be better off getting a sandwich at Subway...I paid $15 for the saddest Club Sandwich I've ever forced myself to eat. Plastic-like chicken and stale white bread (which was called "artisan" on the menu...ha!)By the 3rd day, we discovered that the lap pool was the best place to grab a shady seat and escape the screaming children playing in the other pools. Either way, lounging by a lap pool while the Resort members trained for their triathalons was not my idea of a relaxing getaway. The room had 2 refrigerators, stocked with nothing (no mini bar), and the one and only ice machine was a good 10 minute hike to the other end of the property. Not the amenities I'd expect from a Category 7 Hilton. The spa was pretty nice, I will admit. As a Hilton Honors member, you get free access to the spa which includes a super nice fitness center, lap pool, and exercise classes (we took yoga twice, it was a nice perk!)We paid a ridiculous amount for 2 massages, and both my mom and I had super-chatty therapists, which totally defeats the purpose of a massage...peace and quiet! I've had plenty of massage work done on me, and my experience at the Hilton was one of the least-professional (and most $$) by far. I was hoping the massage would redeem the ugly room, but nope...more disappointment. There seem to be better places with that 'desert charm' thing going on in Sedona. The Hilton is an okay place to sleep, but not ideal for a weekend of luxury and relaxation.I read some of the reviews so we booked a room.  We were disappointed.   For what you pay and what you get.  Not happy.   This is not up to Hilton standards.As a person of color I will not stay here again.  I felt very unwelcome.  The staff was so so.  I was on a family vacation with my family and was very excited and happy.  I took my children to the pool and people immediately left.  I then took them to the other pool and within 5 minutes they left again.  We then went back to the first pool and there they were back in the pool.  The engineer who fixed the broken tub in our room was unpleasant.  When we first came to check in we were told that they had a room with a view available but upon seeing my husband who is darker than me they then only had a first floor room available.  I thought it was my imagination but clearly it was not.  I will not spend another dime in the city of Sedona!Stayed for one night after a round of golf at Sedona Golf resort which is right next door, which is very convenient.  Its not in Sedona and there is only a couple of restaurants within walking distance.  The hotel room was clean, we stayed in a reg king room and had a fire place and frig and microwave.  Overall its a nice hotel but I wouldn't classify it as a resort.  They have a spa and a beautiful patio area for dinner or drinks, but it just doesn't feel like a resort.  Maybe its just me.I will stay here again, but only because they are so close to the golf course.The rooms are large with 7 interior doors!  It seemed to keep going and going.  There is a little fridge, coffee pot, sink and microwave as well as a little patio off the living room area.  The staff was very friendly and the resort grounds are gorgeous!  We had dinner in the main restaurant off the lobby.  The food was great.  I guess I would have to give it only 4 stars because the lounge closes at 11pm, even when the hotel is full.  Thanks to Brian for pointing out the Full Moon Cafe at the bottom of the hill, and walking us most of the way there. Check out the fire pits by the pools - very relaxing.Great spot.  We loved staying south of Sedona in Oak Creek, where the vibe is quiet and serene.  I would recommend staying here over the Hyatt in downtown, so you get more of a vacation feel (if that's your thing), and you only have a 5 mile (scenic) drive to town!  There are some restaurants and shops in Oak Creek as well, so you may not even choose to drive to Sedona.  Beautiful views.  We had a golf course view, but I would try for the red rock view next time.  We were on the 2nd floor, so there was some noise above us...try for the 3rd (top) floor if possible to avoid this, but you'll obviously have more stairs to climb if you don't use the elevator.  If you are a golfer, stay here since the golf course is right across the street.We would definitely stay here again if we visit the Sedona area.Beautiful Resort, was looking at a venue for daughter upcoming wedding. Wouldn't mind coming back to stay a night or two!The hotel is actually in the Village of Oak Creek just south of Sedona which is a 15-20 minute drive away.  The room was a nice size with mini fridge and microwave.  There is also a small balcony to put your wet swimsuits to dry.  The main pool was cold.  I assume it is only heated by the sun.  It was hot while we were there but it didn't get the pool warm enough.  Food at the restaurant is good but the breakfast buffet is lacking.  You can get omelets and pancakes with the buffet but you need to ask them to make it for you.  You can get free water bottles at the concierge but beware as to whoever is working the desk.  Sometime you get a great concierge; other times a big grump.I really like this place. It's a great deal for the price. The rooms are comfortable, they have everything that you would expect, and the service here is quite good. Also, it's kinda nice to be a little off the beaten path. The Village of Oak Creek is much quieter than Sedona, and it only takes about 15 minutes to drive to Sedona from here.The hotel has two pools...they have one set up for kids and another "quiet" pool. I plan to use that one. :) They keep the water heated to 80 degrees, so it's nice on a warm day.Their gym is better than most hotel gyms. Usually they aren't that great and tend to be stocked with so-so equipment. This one has everything you would want for a workout, and their locker rooms are very nice. Free use of the gym with your stay.Our family of 4 stayed in a double queen suite.  Rooms are clean and have a southwest decor. Our suite was spacious- 2 queen beds in a separate room, dining area with mini fridge, wet bar, microwave.  The living area has a fireplace, desk and pull out sofa.  We also had a balcony with a view of Red Rock. Lots of room for 2 adults and 2 teens.  The hotel should cover the balcony door- the sun is awfully bright at 6am, but if you get a room facing the back, you will love the view.Although there were families there, activities for kids on the hotel are limited to the pools.  There is a workout room, tennis courts and a spa on property and golf across the street. There is also a small gift shop on property.There are few dining options in this area. The restaurant on property ,The Grill, is a hit or miss. We dined there 2 different nights and food was inconsistent in quality.  Wait staff was always friendly. It can be pricey for a family- $16+ per person.  Blue Water Cafe serves drinks and light fare at the pool.There is a small retail/restaurant area within walking distance with Italian food (pricey) , a mongolian stir fry place and a few other businesses.  Not a lot of foot traffic there. A short drive past the roundabouts will take you to Wendys and subway and several other eateries.  This hotel is about 15 minutes outside of Sedona, in the Village of Oak Creek ( the nearest Starbucks is at the Hyatt in Sedona)  but it is a straight and easy drive to get to Sedona, Bell Rock, Cathedral Rock( fyi, Cathedral Rock is off "Back O Beyond" road- not clearly marked) .  It is about 90 mins from PHX and 2.5 hrs from Grand Canyon.Stayed here for 3 nights on a very nice Arizona vacation. The room was clean, nicely decorated, had a decent view (I was hoping for more though), and the staff was nice. I had breakfast every morning, and thought it was great. Had everything I wanted.I also dinner at their restaurant twice, and both times were fine. I thought the food was good, but the price was too high for what you get (it's not such a fancy place, yet the prices were high). Overall, I enjoyed my stay and don't have any major complains. I think I'll come back again in the future, if I visit Arizona again.My partner and I recently had a great experience at this resort, particularly the service we received from the concierge Thea.  We mentioned that we were vegan and she went out of her way to find places for us to have a great dining experience. We also mentioned we were looking at the real estate market in the city and she was very generous with her help on local information.  I can not praise her genuine and warm approach to the guests of the resort enough.  The resort itself is nice and very welcoming overall.  The front desk attendant that checked us in was also very helpful and pleasant upon arrival.
review_content_80: Here is the good, bad, and the ugly.Let me start by saying that I am a Hilton Diamond (which only means I have stayed at a ton of Hilton properties because of work travel - I'm not otherwise special due to this designation). So yes, I have stayed at a ton of Hilton properties, in the US and in Europe.Hands down, this was the worst Hilton (not Hilton property, but actual Hilton) I have ever frequented. Let me break it down:The good:They did allow our dog, who came with us on the stay. They have rooms on the first floor designated for dogs, so if you have a dog, don't expect a room on the 2nd or 3rd floor. The staff was very, very friendly. And of course, the location - Sedona - is amazing. Our view from our non-private deck area (if we moved toward the parking lot about 20 feet) was quite breathtaking.The decent: The restaurant food was decent. Breakfast was pretty good. The staff there was fantastic (a recurring theme). The pool area and other amenities were also quite nice.The bad:The overall quality of the rooms was just meh. For a Hilton, I expect more. Also, there were private homes within about 30 feet of our room, and trees which obscured the view directly from our patio area (which was non-private, also a concern.) WiFi was free as a Hilton Diamond, but when we checked out, there were multiple charges for WiFi, and I was told "this is intended for only one device. Did you use more than one device?" I'm guessing the look on my face was telling, because she immediately removed those charges. But I've never heard this anywhere else (and yes, she was very polite). And, the WiFi sucked. Wouldn't stay connected (probably leading to the charges), so we'd have to repeatedly sign back in. And when it DID stay connected, it rivaled my 28k dialup connection from the last century. Slow, people. Also, our television came on sporadically, though thankfully not during sleeping hours. Never did figure this one out, so I unplugged it. The mini-fridge didn't work well, and there was no freezer component.The ugly:Well, the WiFi. I was working remotely for four of the days we stayed there, so the internet was just about enough to prevent my work from being at all fruitful. There was also a goodly amount of 'hallway traffic' and other guest noise. I don't know if this is representative of really loud guests, or poor insulation/construction.As I said, this is definitely the worst-overall Hilton experience I have had, and I have had lots.The Hampton Inn we stayed at in Phoenix was far better than this property. Sure, I have stayed at Hamptons that were worse than this Hilton, but for a Hilton, you expect a certain thing. That thing isn't here in Sedona.So, if not for the great staff, and they fact we could bring our dog, this would have been a rare (for me) 1-star review. Definitely will not be returning to this Hilton. Sedona on the other hand..... absolutely!!!Hotel is nice, but FAR from Sedona happenings. Unfortunately not many good views of red rocks (can only really see the formations from the parking lot).The room service bison burger was all charcoaly and way overdone. The jacuzzi was lukewarm which is an extreme let down once you get all the way to the pool! On the bright side, got an amazing massage at the really nice spa. Go for the 80 minute spa special hot rocks energy and deep tissue awesome.- Tamara Cross LawyerFull review: whentozen.com/2010/09/a-...ActivitiesThis month, I have the extreme pleasure of visiting Sedona which is a two hour ride from Scottsdale, AZ. It was nice to escape the heat into the mountains with a high intensity cardio plan in mind. I grabbed my CamelBak and totted my mountain bike up to the Solder's Pass Trail of Route 89A. If you are driving up to Sedona 89A from Cottonwood, AZ is an excellent and beautiful drive into Sedona. The trail is intense and is a long intense trail that winds down into The Village of Oak Creek through Schnebly Hill and Route 179.Some local incredible features include Devil's Kitchen ( a huge sink hole from 1891) and Seven Pools where rain water pools. I've been visited Sedona every couple months for the last 5 years and every time I find a new location or unique rock structure unlike anything I've ever seen. From a fitness perspective, this is one of the many locations you can just jump into the wilderness and trail run or hike within an hour.As you can imagine all this exciting outdoors adventures does turn into a lot of sweating, (one of my least favorite experiences) and I want to find some quiet and comfortable place to write on my laptop.LocationTo make a full day of it I headed over to the Hilton Sedona Resort & Spa. Although, I did not stay at the resort I did indulge in all the amenities the Spa had to offer. The spa offers a private lap pool with poolside service, tennis courts, a fully stocked and overly accommodating ladies locker room, a fitness room that could keep me busy for hours, massages and treatments, and a luxury golf course across the street. In addition there is a cafe and a hairdresser on site. The cost for Hilton Spa access is $20.00 for the day for non-guests and gives you access to all the amenities except the spa treatments and golf.User ExperienceUpon walking in you are in a tranquil setting and the hostess behind the desk immediately welcomes you and discussed all the elements the spa has to offer. The offer you a private locker key so you can dump off you gym bag and travel light.After exploring the spa my travels took me to the Fitness Center because well... I'm like a kid in a candy store around weigh machines. Have to try them all! The room was clean and the equipment was very new and fully functioning. At the tennis courts I indulged in the ball machine which I scheduled for an hour with when I signed in to the spa. Special perks are the phones at the Hilton, from any blue phone you can order drinks/food and they bring it to you! TOTALLY fabulous experience! I am a big fan of feeling catered too and cared for. (Many businesses seem to miss this element and fail on user experience).After showering and heading to pool to set up in a cozy chair, views of the incredible red rock formations in sight, with my laptop I was very comfortable and the surroundings were quiet. So, awesomely quiet you could hear the white puffy clouds forming above you. Snapping back from my inspirational moment to write another chapter. My salad and margarita arrived as a good sign of another break to be had. The salad was delicious and fresh. The service was prompt and they came to pick up my plate and freshen up my drink moments after I finished. A particular aspect of service I crave is the clean up. If you eat outside the leftover plate attracts flies and bees and it is terrific if the area is cleaned promptly.After and hour and handful of laps I retired to the ladies locker room to clean up and spend sometime in the hot tub before my ride home. There are many amenities including all toiletries are included. I particularly love the conditioner smells like something I can't recognize but calming. There are many facilities and amenities I have not mentioned but worthy of experimenting yourself. I would highly recommend if you need a private escape off the map for the day this is an excellent location.Something about Sedona is a clarifying on a deeper level. The stress and deadlines just melt away into accomplishable bullet points and time management for the next week.Extra Note: I grabbed dinner at A Fork In The Road down the hill. Read my review HERE.Ratings:(Very simply we rate on a 1-5, 5 being the best rating.)Spa: 5Sports: 3Pool: 4Fitness Center: 4Meals: 4Service: 5Room: N/AYelp Reviews Online:This place is gorgeous! Excellent view of the red rocks surrounding the area. The room we had was a suite complete with a balcony, fireplace, spacious bathroom, and a whirlpool tub in the bedroom.Very nice hotel. We were upgraded to a King Suite. The room was a it dated, but clean and comfortable. The hotel is a 15 min. drive away from downtown Sedona, and restaurant choice is limited nearby the hotel. The breakfast was included (as I am HHonors Gold member), otherwise it would be too expensive for what you get.Horrible experience - overpriced, dismissive staff, but beautiful pool and gym. Still will never stay at a Hilton property.* Overpriced $100 welcome "fruit basket" - plate with a banana and apple with a few grapes. Not a basket, just a $10 fruit plate from room service.* Bland breakfast buffet and poor service - dry and plain food. Also, when I asked for syrup, our waitress said "you must have missed it on the table over there". * Poor housekeeping - If I hadn't seen the bed made, I wouldn't even have thought they entered the room. * Unhelpful concierge - We frequently went to the concierge for activity, restaurant and transportation recommendations. They just gave us pamphlets and made us call for reservations and bookings.* Faulty Credit CardAuthorization system - this posted as a pending charge on my card, which flagged Amex to put a hold on my card for 5-7 business days. When I asked the front desk to release the charge, they could not and would not do anything to resolve and address the inconvenience. They blamed their system and did not see a flaw in their service or system.Basic facility, far from main market Sedona, average property, limited menu single restraunt.They wanted $6.00/day for WiFi access in your room. Who does that anymore? They could simply charge every guess .20 cents more and never have to ask for additional money for WiFi. I was forced to go to the local coffee shop out of principle just so I didn't have to pay the $6. BTW the FireCreek coffee shop had great WiFi speed, good customer service and in addition to coffee they have food/bakery items. Great spot. As for the resort, there was nothing there that you couldn't get at any other of the same quality hotels in the area but with WiFi.Tremendous disappointment. Rooms are poorly planned, in no way taking advantage of the wondrous views of Sedona. And the furniture in the suites is so uncomfortable one looks forward to leaving one's room. Too bad, since the reason for paying extra for a suite is to feel like one is home and can take a nice morning lounging around. Not here!Relaxing, Out of the way and Not in the Middle of TownI don't like staying in the middle of town... so this place was perfect for me and my husband. However, if you like to be "in the mix"... don't stay here as it is about a 15-20 minute drive to the main part of downtown Sedona.Hotel Pros:Out of town (for me)Full service resort including spa and golfGreat staff, very accomodating and friendlyReally liked our room which was at the end of the unit and had a jacuzzi tub... and the jets were on your bottom not your sides.... Oh Yea!Comfy bedSeparate living room with soft couch and flat screen TVFridge and microwaveBathroom could be accessed from living room while bedroom was separateView from our 2nd floor room showed Bell Rock and other beautiful red rock formationsHotel Cons:A bit priceyFireplace didn't workCeiling and walls were a bit thinLinens were a tad stiff... not super soft and comfy like at some other hotelsWater pressure was a little low but not as bad as other hotels I've stayed atRoom service had a service fee, plus tax, plus $5 additionalSpa:Enjoyed the Sedona Vortex which was a delight... I almost fell asleep on the table after the deep tissue partMy therapist (Janet) was very nice and had great hands!Spa locker room was one big area with lockers, bathroom, sink, a steam room, dry sauna and jacuzzi but the amenities, ambiance were nothing to get excited about...rather plain (note: I judge everything by either Farimont Scottsdale spa or Green Valley Resort spa...both of which are my favorites)Spa personnel were very nice and spoke in quiet, soothing tones - no loud, boisterous folksOverall.... I'd go back to the hotel and spa if I went back to the areaStayed here with my wife and chihuahua over the fourth of July weekend. Amazing time. I reviewed the dining separate, this is just on the resort itself. One of the nicer things we liked about this, is that it wasn't right in the middle all the hustle and bussel of Sedona. To get to Sedona proper you'd drive about 20 mins. We had a King Suite, which was pet friendly. We arrived about two hours before the scheduled check in, and just wanted to see if we could put our bags in our room. To our surprise, our room was ready and they invited us to check in early...free of charge. Big points in my book. We got to the room, and it was great. Large dinning room table, nice kitchenette, spacious living room...good stuff. I'm a details guy, so the Hilton always impresses me. No dust, none. Clean furniture, fresh smell, and extra pillows. Nice balcony we could just open up and take our pup for a walk. Fireplace worked, but being July we didn't really use it. Two staff members really helped out! Beverly and Javier were especially helpful. Both gave us great advise on some must see trails, and some great off the site restaurants. My wife said the spa was 5 stars. She loved being able to use the steam room and the whirlpool before her massage. The staff was good about letting her relax, and not always asking her if she needs anything.Good place to stay and we were not disappointed in the slightest. I'd suggest staying here if you are looking to lounge and relax. Also, VERY pet friendly which to some of us is important.This is not your run of the mill Hilton. It's the nicest and newest Hilton I've been to with ALL the amenities and then some. Here's the extras you won't get at other Sedona resorts: FULL gym, even locals have memberships here, zumba, yogalates, tai chi. Space, space, space! The 1 bedroom suite for $169 a night! Living room, microwave, frig, 2 queen beds and balcony. Almost as big as my house! Breathtaking location near a residential neighborhood, I love the QUIET.Great resort, an excellent value in Sedona. Happy to be away from the tourists and close to hiking. An amazing pool and golf course too!Just came back from spending 3 nights in a 1 bedroom suite which has a wet bar with no glasses anywhere, a microwave sitting on a countertop and 3 or 4 drawers and a few cupboards with shelves, all of which are all empty. Not a single bowl, plate, made of china or paper nor is there any cutlery. So the fact that they supply a microwave is of no use to anyone, except for making popcorn I guess which you'd have to buy yourself anyway! Yes the bed is very comfortable and the decor is very nice, but it takes more than that to make a place comfortable. Furthermore, there were only 2 garbage cans in the entire unit. One under the bar sink which was so narrow that it didn't hold much when you would put empty cans in it. The second one was in the powder room which is fine, but we all know that one is always needed in the actual bathroom next to the toilet, but not there. Lastly, the place is huge and spread out width wise, so in other words when you first check in and they don't tell you that they have other elevators closer to your room, be prepared to walk and walk and walk. I don't know how I made it to the room which happened to be at one of the extremities as I have serious walking limitations, but I eventually made it in tears from the pain. A lot of negatives compared to the positive.Gorgeous setting for a romantic get away or if you are looking for a meeting space. Great conference rooms & banquet rooms. The staff is extremely accomdating and the food was excellent. We had an overnight meeting for 25 and everything we did was at the Hilton. They bent over backwards for us. The room is fantastic, with your own gas fireplace, small kitchenette & very nice bed. The pillows are fantastic with a range in firmness...you could easily leave yours at home. Highly reccomend if you are looking for a place to run away to in the heart of Red Rock Country.Outstanding ground floor room with car outside patio area about 30 feet away. Estimate 700 square feet suite with a LOT of extras including 2 flat screen TVs, iron and board, fridge, microwave, gas fire place, private patio and big king bed. Also lots of big resort extras like pool, hot tub, exercise room,Disappointments is it is NOT in Sedona and we has poor views of the red rocks.
