It is about 8 miles south of Sedona and out of the area of great views. WIFI is $11.95 a night and slow, even with ether net cable connection. Linking thru the cell phone was faster.They also use the message waiting light as a means of advertising what is going on in the hotel. If you have a cell phone and do not like flashing lights, I suggest you either put the phones in a drawer or unplug them.Nice, clean & comfortable. A little pricey, pretty good views. If you get a chance in the summer get a room with a pool view, you will see plenty of red dirt during your stay. Wasn't a fan of the on-site restaurants but there are a few nicer options within walking distance. It is about 10 minutes outside of the downtown area, which could be good or bad depending on your point of view.The resort itself is nice, above average. There are certainly better. The restaurant downstairs has a good sized bar and full seating. The prime rib, fish special, and a variety of other things our group ordered were all very good. The server, I think her name was Sharon maybe, was awesome. Go there just for her.I've stayed at this hotel a few times and have always enjoyed my visits. However, the amount you pay for WIFI is ridiculous. I don't understand why it isn't just built into the cost of the rooms. Motels down the road include it for "free." Just annoying to have to pay for it separately when you are staying at a "resort." You expect this amenity to be included. It's also a bit of a drive from the town of Sedona. I've only had breakfast at their restaurant and it was pretty good. It's really close to Cucina Rustica (great place for Italian) and they even offered to drive us down in a golf cart and pick us up after dinner if we wanted to have drinks. Concierge made some excellent recommendations for dinner and had menus of the restaurants readily available for us to look at before we made a decision. All the rooms have small balconies and fireplaces. It's great to grab a drink at the bar inside and take it out to the fire pit by the pool and enjoy the evening.Stayed one night, and that was one night too long.We stayed in a suite. Here is why I won't stay here again:-With exception of a friendly man who helped my husband find the Tomcars the staff at front desk were not very welcoming. -The hallway we stayed in was dated. Room service crap sat in hallway too long.-Our Non-smoking room was full of cigarrette smoke. We notified front desk. They brought in an ionizer while we were at dinner. We returned from dinner, my husband rolled the ionizer into hallway & called front desk. The machine didn't do much. Maybe someone was smoking in another room and it was coming through the vents? No follow up from front desk to see if our issue was resolved. I don't like wasting a weekend getaway following up on issues, I expect a Hilton to be equipped to check in with me to identify if the issue is resolved.-Related to above- barely slept, woke up with watery eye's and coughing from cigarrette smoke.-Internet- $12 a day. BS- we payed top dollar for a suite. I would understand if I had gotten a deeply discounted standard room, but that wasn't the case. So, for a one night stay (4 pm to 11 am) we payed $12. Totally felt nickeled and dimed on this one. -kids- I guess its not the hotels fault.. I don't mind kids but I felt like they were taking over our already disastrous hallway.-view- nothing great. 2 chairs on pebbles partial view...-follow-up- After my return from this hotel the Hilton asked for my feedback via email. I took 20 minutes to provide some constructive criticism. I also included points of the stay that we enjoyed- the restaurant and the spa. No response. So, I guess they don't care. I really dislike getting no feedback from a company when I take my personal time to provide them with valuable feedback.PLEASE NOTE: THIS REVIEW IS FOR HOTEL PORTION ONLY. RESTAURANT AND SPA ARE GREAT AND DON'T FALL UNDER THIS REVIEW

review_content: This is my second year back to Orchards Inn.My first experience last year deserved the 5 star review effortlessly. From booking to check in it was perfect. The rooms here have the most breathtaking views.However this year, I learned that not all their rooms are the same. This year my experience at Orchards Inn started at a 3, star review then rapidly declined to a -1. After voicing my concerns to the front desk, Thomas advised that the manager Kevin will help. They quickly regained my five star rating for Orchard Inn.This would of been a bad review it is amazing what great staff and a beautiful hotel can accomplish. The experience this year took a little bit of work, none the less the 5 star rating remains. Thank you Kevin and Thomas!*update*Although the room situation was squared away I do have to say the quality of their beds are poor. On the first night I thought Bc we were sent to the "400 building" (the older not so nice hotel rooms) the bed was springy and flimsy because we were in an old room. However last night with the change of rooms it's like they brought that old bed in here for us to sleep on. The service the view is five stars but their mattresses as seen by other yelpers, I'm afraid to even lift the sheet to actually see the mattress and my whole body aches from sleeping here for two nights.My wife and I stayed here this past weekend on 2/4~2/6 as part of my surprise getaway for her birthday. Our normal place of stay, El Portal Sedona, was completely booked for this weekend, so we chose Orchards Inn based on their website and reviews. The check-in process was very smooth and we were unpacked in our room within 10 minutes of arrival. This is where the positive experience began to go downhill. Our first impression was that our room looked nothing like what it did on the website; it was very obvious that the price we paid were for the view and location in Uptown over the room itself. The views were absolutely stunning, however the room looked like something out of Motel 6. As we arrived on the night of the 4th, we went to bed early with plans to enjoy Sedona early the next morning. When we came back from sightseeing and lunch the following day (5th), we discovered that the room was chilly (65 degrees when the unit was set to 75 degrees) and the unit was blowing cold air. We called the front desk to report, which they sent a maintenance engineer within 10 minutes of the call. The response was prompt, however the troubleshooting took over 2 hours during which we had to stay in our room until completion. The issue seemed to be fixed and we left the room to head out to do some sightseeing before dinner. When we came back to change for dinner, we discovered the room was now down to 60 degrees and the unit had been blowing cold air again. We called front desk to report, to which the maintenance engineer arrived approximately 30 minutes after the call. We then again stayed at the room while the maintenance staff were troubleshooting the issue. We waited nearly three hours, during which the maintenance engineer left the premises without notifying us or of an ETA to fix. We went to the front desk, upon which the engineer was called up and we were informed the problem with the heater was unable to be fixed that night. We had already burned over 3 hours of time (on top of the 2 hours during the earlier visit) where we did not get any information on the issue, time of fix and whether it could be fixed. Due to this, I not only had to cancel the birthday dinner reservation with my wife due to this issue not being resolved until close to 9pm (and the restaurant and most Sedona restaurants close at 9pm), however we also essentially had to sacrifice half of our day (which was our only full day in Sedona). We were provided space heaters, however they were not adequate to keep the room heated for a comfortable night's sleep. Our trip and my wife's birthday weekend was essentially ruined due to this. The only positive I'll give is that the front desk was doing the best they can to help resolve the issue, going as far as comping our 2nd night which is the only reason why I am not giving this review 1 star. However, as they say, you can't put a price of experience (or an experience ruined like this). The views and location were amazing, but I would have rather paid the same amount of money at El Portal Sedona or L'Auberge where I know the customer service and the rooms are exactly what you pay for.What a disappointment. For the tune of $200+ a night, we expected this hotel to be much better than a flimsy motel. We were sorely mistaken.First off, the hotel's website is misleading and inaccurate. We booked this hotel specifically for the in-room fireplaces, as advertised on their website: "Retreat to your comfortable room after a busy day exploring Sedona and unwind in quiet comfort with a gas fireplace and nice amenities." However, upon arrival, we learned that there was NO fireplace at all in our room, and when we brought it up to the front desk clerk, he simply said there was nothing he could do. I also had requested a top floor room at the time of booking, but we were given a room on the bottom floor. Unacceptable.The room left a lot to be desired, and is in dire need of updating. While the view was spectacular, the actual room was dingy and dank. The fan in the bathroom area was deafeningly loud. The shower had the worst water pressure of any shower I have ever used. The walls were paper thin, and since our room was directly next to the lobby, we could hear everything going on. The hotel advertised having a "free breakfast", but each morning we wandered over to the breakfast area and found that they were completely out of most food, coffee, and water - and all of the trashes were overflowing. What a supreme disappointment. The hotel also advertised having a laundry facility on-site, but the laundry facility actually wasn't on site at all. Rather, you had to walk through several other hotel parking lots in order to get to it. Such a bait and switch. We love the town of Sedona, but we certainly won't stay here again. We would have been much better off at a Motel 6.Great location in town, and the views from our top floor room could not be beat--absolutely stunning! The fall weather was a bit chilly at night, so the fireplace was a nice bonus. Our room was spacious (it was a corner suite) and our king-sized bed was comfy. Kevin at the front desk was very friendly. We were pleased with our stay here.After reading some of the other reviews, I was hesitant to spend the money for this hotel, but I'm SO glad I did! We stayed in room 428 which was a King suite room with a king-size bed, fireplace, and love seat. It also had the most amazing views!! Whether it was a sunrise or sunset, the red rocks were beautiful! I can't say enough about the customer service at this hotel, from the reservationist, to the front desk help, they were all very helpful and friendly. This hotel is centrally located in the heart of Sedona yet was back enough from the street to not be loud or noisy. The free morning breakfast was healthy and sufficient to start a day of hiking or walking around the town. If we were to ever return to Sedona we would for sure stay here again!!We stayed at the Orchards Inn for 4 nights and really enjoyed our stay. The staff was friendly and accommodating. Our room was cleaned everyday and the front desk was quick to help when we realized that we forgot to pack toothpaste! The free breakfast was a good option for mornings when we were in a hurry but I can see why some other reviewers complained. Coffee, juice, cereal, granola, yogurt, bagels and toast were offered. No hot breakfast options but it was plenty for us!The views are amazing! We stayed in room 302 and had a great view of Snoopy Rock. If we weren't busy everyday, I could sit on our balcony and relax the day away! The king bed was comfortable and the room was well appointed with a flat screen tv, fridge and gas fireplace. Orchards Inn is is the heart of Uptown Sedona. Lots of shopping and restaurants within a quick walk of the Inn. It's also a quick drive to West Sedona. My only complaint was that you could occasionally hear your neighbors. The walls are a bit thin and in the mornings we could hear showers and door slamming. Not a big deal since we spent most days exploring and hiking the Red Rocks.3.5 Stars.Orchards Inn is a good choice for those who want to stay in the heart of Sedona within walking distance of everything. There are three levels - the main level is considered the second floor. The rooms are old but well appointed with clean linens, a mini fridge, and standard TV. The bathroom left much to be desired and is in dire need of a remodel, particularly the sinks which had severe drainage issues. Look for discounted rates on travel websites like Trivago. Don't pay full price. What I really love about this hotel is the location and view. Every room has a panoramic view of the red rocks, and the balcony was a nice place to take it all in. There's a small pool on the first floor with pool towels. The hotel is located steps away from the main road full of shops, restaurants, jeep tours, etc. The staff was friendly and the continental breakfast wasn't bad (cereal, oatmeal, yogurt, banana/whole kiwi, toast/bagel, mini muffins/danishes, hard boiled egg, juices, milk, coffee and tea). I was fine with this until I saw another Yelper's photo had scrambled eggs and diced fruit. I didn't see any hot breakfast items during our two-night stay!I hope they fix up their bathrooms and repair the sinks because I'd love to come back for another visit.Great experience! Free coffee, tea and water bottles in the lobby. The free breakfast (served across the parking lot in their Mexican restaurant) was surprisingly varied (bagels, pastures, yoghurt, oatmeal, fresh fruit...) and the room just had an amazing view! Will definitely stay again!Room was nice, location is great, view nice. I still can't believe they leave all the TVs on all day though (so you can see the 'visit sedona' tourism channel. That's pretty tacky.We were excited to check in to the Orchards Inn to stay for 4 nights. We pulled up to a small parking lot, and the tiniest lobby ever. The uplifting part of the lobby was easy check in and the view right outside. When we got to our room, the smell was not pleasant, however the view from our second floor balcony was amazing. We had a table with 2 chairs to relax and enjoy. We were lucky to have the end of the building, because the balconies had little privacy from your neighbors. The musty smell of the room dissipated a bit after the A/C ran for a while. Later that night when taking a shower, the water couldn't keep a constant temperature. I almost burned my face off. The drain didn't work well, and there was a pool of standing water during my whole shower. I decided to move past this, until I discovered a streak of BLOOD on my sheets and pillow. We told the front desk about the drain and sheets and they immediately took care of it. We tried to move past this once again, UNTIL the next morning when I woke up and found what looked like a BED BUG crawling on me under my shirt. I did more investigating on the mattress and found casings of dead bugs in the mattress crevices. I immediately called the front desk who sent up the manager and tried to downplay all of my concerns and negative experiences thus far. He offered to move us to another room, but I declined and said we wanted to leave. The only positive thing about this, is that they refunded me the full amount of the stay and offered to find me another hotel. They were pretty professional, but I will never recommend this place and now I have to go back home and sanitize all of my belongings so I don't infect my house.I posted the pictures. If you want proof, you can find it in the album.We had a good stay here. We booked the deluxe king room. We booked directly through the the hotel which was great. Denise was so helpful and called us to get the king room for us bc originally they only had queen available. The prices seem higher on the hotel website than like hotels.com but call and talk to someone because they were lower when I called. The room is deluxe bc of being on the top floor which has awesome views and the fireplace. The fireplace which we enjoyed more than anything since during our stay it was 45 degrees and raining! The room isn't really deluxe it's the fireplace and third floor location that qualifies as that. There is a fridge but no microwave. The shower is small and the shower head is low so if you're tall forget it. Also the water went from hot to cold the whole time. The double sinks are nice though. This place is right in the heart of tourist part of Sedona and we never drove just walked to the Cowboy Club for dinner and the Mexican place in front so that was nice. The staff was super accommodating. Unfortunately the weather prevented us form trying the pool and hot tub but it looked nice. I would stay here again.The Orchard's inn is the perfect place to say in Sedona. When you visit Sedona all the directions are from the "Y" where 87A and 178 intersect. The Orchard's inn is located at the "Y". The pink jeep, the trolly, shopping and everything else is right at your doorstep. Every room in the Orchard's inn has a breathtaking view of the redrocks. Snoopy rock is in your backyard. The room is clean and spacious and includes continental breakfast so you can hit the ground running. Look no further - this is the best place to stay in Sedona.Beautiful views and friendly staff. However, we had a bad experience. Hopefully a fluke. My husband went into the bathroom and the glass light fixture cover unexpectedly fell from the ceiling and shattered all over the floor. Luckily it missed his head, but glass cut his foot deeply. The front desk person and engineering/cleaning staff was very helpful in cleaning up all the blood and glass on the bathroom floor and expressed their sincere apologies, but no offers from the hotel to make amends for the incident or the injury. Not even an extension on checkout, though we had to wait to use the shower due to glass in the shower stall that had been missed by the clean-up crew the night before. I hope they will check and secure all the overhead light fixtures in all their units. If we decide to stay here again, that will definitely be the first thing I check out.Spectacular service! A+ newly renovated rooms. Majestic views. Belly-filling and vegan friendly continental breakfast. Right in the heart of downtown with killer access to all Sedona has to offer. Be sure to visit the crystal wizard at the sacred stone as wellCute clean rooms..patio with the best view ever!! Pool and jacuzzi and nice staff..what more do you need??Why do you come to Sedona? For the vistas! We'll this hotel has amazing vistas and private balconies to enjoy them. The rooms are clean and spacious. Mine had a beautiful fireplace and living room. A continental breakfast was included. Waking up to the sun cresting the tops of the Red Rocks is amazing. There is an outdoor pool but it was a little to chilly in February to enjoy it. Parking is close to the rooms which makes loading and unloading a pleasure. If you are looking for a comfortable bed, ambiance and waking up to the most beautiful view in the world - this is the place for you. I will be backWhere to start- worth about a little above a motel 6. Just for the views.Views are nice but if you are on the first floor you see your curtains because everyone walking by looks into your room!Breakfast is packaged- well coffee is hot and there is some yogurt and hard boiled eggs.Bathrooms are dingy and the ceilings are so low I hit my hands every time I was changing. Ugh. Water surges hot and cold. In a busy part of town- like Disneyland busy...so if you are into t-shirt shops...just sayingGo somewhere else- they really are not even close to the quality of motel for the money they charge.Stay here instead of L'Auberge! We were looking at L'Auberge but were put off by their prices. We looked up the hill and saw this place. Turns out Orchards Inn has better views at a fraction of the price. Rooms were basic but clean and ours even had a nice working fireplace in it as well. For the price I think it's unfair people complain about the breakfast. Sure it's basic but it's included.My family and I stayed here July 27 - 29. I can't say enough good things about how the staff went out of their way to accommodate our needs for handicapped accessible rooms next to each other. The rooms were a bit shop-worn but very very clean and quiet with comfy beds.There were a couple of downsides, though. One was the lack of seating in the room - there was one desk chair. Also, there was a nice balcony overlooking the beautiful red rocks but the hard wrought iron chairs made sitting impossible for more than a few minutes. A couple of cushions would have improved that immensely. Another bad thing was parking - there never seemed to be enough spaces. It would have been much worse if the restaurant (closed for remodeling) had been open. In retrospect, I realized that I should have booked a suite which has a couch. Next time, for sure.My mom and I visited in July for my birthday trip. The room was clean, fairly, quiet, and had an AMAZING view. The location was perfect and we could walk to dining, shops, and the massages we booked. The only complaint I could have had was the out-dated decor for a $200 room. TIP: try to get on the 2nd floor for a better view. Kevin at the front desk was awesome and answered all our questions kindly and accurately! Plus, he made us laugh at check in, which is always how we LOVE to start off a fun trip!
review_content_20: Amazing views, walking distance to shops, restaurants and activities! Great place and would def stay again and recommend. Very quaint.I give 4 stars - husband would give 3.  Rooms are a bit dated but bed was comfortable.  Living room furniture was not the most comfortable but we weren't in the  room too much  anyway.   Liked the fireplace and view was excellent.  I get up earlier than my husband so the king suite was perfect for us - I could make coffee and sit on the balcony to view the rocks.    Parking was ok but could tell at the height of busy season that could be a challenge.    Liked being smack dab in downtown - lots of places to walk to and again, views were awesome.   My husband thought the towels smelled like a locker room gym towel from high school and the shower was slippery and when we requested a nonslip art it took hours for them to find one.  I'd still stay again but maybe with my sister not my husband !!!What a value!  Scenic views of the red rocks from every balcony and was in a prime location in uptown Sedona. Lacking the last star because the pool area is not very impressive and there was no workout facilities. Rooms were extremely spacious. Great for couples or families!Cute rooms and centrally located.  If you are looking for a cabin this place is not it.  But if you want pretty mountain views this is a great place.  It has a nice fireplace and nice views.  Reasonably pricedWhat a great hotel! The staff and service were excellent. Great proximity to eating and shopping in uptown Sedona. We stayed in Suite 403 and the view was amazing. The room was spacious and the fireplace was a nice touch. Only minor complaints were the pillows were hard as a rock (we will be bringing our own next time we stay here!) and the walls are a little thin so we could hear doors slamming and when other people's showers were running. But those were minor things and we'll definitely be back despite those small issues!We stayed here for two nights while visiting Sedona and it was in a beautiful location! Tucked away in the mountainside, the red rocks provide a gorgeous back drop. Our room was on the second floor and our balcony provided a panoramic view of the mountain. The fire place was going and the music was playing when we checked in. I love that the room is more than just the beds and it feels more spacious with the additional sofas and coffee table. They also have multiple sinks, 3 in total, which makes it easy and more convenient for a family of 4 to get ready. The hotel is located right in the middle of town, so you can walk to various restaurants and shops. Breakfast is served at the Mexican restaurant nearby and included only cold items, such as muffins, bread, yogurt, instant oatmeal, cereal, and fruit. I was hoping for some scrambled eggs, sausage, and bacon but the closest thing was some cold boiled eggs. I guess if you come in with no expectations, the food isn't so bad. They have juices, milk, and coffee. Everything else makes up for the lackluster breakfast!Absolutely amazing views, regardless of the time of day. Great parking, nice and cozy rooms, and right in the heart of Sedona which means food is within walking distance. They also have some great discounts and promotions for returning visitors, which is awesome - I'll happily take any excuse to come back to Sedona.I Was on a business trip from Pittsburgh to Irvine California for a month I decided to drive .. With stops in Missouri, El Paso ,and Sedona , wow Sedona is so beautiful must see to believe. I spent one night at the Orchards inn , that I booked months ahead of time but had to spend another night just for the beauty. Staff rocks , Very nice  Bonus in the middle of the small town. This watering Stop Rocks.The views are ridiculous! My husband and I have been traveling cross country and booking hotels usually a couple of hours before. I booked this hotel because the pictures showed some great views. We ended up arriving at night and the best part of our trip so far was waking up at Orchards Inn a d looking out the window. Amazing! We ended up drinking a cup of coffee on the balcony and watching the sun rise. Whenever we make our way back to Sedona,  we will definitely stop by Orchards Inn again!Great location and awesome view from our room. This is our first time staying here and second time to Sedona. We come in the winter because my bf likes cold weather.  The fireplace in the room is a good touch and romantic.  Free continental breakfast, basic, all carbs only protein was hard bolied eggs but it's enough to get you through the morning. In walking distance to restaurants and shopping.  We will definitely be staying here again.The Orchard inn is perfect!  We stayed here for two nights after a business meeting in Phoenix.  We were on the 3rd floor with amazing views of the red rocks from our private balcony.  There was also a fireplace in our room.  They have complimentary bottled water, coffee and tea 24/7 in the lobby.  They also have a computer in the lobby to print your boarding pass (all free).  Their breakfast (served at the restaurant across the parking lot) was your typical buffet, nothing hot, but plenty of fruit, breads, muffins and cereals.  You won't leave hungry.  The beds were very comfortable with cozy down comforters.  We loved that it was so close to everything. You can park your car in their lot and never have to drive again, everything was within walking distance.  We will definitely stay here again!AMAZING views. The desk was super helpful, and the room was clean. We showed up an hour before check in and they accommodated us right away by moving our room to one that was ready, which I thought was really helpful. They also lent us a corkscrew because we didn't have one (and the wine shop across the street didn't sell them because "there's no manufacturers in AZ that make them." Had to laugh). On that note, though, this place is really conveniently located, tucked away off the main drag in uptown, it's a short walk to a lot of great little shops. The beds were comfy, pillows a bit on the firm side. Showers were a bit dated. But let's be honest, you're staying here for the views. We sat on the patio the whole time we were in the room, just turned the music channel up a bit and sat outside.I'll definitely be returning.Visiting a friend in AZ for a long weekend and we chose the Orchards Inn for our overnight in Sedona. We were excited to check in after a long hike. The guy at the counter was friendly and took care of us quickly and painlessly. We booked a two queen room and it was wonderful. Clean, tastefully decorated, spacious, and a postcard view. I enjoyed a cup of the complementary coffee enjoying the view from the balcony after waking up. Room rate also included the breakfast buffet at the Canyon Breeze restaurant  which is only a minutes walk from the hotel. Definitely more than I could ask for in an inclusive hotel breakfast. Starbucks coffee and plenty of choices! I would definitely stay here again!Great hotel! My family and I enjoyed staying here and it was good value. The pool was a lot of fun for my daughter, and the room had a gorgeous view. The traffic can be crazy getting out to the main road, but that can't be helped. We would definitely stay here again!I give this 4.5 stars only because of this one simple thing- for the price of the room, the breakfast should have been a smidge better. It wasn't terrible-don't get me wrong- I just expected a little more I guess. Otherwise, the room was immaculate and amazing. The views of the red rocks from our personal balcony was incredible! The pool was clean and a nice cool treat after a hot day. The jacuzzi was an extra added plus! I could have stayed at the pool area all day! The location is perfect-right in the center if awsome uptown Sedona. In addition, the hotel gives you a 10%off coupon to the mexican place directly in front of the inn. This is also where you eat breakfast. I fully enjoyed my stay at Orchards Inn and highly recommend them for an amazing room with scenic views with top notch location.Although this hotel is a little hidden from the outside, it's right in the heart of Uptown Sedona. Literally within walking distance of all the shopping and restaurants, this hotel also has EXCELLENT views of the natural beauty of Arizona. The room is updated, clean, and romantic with a deck and a fireplace. Absolutely love this hotel and everything that came with it. Breakfast is above average and the front desk is very helpful to point you to local attractions. Will definitely stay here again!I am giving it only 3 stars because of slow wifi and a shower that will not stay a constant temperature. It is not a lot of fun to have a shower that goes from perfect temperature, to cold, to scalding. The room is very suitable for anyone.The front desk is very helpful and very courteous. Also the view is amazing and you will be pleased by the location.The views.......Great place! Was in town for a wedding a we flip flopped where to stay.  On a whim we picked orchards. Room had a balcony with great views which I thought was the best part of staying here.The walls are a little thin b/c  i woke up to my loud neighbors opening and closing doors at 3am. We called the front desk bc we didn't want to be those people but the hotel took care if I bc things settled down a few minutes after and we didn't hear a peep after.We had reservations at a different hotel that didn't work out... While sitting in our car in Sedona searching for option B we stumbled across Orchards Inn due to quality Yelp reviews/rating and reasonable pricing.  From first interaction with the staff to checkout we were extremely satisfied.  We explained our plan B situation to the hotel staff at check-in and they cared enough to give us a call once we had settled in to make sure we were happy.  And we were... the views from our room and hot tub were picturesque.  The walk to Pink Jeep, L' Auberge for dinner and shops was ideal.  Overall great stay and would recommend as an accommodating, cozy, and convenient stay! Thanks!From the outside it did not seem like much to look at. We had been staying in hotels for the last six nights, so this one seemed like s standard (all be it well kept) motel from the street. The desk attendant was very friendly and gave me our keys. There are no elevators here, but it is not that bad since the hotel is on a hill, so the "ground" floor you first see is actually the second floor, and you can choose to go down a flight of stairs to get to the first floor or up to get to the third (where our room was). Like many motels, there is a continuous balcony outside the room entrances on the third floor. Our room was right at the top of the stairs, 304. I crossed my fingers and slid in the key, hoping not to be let down. We were not let down. The room was newly remodeled and much wider than a standard hotel room. It felt like there would be plenty of room for all three of us to spread out, even with two queen beds. There was a gas fireplace (not that we need that in May). The decor was very clean and modern, and the bathroom was a good size. But what caught our attention more than any of that, was the view off our private balcony. Picture turning your head 90 degrees left, and slowly panning through 180 degrees of majestic red rock cliffs lit perfectly by the afternoon sun, with the tops of pine trees almost directly beneath you. We were speechless, then giddy. We spent every sunset sitting on our balcony watching the cliffs change colors. You can even see them perfectly from the Inn's hot tub. It was so relaxing and made us fall instantly in love with Sedona. The hotel offers a free breakfast which was very nice and welcome in an expensive town like Sedona. You just walk across the parking lot and enter Tao's Cantina from the back door, where they have a room with a buffet set up. It is just continental fare, not true "hot" food except what you can fit in the toaster, but there was still a good variety and it was a great way to start each day. Tip: There is an awesome apricot tree right behind the cantina. If you're there in may and you've got somebody with you who can jump - grab a couple when nobody is looking - they are delicious!We will definitely come back to Orchards Inn if we are ever in Sedona. One of the best experiences of our entire trip!
review_content_40: Great hotel, great deal! Until you leave something in the room and never see it again... And don't expect much from customer service. Unfortunate. These people have too much faith in the honesty of their housekeeping.The view was breathtaking! It was a great value given the location. We asked for directions to our next destination at the front desk and the man was so knowledgeable and hospitable! We had a wonderful time there and would definitely return again!WOW!! I got room here thru Sedona resorts only $62!! Beautiful room with incredible view of canyon and with fireplace. Even has backyard grass area for Toto!! Awesome!! I'll be coming back here for sure!! Even get full breakfast in morning & 25% discount at Taos Cantina restaurant in front. AND it's in center of town PURRFECT for walking & shopping!!We have been coming here for years and have not had a bad experience. The staff is helpful and friendly. The rooms are pretty basic but very clean and tidy. The biggest draw to this property is the location and the view off the balcony-awesome- great for sipping a margarita or a glass of wine. It is located right in the middle of town close to all the shops and restaurant's/bars perfect in case you have one too many prickly pear margaritas' and your friends have to drag you back to the room! oops hate it when that happens. Has a small pool and spa available as well that is nice when you get back from a day of hiking.  Great place to stay.Stayed at the Orchards Inn for a family destination wedding and was very impressed. The view from the room is awe inspiring. Refreshing continental breakfast every morning. Don't forget a swimsuit - the pool setting is relaxing.The location of this hotel was excellent. Right in uptown with easy access to all the restaurants, bars and shops. It was cold when we went so the outdoor pool and hot tub were not that appealing, but we did enjoy the in room fire place and large balcony with views. It's worth the value if you're looking for a place in town. Our oh complaint was the water pressure left something to be desired, and the hot water didn't last through 2 showers.Absolutley amazing Inn.  The rooms are clean and fresh.. Balcony views are breathtaking and perfect for the morning cup of coffee or evening wine.  You can hear the fast moving creek down below.  So close to all the fun shops and coffee stops.  Park your car and walk!    I will book here again and highly recommend it for your weekend get away.Great views and great value for the traveler willing to sacrifice some amenities. There are tons of overpriced hotels in Sedona that offer all kinds of amenities for your stay, but you likely will walk into your room at the Orchards Inn and feel like you overpaid. That is until you see the view from your room... so beautiful to wake up to. Also, some areas are pet friendly! Very nice to be able to bring our pup along. Our goal was to spend the time in nature with Sedona, so this modest hotel was cozy and convenient so come back to at the end of the day.The one thing I did not like was the references of Orchard Inns breakfast. When we arrived at the lobby curious about the breakfast it was packets of oatmeal, some drinks, and fruit. Definitely not a breakfast - more like snacks for your morning hike. Very centrally located in downtown Sedona (tucked away behind the plazas of the main drag). Easy walk away from restaurants and drinks.Orchards Inn is a wonderful hidden treasure. We stayed there on impulse while visiting Sedona for a relaxation, rejuvenation, reflection road trip. The hotel is a small, quaint, modest property with an awesome view of the canyon. The rooms were clean, spacious, and modern; although the tub/shower could use a bit of remodeling (not a show stopper by any means). The property is located in a terrific area right on the main drag, highway 89A, and in walking distance of all the shops and restaurants in the immediate area. Although the property is close to the main drag, the area is quiet and peaceful. The grounds are beautiful and perfect for taking a long walk. The pool and Jacuzzi area were clean and relaxing as well.The staff was amazing!!!! Every member the Orchards Inn team treated us like family. They were accommodating, professional, knowledgeable, and friendly beyond our expectations. Margarita and Charles made our guest experience superb!!!!!I will definitely stay at the Orchards Inn again.... and again.... and again :-)I give Orchards Inn five stars for the value.  The rooms are large and each one has a balcony or patio overlooking L'Auberge below on Oak Creek and across to an amazing view of the red rock formations that tower above the creek.  I have stayed here twice now and each time the rooms were clean and expansive with a little kitchen area and a large bathroom.  The swimming pool is small but in a very pleasant setting with vegetation growing on the fence.  There is also a very good hot tub for resting after a hike.  It is convenient to downtown Sedona with all the tourist shops and there is a beautiful walk to L'Auberge for creekside dining.  Pretty good wifi as well.Great views, great location and very good management.  Rooms are outdated and the breakfast was average. Had an issue arise with the room and the staff was very attentive and made it right.......well done.  Would stay there again for the view and location.Great views from rooms.   Good downtown location.  Clean spacious room. It's priceyWant a place with a great view this is it want a place that cleans your room this is not the place to stay.spent 10/31 thru 11/3 and had to ask for fresh towels since got no room service. Lots of places with good views but only this one doesn't clean your roomYou are paying for the view/locationBest Features:Room is spaciousSpectacular view of mountains/RedRocksWalking distance to restaurants and shopsCentrally locatedConvenient parkingDog friendly rooms with attached/gated grass Worst Features: Upon arrival price was listed as 50.00 less /night online then when we had purchased the room.  However, hotel would not match the listed online priceYou can hear EVERYTHING from your neighbors. (TV, talking, singing in the shower, walking)  Every time we tried to sleep something would wake us up. You can hear a constant hum of other hotel AC's in the valley below the balconies.Pool area is BEYOND packed, and very small   Rooms are old and feel like 90's timeshareWhite crusty stains on couch pillows......Eeeewwwwww!Feels very overpriced!The facilities/interior feel run down and the Red Rock King Suite feels shabby and more like a motel. For $250+ I was expecting something a lot more luxurious and if I had known this is what the facilities would be like I would of either spent more at L'Auberge or saved money and stayed at one of the chain hotels. Overall not impressed. Not $250 worth fort sure!View is gorgeous! Rooms are outdated but fit the ambience of Sedona. The beds are uncomfortable, the shower was hot then cold, the paint chipping and door cracked. Parking lot is tight. We were surprised how early everything closes.Love coming here! The views are amazing and your smack in the middle of uptown which is great for walking around town getting ice cream or a margarita and a little souvenir shopping. Rooms are always clean and comfortable.  Have been coming here for years and last time I was there ( April 2014) something had changed in management... the breakfast that was included in your room rate used to be amazing and this last time it was just plan sad. We walked in and no lights were on, the store bought pastries were lacking and there was no serve ware so who knows whos fingers had touched the food before you! What happened to the eggs, waffle maker, fruit, juice and coffee?Everything perfect. Front desk was very helpful. Had a great view of the redrocks. within walking distance of restaurants and shops. We were going to stay only one night but enjoyed it so much we stayed over one more night. Large rooms, clean, we would definitely go back.I just want to give 5 stars to the great hospitality from the front desk team: Juan and Tyler. My family needed to wait for the shuttle to the airport here and they were so welcoming and courteous. They offered water and let us just sit and enjoy the nice lounge overlooking the beautiful canyon. If i ever get the chance i would stay here for a visit too. Thanks guys! Au revoir~This is a great hotel if you're visiting Sedona and want to be active in-town and out of town. It's not far from the various hikes and parks, and is conveniently located in downtown Sedona with ample parking for guests. We got a great rate on our room for booking in advance, and it came with free breakfast. The rooms aren't all that fancy but generally clean and the beds are comfortable...and the view from the rooms are stunning! With all the amazing things to do in Sedona, there isn't any reason to spend a significant amount of time in your room anyways.  Breakfast was quite good, considering it was free for us though the $13 per adult that's charged otherwise is quite a good deal considering Sedona prices. There are hot eggs, potatoes, meats, a waffle bar, bread, bagels, pancakes, breakfast burritos, cereal, fruit (that was all good & fresh), yogurt, and oatmeal...definitely something for everyone. And the cafeteria has a stunning view of the red rocks like the hotel.My only complaint is that we got a noise complaint for talking normally in our room...the walls are very thin and you cannot sleep in here because of the ruckus that starts around 7 am with people getting up and moving around. But otherwise, this is a great place to stay!
review_content_60: I am giving 5 stars for customer service. When we were originally supposed to stay at The Orchards in May, the Slide Fire was blazing in Sedona and we decides to reschedule our stay on a different day. The clerks were very helpful in booking a new day for us. The evening before we were going to head up there for our stay, my husband had a medical emergency and we couldn't go. Fearing it was less than 24-hours before we were set to arrive, I thought we would be facing a fee. Once again the clerks were very kind and helpful in canceling our room... No fee charged! They happily rebooked us for a few weeks from now. Such a flexible and customer-centered place. I appreciate their help and we are looking forward to our vacation at The Orchards even more now!This place is such a wonderful value. For nearly the same price as other middle-of-the-road establishments, you get wonderful front desk service, clean and quite nice rooms, and million dollar views...extraordinary. Will be staying here next time I'm visiting Sedona. Also located in the middle of town, so convenient to shopping, dining, and tours. Free breakfast also is great - waffles, Denver omelettes, fruit, etc...Front desk staff is polite, helpful, and will make you copies of maps for popular local sights and hikes.My husband and I spent a night here after searching thru some other options in the area. We were so happy we chose this place. The views from our room were breathtaking overlooking the red mountains. Super clean room, easy check-in, amazingly helpful and friendly staff. For a little over $100/night, we would absolutely stay here again. It's within walking distance to tons of shops and restaurants but set back just enough so that your not on the main road. The complimentary breakfast was good- your basics were all there. Pancakes, bacon, fruit, waffles, yogurt, cereal etc.Sickest views ever. Wonderful rooms with fireplaces.Pet friendly, make sure you ask for the doggie yard! It's sick.We had a really pleasant stay here as it was exactly what we were looking for in terms of location and comfort. Most important is getting a room on the second floor towards the middle. The view is amazing and gave us excellent photography images day and night. We wanted to do some night photography without freezing. We set our cameras on tripods and got some great shots with the mountains and stars. Luckily Olympus has a wifi app that works with several high end models. I could take shots from the warmth of the fireplace inside. The hotel itself was quiet and the rooms were generally clean. They are pricey but in comparison to some of the high end resort type hotels, it is reasonable. Go here if your a photo buff and want to be close enough to walk the town.Lovely rooms, very convenient, discounts for dining and a free buffet breakfast, too! Our King Mini Suite had amazing views, a fireplace, crisp clean linens and real coffee cups! The room was clean and comfortable, and the staff was warm, friendly and helpful.A great choice in the heart of Uptown Sedona! I. Can't wait to come back.Loved being right downtown, with everything (with the exception of hiking) just a walk away. The Inn was cute, and the staff was very nice. Great views from our room, probably from all the rooms as they all face the mountain views. The only windows they have (at least in our room) was the door, so at night you can't have any windows open for fresh air. A little lacking in their continental breakfast, perhaps it's a space issue since the lobby is very small. I would definitely stay here again, great location.Just arrived after 9 hours on the road.  Rooms are clean & comfortable, location is great for easy access to local restaurants.   Unfortunately we received a less than friendly welcome from Kelly, the front desk clerk.  It seemed like we may have interrupted her break.  We asked if we could have adjoining rooms, our request was met with a frosty response.  We mentioned our reservation included a roll away & she seemed to take pleasure in telling us it was not included, but she would get one delivered.  It's a shame that what appears to be a great hotel has someone with Kelly's attitude "greeting" the guests!This hotel gets five stars for the location and the view.  To me, that is exactly what I was paying for.  It is a basic hotel on the inside, and has most amenities one might need for a one night stay.  Two tiny issues:  I could hear other hotel doors shutting in the morning.  That is what woke me up!  Thoughtful guests could make a small effort and  close the doors without making noise, but sadly, not everyone is thoughtful, including, evidently, those who were near my room.   I think the hotel should recognize that not all of their guests have common courtesy, and do whatever it takes to make the room doors close silently-- sound proofing, a sign reminding guests to shut the door quietly, or whatever else other hotels do to eliminate this problem.   The other issue is that there is no snack vending machine.  The shops in uptown close very early, (5-7 p.m.) and there was nowhere to get a snack.  We drove to a Circle K in west Sedona to get a bag of chips. That could easily have been solved with a vending machine.  Not a deal breaker, but an easy fix, so I hope the owners are reading this.  Back to my original statement:  The location and view are what earned the five stars.For the price this place is as good as it gets.  The beds are comfortable, the views are spectacular, the office staff is friendly and knowledgeable, and the continental breakfast is very acceptable.   The hotel is close to shops and attractions.  I would definitely recommend this place and plan to come back myself.  One note:  The hotel does not have an elevator to upper levels.  Just make sure you ask for a street level room and no elevator is needed.Simple but clean and well maintained rooms. Very friendly, accommodating service. Decent wifi. Amazing, spectacular views and the rooms all face the valley away from the parking lot and street so it's surprisingly quiet. Steps from the central shops and dining in Sedona, so it's an ideal location.Up until recently, this was our "little secret" in Sedona. Recently purchased by the ownership group who runs L'Auberge, every single room has an awesome view of the red rocks. Back in the day, you could easily get in with late notice and pay $130 for a king sized room with fireplace. Now you can expect to pay closer to $200 per night! But man, the views are spectacular and each spot has a patio or balcony to enjoy! You sit right on top of the hill that looks down into L'Auberge and Amara Resort. There are trails you can take around the property that are beautiful. The rooms are clean and have been recently renovated. The beds are comfortable, wish I could say the same for pillows. The rooms are large in size and we've always had an auto fireplace, which is a nice touch during the cooler months. The location is great- in uptown Sedona and within walking distance to some great restaurants (Cowboy Club)  and shops. Yes, this is a pretty touristy area but whatever, it's fun to people watch- lots to see and window shop. You have options to buy snacks at certain places on 89A like bottled water for the fridge in your room. Free wi-fi available and a high def plasma with DVD if that's your thing.Great views for sure from the rooms. The "healthy" breakfast is sugary packaged instant oatmeal you add hot water to and mix yourself, hard boiled eggs or sugary pastries. Set up in a dirty dark Mexican restaurant. Not what I expected at the room rate.I came too Arizona to visit my best friend.  We decided to go to Sedona to see the beautiful scenery of the Red Rocks.  We chose another location at first and then two days later cancelled and booked the last room available on Expedia.  We arrived and Kevin the front desk guys was very friendly and gave us a warm greeting and sent us off to our room. I booked a single standard king room and was given a 2queen bed room which it was very clean and it felt like home!!! We'll in the middle of the night the room was 80' degrees and too hot for me, the A/C did not work either! My boyfriend went up to the front desk and ran into Charles the General Mgr.  He was Awesome!!! My friend told him that he would not want his best friend to say anything about her stay at this hotel on any website! So?????? Then Charles the manager gave us a suite to stay in for the next night! No extra charge for it either!!!! Pretty Cool! Loved it! The suite was comfy and the service was awesome! I highly recommend this place to stay when visiting Sedonna Arizona!!!!!!Hands down the best view for the value.  The check in was quick (and they allowed an early check in).  The room was clean with a big comfy bed and nice balcony with an amazing view of the mountains.  The locations is also great as there are tons of little shops and restaurants all located within walking distance.  When we return to Sedona we will be sure to stay at Orchards Inn.Rooms are uneventful and tired.  This place needs to be updated.  Service at front desk needs improvement.  That said, the view from the room and deck is great.  Location is very good.This is by far an amazing hotel. The price is great for the area and the high quality of rooms. Spend a little extra for the prime view when booking- it's worth it! The staff are friendly too!Very pleasant stay.  I had my travel agent book me a room in Sedona, they did a terrible job because they booked me in the worst MOTEL in Sedona.  My friends and I decided to try our luck and see if we could find availability despite it being a Saturday and the busy season.  We first went to the Best Western and were charged $240 for the night.  I found this to be excessive but wasn't feeling too confident I'd find anything with just as good of a view for any less.  I then went to the Orchard Inn and they had the same view and charged me $140 a night.  I was very happy with this price and booked the room.  The room was very clean, came with a fireplace and a gorgeous view of the rocks.  Also walking distance to all the very nice little shops, restaurants and boutiques that downtown Sedona has to offer.  I would definitely stay here again.  Also, if you wake up early enough, head up the Airport Trail and watch the sunrise over the rocks, less than a mile from the hotel.Made a good pick when we were looking for a hotel to stay on our weekend trip to Sedona. We checked in late on a Saturday night and the guy at the counter was very friendly and attentive. Our room was nice and clean and worth the rate. We did think that the room we got had a fireplace so we were a little disappointed when it didn't, but we lived on. The tables on the balcony was nice and the views in the morning were amazing. We did have their free breakfast buffet which was worth the $12 or so we would have saved for breakfast. It was centrally located on main street which was really nice since we didn't have to drive more than necessary. I would definitely stay here again.Great views, comfortable beds and friendly staff. Parking was an issue, as there were no spots available when I arrived. However, the friendly staff helped me find a space by walking out and standing in the parking space to save it for me. Will be going back. The views from the balcony can't be beat!
review_content_80: We stayed two nights this past weekend and I was pleasantly surprised at the comfort of the room.  I knew the view would be incredible, and it was.  The front desk staff were great.  We asked about hikes and got some great advice on which ones we would like.  I would give it a 5 star, except the bathroom was okay not great.  It needs to be updated.I stayed here in November 2011 and was very disappointed. The room that we stayed in was nothing like the photos on the website. The "suite" was like the first place you rent when you are in college. Very basic, boring, and you were afraid to touch anything.The walls were so thin, you could hear the neighbors TV, phone calls, talking, and I even heard the guy snoring!! Needless to say, I didn't get any sleep! I seriously felt like I wasn't in a safe place. I was thankful that I was only there for one night, and I left first thing in the morning.The staff was really nice and the views are wonderful, but I will never stay here again.This hotel is located in a perfect spot on the north end of Sedona. Dining and shopping are in walking distance. The rooms could use some updating but are clean and have AWESOME  views. The staff is friendly and it is very relaxed here. Ask for the older wing as it is by the pool. You can drive right by this place so when you see the pink jeep tours, you are there. Ask for a 2nd or 3rd floor room for more privacy. Great place, will stay again.Centrally located, very friendly staff, reasonable rates, nice smaller pool and spa make this a great place to stay when visiting Sedona. Even comes with a free buffet at the restaurant next door. We will be coming back. Minus one star because the interior of our room, while clean and in good condition, could use some upgrading.I really enjoyed our stay at Orchards.  It is an affordable and simple hotel with an INCREDIBLE view.  The staff were friendly, helpful and kind.  It's a no frills kind of place, meaning no room service, jacuzzi tub or robes, but the room was clean and welcoming.  We got exactly what we expected and were very happy during our stay.  We did not use the pool, but others seemed to loved it and were using it nightly.  It is situated right above their sister hotel, L'Auberge de Sedona.  You can walk from Orchards to the L'Auberge property.  It is a 10 minute walk to the creek that runs through L'Auberge's property, which is spectacular. Orchards is located uptown, right in the middle of everything so you can walk to restaurants, shops and to the tour offices (we used pink jeep and it was great).  We will come back for sure!We had a lovely stay at Orchards Inn. We booked a suite for our family of four. Although another reviewer stated they didn't have a view with their suite, we had a lovely view. It seems that there is another building of suites that doesn't have the view, so it may be worth asking when you book. Pros:- Location, location, location!  The hotel is right downtown, we could walk to dinner each night, and as I already mentioned there are wonderful views of the red rocks. - Big suite, lots of room to spread out. - Price was great for a suite in Sedona- The pool was heated and also had great views. We didn't use the one by the suites, so I can't comment on that. - Free buffet breakfast was pretty good. Cons: - Low water pressure in the shower. I have a lot of hair, so that's a big one for me. - Thin floors. We were on the second floor, and when we first got there our kids were a bit wiggly and playing a game in the room. The neighbors complained--at 4:30 in the afternoon, so we weren't keeping them awake. We told the kids to settle down, but when we were paying attention we could tell that unless they walked quietly we could feel their footsteps reverberate. - Blinds in the living room didn't block the light well, so our kids woke up at 6am each morning. Even with the cons, we will stay here again if we travel back to Sedona.Nice hotel, great location, and magical views from the room.  Was very happy with the experience, especially since I only payed about $130 for a double queen with a lovely view.This is a great hotel.I was pleasantly surprised when we checked in.  The lobby was small but elegant, and the staff friendly.  We had to wait a bit after checking in because they were still preparing our room, but the front desk agent took my cell phone number and said that she would call once it opened.  I thought that this was thoughtful of her.Being on the first floor, I worried that the view from our room would be subpar.  I was so, so wrong.  It was tremendous.  You get the most amazing views at this hotel, for a price that is really reasonable.  We paid $109/night in August because we checked in on a weekday.Room furnishings are tasteful.  Two sinks in the bathroom!  (Nice!)  Great pool area with hot tub.Now to the breakfast.  The selection was pretty typical for your mid-range hotel: scrambled eggs, waffle maker, assorted pastries.  However, God is in the details, and the Orchards Inn got a lot of the details right.  Bacon: super crispy!  Homemade granola: crunchy and nutty with pumpkin seeds and hazelnuts!  Salsa: fresh and delicious!  Coffee: strong and flavorful!  I do wish that they had mixed it up a bix with the selection. There could have been a few healthier options like oatmeal, too.  Service in the restaurant and front desk was consistently excellent.  They went above and beyond.Wish I were back there!  Thanks for a great stay!Comfortable rooms, friendly staff, exquisite views, great free food, location, good pricing!!Would definitely stay here again.Amazing for the money! I stayed here for one night by myself and felt completely safe, had the best view, love the outdoor balcony, staff is friendly, couldn't have asked for more. It's also in a great location!Fantastic hotel in Sedona with terrific views and was reasonably priced. FREE WIFI in the rooms is a great perk. The FREE breakfast buffet is incredible! Would stay here again in a heartbeat.It is in the middle of tourist central Sedona.  If that's where you want to be located then this is a good choice.  The room that we stayed in was not exactly what one would expect based on the picture.  The unit was more or less a glorified one bedroom apt. with no kitchen.  The amenities were spartan and the decor was dated.  The ultimate plus that this place has going for it are the views.  They were great.Great customer service.  Clean room.  Awesome view, and got a discount at check out because it was only a partial view, still beautiful though. Highly recommend. Best westerns rate was more expensive.I have stayed here a few times and it is always a great deal. Every room has a view, breakfast is included and is actually pretty good. The location is amazing, literally footsteps from the main-street in Sedona. My only complaints are that the WiFi is pretty much un-usable (as are most hotels) and my room wasnt ready by 3pm (check-in time). Other than that, I love this place.The Orchards Inn is a nice, clean comfortable hotel. It is no where near a Motel 6 but it is not a luxury hotel either.  If you are looking for a nice accomodationss reasonably priced with a good breaklfast included then this is the place. The staff was great, the views were spectacular and it was in the heart of downtown Sedona, walking distance to many restaurants and shops.  It's a great location for all area activities. If fluffy sheets and bedcoveres are your priority then go pay triple down the street. Honestly I don't know who goes to Sedona to sit in a hotel room anyway.Great room, great location, great views, great front desk staff!Beautiful view.  Room is clean-nothing over the top-but the view... Dang!these raving reviews are making me suspicious of Yelp. I read them before I came here and they played a big role in my decision to stay here.  What a disappointment.  Let me give you the straight scoop.  The hotel is basically a Motel 6 with a great view.  Seriously.  Not bad, but if you are staying in Sedona you can do much better for the money. Have low expectations and you will be fine.  Motel 6 level.  straight up.In a cross-country road trip with my daughter, we stopped in Sedona to take in the unique beauty of the area and visit the Canyon.  While in the area, we stayed at the Orchards, Inn.The pluses:  the views, the staff, the views, the impeccable service, the views.The minuses:  we only got to stay there 1 night and had a late evening check-in so we missed the evening views; decor is somewhat plain.I felt we got really good value for the price (which included a wonderful Sunday brunch) and wished we had a longer stay in the area.p.s.  A few weeks after our visit, my daughter and son drove from Chicago to California and detoured through the Sedona area.  They also stopped at Orchards Inn and enjoyed it the 2nd time around too.  My daughter thought it was just as nice the 2nd time around....My husband and I absolutely loved our stay here. The rooms have wonderful, amazing views right from your balcony. The front desk staff were all so helpful and friendly. Little extras are nice such as keeping refrigerated water bottles for guests in the lobby. Nice pool and jacuzzi. It's not a 5 star hotel if you need luxury, but it is still quite accommodating. We enjoyed the breakfast buffet provided each morning. It's also right in the middle of everything so you can enjoy shopping or any necessities without driving. The Orchards Inn of Sedona met all of our needs. We would definitely stay here again!

review_content: The pool and spa areas are well kept with beautiful views of the red rocks.  The gym and activity center are nicely stocked and coffee, tea, and hot chocolate are freely available.  The staff is competent.  DVD's and board games are complementary.  The resort is well-located in uptown Sedona so you can walk right to the shops and restaurants and then retire back to the comfort of your unit.  We are a family of five and stayed in a 2 bedroom unit.  The beds in the bedrooms definitely need to be replaced.  The sofa-bed is surprisingly good.  The unit has nice balconies.  I think the big problem is that the sitting room is very small. W-Fi was good enough and free. The TV is a little hard to use if you want to switch from TV mode to DVD mode.  Not a big deal though.  Apart from that, it is a very nice place.This would be a 4 star review except for the poor quality of staff. The hotel itself is nice apart from flaws such as joining rooms, which means you hear all noise from the adjoining room. It makes me sad to write this review as 2 previous stays here were quite good. But due to this experience, Hyatt Sedona Pinon Pointe has lost a good customer.The front office staff are lazy and unwilling to do what's needed to give customers a Hyatt quality experience. We had been guaranteed an early check in, but on arriving we were asked to go have lunch, as the room would not be ready for a while. Only after we asked to speak with the manager were we given a room that have been clean since the night before. Shouldn't a good quality employee have suggested this on his own?The room is good, but beds are very poor and should be replaced. Studio rooms have thin walls and due to the connecting doors means that all noise from the room next door easily carries through. If you're happy to share a room with the grunts, farts and coughs of your neighbor, go ahead and book it!But for most normal people, I strongly recommend skipping this hotel.We stayed here for two nights. When I read Yelpers reviews I thought we won't enjoy staying here BUT...we had a great time! The hotel is nice, our room was cleanand has a nice view. The housekeeping came and cleaned our room (I read one of the reviews that there was no housekeeping).The front desk staff were friendly and helpful. The pool was my favorite area. Nice pool with overlooking Sedona.They have pool table, table tennis, BBQ area, Fire pit. Walking distance to uptown Sedona. Easy access from everywhere. Overall we enjoyed our stay.Well kept property! Very beautiful! Perfect for a nice family getaway! Have everything and much more. Stayed at the 1 Bedroom Suite! Living room with a fire place, coffee table, couch, glass door to the balcony with a dining table outside! Washer & dryer.. Full on kitchen with an island and a large dining table/booth. Bathroom is huge! Double vanity sink, large shower with a seat.. Hot tub jacuzzi! Bedroom with a door access to the balcony! Amazing! Oh wait! 2 t.v's :)This Hyatt is situated in the heart of Sedona with wonderful views of the mountains and the rocks. We got two rooms on top of the hill with wide spacious balconies overlooking the breath-taking scenery of Sedona. The bigger room had washer and dryer in unit, a full size fridge, a dishwasher, a coffee maker, a dining table, a fireplace, and a jakuzi. The smaller room had a mini fridge and a coffee maker. Both rooms were sparkling clean when we arrived and every day after the maid service. All employees were very knowledgable, friendly and helpful. I will definitely stay here again!The views are nice, the pool is pretty, the clubhouse is pretty cool but that's about all this place has going for it. The rooms are tiny, the cleaning service is not all that, they don't have room service and certainly don't bring your kids (big mistake). They are not kid friendly and it's more of a retirement community. Believe me, nothing wrong with a retirement community just not good for a family with kids.We used a friends time share to stay here for a week. We got the two bedroom, which was very spacious for our family of four. We stocked up on groceries and had several meals in the room. Everything was provided right down to the corkscrew to open our locally produced wine. The hot tubs were great and we enjoyed the beautiful views of the night sky. The fitness center provides complimentary books, DVDs and coffee. We did not do the time share pitch and were not at all pressured to do it. The concierge was very nice and helpful as was the front desk staff.Super super super! Really enjoy coming, usually just stay at the resort most of the time!Make sure you pick up food before 7 pm, everything in Sedona closes!5 stars for hotels in this price range. Enchantment Resort would be the 5 star for the area though. If you're looking for something cheaper, Best Western looked pretty clean from the outside and it's in a great location. I'm glad I chose the Hyatt over the Hilton - the Hilton is very far from the town.As far as the Hyatt, I have no complaints. The front desk and concierge were very friendly and efficient. The location is excellent - walking distance to restaurants and tourist area. Our room had a great view of the pool and red rocks. The bathroom was large and clean. Our bed was firm and there was a nice thick mattress on the sofa bed as well. It was nice having a washer, dryer and refrig/freezer in the room. The pool was well designed and there is a separate wading pool for little kids and two jacuzzis. Wish we could have stayed longer. Would definitely stay there again.Giving one star as there is no option to give none !In short, this is Motel 6 under Hyatt name. Does Hyatt know this ?Got very nice view of parking lot!Room was not cleaned when we returned end of the day -- was told that housekeeping was busy..Some lights did not work.Confusing TV channels .. useless programming.Nice 2 hour presentation of a time share and as a gift they gave us $100 visa card to be used only at gas stations. Why gas only - I didn't know. We used the card twice saving us about $30 on gas. The third time the card would not work and I tried it at a couple locations. Checked the balance and it was $0.00  Rip - offThe time-share presentation was OK and the price was almost fair and we were mildly interested but the lack of time share space where we wanted to be was a major stop sign and now this freebie trouble. Can't believe Hyatt tarnishes it's name with this flim-flam game.We stayed here for a week mid July. Exchanged our timeshare. Came up from Phoenix.  We'll start with the good..  fabulous location,  pretty surroundings,  great views from most rooms that I can tell. Concierge very helpful. They check in to see if you need any thing, nicely decorated,  pool and pool views spectacular,  shops, Starbucks, wildflower bakery close to rooms. Great venue for kids 'camp runamucka', not cheap, but has activities for the kiddos. The sofa beds are amazingly comfortable.  Like none other.  The regular beds were a bit soft, but that's preference not a lack of quality. Now the not so great.  We are rather local so we cook in the room and bring our stuff with us. There is Nowhere to put your kitchen stuff and food. The beautiful but poorly functioning cupboards are few and filled with dishes,  etc. The dishwasher in 822 is loud and cheap. As well as the laundry machines, tho the laundry served it's purpose. We were told the coffee maker took 'individual pods,  like keurig',  so we brought a supply.  Nope.  It take coffee packs or ground like a regular drip pot. No worries, we just prepared for something different. Promotions for pink jeep tours.  You should not forego the Jeep tours,  they are great.  But,  just remember that in order to get those huge discounts you will have to attend a 90 min presentation on purchasing Hyatt timeshare. I wouldn't say it was high pressure,  but when we said no several times to the sales person, the manager was brought out,  then when that didn't work  the 'quality control'  person came out with more pitch. The 800 building at least does not have access to the walkway, you have to go out to the parking lot to get to it. Not a big issue. Oh and what's with the pergolas,  ok they are pretty,  but no shelter from sun and it would have been nice to sit and watch the thunder storms over the rock formations. Anyway,  would we stay again... Yes. We had a great time and with a few bugs that would only bother a small fraction of us, it was still good.Stayed here on Christmas Eve and Christmas Day. The place is nice. But for a resort, it is not. You would think there would be room service, but no. Nothing opened and i didnt expect things to be open on Christmas in this so called resort which is actually a time share, but they still charged the 25.00 daily resort fee which there where no extra accommodations. No, I won't stay here again. The Best Western up the street was nicer.Great location, pretty rooms, gorgeous views from the pool (and some rooms). I have stayed here twice and always get the full 2 bedroom unit as a time share exchange. This set up created a fairly quiet and private stay. The parking is a bit limited and you will have to climb stairs. If that's a problem, this not the place for you. The mid week house keeping was nice and very thorough. Many time share resorts are moving away from providing this. There is a shopping area attached to the resort with a Starbucks and a few restaurants and shops. The wildflower bread company is nice to have so close. You can order carry out and walkover to pick up. Lots of great and healthy soups, salads and sandwiches. Seems many reviewers are expecting a full service resort. This is a time share which is sort of like owning the place except you have extra amenities. That said, they are not staffed for full service.Well done, Hyatt. Excellent guest service team (Victoria at the front desk was delightful) and outstanding accommodations. We stayed in the 1 bedroom suite and extended from 2 nights to 3 as the property, pools, views and Sedona experience exceeded expectations. Funny to read other Yelpers views and then have a completely different experience. Is it dark at night on the property? Yes and this is why you get flashlights at check in and appreciate the fact that you don't feel like you are on the Vegas strip. Is it impossible to navigate around because you don't have bright street lights? Of course not. Some have made comments on the dark color interiors. The unit we are in has at least 4 windows and 2 glass patios. We are on the second floor which may help, but again, trying to figure out what people are hoping for and how much time they are spending in a condo vs being outside at the pool, on hikes etc. The decor is a lodge feel - so greens, Browns, oranges, copper is the look. Goes well with the rock fireplace in he living room. Anyway, I highly recommend this for people who are looking for a comfortable, upscale, well appointed condo with an amazing swimming pool, recreation area (ping pong, pool table) and walking distance to uptown Sedona. Splurge on the 1 bedroom vs the Studio if you can.Stayed here over the holidays and was looking forward to relaxing in beautiful Sedona.  I was able to enjoy the beautiful scenery Sedona has to offer, but relaxation definitely did not occur.  We stayed in a studio which was great at first, but when the family checked in to the room next to us, all relaxation went out the window.  All studios are connected to other rooms and there is no sound barrier between the rooms.  You can hear everything!  Every dish being washed, conversation that is happening, door being shut, etc.  We immediately went to the front desk and complained and the front desk was apologetic and stated they would call the room and advise about the noise.  Not sure if they actually called as nothing changed throughout our two night stay.  I woke up this morning at 4:00 am to them talking and again doing laundry.  I'm convinced they were running their dry cleaning business out of the room.  How can someone need to do laundry non-stop for two days??The grounds are nice, but expect to walk a lot of stairs to get around.  For the $$$ you pay I would advise to stay somewhere else in this beautiful town.We only stayed here two nights, but it's worth mentioning that there was nothing to complain about this property, everything was just right.  Check-in was easy and the concierge was there to offer us maps and information about restaurants.  Our studio room was clean and seemed very new, the bathroom was WOW really nice.  There are areas to grill and seating with fire pits and lovely views of the landscape.  We were missing a corkscrew and called the front desk and someone was there in less than five minutes to deliver it.  I believe it is a timeshare property, but we weren't given a sales pitch at all (relief!).  It seemed like many guests stay for a whole week and do grocery shopping and may not receive maid service everyday.The ONLY possible complaint someone might have is that there are A LOT of stairs.  From our room to the front desk you had to walk up, down, up again and then down a short hill.  I liked the walking but it might be an issue for some people.  The location is really great too, we just walked to dinner in the downtown area.I will stay there again and highly recommend to friends and family.We've stayed at the Hyatt on two different trips to Sedona.  Advantage: great location and we can utilize Hyatt points.  Our studio was very compact; the bathroom was nearly as large as the living quarters. It was a splendid bathroom, by the way.  The unit was very dark with inadequate lighting.  The resort has close  access to shops, a great coffee/breakfast place and an easy walk to many attractions. The resort also has fire pits, hot tubs in a beautiful setting.Not really a great resort in a really gorgeous place. For starters, it's a "residence club" not a "real Hyatt," which the employees liked to point out at every juncture: "sorry, but remember, we're not a Regency." Pathetic. I stay in a lot of Hyatts--I'm a Diamond member--and yes, they differ slightly, and yes, I understand why this place is different. But, all the same, the service was lackluster and unapologetic. The pool area was okay--the view was splendid. But the units were cramped and the place seemed more like a family/retirement center than a real resort. Maybe that's the "we're not a Regency part." What's more, even after my boyfriend and I checked in, the hotel reception called and left us the following message: "Mr. and Mrs. K----, I hope all is well....". I guess they didn't take a very good look at us, after all. Better luck next time--elsewhere.We got locked out of our room at least 6 times. Had to stand outside the room in freezing cold after the hot tub. No one was manning the pool towel stand. Had to go to front desk to get towels. Washing machine in room started flooding.
