Waited for it to be fixed. The guy left & the machine did not work. Had to call again. My daughter left her new necklace on the fire place mantel. I called the next day. I was told I would get a call back. I had to call everyday for 3 days to be told that no one found it. It was right there on the mantel. So housekeeping must of kept it. This trip was a complete waste of A LOT of money
review_content_20: Wanted to spend a bit extra on Sedona so reserved a room at Hyatt, but my stay at Holiday Inn was better than this place. Don't expect your room to be ready until at least 5pm. Their idea of a "room with a view" is one with a parking lot and a tree. Doesn't matter if you book months in advance and specifically ask for a nice view.. that's what you're going to get. Unfriendly staff who expect guests to know where everything is. Don't give any directional information. Guests have to buy all food and find dining accommodations on their own. No complimentary ANYTHING. Outlets were few and most of them weren't working. Flashlight was broken so asked for a new one.. which was broken also, so we ended up just using my iphone. Don't waste your time and more importantly your money on this place. You'll be much better off going with a local property.I came here a second  time with my friend and we had a great time. The best times to come are during winter and fall months to avoid the overcrowding. This place has so many features and great scenery.Very nice location and convenient to many of the attractions in and around Sedona.  If you're looking for a "hotel" experience you're not going to get it here.  It's a residence club and with the exception of housekeeping, you're pretty much on your own.  I had reserved a studio which was more than enough room for me.  There was a living area with a small kitchen (no stove), a sleeping area (king sized bed), a large bathroom, and a nice deck to relax on.  I was in an upper unit so sitting out on the deck was nice, but if you get a lower unit you may feel like you're in a dungeon (just sayin').  The room did appear to be a little worn (i.e. the dust ruffle around the bed was torn in a few spots), but it was clean and the kitchen had more than enough supplies.When I arrived to my unit the cleaning people had forgotten to pick up the garbage they left outside my doorway which was a bit of a drag, but mistakes happen.  For the most part I'd say it was relatively quiet, but the people in the adjoining unit were rather loud each and every time they went out of their room.  It seemed like my whole room shook each time they shut their front door.  At least I couldn't hear their TV or them talking while they were in their unit.  While it seemed like every parking spot was taken all around the property, I can honestly say you wouldn't know anyone else was staying in the other condos (with the exception of my door slamming neighbors).  The pool area/hot tubs were nice, but the weather that weekend was a little on the chilly side and windy so there weren't many people around there either.  I did partake in the hot tub one day at sunset and it was super relaxing, not to mention the surroundings were too shabby either.I enjoyed my stay, but I'm just not sure the $208/night fee was worth it to me.  I sort of prefer a bit more of a hotel experience in terms of having an onsite bar/restaurant and seeing other hotel guests.In a wonderful location, quality rooms with good views and great landscaping. Remember this is a Hyatt hotel in prime real estate, you will be shelling out some cash for a room. Book in advance. It is also in walking distance of a Starbucks as well as a few restaurants. One thing to take into account is Sedona is also on peak season cause of the weather. Prices are always up up up.We really enjoyed our stay.  Although our room was small, as it was a studio (room 2110), it had all the amenities.  The resort was very nice and right outside of our room we had a fire pit and bbq grills.  The pool has an amazing view, but it is quite a walk from where our room was.  We did go to the sales presentation, and were hassled somewhat, but just keep saying no.  The rate on the hotel is great if you do the pink jeep tour.Property is beautiful. Our 1 bedroom condo seemed very new, spacious with all amenities. Centrally located with a nice restaurant and a couple small eateries close by. Check in was like someone was reading a script. The desk agent wasn't very personable. She gave directions to the rom and the layout of the place is rather confusing. Checked in at 2pm room wasn't ready until after 4.  The place is also a timeshare so be prepared to be jumped on once checked in. Bellhop was great. Went and got ice for us. Nice fireplace and jacuzzi tub. Had to call maintenance to have them reset the tub so It would work. Pool is decent and of course closes at 10pm. Lame! Check out at 10am sucks! Called to get more towels in the morning and they never came! Overall nice place pretty spendy with check in and out times very inconvenient.  I don't know. May be another place as good and cheaper.I don't understand all the wonderful reviews. Are they staying in a different Hyatt? Pros: Scenery (you get that every where here) Workout facilityCons: Check-in: took about 30 min. They make you go pick up a welcome packet from the concierge. It's not optional. Of course you have to wait for the concierge to finish with the other guests and when you finally get the "packet" it is just a list of restaurants and a single coupon. Finding the room: IMPOSSIBLE! My room was literally hidden on the back side of the building below ground level. I looked for another 30 minutes just to find it. Privacy: forget about it. There is a solid 1" gap under my door. I put the couch pillow up against it. Plus you can hear every word your neighbors say. Cramped: about half the size of a standard hotel roomCoffee maker: never figured out how to use it. Pool: had a layer of dirt in the bottom of itFire pit: just a pit, no fireCable: confusing. Why does channel 33 have 145 options (ie 33-1,33-2) but only 143 and 145 are in use? And no ABC, CBS, or NBC? Bed: not good, bring your own pillows. Parking: difficult. They share a lot with a bunch of over priced shops that are very busy. So forget about parking any where near your room. And no electrical outlets near the bed?! Why can't hotels figure out we charge our phones near the bed so we can use our alarm rather than the unreliable wake up call or the less reliable hotel alarm clock. Over all, this is a Super 8 disguised as a resort.Thank you to Christine and Matthew at the front desk!!  We came in for our honeymoon and were exhausted after the big weekend wedding.  Christine gave us a room, way before check in time, so we could take a nap!  After we awoke she upgraded us to a new beautiful room, as requested by my new husband.  We were rested and then treated to a great room with a kitchen, family room, fire place, jacuzzi tub and lovely separate bathroom.  One of the best things was that the room had a washer and dryer!  We washed a lot of clothes... hiking in red rock proves to be dirty!!  We even went home with suitcases full of clean clothes!!In addition, we went to the store and stocked the kitchen... tired of all the meals on the road.  We had such a lovely time; we sat on the balcony, went to the pool and hot tub, sat by the fire and just relaxed.  During the days we explored the Grand Canyon and beautiful red rock trails of Sedona.  I recommend the Hyatt at Pinon Pointe.  The hotel and staff are wonderful.  Thank you to all of you at the front desk that made our honeymoon so special!  Matthew even found our misplaced ball cap!Outstanding. Have been here several times in last 4 years. We are owners here & at @ 2 other sites in their resident properties. We originally had reserved a studio (one room-limited space) but asked to upgrade to a one bedroom. The gal (Christine) worked very hard to find a one bedroom unit & put us in an excellent unit with fantastic view & great location. This is what we have come to expect since becoming members of Hyatt Resident club. This property is ideally located & the staff is very accommodating. The facilities (ie exercise room, pool etc) are as good or better than most resorts. All in all a very great place to stay in a beautiful town.Very convenient location with beautiful scenery. But the soundproofing between units are poor. Guests upstairs were unbelievably noisy with their thunder-like stomping. Also, the staff (who we always said "Good morning" every day) at the front desk still didn't remember us by asking "Are you staying here?". I would have given 4 stars if we didn't experience these factors. 5 stars for the location tho.This place is nice, clean, reasonably priced, and has an amazing view.  I was able to take better pictures off my balcony then almost any other place in town.  It was very convenient to walk across the parking lot to get a snack, drink, or a coffee.  I never had an issue parking near my room.  The property is also adjacent to downtown shopping area.  I will be back the next time I am in town.Excellent location in the heart of Sedona.  Ample parking with plenty of places to eat within walking distance.Staff is friendly and efficient.  Sales pitch isn't abrasive.  Pool area is well maintained and ultra family-friendly.  Rooms are private, spacious and well-stocked.  We really enjoyed the view from our studio balcony.Okay - cut to the facts.  My wife and I are owners of several Hyatt timeshare properties and are big fans of Hyatt.  They have quality, boutique type resorts in various parts of the country.  Sedona is a fine property with all of the amenities required to make for a very comfortable and enjoyable stay.  Some say the studio is cramped - well look at the website, understand the size and maybe you have should reserved a 1 bedroom unit instead.  The units are studio and one-bedroom, and when combined they equal a very spacious 2 bedroom unit.  The staff is professional and as for having to wait at check-in - get over it, you wait in line at Starbucks and don't complain.  Couldn't figure out the coffee maker - come on, maybe you shouldn't work with electrical appliances - instructions are on the counter next to the coffee maker.  Looking at a parking lot - well the very high mountains behind the lot are the attraction and are clearly visible.  Maybe you should have opted for a higher level of room.  The TV has a lot of channels including all major networks, and a simple instruction sheet is on the TV.  Some people just want to complain and have no interest in being happy, and nothing seems to meet their self perceived worth.  Sedona Hyatt is a gem and the nicest place in town.  The only admonition we have is that the Timeshare sales staff seems to be overly arrogant, rude, and demanding - avoid them at all costs.It was a great hotel. The rooms are awesome. There are full kitchens in the condos and they had everything we needed. Jacuzzi tubs, huge showers, fire place and beautiful patios. The pool area was awesome. It was chili in Sedona but the pools were 85degrees and the jacuzzi's were hot. The pool overlooks the mountains. My 4 year old had a blast. The only bummer was there wasn't a great restaurant onsite. The restaurants in the shops were average. Definitely a great resort and close to everything in Sedona. It wasn't cheap but since it had a kitchen we  cooked some meals and it was well worth it.We came into down early June for a family wedding. The hotel is clean, modern and well maintained.  We initially went with the studio but upgraded to a 1 bedroom with the pink jeep tour.  So glad we went with the bigger room.  Most of the studio's appear to be inner units that look out on stairway.  One & two bedroom have decks/patios and frankly are just more open & airy.   The unit is well appointed - full kitchen, huge tub & shower, ceiling fan over the bed etc etc  With the pink jeep package, they pick you up and drop you off near the lobby which is really convenient! ( and the tour was fun)    Be aware this hotel/time share is big so some units are a drive from the lobby and some, like ours, have many steps down to the unit (it's built on a hillside).  I think our room was in the 1900 building and we had to walk down about 30 steps - it wasn't a big deal really but if we were disabled or it was super hot it could have been an issue so be aware.  Also, having read other reviews I was ready for the sales pitch which we kindly declined with not issue. Site is close to town, they have a few restaurants on site but we didn't try them because the breakfast place didn't open until 7am and we are super early risers.  We would stay here again in a heartbeat.  Really nice spot!After a grueling trip over 3 days from SF Bay to Grand Canyon to Flagstaff to Monument Valley, this place appeared as a paradise and a savior to our complete exhaustion. It also consolidated my belief that Hyatt is probably the greatest hotel franchise in the US.From the very beginning - our check-in - I could see why the brand name Hyatt carried prestige. The front desk was extremely welcoming, friendly & helpful, giving us a plethora of useful information about the hotel & its features. The concierge provided us with info on the city of Sedona itself, such as its energy vortexes and jeep rides. While our family did not partake in these activities, the concierge desk's willingness to make our stay in Sedona enjoyable was much appreciated.Now, onto the rooms. This is not really a "hotel," but as its tagline "Vacation Club" suggests, more like studios/condos. Which is great, because as it is not connected to other rooms, you get quietness and privacy - something many from busy urban hubbubs would appreciate. Inside the rooms lies luxury and comfort, mingled together. The humongous bathroom with the marbled shower; a large kitchen area to prepare all kinds of food (there's a Safeway nearby!); deliciously comfortable living room with a huge TV & nice fireplace; a pull-out sofa bed that you can actually sleep comfortably on; the master bedroom with a JACUZZI! Oh, and most importantly, the beautiful view onto the red rocks encompassing Sedona. Hyatt Pinon Pointe is the perfect escape from your mundane everyday life. Stay here for a few days, and enjoy hiking, golfing, helicopter tours, etc. Sedona is truly a gem in the state of Arizona, and I owe it to this five-star hotel for making our stay so wonderful.VERDICT: For $200 per night, this place is a STEAL!The Hyatt Pinon Pointe is situation as its name implies - on a high hill in the middle of Sedona. It really has some awesome views, in every direction. And even though it's in the middle of Sedona, it doesn't feel like it. Anywhere you look, there are plenty of mountains and colorful skies upon which to feast your eyes.We were given a warm welcome at reception, and they took a few minutes to ask about our interests and what we wanted to do while in Sedona (much appreciated) and based on our feedback they gave some wonderful recommendations for places to explore, such as Red Rock state park. Very cool.Decor - inside and out - is excellent. Very tasteful American southwestern. We stayed in a studio room, which was perfect since we were only there for a few nights and were going to spend most of our time outside. A nice big comfortable bed, loveseat, flat-screen TV, plus a decent-sized kitchenette with flatware and dishes. The bathroom came stocked with a good array of toiletries, as you'd expect out of a resort - including toothpaste.The balcony offered a great place to start the morning (and we were up early, since we were still functioning on Eastern Time). I looked forward to a quiet hour spent reading on the balcony each morning, before starting our day.Parking was OK - though there were only a few spaces right outside our unit, and we generally drove another 30 feet / 10 meters in order to park in the less-crowded parking lots at the higher end of the facility (away from the reception area). Wherever I go, I prefer not to park right in front where everyone is competing for the closest parking spot, anyway, so it was all good to me.The pool area is fantastic. It's situated on a high point, so that you have a view of all of the mountains around. It felt kind of like being on Mount Olympus. There was also a nice big grill for guests to use, a lounge, and a charming fire pit. Awesome.Due to the low light ordinance in Sedona, they provide flashlights for your use. Very thoughtful of them, and I saw several guests making use of them. However, as I'm used to skulking about in the dark, I didn't use a flashlight and got around just fine.Very nice place - and I would definitely stay here again when in Sedona.This Resort has awesome views and the pool and jacuzzi area has gorgeous views of the Mountains and the Red rocks. We stayed in 2 bed suite and was upstairs with amazing view!  The master bedroom had amazing bed with a sunken bath tub..There are restaurants and shops right next door as well !!The Good... The views, clean room...The bad, poor Wifi if you need it, which was the reason I decided to stay here.  I had to do some work and upon checking in for one night, o was specific in asking about the wifi.  I was assured there was, and the front desk also boosted the work out room they had, and the best views in Sedona.  I had to change rooms to get working wifi, and it was not reliable.  I was offered another room change again ( for the third time) but it was 11 pm and I was done.  There is no easy way to move your luggage to and from your car, or another room.  It's very dark at night and lots of stairs.  I did check out the work out room in the morning, and went to get water from the cooler, it was empty.... Seriously?  With the name like Hyatt I would have expected the amenities to be well maintained.  Especially in the desert, you should not be empty on water.This is a time share resort, so it does not have the look and feel of a hotel, but more of apartment or studio style.My first time at a Hyatt time share and I'm really impressed. The brown adobe hut looking buildings didnt look like much but inside it's more like a great 1 bedroom apartment than a hotel room. Furniture's all dark wood, new looking brand name appliances, and it really is a fully equipped kitchen including blender and dish towels. Oh and there's a washer/dryer and the biggest bath tub I've ever seen. Price is pretty steep but its an expensive little town on a holiday weekend so its to be expected. This actually makes me want to check out their properties in other cities.
review_content_40: Great place to stay in Sedona. Can't beat the view and the pool is awesome. Clean rooms and great staff.Nice location and very nice views  Property well maintained but very large and spread out. From our room to the pool was a 10 minute walk - mostly uphill it seemed. Hotel staff was friendly. I thought it was nice but for a couple I think there would be a couple of places in town that seem a bit more cozy but still elegant. The Sedona strip is right next to the hotel and the upscale mall next to the Hyatt is very nice and convenient.Very impressed !! Nice experience !!! Studio Rooms were very spacious and clean. Great View from the room's patio. Rooms have a small kitchenette with microwave and fridge. Bathroom had double sinks and very spa like. We had one sink that was slow draining and they came and took care of it right away. Staff very friendly. Pool and Hot tub area very nice. Landscape around the pool area was extremely nice and relaxing. Shops and Restaurants in walking distance. Very Pleased !!!Ok, there are definitely some things that one can complain about, but not me. Why? In-room hot tub. As I lay back in it, I said, everything is forgiven. And it was. So what...irked me temporarily? Lack of parking. Excess stairs. Views which are somewhat dubious (yes, you can see red rocks, but past the other blocks). It's really hard to know what you're getting without having been there first. I saw some hotels which really had much better views, but I HAD THE HOT TUB. And a lot of space. and two sinks. and a balcony. which is what I really wanted.I just love Sedona.  It is like a city within a national park.  This was my third visit. This hotel/condo is in prime location - right at the "Y" and yet, on an elevation so it feels a little remote also.  The entrance is pretty and the rooms/suites are nice and comfy enough.  The bathrooms are upgraded nicely.  It is not a 5 star place but still nice for families.  There is a small pool and an activity center, which has a small work out room, well stocked with towels and water.  The jacuzzi and the BBQ area were nice but small, already taken by what appears to be a small party of extended family with small children.  At my last visit, we stayed at the Arroyo Roble, which is creek side and we had a room with a fireplace which made it special.  The Hyatt was ok but I probably will stay at the Arroyo Roble next time.Very nice, very clean. Great facility, great views. Has a great little pool for small children. Also the connected shops, especially the Starbucks are very convenient. Very close to "Old Town Sedona"Super friendly staff, helped out when i had to change my stay dates upon arriving. Helping with tour guides etc. Rooms were small but had the basic stuff and were clean - great location.Beautiful views, excellent customer service and concierge/welcome package, gorgeous room, spacious kitchen for us to cook most of our meals in, gigantic jet tub, big patio, simple parking lot, centrally located, tons of inclusive accommodations- guest speakers, movies, work out center etc... We may consider going with a Hyatt timeshare when we retire.Love this place, I didn't even want to leave my room. Place is amazing with it's great view from the porch, the fireplace,(oh how I love fireplaces), granite countered kitchen, the jacuzzi bathtub! The staff was so helpful and friendly. If you have ever stayed at a timeshare, you know what I'm talking about. What a steal at $180 a night, considering there was a pull out couch which is perfect to accommodate additional people. Our friends stayed somewhere else, so we had this place all to ourselves, which was fine in my book.  Remember this is a timeshare, so of course they tell you about this meeting they have with their tenants. They tell you, "If you go you get $160 credit back towards your room, with no purchase obligation". We didn't do it, so I advise you do the same, it's a timeshare so their goal is to sell you it. If you have ever encountered timeshare sales people, they are worse than car salesman. As long as you don't attend that, you will have a beautiful experience.Our family of four stayed here and loved it. Full kitchen, fire place, washer and dryer in the unit, beautiful furnishings, lovely patio,, amazing service, especially for a timeshare. We grilled out near the fire pit, looking at the sunset over the mountains. It was magical. The only bad part was only getting to stay one night. We can't wait to go back.Our group of 4 families rented 4 one bedroom units. Each of the unit  was  beautifully furnished, clean, nice kitchen, roomy, washer/dryer provided. All  with great views. One unit assigned to us had an old looking bathroom, with no jacuzzi tub. They granted our request to move to a better one the next day.We checked in very late, the pathways to the units were confusing in the dark, and the direction the front desk gave us was wrong. That particular receptionist didn't seem very welcoming, we got the feeling she can't wait for us to leave her alone. We had requested to keep our units as close to each other as possible awhile back, but to no avail.There are units with several steps to climb, no elevator.Our kids enjoyed the pool and hot tub, with plenty of time to swim after hiking, it was nice that  they keep it open till late not like some hotel pools that closed at 6/7pm.The view is unbelievable from our room and balcony. All of us fell in love with Sedona. Definitely recommends the city and the Hyatt for families.The location of the hotel is in the middle of the city, high on a hill. Very convenient to everything. Considering everything, the hotel is great value for the money. We'd love to go back.I stayed here with my parents, who own a timeshare, hence we were spared the sales pitch. The thing I really liked was actually being right in the middle of town and even within WALKING distance of stuff. That seems almost unheard of for any hotel in Arizona, much less a nice, refuge-like place like this. You can walk around Uptown Sedona for an hour or two, then retreat to the pool deck and watch the moon rise over the red rocks.So if I were here on my own and had to endure that sales pitch....yep, still worth it.Became a Timeshare owner here a few years ago. Have stayed at the resort many times. The staff are professional and courteous. The units are first-class and clean. Love the jetted tub! Full kitchen, gas fireplace, and private patios with awesome views of the red rocks. Probably the main reason we opted for this resort is the proximity to Uptown Sedona. We can park the car and walk to many shops, and take the free trolley to many more. The traffic in Sedona can get terrible at times. Heated pool and hot tub. Gas fire pit by the pool.Good location, but average. There are no Dining facilities at the hotel. Staff recommends a restaurant across the driveway, but it does not open until 5pm. There is a Starbucks there , which Has outdoor seating with great views of the red rocks.Stayed in a one bedroom with a fireplace. It was a little seedy for my taste but my boyfriend loved it. Unfortunately, the pools were closed for renovation.  I would go back if going to Sedona b/c of the location. There are lots of shops and activities close by. The hotel has free parking for guests.Gorgeous views and beautiful suites!Fabulous hotel! Staff was extremely helpful and kind, room was perfect size, very clean and well stocked, and the location and view was awesome. The whirlpools by the firepit on a cool night under the stars was incrediblt after climbing the red rocks all day. Very nicely located near everything in Sedona. Will definitely stay there again when we return.I love it here, my favorite place to go and i go every fall. The Hyatt has the best view, close to walking around the town,pool is so relaxing. The rooms are spacious and comfortable and even have washer dryers.Stayed here 1/13/12 to 1/16/12. The 1 bedroom rooms are great. They have a full kitchen with mini washer & dryers in the unit.My young family and I enjoyed a wonderful experience at the Hyatt over a six night stay.  Our 2 bedroom unit was clean, well stocked, and had a 270 degree view of Sedona's red rocks.  The staff was professional and courteous.  The pool was near-by, loaded with plenty of chairs and tables for sun or shade, and the 1.5 foot kiddie pool proved to be a winner with my young child.  The BBQ's were available nightly and cleaned daily.  I would highly recommend to my friends and family.
review_content_60: are you thinking of investing in a timeshare?  are you dying for someone to take you on a tour of their not-quite-yet-finished condos?  do you want a free helicopter tour of "old sedona"?  then you have come to the right place!  the hyatt pinon pointe has it all:  clean and comfortable accomodations, beautiful views, access to shopping, dining and activities, and a PUSHY, PUSHY staff that will STALK YOU until you agree to go on their 90-minute tour of their almost-but-not-quite-finished condos in exchange for a free helicoptor tour of old sedona.the bf and i hid out in our room, planning our comings-and-goings around the concierge's lunch schedule, dodging voicemails, and avoiding eye contact with the staff in order to get through our 2 night stay without having to endure a sales pitch.  we live in san francisco for chrissakes...like we can afford more property!that aside, this seemed to be the nicest hotel in sedona (besides the enchantment) and for $119/night, we got a nice little studio with refrigerator, dishes, microwave, TV, couch, etc.  it is also centrally located near lots of food, shops and grocery stores.  i would definitely be back...but not until their timeshares are filled.

hotel_name: Best Western Plus Inn Of Sedona
review_content: This place gets 5 stars because of Saara and her superb customer service. Excellent stay all due to her kindness and her helpfulness. This place also has some killer views at sunset and a pretty decent jacuzzi. The lobby feels like a lodge in winter time, with its cozy fireplace and warm cider. The rooms are basic, but you aren't in Sedona to stare at four walls, are you?You are surrounded by beautiful vistas everywhere you turn at this property.  Sedona is gorgeous.  The staff here is top-notch and couldn't have done enough for us.  From booking an off-road jeep tour to driving us into town for dinners and then picking us up with their free shuttle, everyone that we met was truly service oriented.Clap! Clap! Clap!Thank you Best Western Plus Inn of Sedona--you are a great team.Breakfast each morning offers many, many choices.  There is something there for everyone.It was an extremely generous breakfast to offer their guests.We had a comfortable king size bed with a fireplace.I noticed that this business is also pet friendly.Just came back after a 6 night stay. I'm always a bit nervous to commit to that many nights at a place I've never stayed before but we were really pleased with our choice. Initially booked through Expedia but later called the hotel directly to reconfirm room type and got upgraded to a third floor King with fireplace (and if you are coming in anytime from now on, you'll appreciate that!). The location was easy to find, minutes into Uptown Sedona, fantastic hiking "in your backyard", Airport Mesa for more views, shopping at Whole Foods or Bashas. We were glad we weren't right in Uptown as it was really busy even for mid-November. Room faced west so perfect for sunsets. Very clean. Comfy bed. Nice touches included a Keurig and  dispensers for all toiletries like shampoo and updated bathroom and room colours. Parking was right in front of the door. Check-in was super fast and friendly with a good recommendation for dinner (Judi's, just about a 2 minute walk down the hill). Wifi was great. Complimentary breakfast was varied and hosted by 2 really nice young women who kept up with refreshing everything. We made breakfast sandwiches and yogurt parfaits, toasted bagels  and more. Pop and ice machines are in a stand alone feature which eliminated the usual "down the hall" rattle. We took the hotel shuttle on a whim one night but found the location made it just as easy to drive into town on our own. Weather didn't permit as much pool time as we'd hoped for but did manage one afternoon - the pool area was really clean, had brand new lounger furniture and towels were in a big cabinet poolside. Pool is heated but not overly so - would be a bit of a stretch for swimming in the winter.We wish for two things - 1. How about going no smoking? Since all the terraces are shared, it would be so much better not to have to move inside when the neighbours lit up. 2. Recycling bins in rooms so that we could recycle whatever the hotel does - bottles, paper? We're used to separating stuff and the hotel seems committed to a number of Green initiatives.I'm a Best Western Diamond member and this is one of my favorite hotels, based on the views alone! Simply breathtaking! We stayed here 5 nights for our first trip to Sedona and could not be happier with this hotel. The rooms were clean and the beds were very comfortable.The breakfast had a lot of variety and was included in our stay. The pool area was very clean and refreshing after a hike. We used the shuttle service and it was convenient. I suggest to travelers to make sure you call ahead so you don't have to wait as long. We had to wait 25 minutes one time as we didn't plan ahead. The best part is the view of the red rocks. We sat on the terrace daily and enjoyed sunrise, sunset and stars! Simply amazing!***** For the Staff and Location*For the room itselfI'm one of the Best Western Rewards member but not sure what that means any more. The front desk staff and manager were most helpful and able to handle our issues. They were understanding and polite.  We were offered a room on the second floor in the building opposite to the registration area.  Checked out the location asked for a room in the main building with the large patio facing east and were granted a different room on the top floor two doors from the office. The breakfast was great, well supplied and staff was also very helpful and friendly. The property is well maintained and you couldn't ask for a more picturesque site.  Didn't use the shuttle service. This is an ideal location since this is in the center of town away from the hustle of the main business area. It's quiet and the views are fantastic. Now for the room: stayed for two nights. Our room had an issue with the sheets and we were just too tired from ripping everything up late at night. Did a further inspection and after some brushing off and further checking, it was decided that the sheets and pillows will be satisfactory for the night. The duvet cover was backwards (open end at the head) but we just tucked everything in and folded the top sheet further down.  For the bed itself, just lying on your back and you're leaning toward the window. The next morning we brought the matter of the bed sheets to the attention of the front desk staff and the manager was present. They were aghast, truly apologetic and would have the room cleaned with new sheets.  Not wanting to make a big fuss, that seemed to rectify the matter.  At least the sheets were clean and the duvet cover is now properly set.  Maybe I can still try to sleep with a slightly tilted mattress in clean sheets. Bottom line: I should have asked for a different room when we first noted the issue with the sheets since this should be a big hint that all was not right with the room since the mattress was rather worn and the air conditioner didn't work properly either.  Can't say that I got a decent nights sleep in two days. I've stayed at many BW's before and this is the first major room issue. This is an unusual isolated situation limited to what was encountered in that room and not a reflection on the entire property, however I just read that another patron had a similar issue with the air conditioner. Other people may have had great experiences and it was unfortunate that I did not since my experience was disappointing. Would I be back? Not sure and trust that BW's standards here will be reviewed and improved.  To the staff and manager, thank you for trying.We were very impressed!! What a gem. First, the location is great. Central to all the Sedona action. The views from the shared balcony are nothing short of spectacular!!There was hot apple cider in the Libby when we checked in. What a nice treat! They also gave us a welcome bag with 2 bottles of water and 2 granola bars.  A very thoughtful touch. Our room had a fireplace which was great. The bed was super comfy and the water pressure in the shower was excellent! We had everything we needed. No complaints. Breakfast included in the morning with all sorts of options including bagels, toast, cranberry nut bread, eggs, sausage, potatoes, cereal, fruit you get etc. They have a nifty pancake machine with a conveyor belt. My little one loved watching it.  We would stay here again anytime we return to Sedona. Would be awesome to have a snack and a glass of wine on the balcony. Was too cold during our stay. Next time!! Same case with the pool and jacuzzi. Looked nice but brrrr! A great choice for a reasonable price. Parking was a breeze with a spot right outside our door too.The views are spectacular from the terraces, and most of the rooms.  This was our second visit after being here 15 years ago, so this hotel had lost a bit of it's new hotel looks, but the views always make it a great hotel!  The complimentary buffet breakfast is a big plus.  Take advantage of the complimentary shuttle driven by Jamie, who will keep you entertained as he drives you to local restaurants (have a few margaritas because you aren't driving!). We loved Elote restaurant!!This was are first visit to Sedona and we enjoyed our stay at this Best Western Inn at Sedona. There are views from all sides of the Canyon at this hotel. We had a west view and were delighted. The rooms were clean and comfortable. We had a problem with our A/C and called the front desk to report the problem. An employee came to repair the issue quickly and curiously. The breakfast was diverse and plentiful.  The front desk arranged a Pink Jeep Canyon Tour which was wonderful.The hotel staff was friendly and helpful. We can't wait to come back and stay again.This wasn't my first pick in hotels but I ended up being happy with it. It was more than what I wanted to spend (I stayed at the Sedona Motel the first time I was in Sedona) but it is a very nice place. The room was very clean, and looked modern. The views from the patio were insaaane! I feel like you get great views regardless of where you are placed within the property. There is a real breakfast-buffet style, with eggs, sausage, and pancakes. The fitness room had three machines, and a rack of dumbbells going up to 30# I believe. I took advantage of the shuttle, as it is very convenient and free (tipping not included). It was nice to drink at dinner and not have to worry about driving. Very nice hotel option for Sedona!While planning our stay in Sedona, there were two Best Westerns availabe - the one that was in downtown Sedona, and this one, just a few minutes drive outside the downtown stretch. We chose this one because it was a bit cheaper, and boy, are we glad we did.The back door of the room opened out onto a public balcony, and the view from here was absolutely breathtaking. I woke up before the rest of the sleepyheads and spent some time on the balcony early in the morning and couldn't believe my eyes. The included-breakfast was very well stocked. And get this - they had an automatic pancake machine! You press a button, and a conveyor belt starts rolling, and a minute later, a fresh-cooked pancake plops out. That made my day.The gym was a little bit small, but seriously - who goes on vacation to work out? Work out in your bed! Let the excellent views inspire you.Like others said, awesome views you can see from the extensive terraces. Surprisingly quiet. Those things were a big plus for me--I was visiting Sedona to de-stress.Pretty fountain outside and fireplace in the lobby. They have a concierge.The rooms are comfortable and nice, not luxury, but they don't claim to be a 5-star fancy hotel or anything. Granite countertop in the bathroom and updated furniture. Clean. Coffee maker in the room, cable, etc.Staff in the lobby was pleasant and helpful.Full breakfast was served buffet style--standard stuff--eggs, cereal, toast, etc.4 stars only because they don't have a bar or restaurant on site. It would be nearly perfect if they did. They did have a shuttle that we didn't have the chance to use, so that kind of counterbalances the lack of a restaurant/bar.They have a pool and hot tub, which we didn't try because the weather was pretty chilly. Looked clean and nice.I love the views from this hotel.  It was quiet and clean and the beds were comfortable.  The breakfast was just okay.Best secret in town :-) great location. Great views from terrace... The upgrade way worth it.  Little traffic..compared to the crazy traffic close by. Joan at the concierge was brilliant.. hidden trails.. thank you best westernI just got home from a weekend with friends in Sedona. My two friends, along with me and my dog, checked into our room on Friday, January 31, 2015. Things started off great with a warm and welcoming front desk staff.They were very accommodating with us humans and extremely sweet with my shy pup. They have Milk Bone dog biscuits at the front desk and hot apple cider for their two-legged guests near the fireplace. Our room was wonderful, with the most amazing view! I don't think there's a bad view to be had here. It was also super-clean and the beds were very comfortable. Just across the street from the hotel is a sweet little park for early morning walks and there are a couple of great trails within walking distance. The free breakfast was great and we were able to enjoy it on the heated, dog-friendly patio. I don't believe I would have enjoyed my Sedona vacation half as much if we'd stayed anywhere else!Our second visit to this Inn and it was another great visit! Many thanks to Hope at the front desk who upgraded us and put us in a 300 block room early in the day: we arrived from the Grand Canyon around 11:30 in the morning and the Inn's shuttle took us to uptown Sedona for sightseeing while our room was getting ready. We were able to check in early and had a great stay! The only thing I'd caution future guests about is the air conditioning (this one was really noisy for some reason) and to remember to be gracious neighbors to anyone in the unit below you, if you decide to move the extremely heavy patio furniture (apparently it gets pretty windy there in Sedona and they need sturdy chairs!); don't drag those things across the patio because it's right above the people below you.The breakfast is again a key feature of Best Westerns; it's really helpful when the average cost of a family meal during vacations here is around 70$ for 4 people... Also love the fact that Best Westerns always have coffee available in the lobbies.We have stayed in many B&B's and chain hotels in Sedona and the one we continue to return to is the Best Western Plus Inn of Sedona. The property is especially great for groups which we often have 6- 8 friends meeting up. The staff is friendly and accommodating. The rooms are clean and comfortable. I suggest the rooms on the upper level, those with the room numbers 3xx either on the east or west side. East offers great morning sun and west beautiful sun sets. The views of the red rocks are great from either side. The outdoor patios are perfect for a group get together especially under the covered patio area. The pool and hot tubs are great features. The daily newspaper and hot breakfasts are included with your stay. One of the great amenities is the roundtrip complementary shuttle which cannot be beat because it eliminates the task of finding parking at the shops and restaurants. It's definitely worth giving the driver a tip for the convenience of the transportation.We were booked for a 2 night stay at Best Western.  We had a 3 year old, a 9 month old, and 2 dogs.  Initially we were booked a room that was the FARTHEST you could be from the vehicle parking.  Our room was down 2 flights of stairs on a small sidewalk.  Not very accommodating for all the crap we had with us be be back and forth.  Plus my wife had carpal tunnel surgery the previous day, so she wasn't very useful!Upon going to the vehicle and coming back with some more things (almost everything by this point) the phone was ringing.  It was the front desk.  They were calling to ask if everything was as expected.  I explained the room location situation and asked if there were others available.  They were very wiling to show me another room and let us swap.  That's exactly what we did.  The new room was feet from the parking, and NO stairs!  Perfect!  One of the employees saw me struggling with everything going to our initial room and he asked if he could get a cart and help move things to the other room.  This was great!  Thank you random employee!  Think he said he was the shuttle driver.The morning breakfast is great!  Much more than we expected, and much more than a typical hotel breakfast. We were stuffed before we even walked out the door for the day.They were also willing to let us slide our checkout time back to 12pm rather than 11am.  That extra hour with kids and dogs can make a huge difference and helps lower the stress in general.All in all it was a great stay.  Would stay there again no doubt!This property is beautiful and enchanting. Nestled in a hill overlooking cathedral rock, I think? The outside is really really pretty and charming. Our room was facing the parking lot, maybe all the view rooms were full because we got there early evening? Sadly, no view for us. But a short walk to the front of the property did allow for the lovely view. However, I think we should have had a much better room rate given that we had no view. Not quite a good value for the money. The room was clean enough but there were stains on the carpet so that was kind of gross. I have two small dogs so maybe it was a dog room. But my dogs do not pee on carpets so it's pretty disgusting to have a room with stains from other pets. Tile would be a much better option for dog rooms.The breakfast was very good, as was the coffee. And any hotel with staff who make my dad feel comfortable walking around in his muppet character pajamas at 6am is okay with me. We woke at that time and I took my dogs out to relieve themselves after their night in their crate. We walked out to the front with a misty view of the red rocks, it was so glorious! My dad went in the lobby to get some coffee and it started sprinkling. I hurried back to the room and right as I got back it started pouring. So poor papa was either to get drenched or remain in the lobby in pajamas. He did that and apparently someone said we had to do a pink jeep tour. Pops came in an hour later all excited about the jeep tour. Who was this man? My dad is not usually adventurous enough for jeep tours. Before he could change his mind I said absolutely yes! So we did that and it was spectacular. What a fun time!! The hotel staff was very amenable to a slightly later checkout time if we didn't get back from our tour on time. (We stopped on our way to Gallup and only stayed one night). It was nice that their shuttle took us in to town to the jeep tour location. And we called when we were done and the shuttle was there within ten minutes to pick us up. I prefer this hotel location to being right in town. It's more peaceful and it's only a five minute trip by car, if that.So overall, another really good Best Western experience.We stay at the Inn of Sedona for several nights each year when we visit the area.  We've been returning to this property for about 10 years now, because it is quite simply a great experience all around.  They always seem to be making improvements to the hotel and keeping up the quality of the rooms and amenities.  Our only critique was the removal of the fountains near the breakfast area.  They clearly are looking to make room for all the guests at this time, but we'd love to see them somewhere else on the grounds.  Anyhow, the staff are all very friendly and accommodating, the location and views are outstanding, and all at a decent price.  We've thought about staying at other places when we visit, but haven't been impressed enough by the other venues to try them.  Look no further, you won't regret staying here. Can't say enough good things.Myself and our entire wedding party stayed at The Best Western Inn Plus in May. I worked with Jennifer as far as reserving the rooms for everyone. She was fabulous and was able to put us all on the third floor terrace. The view from our rooms far exceeded our expectations. The complimentary hot breakfast each morning was a wonderful added bonus.
review_content_20: The rooms here are comfortable, with all the basic needs for the traveler, including a beautiful view of the Sedona treats! Also, each level has a common patio with tables and chairs for your enjoyment. Sedona is a busy area, so the hotel shuttle comes in very handy, departing every half-hour to all the populars stops. Wonderful views. Great shopping. Go!Great view and great stuff. We only stayed 2 night but we had great time in here.Free breakfast and free shuttle to uptown.I was really expecting to be impressed with this place, but I left feeling kind of sad that we had spent so much money to stay here.Obviously, everywhere in Sedona there are views, and every view in Sedona is gorgeous. The way this inn is built is really interesting, because every level has terraces that go upwards to the main level on the hillside, giving even more interesting views depending on where your room is. Even the lobby is entrancing with great decor and pleasant staff.The first problem we encountered was directly after we got into our room. I was practically suffocating from the heat, even though it was after 10PM. The room was above the temperature reading ability of the thermostat, and, even though the air conditioner was on, there was barely any cool air blowing out. After being on for a minute or two, it would turn off again. Even though it was so late, and we were so tired and ready to pass out, we had to go to the office because the phone was also not working! We received a "free upgrade" as compensation to a room near the office.Now, I don't really get why this was an upgrade, because the room seemed smaller, and the bathroom was about half the size of the one we had before. There was a door in the back as well as the front that went out to the shared terrace, but if people pay extra for that, I have no idea why, since you can just walk out there any time. At least the air conditioning and phone worked, but the beds were so incredibly uncomfortable to me that I barely got any sleep whatsoever. The mattresses seem pretty old and dilapidated.All that being said, the parking was still easy to get, the hot breakfast was VERY good, and it was easy to get back to the main road to leave Sedona. I still would avoid staying here again if I visit Sedona any time soon, because that whole experience was definitely not worth the nearly $200 we paid.Very nice place, the views are wondrous. The rooms were clean and very well done. The Staff is friendly and very helpful. One of our party left her purse after a trip on the Pink Jeeps, look for this review. The shuttle driver who was getting off, took her back to town and was able to track the purse down at the Lost and Found. Honest people are visiting here. We at breakfast at the motels buffet. Standard fare but very well down. large selection of fruit, eggs, sausage both pork and turkey, bagels, biscuits and gravey ( gravy was very good and not pasty. We ate here 3 times and the options do change, different eggs and potatoes, all good.Amazing hotel. Picturesque views, very clean and comfortable, high quality rooms, super friendly staff... Can't beat it!Great value for money!!The rooms are smaller than it seems in the pictures. Has the basic amenities. Almost all rooms have a shared common balcony with breathtaking views! You can literally draw the curtain and see the sunrise/sunset from your bed.They offer free hot breakfast - eggs, oatmeal, pancakes, potatoes, meat and coffee and juices. Pretty standard for a best western.The biggest perk is the free shuttle service. You can get pick-up/drop-off service to any restaurant so go ahead and have that extra glass of wine/beer/margarita....This place was great!  A nice surprise for a Best Western and what we paid.  The rooms were very nice (entrances from the outside), a hot breakfast was included, and the view from the balcony behind our room was unbeatable.  That was probably the highlight.  It's a shared/community balcony with the other rooms in your area, but there's tons of room and it's a great place to sit and enjoy the sunset/sunrise.  One star knocked off for the small, somewhat dirty pool.  Otherwise, everything was top notch.  We would definitely return.Of course they are in a nice location.  Great views from the terrace.  It also feels fairly isolated, which is nice.  Like most Best Western Pluses, this place was nice, clean and free breakfast that includes more than just carbs.  I do have to say the coffee was lacking in flavor.  We were able to get the room from points.  It pays to be a member of Best Western!  We never got anything from Hilton and we were members for a few years and stayed with them several times.  They also gave us a bottle of wine.  That was nice.  The rooms are good size.  I did notice the rooms had a hint of old smoke, but only a hint.  I actually liked it because it reminded me of traveling when I was a kid.  The smell was very slight.  My wife didn't even notice the smell.  The beds were very comfy too.  Despite being in the 90's during the day the pool looks like it was closed.  It was green anyway, and not clear either.  We only spent the night so that was not a problem.  My wife stayed at the other Best Western and she says it is a little better and by a creek for a nice walk.  It is also in downtown.Recently stayed here with my daughter and granddaughter for two nights while in Sedona.  This hotel was fantastic.  I would highly recommend it.  The rooms are nice and clean.  Continental breakfast is served each morning from 6:00-10:00.  The views from the terraces are breath taking.  The front lobby staff was extremely helpful and courteous.  There is a shuttle bus that takes you to many nearby places.  The shuttle driver, was extremely knowledgeable about the area.We stayed at the best Western over Thanksgiving 2014 for two nights. The staff was incredibly helpful and went out of their way to make us feel at home. The rooms are clean and well kept. I would definitely return to this one and get an upper room with a beautiful view of the red rocks. My only downside is that the breakfast was heralded as being excellent, but it was the typical scrambled eggs in a large pan with sausage, etc. It was what you might expect of a free, all you can eat breakfast, if you like that kind of volume.Great value for your money! Clean rooms with much space! Superfriendly staff that will help you with anything! And there is a free shuttle service every half hour!If I ever would come back to Sedona, I will certainly stay here again! Nice place with nice view :-)Beautiful rooms, great service,  great for the price. The only complaint is that the breakfast wasn't as good as the other best western.  The manager there made up for it tho! Highly recommend!The service is great.  The breakfast is free and reasonable.  Safe environment with nice hotel crew :)I recommend this hotel to anyone with a family as well.Greetings, I need the help of anyone who might have stayed at this hotel after March 18th. My mother came to visit March 11-March 18 and stayed at this hotel in room 223. While here she lost two very important items and I'm hoping someone can help me find them. I know this is a long shot but she's heartbroken and I have to at least try and track them down. I'm attaching pictures here. (They aren't great pictures but they're what I have) The earrings are silver looking with a little gold horse head in the center -- they were her mother's. The ring is a basic gold band that was her father's wedding ring. My whole life my mom has worn these things and they mean everything to her. If you see these/have them/know someone who has them please please please contact me. I've been to Twice as Nice and Goodwill with no luck. I'll pay to get them back for her if given the opportunity. Thank you so much.Beware when booking here and you have a change of plans.  Unless you die, or maybe not even then will you be refunded for a stay you previously booked. Even though I called and canceled the reservation, they said I didn't.  Shame on me for not writting down the name of the person I spoke to when I canceled, which was days before the arrival date.  They will not even budge one bit.  We were charged the whole fare plus taxes for a room we did not use...  Being a Best Westen member, I thought they might take that into consideration, but did not.  Oh well I guess they need the money.Hope in reservations is an Angel. Haven't met her yet. Just really appreciate the service and help with making and adjusting my reservations due to an injury. It's the human factor that makes such a difference in how you feel about a place.What can I say but WOW! I never expect perfection but this was as close as it gets! We were able to bring our older dog with us, the room was super clean & smelled fresh, the service was second to none (incredibly friendly, helpful staff), and the views are amazing. This place doesn't have the regular "hotel" feel because of how the rooms are located on the hills, which greatly pleased us. The front desk and concierge staff were so helpful & even provided us with a list of pet-friendly restaurants in the area. Plus they give a small container of doggie poo bags to guests with pets. Oh and the breakfast! I've never seen a breakfast spread like this for free. Scrambled eggs, sausage, biscuits & gravy, pancakes, fresh cut fruit, 2 flavors of yogurt, granola, oatmeal w/fixins, whole bananas, muffins, toast, coffee, tea, and a selection of juices. We actually looked forward to our breakfast every morning! We didnt use the pool but it wasn't real big. We did use the exercise room & it was small but adequate. No complaints.Will definitely be back again. Thanks!5 minutes from Uptown. Somewhat centrally located, decent room, crazy wild shower head. The view is nice if you're on the right side of the hotel. The AC was extremely loud compared to some other hotels we were at, but we slept well.The first time I came here was with my  then fiance (now husband) 2 years ago when we randomly stayed at this best western. Here's how it went down. We arrive at beautiful Sedona on an insanely hot afternoon and started browsing the shops and restaurants for a place to eat. We randomly met this time share representative that offered us a free stay at the best western if we participate in this time share thing. We said yes of course and later on that night went up to our room, which had GORGEOUS views of the red mountains, and I mean GORGEOUS. I really didn't expect to get much from Best Western, let alone a free room at BW, but I was pleasantly shocked. The room also came with breakfast that was bland, but at least it came with a breakfast. This BW is easily one of the nicest I've seen, an the views....oh the beautiful views!Service here was five star. You will not find better. Rooms smaller than the pictures indicate but nice and clean. Beds and pillows very comfortable and clean. Deck is shared so privacy is limited by other guests and their noise level. No lounge chairs on the deck makes no sense to us. Pool and whirl pool awesome as the do not use chlorine rather a natural cleaning process. First day was not fun as little kids ruined the beautiful view from the hot tub. Second day was perfect as no kids anywhere. Breakfast is one of the best settings and food for a free breakfast. Example was both pork and healthier turkey sausages. Across the street on level two is a path to a Catholic Church. It is a three minute walk. If Catholic you must go. If not go to see the beauty of the grounds. You are a mile from midtown and for 99% of people the hill is too steep to walk. This place is set off from the crowded tourist areas. We would stay here again. Great value for what we paid. Enjoy.
review_content_40: I stayed here with my husband and another couple in June.  At first I was concerned that it was not in the center of town, but it actually worked out much better than I expected! The lobby was pleasant and very clean and modern.  The room (with two queen beds) was comfortable.  All the rooms we saw open onto very large communal terraces.  The terraces have tables, chairs, and a spectacular view of the red rock mountains/formations surrounding Sedona.  Because the hotel is a little higher elevation than the surrounding area, our view was unobstructed.  It was absolutely beautiful especially at sunrise and sunset.The room was large enough for 4 adults to share (and we, as a couple, typically don't share a room, so that means a lot!).  The bathroom was partitioned into two sections, so one person could use the sink area and hair dryer while someone else was using the shower/toilet area.  It worked really well.  The sink and vanity area were very large. The room had lots of outlets, which was important, because we travel with too many laptops, iphones, etc... We decided to use the hot tub after dinner.  They said it closed at 10, but the nice security guard said we could stay until 11pm.  It was HOT and the pool was quite cold!  It was very nice. In the morning, we headed to the included breakfast.  It was way more than we expected for a 'continental breakfast'.  My husband had cereal, muffins, and coffee.  I had a delicious fresh-made waffle and fruit. There was a very nice gentleman restocking everything and cleaning up.  He made sure we had everything we needed. I was very pleasantly surprised with the breakfast.  We went for a morning swim after breakfast.  The breakfast area is located directly next to the pool.  We were impressed with this hotel.  It was $129 for the four of us.  I'd definitely stay here again.The views are stellar and the included breakfast is complete. The room was a little dated, but comfortable, quiet, and clean. We would stay here again without looking elsewhere.I stayed here with my wife while we were on vacation in Sedona.  The hotel has great views of the scenery.  The rooms have a lout A/C unit and this should be retrofitted with more modern cooling systems when it comes time to remodel the place.  The included breakfast was pretty decent and varied each of the days that we stayed at this place.  The hotel staff were always nice and did their best to make us comfortable.Beautiful, beautiful, beautiful. From the moment we stepped into the lobby everything was perfect.Everything was spotless, worked perfectly and comfortable.All staff had a glowing attitude the entire time.It was not in the center of town which was good for us since we just wanted a night to relax and get away.We will definitely be back in the near future.Notes:-- Wi-Fi free (and no password needed)-- Coffee is 24/7 in the lobby-- Breakfast is 7a-10a. Slightly better than typical continental breakfast.-- The concierge recommends going up Airport Rd for sunsets. I do not recommend this as it is PACKED, the road is narrow and windy and sometimes people walk up it. If you do, someone is there to nudge you to donate money for the view.-- The center of town shuts down early. It was Saturday night at 7pm and we had a hard time finding something reasonable to eat.-- They offer a shuttle within 5 miles for free until 10pm (use this for the sunset view up above)-- Parking is freeI went here with my family on a trip to see the Grand Canyon, Vermilion Cliffs, Antelope Canyon, and (of course) Sedona. We definitely chose the right place for good views, because this place had absolutely wonderful views! You could see all around you on the humongous shared patio, or just from a window. This is defiantly the place to go if you want to get a good view. The rooms are clean, and pretty spacious. The bathrooms are clean, and medium sized. Breakfast is free, with eggs, toast, coffee, sausages, potatoes, and a neat automatic pancake machine. There is a small gym with a TV in case you want to workout, and a nice lobby with a fire you can throw pine cones and cinnamon sticks in, plus computers with WiFi you can use for free. There is a free shuttle that will take you to downtown, too. If we come to Sedona again, we will defiantly come here!We stopped here on the way from NorCal to Louisiana. I honestly have not one bad thing to say! This hotel was amazing. We booked it while having lunch at a restaurant by the Hyatt, thinking it was the hotel right in Uptown as you come into town on the main strip. This one is about 2 miles down and around.  We were upset until we realized how amazing the hotel was.  It feels like you're in a remote location.  They gave us a very generous military discount ($125) as compared to other hotels in the area that seemed to run $250+.  Our room was very clean, updated and modern...comfy bed, clean carpets, nice window treatments, and a roomy bathroom with a huge granite countertop.  They offer a free shuttle service to anywhere you want to go.  The driver was super nice! It runs every 30 minutes until 10pm.  They are pet friendly and provided us with a list of restaurants that are also pet friendly.  They had the crib set up in our room prior to arrival. Free and fast wifi. The views are incredible. You may not have a view from your room but they have 5 terraces that are spectacular (and pet friendly). Their free breakfast was the best I've ever seen. They had everything from eggs, sausage, seasoned potatoes to pancakes, waffles, cereal, fresh fruit, oatmeal, etc. Coffee was good and had a machine with flavored creamers (it's the simple things right?)  They had indoor/outdoor seating.  The staff was impeccable. Tom thanks for everything!  I cannot wait to come back to Sedona and stay with y'all again!!!When you think Best Western, you usually don't think of the best location in town. This one is the exception. Views are magnificent and just a short drive from the hot spots without being in the congested main area. Rooms were clean and well appointed. Some minor snags: our phone didn't work and neither did the remote, and there didn't seem to be much interest from the Front Desk in fixing either problem.Free breakfast, but go early. It's a mob scene. Go early.Pool is small with an adjoining hot tub. Small exercise room (no views).There's a nice mall with a couple restaurants and a great food store right behind the hotel.We paid $200 for a night in March with tax.When I go to culturally cool places like Sedona, I will normally pick a local hotel over a chain for a more immersive experience. However, we read the great reviews for this Best Western and decided to try it out. I'm so glad we did! I really did love it! The hotel is set into a hill and designed to blend unobtrusively into the locale - which is totally appropriate for any building in a town where the landscape is the star attraction. The service was excellent, the staff was friendly and the room was spacious and nice. On top of that, the complimentary breakfast each morning was excellent! I'd definitely go back.Great family hotel! It is what one expects from a Best Western. It was clean,comfortable and the views were great! I miss sitting on the patio. The breakfast was wonderful and my son loved the sausages. we had a few issues such as the fridge not working. I mentioned it to the front desk, went out to dinner and their was a new working fridge upon our return-very happy with how fast they corrected the problem. Only complaint I have but would still return is the very little shade at the pool a few umbrellas would be nice but maybe due to the wind it might not be safe.  We stayed 5 nights and had a wonderful stay!Stayed last weekend with three kids. Amazing, amazing views. Incredible nice staff and spotless rooms.Was very glad I found this place on the Internet. Breakfast was not a gourmet but hey, who cares? It came with the room and offered a nice selection of eggs, pancakes, cereal etc. Started early and got a bit over crowded by 8:00am, still a great value for families. Everyone likes to get an early start this time of the year because of the weather anyways.Pool was a bit small but I would definitely stay again! Did I mention the gorgeous views?Lovely views. Helpful, friendly staff. Rooms are OK - nothing special. My favorite part of staying here is that one can hike or run on the trails in the Cocochina National Forest after a day at work. And, of course, Sedona is magical.Awesome views of the red rocks from your room (and the terrace in front of your room).The beds are very comfy.  The rooms are decorated well with some nice mounted photos of local scenery.  The wi-fi is easy to hook into.Only minus would be the room's individual cooling/heating unit - pretty noisy.We enjoyed our 2 night stay here during a March trip through the area. It was good to be a bit away from the busy-ness of Sedona (which is far more touristy than I had imagined). This hotel has fantastic views Friendly enough staff with a helpufl concierge to answer questions about hikes and local places. Basic hotel breakfast in a crowded room. Decent pool and jacuzzi which we all enjoyed. Good place to stay in Sedona.Beautiful views. Breakfast was fine, parking is good, and the location is excellent.The people who work there are very nice, but in all honesty, we had the following issues:The air conditioner in our room was so loud that we were awakened every time it kicked on. Unfortunately, it was too hot outside to leave it turned off. The curtains do not close tightly against the wall and anyone passing by can see into the room if your lights are on at night.The hot tub was lukewarm at best.The toilet would not flush and my husband ended up repairing it rather than asking for help since we were all ready to go to bed.Though the view was amazing and the staff is great, next time we will stay somewhere where we can actually sleep through the night.I was at this hotel in July 2014 with a large group of family and friends (13 people) and occupied 4 adjoining rooms on the second floor. From check in to check out, we had a fabulous experience. We arrived rather late, and we were very surprised that our rooms were held on the same floor and together. The front desk clerk was VERY accommodating and nice, we went later to ask for wine glasses and he offered us a complimentary bottle. The fact that there's no elevator didn't matter at all, because the way the hotel is situated down a slope, each level was accessible from the street, we got a luggage cart from the lobby and we were fine. The best part was that both nights we were there, we stayed out (late) on the very spacious balcony talking, listening to music and having drinks, and NOT ONCE did anyone come out to complain! Oh, and in the morning we woke up to a magnificent view! I never made it to the included breakfast, but the ones in our party who did, said it was just OK. I would definitely return to this very well run property!In planning our trip to Sedona, I definitely looked at all the hotels and helped narrow it down by a review...the breakfast is what enticed me along with the views.  Nothing disappointed.  The views were wonderful, the breakfast was great and surprised us and the room and staff was wonderful.  I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone!Extremely clean and well kept. Staff was  very friendly. Our room had a gorgeous view of the red rock and we really enjoyed the patio. Bed and pillows were pretty comfy and the room was nice. I would have given 5 stars but the complimentary breakfast wasn't good. Eggs were cold. Coffee was burnt. Not a good last impression....Stayed in a pet friendly room after having a not successful check in at Sedonal Real. The facility was very accomodating and let us view the room prior to choosing to stay. Continental breakfast was ok. Staff was wonderful! I would def recommend this place!This BW is outside of the touristy part of Sedona.  It is cheaper than the BW in that part of Sedona and more than makes up for its location with the views.  These are easily some of the best views in Sedona.  One can sit on the porch outside the room for hours.  The rooms are clean with good beds. The staff is always friendly.  The breakfast has a wide variety of foods from waffels to cold cereal.  I last stayed here in January 2010 and liked it enough to stay again last night.  One of the reasons I booked it again was they were offering a $99 a night special that included $100 gift certificates at Tlaquapue. Turns out those were actually things like '10% off when you spend $50 or more' at certain stores.  So not so great.   Didn't matter that much to me as I don't care for Tlaquapue.  Will definitely stay at this BW again.Perhaps it's because this place holds a special place in my heart...but I really loved our stay. We were crazy and drove up on my her motorcycle.  When we pulled up they were not only accommodating, but they also gave us a little gift bag type deal with a compass and some other little niceties.  The room was nice and the bed was comfy.  The views were beautiful and their complimentary breakfast was amazing!  It's not your typical continental deal with some apples and cereal, although those were available, too.  They had two waffle irons hot and ready for me to come make a tasty breakfast delight.  They had regular batter or blueberry.  I just like my waffle plain,so I poured it in and let it do its magic, all while I looked out at the beautiful red rocks of Sedona.  There was juice, yogurt, bagels and toast, coffee and milk, as well.  I always look to Best Western first when planning a trip because of the great first experience I had with them.
review_content_60: A decent breakfast, and wifi, but a cockroach and bed bug in the room.  Need I say more?I have mixed feelings about this hotel.  Staff was amazing.  Extremely friendly.  Rooms were very small.  We were traveling with a dog and when we checked into our room it wreaked of chemicals.  The rooms here use the old heating and air conditioning units that are very loud.  Bathroom toiletries were nice.  The hotel itself looks nice from the outside and they do have nice terraces on the second floor for viewing.  Our dog was too old to get up the stairs so we just opened our room door (partly to clear out the chemical smell) and enjoyed the view.  We did not have as nice of a view on the dog friendly side of the hotel but, I don't think you can find a bad view in Sedona.  Breakfast was atrocious.  Food was mediocre but, the horrible part was the extremely small space to get your food amongst the crowds of people.  We ate outside and it was rather cold.  On a good note, the very friendly staff gave me a list of dog friendly eateries in town and let me know that you can order room service from the Mesa grill.  We took advantage of Mesa Grill room service and all I can say is definitely order if you are tired!  They are expensive but, worth it.  They bring everything just as if you were getting room service at a nice hotel and the food was fabulous!  I highly recommend the mango mousse cake!Great place! I have paid more money to stay at hotels that miss the mark - The Best Western Sedona is clean, has well appointed rooms, friendly staff, free breakfast and fantastic views. Someone else mentioned a noisy air conditioner in their  room - mine made a little noise as well - no problem however - I paid three times as much for a room at a Sedona resort hotel with the same problem - I highly recommend this hotel and I will stay here again the next time I am in town.Really liked this place. Would definitely stay here again. Love that they are pet friendly! The room they gave us was super good for dogs, there was even a pretty trail to walk the dogs on just up the road. The hotel room was clean and comfortable and it was very convenient to have coffee and breakfast at the hotel in the morning. Nice pool area and it was super nice to be able to walk to the upper level of the hotel and watch the sunset. Super pretty views when walking around the parking lot and love that it is walking distance to New Frontiers market, the best grocery store ever. Checking in and out was super easy and everyone was nice.I don't know what Walt's talking about.  I thought this was the best value in town.  Then again, I booked on the Best Western website and pre-paid to get one of the cheapest rates available.  I think we paid around  $130 a night for a terrace room with an awesome view.I believe all of the rooms at this hotel are terraced, which means you have an awesome, panoramic view of the red rock mountains, which is why 99.9% of people go to Sedona in the first place.The room itself was spacious, with two queen beds and a very modern, clean bathroom.  The only thing that was lacking was storage space.  There was this one small closet tucked into the corner of the room and a small bureau that was just big enough to hold the about 37" TV.  Otherwise, there was a table/desk that was big enough to hold a laptop and a couple sheets of paper side-by-side.  There was definitely room for larger pieces of furniture.We had good service from the employees.  My favorite employee was the guy who worked the breakfast room on the weekend.  Yes, you get free breakfast with your stay.  They say it's continental, but I'd call it continental plus.  In addition to the fresh-made pastries and bagels and bread, along with jelly and peanut butter and butter and syrup, there were hard boiled eggs and whole fresh fruit.  They were a bit lacking on the fresh fruit side, but I'd give that up to the location more than anything else.  I'm not sure where you'd grow produce in the desert.  The best part, though, were the make-your-own waffles!  It was just like being back in the dorms!  They had two industrial waffle irons and the batter was ready made for your pouring pleasure.  The weekend we were there, the guy said he felt like being crazy and threw some blueberries into the batter.  YUM.  Blueberry belgian waffles are so good.As for the guy himself, he gives great advice on places to eat in the area.  I asked him where the locals go for good cheap eats and had a lot to say.  And he was very nice to boot.This hotel is about a mile away from the "center" of town, but I didn't mind at all.  We had a car so we drove the 3 minutes (literally) into town without a problem.  Also, the hotel is across the street from the turn off to the airport in the sky - which also has a great view.  We saw the other Best Western that Walt was talking about and it just didn't seem to have the same relaxed ambience and awesome view that ours did.  Plus, it's a whole lot more expensive.  I would definitely stay at the Best Western Inn of Sedona every time I'm in town.  And I do want to go back as soon as I can afford it!A perfect honeymoon Inn - and we were not on our honeymoon. Stayed in the #300 rooms (top level) with wonderful view of the sedona red rocks. Wonderful with cool clear evenings. Amenities were very nice including the morning breakfast.This is one of the finer BW Inns we have stayed at in the USA. Nice nice, nice. Friendly staff too.I am bummed. Everything "looks" nice but nothing worked. The info says it has been recently remodeled. It has a beautiful view from every room and balconies accessible as well. BUT the shower was a bullet of water that was pathetic. It was so bad that we didn't use it the second morning because it is too much trouble to deal with. The A/C was horrible. The free "deluxe" breakfast was disappointing also. Nothing hot. No meats. All cold items with the exception of a waffle maker. And there are bugs. Crawling ones and flying ones- in the room.  Do not stay in room 109. Asked to be moved but.....no go. And they had vacancies. So I said my review would reflect the poor treatment. They didn't seem to care.A 3 star hotel at a 4 star price. I stayed there in August for just one night. We were able to get a nice "mountain" facing room with a large common terrace. Nothing fancy at all. But for almost $200 after everything was said and done, I expected a little more. Location Location Location. Blah. Stay at the other Best Western in the east part of town.
