From that one you can walk the shops and whatnot.I don't know what hotel these other people stayed at but this hotel is by far one of the worst I've ever stayed at. When we went to check in the lady at the front desk said that the computers were down and we couldn't check in. She suggested that we take the shuttle in to town and come back a little bit later to check in. She gave me a card so I could call them to send the shuttle. It runs every hour on the half hour. We went into town and looked around, it was 2:15P and we decided to call the shuttle to pick us up at 3:00P. We went to have a sandwich and called the front desk to ask them to send the shuttle at 3:30PM instead. Whomever answered the phone started to argue with me and said he would send the shuttle at 3:10PM, I explained to him that he could send it whenever he wanted but, we would not be ready until 3:30P. We went to the pick up spot at 3:20P and started to wait. At 3:45P I called to find out if the shuttle had been dispatched yet. The lady that answered said she would send it right away.The hotel is three minutes from the pick up spot (I timed it on the shuttles clock), and this guy picked us up at 3:55P. I went to check in and when the lady at the front desk was finished with her personal phone call, I complained to her about the shuttle. She said she was very sorry. We went to our room (Number 136), at the furthest west side of the hotel, in the very back.The people above were moving the patio furniture around and we could hear it in the room, as well as there conversations. I went back to the front desk and asked to be moved, as you guessed, no rooms available but, she could absolutely do something tomorrow, the day after Memorial Day. She told me that I should come in the morning turn in the key and talk whoever was at the front desk, she'd leave a note for them. I did as she asked and the guy said "sorry" because I had booked through Expedia there was nothing he could do, first floor rooms are reserved for third party bookings and there was nothing he could do. The hotel had been emptied. There were only two other couples on our side of the hotel. Yet, Best Western employees could (or would) do nothing to move us to a room with a nicer view than the vending machines. I understand your policy but, if you have the rooms available and no one was in them, what would it have hurt? You might have gotten a completly different review saying how great you were but, I have to say this Best Western is severely lacking in customer service, and their free breakfast make a school cafeteria look good. If I could give minus stars, I would.Stayed one night, and wish I had stayed two. Great convenient location. You could walk to a store or a couple of restaurants, or take a really short drive wherever you wanted to go. Check in was about two minutes, and checking out was even faster. Kids enjoyed the pool, and they are pet-friendly (the hotel not the pool). There is also a gym if you want one. Rooms are neat, clean and decent size for a hotel, with a separate door for the powder room and bathroom, which is nice so you can use the sink while someone is taking a shower. Get a free breakfast in the morning too. I enjoyed having morning coffee out on the terrace outside our room. I would stay there again for sure.This is a great hotel!  The staff are ultra friendly (and most we've met love dogs), the rooms have fabulous views, and you also aren't in the middle of downtown, which lets you enjoy those views without all the hustle going on around you.  If you want to be in the center of it all, this will undoubtedly disappoint, but aren't most folks here for the scenery?The breakfast is toast, waffles, some fruit, cereal, instant oatmeal, yogurt, breads, bagels, hard-boiled eggs, juice, milk, and coffee (sorry if I missed something).And the price is certainly comparable to other places in Sedona.  For the room, views, and service, it seems about right.We loved this hotel!! - Amazing views!!!! - A decent price. - Very large rooms - Very clean!! (I always travel with my own sheets and pillows..and i didn't even feel like i needed them here) - Love the closed off powder room, separate from the bathroom and bedroom - Pet friendly - great continental breakfast - and the guy making all the food in the morning was incredibly friendly! If we travel to Sedona again.. we will definitely be staying here.

review_content: This place was a very pleasant surprise! My girlfriend and I took a last minute road trip to Sedona from Vegas and booked our room on a weeknight for way less than their neighbors were asking for at last minute prices. We were welcomed by a pair of sweet as pie little ladies at the front desk and then directed over to the concierge desk to meet Debra, who is way too good of a host to be in a small town! Nevertheless, she was awesome! She knew every restaurant in town and helped us pick which one to go to for a "fabulous dinner" (as she put it and was right) she also suggested we take a drive up one road for a perfect view of the stars which my little lady just loved! (Ask Deb which road) Aside from the service being great the room was also superb! Granted this isn't the Hyatt suites but you will get more than you expect with this place. We will definitely be going back again for sure and can't wait to see Debra when we get back that way again!PS They will try to sell you on some kind of repeat client program. I didn't go for it even though it does seem like a pretty cool deal. But even though I declined I still received excellent service.BEWARE- THIS PLACE TURNS AWAY ACTIVE DUTY MILITARY OFFICERS AND FAMILIES WITH PAID AND CONFIRMED RESERVATIONS. Diamond resorts international sold us a 3 night stay with a timeshare tour at the Bell Rock Inn, Sedona, AZ just about a month ago. I explained to the person I spoke with that we weren't planning to see Sedona again anytime soon, unless they happened to have a room this December 26 so we could stay there on our way to Santa Fe and Colorado. They did!  Yay!  Upon arriving at our resort after a 12 hour drive, we were told by Sheila at the front desk that we had no reservation at that hotel. Ever. I produced my bank statement showing the charge, one paper confirmation letter and one email, all from diamond resorts international. The manager, Seth Gibson was called, and after a very long time searching the computer, he offered to rent us a room for the regular rate of $286 a night plus resort fees and taxes. We refused to pay and said we will just sleep in the lobby. Set up camp. Watched while three other couples checked in behind us. Manager called back and offered us a room for the rack rate of $98 a night but only for two nights, not the three we paid for.  NO THANK YOU. The lobby works for us. Just as the kids finally wound down to sleep on the lobby couch and floor, the manager called the police on us for trespassing. That obviously didn't work, since we had a confirmation letter in hand. We explained what had happened. The officer called Seth Gibson back twice to talk him into finding us a room at another property for at least the night. The manager refused, so we were forced to wake our kids at 1:00 am and drive 2.5 hours in 18 degree ice and snow weather on a very windy mountain road, which had our 9 year old terrified and bawling her eyes out in the back seat until 3 am about how were all going to die. We didn't die. We made it the next nearest motel with a room. Found one in Holbrook, paid for a night, passed out at 3:30 am. We just left to see what we can do at this point about the rest of our 9 day trip. DO NOT BOOK at this resort or with any diamond international resorts/hotels. They will call the police and kick out an Army family on Christmas break with paid and confirmed reservations, even in the middle of a snowy night on a long mountain road with two young children scared, tired and crying.Yesterday my friend drove 12 hours with her family, including two children to Sedona. She had a confirmed reservation at Bell Rock Inn for 3 nights, the charge had already been made on her credit card. When she arrived at midnight after a day of driving, she was told there was no record of her reservation. She was able to present the staff with her email confirmation and proof of credit card charges. SETH the manager, (who was on the phone with the staff at the desk & not present) said her only option was to pay twice as much for the last remaining room she was already charged for. While this was happening, they checked another guest into the last room. It was 18 degrees outside and all other hotels in the area were completely sold out.My friend & her MILITARY family sat in the lobby trying to figure out what to do, and the staff CALLED THE POLICE on them. They were kicked out into the 18 degree night at 1am with nowhere to go. They had to drive another 2 hours on icy roads at 1am to the only hotel they could find with a vacancy. This is absolutely unacceptable and I hope anyone reading this chooses to stay elsewhere.SEE PHOTOS FOR PROOF OF RESERVATION AND HER ACCOUNT OF WHAT HAPPENEDI want of the people that came here to stay for just a day or two instead of a week and I will tell you this as long as the rates hold to be reasonable I will be back for an entire week,  because there's a certain peace to Sedona, and it's felt here as well.  It's south of the hustle and bustle of the touristy areas, and that's just fine with me.  Opening my curtains to see Bell Rock RIGHT THERE...  Yeah. I'll be back.I found a deal on groupon and since camping would have costed the same (i know right?!) we decided to stay warm. After checking in, I kind of changed my mind and was mad that I didn't camp. Check in took 10 mins but after that we were told to go to concierge. We drove for 8 hours and we were exhausted, even after mentioning that we are very tired, the lady managed to keep us there for something that felt like a lifetime to tell us about the sales and promos and places.... If you want to interest people, you need to know that it won't happen when they are tired. Very clingy! The next morning we went in to get an address, a new girl was at concierge helping a family PRINTING OUT A COUPON FOR 1 HOUR! I mean, you can lift you head and say, be right with you, but she kept calling people asking them how to get the printer to work from 9am to 10. We just walked out... Waste of time, this place.After a delightful trip to Flagstaff, my wife and I spent a night here in Sedona as a detour on our way back into the inferno of Phoenix in July.I booked through Priceline's Name Your Own Price. It was a good value, considering the spacious room and fairly well-kept property. Overall, it all fell a little bit short of my expectations for a three-star hotel (in particular, the service felt strained and less than professional). The front desk staff and housecleaning staff went above and beyond when my wife forgot a couple items in our room the morning we left. But no serious complaints about our room or the hotel itself.My one and only serious complaint has to do with the "concierge". Immediately after checking in, we were given a raffle ticket (a little odd in itself) and sent to the concierge desk behind us. There, we were immediately greeted by a slightly-too-friendly man who first tried to push an Italian restaurant on us (to the extent that we wondered whether he got commissions from the restaurant), then tried to sell us a "4-nights-for-the-price-of-3 exclusive offer" for the hotel chain. When I said no, he replied, "May I ask why not?"Not only did this all feel sleazy and unbecoming of a resort hotel (the kind of establishment that, in my experience, doesn't try to sell you extra stuff - you've already paid for it, and their job is simply to provide you the best experience possible with no expectations than that you'll have a great experience and want to come back). I'd go so far as to characterize it as a breach of trust. Like a tour guide, a waiter, or a sommelier, a concierge is not a salesman. He (or she) is a professional who is paid to put your interests first and guide your through unfamiliar territory toward those things that, in their well-informed judgement, will give you the best experience possible. This is an important and honorable role, and one the name of which the Red Rock Inn's man showed himself entirely unworthy.Despite the hotel's good qualities, I cannot recommend that anyone patronize an establishment that does business this way.We stayed for two nights for a weekend getaway. Overall we had a great experience. The hotel was in a great location and we loved the room amenities lik e the kitchen.My two biggest complaints were the bed and the shower. The mattress was very uncomfortable. I couldn't find a good spot to sleep and woke up on incredible passion both mornings. The short was the worst! The shower head had such small openings that it felt like the streams were etching your skin.Overall it was a great experience. I would stay again, I would even take the kids because of the pullout couch.****If you got trick into staying here for a 90-120 minutes timeshare presentation and have a 3 nights stay at a good deal, read on. You will thank me for it*****Location: The hotel is very close to a main road. You can hear traffic noises depending on which building you stay in. It was extremely difficult to pull out from their driveway going to uptown Sedona since the traffic is heavy in that area. Service: front desk was very friendly. I specifically requested to look at the room before I checked in due to so many negative reviews that I saw via yelp. They were very corporative and did not give me a hard time about my odd request. This review isn't based on the service of the hotel staffs at all (keep reading.....)Hotel room: we stayed at a remodeled studio at building D. I guess since we are here for a timeshare presentation, they put us up in one of their "nice room". The room is decent and clean except the hallway does have a strong smell of cleaning materials (just like what other yelpers said - and I should have listened). The wall was so thin. I got woken up 1:30 am in the morning because I could hear someone above me moving chairs and walking around in their own room for 20 minutes straight. They also didn't install padding on the door. It slams shut whenever people go in and out of their rooms. It is super loud. Even when someone leaves their room 7 rooms down from us, I still could hear it. Timeshare presentation: 90-120 minutes? Dream on. They made us sat there for 3 hours. By the time I walked out, I was completely drained, hungry and upset. They started out by assigning u to a person who did the presentation. Nice lady. Her manager, co owner of the timeshare program, came by once in a while trying to up sell it even more. These 10 years contract is approx $23k at 18% interest rate (WHAT!). When you finally said no to both of them, the third person showed up from "the corporate" asking you to purchase a $3000 package with no contract. Basically, they keep lowering and sweetening the deal until you breakdown and buy something. Rating: the reason I didn't purchase it is because (1) if Bell Rock Inn is one of their nicest timeshare hotels? God I am scared to see the rest of them on the list. (2) their interest rate is ridiculously high. (3) they didn't stick with their commitment of 120 minutes max and made us sat there until I was sick of it. I never like high pressure sales. If they would have given me more time to think about it, I might probably would have re-considered it since I do travel quite a bit. (4) I am in a committed relationship with my partner and they demand to see documentations to proof that we are a committed couple including driver license or marriage certificate when we finalized our reservation with the hotel over the phone (last minute request by the way) - which was completely invasion of personal privacy. We were scheduled to stay there for 3 nights and end up checking out on the 2nd night. If you prefer 4-5 stars hotel stays like I do, don't come here. You will regret it like I did. Staying here + the presentation ruins my weekend up in Sedona and leave a bad taste in my mouth.Our experience began when we were assaulted at check in with creepy calls of "Welcome Home" from 5 or 6 staff members. Check in seemed to take quite a while, but the desk clerk was very polite. He then sent us over to the concierge, who was pushy beyond belief about viewing their time share program. We paid for our rooms and didn't feel we should have been subjected to this. She just wouldn't let us go to our room! After finally mak8ng it out of the office we voqed not to head back in. The room was dated, but clean. The ceiling was patched in several spots and the curtain valance had some brownish water stains on it (I have photos I will post.) Just much more aged than I expected. Disappointing.So far worst experience.They called my room 3 times ON THE HOTEL PHONE at 9am. I was sleeping and the phone woke me up. I was pissed as I didn't ask for a wake up call, nonetheless 3 calls! I finally picked the phone up the 3rd time thinking it was urgent. When I answered, some weird ass middle eastern sounding song was playing, as if I was on hold to India. I said Hello a few times and no one answered. Pissed me off more.I unhooked the phone so they don't keep calling pointlessly with Indian music. So now if there's a real emergency, they won't even be calling me. That's fucking annoying to know. But I'm not going to deal with being woken up every morning with calls upon calls upon calls, until I answer the damn thing!(Update at 1:30pm: Didn't notice there were two phones in the room. The phone just rang over and over and over again. So whatever the purpose of these calls are it wasn't for a wake up call. What the Fuck!? Now both phones are unplugged. Very very annoying!)This "resort" is a joke!Walls are paper thin. Next door neighbors bathtub and bathroom fan sounds like you're on the battle front. You can hear when people walk up the stairs. It sounded like a pack of rhino was running up the stairs and through the hallway.When someone walks in the hallway or up the stairs, the entire room shakes. No joke. I'm surprised this place is still standing.The heat doesn't go very high and it gets cold in here. Also: The fireplace isn't a fireplace. Its not even a heater. I had it on for more than an hour and it didn't get hot once. Not even lukewarm. Not even cold. Nothing came from it.(update: the heater doesnt even work at all. Cheap place doesnt update anything.)The tv doesn't turn much so you have to creak your neck weird. Its designed to watch tv at the kitchen table. In a studio unit, this does not make sense.There was a weird stain on the bed like someone got murdered here.I constantly hear someone trying to open my door too. I don't feel safe here. This happened late last night too, so it wasn't housekeeping. This room is really dusty too. Woke up with crazy allergies. This only happens when it is really dusty in a room. I haven't had issues with Sedona/VOC with allergies. So it's the room. The only thing nice is there is a full kitchen. But I'd rather choose a hotel with a small fridge and better quality.This place isn't worth it. So far, nothing but issues. The phone issue is what pissed me off most. Who does that!? I didn't tell them to give me a wake-up call and they gave me THREE wake-up calls, one right after the other. Fucking assholes. I'm thinking they did it because I wouldn't stay to talk more about the timeshare last night. Shady! Do you really want to stay in a place where they don't respect the guests and get revenge on you?We were early and checked in pretty quickly. Everyone is right, stay away from the concierge desk... Holy cow! Talk about being bombarded. I think they need to change that. It's good to have good customer service, but not good to be pushy, anyways. Our room was great! Tons of room and love that they have a kitchenette, great stay for a long get away, the only downfall of the room was the bed, it wasn't comfortable at all. The WiFi was sometimes slow, but that's normal usually with everyone using it. I think I would definitely stay here again maybe even with a more updated suite! But you can't beat the price!Very nice place, reserved a studio and was expecting a small room..... studio. We got a very large room, way more than we were expecting and paid for. Our room looks out upon Bell Rock, well through the parking lot and over the next building.  Room seems very clean, and after reading the other reviewers I had doubts. I wonder if they were really here.Pretty tacky place. We had terrible picture in the room and asked them to replace. Of course, they never did.I'm torn about this review. I hate to give any outfit with decent rooms and good prices one star, but I will never stay here again, and can't justify a higher rating based on one serious issue.   I knew this was a timeshare before I arrived, so made sure to avoid the "concierge", whose function is to try to sell you a unit.    The room itself (studio) was more than large enough, had a two-burner stove, microwave, full-size fridge, dishwasher, built-in granite dining table, king-size bed, large (if awkwardly placed) TV, decent seating area, and a little patio. Rustic 50's "cowboy" decor, but tastefully done, and on the first night, I was thoroughly pleased with myself for finding such a decent place at such a great price (for the Sedona area).   Then I got up the next morning, went to take a shower, and found a large live centipede cruising around the bottom of the bathtub! Now, I know I have a major bug phobia, but to have this first thing in the morning was super jarring!    I washed my new pal down the drain, took my shower, and headed out to the living room ...  where I found a TWO INCH LONG COCKROACH on his back, waving his legs in the air and twitching his feelers! Totally gross. Covered him with paper towels, stomped him, wiped up the carnage, and continued on.   Then the next morning, there was ANOTHER TWO INCH LONG COCKROACH on the kitchen floor! I called the front desk, and was told "... I can send somebody out from engineering. They won't spray or anything, but they can talk to you about it..." As I said to him then, "What would be the point of that"?   One bug is a nasty anomaly. Three of them in two days (especially when two are giant cockroaches) is flat-out disgusting! Would strongly recommend against this place for this reason alone.Stayed here for a quick getaway. Front desk was very nice and helpful.Concierge was so rude. I wrote management and I still dont feel I was taken seriously. Concierge was so upset I wanted to just enjoy my time and not take his resort tour. Room was fairly clean bathroom was not cleaned very well. Room did have a great view!Adding to my previous review: Well D'oh- there is a grocery store (Webers) near Bell Rock Inn- walking distance, even.On my most recent visit, I stayed in a studio in the building parallel to 89A, in a rear unit facing the pool. It was configured very well and perfect for one person. Although I missed the full kitchen, the two burner stove top and microwave served me fine. Decor in the studio was more "Western" than in the 2 story one bed. I imagine facing the pool would not be ideal in the summer, but in winter/spring months, it was not noisy.We liked the Bell Rock Inn -- cute room with "fireplace" and a nice little kitchen. Very clean and the bed was super comfy. Nice to have a king size and a queen size pullout for the kiddos, too. Hot tub and pool were very nice and the staff was great. Yes, you get a sales presentation but it was low key and not hideously pushy like most. Would definitely stay here again -- great location right by Bell Rock Trail, Fireside Coffee, Tara Thai, etc.We stayed in the John Wayne suite, and first glance you would think that's great but you'd be a fucken liar, first off the door is squeakier than a goddamn 5 year old, then every single door doesn't fit in the correct spots so you look like a psycho trying to close and open every door, all the showers are broken as hell and you're either burning or freezing, and last of all and probably the worse the fuckin table is stickier than a licked lollipop and I'm currently writing a review while it's stuck and everything is stuck. F*ck this place...Bell Rock InnSedona, ArizonaThis is a totally negative review based on my interaction with Hotel personnel regarding their handling of my cancellation request. I did have a reservation with cancellation fee costs. My 76 year old wife came down with a recurrence of shingles. The 12 hour drive would be extremely difficult for her. I requested a cancellation with reasonable fees. They refused to negotiate. They displayed a lack of consideration and compassion. Their greed and avarice prevailed. I cancelled  my reservation and accepted the full cost of the reservation, their version of cancellation fees.Bob TarozziWe got hotel via Priceline wasn't able to find are reservation for hour and a half. Had to call Priceline and wait around for resolution. Bed is hard. Shower doesn't drain and iron doesn't work. It is spacious with up stairs living room and kitchen.  Not my top choice.
review_content_20: Room was ok.  Buyer beware.  I booked the room online on their website.  I received confirmation but it didn't give me a price.  When I arrived they overcharged me by $50.  I had to jump through hoops to get the correct price.Stayed for 2 nights with our kids (11,9 and 3) Dora at the front desk was very nice, as was Moy (I think her name) at the concierge desk. Totally recommend for families, it is great having a kitchenette. Not super fancy (again, great for families) Yes they try to get you to listen to the timeshare presentation and buy a further stay within the next year.... But it IS a timeshare, that is their job, we knew that going in so I have no complaints (and I politely declined)We got a good price on Expedia but wouldn't stay here again, room was okay. Not very close to the main Sedona area. STAY AWAY FROM THE CONCIERGE DESK!! They will try many times to sell you a time share. A daily Resort Fee was added on to the bill in addition to what we already paid.My advise, Keep looking at other options.The room has nice facilities esp. The kitchen. Lots of clean towels available. The room did smell a little musty but i guess most hotels are like that; hence 4 stars. BUT will still go back because the hotel is generally ok and has facilities that cater for my dog. Love it!The stay was great. The room comfy and cozy fold out couch kitchen. Frank was awesome booking us a dinner time. Very clean and everyone is nice. TV folds out away from wall. Staff was awesome. Most def recommend. One thing plz... More equipment for the gymThe staff was excellent and the location great!  The actual room was adequate.  It needed a little TLC but functioned fine.  Few minor issues...bathroom door looked like it had been clawed by a pet who was perhaps left in there too long.  Internet was up and down.  The refrigerator had a pretty loud compressor that you didn't really notice until you were trying to sleep.  But overall not a bad place and it was clean.Yes, I would stay here again but it's not the best place I've ever visited.  What we liked best was that it was quiet and in a great location...walking distance to fantastic trails!  Just enough restaurants to avoid driving up to Sedona too.My sister and I met in in New Mexico for our Uncles Memorial.  We decided to stay at the Bell Rock Inn on out way back to California for some R&R.  I became ill the night before our first nights stay at the Bell Rock and called them to change our reservation to a day later as I could not travel due to being so dehydrated.  The receptionist Shelia, basically said to bad and charged us anyway.  Granted it wasn't 24 hours that we tried to change the reservation, it was 20 hours.  Where is some human compassion?  So we traveled there to catch our second night.  As we checked in, Shelia was there and remembered our call, it was obvious I still was not feeling very well, she was very rude!  (Very nice to the wealthy LOOKING couple prior to us checking in by the way)   She was going to charge us the resort fee for the night we weren't even there but took the charge off as a favor (10.00)  We asked about staying another night and were sent to the Concierge, that is when I realized that this was a time share property and we got the sales pitch from Brandon, whom was very sweet, he offered us the second night at no cost if we went to the presentation the following morning.  Finally we agreed as we really wanted to rest and check out the beautiful town.  Brandon was suppose to call our room with in a hour to let us know if we were going to go to the 8 am presentation or the 11 am.  Brandon never called so before bed I called and spoke to someone at the desk, Brandon was gone and she said I would just have to wait until the following day.  I woke to the phone at 7:30 am to some offer of a cheaper room rate at a future date and no mention of the prior agreement.  (Really? 7:30 am?)Basically our trip was ruined and I will NEVER stay there again!Who wants to go to Sedona and spend the whole time messing with hotel reservations and sales people?  Terrible business practice, poor customer service and rude Shelia made this choice a bad one for us!The room was nice and clean, but small.  You can't watch tv in bed as the tv is mounted on the wall and can't turn towards the bed.  NOTHING SPECIAL!Upon check out, we were again charged the 10.00 resort fee for the night we weren't there!  You have been warned!!!!!!!I tore my Achilles tendon and will have to get surgery. I called this hotel to cancel my reservation, or perhaps get them to let me take the trip after I recover. They told me that I would have to know for certain the dates I want to change my trip to, or else the request would be denied!  And it would be subject to Priceline's availability (I booked the trip through them), and I would have to pay whatever extra fees Priceline chooses to impose. What a shameful, shameful response. This is no way to treat someone.  Shame on this hotel, on its own Diamond Resorts, and on Priceline.  I should be focused on the surgery I have to undergo, and the lengthy recovery, and not this. I was looking forward to this trip.I would strongly discourage anyone from staying at this hotel.We stayed at  this  resort  based  on the  great price  and convenient  location. The room was clean. It rained, water was seeping in from the floor  tiles on the first floor. The worst part is the annoying guy and his wife acting all friendly after you check in. He literally starts trying to arrange  your whole vacation and  include selling time shares. I caught on right away, ended the discussion and he turned cold as ice with a real negative attitude. He  also  stunk of stale  cigarette smoke too.  After staying at  this resort I started receiving a dozen or more telemarketer calls from  different  states. Finally, I answer and i hear young men acting silly on the phone and I say loudly, hello, he responds that he is calling about giving me something free at Bell rock Inn, diamond Resorts. I cut him off, tell him how many phone calls I already received. STAY AWAY FROM THIS STUPID TIME SHARE ANNOYING PLACE! YOU WILL WIND UP WITH NAGGING TELEMARKETERS EVEN AFTER YOU DECLINED THE MAN IN THE FRONT DESK.We were her Christmas Day, this place is located in perfect area, view is wonderful, we don't stay in the room much until night. Bed was comfortable. If we back this area we will returnSo after reading all the bad reviews on this hotel I was a little skeptical booking a room here. We are on  budget right now and felt it was the cheapest way to get out to Sedona so decided to give the place a chance. Glad we did! We have been to Sedona countless times and have stayed at different hotels and resorts each time so we know what is out there. Upon check in we were greeted by a nice courteous clerk named Dora. She was super helpful and informative. She did ask us to stop at concierge for more information. Sure he did ask us to stop at resort for a information seminar and tried to lock us in to setting up appointment. We politely said no thank you and that was that. No biggie. He was polite and not pushy. Gave us some maps of area and tips on things to do that afternoon. We stayed in a king studio looking out toward pool. Room was clean and spacious enough for 2 adults. Room had large TV and kitchenette. Full sized refrigerator and microwave. Even had a stove top burner if you needed to warm something up. Cabinets were stocked with plates and basic cookware. Also room has dishwasher. Didn't use anything but refrigerator and microwave in room is great for room rate. Bed was comfy and I managed to relax and enjoyed my stay. Only complaint was we could hear what sounded like chairs being moved in room above us. It wasn't all night but maybe  in the evening for short period of time. It wasn't enough to ruin our stay. Was this the best hotel with best room I ever been to? No. But I will book there again because I felt it was a nice hotel and room for the value. Staff was great and grounds were lovely. Also there is 2 pools with hot tub. Looking forward to my next visitMy husband and I stayed there last winter and loved it.  We are going back this year!  Our unit was perfect and it sure didn't hurt that we had 75 degree weather!  You do have to be prepared for a sales pitch since this is a timeshare.  We made it clear we were not interested and they did leave us alone.You get what you pay for, and this place is cheap. Stayed in "upgraded" 1 bedroom unit, fireplace is a joke (loud fan blows warm air and logs have red tin-foil 'fire'), toilet seat old/dirty (thankful for 2 bathrooms), lobby is lame tacky mural, smells bad, temporary?), but parking was ample and Chasity was uber-helpful during late night ,check-in. No view from most rooms, unless you get a 2 bedroom unit. We did have peekaboo view of some rocks (had a better view of cars parked right outside our windows).Strange 2 floor, 1-bd unit (118) with access from both floors to hallway - one front door had a latch like those found on barnyard stalls. Not confidence inspiring.All-in-all, a disappointing 2.4 stars.This was the best deal on Expedia for the location. After reading all of these reviews I was a little nervous to stay here, but it turned out to be perfect. I took the advice of many and stayed clear of the concierge desk. After checking in the lady told me to go to the concierge desk for maps and info about the area, blah blah blah. No. So I said I would just go to my car first and come back, but I lied. The room itself was amazing, probably the best hotel room I've ever stayed in. There was a kitchenette and it included a medium sized refrigerator/freezer, microwave, coffee maker, sink (soap and sponge included), dish washer (detergent included), pots and pans, cups, everything you need! This was perfect for us because we had food with us and were able to cook our meals here, as well as store food for the rest of our trip. There was even laundry on site that is free, but you have to provide your own detergent. We had one king bed and the sofa pulled out into a bed too. Everything was clean/comfortable, no complaints. It's true though, the room doors slam shut and are a little loud, but nothing to get all mad about. We also used the jacuzzi at night after a long day of hiking and atv riding. Overall, a great stay in Sedona and close to everything. I would definitely stay here again if I come to visit Sedona again!Found this place on Priceline's name your own price for 66.00 dollars! They gave us a townhouse style condo with a full kitchen, 2 baths, sofa bed in the living room and more! Be prepared for the concierge to try to get you to a timeshare presentation, not to pushy though. Definitely would stay here again!Extremely deceptive. Specifically asked for 2 Q beds and were given a K and a couch. For a room advertised as non-smoking and no pets there was an over powering bad odor. The carpets in the hall and the room were stained. The lights in the bedroom did not work. Customer service was awful. They wouldn't listen and were only interested in making a sale - even tried to 'invite' us to a 90 min sales pitch! Avoid this facility at all costs! Do not even want to give 1 star!Nicer than your average hotel. We stayed here for two nights in February after purchasing a Groupon deal. It's close to local shops like Fireside Coffee and just a short drive into Sedona. When we booked our stay all of the studio rooms were full, so we booked a suite. It included nice amenities like two full baths, two televisions (though CRT, not HD), a DVD player, a kitchenette with a two burner stove, larger fridge and even a dishwasher. I liked having a separate living room upstairs with a couch and armchair. The bed was pretty comfortable and the linens were soft. I'm picky about my pillows, but these were great. There were a few downsides to our stay, though. The finishes in the room were sub par - the floorboards didn't meet the flooring, the flooring didn't meet the tubs in the bathrooms. There was this weird noise that we heard periodically, like a humming noise in the AC. The walls are also paper thin - you can hear absolutely everything, from your neighbor's TV to the chatting hotel staff to doors opening and closing through the night. I heard a knock at the door and it wasn't our door. I thought the cleaning staff was upstairs in our suite while we were downstairs in the bedroom but they weren't. You can hear that much, seriously. Also, they have free wifi, but it is  spotty. They do say that if you need a stronger wifi you can come to the lobby. Overall, I'd say that Bell Rock Inn is nicer than a days inn, but it's definitely not the Hilton. If you're looking for a budget friendly getaway in Sedona and won't be spending a lot of time in the hotel, it's a nice option, but I think I'll be looking for other hotels on my next trip to Sedona.Two pools with a great view of bell rock!! All the amenities are super! It feels like home with everything that you need just inside your room. In a quiet part of the town but with  good restaurants just nearby.. And for the price it's worth it!! I've checked other hotels in Sedona and they are much more expensive than this one. Will definitely come backOur room was dirty when we checked in, and it smelled really awful. I called front desk and they moved us to another room right away.Fine for what it is. It is a budget friendly, relatively clean time share/hotel.Pros:Free WiFiFree ParkingPeacefulNice big pools and jacuzziComfortable bedFriendly check in staffCons:Dirty and stained carpets10 am check out ????The cleaning staff that would stand outside of the room yapping and cackling endlessly while cleaning rooms surrounding yours. Horribly annoying while trying to nap.I am not sure that I would opt for this particular hotel when in Sedona next, but it is not a bad place to stay and is decently budget friendly.
review_content_40: We own diamond and stayed here for 4 nights. It was perfect; location, service, accommodations. Request a downstairs room facing the pool. We would stay here again.For a comfortable, clean, quiet suite with nice grounds and facilities, Bell Rock in is a very good deal. We stayed in the shoulder season in late May so the place was not full - that could be a factor to consider. The room had a fireplace, a couch, and a table with two chairs for meals. The kitchen was efficiently equipped and included an electric stovetop, a dishwasher, and a small refrigerator/freezer. We will stay again if we return to Oak Creek and the Sedona area. It is about 8 miles from the middle of Sedona, which might be a negative for some, but the rates compensate for the distance.Worst hotel experience we ever encountered!Pros:The bedding was cleanThe room wasn't terribleCons:The shower head was like a single jet streamShower curtain was dirtyThe fireplace was fakeThe walls are paper thin we could hear 3 doors down Service was terrible the girls at the desk were extremely rude and snottycheck in is at 4:00 pm and check out is at 10:00 amthey charge an extra $100 as a safety depositeverything is out dated All of that was nothing to what we experienced in the morning. I was sleeping and it was around 8:30 am when I was woken up multiple times over a period of 30 minutes of loud banging. I thought it was just because the walls are so thin. Eventually I got up to look out the front door and found to my horror a man's arm reaching around the door trying to unlock the deadbolt. I yelled hello and he said sorry and ran off so I slammed the door. when we went to check out we reported to the lady at the front desk who did nothing about it and didn't even seem shocked. We are still not sure if this was a cleaning person or someone else either way it was horrible. If it was a cleaning person they should have known someone was in there if the deadbolt was on or at least called the room after he had tried to break in for a full 30 minutes.  I just feel very lucky that he was unable to get in.It was just okay. It was clean so you can't go wrong there. The setup was really odd, but hey you're not in Sedona to hang out in your hotel room, right? The bed was comfortable. I like that there was a kitchenette. Two annoyances: a dog in the dog-friendly room barked constantly. The second annoyance: the concierge. Avoid the concierge at all costs. We had been traveling for hours and just wanted to get into our room. After check-in, we were asked to go to the concierge desk where we dealt with a man that was basically a rude salesman and was very passive aggressive when we expressed that we were not interested in buying any vacation packages. Sorry we're not as rich as you had hoped. The guy was a real jerk and it kicked off our stay in Sedona on a bad note. He was very condescending when we shared that we were playing our trip by ear and that we were going about things wrong by not taking his suggestions on where to eat. What a prick. The next morning the lady at the concierge was just as bad, but by then I knew not to waste my time talking to her. Next time we visit Sedona, we will not be staying at Bell Rock Inn. The energy there does not go with the surroundings. The smoking area next to the entrance is pretty off-putting as well. A little weird to not be able to see who may be back there. Especially when it's late at night.Wife and I did a time share presentation with no intent on signing up, got 2 nights free here. Not a bad little place... Room was really nice- HDTV w/ DVD player, full kitchen, regular sized fridge, etc. Made use of Barbeque at pool, watched a few movies at night, had a really nice stay. I'd go back here again if I could get the $29 a night deal they were offering at the time of check in (at The Krazy Coyote).My husband & I went to Sedona with another couple this past weekend and stayed at the Bell Rock Inn after exchanging rooms with a Time Share. It wasn't quite what we expected but was a comfortable place to stay for a long weekend. Our one bedroom 'condo' had a full sized fridge, 2-burner stove, microwave, counterspace, etc. It was great to just go to the store & not have to eat out our entire trip. The bedroom was comfy, & they just got new beds which was great. The TV was small, but watchable. Our room was fairly large compared to what I have been in before. Our friends stayed on the sleeper sofa which wasn't very comfortable & squeaked a lot. In the livng room there was a couch, coffee table, comfy chair, and 4-seater kitchen table. The location was great because we could zip up to Sedona from Oak Creek within 10-15 minutes and do all the things we had planned.I would stay there again for a casual vacation weekend. (Not the Ritz!)Bell Rock Inn is a decent place to stay near Sedona. The view from our room was of one of the pools so we got to watch several grannies doing water aerobics in the morning. Since this is a timeshare type of "resort" you have to dodge the lady in the lobby handing out a "welcome packet" which is basically an invitation to sit through a presentation on how to buy a timeshare. Our room was in the refurbished section of the hotel and didn't really scream out refurbished. The furniture is still pretty dated but the TV and flooring/countertops look new. The room wasn't as clean as it could have been. I guess I wouldn't stay here again unless I ended up here through Priceline. If I could give 2.5 stars I would.I found this hotel a very confusing place to stay, mostly because you're never sure if it's a hotel or not.It seems to be a timeshare that fobs off spare rooms on hotel guests to maintain occupancy and make a few extra bucks.  The desk staff were pleasant enough, though a little inflexible.The rooms are HUGE and stunningly well appointed.  After all, for a timeshare you'd expect a full size fridge, stove (two burners), and a full complement of kitchen accessories (saucepans, cutlery, crockery).I had an unexpected issue with the bathroom sink, as it was being repaired (engineering, who came to visit just as I got out of the shower, was surprised that they'd rented out the room, but I was in no mood to move all my stuff for the sake of not looking at a wood clamp for the two nights I was here).Given the price of the rooms, and their size, I'll be perfectly happy to overlook the shortcomings and stay here again.We got our stay at Bell Rock Inn through a Timeshare Exchange.  I chose this because of the kitchen facilities.From the outside, its apparent the facility is a little older, and I was concerned about the quality of the accommodations. (They were great, more to follow.)The Lobby was worn and outdated, but clean.  Staff was friendly, and the lady manning the front desk couldn't have been better.  She was kind, efficient, and helpful.  The concierge of course had a timeshare sales pitch, but that's to be expected.  She did provide the information I needed, but I wasn't impressed by the stained shirt and visible panties. (Over the top of her pants.)  All other staff we encountered were very friendly and professional.The halls were a little outdated, with slightly tacky Southwestern art. With the adobe-style outside, it was almost expected. Our room definitely exceeded my expectations.  It was very clean. The king-size bed had crisp white, modern linens.  The appliances were obviously new, and very clean.  I was pleased to find the basic items, as well as some useful extras-like a corkscrew and a whisk.  :) The pull out sleeper sofa was more comfortable than expected.  We had plenty of towels, and they were very nice-fluffy!  Loved the pull out flat screen that we could rotate towards the bed or seating area.Our room was in a great location, and we were maybe a 10 second walk from the "adult" pool.  It was clean, with plenty of seating.  Lots of umbrella tables, loungers, and regular chairs.  The pool was large, and the hot tub was nice as well.  Sitting in there and gazing at the red rock  formations was unbeatable!The Bell Rock Inn is a very short drive from hiking, shopping, Uptown Sedona, dining, etc.  Its partway between Oak Creek and Sedona.  I enjoyed the fact that it was away from the uber-tourism of Sedona Proper.  Not luxurious, but definitely nice.I'd book here again without any hesitation.We went to Sedona to get Married last month. We found a Groupon for the Bell Rock Inn that we used during our stay so it was a decent price. We also brought some family and friends that stayed at the hotel as well. When I booked the room I mentioned to the reservationist that we were getting married during our stay. She was excited about it and mentioned that the hotel would be doing something special for us. I also mentioned it again when we were checking in. Big surprise.... Nothing was done for us. I wasn't even going to mention it because I don't like doing that but everyone told us you have to tell them over and over. It really wouldn't have been a big deal if we weren't told something was going to be done. We could have at least been given a renovated room like the REST of our wedding party did. I think we had the worst room out of everybody. I received a survey from the hotel a week or so after our stay. I mentioned all of this in the survey and have yet to hear back from them. They mentioned how committed they are to guest satisfaction but apparently that is just a crock. They could have at least replied.My wife and I scheduled a 2 night stay on a Diamond Promotion for our 41st anniversary 12/26-28. We are silver Diamond owners and have stayed in some lovely places including Summit and Ridge in Sedona. The Bell Rock Inn is the worst Diamond property we have stayed in in our 5 years of ownership. The only good quality was the excellentDiamond" standard bed. It was fantastic. But linoleum floors, you've got to be kidding. I was told all the rooms have linoleum except for pet rooms that have some carpet? Seems to me it should be pet rooms that have linoleum and non-pet rooms carpet.So, fortunately we were only 2 hours from home, so after 1 night, back to  Phoenix we went. This property needs substantial upgrade to be on the scale of Diamond International Resorts. We will not stay again and recommend it only for the traveler looking for a very basic accommodation in Sedona.Stayed here as part of our timeshare.  In their defense, we brought our dog and although the dog rooms were recently refurbished, they were still dog rooms. The refurbishment wasn't as complete as I would have liked. Parchment paper was still taped to many items in the unit, and the efficiency kitchen, although only missing a stove, was positioned next to the door so the door kept slamming into the dishwasher, the cabinet doors and the refrigerator. The view from the parking lot was beautiful. The view from our patio, not so much. The gorgeous Sedona Rocks were blocked by a storage trailer. The workout room consisted of two machines. Moy, the concierge, knew nothing of the dog-related activities and shopping in the area, but was very good at the hard-sell component of her job. All in all I was unimpressed, but plan to give them another chance in the future.The room we got was really old with no updating whatsoever. The TV had really bad reception. Maybe if we had paid more we would have gotten a better room I don't know. Great location. Would maybe stay there again if I got a room that looked nice like in the pictures online.I kinda have a love/hate relationship with this place.  My daughter and I went up to Sedona on a whim- I got a smoking deal with this place using Priceline Negotiator.  It's about 10 minutes outside of where the main strip of Sedona is.  It's not much too look at from the outside, but definitely not bad, and definitely clean.  We really enjoyed the room, kitchenette, view, etc.  I'd probably give it four stars if it wasn't for the uh, slightly unusual experience.  When we went to check in, they didn't have record of our reservation.  To be fair, this could be an error with priceline.  However, we waited about fifteen minutes to confirm everything until we were given our keys.  They also pre-authorize a card for $100 in case of incidentals, which is fine, but I'll get to later.  It was a little frustrating getting into the room, but once we did, we were happy.  Until- we went down to the pool and got locked out of our room at 11pm.  I didn't get the key wet, have it close to magnets, etc (they said that could wipe its memory). So, we go to the lobby soaking wet.  Four people are there checking in, same party.  We waited half an hour (the key here being in towels and WET) to get our key programmed.  Whatever, not that big of a deal.  However, the next day, I got locked out AGAIN. Thankfully, my daughter was in the room.  I go to check out- they don't have record that I paid and try to charge me.  After waiting another fifteen minutes and showing a copy of the receipt AGAIN- they let me leave.  I am curious, however, to see if my credit card they kept for incidentals gets a charge.  If so, I'll amend the review.Bottom line- the place was clean and presentable, but the service ruined it.  I would have definitely stayed there again, but not sure now. PS Give the maid a raise.Ahhhhhhhhhh Sedona :)One of the most beautiful and tranquil places I've ever been to. It's high desert and it's red rock land and if you are into any type of soul searching or practice meditation of any kind, this will be your golden ticket into that realm.Every time I've made the journey here, we've stayed at the Bell Rock Inn for a number of reasons. The first and best is...it's cheap. And if you get a room facing Bell Rock (which is a giant vortex that looks a lot like a...you guessed it Bell) you will be stoked at what you are paying and the view you are getting. They also have a really good little restaurant here that makes a killer Eggs Benedict.The rooms aren't posh by any means, but you are in Sedona to see the natural surroundings, to hike, to take Jeep tours if you wish to, not sit in the room. There are great spas around, but for the most cost effective way to spend a few days in Sedona, this is the way to go.As a personal tip, the best time to hit Sedona is in the Spring as the snow is melting. You then get the amazing little creeks and it's just sooo beautiful!My husband and I belong to Diamond Resorts.  I was a little hesitant to reserve a unit at Bell Rock Inn because it looked older than our usual Sedona resort called Sedona Summit.  We were not disappointed at all.  We had a two story, one bedroom unit; it reminded me of our Lake Tahoe cabin, complete with a fireplace and wood beamed ceilings.Everyone I met at the pool were friendly and having a good time.My two suggestions for improvement include replacing the worn hallway carpets and get rid of the cockroaches.This is a place to trade timeshares and a regular hotel, so it seems a cut above a regular hotel.  It has two big outdoor pools and an outdoor whirlpool.  The housekeeping staff doesn't speak English, so if they knock and you need to vacate your room while they clean, they don't understand "come back in 5 minutes".  I waited at the pool all morning for them to come back!  Location wise, it is within walking distance of some good restaurants if you don't want to drive into Sedona.  Particularly Tara Thai and Marie's (mexican).  Beware of the concierge, she will try to convince you to sit through a two-hour spiel on timeshare ownership in exchange for a reduced rate on a pink jeep tour.We bought (2) groupons in order to stay 4 nights at Bell Rock, which is located about 15-20 minutes from Sedona, (although it is within Sedona city limits so it is considered a part of Sedona). Decent price per night with the Groupon (I cannot imagine staying at this timeshare for the full price of $149/night but at 1/2 that per night is a deal!). It is not your fanciest of places but since we were staying in our rooms the entire time, it was good enough for our needs. GOOD- Decent price with Groupon- Free DSL!!!!- Kitchenette (our room didn't have a full separate kitchen but it did have a full size refrigerator, electric stove top, coffee maker, toaster, small microwave, and plenty of counter and cabinets).- Towels were provided for use at the swimming pools (don't take them or you will be charge $25 per towel!)- King size bed (clean linens, plenty of pillows, pretty cushy)- Front desk people were friendly and helpful- If you need anything (extra towels, light bulbs, toilet paper), they bring it to you within 10 minutes or less!- Spa/Jacuzzi was perfectly heated- BBQ and gazebo area for families to cook their own food- Fitness room available (didn't get a chance to check it out but good to know that there is one available)- Fake Fireplace :)- Accomodated our request for a second floor room- Convenient location near gas stations, some local shopping (GAP outlet!), cafes/restaurantsBAD- You have to make reservations through their main site (Diamond International Resorts) and the wait can be long to talk to an operator. If you call the front desk directly, they will not help you make a reservation.- Small bathtub/shower combo (just like the ones in an apartment complex)- Small bathroom sink (would be nice to have double sink area)- Couch was a bit lumpy- TV was a flat panel mounted on the wall but it had a swivel neck so you would have to turn it in the direction you wanted to view it (thus, people who were laying in bed and people who were sitting on the couch)- Cold, tile floors throughout room- Concierge would not assist us with our questions about tours until after we checked in at the front desk on the first day we arrived. While I waited in line, I had asked my hubby to ask the concierge about GC tours and she said she preferred for us to check in first and then she would help us. She was not helping anyone else at the time but of course, by the time we finished with our check-in, she was helping someone else. We didn't want to wait since we had just driven 8 hours and were beat tired. She called later that night and wanted to arrange a 9am appt. with us but we politely declined (heck she brushed us off so screw her!).- The shower made a really obnoxious bull-horn noise whenever we used the shower head and the walls are pretty thin that I could hear the people in the room next to us taking a shower!- The main pool was small and is supposedly heated but it was still cold (although the kids didn't mind going in it)- Early check-out (10am)- No elevators (we lugged heavy luggage up and down to our 2nd floor room) but they did offer to have hotel staff help us with the luggage- The nearest major supermarket (Safeway) is in the heart of Sedona, about 20-25 minutes awayOverall, we would stay here again if we got the same Groupon deal since it was pretty decent living conditions with (for the most part) friendly staff. I would not stay here again if I had to spend more than $100 per night.Great place to stay, kitchen had everything we needed.  The bed was very comfortable and it was nice to have a heated pool and spa to use.  I liked that they are "green" and have recycle bins all over, including in the room.I am staying here thru my timeshare, The check in staff was friendly but then they send you over to the concierge for info, I was thinking she would tell me places to see,, no she starts questioning me on who is with me when I said I have a 18 yr old and a 11 yr old she said are they you kids, yes(why is that her business) she then says is that all that is with you? I said yes she then asked me if I am the one that owns my timeshare I said yes and then she said do you own it with your husband? I said yes.  then she said is your husband not with you(why is this her business??) I said no. she said well is he going to come up? I know I gave her a a look of surprise, I said I don't know, she said your not sure?? now I am getting mad, I said if he can get a way from work maybe I am here to enjoy myself with my kids. I know I said it rudely as I am thinking why is this any of her business.. then she said well we wanted to have you come to a timeshare presentation but your husband has to be with you. ooh now all the questions make sense.. but still none of it was her business why didn't she just say would you like to take a timeshare presentation.. I am also bugged that they make you go to her to go thru this. I have never had another time share put me thru this to stay there!!!The room is a 2nd floor studio, not what I thought I was getting. no patio, it is big for studio size and works ok for us, the issue I have it the low flow toilets that hardly handles anything and we have had to have them plunge twice.. the guy says you can hardly use any toilet paper in the toilet, so you have to flush more often and hope it goes down which have the time it doesn't so you have to flush agian,,so where are we saving on water.. the shower is a low flow shower but very loud and comes out really hard,, it does save on water as you want to get out of the shower as soon as possible.The front desk staff at night is 2 young girls that have a attitude and should remember that they are there to help the guest and be happy to have a job and not act like you are bugging them if you ask for something.. we were scheduled for a mid week cleaning, well all they did was make the bed and give us more towels, the place has linoleum floors which they didn't sweep or clean the bathroom.. very disappointing.I will not stay here again did not live up to my timeshare expectations at all!!!
review_content_60: Great views of the Oak Creek traffic.. cars nonstop! Don't come here if you want silence. Ugly lobby. Slow maids check in was 4 but room wasn't ready.. we even called at around 1 o clock to let them know we were getting to Oak Creek early and to see if we could possibly check in early.. the girl was nice and said she'd see what she could do and call back at 2:30. So we just pulled in at 2:30 thinking that since we called they would jump on cleaning our room and have it ready for us but nope instead the lady wanted to let me know that the maids have until 4 and your room is not ready....... If you have a guest arriving early I would think you would want to take care of us.. I mean if they wanted us to come back here... The lady said she'd call my cell when they got the room ready. So I bit my toung and sat in the car with the a/c on so my grocerys didn't spoil until about 4:05 I went into the lobby again AT CHECK IN TIME because I never recieved a phone call, only to find out it would be another 15 minutes! Wow is all I could say at this point.. I could've said much worse but I'm too polite.... The rooms are nice but they face the wrong direction.. the street??? and early check out 10 am! Crazy. I'm going to take the extra 20 minutes I waited for my room (with parishable grocerys and in the rain) and check out at 10:20. Thank you very much..My family and I were treated terribly by the manager at the Bell Rock Inn.  We arrived after an 8 hr. car ride and it was around 100 degrees outside and our room was almost 90 degrees.  The manager told us the air conditioner had probably got turned down too low and froze the unit.  He assured us that if we waited an hr., it would thaw out and the air would turn on.  We continued with this charade for the next few hrs. and we were exhausted and just wanted to unpack our things and relax.   We kept asking for another room and when he finally agreed, I walked into a room with people in it!!!!!  I was horrified and the manager barely blinked an eye.  We had our 2 young children with us, it was getting late,  and we were getting quite flustered by this point. He finally put us in another room which he said would be an upgrade and it was a nicer room, although it only had one bathroom.  The next morning I get up, unpack (we were staying for a week), and then we receive a phone call from Mr. Manager saying we had to move rooms again.   I was livid by this point and I would have never  unpacked our belongings if I thought we would have to move again.  At no point did he say the previous night that the upgrade would only be for the night.  I went to the office to tell him I wasn't moving, he was rude and unprofessional and made me feel like the other guests were more important than us.  We ended up keeping our room but I would never stay there again and would never recommend anyone else to stay there.This place isn't anything fancy but the grounds are well kept, the staff is very friendly and helpful, and the location is great (walking distance to Bell Rock and some decent places to eat.)  I loved having a small kitchen in our room, it's nice not to eat every meal out.  We stayed in a dog friendly room so our room smelled of dogs, but the upside is that they separate the rooms that pets are allowed in so if you stay in a non-pet friendly room it should smell fine. Our AC didn't work very well - it won't let you set the temp lower than 70 and we had to run ours nonstop on 70 just to try to keep it cool.  The pet fee doesn't make a lot of sense because it's $20 per pet per day, but they don't clean your room every day - usually the fee is associated with some kind of required cleaning.  However, we got a great deal and for about the same price we would have paid next door at La Quinta we got a room with a kitchen and sofa bed, so if we find ourselves traveling with pets through Sedona again we will certainly consider Bell Rock Inn.
